name: Lovely cabin, great Asheville spot
summary: You will be staying in a lovely, bright 1-bedroom cottage nestled between two beautiful old growth oaks trees and centrally located close to everything Asheville has to offer.
space: You will be staying in a lovely, bright 1-bedroom cottage nestled between two beautiful old growth oaks trees and centrally located close to everything Asheville has to offer.   The cottage has a full bathroom and kitchen supplied with all of the basic dishes and cookware, including blender and wine glasses.  The cottage also includes wi-fi, a stone fire-place with remote control gas logs, a/c, ceiling fan, plenty of parking, and a large, shaded yard great for relaxing in the hammock after a long day exploring Asheville or the surrounding areas.  The bedroom has a comfy queen-sized bed, roomy closet, and lots of shelves.  Linens and paper products will be provided.  When available enjoy fresh eggs from the backyard hens.  Sample veggies from the organic garden.  If disc golf is your game, there is a basket for practicing your putts.  The heart of downtown is within 3 miles, the Biltmore Estate is less than 10 miles, hip West Asheville is 1.2 miles, and the upcoming River Arts district

host_about:
I like to enjoy the day as much as possible, usually through some sort of exercise like biking or disc golf.  I enjoy music, art, and having a good time.  

My travels so far have taken me to Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, Peru, Mexico, China, Thailand, Laos and all over the U.S.  I can speak English and Spanish. 

My company is called Dog Tag Art.  We make really neat, custom ID tags for pets.

You should come visit Asheville, I think you'll like it!

name: Glamping w HOT TUB + AC!
summary: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more
space: Please note that this tent does not retain heat like a normal home- we have electric blankets and a mattress cover that guarantee that you are warm and comfy sleeping- but the rest of the tent will match the outside temp in the colder months. The bathroom is heated and stays toasty and so does the HOT TUB! :-D  ***To whom it may concern: We are operating a legal rental. Our property is covered under zoning as a campground. As of August of 2015, Asheville has started to enforce the ban on short term rentals that are located within Asheville city limits that are in areas that are zoned residential- our properties are zoned "open use" just outside of Asheville city limits, in West Asheville.  We have been constantly upgrading this site since we offered Asheville's first set up tent rental in April of 2014! We are now pleased to offer our guests a luxury Bell tent fully furnished with everything you need to go Glamping for 2015!  Follow us on INSTAGRAM @ashevilleglamping and check out pict

neighborhood_overview: ***To whom it may concern: We are operating a legal rental. Our property is covered under zoning as a campground. In August of 2015, Asheville has started to enforce the ban on short term rentals that are located within Asheville city limits that are in areas that are zoned residential- our properties are zoned "open use" just outside of Asheville city limits, in West Asheville.  Our 3 acre property is in a neighborhood located just two short miles from popular haywood road in west asheville which is lined with breweries and fantastic eateries! We provide all of our guests with a local guide with our favorite places to go in the area, including everything on haywood road!  We are just 5 miles from the heart of downtown Asheville.  ******The neighborhood is typical of rural appalachia- aka not wealthy ;-) You will see mobile homes along the road to our property. PLEASE  keep that in mind if you are looking to stay in the middle of nowhere or in a higher end part of the city. The last th
notes: The tent site is just 2 miles from popular haywood rd in west asheville and just 5 miles from downtown asheville (our property IS in Asheville). If we are available and you want us to take you to our favorite spots (hiking/ biking/ or otherwise- just let us know ahead of time- we would love to! really!)
transit: You will need a car. Once you are here you may take a cab into downtown asheville for under $10- Downtown Asheville is a quick 5 mile drive and all the attractions on popular haywood road are just 2 miles away!
host_about: We LOVE alternative dwellings and micro housing. We ourselves live in a  270 sq ft vintage camper with our three dogs. We have really been enjoying the opportunity to share our land with guests and have met so many amazing people through hosting on AIRBNB.   Together, Josh and I own two pieces of land in Asheville. One has just the yurt alone on it. Our other property is home to Bettie and also has several private campsites. It's nice to be able to offer people a range of options- from camping on the cheap to enjoying a luxurious stay in our yurt or restored vintage trailer! Joanna owns an environmentally conscious cleaning company in Asheville, Clean Green Asheville. Josh makes tactical gear like tourniquet holders and works out of his airstream shop. We are both very friendly and active people and we do all of the work on both properties ourselves :-)

name: Good size bedroom,  private
summary: Asheville is a great place to visit.  If you are in between homes, on business,  or just need to get away; this is the place to be. We are located on a few minutes from downtown,  but the country feel of the Carolinas. Small quaint neighborhood.
description: Asheville is a great place to visit.  If you are in between homes, on business,  or just need to get away; this is the place to be. We are located on a few minutes from downtown,  but the country feel of the Carolinas. Small quaint neighborhood.
host_about: single mother of 2. I work a full time job at the hospital and just need to have some spending money.  Not out to get rich.  I like meeting new people and I have a room for rent.  Short term only, pets available for additional $20 per day.  Pet must get along with mine. I have a rescue that is 1 year old about 45 lbs and loves to play. I have a fenced yard for them and a wonderful neighborhood to walk in.  If you bring your dog we need to meet somewhere prior to you renting to see if they will get along.

name: Mixed Dorm Bunk at BPS Hostel
space: Dorm bunks at BonPaul and Sharky's Hostel. We have a co-ed dorm, as well as female only dorm.  We have some offstreet parking behind the hostel and are located in a very safe neighborhood with plenty of free on-street parking.  Our front porch is awesome, with a porch swing.  Asheville public transit bus stop one block away.   Each room has 6 bunks and plenty of windows. Guests have access to all hostel amenities: full kitchen and bathrooms, wifi and internet, common area, book exchange, and cool international travelers. We are located in Historic West Asheville, walking distance to amazing restaurants, cafe's and pubs, grocery, and Asheville's River Art's District. Two private bathrooms are shared throughout the hostel. We are a traveler's hostel and therefore CANNOT BOOK TO AREA LOCALS. The bunk price is listed per bunk. For multiple people please be sure to adjust number of guest for correct price.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and peaceful, surrounded by mountain views and rolling picturesque landscape. You have complete privacy on the back deck.
transit: Less than 15 minutes to Haywood Road in WEST Asheville and all the Culinary delights it has to offer. Less than 15 minutes to the heart of Downtown Asheville.
host_about:
Traveling all over the world inspired me to get my degree in Culinary Arts and inspired me to move to Asheville.  Great food and unique culture is hard to find in one place.  Somehow Asheville has managed to combine culture, art, great food, locally brewed beer, local farms, and local businesses into a charming town nestled into ancient mountains full of waterfalls, hiking, history, and art.

Asheville is one of the few places that has four beautiful seasons and some of the best coffee and restaurants around.  I am excited to open up my home to travelers and I'm looking forward to share all there is to experience in and around Asheville.

name: Bright Suite with Sunroom
summary: Urban farm/Private Suite in our home is 3min from downtown with all the Asheville wonders close by. Our toddler zone can entertain your little one too! We can help you navigate for a great time! Ask about our futon for +guests.
space: Bedroom has a private outdoor entrance off the covered front porch, located next to the shared bathroom, and features a sunroom open to the bedroom. The room is bright and the sunroom is a wonderful spot for enjoying tea or lounging while listening to the songbirds. Room includes a Queen sized bed, desk, and small tea table with two seats. The living room and kitchen have an open floor plan with updated kitchen appliances and many windows that make the space very bright. There are hardwood, tile and bamboo floors thoughout the space with comfortable furnishings. The kitchen features Athena water filter. The bathroom is located next to your private bedroom, and includes a shower and bathtub. The outdoor space at this house is very special. This is an urban farm with a sunny  backyard that features organic veggie gardens, backyard hens, fire pit, propane grill, and sunny stone patio.

The bathroom is located next to your private bedroom, and includes a shower and bathtub. The outdoor space at this house is very special. This is an urban farm w
neighborhood_overview: Convenient urban farm located less than three miles from downtown or West Asheville. Our home is situated at the end of a quiet dead-end road off of Patton Ave. In addition to being minutes from downtown Asheville, many other urban activities are close by including: Asheville Zipline Adventures (within walking distance), blocks from mountain bike and hiking trails, River Arts District, and unique West Asheville. Close to multiple grocery stores including Earth Fare, a great health food store, and restaurants galore.
notes: Upon request we can set up in-house private massage therapy. This is a family home and we generally wake up around 7 am so the common living space will be active in the morning. This is a good fit for early risers. At times you may have to excuse the stored materials that are being used for our personal outdoor projects. We are close with our neighbors and community, so during your stay you may have the pleasure of meeting some sweet and colorful Asheville characters.
transit: There is an enterprise car rental company very close. It is only a $10 cab ride to downtown. There is also a city bus route and a stop close by.
host_about: I've lived in Asheville for about 12 years and love being in the mountains.  My (almost) two year old son is a joyful and vibrant soul who loves music and dance, just like his Mama.  We are a community minded family with a fun, creative flair.

name: Serene, spacious, cozy and clean!
summary: Mountains! Music! Beer! Eats! Make yourself at home... Arts & Crafts bungalow 2 blocks from vivacious West Asheville. Beautifully tended, inside and out. Comfortable queen-size bed in lovely room next to shared bathroom. Home made breakfast scones.
space: The lovely master bedroom is cozy, quiet and serene with a firm queen-size bed, ample closet and drawer space and views of the inviting front porch.  Enjoy beautiful hardwood oak flooring, a futon couch for lounging and WiFi in the room.  The pristine clean shared bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom. The remodeled kitchen with breakfast nook or the front porch are inviting places for breakfast.  There is shelf space in both the kitchen and bathroom for guest use.
description: Mountains! Music! Beer! Eats! Make yourself at home... Arts & Crafts bungalow 2 blocks from vivacious West Asheville. Beautifully tended, inside and out. Comfortable queen-size bed in lovely room next to shared bathroom. Home made breakfast scones. The lovely master bedroom is cozy, quiet and serene with a firm queen-size bed, ample closet and drawer space and views of the inviting front porch.  Enjoy beautiful hardwood oak flooring, a futon couch for lounging and WiFi in the room.  The pristine clean shared bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom. The remodeled kitchen with breakfast nook or the front porch are inviting places for breakfast.  There is shelf space in both the kitchen and bathroom for guest use. Each morning, guests are welcome to enjoy hot tea, freshly brewed organic coffee, gluten-free scones, yogurt, granola, fruit and orange juice. Eat in the kitchen or out on the magical front porch swing. We are absolutely available to support guests by suggesting dining and touring o
neighborhood_overview: This West Asheville neighborhood is a wonderful community mix of local and transplant folks of all ages. Many neighbors thrive as entrepreneur artists, healers and gardeners.  The vibrant downtown is two blocks away from my home with over 20 eclectic gastro-pubs, breakfast joints and gourmet destination restaurants. The Isis Restaurant and Performance Hall offers both excellent food and really good music every night.
notes: Welcome to your serene, spacious, cozy and clean Air BnB home! GPS: 19 Olney Road * West Asheville, NC (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) I am glad you have chosen to stay here and invite you to rest, relax, enjoy good hospitality and all that Asheville has to offer. Here are some guidelines to help you orient to the home: 1)  Check in any time after 3 p.m. 2)  Park your car across the street, mindful of neighborhood driveways and trash cans. 3)  Come and go through the back door (top of the driveway). Your house key is for the back door. 4)  Enjoy a cat-free room by keeping your room door closed. 5)  Although there are several mouthwatering and renowned breakfast joints within walking distance, I can provide a simple breakfast of gluten-free scones, granola, yogurt, fruit, coffee or tea. Let us know your preferences. There is a shelf in both the refrigerator and the pantry for storing your own food. Feel free to eat in the kitchen or on the front porch, but do not eat or drink anything other than
transit: Our home is 3.6 miles from downtown Asheville. The route downtown takes you through the groovy River Arts District. There is bus service and I have 2 bicycles for rent ($25/day). Easy access to I-40, I-26, I-240 (airport is 15 minutes away).
host_about:
My husband and I have lived in our home for 17 years. We have two friendly male cats, Peanut and Chippie. We love good food, gardening, hiking and motorcycling.

I'm a Kripalu Yoga Teacher and teach full-time from my home studio.

5 Things I Love:
My husband, Greg
My cats, Peanut and Chippie
Long Walks in the woods
Breathing, Stretching and Contemplation
Laughter

Favorite Quote:
I am a part of all that I have met;
Yet all experience is an arch wheretho'
Gleams that untravell'd world whose margin fades
Forever and forever when I move. - Tennyson's Ulysses

name: West Asheville top floor sleeps 3
summary: Walk to restaurants and bars. Top floor of handcrafted home with vaulted ceilings. Large full bath with glass shower.  One queen bed and one twin. Coffee table and seating, small fridge and coffeemaker. Yogurt, coffee, creamer and water bottles.
space: Beautiful space with large windows throughout. Coffee, yogurt and water provided. Great linens and comfortable beds. This is the room you want to wake up in. The room has two beds, one queen and a twin. We have a cat and a dog that are friendly and curious. If allergies are an issue, think twice.
description: Walk to restaurants and bars. Top floor of handcrafted home with vaulted ceilings. Large full bath with glass shower.  One queen bed and one twin. Coffee table and seating, small fridge and coffeemaker. Yogurt, coffee, creamer and water bottles. Beautiful space with large windows throughout. Coffee, yogurt and water provided. Great linens and comfortable beds. This is the room you want to wake up in. The room has two beds, one queen and a twin. We have a cat and a dog that are friendly and curious. If allergies are an issue, think twice. You can access the top floor from our front door. We will be here to greet you and show you the ropes. We have a large front porch for relaxing and having a drink before walking 3 blocks to West Asheville for a great dinner and live music. There is street parking right in front. It's a quiet two block street. Jen and Steve will be here throughout your stay to offer any assistance or to stay out of your hair. We know the area well and have a guide book
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville has many unique restaurants and is compact for easy walking access. Several bars offer live music. Food  venues vary from award winning to food trucks. Check out the guidebook, click on the map for my suggestions. Our street is quiet and friendly with plenty of street parking.
notes: We have a smallish dog, Joe, that is always at my side. Very well behaved and a cat that will be in and out. They are a part of the household and family. Neither will be upstairs, tho the cat might try it. Cat allergies might be an issue. Street parking is plentiful and Uber is a call away. Remember that West Asheville/Haywood Road is 3 blocks away.
transit: ART, Asheville's bus line stops 3 blocks from home. Tho it does not run on Sunday. Uber and cabs are available. West Asheville shopping and dining is a three block level walk. Bike rental is available nearby.
host_about: Steve and Jen built this Arts and Crafts style home in 2010. We love West Asheville because of it's easy access to nightlife and shopping. We are antique dealers and build industrial furniture. I was a travel agent and love to travel the world. Our daughters are grown and gone. We have a small dog named Joe and a cat Amorous. They are cool. We travel to many antique shows through the year and buy and sell some unusual items. It's a great way to see the area and meet some characters. Our neighborhood is quiet and safe and our neighbors are our friends.
street: Drake Street, Asheville, NC 28806, United States

name: Eclectic Room with Jacuzzi tub
summary: Overlooking the River Arts District and Downtown Asheville. Tucked away but within walking distance to great shops and restaurants. The home is a large rambling house. Your room has a single bed and is adjacent to the bathroom with jacuzzi tub.
space: This room is suitable for one person. Comfortable bed, and privacy. The room is on the other side of the house from your hosts room and right next to the bathroom with the Jacuzzi tub /shower. You will have your own entrance separate from mine. I love this house, it has tons of space and unique features. The bathroom and kitchen have been redone and hold modern appliances and fixtures.
description: Overlooking the River Arts District and Downtown Asheville. Tucked away but within walking distance to great shops and restaurants. The home is a large rambling house. Your room has a single bed and is adjacent to the bathroom with jacuzzi tub. This room is suitable for one person. Comfortable bed, and privacy. The room is on the other side of the house from your hosts room and right next to the bathroom with the Jacuzzi tub /shower. You will have your own entrance separate from mine. I love this house, it has tons of space and unique features. The bathroom and kitchen have been redone and hold modern appliances and fixtures. In addition to your bedroom you have access to the bathroom, kitchen, laundry room and front porch. There is a back yard area that you are welcome to enjoy it is shared with the other apartments.  You are welcome to cook and use any spices or tea in the cabinet.  Linens for the bathroom and bedroom are provided. Basic toiletries are provided I will be available to
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is referred to as East West Asheville or EWANA. I think its the best of both worlds its a cute residential neighborhood with historic homes, mixed with new construction (check out the stilt houses along Riverview). Also close to Carrier Park and Haywood RD with all the shops and restaurants. The Biltmore is a very short drive from the house.
notes: Old house so be mindful of noise and considerate of neighbors.
transit: Public transportation is available along Haywood RD. Uber is also a good choice for trips around town. From my house to Downtown Uber is $6-$8
host_about: I recently graduated, I studied scenic design, theater and film. I am working for a renewable energy company. I volunteer for a design center.  I love to surf. I do a lot of sewing as a hobby. I have used Airbnb as a guest and have had great results and met wonderful people! Im excited I can return the favor and host my own guests.

name: West Asheville Bound
summary: A foodies dream. Seven world class restaurants within walking distance. Close to lots of food and entertainment. Within driving distance to hiking and 1 mile from Asheville. Comfortable room, very quiet neighborhood.
space: Our home is a Depression Era cottage, in a residential area, just off Haywood Road in West Asheville. An Orientalist delight, our home contains an eclectic mix of Chinese design and original art.  The room itself has a flat screen tv, lots of DVDs and a nice library.  Orbits, the best movie rental store ever, and Red Box are close by.
description: A foodies dream. Seven world class restaurants within walking distance. Close to lots of food and entertainment. Within driving distance to hiking and 1 mile from Asheville. Our neighborhood is quiet and safe. Our neighbors are quite friendly. Be careful, you might fall in love with this town. We are in w

notes: Drum circles, live music and art make Asheville, Asheville. Let us facilitate your immersion into our counter culture. Ask for details.

name: Squash House
summary: Squash House is the home of three female roommates. We provide a squeaky clean spare bedroom, fully equipped kitchen, attached greenhouse, a large secluded yard with a garden, a patio with a grill and a comfortable living area.
space: Our house is in the perfect location to get all you can out of a short stay in Asheville. We are located right between downtown and West Asheville and just seconds away from all the major highways taking you out of town and to surrounding areas. (240, 40 and 26) This makes getting around super convenient. You could walk to Haywood Rd (the main drag of Historic West Asheville) or the River Arts District in about 20 minutes. Driving downtown takes only 5 minutes. Despite being so close to the commotion of town, our property is lush, secluded and  makes you feel away from it all. There is even a perfect view of Mount Pisgah that you can see from the back deck.  What is most unique about our household is that we are a tight-knit group of young ladies who are active and thriving in the hospitality, arts and entertainment scene of Asheville. Join us for a local Burlesque show or local music, talk to us about handmade crafts and enjoy the local art we have around the house. Learn about garden

Asheville is the Haight Ashbury of the South. When you get a look at West Asheville you will understand local flavor and color.
notes: Nice neighbors. Respect privacy. If you park in their spot they get really onry so please only park in #6!

name: Cozy Cabin Studio Apartment
summary: Welcome to our 1930's home where our studio apartment can be your cozy cabin while visiting the fun city of Asheville!  We're walking distance to downtown, The River Arts District, Sunny Point Cafe, The Admiral, The Isis, Urban Orchard, and much more
space: Welcome to your roomy space with a cozy feel,  private entrance, mountain views, which is walking distance to everything Asheville has to offer. Your space is a cozy cottage room added to the back of our 1930's home. There is an empty dresser for your belongings next to the brand new comfortable queen size bed. In the living room area, there is a full-size thick Futon couch for you to relax and watch one of our many movies or lay flat to sleep 1 adult or 2 children comfortably.  There is a wooden round table for working on your laptop or enjoying a cup of coffee or tea from our kitchenette. The kitchenette houses mugs, glasses, dishes, silverware, a coffee maker, toaster, microwave, and small fridge/freezer.  You have your own private bathroom with a shower. We provide towels, linens, toiletries, coffee, and tea.  *Wireless internet *Flat screen TV *DVD & VHS Player with selection of movies. neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a quiet safe place to  walk, jog, or bike. There are several bike trails and parks nearby. The French Broad River is two minutes away with access for kayaking, tubing, stand up paddle boards, etc.  We are within walking  distance to some of Asheville's finest restaurants, coffee shops, bars, music venues, and art studios. To name a few: The Admiral, The Walk, Sunny Point Café, Biscuit Head, West End Bakery, King Daddy's, The Grey Eagle, The Isis, Urban Orchard, and many more...
notes: -A brand new queen size bed -An empty dresser to get settled into -A full size thick futon couch that can lay flat to sleep one adult or two children comfortably.  - kitchenette with mugs, glasses, silverware, a coffee maker, toaster, microwave, and small fridge.  -private bathroom with a shower -we provide towels, linens, toiletries, coffee, and teas.

host_about: Our family has lived in this beautiful home for six years and we've put a lot of love and energy into it. We enjoy hiking, working in our yard, and spending quality time with one another and our friends. We love to travel and during our most recent stay in an airbnb in Scotland, we decided to open our home to travelers. We look forward to meeting you!

neighborhood_overview: This adorable bungalow is located in the middle of it all! Close to just about everything, much within walking distance. Great food, music, yoga, dance, coffee, and all that Asheville has to offer. Walking distance to the hot-spot Haywood Road in West Asheville and only a few minutes drive to down-town. About 5 minutes to the River Arts District, driving or biking, and only a bit further to Biltmore House, hospitals, UNCA and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: I have rented out my entire house several times with great reviews. This is a first listing for the guest room only. For overall reviews of the house and guest experiences, please see full house listing "Vacation like a local".
transit: Public transporation is available nearby. East-West Asheville is a very friendly walking/ biking area. Easy access to interstates 240 and 26 within minutes.
host_about:
I love living in Asheville!!! 
I am a generous, health conscious, independent gal who loves the outdoors- rivers, oceans and mountains! Asheville has been my home for 15 years- on and off- and I am 100% in love with my community here. I adore traveling yet equally love home and have worked hard to make mine comfortable for others- including you!!!

name: 400+ REVS Apt #7 in Artsy W ASHV!
summary: Airbnb host for 4 years w/ 400+ EXCELLENT REVIEWS. All six units are completely private with separate entrances. Links are at bottom of profile page. Apt 1, Apt 2 and Apt 3  are in Historic MONTFORD. Apt 5, Apt 6, Apt 7  are in ARTSY WEST ASHEV.
space: The Urban STUDIO is located on residential property of a large two story home. There are three completely separate and private airbnb units at this address. The older walking neighborhood with sidewalks is tree-lined and in the heart of funky art and food-crazed West Asheville, known for it's eclectic offerings. Buy fresh produce from the weekly farmers' market, buy coffee beans from the local roaster, and enjoy craft beers at several local brew pubs. Fresh baked goods are available at your choice of bakeries.
description: Airbnb host for 4 years w/ 400+ EXCELLENT REVIEWS. All six units are completely private with separate entrances. Links are at bottom of profile page. Apt 1, Apt 2 and Apt 3  are in Historic MONTFORD. Apt 5, Apt 6, Apt 7  are in ARTSY WEST ASHEV. The Urban STUDIO is located on residential property of a large two story home. There are three completely separate and private airbnb units at this address. The older walking neighborhood with sidewalks is tree-lined and in the heart of funky art and food-crazed West Asheville, known for it's eclectic offerings. Buy fresh produce from the weekly farmers' market, buy coffee beans from the local roaster, and enjoy craft beers at several local brew pubs. Fresh baked goods are available at your choice of bakeries. There are multiple motion detector night lights for the security minded. Long term residents also live on the property but they are completely separate and have separate entries. This sunny studio apartment has windows on three sides at g
neighborhood_overview: The older walking neighborhood with sidewalks is tree-lined and in the heart of funky art and food-crazed West Asheville, known for it's eclectic offerings. Walk to the library, buy fresh produce from the weekly farmers' market, buy coffee beans from the local roaster, and enjoy craft beers at several local brew pubs. Fresh baked goods are available at your choice of bakeries-check out the new one that specializes in homemade doughnuts.
notes: The laundry is shared and is located on the premises.
transit: Take an UBER ride* from the airport or rent a car. It's about 15 minutes to/from airport. Getting into downtown from here is easy and there's several routes. You can rent a bike, take the local bus (bus stop is one block away) or drive 5 minutes. For the walkers, it's about 30 minutes by foot, across the bridge, passing through the River Arts District.  *First time UBER users, feel free to ask about a 20% discount code!
host_about:
I have travel in my blood. I was born in Chateauroux, France. My sister was born in Germany and I learned to speak German when my family lived there for four years. Some of my favorites places include, Lagos de Atitlan, Uxmal, Merida, San Cristobal, Antigua, Ambergris Caye, Chichicastengo, Amsterdam, Vancouver, Cologne, Berlin and Prague. I prefer to travel off the "gringo trail" and have many more places to visit. Open to house trade.

I am a passionate student of compassionate communication (NVC). Two important things I've learned is that other people's behavior rarely has anything to do with me and that with patience and compassion, most all our needs can be met. 

For fun around here I have ridden a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a mountain top zip line tour nearby, seen our ancient mountains during a flying lesson, rented a scooter and rode the blue ridge parkway, took a few archery lessons so I could pretend to be like Katniss from The Hunger Games, which was filmed nearby. I also enjoy sitting in the backyard watching my chickens do goofy things. What do you like to do for fun? Let me share more fun things to do in our beautiful mountains.

name: Great location, so cute and cozy
summary: Our 2 bedroom home is walking distance to West Asheville "main street" and River Arts district as well as 5 minute drive to downtown! This 1926 bungalow is clean and comfortable.  We are permitted with Asheville city #16-O1664.
space: Welcome to our West Asheville home!  There are 2 bedrooms with new, comfy queen beds and one bathroom. We also have an air mattress and toddler mattress if needed. Our 1926 bungalow is restored and quite peaceful. There is a front sitting porch and a more private back deck. We accept dogs with prior approval and have a large backyard.  Our goal is for you to have an insider's view of Asheville and all it has to offer. We want to share our favorite places to go for the best local food, drink and outdoor fun. For families with children, we have some items to help make your stay as easy and comfortable as possible (pack and play and high chair). Let us host you in our home and our city that we LOVE!

We accept dogs with prior approval and have a large backyard.  Our goal is for you to have an insider's view of Asheville and all it has to offer. We want to share our favorite places to go for the best local food, drink and outdoor fun. For families with children, we have some items to help make your stay as easy and comfortable as possible (pack and play and high chair). Let us host you in our home and our city that we LOVE! The kitchen will be stocked with necessities and treats; we want t
neighborhood_overview: You can easily walk to the French Broad River and the River Arts District to see artists throwing pots & blowing glass. Haywood Rd. (the main strip in West Asheville) has local eateries within walking distance. You may also want to visit some of our local breweries and enjoy our famous craft beer. Our location is so central and easy! Enjoy this quiet neighborhood tucked between downtown and West Asheville.
notes: To help make coming and going a little easier, we have installed a key pad style lock on the front door and will give you the code prior to arrival.
transit: We have room for 2 cars to park off street. There is a bus stop on our corner. We are located literally a few minutes from downtown and walking and biking distance through West Asheville and the River Arts District.
host_about:
After about a year of travelling, Katie and I decided to call Asheville our home in the spring of 2001.  We have really seen our small city grow and flourish.  Asheville continues to be an amazing place to live and raise a family.   As fellow travelers, we like to get a genuine feel for the places we visit and want for you to experience the best Asheville and the surrounding area has to offer.
Katie is a labor and delivery nurse and I have my own plumbing business. We have two kids, some dogs and some chickens. Life is good.

name: Cozy River Arts/ W. Asheville Apt.
summary: Location! A cute and cozy apartment that is centrally located in a residential neighborhood allowing you to stroll to The River Arts District and West Asheville, and just a 30 min. walk to Downtown. Large beautiful yard to relax in!
space: We love our little home in West Asheville and we wanted to share it with others! Our neighborhood is quiet and safe while also maintaining a great location being right in between West Asheville, The River Arts Disctrict and Downtown. In the summer we have tubes you can use to float the French Broad River and you can borrow our bicycles for getting around town. We LOVE our backyard- it's a good size and a perfect place to play corn hole or sit by a fire.

We live right upstairs, so if you need anything at all we are right there to help. We can be as involved or uninvolved with you as you want :) We love meeting new people, but also understand wanting to have t
neighborhood_overview: We live in a great neighborhood. Very quiet and safe for walking and bike riding. Lots of young families. The best thing about our neighborhood is that we are walking distance to so much- we recommend a stroll up the street to Taco Billy for lunch or Hole for a hot fresh donut in the morning.
transit: The public bus stops conveniently at the foot of our street and is just a quick ride to downtown. Otherwise- everything in West Asheville and the River Arts District is just a quick walk away. Uber cab service is also readily available in Asheville, and is a great way to jump around.
host_about: My husband Griff and I love to travel! One of our favorite things about traveling is all the people we meet, for this reason we love the idea of airbnb! We are new to the system, but we look forward to many wonderful stays and meeting some great people!

name: Bright Efficiency in West Asheville
summary: This clean and bright West Asheville efficiency HOMESTAY is a convenient 2 minute drive to downtown Asheville or Haywood Road, West Asheville; close to breweries, music venues and amazing restaurants.
space: Located in a cozy and well kept older home (110 years old!), the apartment is a fully furnished bedroom (queen size bed), small kitchen and bath, with linens and towels provided and high speed wireless internet.   The best thing about this home is the location. You can see the downtown Asheville skyline from the side deck, but the back yard feels secluded and woodsy with tons of birds, cicadas at night and lightning bugs in the summer. In the winter, less green, but a nice view of downtown (especially at nighttime)!  You can walk under the highway to the Earthfare grocery store, a drugstore, deli and other amenities, or to Haywood Road, the main drag through West Asheville.  We are on the same street as Shambala center and the Asheville School of Holistic Herbalism.

neighborhood_overview: This sweet, newly remodeled private space is in a desirable location, a 2 minute drive to downtown Asheville or West Asheville, and a 10 to 15 minute walk to Haywood Road, closest  walkable places (10 to 20 minute walking distance) include 'The Walk', ART bus stop, the Admiral, soon to be built New Belgium Brewery, The Wedge Brewery and River Arts District, The Grey Eagle music venue, White Duck Taco, SunnyPoint Cafe, Zia Taqueria, Battlecat Coffeeshop, and just a bit further to West Asheville businesses including the U-Joint, Westville Pub, and the Isis Theatre, just to name a few.  Also a quick 4 minute drive via Riverside Drive to the Botanical Gardens and UNCA campus.   I recommend planning walks in the daytime, as some neighborhoods do not have sidewalks and are dark at night.  You can walk through neighborhoods to Haywood and points in West Asheville, or past industrial area/construction site of soon to be built New Belgium Brewery to get to River Arts District.  It takes me 10 m
notes: There is no television in the space, just high speed wireless for your laptop or Ipad.   Asheville has been awarded as Beer City USA and its for a reason, there are so many fantastic and delicious brew pubs and beer tours we suggest checking them out.   A 10 to 15 minute drive to the East or South brings you to the scenic Blue Ridge Parkway, visit (website hidden) for info.
transit: A 10-12 minute neighborhood walk to Haywood puts you right at the ART bus stop on Haywood in West Asheville.  Daytime is best for walking as some neighborhoods are more well lit than others.
host_about: Asheville is really my favorite place I have ever experienced.  I lived in Colorado for nearly 16 years, but when I visited Asheville I knew that I had to move here. I love playing music, dancing and going out to the wine bar in downtown Asheville.  I'd love to  be your hostess and give you advice and tips on the great things to do, places to eat, and music to hear in this vibrant town. I also love nature and the outdoors, so being at the congruence of three ancient and beautiful mountain ranges, and easy driving distance to hikes, mountain peaks and water falls, is perfect for me!

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of West Asheville, you have many options. Peruse these articles for descriptions: From New York Times Article: "Gritty is still an operative description for West Asheville, N.C., a section of this city where pawn shops, tattoo parlors and auto repair shops have reigned. But as Ashevillians move to this side of the French Broad River to escape downtown's escalating rents and tourism, the area has become a blue-collar hybrid with yoga studios and bistros joining longtime establishments along the main drag, Haywood Road." THE ODDITORIUM This eclectic venue, part Ripley's and part multigenre performance space, opened in April. Glass cases display such curiosities as Chinese binding shoes and antique mortuary tools. Across the dance floor, the stage hosts everything from live music and poetry readings to comedy. 1045 Haywood Road THE OYSTER HOUSE BREWING COMPANY Oysters abound at this brewery, which opened in June. Shells are embedded into the polished-concrete bar. Its
transit: Close to bus stops; biker friendly neighborhood

summary: I've been an airbnb host for 4+ yrs with  380+ great REVIEWS. All six of my apartments are completely private with separate entrances. Apt #1, #2, #3  are in Historic MONTFORD.  Apt #5, #6, #7 in artsy WEST ASHEVILLE
space: This upstairs garage apartment offers loads of storage, luxury furnishings and the best part it is within walking location to some of Asheville's finest music venues and restaurants. It's sun-filled, quiet, cozy and comes with private entrance. #5 unit boasts a new kitchen w/ stainless appliances, off street parking for a small compact car, 40" cable tv with Roku and wi-fi internet, luxury furnishings, comfortable seating and desk area.

It's sun-filled, quiet, cozy and comes with private entrance. #5 unit boasts a new kitchen w/ stainless appliances, off street parking for a small compact car, 40" cable tv with Roku and wi-fi internet, luxury furnishings, comfortable seating and desk area. Although this is considered to be a very safe neighborhood, I have installed several sets of dusk-to-dawn motion detector flood lights. Long term residents also live on the property but they are completely separate and have separate entries. This unit is above a storage building in the back yard of the large older home. Guests in Apt 5, Apt
neighborhood_overview: The older walking neighborhood with sidewalks is tree-lined and in the heart of funky art and food-crazed West Asheville, known for it's eclectic offerings. Walk to the library, buy fresh produce from the weekly farmers' market, buy coffee beans from the local roaster, and enjoy craft beers at several local brew pubs. Fresh baked goods are available at your choice of bakeries-check out the new one, Hole, that specializes in homemade doughnuts.
notes: The laundry is shared and is located on the premises.
transit: Take an UBER ride* from the airport or rent a car. It's about 15 minutes to/from airport. Getting into downtown from here is easy and there's several routes. You can rent a bike, take the local bus (stop is one block away) or drive 5 minutes. For the walkers, it's about 30 minutes by foot, across the bridge, passing through the River Arts District.  *First time UBER users, feel free to ask about a 20% discount code!
host_about:
I have travel in my blood. I was born in Chateauroux, France. My sister was born in Germany and I learned to speak German when my family lived there for four years. Some of my favorites places include, Lagos de Atitlan, Uxmal, Merida, San Cristobal, Antigua, Ambergris Caye, Chichicastengo, Amsterdam, Vancouver, Cologne, Berlin and Prague. I prefer to travel off the "gringo trail" and have many more places to visit. Open to house trade.

I am a passionate student of compassionate communication (NVC). Two important things I've learned is that other people's behavior rarely has anything to do with me and that with patience and compassion, most all our needs can be met. 

For fun around here I have ridden a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a mountain top zip line tour nearby, seen our ancient mountains during a flying lesson, rented a scooter and rode the blue ridge parkway, took a few archery lessons so I could pretend to be like Katniss from The Hunger Games, which was filmed nearby. I also enjoy sitting in the backyard watching my chickens do goofy things. What do you like to do for fun? Let me share more fun things to do in our beautiful mountains.

summary: This West Asheville home privately located on a quiet residential street, right next to Carrier Park and Asheville Food Park! Haywood Rd (West Asheville's most happening street) and the River Arts District are both a short walk.
space: This three story house has been recently updated, full of all the amenities you need to make your trip comfortable. Enjoy fast WiFi all throughout the house as well as decks on every level. The lower floor is the master suite, which has a desk with lamp, walk in glass shower, comfortable queen size bed, iPad and TV for Netflix/YouTube. An open kitchen/living area is on the main floor along with a half bathroom. Coffee is provided each morning via a convenient Keurig machine. The top floor has two bedrooms (with spacious closets) and a bathroom. One of the bedrooms has a deck right off of it as well as a super-fast PC with 27" screen. All TVs throughout the house have a Chromecast connected so you can stream your favorite content from your phone or the iPad. Each level has independent heating/air control.

neighborhood_overview: We're perfectly situated as one of the best "home bases" in the city. Whether you're sticking to the immediate area or checking out all of Western NC, this is an excellent place to start. Located on a quiet street with recently built homes, we're nearly equidistant from the best attractions in Asheville! One of Asheville's best parks, Carrier Park, is a very short ~5 minute walk away. Asheville Food Park is equally as close, hosting a variety of food trucks daily, farmers market, as well as a permanent coffee shop and bar. There's also kayaking and tubing opportunities nearby on the French Broad River. You'll also be close to Haywood Rd (full of great restaurants, bars, and coffee shops) and the River Arts District (full of working artists, restaurants, and shops). Biltmore Estate is just across the river as well! For day trips, we recommend Linville Falls or Looking Glass Falls (a bit closer). A drive on the Blue Ridge Parkway is also hard to beat any day of the week! There's also Mt.
notes: Details on how to access the space and lots of other helpful info are located within the "House Manual" that you'll receive via email once you book.
transit: Asheville is primarily a car-dependent city, but also very bike-friendly! West Asheville itself is very bikeable, as is the downtown area, but the bus is also accessible. You could also hail an Uber.

description: The Urban Oasis is a spacious and cozy 1Br newly renovated apartment with a private covered porch and hot tub, set in the heart of West Asheville.  Walking distance to some of the best restaurants and shops Asheville has to offer! The Urban Oasis is a recently renovated apartment on the lower level of a 1920's bungalow.   It has one very spacious bedroom, one bathroom with access to a  large wooded shared yard.  Your home away from home has a comfy queen size bed, A/C and a kitchen stocked with an assortment of tea and coffee to keep you comfortable and cozy. A Flat screen tv, books, and games are available to entertain you on a rainy day! Other perks: Off street parking (one space), washer/dryer and pet friendly (with a pet fee). The living room has a queen size fold-out bed! There is an additional linen charge, if it's just 2 guests requesting an extra set. Extra linens are included with the "extra persons fee" (more than 2 people). Guests have a private covered porch with an amazing
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip and eclectic neighborhood with a downtown of its own.   Best brunch contenders Sunny Point and Biscuit Head,  the Admiral, New Belgium Brewery and many more are within walking or biking distance.  Riverside park (has a dog park!) and Carrier park, hiking/biking and river floating are all just a hop and skip away. There is a plethora to see and do right in the neighborhood and Downtown Asheville is an easy bike ride away!
notes: There is  no cable. However, there is a DVD player for watching movies, some books for your reading pleasure and plenty of entertaining things to do around town!  The Urban Oasis is professionally cleaned using all natural/green products!!
transit: You will be walking distance to many great shops, amazing restaurants and bars. Public transport is available and you can get  taxi services for only $20 to downtown round trip!!
host_about:
We are from the Mountains of Western North Carolina. David is a contractor, specializing in GreenBuilding and Melissa is a Physician Assistant at a Family Practice. 
We to love travel, play outdoors with our dog and enjoy all the great restaurants Asheville has to offer.

name: Walkable West Asheville Hideaway
summary: This gem is close to the historic Haywood rd in West Asheville and all it's attractions, but off the street and quiet.
space: Our house is fairly new and is well insulated and cozy. The open floor plan makes it super functional and inviting. We have a full kitchen with dishwasher, washer and dryer and central heat and air. It's fairly quiet and hidden off the street to feel safe and secure yet walkable to everything!
description: This gem is close to the historic Haywood rd in West Asheville and all it's attractions, but off the street and quiet. Our house is fairly new and is well insulated and cozy. The open floor plan makes it super functional and inviting. We have a full kitchen with dishwasher, washer and dryer and central heat and air. It's fairly quiet and hidden off the street to feel safe and secure yet walkable to everything! You will have access to all spaces except one of the three bedrooms will be closed to store extra stuff. If you have a child we can leave the kids room open and close one of the other rooms,can be discussed after booking. We have a small back patio though the sliding glass door from the kitchen that you can relax on if the weather is pleasant. There are two full baths. Two bedrooms have comfortable queen size beds and the third has a twin size bed We will be available through email and will have someone in the area to contact via phone or can be available in person if needed. Wes
neighborhood_overview: West asheville is the hottest area in Asheville right now and our little house is right in the mix of it all. It is walkable to pretty much anything on Haywood rd which hosts an amazing selection of bars, music venues, restaurants, coffee shops, salons and much more. Check out the Guidebook for all my recommendations . The vibe is chill. Everyone is friendly/Kid friendly. Enjoy!
notes: This is our personal residence so there will be lots of our stuff in the house.  I think it makes it feel more cozy and homely. We will be storing extra clutter in the room that's closed, hence why it is off limits. Oh and if you hear jingling bells, it's not Santa and his reindeer it's just the goats right over our fence Ziggy and Cleo grazing the yard ;)
transit: Like I said you can walk walk walk here to all over Haywood rd. There is a bus stop on the corner of our street. Downtown and The River Arts (RAD) is a short 5 minute drive away.
host_about:
I am one of the few natives of Asheville NC and have lived here on and off my whole life. I live here now with my partner Jason and three year old daughter. I am a local hair stylist and my partner works in construction. We love the area and are enjoying the new growth and development of this little city. We have found it to be super child friendly place to live and lots of fun with great folks.
I personally enjoy yoga, swimming , dancing, art and being with friends and family.
We love to travel in the winter times. I have lived in Europe, Central America and recently just moved back here from the bay area California.

name: One block from Haywood Road
summary: My house is conveniently located in the heart of West Asheville near Haywood Road. You are in walking distance to all the favorite restaurants, bars, grocery stores, coffee shops, unique stores, a yoga studio and music venues in West Asheville.
space: Fantastic location in West Asheville. Award winning restaurants like Sunny Point Cafe are a minute walk away. Inside this 1920's bungalow that sits tucked away up on a hill offers urban convenience in a peaceful setting. You will have access to the complete home, with easy off street parking next to the backdoor.  Both bedrooms have new queen size beds, with nice linens and new pillows.  The recently renovated bathroom has a claw foot tub and we provide towels during your stay.  The kitchen has a coffee maker, basic pots and pans, dishes, a nice stove and a microwave to reheat your leftovers. Plenty of chairs are available to sit out on the front porch. There is a new flat screen tv, that is set up with netflix. No cable tv.  The third bed is a futon in the living room for extra guests or kids. 2 cars can fit in driveway more than 2 cars one will need to park on street.

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville has its own funk and charm that is compact and easy to explore.  Walk to great restaurants such as The Admiral, Sunny Point, The Walk, Zia, Biscuit Head, The Isis Music Hall, The Oyster House, The West End Bakery, Asheville Sandwich Co., King Daddy's Chicken and Waffles, The Altamont Brewery, and The Brew Pump where you will find local food trucks.  Zip down to the River Arts District where you can find local art as well as The Wedge Brewing company, The Grey Eagle Music Hall, The Bull and Beggar and All Souls Pizza.  This house is located within 5 miles to thriving Downtown Asheville, The Biltmore Estate, Biltmore Village, Asheville Outdoor Center, Amboy Park, Bent Creek, and The Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: No central A/C but the window units and trees surrounding the property keep the place cool in the summer time. Heating system is oil heat. The house heats up fast. If there are 6 people staying here you will need to leave bedroom doors cracked for heat to come in. Because house is so small heat is not vented into individual rooms.  LGBTQ Friendly
transit: City bus stop 1 block away, I-240/26 access 4 blocks away, downtown Asheville is a 5 minute drive, restaurants, coffee, and bars are within a minutes walk.
host_about:
A resident of Asheville for over 22 years. 

I love the local food scene here. I am happy to recommend anything from a simple hike with amazing views, to the spots to hang like a local. 

Let me know if you have any questions I am happy to help!

name: West Asheville Couple's Retreat
summary: Our beautiful, modern 2 bedroom, 2 1/2 bathroom duplex is your perfect Asheville getaway! You'll be less than 4 blocks from the heart of West Asheville and just minutes to downtown. Yet, the home is tucked away from the street so it's silent...
space: A lovely 2 bedroom, 2 1/2 bathroom duplex in the heart of West Asheville. Walking distance to all the coolness of the neighborhood but tucked away and silent- all you'll hear are the birds! The master bedroom has a queen-sized Tempurpedic bed and a third guest can sleep on the couch in the living room.  Our kitchen is stocked with a dehydrator, juicer, Vitamix blender, food processor, spiralizer and many other toys so you can make healthy meals at home.  No microwave or coffee machine but there are amazing coffee houses within walking distance. Washer and dryer are available to guests as well. Make yourself at home!

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is the best! Hip and laid back, with everything in walking distance.  Great restaurants, music venues, and adorable shops are all at your doorstep.  And Downtown Asheville and the River Arts District are just minutes away.
notes: Everyone who comes to this place mentions what great energy it has and how relaxing it is.  This is truly your urban retreat!
transit: No need for public transportation because you can walk to everything in West Asheville! And two free parking spaces come with the house.
host_about:
I am a former attorney turned actor and entrepreneur.  I own a company called Shift Bars- we make the world's first raw vegan zero-sugar energy bar and launch in late 2015. I love eating awesome, healthy food, hiking, watching movies, dogs and much more.  I love living here and am so excited to share it with you!

Life motto- "Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." George Bernard Shaw

summary: Sweet little home close to all the cool things in East West Asheville! Pet friendly for well behaved dog. Bonus: Horses in the back field!

name: Cozy 2 bedroom. Short walk to WAVL
summary: Our cozy 2 bedroom sleeps 4 lucky folks. Just a couple of minutes walk to trendy West Asheville and a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville, your vacation will be filled with activities before you know it!
space: Our house is located right in the heart of West Asheville. A short walk will bring you to the best bars and restaurants this area has to offer. Check out the popular Sunny Point Cafe for breakfast (featured on Good Morning America) and if you're into craft brews, Pour is a bar that allows you to pour your own beers!  If that isn't enough to fill your schedule, check out downtown Asheville. The arts and craft scene downtown is phenomenal and there is always something being celebrated in town. Take a ride on the La Zoom tour. This big purple school bus takes a comedy tour through the different areas of town, highlighting Asheville's extensive history.  For the outdoorsy type, we are located a short 10 minute drive from the Blue Ridge Parkway and NC Arboretum. Get out and experience all Asheville and the surrounding area has to offer!
description: Our cozy 2 bedroom sleeps 4 lucky folks. Just a couple of minutes walk to trendy West Asheville and a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville, your vacation will be filled with activities before you know it! Our house is located right in the heart of West Asheville. A short walk will bring you to the best bars and restaurants this area has to offer. Check out the popular Sunny Point Cafe for breakfast (featured on Good Morning America) and if you're into craft brews, Pour is a bar that allows you to pour your own beers!  If that isn't enough to fill your schedule, check out downtown Asheville. The arts and craft scene downtown is phenomenal and there is always something being celebrated in town. Take a ride on the La Zoom tour. This big purple school bus takes a comedy tour through the different areas of town, highlighting Asheville's extensive history.  For the outdoorsy type, we are located a short 10 minute drive from the Blue Ridge Parkway and NC Arboretum. Get out and experience all
neighborhood_overview: Where do I begin? West Asheville has everything you could imagine packed into one tiny, walkable space! From nationally known restaurants to fun, relaxed bars, there's really something for everyone here!  If you like a good burger I would have to recommend Universal Joint. This bar/restaurant is in an old converted service station and is one of our all-time favorite places to eat. The Steinbeck burger is loaded with homemade pimento cheese, bacon and pickled (URL HIDDEN) die for! Oh, and did I mention the tater tots? Exquisite. If you're not a burger fan they offer a huge selection of other amazing items. When you're finished with dinner, take a 30 second walk down the street to Pour. This is one of 2 bars in the country where you pour your beer yourself. When you arrive, you get a bracelet that keeps up with how much you've poured. Not sure if you'll like a pumpkin IPA? Just pour yourself a small taste. That's the beauty of Pour. It's a great place to test your palatte! Among the othe
transit: The very best way to get around West Asheville is to walk. You will get to see more and may even find something you wouldn't have seen otherwise. If walking isn't an option or you would like to explore the River Arts District or Downtown Asheville, we have several cab companies and our lovely city now has Uber!  If in need of a ride from the airport I would be happy to pick you up if able for a small charge. Just let me know!
host_about: I am a hardworking girl looking to travel a bit more! I taught school for over 9 years. Since then I have been trying my hand at several fields to see what is the perfect fit for me. I want to be able to make a few changes to my house and would love the opportunity to travel more. I thought airbnb would be the perfect opportunity! I have family all over the place right now: a brother in Japan, sister in Colorado, and a cousin in San Fran--all places I'd love to visit! I love all things silly and quirky especially a good British Comedy or Tom Robbins novel. Much of the reason I moved to Asheville is for the incredible variety of cheap, delicious food and beer. There's always something to do around here whether it's catching a new independent film, tubing down the French Broad River or tasting a new micro-brew!

name: Sweet Studio - Walk West Asheville
summary: Keyless entry with a door code, so you can check-in without host's help!  Full kitchen, queen bed, living area, and private outdoor patio - all within a 10 minute walk to the best of West Asheville.  Just a 5 min drive to downtown. Basement apt.
space: Studio apartment in the heart of West Asheville.  Private entrance and private space.  Walking distance to Sunny Point Cafe, West Asheville Yoga Studio, The Isis, West End Bakery, Westville Pub, The Admiral, the new Biscuit Head, the tailgate market (on Tuesdays), grocery stores, and much more.  15 minute bike ride and a 3 minute drive to downtown.  Even closer to the River Arts district!   Full kitchen, bathroom, queen bed with high quality linens, comfortable living area, including a couch and chair, and a private patio.  Brand new construction, unique, funky, retro, clean and convenient.  I can offer a sleeping pad or air mattress for a 3rd guest. Expect a relaxing environment, comfortable accomodations, mini-split heating/cooling, knowledgabe, friendly, and helpful hosts, a big back yard, and a safe, lovely, and interesting neighborhood.   We love Asheville, and we're happy to tell you why and help you find your way around.  Or leave you alone.  Whatever you prefer.  Y ¡hablamos Es

Expect a relaxing environment, comfortable accomodations, mini-split heating/cooling, knowledga
neighborhood_overview: Walkability is the best feature of my neighborhood.  So many fun restaurants, shops, and night spots are within a 10 minute walk of the studio, as well as quiet neighborhood strolls if you prefer.   Biscuihead for breakfast and The Admiral for dinner are my two recommendations.  If you love to walk, this is your spot!  And downtown is just a 5 minute drive. Walkable evening venues include The Isis, The Mothlight, and Westville Pub.  Other favorites are The Brew Pump, Oyster House, and Dobra Tea.
notes: The pump for the toilet is very sensitive, so PLEASE do not flush anything except toilet paper and human waste.  No condoms, baby wipes, used tampons, tampon inserters, paper towels, cotton balls, plastic of any kind, cotton swabs, or condoms.  That's NO CONDOMS. Sorry, but we've learned that we need to spell it out - ONLY TP and human waste in the toilet please!  Thank you!
transit: One parking place is reserved for you in my drive.  There's also a public bus stop right down the road. And if you prefer to bike, Asheville is bike friendly.
host_about: My daughter Rosa and I share our West Asheville home with our indoor cat, Joey and our sweet dog, Fina.  We have been here for almost 10 years now.  We love to travel, camp, hike, and otherwise enjoy all that Western North Carolina offers.  I lived in Europe for two years and have subsequently traveled extensively, mostly in Central and South America.  I am a Spanish teacher and musician and love to work with children and adults.  I practice yoga, love to read, dance, eat out, and socialize, and feel fortunate to have wound up in this great city of Asheville with my fascinating and fabulous daughter.

name: The Hideaway in West Asheville
summary: A short walk to award winning restaurants, music, breweries, parks, artist studios, and shoppes. Two bedroom, one bath, spacious lower-level 1000 sq ft apartment with access to fenced yard, hot tub, and fire pit. Registered with City of Asheville
space: A short walk to award winning restaurants, music, breweries, parks, artist studios, and shoppes. Two bedroom, one bath, spacious lower-level 1000 sq ft apartment with access to fenced yard, hot tub, and fire pit. Registered with City of Asheville Highlights: Unbeatable location and comfort!  Hot tub!  Cozy beds, a large, climate controlled living space with cable TV, kitchen, and a covered patio and fire pit will make you feel right at home! The Hideaway is a private apartment  located on the lower level of a duplex.  Guests have access to a fenced yard with hot tub, large patio, fire pit, and paved driveway.  The apartment has outdoor appeal but is only a short walk from virtually every downtown convenience imaginable. For added comfort, the Hideaway is equipped with a Mitsubiti Duel Split heating and cooling system with two separate zone controls. This allows for independent temperature control in different parts of the apartment.   We also provide, at no additional charge, area maps

neighborhood_overview: We are smack dab in the middle of downtown West Asheville, Hipster Paradise of the South.  Located just half a block from Haywood Road, you will not need a car to get around.  Our streets are safe to walk day or night.
notes: The Hideaway is located within ONE MILE of... bars (x10 plus), restaurants (x10 plus), breweries (x3), stationary shop, print shop, laundromat, nail salon, hair salon, baby store, consignment shop, vintage clothing store, tienda, pizzeria, bike shop, tattoo salons (x3), acupuncture, massage school, yoga studio, fitness center, grocer, market, bakeries(x3), dog park, cafe, coffee roaster,  music venues, banks, art studios, mechanic, pawn shop, hardware store...You name it!  Its here! The Hidaway is cleaned with non-toxic Shaklee products!  In addition to a thorough cleaning, all bed linens are laundered and light switches, handles, and remotes are thoroughly sanitized before each guest visit.
transit: If your flying in, the Hideaway is 12 miles from Asheville Regional Airport.  Once your here, It's an easy walk to any West Asheville business or park.  The eclectic River Arts District (RAD) is just a mile away!  Downtown historic district (Asheville proper) is approximately 2 miles away. River access is less than one mile away at Carrier Park.  Here, you can put in a canoe, kayak or tube and float the river.  The park also has many miles of walking trails, a dog park, a velodrome, volleyball, baseball and soccer fields, and a field hockey rink.
host_about: I'm at home here in Asheville, the "Friendly City" where I get to enjoy the trails with my 2- and 4-legged friends, go out for fantastic meals, see touring music, try new brews every week, and appreciate art at every turn.  It's a great place to visit and I am happy to help with suggested sights!

description: Colorful little home in West Asheville just minutes walk to main drag of Restaurants, Pubs, Cafes and shops on Haywood Ave.    And just a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, French Broad River and Blue Ridge Parkway. First floor unit is available for airbnb rental.  There is a tenant in the basement unit below.     First floor rental unit uses free street parking just in front of house.  Front yard and side porch is for airbnb renters private use. Driveway and backyard parking is for downstairs tenant only. I am available when guest arrive for house tour, recommendations, directions, etc.  Me and my two cats and one dog live and have an art studio in the basement unit and I am available by phone anytime. Guest are always welcome to visit and socialize with me and my pets in the
neighborhood_overview: The Brucemont Circle  Neighborhood is a great little street in West Asheville.  Because Brucemont Circle is not a threw street and just does a loop, the street stays very quiet and does not have a lot of traffic. Great street to take a nice stroll. Beautiful older homes with great gardens and trees. It is also conveniently just a block from the main drag, Haywood Road, in West Asheville.  Walk-able to all the restaurants, pubs, and music that line Haywood Road.
notes: Pets (cats and dog) do live on the premises and in the unit when there are no renters.  If you have any pet allergies please realize that the unit is cleaned thoroughly but pet allergies are still not recommended.
transit: To vist all of Asheville it is best by car or bicycle.  But West Asheville is very enjoyable by foot!
host_about: Hi, I am an artist living in the Western North area of NC.   I enjoy sharing my home with others and introducing them to the beauty of these amazing mountains.  I love to travel, draw, paint and sculpt. I also love to swing dance. Look forward to meeting amazing people from around the world through airbnb!

name: Woodsy Retreat In Town
summary: New home in West Asheville with modern kitchen/baths and three bedrooms, and in close proximity to many restaurants, bars, and shopping.  Peaceful, semi-wooded location with easy access to Haywood Rd., River Arts District, and downtown.
space: This is a new house, finished in January 2014, in which I live and occasionally rent out to guests when convenient.  The house is suited for a couple, a couple of couples, a small family, or a single traveler who wants ample space in the heart of West Asheville.  Amenities include a full modern kitchen, three bedrooms, an endless supply of hot water (tankless water heater), wireless internet, large porch with old-school metal glider, off street parking, and a bonfire pit.  There are birds singing in the morning and lightning bugs in the evening, amidst tall oaks and bamboo, very nice to soak in from the elevated front porch.
description: New home in West Asheville with modern kitchen/baths and three bedrooms, and in close proximity to many restaurants, bars, and shopping.  Peaceful, semi-wooded location with easy access to Haywood Rd., River Arts District, and downtown. This is a new house, finished in January 2014, in which I live and occasionally rent out to guests when convenient.  The house is suited for a couple, a couple of couples, a small family, or a single traveler who wants ample space in the heart of West Asheville.  Amenities include a full modern kitchen, three bedrooms, an endless supply of hot water (tankless water heater), wireless internet, large porch with old-school metal glider, off street parking, and a bonfire pit.  There are birds singing in the morning and lightning bugs in the evening, amidst tall oaks and bamboo, very nice to soak in from the elevated front porch. Guests will have full and exclusive use of the top three floors of the house.  I may sporadically come in and out of the basement
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is "eclectic" and is more or less at the epicenter of what's considered to be the liveliest/"hippest" part of Asheville.  There's an interesting/unusual/artistic community garden just two blocks up the street (Christopher Mello's Gnomon Garden) which is very kid friendly.  Also there's a bio-diesel pump right up the street.  Great food and nightlife is a five minute walk away (WALK, Admiral, Double Crown, Battlecat, Desoto Lounge, Isis, King Daddy's, Sunny Point, etc.)  You can very easily walk to many other local coffee shops, restaurants, bars, and shopping on Haywood Rd. in West Asheville.  The River Arts District, the French Broad River, and Carrier Park are all nearby.  The house is just three turns off of I-240 so very convenient to access.  You can walk to most places of interest in West Asheville from the house, and getting out to Bent Creek, DuPont, or Pisgah for a hike or mountain bike ride is a breeze.
transit: Public transit in Asheville is a joke, better you have your own car or bike to get around.  It's a 15-20 minute walk or 5 minute drive to downtown.  10 minutes to the Biltmore Estate area of town.  All of West Asheville is within very easy reach by foot.
host_about:
About me: I enjoy mountain biking, flatwater kayaking, reading (mostly non-fiction/science/anthropology/psychology/history), photography, spending time with friends and family, and traveling internationally (30 countries so far, most recently in Panama, Morocco, and Poland).  

As an airbnb guest I'm clean, considerate, and respectful.  I like it best when I can spend a little time getting to know my host -- although this certainly isn't a necessity -- as I've met very interesting people this way.

As an airbnb host I want to make sure that my guests are very comfortable and that I'm giving them a great place to stay at a fair price.

name: Relax in West Asheville Homestay
summary: This 2 bedroom/2.5 bath house is perfect for a weekend getaway to relax and visit with family and friends. The ideal location gives you access to all of the attractions and out door activities that Asheville has to offer.
space: Main Floor sitting room that can be converted into bedroom with a very comfortable, luxury futon modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances and granite countertops 42" flat screen TV large dining table that seats 8-10 people two tiered back deck with an amazing view, gas grill and plenty of seating powder room with granite countertops 2nd floor 3 bedrooms with queen size beds large master bathroom and additional full bathroom for guests to share front load washer and dryer ceiling fans in every room central heating and air key-less entry

Guests are welcome to call or text if there are any questions or concerns. This property is within walking distance of multiple restaurants and bars s
neighborhood_overview: This property is within walking distance of multiple restaurants and bars such as Hole Doughnut shop, Wedge Brewery, The Admiral, Sunny Point Cafe, White Duck Taco, Biscuit Head, 12 Bones Smokehouse among many others. For outdoor activities you have easy access to the French Broad River for tubing, kayaking and fishing and Carrier Park for biking and running. Urban heights is a very short drive where you will find restaurants, day spas, art galleries and shopping. The house is only a few miles from the River Arts District where you can peruse the beautiful creations of local artists. You are also only minutes from New Belgium Brewery, the Biltmore Estate, the Asheville outlets and The Grove Park Inn. The Asheville Regional Airport is conveniently located about 20 minutes away.
notes: The house has a 42-inch flat-screen TV in the living room. We don't have cable service, but we do provide free Netflix which features hundreds of movies and TV shows. If you have a Hulu, Pandora or Spotify account, you can also sign in to those services on the TV.

name: Modern/ Earthy West AVL Bungalow
summary: Our Newly remodeled bungalow is conveniently locate in hip West Asheville.  Entire house rental comes fully furnished, boast large cooking and entertaining spaces, has 2 bedrooms, and 1 spacious bathroom.  Private parking for 3 cars, front and back porches, gas grill and laundry available.
space: This newly remolded home has a clean, uncluttered, modern feel with earthy accents that make it warm and inviting. You couldn't ask for a better location. Just blocks off the interstate for easy access. Walking distance from The Admiral, Isis, Sunny Point Cafe,  Biscuit Head, Nine Mile  Oysterhouse Brewing, Westville Pub, The Universal Joint, Standard Pizza, and Lucky Otter just to name a few.  Entertaining is made easy whether you prefer relaxing on the front porch, staying indoors, or going out on the town. A small TV in the living area has netflix. There is also a music system to plug your iphone or music device up to located in the living room, and can be heard throughout the home. Both bedrooms have full size beds. A queen size blow up mattress is also available UPON REQUEST.  All beds, including air mattress, are fitted with sheets, comforter, and pillows.  Large kitchen space is great for cooking with friends and family or enjoying a small breakfast for two. The stove has recent

neighborhood_overview: *Please note that the street view is NOT accurate.   Our West AVL neighborhood is a family friendly, hip place to stay while visiting North Carolina.  West AVL is centrally located with several of Asheville's most popular and well reviewed restaurants, shops, and galleries.  Everything you need is right here in West Asheville coffee shops, grocery, pharmacy, bars/ pubs, music venues, hiking trails, and the French Broad River. But if you do decide to venture out of West AVL, downtown is just minutes away as is the Blue Ridge Parkway, The Biltmore Estate, and RAD (River Arts District)
notes: *The Street view listed is NOT accurate. Great for Family and Friends Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Years rental! We now have a small vegetable and herb garden that we are allowing guest to pick from.  Right now we have lots of Kale, salad greens,strawberries, basil, cilantro and other herbs  We usually leave a freshly picked bag out for guest use.  Later in the summer we will have tomatoes, peppers, eggplant, and cabbage.   (Garden is still producing kale, arugula, tatsoi, and cilantro under hoops)
transit: Home location makes walking and biking an easy choice.  Public transit is available, but limited.  Taxis are always available.  A taxi ride home from most anywhere in town is about $10. Asheville now has Uber taxi service too.
host_about:
My partner, Kevin, and I are avid Airbnb host and guest.  We love traveling and sharing our home in Asheville, NC with other travelers.  Through our adventures we have discovered just how beautiful this tiny little planet is.  We do our best to keep it that way.  We use all natural and homemade cleaning supplies, recycle, up-cycle, compost, grow our own, and share :) 
We have two big old dogs who have traveled almost everywhere with us.  They are respectful, calm, and adorable.
We are also interested in home swapping.

name: Dog Friendly Bungalow in W. AVL
summary: Howdy! I'm so excited to be offering my home up to AirB&B! Its a quick walk to the hot-spots of West Asheville and is a great walk into downtown, via the art scene of the RiverArts District. It has two awesome porches, a yard, and is PUP FRIENDLY!
space: Check In - 2:00 p.m. Check Out - 11:00 a.m.
description: Howdy! I'm so excited to be offering my home up to AirB&B! Its a quick walk to the hot-spots of West Asheville and is a great walk into downtown, via the art scene of the RiverArts District. It has two awesome porches, a yard, and is PUP FRIENDLY! Check In - 2:00 p.m. Check Out - 11:00 a.m. **Please note: There are window units in the two bedrooms, but the house does not have Central A/C. I find that the ceiling fans do just fine keeping me cool but I understand if some people prefer to have A/C throughout. So thats just FYI :D
notes: **Please note: There are window units in the two bedrooms, but the house does not have Central A/C. I find that the ceiling fans do just fine keeping me cool but I understand if some people prefer to have A/C throughout. So thats just FYI :D
host_about:
Well hello! I'm Morgan and I'm a long-time resident of Asheville, NC. I love it here in the mountains but am always looking to get out of town on an adventure.

I'm an entrepreneur of sorts in that I started a tree service with my brother in 2009 and I also have been working as a wardrobe stylist since 2010. I love the variety of my work and how one day I'll be chipping brush and the next I'll be dressing the Avett Brothers- it really is a blast!

I'm somewhat of a quiet person though I do enjoy getting together with friends or taking myself out for a night on the town. When staying at someone's house, I am always conscientious of that person's life and am very respectful of everything in their home; I hope you feel the same way!

Looking forward to sharing my home with you,

-MP
