name: 1930's charmer in West Asheville
summary: Welcome to our 1930's historic charmer in eclectic West Asheville! Enjoy being close to EVERYTHING that Asheville has to offer! Just a short walk to restaurants, coffee shops, bars, festivals, music venues, and the great outdoors!
space: Welcome to lots of charm! We love our home!:) Our 2500sqft 1930's home has all of the original fixtures, including glass doorknobs and red radiators! The house has 4 bedrooms that can sleep up to 10, and 2 bathrooms. There is an additional studio apartment off of the kitchen that can be used with a reservation of 8 or more.  The "main" house has a big spacious living room and music room (including piano), dining room, and well equipped kitchen with gas stove, stocked pantry, and farm sink with a mountain view. The master bedroom is on the main floor with a king sized bed in it and an attached "movie room"/bedroom. This has a pull out couch in it to accommodate 2 people. The bathroom downstairs has a claw foot tub and shower. There is another pull out couch in the living room for 2 more people. Upstairs there is a reading nook, laundry room, bathroom with a claw foot tub and shower, and two bedrooms. One bedroom has a queen bed, desk, and mountain view. The other bedroom has a set of tw

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a safe walkable place. There are several local restaurants, coffee shops, stores, bars, and music venues within walking distance. Some of our favorites are The Isis, the Grey Eagle, the Wedge, the Urban Orchard, White Duck Taco, Sunny Point Cafe, BiscuitHead, the Wedge, the Admiral, the West End Bakery, and many more!
notes: *The cool Asheville weather allows us to live most of the summer with the windows open and a cool mountain breeze. There are, however, window AC units in the bedrooms for the occasional heat wave.  *We have two adopted cats that stay on our front porch and yard. Blotchy and Fluffy do not come in, but Please feel free to love and pet them. They love attention.  * a reservation of 7 or more includes the studio apartment * the house is fully furnished. We provide linens, toiletries, coffee, and teas. *we have a lease agreement that you will need to sign before your stay.
transit: We are about 3 miles to downtown Asheville  About a 10-15 minute walk to downtown West Asheville or the River Arts District A 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville A 10 minute walk to the French broad river A 5 minute drive to the Biltmore estate  Take note: Asheville is hilly wherever you walk.  Lots of taxis Close to a bus stop 3 minutes away from I-240
host_about: Our family has lived in this beautiful home for six years and we've put a lot of love and energy into it. We enjoy hiking, working in our yard, and spending quality time with one another and our friends. We love to travel and during our most recent stay in an airbnb in Scotland, we decided to open our home to travelers. We look forward to meeting you!

name: Sweet spot in West Asheville
summary: Colorful home in quiet, friendly neighborhood in "East West Asheville," close to everything! Walk to coffee shops, restaurants and bars; 1 mile from River Arts District, and just 2 miles from downtown. Comfortable patio and a cool shaded lot. *Pets and additional guests require prior approval, please.
space: Colorful home in quiet, friendly neighborhood in "East West Asheville," close to everything! Walk to coffee shops, restaurants and bars; 1 mile from River Arts District, and just 2 miles from downtown. Comfortable patio and a cool shaded lot. *Pets and additional guests require prior approval, please. My house is painted beautiful bright colors so hopefully you will find it an artsy cheerful place to be. There's purple, orange,  green, teal and many many green plants. There is a nice patio space in the back that is partly shaded and partly sunny. (Please do not use the fire pit).  This home was built in 1962 and is on 1/3 of an acre beside 2 neighbors and behind a beautiful elementary school.  I have a dog that lives here with me, but I would have him with me when you stay.  I am comfortable most of the year with the windows open and the breeze. The house is shaded and stays cool and there are ceiling fans that make it comfortable. If it gets cold, there are extra blankets available. P

There is a nice patio space in the back that is partly shaded and partly sunny. (Please do not use the fire pit).  This home was built in 1962 and is on 1/3 of an acre beside 2 neighbors and behind a beautiful elementary sch
neighborhood_overview: I love that I can walk to everything, starting with walking to my favorite coffee shop, Battlecat, just around the corner. Haywood Rd has everything I need within a mile and a half including market, grocery, yummy restaurants, bars with outdoor seating and great beer selection, my favorite yoga studio, juice bars, and my wonderful school where I teach! Everything is so close on a bike too- I can be downtown in 10 minutes, and my house is only a half mile from Carrier Park where I like to jog on the Greenway by Hominy Creek/French Broad River. And I really love that folks are friendly and say hello.
notes: I am open to pets, though I would like to hear about them first. I have one dog (who would be with me) who is older and so well behaved, doesn't have "accidents" in the house, chew, get on furniture, etc.  I do have a dog door that can be open and closed that leads to the back, fenced in yard.
transit: There's lots to walk to or a short drive. The ART bus is not super frequent or fast but there are stops that are close by and the schedule is easy to access online. Taxis are cheap if you want to get back from downtown later than the bus, around $10.
host_about: I am a hard working teacher. I like to walk, love to eat well and practice yoga. I love to read and learn and occasionally play some music or dabble in an artsy project. My partner and dog live here with me.

name: Great location- Walk to River Park
summary: This house is conveniently located 2 blocks from a 6-mile stretch of park on the river and one mile to the River Arts District, W. Ashe shops and breweries, and Biltmore Village. Just 3 miles downtown- or a $7 cab ride:)
space: Comfortable master has a queen bed and private bath. Two additional bedrooms feature one full size bed and one single. A futon in the living room pulls into a full size bed to sleep two more. Front porch provides comfy seats for enjoying Asheville weather and back porch for dining outside. Garden in front provides summer produce and fenced side yard has a swing set for the big or little kid at heart.
description: This house is conveniently located 2 blocks from a 6-mile stretch of park on the river and one mile to the River Arts District, W. Ashe shops and breweries, and Biltmore Village. Just 3 miles downtown- or a $7 cab ride:) Comfortable master has a queen bed and private bath. Two additional bedrooms feature one full size bed and one single. A futon in the living room pulls into a full size bed to sleep two more. Front porch provides comfy seats for enjoying Asheville weather and back porch for dining outside. Garden in front provides summer produce and fenced side yard has a swing set for the big or little kid at heart. Guests have access to the full upstairs of the house. Whether seeking adventure on trails or river (ask about borrowing canoe), live music, or a family oriented visit to Asheville I'm your go to host. I am offsite but can be reached via phone, email, or online through airbnb. Only 2 blocks from the River Walk you can enjoy the 6 miles of trails along the river for easy wal
neighborhood_overview: Only 2 blocks from the River Walk you can enjoy the 6 miles of trails along the river for easy walking and/or bike riding. The park also features Asheville's best playground. The neighborhood is in the best location in Asheville with several of Asheville's best restaurants and music venues within a mile of the home.
transit: The house is a mere 1 block from the closest bus stop. You can head out from the house in 3 directions and be on Haywood (the main street in West Asheville), Biltmore Village, or downtown within minutes in a car or on a bike.

name: Private Entrance Studio Suite
summary: Romantic Top O' The Knob Chalet.  Spacious, private room. Living space includes bedroom, living room, & walk-in closet;  w/ spa bath & double shower.  Private deck/porch; spectacular view of the Blue Ridge Mountains.   High-end bedding and amenities.
space: Private entrance, recently renovated, this space is superb for relaxing and is only a few minutes from trendy West Asheville and ten from Downtown.  New pillow top mattress and bedding, Sateen Egyptian Cotton sheets and duvet.  Spa tub, huge shower, separate sitting area.  Our reviews are five-star across the board from here and other rental sites.  Just a 20 minute drive from the Asheville Airport.
description: Romantic Top O' The Knob Chalet.  Spacious, private room. Living space includes bedroom, living room, & walk-in closet;  w/ spa bath & double shower.  Private deck/porch; spectacular view of the Blue Ridge Mountains.   High-end bedding and amenities. Private entrance, recently renovated, this space is superb for relaxing and is only a few minutes from trendy West Asheville and ten from Downtown.  New pillow top mattress and bedding, Sateen Egyptian Cotton sheets and duvet.  Spa tub, huge shower, separate sitting area.  Our reviews are five-star across the board from here and other rental sites.  Just a 20 minute drive from the Asheville Airport. Guests have a designated parking space on blacktop and a short stroll will bring you to your separate entrance where you can come and go with privacy.  Extra parking for an additional vehicle is available in a designated area. Ken and Patti will greet you at check-in and are available to answer questions throughout your stay.  The room has a pr
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is residential and in a rural area.  Take I 40 to exit 44.  Turn toward Asheville.  Turn left at the first light onto Old Haywood Road.  Go approximately 1/2 mile and turn left onto Starnes Cove Road.  Go 3/4 mile and turn right onto Pisgah View Road.  Go 2/10 mile and turn left onto McKinney Road.  Turn right on the first street on the right which is Candler Knob Road.  Go up the hill approximately 1/2 mile.  Our mailbox is on the right, and the driveway is on the left across from the mailbox.  The turn is a hairpin turn up the driveway.  If you can't make the turn, continue down Candler Knob to the water towers on the left to make the turn to come back down Candler Knob to our driveway.  Park in the Guest Parking.
notes: The mailbox is across the street from our driveway.  Our driveway is paved but it is a bit steep, cuts to left, and winds around the house in the front to the side.  Please do not turn around in the neighbor's driveway.  If you come in from the West, it is best to continue past our driveway to the large water storage tanks 1/10th of a mile on the left and turn around there to backtrack and gain easy access our paved drive.  We are a five-star property on other rental sites.  Some of our references are quoted below: Kevin L. said...PERFECTO!!! Date of Stay:  Decemb(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Visited family for 3 days.  After driving 10 hrs, this was nice.  Big, comfy bed. Big bathroom, everything very clean.  Nice coffee maker.  Ken & Patti are very helpful.  We will be back!! Rachael H. said...Great Place to Stay! Date of Stay:  December 4, 2015 Me and my girlfriend wanted come to Asheville for a girls weekend. We are from Charleston. We have never used VRBO. Great first experience with grea
transit: We are approximately 3 miles from Interstate 40 which is the main East/West thoroughfare.  We will have a map available for you to navigate Asheville.  Ubercab is available to Downtown for $9 - $15.
host_about: Ken is originally from South Florida, and Patti is originally from Southern California.  Ken moved to the mountains in 1982 and Patti moved in 1992.  We are both retired, and have four children and seven grand children between us.  We love the Mountains but enjoy getting away to the ocean where we are advanced scuba divers.  We also enjoy traveling and meeting new people.  Most recently, we went to the Southwest to visit Sedona, AZ; Cortez, CO; Bryce Canyon and Zion National Park, UT; and the southern Alaska area.  Several of our pictures from this trip appear in the rental suite.  We look forward to having guests in our recently renovated space, and if you're really lucky and ask really nice (and are here long enough), you might get some North Carolina BBQ (Ken is an excellent BBQ chef and cook).

name: Pinball Sanctuary West
summary: Privacy is yours in this mother-in-law suite with a separate entrance. Our pinball machine collection is at your fingertips. Secluded mountian getaway 5.5 miles from downtown Asheville. The queen sized memory foam mattress has many sleeping late. The chickens are raucous comedians as your neighbors!
space: The pinball machines are on free play all the time, there is no charge to play! We have four working machines at the moment. The assortment changes regularly with some machines being lovingly worked on, at times.  The guest room is located on the same, lower level of the house. There is an empty dresser, large table, shelves, and a mandolin for your use. A private bathroom with shower is attached to the guest room. A space heater is provided in the cooler months for added comfort. A fan is also provided for use anytime. A small fridge, coffee maker with coffee, and microwave are yours to use as well. The bed is a guest favorite having many want to stay longer than  intended. The chickens are fun neighbors!

The bed is a guest favorite having many want to stay longer than  intended. The chickens ar
neighborhood_overview: We live on a dead end gravel road that is nestled on a forested hill. The driveway is typical of many in the area, steep and gravel in sections. It is intimidating to some. Fun for others! You can drive to west Asheville in five minutes. Fifteen minutes to downtown Asheville. We love all the trees surrounding the property. We are just outside the city limit and it certainly feels like the country. Our rooster will not let you forget where you are. The steep gravel driveway may give you a thrill!
notes: We have chickens who free range in the yard. They provide us with endless amusement and the occasional ill placed poop. A broom is provided to keep the entryway tidy. We have a dog that may bark for short periods at random times. Luckily the house is built like a fort so the noise seems to stay upstairs according to previous guests. Also, we have a cat that has had access to the guest room in the past. We have had the guest suite deep cleaned sense then but some cat hair residue may still be detectable to the extremely allergic. She might leave a little trail of kitty paw prints on your car if you are lucky.
transit: Being just outside the city limit, there is no public transportation to the house. The last city bus stop is over a mile away.  We use über when we need a ride service but there are several cab companies that are also available.
host_about: I love Asheville! I have lived here most of my life. I graduated from Warren Wilson College with a BA in Philosophy but also studied the ecosystem with time spent working in native plant restoration. I love helping people explore the area. I like the natural world. Trees, plants, minerals, animals, air, and sometimes fire.

name: Hot Tub! "The Silver Bettie"! Glamp
summary: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more- only 5 of our 11 "glampsites" are listed on airbnb. The other 6 sites are exclusive to ashevilleglamping 's home site.
space: Hi! We are Joanna and Josh! Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" We aim to give our guests a unique travel experience with our whimsical vacation rentals! *Only a few of our listings are on the airbnb website.  Follow us on INSTAGRAM @ashevilleglamping and check out pictures of our other sites and glamping adventures! Come stay in an awesome 1955 Spartan Royal Manor-the Queen of Vintage Campers! The Silver Bettie is equipped with all of the modern comforts with decorative tributes to the 1950's atomic era! The Bettie also features a brand new 4 person round hot tub :-)  Our Spartan was manufactured in 1955 by the Spartan Aircraft Company who made their start making war planes during WWII. After the war Spartan began making these huge luxury rolling caravan's. The first Spartan Camper was made in 1948 and the last Spartan was manufactured in the early 60's before the company closed it's doors for good in Tulsa Oklahoma.  The Bettie is similar to an airstream, but with MUCH more h

neighborhood_overview: ***To whom it may concern: We are operating a legal rental. Our property is covered under zoning as a campground. In August of 2015, Asheville has started to enforce the ban on short term rentals that are located within Asheville city limits that are in areas that are zoned residential- our properties are zoned "open use" just outside of Asheville city limits, in West Asheville.  Asheville Glamping is  just minutes from  down town asheville and only 2 miles from the booming West Asheville- yet once your in the center of our property, you wouldn't believe you are so close to downtown! We love our neighborhood because it has a woodsy feel, but it's so close to downtown! Our 3 acre property is in a neighborhood located just two short miles from popular haywood road in west asheville which is lined with breweries and fantastic eateries! We provide all of our guests with a local guide with our favorite places to go in the area, including everything on haywood road!  We are just 5 miles from
notes: Please note again that we can not allow dogs or any pets - not even our own 3 doggies are allowed in our vintage campers-  thanks for understanding!
transit: You will need a car
host_about: We LOVE alternative dwellings and micro housing. We ourselves live in a  270 sq ft vintage camper with our three dogs. We have really been enjoying the opportunity to share our land with guests and have met so many amazing people through hosting on AIRBNB.   Together, Josh and I own two pieces of land in Asheville. One has just the yurt alone on it. Our other property is home to Bettie and also has several private campsites. It's nice to be able to offer people a range of options- from camping on the cheap to enjoying a luxurious stay in our yurt or restored vintage trailer! Joanna owns an environmentally conscious cleaning company in Asheville, Clean Green Asheville. Josh makes tactical gear like tourniquet holders and works out of his airstream shop. We are both very friendly and active people and we do all of the work on both properties ourselves :-)

name: West Asheville Efficiency Loft
summary: You'll love this finished attic space equipped with everything you need for a comfortable stay in Asheville.  You will have a private entrance to your own apartment complete with a bedroom, bathroom, sitting/dining area, and efficiency kitchen.
space: I will welcome you with a small treat from a local business.  In the bedroom you'll find a comfortable queen size bed complete with linens. There is also a luggage rack, closet with hangers, dresser and bench.   The efficiency kitchen is stocked with dishes, basic cooking utensils, dish soap, dish drainer, dish towels, washcloths, microwave and refrigerator. I will also make sure that you have coffee and tea.  There is also an electric tea kettle and french press.  Towels, washcloths, shampoo, conditioner and soap are provided for you.  My house has central heat and air but it is not sufficient for keeping a comfortable temperature upstairs. In the summer there are window units that do a great job and keeping the space cool. During the colder months there will be space heaters.   My cat Henry lives in the main portion of the house but doesn't go into the rental. Pets are not allowed in the rental. The furniture and linens are new and the space has been recently renovated. I love animal

neighborhood_overview: I live in a small, quiet neighborhood in West Asheville.
notes: Monthly rental includes weekly linen change and optional cleaning of apartment.
transit: My house is located close to Haywood street in West Asheville. The Altamont Brewery and Nona Mia are a short walk.  You can walk or drive down Haywood street where you'll find the Universal Joint (great burgers), Pour Taproom (pay by the ounce for beer or wine), Odd's Café (coffee and yummy pastries), Sunny Point Café (best Huevos Rancheros ever) and many other great places to eat, drink and shop! Downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway and anything else you might want to do in Asheville are only a short car drive away. I also live close to several bus lines if you prefer public transportation. Riding your bike is also a great option for getting around Asheville.
host_about:
It's hard to believe that I've lived in Asheville for 10 years,  it has felt like home since the moment I moved here. I am fortunate to have a job that I love, a home to share, and an amazing community of friends.  There are so many things to see and do in Asheville. A few of my favorite are  riding my mountain in Bent Creek,  enjoying a good glass of red wine at Sante or the Battery Park Book Exchange, floating down the french broad river, frequenting the never ending list of eateries, seeing a show at the Orange Peel or Grey Eagle, and  catching a movie at the Fine Arts Theatre or the Brew and View. Sometimes you'll find me just being plain ol' lazy because the one thing I can't live without is a good nights sleep! I also enjoy reading a good book and making jewelry.

I'm an easy going person that is dependable. As your host, I will do my best to make sure that you are comfortable and have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable.

name: Trails End Cabin Pisgah Nat. Forest
summary: If you're looking to explore nature then book your stay at the most unique and private cabin in the mountains of Western North Carolina. Trails End Cabin is located in the Pisgah National Forest. No neighbors, no traffic, no distracts and no worries.
space: Bring your bomber and clean the twisty single and dual tracks and the national forest offers endless miles of hiking, running and mountain bike trails.  Enjoy a mud-ectomy for both you and your bike in the outside hot and cold shower. Pitch horseshoes as your dinner smokes on one of the two professional grade grills on the local blue granite stone patio and walkway.  Enjoy your favorite beverage on the over-sized deck with endless views of mother nature's best work.   Inside the cabin you'll enjoy cooking in one of two kitchens.  One complete kitchen upstairs and a new kitchen downstairs.  The cabin features locally harvested knotty pine in throughout and beautiful oak hardwood flooring.   There's three bedrooms upstairs along with one full bath and one half bath.  Downstairs there's a bunk house bedroom which has multiple beds for extended guests. I'm an Asheville/WNC native.  I love hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic  and ancient mountains.   My vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, Pandora, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, DOG FRIENDLY and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back.

My best friend Troy Pope and I are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

I look forward to sharing this area with you!

summary: This charming home will welcome you with it's comforting and unique space. Huge updated kitchen, quiet deck, comfortable rooms, and one-of-a-kind artwork. Just 4 blocks from the heart of West Asheville and 10 minutes from downtown.
space: The house is full of sunshine, has a gorgeous newly renovated kitchen, two living rooms, three bedrooms, a large deck with a grill, and a vegetable garden that you're welcome to eat from. Would be great for a family or a group getaway!
description: This charming home will welcome you with it's comforting and unique space. Huge updated kitchen, quiet deck, comfortable rooms, and one-of-a-kind artwork. The house is full of sunshine, has a gorgeous newly renovated kitchen, two living rooms, three bedrooms, a large deck with a grill, and a vegetable garden that you're welcome to eat from. Would be great for a family or a group getaway! The entire home, deck, and yard (except the basement). We may be available to check you in, but will be away throughout your visit. host_about:
I am a full time, self-employed artist. My love for craft and art can be seen in my home- fine art, pottery, photography, sculpture. I have an affinity for cooking, growing things, building things, walking in the woods, and deep conversation.
I sell my artwork at craft shows across the country and discover amazing places along the way. But coming home to Asheville is always a blessing!
My space is welcoming, lovely, and quiet- but accessible to everything! I love my home and hope my guests will, as well.

name: Modern small home in West AVL
summary: Our modern home is 800 sq feet with a private screened porch facing greenery. The open floor plan is centered around a big kitchen with tall ceilings and lots of windows for natural light. We're in the heart of West Avl (Best AVL) and love it here.
space: We live in a sweet house that was just finished in May 2015. It's small because we aspire to live a simple life with less stuff. The design is clean, modern, and has lots of natural light.  You will enter the house through the bathroom\mudroom with a keycode. The bathroom has a washer, dryer, energy efficient toilet, and an amazing shower with glass doors. We have an on-demand hot water heater so you can take the hottest showers you can stand! The open floor plan features a large kitchen with an island used for cooking prep or eating. The L shaped bench seating is the perfect nook for meals, reading, working, or catching up with friends. The kitchen has everything I'd ever want - crock pot, juicer, food processor, sharp knives, coffee grinder, and more. If you can't tell, I love to cook so the kitchen gets a lot of love from me.  The bedroom has a closed door off of the main part of the house. It faces north so it's nice and dark for sleeping. The queen sized bed is pillowtop and we us
description: Our modern home is 800 sq feet with a private screened porch facing greenery. The open floor plan is centered around a big kitchen with tall ceilings and lots of windows for natural light. We're in the heart of West Avl (Best AVL) and love it here. We live in a sweet house that was just finished in May 2015. It's small because we aspire to live a simple life with less stuff. The design is clean, modern, and has lots of natural light.  You will enter the house through the bathroom\mudroom with a keycode. The bathroom has a washer, dryer, energy efficient toilet, and an amazing shower with glass doors. We have an on-demand hot water heater so you can take the hottest showers you can stand! The open floor plan features a large kitchen with an island used for cooking prep or eating. The L shaped bench seating is the perfect nook for meals, reading, working, or catching up with friends. The kitchen has everything I'd ever want - crock pot, juicer, food processor, sharp knives, coffee grinde
neighborhood_overview: We live in the best part of the best neighborhood in Asheville. 5 minutes walking is a group of bars and restaurants, and an organic grocery store with a juice and tea bar. Feel free to ask for recommendations to restaurants - we're foodies and have tried a lot of places. 1 mile away is a dirt trail that follows a creek. The creek flows to the French Broad River, which has a paved greenway with a dog park, velodrome, and food trucks along the way. Downtown Asheville is a 10-15 minute drive. The River Arts District has studios where you can watch artists create and buy gifts. The Asheville area has hundreds of amazing hikes and there's nothing like the mountains here.
notes: A reminder that from the road to the house is a long set of stairs. And, access to the loft requires climbing a stair\ladder that is very steep. Also, our sweet pup Rus lives with us and while we do our absolute best to get all his tiny dog hairs out of the house, it won't be perfect. If you are super sensitive to dogs then this might not be the booking for you.
transit: You'll want a car in Asheville, as the public transportation isn't great and biking is strenuous. There's a lot to do in West Asheville that you will be fine walking, but anything outside of that will require a car. Uber and Lift are available in Asheville as well.
host_about: We live in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, NC. Ali is an art therapist and loves being a witness and partner in the healing process. Dave is an entrepreneur and started his own company related to software testing. (Dave can pretty much do anything related to computers). We are pretty active and like to seek out hiking/biking/walking paths. And, we love to eat. Eating and drinking like locals is our most favorite fun way to get to know a new area. Our overseas adventures include Singapore, Malaysia, India, Costa Rica, and Argentina. We've had many memorable stays using airbnb and love the community feel of this way of travel.

name: Eclectic artists' home in West AVL
summary: This small, bright and colorful artists' home is close enough to walk and enjoy the hustle and bustle of West Asheville, but far enough to have a quiet and cozy stay. Enjoy our loads of books, records, and textiles! 7 minute drive from downtown.
space: Our home is our sanctuary. It is situated high on the street so has a serene and secluded feel in the middle of a neighborhood. Everything in our home we have either made or collected from our extensive travels or from fellow artists. It is bright, clean, eclectic, and filled with love. Gentle guests only - no parties or unauthorized guests allowed.

Everything in our home we have either made or collected from our extensive travels or from fellow artists. It is bright, clean, eclectic, and filled with love. Gentle guests only - no parties or unauthorized guests allowed. Our guests will have access to the entire house - 2 bedrooms, kitchen, bathroom, living area, front and back porch, and backyard. We will likely greet you when you arrive. We love visitors and are happy to tell you all of our bad jokes. We are both self employed artists and work long hours, but available if you need anything. It is a lovely street in the middle of Malvern Hills/Horney Heights in lov
neighborhood_overview: It is a lovely street in the middle of Malvern Hills/Horney Heights in lovely West Asheville. We are just two blocks from a beautiful park that has tennis courts, and a $3 pool that is open from Memorial Day-Labor Day! It is a less than 1 mile walk to the heart of West Asheville, and a 7 minute drive to downtown Asheville.
notes: Two parking spaces are available behind the house for guests, or you can park on the street in front of the house. We will send further instructions upon booking. We do not have a television, but offer wifi, so bring your tablet or laptop if you'd like to watch movies. The house is quite small (675 sq ft) but it is a great amount of space for 4 people. The dining table is in the kitchen.
transit: We are located less than a mile from Haywood Road in West Asheville, which has too many restaurants, bars, and shops to count. Uber and taxi service is available in this area. We are a 7 minute drive from the heart of downtown Asheville.

name: Mid Century Mod w/ private entrance
summary: The outside of the house leaves something to be desired. 2 dogs that sometimes bark. Neighbors that sometimes play loud music on weekends. No AC... but hey, the room is cute, bed is comfy, and it's cheap!  All proceeds of Airbnb will go to making our house more adorable!
space: We bought this little fixer upper back in April of 2015. By we, I mean me, my future husband Jason, and our two dogs Harley and Wheat Thin.  We fixed up the rental room first, and all of the Airbnb proceeds go to making our house a more beautiful and comfortable place to live. When you're here, you may see us working on the porch (but we never do anything loud while our guests are home). The room is spacious and comfortable for two people. There is no AC in the summer, but because the house is so shaded by trees, it stays nice and cool with the windows open. In the winter, the room does stay a few degrees cooler than the rest of the house, but we have an extra space heater, blankets, and we are ALWAYS willing to crank the heat if you're cold.

notes: If you have any special needs (laundry, want to use the fire pit, etc) just ask, we can probably accommodate you. We also have a twin sized air mattress for a third guest, if you need it.
transit: The house is 4 miles to Downtown Asheville (8-10 minutes) and 2 miles from Haywood Roan in West Asheville (5 minutes).
host_about:
We (my future husband, Jason, and our two dogs Harley and Wheat Thin) bought our house in April 2015 and are working hard on getting it to be a beautiful and cozy place to live. That's why we do Airbnb! So we can afford to make more improvements!  

We're a pretty chill household. We like to cook and watch movies. We also love rugby! After playing for 10 years, I have retired, but Jason still plays for Asheville. 

My favorite movie: Frida
Jason's favorite movie: Jaws 
Wheat Thin's favorite movie: The Muppets (because he is one)

name: Private floor, stroll to W. AVL
summary: We are happy to offer a full private floor in our green-built home, just a 5 minute walk to the best of W. Avl dining and nightlife.  Queen bed, full bathroom, living room with queen sleeper sofa, creek views from the breakfast nook, full size deck, mini fridge.
space: You'll be enjoying an entire private floor of our green-built home.  The pictures say it all; hardwood floors, comfy bed, spacious deck with views, breakfast nook with mini-fridge.   *Please note that your space is accessed by a flight of stairs.  The 3rd/4th guests can sleep on the memory foam sleeper sofa in the living room area of you private floor.
description: We are happy to offer a full private floor in our green-built home, just a 5 minute walk to the best of W. Avl dining and nightlife.  Queen bed, full bathroom, living room with queen sleeper sofa, creek views from the breakfast nook, full size deck, mini fridge. You'll be enjoying an entire private floor of our green-built home.  The pictures say it all; hardwood floors, comfy bed, spacious deck with views, breakfast nook with mini-fridge.   *Please note that your space is accessed by a flight of stairs.  The 3rd/4th guests can sleep on the memory foam sleeper sofa in the living room area of you private floor. Please feel free to park one car in front of the house (more parking 100 yards away).  You have exclusive access to all amenities listed.  Specifics will come once your reservation is confirmed. We'd like to say hello once you arrive, then go hands off (as always, we want to know immediately if there's anything wrong with your room so we can ensure you have an awesome visit).  If
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is where the locals hang out.  We have a number of great restaurants (Nine Mile, The Admiral, Biscuit Head, Zia, Sunny Point) nearby and several great bars (Buffalo Nickel, Westville Pub, Pour Taproom, Universal Joint, Brew Pump).  We typically walk to our favorite spots from home.  Please be respectful of neighbors and mindful of outside noise.
notes: It is of paramount importance to us that you are comfortable.  Should there arise any urgent issue, please contact us directly by phone so we can ensure you have a great visit.
transit: Breakfast, lunch, dinner and drinks are all a half mile away!  The River Arts District is 2.5 miles away, and downtown AVL is 4 miles.  Asheville is very bikeable and walkable.  Parking downtown can be challenging so we recommend going to one of the easily accessed parking garages off of Biltmore Ave.
host_about:
Hello friends! 

I began traveling abroad at 18 and have traveled much of Latin America and the USA.  I'm fluent in Spanish and I'm studying Brazilian Portuguese and French.  Throughout my travels I've learned the importance and value of being a welcoming and obliging host, and the merits of being a humble and grateful guest.  It is my aim while hosting to provide my guests with a superb experience.  Whether you're looking for a brewery tour, exquisite culinary outing, or a peaceful waterfall hike, I'm happy to point you in the right direction!

neighborhood_overview: Quiet (90% of the time) but always friendly neighborhood.
notes: I strongly prefer that guests have a completed profile, where they have shared a bit about themselves.  I have taken time to do the same, and I'm uneasy having a complete stranger in my home that hasn't even put up a picture and told me a little about themselves.  Thanks.
transit: There is a bus stop on Brevard Road within a quarter mile.
host_about: I love to travel and have so far, enjoyed hosting.  My interests include the outdoors, anything physical, reading, cooking, trying different beers and gardening (often times the last two combined).  I'm in and out of my house a lot.  I'm easy to get along with and will do what I can to make sure my guests have a great experience in Asheville.

name: Lovely/Safe neighborhood
summary: I have an  bedroom that is available for 1 or 2 people traveling.  Great neighborhood , grocery store within minutes, outlets mall  20 minutes, Hospitals close by, VA Hospital is 18 minutes. Use of bathroom & kitchen and living space.
space: My space is nice for 1 person and your pet if you choose to bring them.  They must be friendly and love other dogs.  I treat you as one of the family and not an outsider.  My home is your home while you are staying with me.
description: I have an  bedroom that is available for 1 or 2 people traveling.  Great neighborhood , grocery store within minutes, outlets mall  20 minutes, Hospitals close by, VA Hospital is 18 minutes. Use of bathroom & kitchen and living space. My space is nice for 1 person and your pet if you choose to bring them.  They must be friendly and love other dogs.  I treat you as one of the family and not an outsider.  My home is your home while you are staying with me. 1 bedroom space with 1/2 closet, 4 drawers in the dresser and the night stand is all yours to use. In the room is a lamp, queen size bed, dresser, night stand, fan, and a hamper.  Access to the bathroom, kitchen and living room. (when my daughter is present we need to refrain from rated R movies). I am home every evening by 4:30 to help with any questions that you might have, if not you can contact me via cell phone. wonderful place to walk, walk your dog.  1 time around is a mile.  you will enjoy the bunnies, birds, and squirrels. we
neighborhood_overview: wonderful place to walk, walk your dog.  1 time around is a mile.  you will enjoy the bunnies, birds, and squirrels. we also have deer but mostly in the fall.
notes: No smoking in my home.  But you can smoke outside
transit: The grocery store is only about 1 mile away and you also have Sonic, & Walgreens just up the street.  The Asheville Mall is about 15 minutes away, Asheville Outlets is also about 15 minutes in the other direction, Biltmore House is off of I240 about 15 minutes from my home.
host_about: Divorced mother of 2. After 17 yrs of marriage I am on my own again.  I have a wonderful job at the Hospital, but still need to make ends meet.  therefore I have come to Airbnb to offer a space for people traveling and need a safe environment to sleep as well as I do.  I enjoy my kids, shopping, walking my dog Cody, cooking and just hanging out with friends.

name: 1925 Bungalow in the Heart of West
summary: A charming bungalow built in 1925 in the heart of West Asheville. Two blocks from Haywood Road, 3 miles from downtown. Private bath, wifi, and storage for your bicycles.
space: Bedroom with a queen size bed. Private bath next door with an antique claw foot tub and hand held shower attachment.
description: A charming bungalow built in 1925 in the heart of West Asheville. Two blocks from Haywood Road, 3 miles from downtown. Private bath, wifi, and storage for your bicycles. Bedroom with a queen size bed. Private bath next door with an antique claw foot tub and hand held shower attachment. Guests are welcome to enjoy the front porch with its swing and eating area.  A wonderful place to enjoy takeout from one of the many fabulous eating establishments in the Asheville area. I am more than happy to give directions or recommendations. And can always suggest wonderful bike rides, both road and mountain.  I can also recommend restaurants, hikes, rivers and art studios to explore. I am located in the heart of West Asheville on a quiet maple lined street.  Just two blocks from Isis Theater and Restaurant, The UJ, West End Bakery and Nine Mile.  Also very close to Sunny Point, The Admiral, and Biscuit Head.  Located 2 miles from the River Arts District and 4 miles from the center of Downtown Ashev
neighborhood_overview: I am located in the heart of West Asheville on a quiet maple lined street.  Just two blocks from Isis Theater and Restaurant, The UJ, West End Bakery and Nine Mile.  Also very close to Sunny Point, The Admiral, and Biscuit Head.  Located 2 miles from the River Arts District and 4 miles from the center of Downtown Asheville.
notes: I have a golden retriever named Lucky.
transit: Asheville does have a few taxi services, the public bus is available but limited.
host_about:
I love to travel all over the world and meet people from all walks of life.  I am a Bicycle Tour Guide where I guide road bike tours all over the USA and some abroad. I also own a small handcrafted soap company.

If you are coming to hike or ride bikes I have safe storage for your bikes and I am happy to tell you about wonderful routes both road and mountain. I have lived in Asheville since 1999. Previously I lived in Delaware, Lancaster PA and Alaska.

space: Private room and bathroom available for rent in beautiful 1928 arts and craft bungalow in hip West Asheville. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, and shops. Short drive to downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and Biltmore Estate.

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a wonderful, eclectic neighborhood and our house is within walking distance to many pubs, restaurants, shops, and playgrounds. We are happy to suggest places to go!
notes: Since it is a basement, ceilings are somewhat low and noises from us walking upstairs will be heard. Can be chilly in basement so a space heater is provided. Also, we may use the laundry and TV area in basement occasionally but for the most part, we will stay out of your way!

host_about: I love to read, travel, and spend time with family. I also enjoy sharing how amazing Asheville is with other travelers!

name: West A'ville sanctuary in the trees
summary: Beautiful, inspiring and peaceful. 5 minutes to town and a world away.
space: A peaceful retreat awaits you in the trees just outside of West Asheville's "locals" downtown! Walkable to Haywood Rd and all our excellent neighborhood restaurants, art and yoga studios, farmers market and pubs. Or you can borrow a bike from us and zip into town. This is a quiet place to write and rest or just commune with the big oaks around your private deck. The studio is small (12x15) but well equipped with a small kitchenette (sans oven), small table and 2 chairs and a nice queen size bed. You have your own bathroom with shower and a laundry room is also available. It is a very private studio apartment below the main house which has its own entrance and outdoor space. Our family lives above and we are very respectful of your privacy.  If you are looking for an unique space that is peaceful and quiet but part of a vibrant creative community you will enjoy staying with us and we will enjoy hosting you!
description: Beautiful, inspiring and peaceful. 5 minutes to town and a world away. A peaceful retreat awaits you in the trees just outside of West Asheville's "locals" downtown! Walkable to Haywood Rd and all our excellent neighborhood restaurants, art and yoga studios, farmers market and pubs. Or you can borrow a bike from us and zip into town. This is a quiet place to write and rest or just commune with the big oaks around your private deck. The studio is small (12x15) but well equipped with a small kitchenette (sans oven), small table and 2 chairs and a nice queen size bed. You have your own bathroom with shower and a laundry room is also available. It is a very private studio apartment below the main house which has its own entrance and outdoor space. Our family lives above and we are very respectful of your privacy.  If you are looking for an unique space that is peaceful and quiet but part of a vibrant creative community you will enjoy staying with us and we will enjoy hosting you! Your litt
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is the best! Quiet and neighborly, it's not like downtown Asheville with hotels and so many tourists but you can get there or the parkway or the Biltmore very quickly by car. Downtown, five minutes, everywhere else, ten minutes. We have our own downtown in West Asheville and there's many excellent restaurants and music venues within walking or biking distance.
notes: We do not charge a cleaning fee in order to keep your cost down and our selves sane. Just do your best to leave it in the same condition you found it. All supplies and a "honey do" list are provided in the studio. If you would rather pay a cleaning company $50, that's fine too. Just let us know and we will make arrangements for you.
transit: We recommend cars or bikes for getting around. There's two River parks nearby for walking or running. The Hominy Creek trail and Hominy creek River park.
host_about: Jakub and I have been together since 1999. We are both architects and we are both from Eastern Europe. We have two children, a boy and a girl. As a family we like hiking, mounting biking, travelling, creating art, reading and spending time with friends. We are planning a year of travel around the world November 2013- November 2014 and we are renting our house while away. We are very excited to share our home with others. We feel it is a special place and we hope you will enjoy it. What we most love about our home is its openness, the view of the trees, the quiet and the light.

description: Bright sunny studio apartment in great neighborhood, eat-in kitchen. All linens and towels are provided. Guests have the entire apartment to themselves, there's a small porch and back yard that guests can use. We are available via text, phone or on site if needed. Our West Asheville neighborhood is a family friendly beautiful walking neighborhood. There is a city pool only blocks from the apartment.  West Asheville is centrally located with several of Asheville's most popular and well reviewed restaurants, shops, and galleries. Everything you need is right here in West Asheville including coffee shops, grocery and health food stores, pharm
neighborhood_overview: Our West Asheville neighborhood is a family friendly beautiful walking neighborhood. There is a city pool only blocks from the apartment.  West Asheville is centrally located with several of Asheville's most popular and well reviewed restaurants, shops, and galleries. Everything you need is right here in West Asheville including coffee shops, grocery and health food stores, pharmacy, library, amazing movie rental store, banks, bars/pubs, music venues, hiking trails, and the French Broad River.  Downtown Asheville is just minutes away as is the Blue Ridge Parkway, The Biltmore Estate, and the River Arts District.
notes: Both hosts are bakers and depending on the day of the week you are staying- you may receive fresh bread and/or baked goods!
transit: Public buses are available in the neighborhood, but limited. Walking or biking to Haywood Road in downtown West Asheville is approximately 2 miles. Taxis are always available. A taxi ride home from most anywhere in town is about $10.  Asheville now has Uber taxi service too.

summary: Beautiful 1900 sq. ft. home in the highly sought after West Asheville Area.  Just bring your clothes and a toothbrush. This home provides you everything you will need to relax and enjoy this amazingly perfect location. You will feel right at home.
space: A perfect Asheville location, this is a gorgeous 1900 sq. ft. town home with high end premium comforts and amazing mountain views. You will not find a better location.  We are super close to  Downtown Asheville, The Biltmore Estate, Winery and the Asheville Outlets. The home is less than 5 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, Arboretum, and Carrier Park where you can fish, use the walking/running track, Kayak, or canoe.  Our home is well taken care of with all high-end comfortable furnishings, a nice yard with a Koi Pond to enjoy, a great deck with a lovely outdoor furniture .  It is 2 stories and 3 bedrooms.  The master bedroom has a king bed with an amazing cooling gel memory foam mattress.  The 2nd bedroom has a very nice queen pillow top mattress.  The 3rd bedroom has a great full size memory foam mattress.  The master bedroom,  both upstairs bathrooms, and living room all have recessed lighting.  The master bedroom has a huge jetted tub.  There is a laundry room between the three
description: Beautiful 1900 sq. ft. home in the highly sought after West Asheville Area.  Just bring your clothes and a toothbrush. This home provides you everything you will need to relax and enjoy this amazingly perfect location. You will feel right at home. A perfect Asheville location, this is a gorgeous 1900 sq. ft. town home with high end premium comforts and amazing mountain views. You will not find a better location.  We are super close to  Downtown Asheville, The Biltmore Estate, Winery and the Asheville Outlets. neighborhood_overview: We live in a very small, private community.  Everyone here is quiet and polite.  We live in one of the best centralized places in Asheville.  You can get anywhere in Asheville in just a few minutes.  We are located just off both main interstates.
notes: Take a few minutes to check out all the great restaurants, bars,  and entertainment for your entire family, listed in our guidebook, all within 10 minutes of our home.
transit: Asheville has a public bus system that is extremely cheap (around 1.00 a trip) and goes all over the city.  We have a bus stop just at the end of our street. Asheville also has great UBER drivers.   There is parking beside our home for 1 automobile and room for 1 automobile in front of the house.
host_about: We are both very laid back and truly love living in Asheville.  We hope to make your trip as comfortable as we can.  Tracy is a postal supervisor and Brent works as a nurse at our local VA.  We are looking forward to sharing our home with you.

name: New Garage Apartment! Sleeps 3
space: The space is completely private and sleeps 3 comfortably.  1 bedroom with queen bed, 1 bathroom, full kitchen, deck with rocking chairs, pull out sofa and wifi. This comfortable space is tucked in the trees in our backyard, allowing you to feel completely secluded from us and our neighbors.  At the same time, we're just steps away if you have any questions about the space or the Asheville area.   We are about a mile from Haywood Road in West Asheville.  Music venues, bakeries, coffee shops, bars, great restaurants, boutique shops, record store, vintage garb, grocery and so much more.  Downtown is a direct shot down Patton Ave.  10 minutes with a little traffic. The nearest bus stop is less than a 5 minute walk away and although there are a lot of hills in Asheville, cyclists may find it's the best way to get around. Hope we see you soon!

We love Airbnb and all the unique spaces we have found to stay using this site, including a barn in West Virginia and a treehouse in Santa Cruz!  Hope we see you soon!

name: Quiet Luxurious Studio-Guest House
summary: Our quiet, studio guest bungalow is conveniently located walking distance from downtown West Asheville, and features a luxurious bathroom, spacious stocked kitchen, comfortable double bed, work space with wireless internet, and off-street parking.
space: Our guest house is quiet and private, with one of the most fabulous bathing facilities in Asheville -- the roomy double headed shower and large garden tub with mirror surround make staying here truly luxurious. Comfy queen size bed can be supplemented with a twin size trundle on request (please inquire for rates).
description: Our quiet, studio guest bungalow is conveniently located walking distance from downtown West Asheville, and features a luxurious bathroom, spacious stocked kitchen, comfortable double bed, work space with wireless internet, and off-street parking. Our guest house is quiet and private, with one of the most fabulous bathing facilities in Asheville -- the roomy double headed shower and large garden tub with mirror surround make staying here truly luxurious. Comfy queen size bed can be supplemented with a twin size trundle on request (please inquire for rates). Private, off-street parking.  Access to the shady, tree-filled yard.  Additional supplies available if needed - just ask!  We live in the main house just in front of the guest house, and are available to give directions/recommendations during your stay, loan you specialty items, etc.  The neighborhood is conveniently located near the intersection of Haywood Rd. and Patton Ave. -- but despite being near a major intersection it's supe
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is conveniently located near the intersection of Haywood Rd. and Patton Ave. -- but despite being near a major intersection it's super chill, quiet, and beautiful.  The neighbors are friendly and it's great for taking walks -- it's even near a great park with public swimming pool and tennis courts.
notes: The guest house has one queen bed -- but we also have a twin-sized trundle (please inquire for price) if you need extra sleeping accommodations.  There is a full multimedia art studio on the property, so if you are an artist and need any supplies (glue, sewing supplies, etc.) we may have what you need.
transit: Downtown West Asheville is only a 5-10 minute walk away, featuring market, coffee shops, video store, bars, restaurants, clubs, etc. AND, if you want to go to downtown Asheville and don't want to drive, it's right on the bus line (maps and schedules provided). It's also a 15-20 minute bike ride or 40-60 minute walk to downtown Asheville.
host_about:
I'm a Sundance filmmaker who appreciates health and wellness. Yoga, dance, mediation, film etc.. I'm positive minded and energy conscious. I love my friends and family. I am easy to get along with and I appreciate good communication and follow-thru! :)  
My partner Iz is a multimedia artist, specializing in writing and circus arts. She has been renovating the guest house for the past 10 years and is happy to share it with you on your visit!

name: Delightful 3BD bungalow +great yard
summary: Pleasant & comfortable 3 bedroom/2 bath bungalow with a nice yard and a large deck for your enjoyment. Easy 5 minute access by car to downtown eateries and activities and also walking distance to trendy Haywood Ave area. Hardwood and tile floors.
space: Welcome to our West Asheville home. Our home is comfortable and liveable; it's a nice walk over to the West Asheville restaurants, and an easy drive to downtown or the Farmer's market.  We have a fairly well equipped kitchen, a working gas grill out back, and a new washer/dryer. There is an electric kettle, a proper tea pot and a cozy in case you want tea; a coffee maker is also available. We keep cotton sheets on the bed and have a variety of pillows; we believe in comfort when you sleep. One bathroom has a walk in shower; the other one has a soaker, jetted tub. Both are compact, but serve their purpose!  We view the deck as an extra room on the house and take many meals out there in the spring, summer and fall. The back yard is fully fenced, which is helpful with children. My mother is in her 80s, and she wanted me to say that she finds the house easy to navigate. One step up to get in and the rest is all one level.

neighborhood_overview: We live in a residential neighborhood. During prime traffic time in the morning and afternoon our street can be busy but we walk in the area quite comfortably. It is NOT a "hide in the woods" location, but we love the ease of access to the major roads.
transit: We recommend having a car; there is parking for several cars in our driveway.
host_about:
Ron and I love hiking, gardening, good food and good art. We also love music, theatre, dance -- pretty much all visual and performing arts. We travel as much as we can. We both lived in Central America as children, and you'll see little bits of that around the house. 
This house has been our part-time home for years; and has served as "The Sanctuary" (so dubbed by our niece) for the whole family. Our daughter and son-in-law use it for weekends when he goes fly fishing and she visits friends; our son and daughter-in-law find it a nice change of pace from home. 
Our profile photo was taken when we were out sailing with good friends in San Francisco.

name: The Refuge in West Asheville
summary: Start your Asheville adventure here! Modern home in central West Asheville with 2 bedrooms. Walk to restaurants, cafes, yoga, and music. Minutes from the river arts district, downtown; hike, kayak and mountain bike.
space: This free-standing home features modern architecture decorated with creations by local artists.  A beautiful sleek construction accented with lots of glass, a vaulted ceiling in the living space, modern furniture, bamboo, wood, and tile flooring throughout makes this your favorite place to stay when in Asheville.  There are 2 bedrooms: one full bedroom downstairs and one loft with a queen bed.  This guest house easily sleeps up to 4.  Living space includes built-in laptop desk with speakers to plug in your music.  You have a well equipped kitchen with stainless steel appliances and stone countertops. Enjoy quiet time on the private back patio under a huge black walnut and walk to some of Asheville's renowned restaurants, bars and clubs.  FYI, once you get the address, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Maps shows our old garage, which was torn down to build this structure.  You will be staying in a beautiful new building, not an old garage. The Biltmore Estate is about a 10 minute drive.  The

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville Rocks! West Asheville is considered one of the most fabulous neighborhoods in the country, and the happy residents here will readily agree!  People here smile.  They're nice and welcoming.  West Asheville is currently the hottest area of Asheville, with new restaurants, music clubs, a popular yoga studio, coffee houses, tree lined streets, yet still lots of friendly folk about.  Our neighborhood is only a block from popular Haywood Road and all its amenities, yet quiet and peaceful with big old trees that are home to many song birds.  Halloween is OFF THE HOOK in this neighborhood with folks coming from miles away to see the spectacle of "Vermont Ave Halloween" (just a few steps away) and the beauty of the leaves as they turn brilliant fall colors.    FYI, once you get the address, (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Maps shows our old garage, which was torn down to build this structure.  You will be staying in a beautiful new building, not an old garage.
notes: A great choice for your yoga weekend or yoga training/healing experience.  There is space to leave your bike and/or boat hidden from the street so you don't have to drive around town with them on your car.  The  neighborhood is quiet and safe.   We love Asheville and have hiked, biked, and camped all over these mountains and are happy to share information with you to assist your adventures.   All the art, even the glass pendant lights, purchased from local artists.  We take pride in our Asheville artists and love to show them off in The Refuge.
transit: We are just a few minutes drive from I-240 and I-40, and 15 minutes from the Asheville Airport.  The Refuge is 5 minutes to downtown Asheville and 15 minutes to Bent Creek Forest for excellent mountain biking and hiking, and easily accessible from the highway.  Bus stop is just a block away on Haywood Road.  Off street parking in your private driveway is available for 2 cars, stacked one behind the other, in your narrow private driveway.
host_about: Cat and Jeff are healing arts practitioners. We are dedicated to this wonderful community and the preservation of the Appalachian mountains.
street: Vance Crescent Street, Asheville, NC 28806, United States

name: 10 Minutes From Downtown: Zen Den
summary: This is a newly furnished studio apartment with queen Tempurpedic bed and  over-sized bathroom. There is a walk in closet for storage and a mini kitchenette. The space is freshly painted and furnished for relaxing.  Easy drive into town.
space: Sunnyside is a property where there are three units; the studio apartment is in the basement of a larger cottage. The space is completely private, with approximately 600 square feet of living space with just as much deck. It's beautifully furnished and brand new. Located near the entrance to the Blue Ridge Parkway, the French Broad River, the NC Arboretum and Bent Creek, it is ideal for the cycling or water enthusiast. Plenty of space for bicycle or boat storage and parking while you're dining out in downtown Asheville only 10 minutes away. Grill and fire ring available for your use (as well as others). Easily accessible and a friendly atmosphere. This apartment is also available for longer stays; it's a great transitional space for people moving to the area who haven't chosen a home yet. Please contact the host.

name: Charming Bungalow in West Asheville
summary: This light filled 3 bedroom house is tucked into the lovely Malvern Hills section of West Asheville on a quiet street.   It comfortably fits 6 people and is an easy  5 min drive to downtown and many hiking/biking trails.  Enjoy!
space: This pleasant, roomy 3/bedroom 2/bath bungalow will be a welcome refuge in this quaint neighborhood complete with a private, covered front porch to catch the eastern sunlight for your morning coffee. A private back patio equipped with a gas grill, fire pit, and large back yard can be the center of enjoyment on a long weekend away. Hardwood floors warm each room in this 1250 sq. ft. bungalow.  The king-size master bedroom and private bath/ shower is arranged in the back of the home.  Two bedrooms (Queen and Twins) share a bath from a private hallway off the dining room. A central TV/Cable with Wi-Fi is provided. The well-equipped kitchen with dishwasher, microwave and all the essentials for basic cooking needs is centrally located with a roomy dining space serving six comfortably. With new and freshly decorated linens, bed and window treatments you are liable to stay an extra few days! Located conveniently a block from Malvern Hills Community Park and pool. Don't forget to bring your te

It comfortably fits 6 people and is an easy  5 min drive to downtown and many hiking/biking trails.  Enjoy! neighborhood_overview: The home is just a block away from Malvern Hills Community Park and pool (one of the best parks in all of Asheville.)  It provides tennis courts, a swimming pool, walking paths and a jungle gym. Blanketed with shade trees and a small creek, this park is great for picnicking. This Arts and Crafts neighborhood hasn't lost it's appeal with all the newer developments popping up, carrying it's quaint charm throughout. Enjoy live bands and good company and food on Haywood Rd in West Asheville. Touring includes: West Fest, along with touring the Biltmore Estate, exploring the Blue Ridge Parkway, Pisgah Forest, downtown Asheville, and outdoor sports. Downtown is just a mere five minute ride, and south Asheville ten minutes.
transit: We recommend cars or bikes for getting around. There are two river parks nearby for walking and biking. The Hominy Creek trail and Hominy Creek River Park is easily accessible from the house.  Public transit routes are available nearby if you don't want to drive.
host_about: Walter, my husband & I have lived in Asheville for nearly 20 years now and love all that this magical place has to offer.  My husband is a high school building construction teacher and I am a residential designer.  In our free time, we like being outdoors playing or gardening. We have stayed in a few vacation rentals over the years which have inspired us to create our own to share with you.  Enjoy!

name: West Asheville Home
summary: Vacation 1 wk. on a wooded hillside in West Asheville.  2 miles from Haywood St. cafes, music venues & restaurants; 4 miles from the delights of downtown Asheville.  Hike: No camping req'd. Looking for two couples to rent 8/ 7 to 8-14 for about $1350
space: Over 2000 sq. ft. of living space plus a front porch and a screened back deck.  Downstairs features an open concept living/kitchen area. The kitchen is fully equipped with a huge island that seats four. There is also a full bath on the ground floor as well as an office with computer, futon and t.v. on which you may watch Netflix. There are two large bedrooms upstairs; one with queen bed and one with double bed. The ensuite master bath may also be accessed by the second bedroom through a hall door.  There is a washer and dryer on second floor.   There is wifi throughout, though the signal is weak upstairs.  The back deck is set up with table and chairs for 4.  There are ceiling fans in all rooms and both porches; there is also two zoned air-conditioning.   This is a very restful, happy house. neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is quiet, even "sedate."  We are bordered entirely by privately owned land once belonging to the campus of The Asheville School, an international prep school.  In summer they host day camps (soccer, etc.) which you will hardly notice.  Our driveway is actually owned  by the School, and we must be respectful of their rights to limited use.
notes: We have no pets and you may not allow any pets into the house.  Smoking is not allowed, either the house or on the property, which is a little less than half an acre. Actually, we are surrounded by privately owned lots and driveways.  There is room to park two cars, and while you may have guests for a few hours, no "partying" is allowed after 9:00.  Additional guests overnight not allowed.
transit: Uber is available in Asheville.
host_about:
Craig and I moved into our newly constructed West Asheville home in May 2014. Santina is a retired psychotherapist who loves gardening, cooking, and meeting with friends. Craig is an Uber driver as well as a photographer/personal historian.

Our home is a wooded oasis just 2 miles from the center of West Asheville and 4 miles from downtown.  Deer, wild turkeys and rabbits are frequent visitors.

name: Garden Bungalow
summary: Our 2 bedroom one bath house sleeps 4-6 people, with a fold out couch in the living room. Easy walking distance to West Asheville restaurants, shops, bars, and music venues. Gardens in the front and back yard to explore and a full service kitchen.
space: This house is perfect for folks who like to cook and enjoy their dining experience. Large dining table on the front porch with a ceiling fan to keep you cool. There is also indoor dining space right next to the large kitchen. The open floor plan is perfect for socializing.
description: Our 2 bedroom one bath house sleeps 4-6 people, with a fold out couch in the living room. Easy walking distance to West Asheville restaurants, shops, bars, and music venues. Gardens in the front and back yard to explore and a full service kitchen. This house is perfect for folks who like to cook and enjoy their dining experience. Large dining table on the front porch with a ceiling fan to keep you cool. There is also indoor dining space right next to the large kitchen. The open floor plan is perfect for socializing. Tubing canoeing and kayaking on the French Broad River is minutes away with river access at Carrier Park. Guests can walk two tree lined blocks to bakeries, cafes, shops and entertainment. We are a five minute drive or a 15 minute bike ride from the river arts district (with breweries and artist studios). We are a 7 minute drive from bustling downtown Asheville. Guests who like to explore on foot will enjoy the park at the end of our street as well as the interesting variet
neighborhood_overview: Guests who like to explore on foot will enjoy the park at the end of our street as well as the interesting variety of architectural styles in the neighborhood. The is no reason to get in a car most days as we are conveniently located close to grocery stores, restaurants, and entertainment.
notes: We do have a dog who will NOT be at the house when guests are renting it. We clean thoroughly but if guests are highly allergic to dogs this could be a problem.
transit: We have off street parking available in our driveway.
host_about: My wife, Cathy, and I are outdoor enthusiasts who are passionate about food and food justice.  We live in beautiful Asheville, NC.  We've both traveled extensively, having spent a lot of time in youth hostels, and are more found of European style B&B experiences than the posh US interpretation of B&Bs.  We don't require a lot of fuss; just looking for a comfortable bed and pointed to coffee/tea in the morning.

neighborhood_overview: Haywood Road in west Asheville is home to many delicious restaurants and fun night spots just 4 blocks away.  My favorite restaurants in west asheville are Nine Mile, The Admiral, and WALK.  Asheville itself is a foodie town.  My favorite eateries downtown are Addissae (ethiopian), Katmandu Cafe (nepalese), Salsa (mexican-caribean), and Jerusalem Garden (middle eastern).
notes: Massage available on site! I am a licensed massage therapist and am highly educated, skilled, and experienced.  Ask for more information and my web address when you book to find out more.
transit: This house is super convenient!  You can walk to the local bars and restaurants in west asheville or be on any of the main highways in about 2 minutes.  The bus line is just a 4 block walk.

summary: Funky and hip West Asheville- walk to Haywood Road or Carrier park on the French Broad river. A mile to the River Arts District, South Slope breweries, and Biltmore Village. 7 mins to Downtown, $8 cab/uber ride. Please park in State Street driveway.
space: 2 bedroom, 1 bath, with an open floor plan between the living room and kitchen. Totally private and separate from the downstairs apartment.

Please park in State Street driveway. 2 bedroom, 1 bath, with an open floor plan between the living room and kitchen. Totally private and separate from the downstairs apartment. Guests have access to the entire top floor. Private entrance. Not connected to the bottom floor. No shared space between the top floor and the bottom floor. 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom, a living room and kitchen with an open floor plan. Both the front and the back door open to a deck. With a large green yard to enjoy the sun and nice weather. I will be available to help you out with whatever you need. I live downstairs. I work in my studio 5 days a week, which is right up the road on the corner of Haywood Road and i240/26. And I bartend at the bottom of State Street 2 nights a week (2 minute walk). So, I am
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is super cool. People like to use words like Funky and Hip to describe it. There are a couple cornerstone's of business along Haywood Road. From fine dining (american fusion) at the Admiral, to strong cups of coffee at BattleCat. Harvest Records has a large selection of new and used vinyl, tapes, cds, zines, and whatnot. SunnyPoint has amazing breakfast. And there is artwork everywhere. Murals adorn the walls of our city. So take a stroll, and see what West Asheville has to offer.
notes: Please count your pets as a guest if you plan on bringing them into the house and having them stay the night.
transit: Uber is incredibly cheap and fast here.
host_about: Hi there! My name is Dustin and I am a local artist and bartender in Asheville, NC. I run a studio on Haywood Road in West Asheville called 474 Gallery Studio (but sometimes its still referred to as "Spagnola," which is my last name.) I am currently bartending two nights a week at The Cascade Lounge which is nestled inside of the Asheville Food Park. I like to paint pictures on canvas and on walls. I love traveling and often go out of town to paint murals, sometimes alone, sometimes with friends. Places I have painted in the past include Miami, New York City, Atlanta, Memphis, Nashville, Charleston, and Kathmandu. All of this traveling has led me to stay at air bnb homes accidentally, and I love the service. I love travelling and I love exploring new places and not feeling like a tourist. I love to feel myself becoming integrated into every new place I go.  Feel free to check out my work on my website: dubyou dubyou dubyou dot dustin spagnola dot c 0 m.  I have a dog that I love very much, his name is Louie and he's a small doberman mutt.

Lots of open space, good heat, it has a warm, light, feel of well built charm. Oh and a lovely back deck. my kitchen is set up with things to cook - including spices, oil, pots and pans, condiments and tea is there too.

notes: disclaimers: I'm right off a main drag (Patton Ave.) with a four lane road so this lacks a neighborhood to walk around in and there is some noise from the traffic.  I have neighbors - my apartment is in a building with three other apartments - everyone is nice.
transit: I'm super close to lots of things - centrally located near Paton Ave and Louisiana Ave in West Asheville. There's a bus stop right next to my place, a bank, Golds Gym, Kmart, and other stuff... the big west asheville center is only a mile up the road.
host_about: I am a traveling yoga teacher, and artist.  I like to live close to the earth and healthy.

neighborhood_overview: Very walkable, and many friendly people in West Asheville!  Markets, coffee shops, music venues and restaurants all in walking distance.  Bus service to the heart of downtown Asheville. Top 5 Sunset Spots in Asheville, N.C. The Best Places to Catch a Scenic Sunset It's no question that some of the world's oldest mountains offer some of the best vantage points to watch the sun drop below the peaks in a splash of color. In an online poll, fans of Asheville, N.C. nominated their favorite places to watch the sun set over the Blue Ridge Mountains. Here are their responses, in descending order of popularity: Max Patch in Fall 5. MAX PATCH This grassy bald is definitely a favorite, with true 360-degree views of the Smoky Mountains and an intersection with the Appalachian Trail. For a sunset to remember, get there early and bring a picnic and a blanket—and your camera to capture the colors of the sunset reflected on layers of majestic mountains. Here are directions to Max Patch. 4. BLUE RIDGE
transit: Public bus and private taxi services.  If you have your car, you can be in downtown Asheville in 5-10 minutes.
host_about: I enjoy people, hiking, writing, genealogy, painting, fixing things (like plumbing if it isn't too complicated), puttering in the yard, dogs, cats, and maybe some day.... chickens.  (We are allowed to have chickens in the city limits but no roosters.)  Our children are grown.  I am on a part-time schedule with consulting, and love hosting with airbnb.  With each new guest I am amazed anew at how many incredibly good, gracious people there are in the world.

notes: Be advised that Airbnb charges a service fee to all renters ranging from 6% to 12%, that service fee is not under the control of the host. host_about:
I love living in Asheville, NC. I'm walkable / bike-able to everything I could possibly need. Asheville is a foodie town with amazing restaurants and some of the best breweries in the country. There's a great music and art scene, there is always plenty to choose from. 

I enjoy traveling too, some of my favorites include San Francisco, New York, Savannah, Colorado, New Mexico, and Toronto. I recently returned from 2 weeks in Brazil. 

I study endangered birds, play roller derby, and teach salsa and yoga.

We enjoy the short stroll (there are a couple of small hills) to Haywood for Sunday night jazz or other concerts at Isis, cafes, ice cream, pubs and Dobra tea house. Close to Hominy Creek Greenway running trails.
notes: There is an unseen highway in the distance that for me, flows into white noise. That could be different for some folks. Also to note, sometimes I can accommodate last minute booking such as one day prior and often I can arrange for an earlier check in, just contact me. Thank you.
transit: Parking on site. Walk to many fun places, bike or take public transit. Many people take the ART buses in Asheville or call  Uber for a night in downtown.
