Four long term co-residents also reside there. Kindly be noise respectful...quiet hours between 9 p.m. and 9 a.m. The older walking neighborhood with sidewalks is tree-lined and in t
neighborhood_overview: The older walking neighborhood with sidewalks is tree-lined and in the heart of funky art and food-crazed West Asheville, known for it's eclectic offerings. Walk to the library, buy fresh produce from the weekly farmers' market, buy coffee beans from the local roaster, and enjoy craft beers at several local brew pubs. Fresh baked goods are available at your choice of bakeries-check out the new one that specializes in homemade doughnuts.
notes: Wi-fi "netgear10"2g" or 5g is: mightyink611 Wi-fi "mycharterwi41-2g" or 5g: unevenflower966
transit: Take an UBER ride* from the airport or rent a car. It's about 15 minutes to/from airport. Getting into downtown from here is easy and there's several routes. You can rent a bike, take the local bus (stop is one block away) or drive 5 minutes. For the walkers, it's about 30 minutes by foot, across the bridge, passing through the River Arts District.  *First time UBER users, feel free to ask about a 20% discount code!
host_about:
I have travel in my blood. I was born in Chateauroux, France. My sister was born in Germany and I learned to speak German when my family lived there for four years. Some of my favorites places include, Lagos de Atitlan, Uxmal, Merida, San Cristobal, Antigua, Ambergris Caye, Chichicastengo, Amsterdam, Vancouver, Cologne, Berlin and Prague. I prefer to travel off the "gringo trail" and have many more places to visit. Open to house trade.

I am a passionate student of compassionate communication (NVC). Two important things I've learned is that other people's behavior rarely has anything to do with me and that with patience and compassion, most all our needs can be met. 

For fun around here I have ridden a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a mountain top zip line tour nearby, seen our ancient mountains during a flying lesson, rented a scooter and rode the blue ridge parkway, took a few archery lessons so I could pretend to be like Katniss from The Hunger Games, which was filmed nearby. I also enjoy sitting in the backyard watching my chickens do goofy things. What do you like to do for fun? Let me share more fun things to do in our beautiful mountains.

name: Family-friendly West Asheville Home
summary: In the quiet Malvern Hills neighborhood of West Asheville our home is kid-friendly and private with room to spread out and a large backyard to enjoy. It is a 3-5 minute drive to the shops and restaurants of Haywood Rd and quick access to Patton Ave.
space: Our house has three bedrooms with a king size bed, a full size bed and a baby's crib.  It also has a queen size futon in the living room that is very comfortable for sleeping. It has a high chair if needed as well as many toys for little ones.  There is a large room in the front of the house that is the studio used for painting and yoga.  While you are welcome to use this for a yoga/meditation practice, it will most likely serve as more room to spread out.  Finally, one bathroom is by the bedrooms while the 2nd bath is off of the living room.

name: Convenient Location and Beer Themed
summary: Cute bungalow in 1 of best locations in Asheville right off main thoroughfare Patton Avenue yet quiet thanks to wooded lot & few neighbors. Walk to artsy West AVL; 3 miles to downtown; 6 to Biltmore. Beer lovers: hops to dunk in your beer in fridge!
space: Built in 1925, this home has been converted into a duplex-style layout. Your apartment has a private covered porch with porch swing, lots of windows, 1 bedroom with a queen bed, a bathroom with tub and shower, and a living room with a pull-out couch for additional guests. A small kitchenette area has the essentials including hops to dunk in your beer (it's delicious!) waiting in the small fridge plus a coffee maker, electric skillet, crockpot, dishes, toaster, utensils, cutting board, and pub table so you can cook up easy meals during your stay (WNC Farmers Market is 2 miles away and open 7 days a week from 8am-5pm). You're also welcome to use our Weber grill. The living room area has a 50-inch television with DirecTV (and NFL Sunday ticket) and a DVD player. Local coffee, coffee sweeteners, hot chocolate and teas will be provided as well. Wi-Fi included.  Three breweries are located in West Asheville (Altamont, Oyster Brewing Co. and Urban Orchard Cider) and 5 music venues (Altamont,
description: Cute bungalow in 1 of best locations in Asheville right off main thoroughfare Patton Avenue yet quiet thanks to wooded lot & few neighbors. Walk to artsy West AVL; 3 miles to downtown; 6 to Biltmore. Beer lovers: hops to dunk in your beer in fridge! Built in 1925, this home has been converted into a duplex-style layout. Your apartment has a private covered porch with porch swing, lots of windows, 1 bedroom with a queen bed, a bathroom with tub and shower, and a living room with a pull-out couch for additional guests. A small kitchenette area has the essentials including hops to dunk in your beer (it's delicious!) waiting in the small fridge plus a coffee maker, electric skillet, crockpot, dishes, toaster, utensils, cutting board, and pub table so you can cook up easy meals during your stay (WNC Farmers Market is 2 miles away and open 7 days a week from 8am-5pm). You're also welcome to use our Weber grill. The living room area has a 50-inch television with DirecTV (and NFL Sunday ticket
neighborhood_overview: Location location location! People always say this but this home can deliver as it's one block away from the main road into downtown (Patton Avenue) which will get you there in less than five minutes. But creative, eclectic West Asheville is within walking distance and has great restaurants, galleries, shops, and more that you won't want to miss and is where locals like to hang out. And getting to interstates 240, 26, and 40 is very easy since Patton Avenue connects to everything. The neighborhood is safe, quiet and beautiful with sidewalks everywhere and people constantly out and about jogging and walking their dogs. There's a convenience store, pizza place, bowling alley, and Rocky's Hot Chicken within two blocks. Lastly, you can walk down the hill to Malvern Hills Park which has fun recreational options including a public pool, trails, doggie trash bags and receptacles, and a playground.
notes: First pet free. $25 fee per stay, per pet for guests with more than one pet. The apartment is about 600 square feet. There is no sink in the kitchenette area, only in the bathroom. An extension cord is located on the nightstand and a power strip behind the microwave to charge your devices.
transit: Public bus route stops are within walking distance. Cabs to and from downtown, West Asheville, etc. are around $10 or you can use car sharing services like (URL HIDDEN) or Uber. Closest airport is Asheville Regional, and closest international airports are Greenville-Spartanburg 52 miles away or Charlotte/Douglas International is 94 miles away.
host_about:
I'm a travel blogger, social media marketer, and (EMAIL HIDDEN) who loves living in Asheville but always planning my next vacation too. I spend my free time trying craft beers, reading, skiing, and seeing live music. My husband and I are saving up for a month-long road trip through Ireland for next year to celebrate our 11-year wedding anniversary (will definitely be using airbnb during that trip!). 

Favorite movie: Good Will Hunting
Favorite book: So many--English major--but highly recommend The Book Thief and The Paris Wife
Favorite TV shows: Daily Show, Brooklyn Nine-Nine, Parenthood
Favorite quote: "My life is like a stroll upon the beach, As near the ocean's edge as I can go." Thoreau

name: Spacious Room in West Asheville
summary: This clean and spacious bedroom homestay in a sweet older West Asheville cottage, is a convenient 2 minute drive to downtown Asheville or Haywood Road, W Asheville; close to breweries, music venues & amazing restaurants.  Shared screened back deck.
space: A great homestay in a cozy and well kept older home (110 years old!), the bedroom is furnished with a bed, desk, nightstand and glider rocker.  Small closet available for guest use.  The kitchen, living room and bath are shared, with linens and towels provided and high speed wireless internet.  Space is available in the refrigerator as well.   You must be a pet lover, there are cats and a friendly dog in the home! Many of the dates posted are when I am out of town, so you will likely have the entire space to yourself, other than the cats who are often closed in their own room... You must love pets for this place to work for you, please email for details.  The best thing about this home is the location. You can see the downtown Asheville skyline from the side deck, but the back yard feels secluded and woodsy with tons of birds, cicadas at night and lightning bugs in the summer. In the winter, less green, but a nice view of downtown (especially at nighttime)!  You can walk under the high

neighborhood_overview: This sweet, newly remodeled home is in a desirable location, a 2 minute drive to downtown Asheville or West Asheville, and a 10 to 15 minute walk to Haywood Road, closest  walkable places (10 to 20 minute walking distance) include 'The Walk', ART bus stop, the Admiral, soon to be built New Belgium Brewery, The Wedge Brewery and River Arts District, The Grey Eagle music venue, White Duck Taco, SunnyPoint Cafe, Zia Taqueria, Battlecat Coffeeshop, and just a bit further to West Asheville businesses including the U-Joint, Westville Pub, and the Isis Theatre, just to name a few.  Also a quick 4 minute drive via Riverside Drive to the Botanical Gardens and UNCA campus.   I recommend planning walks in the daytime, as some neighborhoods do not have sidewalks and are dark at night.  You can walk through neighborhoods to Haywood and points in West Asheville, or past industrial area/construction site of soon to be built New Belgium Brewery to get to River Arts District.  It takes me 12 minutes wa
notes: There is no television in the space, just high speed wireless for your laptop or Ipad. PLEASE NOTE THAT THE HIGH SPEED WIRELESS ROUTER IS TURNED OFF DURING SLEEPING HOURS, FROM 10:30 PM UNTIL 7:30 AM DUE TO HEALTH ISSUES. YOU CAN USE CELLULAR DATA AT THAT TIME, OR LET ME KNOW AHEAD OF TIME IF YOU WILL NEED IT LEFT ON FOR A SPECIFIC NIGHT/TIME! Asheville has been awarded as Beer City USA and its for a reason, there are so many fantastic and delicious brew pubs and beer tours we suggest checking them out. A 10 to 15 minute drive to the East or South brings you to the scenic Blue Ridge Parkway, visit (website hidden) for info.
transit: A 10-12 minute neighborhood walk to Haywood puts you right at the ART bus stop on Haywood in West Asheville.  Daytime is best for walking as some neighborhoods are more well lit than others.
host_about: Asheville is really my favorite place I have ever experienced.  I lived in Colorado for nearly 16 years, but when I visited Asheville I knew that I had to move here. I love playing music, dancing and going out to the wine bar in downtown Asheville.  I'd love to  be your hostess and give you advice and tips on the great things to do, places to eat, and music to hear in this vibrant town. I also love nature and the outdoors, so being at the congruence of three ancient and beautiful mountain ranges, and easy driving distance to hikes, mountain peaks and water falls, is perfect for me!

space: We especially welcome traveling doctors, nurses and PAs for longer term housing but are happy to accommodate the week-end visitor or multi-day tourist for a minimum of a 2 night stay.

neighborhood_overview: This is a very quiet, park-like neighborhood in a super convenient location near nature trails, gardens, river fun, shopping, and freeway accesses in all directions.
notes: Please note the bed is a "double" making accommodations suitable for 1 or 2 people only. The suite does not have a washer/dryer but main house does.
transit: We are less than 1 mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway, French Broad River, Arboretum, Lake Powhatan, and Asheville's brand new Outlet Mall. We are  2 miles from I-26, I-40, I-240, the BRP commuter section and the Farmers Market; and a 10-minute drive to dozens of fine restaurants, antique shops, mini-breweries, the Biltmore House, and area hospitals.
host_about: I am a reader, a writer, an artist, and a history buff.  I can be very accommodating to those who respect my property.  I enjoy meeting folks and cooking but I don't do well in heat and humidity...which is why I live in the beautiful mountains. I love to travel and always seek out the historical sites and stories and museums. I believe we should never stop learning.

space: A studio-style one bedroom apartment with it's own entrance. We are around on and off but will try to give our guests lots of space.  Our property is almost a
neighborhood_overview: Emma neighborhood is a small old farm community that is not in the city limits but less than 10 minutes from downtown.  Most houses have a good amount of property with them so there are not neighbors right on top of each other.  We are very close to Emma Elementary School so there can be school traffic during school hours.  The neighborhood is walk-able but the county has not created sidewalks here yet so it's not a safe walk downtown; driving or ubering/cabbing is easy and fast.
notes: The gate to the property opens towards the road so when you pull up to open it, park in the road- not the driveway.
host_about: I am a Massage Therapist and an Oncology Nurse. Ben is an electrician. We love to travel and host. We live with our dog, Louise, (3 years old) and cat, Oliver, (13 years old).  We are very outgoing friendly people and love to meet new people and experience new cultures.  We love adventuring outdoors as we do lots of backpacking, rock climbing, bicycling, hiking, and more.  We look forward to adventuring with you and more.  Cheers!

name: Country Peacefulness near Town
summary: Have breakfast on your own large covered patio surrounded by oak trees and birds. Cozy, one-room studio in a rustic setting less than 10 minutes to downtown Asheville.   Perfect for hikers, kayakers, outdoor enthusiasts, musicians & artists.
space: Simple 235 sf studio attached to our home with fully operational kitchen, double bed, sofa, table and chairs, bathroom, propane grill (upon request,) large covered stone patio & fire pit (all built for guests' use only.)   A friend and I built this house with our own hands implementing a lot of recycled materials from an old barn and an old fallen house. It's a super labor intensive, sustainable work of art that carpenters will appreciate.  The house is situated on a fully fenced-in rustic acre complete with a silversmith studio called "Metaluna" (where small classes are occasionally taught) and piles of old hard wood lumber that we are trying to figure out how not to waste.  The kitchen has oven/range, coffee maker, pots & pans, dishes, mini-fridge/freezer, etc.  We are located down a bumpy dirt road in a warehouse district near town.  Sports cars that are low to the ground are cautioned to drive slowly.

neighborhood_overview: This is a quaint, rustic, dirt road neighborhood where most of us know each other and are friends.   It is mostly an Appalachian country setting tucked in the warehouse district.
notes: Note that there is no T.V., only wireless internet.
transit: It is about a ten minute walk from the bus stop, and a 20-30 minute walk up to Haywood Rd. and the West Asheville coffee shops, bars, etc.   At the bottom of the drive there are walking/mountain bike paths that lead to the golf course that I frequently walk across to go to the Mexican Market (el Toro) for meat, produce, and beverages.  Caution:  trails can be muddy and there is some poison ivy in places to contend with.

host_about:
My home is my castle, so I love entertaining and sharing interesting food/wine with friends and family. I enjoy gardening, hiking with my beloved dachshunds and a good movie in the evening.   Also, I am an avid yoga enthusiast.

Travel is on the forefront in my future plans.  I love learning about other cultures, their lifestyles and their passion for food and wine.  

My neighborhood is peaceful and friendly.  My home would be a wonderful place to unwind from hiking or touring Asheville.  It is close to the Blue Ridge Parkway.

NON SMOKER, PLEASE AND NO LATE NIGHTERS!!!

name: Central Location, Mountain Views
summary: On a quiet street, yet just 1 mi from the River Arts District, 2 mi to downtown, and 1 mi/less to central West Asheville. This peaceful home is the upper half of a historic duplex with great character & lovely mountain views. Private room, queen bed.
space: Great light and lots of character. The bedroom has a queen bed with pillow top and plenty of closet space for your belongings. Stay cool with a ceiling fan/ window air-conditioning unit or toasty warm with a quiet space heater. Fresh linens and towels, soap, shampoo/conditioner, and toothpaste are provided. Toast, eggs, and coffee/tea are available for you to help yourself/prepare in the morning. Access to: an ironing board/iron, hair dryer. You are also welcome to use any condiments or spices. My apologies- this home is not currently suited to host young children. This listing is brand new as of July 2015. I look forward to welcoming my first guest/s! ***For security reasons, I only accept requests submitted by someone with an uploaded photo and at least three forms of ID verification.***

This listing is brand new as of July 2015. I look forward to welcoming my first guest/s! ***For security reasons, I only accept requests submitted by someone with an uploaded ph
neighborhood_overview: I really believe East West Asheville is the best neighborhood in the city. This is a quiet, residential neighborhood but literally just on the edge of the River Arts District and the soon-to-open New Belgium Brewery and the greenway expansion that will come with it. Downtown and its eclectic fun is just across the bridge and up the hill (you can see downtown from the front of my house when the leaves fall). Central West Asheville - a little village unto itself- is also just down Haywood Road. The French Broad River Park and Carrier Park (both great for walking, running, biking), are just down the hill. It's also very simple to get to I-240/I-26 and I-40 from here. Biltmore Estate is 6 miles away.
notes: The house was built in the 1920's, so while it's well loved, it is an old home. The floors are creaky, and it has some minor cosmetic issues that I am working to address. I am in the midst of touching up the trim, for instance. It is a work in progress but clean, bright, and very peaceful. As it borders the River Arts District, is also across the river and up the hill from the train yard. Noise is minimal, though you may hear cars being moved.
transit: There is ample off-street parking on-site, and driving to anywhere in the city is a breeze from here. Parking downtown is fairly inexpensive at city lots. A cab to/from downtown shouldn't cost more than 6- 8 dollars. The bus line is nearby, but if you're a walker/biker who isn't intimidated by hills, you can easily access the River Arts District, downtown, and West Asheville (less hills to walk in W. Asheville proper). My home is just over 2 miles from downtown Asheville.
host_about:
Hello, and thank you for considering my home for your Asheville visit!

I moved to the Asheville area in the summer of 2013 to be near family. I love this lively mountain town full of wonderful art, music, food, beverages, and people. 

While Maryland and West Virginia are my home states, New Mexico, Maine, and Oregon are others where I've been fortunate to live. I have also lived in England and traveled through out Europe. 

I work in administration at a renewable energy company, though my background runs the gamut from social service, healing arts, grassroots fundraising, to sales/management. My degree is in cultural anthropology and sociology; I can find something in common with just about anyone.

When not at work, I enjoy exploring trails in the area, trying new restaurants, reading, running, spending time with friends and family, gardening, practicing yoga, and doing genealogy research. 

My home reflects my love of vibrant colors, affinity for the natural world, appreciation of pretty little antiques, and my peaceful, tidy aesthetic. I am kind, sincere, and playful. I love meeting and hosting new people and take pride in providing a clean, peaceful, comfortable place to relax while traveling.

name: Modern Meets Zen - West Asheville
summary: My Asheville home is a hybrid of modern & traditional, Asian & Western, modern & cozy. It is within walking distance to many local favorites in W. Asheville. The feel & tone of my home is quiet, contemplative, relaxing & refreshing. I #HostwithPride.
space: Enhance your visit to Asheville by treating yourself to some "zen" in a home in West Asheville. Completed in April '13, my home (which I live in, full-time) is a unique hybrid of contemporary & traditional, Asian & Western, modern & warm. It is within walking distance to many local favorites - 7 minutes walk to Sunny Point Cafe (rated "Best Brunch" in Asheville), Ouster House Brewing Co., 8 minutes to West Asheville Yoga, 12 minutes to Biscuit Head, West End Bakery, 9 Mile, The Hop Ice-cream, & 20 minutes walk to King Daddy Chix & Waffles, The Admiral and other favorite local joints. You can easily get to Downtown Asheville - 8 minutes by car via I-240, or 30-35 minutes bike ride through artsy River Arts District. In under 20 minutes you can be on your way to hiking trails, parkways and other outdoor attractions in mountains of Western North Carolina.  Your room has a built-in Japanese-style tatami mat platform with a comfortable bed on it (see the great things guests have said about t

The feel & tone of my home is quiet, contemplative, relaxing & refreshing. I #HostwithPride. Enhance your visit to Asheville by treating yourself to some "zen" in a home in West Asheville. Completed in April '13, my home (which I live in, full-time) is a unique hybrid of contemporary & traditional, Asian & Western, modern & warm. It is within walking distance to many local favorites - 7 minutes walk to Sunny Point Cafe (rated "Best Brunch" in Asheville), Ouster House Brewing Co., 8 minutes to West Asheville Yoga, 12 minutes to Biscuit Head, West End Bakery, 9 Mile, The Hop Ice-cream, & 20 minutes walk to King Daddy Chix & Waffles, The Admiral and other favorite local joints. You can easily get to Downtown Asheville - 8 minutes by car via I-240, or 30-35 minutes bike ride through artsy River Arts District. In under 20 minutes you c
neighborhood_overview: From a local real estate website: "West Asheville is an area that moves easily between its old-world history and new-world energy, enjoying the charm of its neighborhoods and the spirit of its quaint main street.  It's both down-to-earth and cutting-edge, with 1920's bungalows and eco-built new homes, with old brick buildings that house innovative businesses, with appreciation for its stories and excitement for its future." And from the "Explore Asheville" website: "West Asheville's funky vibe translates into a varied mix of eateries. Happening on this unique neighborhood leaving downtown Asheville, you encounter boutiques and cafés lining Haywood Avenue. This West Asheville hub of activity is in the midst of a neighborhood renaissance."
notes: Note that the main bed in the room isn't a futon but a regular mattress with a very comfortable posturepedic mattress pad on top. The futon mentioned somewhere in this listing is a second, single bed that normally is folded up as a mini-couch but can be used as a bed for a third guest. You will have access to a meditation space in Downtown Asheville (Tuesdays to Sundays noon-5pm) if you so wish to use it while here - just ask!
transit: Off-street parking is available for one guest vehicle. You can catch the local public bus on Haywood (8 mins walk) to get to Downtown Asheville - a pleasant and efficient ride. You can bring your bikes along on the bus-ride or bike into Downtown (25-30 minutes ride).
host_about:
I first came to Asheville 2003 and after a five-year stint teaching at Warren Wilson College, I moved two hours away because of a new job only to return five more years later. Perhaps it has something to do with the "vortex" in Asheville that some folks here talk about but probably more to do with the relationships that I have cultivated here, the people and their values, the mountains that surround us, the great climate, the restaurants and bookstores. 
I was born and raised in Malaysia but have lived longer in the United States than I have in Asia now. I have traveled a bit, mostly to Asia - 5 trips to Tibet, 4 to India, 6 to China, several to Taiwan, Thailand, Bhutan other Asian countries, Chile, Peru, Guatemala and a sprinkling of European countries. I've also lived a year in London and loved it. I'm a hybrid of quiet and gregarious, easy-going with others and meticulous with myself. I don't smoke, I'm not into mind-altering substances and I don't drink (but don't have a problem with others drinking). I spend a lot of time at a downtown, spiritual (Buddhist) center but I am capable of talking about things other than meditation and mindfulness!  Especially food. And food.

name: Private Entrance to Two-Room Suite
summary: Suite on private floor with private entrance, with queen bed, bath, and adjacent sitting/sleeping room. Comfy and Clean! One mile to W. Asheville hotspots, 5 miles to downtown, and minutes to blue Ridge hiking. Great for couples or groups.
space: Imagine yourself in this large two-room suite, plus private entrance and newly renovated bath.  Accessible from a beautiful backyard, you'll enjoy a private and quiet space with lots of light. The cozy master bedroom has a new queen-sized mattress, homemade quilts, and a workspace. The family room doubles as an extra bedroom with queen-sized inflatable and a comfy couch for larger groups. A small refrigerator is available, with snacks and water provided, as well as a coffee maker and coffee/tea.  The family room also has a real fireplace, which guests are welcome to use when the hosts are home. Although we don't have cable TV, we provide Amazon and Netflix on a large-screen tv, along with an assortment of DVDs. For rainy days and inside play, you'll find lots of games and puzzles in the cupboard, and a ping-pong table in the basement.  Free reliable wi-fi, central heating and air throughout. Outside, you'll be surrounded by gardens, tall trees, and bird-song. Guests are welcome to have

Accessible from a beautiful backyard, you'll enjoy a private and quiet space with lots of light. The cozy master bedroom has a new queen-sized mattress, homemade quilts, and a workspace. The family room doubles as an extra bedroom with queen-sized inflatable and a comfy couch for larger groups. A small refrigerator is available, with snacks and water provided, as well as a coffee maker and coffee/tea.  The family room also has a real fireplace, which guests are welcome to use when the hosts are home. Although we don't have cable TV, we provide Amazon and Netflix on a large-screen tv, along with an assortment of DVDs. For rainy days and inside play, you'll
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very safe and walkable, with trails, parks, and sidewalks. We are about a 5 minute drive (2 miles) to West Asheville's Haywood Road, which has a great bakery, coffee shops, and several restaurants and pubs. West Asheville is also home to the brand-new New Belgium brewery, the River Arts District, and the Hole donut shop. Access to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Bent Creek Recreation area biking trails, the Carrier Park river and tubing access, and a local outlet mall is equally easy—just 15 minutes away.  Driving east, you can be downtown or at the Biltmore Estate in 15 minutes too.  Further afield, we're happy to direct you  to Dupont State Forest, where The Hunger Games were filmed, Pisgah National Forest where you can slide down a waterfall, or the Nantahala River, where you can take a rafting trip. Stay longer and do it all!
notes: We have two cats who live upstairs and won't invade your space unless you ask for them.  Then they will be more than happy to offer a warm fuzzy wake up call or a purring lap buddy.
transit: You'll need a car to get around Asheville easily. Or, take an Uber—our neighbor is an Uber driver (a ride Downtown  will cost you about $10)—and drink responsibly. Happy to help with directions, hooking you up with Uber, or occasionally giving a ride. Ask!
host_about: I'm an educator and education writer. My husband teaches college chemistry. Now that our two kids are in college, we've turned our empty nest into a cozy space for you. We enjoy hiking, canoeing, and the lively arts and craft beer scene of our hometown in Asheville. Scroll down to the map and  click on the icons to see what we recommend in the area! We also enjoy  learning about other parts of the country while traveling in the joyful and adventurous Air B n B community.

name: West Asheville bungalow
summary: Bright and cozy home with Scandinavian design. Perfectly located in downtown West Asheville - walking distance to the popular Haywood Road, River Arts District, and French Broad River Greenway. Relax in the sunroom or enjoy a fire in the woodstove.
space: An open design makes this home perfect for entertaining, while still feeling intimate. The sunroom that spans the south side of the house provides plenty of natural light.  A front and back porch means you can find sun or shade any time of the day. The home is conveniently located in downtown West Asheville, while still being in a quiet residential area with off-street parking. You can easily walk to the French Broad River or the trendy West Asheville restaurants and bars. The house is a lovely place to relax or a convenient jumping-off location for any Asheville adventure! I use only natural cleaning products and unscented laundry detergent.

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is quickly becoming one of the most trendy, funky, eclectic destinations in Asheville. The restaurant, shopping, and art scene on Haywood Road is an easy walk from the house. A short walk in the other direction takes you to the greenway along the French Broad River. Right across the river is the River Arts District. Downtown Asheville is just 2.3 miles from the house, and the Biltmore Estate is 2.6 miles away.
notes: The house has 1 bedrooms with a double bed. The daybed in the living room is made from a twin-sized mattress and serves as the second bed. The sunroom loveseat folds out into a twin-sized bed as well, however the room is unheated and gets cold at night in the winter. The TV only has an Amazon Fire Stick, so you can watch Netflix, Amazon Prime, YouTube,  etc, but it doesn't get any channels.
host_about: I'm a forestry professor who has lived in Asheville for 13 years. As my profession would imply, I love the outdoors and exploring the Western North Carolina mountains. I can help you locate that secret waterfall, or the best place to watch the sunset. I also love living in the vibrant West Asheville community and I can give you great recommendations for the city scene as well. I'm an avid traveler myself, and I truly enjoy the opportunity to share my home with visitors!

I will mostly stay clear of you, but I will be sharing the space with you somewhat, due to my studio being in the space, and the laundry
neighborhood_overview: This is a quiet neighborhood, family friendly and tight knit community.  People are into nature here, and care about their neighbors.
transit: You will want your car and maybe your bike.  Lots of places you can bike to from here.
host_about:
I am a naturalist/artist/minimalist.  I love working out, camping, backpacking, yoga, and creek walking.  I love kids, am a sun worshipper, and tree-hugger. 

I have traveled all over the States as well as Europe, Scandinavia, and some Mediterranean.   I travel light.  I was raised in a loving travel-thirsty family.

Hosting style:  Chances are I will not be here to greet you.  I work a professional full time job, that requires my 100% attention while I am there, and I am a mom when I am not at work, so I may not be able to answer your questions as soon as you'd like.  Please try to get all your questions answered prior to your trip, so that I may take the time they deserve to answer them.  Also, please refer to the "Guidebook" I have set up on Airbnb to let you know my favorite haunts, and must visits of Asheville.  

I am an early to bed early to rise person, so I won't answer texts after 9pm or before 7am.  Sorry, but I have found I need to draw the line ;)  

The neighborhood is a family neighborhood (kids next door) so please no loud interacting, no lude behavior, and no partys.  Reminder that no more than the registered guests are allowed to be on the property, unless with prior permission.  Monday-Friday its work and school week as usual, so no late nights outside that would disrupt the neighborhood.  Weekends are a bit more slack but still please no loud interacting outside that would disrupt anyone's pleasure, or sleep.

The 3 units on the property are either rented via Airbnb or to longer term tenants, so they will probably not be of assistance in answering any questions, and it would be important to not infringe on their privacy or their enjoyment of their vacations or visits.  Please keep to yourself and act with mature behavior.  

Otherwise, I am super excited to host you, and have you here at my house.  The garden I planted my self, and so I hope you have a chance to enjoy it.  I am very proud of my little shady spot.  It's a great safe place to relax and be close to town, too.

Safe travels!  

~Cat
Have a sunny day, regardless of the weather

space: For YOGA and MASSAGE students only! This cozy guest room is available for rental for students who are taking yoga workshops, yoga trainings, and massage therapy trainings in Asheville, NC.   The guest room is located in the front of the house and has a queen sized bed that is very comfortable to sleep on.  The room has three windows, wood floors, a dresser, and several plants. A space heater is in the room during the winter and a window air conditioner is installed during the summer so you can adjust the room temperature to your liking.  One caveat: if you have a very large car / truck you may need to park it on a side street. I have selected the strict cancelation policy, but if I am able to rent the room out during any canceled dates I can refund you for those days. When making a reservation please let me know your preferred check in and check out times.

name: Cedar Springs Farm- Apartment
summary: This old country house was built in 1915, it has been remodeled through the years. Our remodel includes this efficiency apt for your bnb get-away.  Private Bedroom with double bed, bath & shower, semi-private living space & kitchenette.
space: This 21 acre property is located just 5 miles from the center of Asheville and only 2 miles from Haywood Rd. in West Asheville.  We're 1 mile outside the city limit. Our unpretentious neighborhood and rural feeling gives you the best of both worlds- quiet nights and lots to do and see both in Asheville and in the surrounding mountain and river ecosystems.  The house was homeowner-built before there were inspectors for such endeavors.  However, it is safe, comfortable and clean.   The best part is that it is SPRING water supplying all our H2O needs!  The efficiency apartment is our own home-owner addition, and includes a bathroom with a shower and an innovative composting toilet, and a kitchenette. The private bedroom has a double bed and a fresh coat of paint. I have been a host for Airbnb for over five years, and in this time frame I've booked more than 400 bookings and have earned more than 150 5- star reviews.
description: This old country house was built in 1915, it has been remodeled through the years. Our remodel includes this efficiency apt for your bnb get-away. The efficiency apartment is our own home-owner addition, and includes a bathroom with a shower and an innovative composting toilet, and a kitchenette. The private bedroom has a double bed and a fresh coat of
neighborhood_overview: This is as rural as it gets within 5 miles of downtown. The closer you get to our place, the more spread out the houses get. It's quiet day and night, with very light traffic on the road leading in. Beautiful mountain vistas can be seen along the way if you take certain routes we can tell you about.
notes: We are a couple of permaculture designers, implementing sustainable principles of this design system as we settle into living on this land.  Our remodeled apartment has been done with mostly recycled, salvaged and some limited quantity of new materials. The finish work is done with non-toxic milk paints and some no-VOC latex, recycled grocery bag wall paper, with tung oil and carnuba wax for the wood work.  Eventually we plan to have tree houses and alternative structures built with indigenous materials, workshops and retreat events...stay tuned!
transit: City bus stop is one mile away, downhill most of the way there!  Once in town- you'll want to be on foot with easy walking and lots to see along the way between points of interest. Leaving the driveway can be a bit daunting as it seems to be a blind drive. I've found that rolling down the windows and listening is the best indicator of oncoming traffic. That method has worked every time, and it's not a very busy road either.
host_about:
Your Hostess:
Kelly is an unapologetic idealist & liberal, permaculture practicing free thinker.

name: Mountain views minutes from brews
summary: Peaceful LGBTQ friendly neighborhood in historic West Asheville only 1 block away from popular Haywood Road. Catch a city bus downtown or walk to dozens of eclectic shops, eateries, cafes and pubs.
space: During WWII, this 1915 home was redesigned for dual family living. The room available is the best room in the house due to the natural sunlight and  mountain views. It's also the most creatively decorated room in the house with different ecosystems painted mural-style on the walls. Perfect background for quirky vacay pics! The space includes a double bed, loveseat (pulls out into a single bed), desk and nightstand. A newly remodeled full bath is easily accessible.
description: Peaceful LGBTQ friendly neighborhood in historic West Asheville only 1 block away from popular Haywood Road. Catch a city bus downtown or walk to dozens of eclectic shops, eateries, cafes and pubs. During WWII, this 1915 home was redesigned for dual family living. The room available is the best room in the house due to the natural sunlight and  mountain views. It's also the most creatively decorated room in the house with different ecosystems painted mural-style on the walls. Perfect background for quirky vacay pics! The space includes a double bed, loveseat (pulls out into a single bed), desk and nightstand. A newly remodeled full bath is easily accessible. In addition to the primary room and shared full bathroom, guests will have access to the front porch, back porch, and backyard. One other upstairs room might be occupied. Guests will also have free wifi access. We will be available to meet you and get you settled. We're also happy to provide free local insider information about the
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood! The people in this neighborhood are all exceptional humans. And the location is a rare find (minutes away from the best places without the noise and traffic of living on a busy main road). In addition to plenty of food/drink and shopping options within walking distance, we can also walk to yoga studios, community acupuncture, and massage practitioners.
notes: The ideal guest is a non-smoker who enjoys animals. We have an "exuberant greeter" mid-size rescue dog named Karma and an indoor/outdoor rescue cat named Bagel. Karma will occasionally bark and the cat enjoys hanging out on the roof outside the bedroom window. We have backyard chickens and bunnies as well as an indoor pet bearded dragon.
transit: A 10 minute walk from our front door takes you to dozens of eateries and pubs, two excellent music venues, coffee shops, a food truck park, bookstores, dozens of shops and small businesses, and a fantastic public park and river walk. There's a city bus stop less than a block away and downtown is  less than 5 minutes away by car. The River Arts District is about 3 minutes away by car and downtown Biltmore (Biltmore Estate) is about a 7 minute drive from our house. Local Uber and taxi services are also available. We are about 30 minutes from the Asheville Airport if renting a car.
host_about:
Former educator, adventurer, wellness advocate, business owner, mother, urban chicken farmer, foodie, wordsmith, artist, free-thinker. 

"Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all."--Helen Keller

name: Lovely 1926 home in West Asheville
summary: It's spacious and comfortable with lots of outside living space,  a big yard and an easy walk to all the restaurants and shops in West Asheville.  As we know our vacation plans we always add available dates to the calendar.
space: This house is bathed in light from your morning coffee until the evening on the porch for dinner.  The kitchen is spacious and has all that you need to make a lovely dinner.  It's comfortable for adults and bigger kids alike.   There are plenty of board games to play, Legos and PS3.  Please check our calendar.  Some time in March will will begin to have available dates listed as we plan our spring/summer trips.
description: It's spacious and comfortable with lots of outside living space,  a big yard and an easy walk to all the restaurants and shops in West Asheville.  As we know our vacation plans we always add available dates to the calendar. This house is bathed in light from your morning coffee until the evening on the porch for dinner.  The kitchen is spacious and has all that you need to make a lovely dinner.  It's comfortable for adults and bigger kids alike.   There are plenty of board games to play, Legos and PS3.  Please check our calendar.  Some time in March will will begin to have available dates listed as we plan our spring/summer trips. You will have full access to the home except our office room in the back.   Our kitchen will have all the condiments you need plus coffee and tea. The back yard is big.  There is a fire pit area and we have wood at the ready for you. I will be happy to give you any information you need by phone and email.  Written details about the house will be here for your
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is full of options for dining, hanging out for a craft beer,  walking up to the HOP for homemade ice cream or going out to see live music.  We are not only part of the neighborhood, we own a business here as well.   From here to can walk to just about anywhere in West Asheville and its less than 3 miles to downtown and the River Arts District.  Carrier Park and the French Broad River are a bike ride away.
notes: We have a shared driveway and ask our guests to park in the designated spaces in the front of the house only. This is our family home.  We will make personal space for your clothes and belongings in each of the bedrooms.   Our downstairs office is open so you can access all the board games if you wish but otherwise please leave that room private.
transit: You can bike anywhere in town but beware for those who are not used to biking without bike lanes.  Around the neighborhood you can just leave your keys and car at home - walk!   But to enjoy all that Asheville and the surrounding area has to offer you will need a car.  If you are a mountain biker - Bent Creek Experimental Forest is just under 6 miles away and easy access to some great trails.
host_about: I'm the mom of an 11 year old boy, Ian,   trying to bring him up with as much time in the outdoors as I can.  My husband Russ loves to road cycle, go to baseball games with Ian and manage his business, Second Gear here in West  Asheville.    I am a Pediatric Occupational Therapist by day and other days I'm a runner and cyclist with friends, singer of traditional music, gardener, volunteer and girl who loves a good glass of wine and sitting on the porch with a friend.  We are so fortunate to have a comfortable home and a sweet life here in Asheville.

summary: Hi!  Toys, cats, shared bathroom, high speed wireless, fridge and coffee, front half, own entrance,
space: This is not just a room, it's the entire front half of the house, with a private entrance. Our living space is in the opposite end of the house, and sound doesn't travel easily through the house, so we can make a little noise without disturbing one another. I make and use all of my own household cleaners! The space includes:  -My personal favorite room in the house: a plant filled, sunny, and peaceful, porch. It's perfect for coffee in the morning or curling up on the couch to read. -a bedroom with a queen size bed -a living/dining room with a (full size) futon; a small fridge, coffee pot, and toaster oven; a DVD player, stereo receiver, TV (not a flat screen, and no cable, a true dinosaur!), and VCR (with some video tapes if you want to take a trip back into the olden days) in a closeable cabinet. -a shared bathroom (we will always be respectful of your space and knock before entering your part of the house) -if you have children there is a play area in the living room with toys, art

neighborhood_overview: This is a nice quiet little street, where all the neighbors know each other well. We are just a few blocks from Haywood rd. with lots of restaurants and nightlife within walking distance, the River Arts District (RAD) is only about a mile away, the French Broad River is also about a mile away with parks situated right on the banks. The closest restaurants to the house are The WALK, The Admiral, and a great little coffee shop, Battle Cat with a restaurant in back. I have put together a list of West Asheville restaurants and shops for you, and I can send you to visit some potter friends in the river district and/or around Asheville, if you're interested.
notes: Ask me about pottery lessons or having a personal Raku firing! This is not my normal job and my time is tight, so I only offer this to my guests (for a fee).
transit: My private entrance and pottery studio are located behind the house, so there is street parking only. Using the driveway to load/unload is fine.  The bus line is just 2 blocks away.
host_about:
Hi! I'm Laura. I'm a single mother with two children, ages 14 and 7. I love to work in my garden! I have a pottery studio behind my house that I work and teach in, and a large kiln that I share with other potters. I also teach pottery at the local community college. When my kids aren't with me, one of my favorite things to do is to go to the scrap metal yard and find odd and unique things to make art with. 

My kids and I like to walk around downtown just to see the sights and we try to hit the local festivals from time to time. We also like to spend time tubing down the river.

host_about: Chris is in Real Estate and has lived all over the United States, Aubrey is a Licensed Esthetician and grew up in Asheville, North Carolina.

name: Cottage! BonPaul + Sharky's Hostel
space: Private cottage located behind the main house at the Hostel in Historic West Asheville.   Cottage has full size bed, private kitchen and bathroom.  A twin cot can be added to accommodate a third guest for an extra $12/night. Please note that the cottage is not big, and adding a third person is doable, but gets crowded. Dogs are welcome for an extra $12/dog/night. To add a third person, or a dog please let us know in advance when booking. You can pay the added fee when you arrive. Guests get full access to the hostel: book exchange, community computer, common areas with cool international travelers and all the cool restaurants, pubs and cafe's that West Asheville has within walking distance!

name: Art Barn off-grid in-town!
summary: This is a working art studio, with a loft for sleeping.  Very rustic.  No modern facilities - outdoor shower and composting toilet. Inside has a mini fridge, hotplate.   One small step above camping. Very cute property shared by another Airbnb and f/t tenant.
space: About a mile to downtown.  This is a small barn that is also used to create art.  It is rustic like a campground.  If you require perfect cleanliness, this isn't the place for you.  It can be dusty and rustic.  There is one shelving unit that has my camping storage on it.  FYI. There is a ladder to the loft area and a full-sized mattress pad down - upon new carpet padding (surrounded by a bug netting).  You cannot stand up in the loft.  Fresh sheets & pillow cases are provided, as well as towels. The space is used for various art projects, and so part of it is an art explosion, another part is storage.  The other part is very rustically set up as a "living" space - there is a sofa/chair and table there, a small refrigerator, and hotplate.  A few lights are there which can be moved to your liking.  I will provide a large container of potable water for both drinking or whatever. Priced at the average cost for a local camping spot per night.  Economy space!  NOTHING FANCY!   This is a do-

The other part is very rustically set up as a "living" space - there is a sofa/chair and table there, a small refrigerator, and h
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is relatively unknown to Ashevillians.  It is up one of the last known dirt roads in town, and only has a few homes on it.  There are lots of old growth trees, and the property borders the public golf course.  There is a train that is nearby and comes through several times a day.
notes: Bring your own sleeping bag(s) or linens is recommended.  There is a bug netting over the full sized futon mattress pad on the floor, since bugs can get inside the not-perfectly-tight barn. There is a composting toilet system here, which you are responsible for following the directions.  It's sort of fun, and easy! No pets, sorry.  It's just not suitable.
transit: A vehicle is recommended, but one could get around on a bicycle.  There is a back-way to downtown from here.  There is also a bus stop nearby.
host_about:
I am a naturalist/artist/minimalist.  I love working out, camping, backpacking, yoga, and creek walking.  I love kids, am a sun worshipper, and tree-hugger. 

I have traveled all over the States as well as Europe, Scandinavia, and some Mediterranean.   I travel light.  I was raised in a loving travel-thirsty family.

Hosting style:  Chances are I will not be here to greet you.  I work a professional full time job, that requires my 100% attention while I am there, and I am a mom when I am not at work, so I may not be able to answer your questions as soon as you'd like.  Please try to get all your questions answered prior to your trip, so that I may take the time they deserve to answer them.  Also, please refer to the "Guidebook" I have set up on Airbnb to let you know my favorite haunts, and must visits of Asheville.  

I am an early to bed early to rise person, so I won't answer texts after 9pm or before 7am.  Sorry, but I have found I need to draw the line ;)  

The neighborhood is a family neighborhood (kids next door) so please no loud interacting, no lude behavior, and no partys.  Reminder that no more than the registered guests are allowed to be on the property, unless with prior permission.  Monday-Friday its work and school week as usual, so no late nights outside that would disrupt the neighborhood.  Weekends are a bit more slack but still please no loud interacting outside that would disrupt anyone's pleasure, or sleep.

The 3 units on the property are either rented via Airbnb or to longer term tenants, so they will probably not be of assistance in answering any questions, and it would be important to not infringe on their privacy or their enjoyment of their vacations or visits.  Please keep to yourself and act with mature behavior.  

Otherwise, I am super excited to host you, and have you here at my house.  The garden I planted my self, and so I hope you have a chance to enjoy it.  I am very proud of my little shady spot.  It's a great safe place to relax and be close to town, too.

Safe travels!  

~Cat
Have a sunny day, regardless of the weather
street: Hazel Green community, Asheville, NC 28806, United States

name: Sweet West Asheville Bungalow
summary: Charming 1920's bungalow - a true sanctuary. I have created a warm, inviting and serene environment here. You will feel it as soon as you enter the house. Great home base for exploring the area - close to everything -- downtown, river arts, Biltmore
space: Charming 1920's West Asheville bungalow - a true sanctuary. I have created a warm, inviting and serene environment here. You will feel it as soon as you enter the house.  Relax on the front porch or back deck. The front porch now has larger dining table to seat four; lower back deck has large dining table, large umbrella and chairs.  Snuggle up to the warmth and beauty of the fireplace in the living room.   Enjoy the art throughout the house. The master bedroom is like being in a tree house -- with great sounds and sights of nature.  Master bedroom has queen bed and master bath with beautiful new custom-built shower. Second bathroom has an awesome claw-foot tub. This bathroom gives you a pampered, luxurious feeling. The second bedroom is now available. Photos of it coming soon. Check out my reviews from the other listing for this house: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/612660 My house is conveniently located in the heart of Asheville's favorite neighborhood, near Haywood Road in West Ashev

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is consistently voted 'favorite neighborhood' each year.  It is a very dynamic, friendly, creative, walkable community.  Plenty of unique and interesting restaurants, music venues, art, yoga, groceries and retail stores.
notes: HOLIDAYS - 4 NIGHT MINIMUM
transit: In addition to parking in the driveway, there is a church parking lot across the street from my house. Convenient access to public transportation (Asheville Transit), bicycles, Uber or taxis.
host_about: I have been here since 2007, and continue to fall more deeply in love with Asheville.  I adore my neighborhood, West Asheville.  It is super friendly and very community-oriented.  It truly has the charm of an old-fashioned neighborhood.

name: Serene Cozy Getaway
summary: Greetings & welcome to my peaceful, happy house!  Treat yourself to some "zen" in my house in West Asheville.  My home is an old craftsman style welcoming,  light and bright.  A cottage like feel, surrounded by woods, deck & garden.
space: So you'll get a " Zen in the woods" feeling, but just minutes away from everything.  I have lived all over the world so my home is a unique blend of contemporary,  traditional, Asian and European style and furnishings and décor.  Comfortable and cozy. I have travelled all over the world using Air B n B and it is great to give back and open my home as a host. You have your own entrance. Just outside your private room is the kitchen which you are very welcome to use. Your room overlooks the garden, is quiet and serene with lots of  natural light, great decor, and a very comfortable European style convertible bed. A table and chairs and of course a rocking chair to relax in.  There is a great deck to sit on, to eat or just relax and enjoy the sunshine and outdoors. After a busy day you may just feel like watching a movie, or listening to music. So please make use of the TV with DVD/CD player in your room. With a membership at the local DVD rental store,  there are always  a couple of movi

neighborhood_overview: My place offers the best of both worlds! Located in the heart of it all. Did you know that Asheville is ranked the number 3 city in the WORLD for the happiness of the people living here? We will smile at you, speak to you, help you, and even wait patiently if you dart out in front of us in traffic. We love it here, and so will you! Enjoy the quiet, safe neighborhood, while relaxing on the porch with your coffee or tea and included continental breakfast.  Then in just a few minutes  hit the hot spots of West Asheville, with its great cafes, coffee shops, restaurants, bars, local beer breweries, theaters and music. The River Arts District where local artist will dazzle and seduce you with their creativity. Continue on to explore Downtown and the charming neighborhoods of Montford. (Lunch or dinner at Nine Mile is a must), Biltmore Village, or  North Asheville.  f you are vegan or vegetarian, or just love great local prepared food, into yoga, massage, gardening, meditation, hiking and the
notes: In Asheville, buying local is "in".  We are into permaculture, sustainability, simplicity, healthy living, organic food, creativity and self-expression. In the summertime a visit to our Tuesday Farmers Market is a must. Meet some great locals and enjoy the freshest of goods.  JUST SOME OF THE GREAT PLACES TO EAT IN ASHEVILLE Asheville has some of the best restaurants and food on the planet!. Every type of cuisine is available.  I love to share my favorite places. Here are just a few  If you love vegetarian restaurants I recommend ROSETTA'S KITCHEN. This is a low cost, health food retreat where the locals meet for good home cooked meals. For a more refined touch try the LAUGHING SEED CAFE. A really nice restaurant that's a bit more touristy but still has great food and decent prices too.  Nona Mia is one of the best Italian restaurants and just a short walk from the house.   The DOBRA TEA HOUSE is a great place to sit and converse over a cup of tea. . The selection is incredible. On Fri
transit: Everything is located within a short  walk, bike ride drive from the house. .Although a car is recommended by most, (I walk and bike mostly),   to get to most places, everything is located within a short drive from the house. You are within walking distance to many of my local favorites - start with great coffee and tea at Waking Life Café just at the top of my street.   The West Village Market is a great place to pick up various fresh natural, organic grocery items, yummy deli foods, made to order, coffee, tea and a superb juice bar. West Village Bakery right next door has all homemade breads, cakes, soups, all fresh local ingredients. From the house its 15 minutes walk to Sunny Point (rated "Best Brunch" in Asheville), 8 minutes to West Asheville Yoga, 10  minutes to West End Bakery, and 18 minutes to The Admiral. You can easily get to Downtown Asheville - 7 minutes by car via I-240, or 20-30 minute bike ride through artsy River Arts District. You are welcome to borrow my Schwinn bik
host_about: I am a positive, relaxed soulful person, who loves to share with like minded people. I enjoy meeting people from all walks of life and cultures. I have had the privelage and the opportunity to work and live in several different countries, travel is one of my passions along with writing, working with essential oils, cooking, great fresh food, health and well being. I love living and relaxing in the sunshine, nature and enjoy the outdoors, arts and culture.

name: Purple Door Studio Apt. W.Asheville
summary: Purple Door Studio is a newly renovated basement apartment in our home in the heart of West Asheville. Keyless entry, off-street parking, comfy bed and couch, mini-split heat & air, kitchenette, big bathroom, eating area, all in a great location! Permitted by the city for legal Homestay.
space: We've created a 'glorified hotel room' -style apartment in our basement. It's brand new construction, with all new furnishings and appliances. The Purple Door Studio has a separate entrance with keyless entry, new mini-split heating and air conditioning unit, a kitchenette, full bath, queen size bed and a couch, a small eating area, and off-street parking.
description: Purple Door Studio is a newly renovated basement apartment in our home in the heart of West Asheville. Keyless entry, off-street parking, comfy bed and couch, mini-split heat & air, kitchenette, big bathroom, eating area, all in a great location! Permitted by the city for legal Homestay. We've created a 'glorified hotel room' -style apartment in our basement. It's brand new construction, with all new furnishings and appliances. The Purple Door Studio has a separate entrance with keyless entry, new mini-split heating and air conditioning unit, a kitchenette, full bath, queen size bed and a couch, a small eating area, and off-street parking. Guests will have their own driveway for off-street parking and a private entrance to the apartment. There is a vintage Dwyer kitchenette with two burners, a sink and some storage for your use. There is also a refrigerator, microwave, and coffee pot. There is fast wi-fi access, but no TV. There is a small eating and/or work area with a table top and t
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a super-unique, vibrant section of Asheville, and we live right in the heart of it. From our house you can easily walk to restaurants, bars, playgrounds, grocery stores, an ice cream parlor, coffee shops, and the bakery. One of Asheville's many microbreweries, Oysterhouse Brewing, is very close, and Sunny Point- the best breakfast in town- is right across the street from that. Our neighborhood is a mix of young families, retirees, and college students.
notes: We do live upstairs with a pre-schooler and a baby, though we've insulated well, you will probably hear some footsteps and occasional kid noise while you're here.  We have provided a white noise machine for your use if you want while staying in the apartment, but if you need absolute silence, our place may not be your best choice. We also live in the heart of West Asheville so you will hear some vehicle and pedestrian traffic, but with the doors and windows closed, outside noise is minimal.
transit: All of West Asheville is walk-able from our house. Getting downtown is an easy 5- 7 minute drive, and the River Arts District is 4 minutes away. You can jump on the Blue Ridge Parkway in 12 minutes, and be on the Biltmore Estate in 10. We are also blocks from a bus stop and have active Uber drivers in our area.
host_about:
I'm a 'retired' touring musician and I stay home caring for my two young daughters while my husband teaches middle school. I work part time from home for a bluegrass band, Steep Canyon Rangers, handling all of their tour logistics. 

We love Asheville and sharing our home and insider tips. ;)

name: West Asheville Family Home & Garden
summary: Walk or bike to West Asheville restaurants, pubs & the market from our comfy mountain home. Great front porch, screened hot tub room, lovely gardens and a public playground nearby.
space: Walk or bike to restaurants, pubs & the market from our comfy mountain home. Features screened hot tub room, lovely gardens and a public playground nearby. Great kitchen & beautiful back porch that features outdoor dining. Just 12 minutes to downtown Asheville, but you'll find plenty to do in our West Asheville neighborhood! As a guest, you'll have access to the top floor. We have a gas grill on the back porch, a hot tub in a screened in room, an outdoor fire pit, and a front porch swing for those lazy days. There's a dog door for your pooch, and our big yard is fully enclosed. West Asheville is a fun neighborhood, with lots of great restaurants, bars, parks and an awesome bakery and ice cream shop! There's a playground and community garden just across the street, so your kids will have fun too.

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a fun neighborhood, with lots of great restaurants, bars, parks and an awesome bakery and ice cream shop! There's a playground and community garden just across the street, so your kids will have fun too. The Isis is an excellent music venue, and there are at least a dozen restaurants on Haywood Street, including Biscuit Head, Buffalo Nickel and Nine Mile. You can walk to the lively center of West Asheville in less than ten minutes!
notes: Please enter and exit through the front door on the top level, not the basement. (We will be staying in the downstairs apartment.)
host_about: I'm a mom and wife, and a lover of books and music and gardening. I really love sharing our house with other travelers!

name: Comfy 2 bedrm w/bath in 1920's home

space: Hello, my name is Susanne.  My home is located in W. Asheville in a quiet neighborhood.  The bedrooms are spacious with high ceilings, lots of charm, one bedroom with queen size bed and a bedroom w/2 single beds w/adjoining private bath.  There is wifi, use of kitchen, and wonderful front and back porches to enjoy in spring/summer.  I am also within walking distance to downtown West Asheville where you will find great coffee shops and restaurants and only 7 minutes to downtown Asheville, plus a short distance to the parkway and hiking trails.   I can provide a healthy breakfast, if desired, but limited to weekends only and served between 8:30 and 9:00 AM.  I require a 2 night minimum and a 1 week maximum. Since I am retired, I am usually at home.  Also, I have two mini-dachshunds, so any individual staying with me should be aware of their friendliness and energy and have no allergies to dogs. neighborhood_overview: The quiet and ease of getting to downtown or anywhere in the outlying Asheville area is a plus when staying in West Asheville.
notes: I prefer check in to be before 6 o'clock PM, but if later, I wish to be informed via email or phone shortly after 11 AM.
transit: There is a bus transit pickup and taxi service within 2 blocks of my home.
host_about:
My home is my castle, so I love entertaining and sharing interesting food/wine with friends and family. I enjoy gardening, hiking with my beloved dachshunds and a good movie in the evening.   Also, I am an avid yoga enthusiast.

Travel is on the forefront in my future plans.  I love learning about other cultures, their lifestyles and their passion for food and wine.  

My neighborhood is peaceful and friendly.  My home would be a wonderful place to unwind from hiking or touring Asheville.  It is close to the Blue Ridge Parkway.

NON SMOKER, PLEASE AND NO LATE NIGHTERS!!!

name: Walkable West Asheville Bungalow
summary: Sunny and bright renovated 1920s bungalow in happening West Asheville. Only a short walk to the bustling Haywood Road and minutes from Downtown Asheville. Relax on the porch under 100+ year old maple tree and enjoy the king size bed and living area.
space: Renovated Bungalow, 5 minute walk from bustling Haywood Road. The entire home is yours with the exception of our office which we keep locked. We are away many weekends for our business we run called Bellyak. Thus enjoy the privacy of your home away from home while you stay in Asheville!

name: PET FRIENDLY APT CLOSE TO DOWNTOWN
summary: So close to downtown but quiet and rural.
space: PET FRIENDLY 1  BEDROOM APARTMENT NEAR DOWNTOWN “Luca's Place"  is  a 950 sq ft one bedroom apartment located in the country but only 3 miles from downtown.  It is a short ride to everything you want to do in the Asheville area, from wonderful dining, gorgeous hiking, and antiquing.  The Biltmore estate is 15 minutes away. After a day of sightseeing and adventure, Luca's Place is a great place to call home.   Here you can cook a meal in the fully appointed kitchen, watch TV, go on the internet, or just relax.  Our semi-detached apartment has a very large living room and dining area with a fully equipped tiled kitchen and a tiled bath with a large shower.  The bedroom has a queen size bed  with a pillowtop mattress. There is a very comfortable queen size sofa with a pull-out bed in the living room. The apartment has its own driveway and entrance,  and is a great place to relax after a day of exploring Asheville or as an alternative to a motel on a business trip. Asheville boasts activit

name: Bed, Bath, Breakfast and Beauty!
summary: Airbnb all over the world! BUT when you Airbnb in Asheville...  enjoy your visit in a creative home - super clean bedroom and private full-bath. Delicious, quality breakfasts - FREE daily. My Airbnb = 96% 5-star reviews. (Asheville avg. = 81%).
space: Bedroom has a great closet, hardwood floors, a new double bed, new mattress and dresser, lovely linens and Restoration Hardware Silver Sage paint. It's a serene, very clean room - with a closet that holds all your belongings and luggage - and reduces visual clutter in your bedroom. The bathroom has a tub and shower and is in perfect shape. The house is 6 years old, so everything is clean - NO MOLD or musty areas - unlike many of the older houses in this damp Asheville climate.  Are you worried about privacy? Your room and private bath are at one end of the house, separated from my bedroom by the bathroom and the office - quite private for an in-house room.  Are you worried about safety? Bedroom is on first floor with huge window for easy exit in case of fire.  It's also close to the front door. Definitely a safe place to stay.  Do you like fine food? A different hearty and healthy, delicious breakfast is offered daily.  N'espresso lungos, fresh cage-and-cruelty-free eggs, high quality

neighborhood_overview: I live in a small, modern, attractive house in a quiet, very modest West Asheville neighborhood. I have good views off the back and have a beautiful European style garden (parterre).  It is a 10 minute drive to downtown Asheville along Patton Ave (Rte. 19/23). Very, very easy drive. Straight shot into town. Also, we have UBER here and if you want to enjoy the city's breweries without worry or much expense, you can take UBER and leave your car at home. OR, leave it uptown, take UBER home and I will drive you to get the car in the morning.
notes: Enjoy your own beverages and snacks on the lovely screened in porch overlooking the garden.
transit: Yes. 1/3 mile walk to bus stop. It's best to have a car though. Park your car in my driveway - at the top near the front entrance. If your car is low, park in the lot across the street (free)
host_about:
From Boston, MA  I've lived in Asheville for 10 Years. I was a Marketing Executive for Digital Equipment and, later, HP. My main interest in Asheville has been the Carolina Mountain Club - which is a rather vigorous hiking group - and one of the oldest clubs in the country. We maintain sections of the AT and the Mountains To Sea Trail, as well as lead hikes across Western North Carolina. I'm also a volunteer with Asheville Humane Society and an animal lover. Another big interest is gardening. And, to a small degree, home decor and home maintenance.

I'm friendly and cheerful and like to "go the extra mile".
 
In my 20-month career as an Airbnb host, I've driven people to interesting  neighborhoods to give them a morning 90- minute tour and an overview of what kinds of houses and apartments are available. Or, I've driven my guests around just to just give them "the lay of the land" so they can explore what they like later in the day.  I've enjoyed keeping their dogs happy here at my house and fenced-in yard, while they attended an event. I've provided guests with information on fun things to do in Asheville - like hiking information, things to do downtown and in West Asheville, including the fun La Zoom bus tour of Asheville. I've driven guests to the top of a trail head along the Mountains To Sea Trail so they could leave their car at the other end for a good one-way hike. I've also printed them maps and made a detailed printed plan for visiting the Blue Ridge Parkway and its Visitor's Center and Folk Art center and helped them select the right hike for their time constraints and ability level. 

So, whether you are job hunting, house hunting, or here for fun and adventure, I can help you make the most of your visit.  BTW, I've done a lot of international and domestic travel - sometimes staying at hotels for weeks at a time. Some were good but many were rather creepy - especially their rugs and bedspreads. Your room here has hardwood floors and every piece of bed linen, including liners and mattress pad is washed before every visit.  Do I have a life motto? Hmmm. I guess it's Never Face The Facts. It has let me do a lot of "impossible" things.

neighborhood_overview: I live in a quiet, safe, up-and-coming residential neighborhood. It's not all the prettiest, but I feel very safe here. There are not loud parties or issues in the evenings (and, of course, my guests and I show our neighbors that same courtesy in return). My home is a brick rancher built in the 60s with nearly an acre of property - this neighborhood was built before they started really packing the houses one on top of the other. Extremely easy access to Patton Ave (straight to downtown) or to i-40 (which will get you anywhere else around Asheville). About 15-20 minutes from downtown depending on traffic. 25 minutes to the airport.
notes: I do run an interactive theatrical business out of my home/property, so that means people coming through with some regularity, and often into the later evenings. This is primarily in the downstairs space, which is soundproofed so I don't foresee any issues, but don't hesitate to speak up if anything isn't feeling good on your end and I'll see what kind of accommodation I can make. PLEASE NOTE: I own a small Boston Terrier and a Boxer/Pug mix, and occasionally have visits from or dogsit my mother's Schnoodle. They are all are very friendly dogs, but this listing is only appropriate for those who can tolerate small loving fur balls in common spaces (they will, of course, not have access to your room).
transit: Off-street parking is available for your one car at our home. The closest bus stop involves walking a busy road with no sidewalk, so we don't recommend it. You can drive a very short distance to another stop and then bus into downtown proper if your heart is set on public transit. Uber has many affordable options in town. Other local taxi services are also relatively reasonable. Those with bikes could use them, please again be aware of your own safety needs and comfort levels with roads that lack shoulders or biking lanes.  I'm happy to recommend my best tips for finding easy parking downtown during Drum Circle, festivals, etc.
host_about:
I relocated four years ago to Asheville from New York State, looking for a change of pace. Sure found it! I love this town and its quirky people. Bought my first house almost two years ago, and working hard in my downtime to fix it up - it's a passion-project, I love being crafty and learning how houses work! The guest rooms were first on the list, and you'll occasionally see a work-in-progress as you visit. Don't worry, I keep the dust to a minimum when guests are in the house!

From being a fast-paced-burned-out-exec I have turned into a part-time chinese health clinic manager, part-time horse drawn carriage tour guide, and student. All these activities keep me on-the-go, so we may or may not meet when I'm hosting unless the stars align! When we do, I am super-happy to chat over a cuppa, make recommendations, and learn more about the awesome guests who come through my home. Always feel welcome to text, even if we don't connect face-to-face :)

I love travel, meeting new people, and discovering new experiences!  I lived in Paris for a year in my early adulthood, have lived in many states and moved more than 30 times as an adult - as a former vagabond, I love hearing about your experiences.

When hosting, I want to be sure you're as comfortable (or even more so!) as you would have been at home. I keep the house as clean as possible for everyone's mutual comfort, and the shared bath is cleaned daily to be sure it's fresh when you're getting ready for your plans in town.

Looking forward to meeting you and hosting you in my home!

name: Fun Tent Cabin 5m Downtown
summary: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more
space: What is Glamping? Glamping is Glamorous camping! When you're glamping, there's no tent to pitch, no sleeping bag to unroll, no uncomfortable ground to sleep on and no headlamps!  ***To whom it may concern: We are operating a legal rental. Our property is covered under zoning as a campground. In August of 2015, Asheville has started to enforce the ban on short term rentals that are located within Asheville city limits that are in areas that are zoned residential- our properties are zoned "open use" just outside of Asheville city limits, in West Asheville.  Want to see more pictures? Follow us on INSTAGRAM @ashevilleglamping and check out pictures of our other sites and glamping adventures! Our gorgeous tent cabin, is located just 5 miles from downtown asheville and 2 miles to all of the popular breweries and restaurants in hip West Asheville. The tent cabin is cute and cozy with room for up to 4 guests. The tent has electricity and a small refrigerator to keep your drinks cold!!  Our te

neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood because it has a woodsy feel, but it's so close to downtown! Our 3 acre property is in a residential neighborhood located just two short miles from popular haywood road in west asheville which is lined with breweries and fantastic eateries! We provide all of our guests with a local guide with our favorite places to go in the area, including everything on haywood road!  We are just 5 miles from the heart of downtown Asheville.  ******The neighborhood is typical of rural appalachia- aka not wealthy ;-) You will see older model mobile homes along the road to our property. PLEASE  keep that in mind if you are looking to stay in the middle of nowhere or in a higher end part of the city. The last thing we want to have are guests who are picturing a high end resort with rolling acreage to come and be disappointed by the neighborhood surrounding our land. That's no fun for us! As you can read in our reviews (more reviews can be seen under our profile, we have more than
notes: Please plan to arrive before dusk. We provide directions needed to get to our exact location- the directions are easy to follow- but harder after dark.
transit: You will need a car- uber taxi is also available
host_about: We LOVE alternative dwellings and micro housing. We ourselves live in a  270 sq ft vintage camper with our three dogs. We have really been enjoying the opportunity to share our land with guests and have met so many amazing people through hosting on AIRBNB.   Together, Josh and I own two pieces of land in Asheville. One has just the yurt alone on it. Our other property is home to Bettie and also has several private campsites. It's nice to be able to offer people a range of options- from camping on the cheap to enjoying a luxurious stay in our yurt or restored vintage trailer! Joanna owns an environmentally conscious cleaning company in Asheville, Clean Green Asheville. Josh makes tactical gear like tourniquet holders and works out of his airstream shop. We are both very friendly and active people and we do all of the work on both properties ourselves :-)
