name: Large West Asheville Studio
summary: Studio apartment in a quiet neighborhood, just steps from the Hominy Creek Greenway (connects to the river arts district) and a walkable mile from the shops and restaurants on Haywood Road. Easy access to all highways and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
space: A spacious studio apartment with a full kitchen, conveniently located just minutes from West Asheville and downtown. A private walk out basement, the space is light, warm, and open with plenty of space to spread out and relax.
description: Studio apartment in a quiet neighborhood, just steps from the Hominy Creek Greenway (connects to the river arts district) and a walkable mile from the shops and restaurants on Haywood Road. Easy access to all highways and the Blue Ridge Parkway. A spacious studio apartment with a full kitchen, conveniently located just minutes from West Asheville and downtown. A private walk out basement, the space is light, warm, and open with plenty of space to spread out and relax. Full kitchen with gas stove/oven and full size fridge, two seating/lounging areas, off-street parking spot. Queen bed plus a futon. Window air conditioning unit (in summer months) keeps the apartment cool and dry. Multiple heating sources allow for temperature control throughout the apartment in colder months.  Basic cable with a DVR, DVD/VCR player I want you to feel this is your space while you're here, so I've set up self check-in and out. I'm nearby and available if you have any questions or concerns though! We're clo
neighborhood_overview: We're close to everything, yet the neighborhood feels a bit set a apart from the hustle of an urban area.  Shops, restaurants, and music are all available on Haywood Road, a two-three minute car ride or easy 15-20 minute walk away. A local tailgate market each Tuesday evening (spring-fall) offers lots of yummy locally made and grown products.  Popular destinations in downtown Asheville, the Biltmore Estate, and the Blue Ridge Parkway are close and easily accessible. (Under 12 minutes in a car.)  Our neighborhood is also right across the street from the West Asheville greenway, which is a nice walk along Hominy Creek, or a scenic bike ride to the river arts district. There are a few good swimming holes along the way too.
notes: Longer stays are welcome! Monthly rate is 40% off the nightly prices and the weekly rate is 20% off.
transit: Access to all local interstates (240, 40, and 26) is just two - three miles away.  There are also many taxis and a bus system. The bus has limited hours and routes, please investigate before planning on relying on this as a method of transportation!

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very family friendly.  There are often families walking with children and pets.  The West Asheville Park is a short 3 minute walk at the end of our street.   And, the bustling Haywood Rd is a convenient 15 minute walk through the park and down residential Vermont Ave.
notes: We will match the rate of any comparable property in the Asheville area, based on location and quality.   We look forward to hosting you at the Nauhaus.   You will love it here!
transit: There is public transit on Haywood Rd, and I believe Brevard Rd if needed.  We offer off street parking close to our home.  The Asheville Airport is only about a 15 minute drive from our place.  There is a taxi service, and car rentals are available at the airport and in town if needed.
host_about:
Meet Lizzy & JahSun
 
Lizzy and JahSun are coaches, guides, facilitators, students, world travelers, adventurers, and lovers of life.  They are proud new parents of beautiful Baby Sophia Sol, who was born on 10 August 2013!  They met while working on a project to build a sustainable community.  They are inspired by the unlimited potential of humanity made possible when we each bring forth our greatest gifts in service to the Whole.  Their lives are in service to helping people get their greatness, and supporting people in collaborative and co-creative endeavors.  Their mission is to remind us all of our Oneness with all things, and to awaken all of humanity to the power of our love and awareness to consciously co-create a world that works for everyone.  They see creating conscious partnerships as a fundamental steppingstone to creating a peaceful existence on the planet for all.  Their big dream is to create a conscious civilization, equipped with permaculture farms, holistic education and healthcare centers, renewable energy systems, conscious birthing and dying temples, and community gathering spaces.  A village to raise the next generation of humans with love and mindfulness, and act as a blueprint model which inspires the world.

Check out our website (URL HIDDEN) to learn more about who we are and what we are up to in the world! We look forward to hosting you and supporting you in having an amazing experience in Asheville!

name: Stylish garden studio in West AVL
summary: Our lower level, newly renovated studio apartment is walking distance to restaurants, coffee & cupcakes. It offers a shiny new bath, kitchenette, full size bed & open living room. Warm, inviting & private. 3 minutes to RiverArts District & Downtown.
space: Our lower level apartment is open, warm and inviting.  Completely private off-street parking leads to a tucked away deck with rocking chairs to enjoy the gardens or your morning coffee.  The interior space offers ten foot ceilings and an open studio floor plan.  There is a brand new kitchenette with coffee maker, induction cooktop, microwave, toaster, and mini fridge.  The bathroom is newly renovated with a soaking tub and ceramic tile throughout. There is plenty of comfortable hangout space by the wide screen TV, a cute eating area by the kitchen and a comfy full sized bed with down comforter and pillows. One side of the studio is below grade, and the space is filled with light and brightness.  The studio offers an outdoor, private, covered area to lock up bikes or store kayaks.
description: Our lower level, newly renovated studio apartment is walking distance to restaurants, coffee & cupcakes. It offers a shiny new bath, kitchenette, full size bed & open living room. Warm, inviting & private. 3 minutes to RiverArts District & Downtown.  Our lower level apartment is open, warm and inviting.  Completely private off-street parking leads to a tucked away deck with rocking chairs to enjoy the gardens or your morning coffee.  The interior space offers ten foot ceilings and an open studio floor plan.  There is a brand new kitchenette with coffee maker, induction cooktop, microwave, toaster, and mini fridge.  The bathroom is newly renovated with a soaking tub and ceramic tile throughout. There is plenty of comfortable hangout space by the wide screen TV, a cute eating area by the kitchen and a comfy full sized bed with down comforter and pillows. One side of the studio is below grade, and the space is filled with light and brightness.  The studio offers an outdoor, private, cover
neighborhood_overview: We are in the heart of East-West Asheville (it's a thing, really!) with great access to Haywood Road, Downtown Asheville, the River Arts District and Biltmore.  The neighborhood offers over 23 restaurants, great friendly bars &  funky fun coffee shops.  We are walking distance to the Sweet Slope with homemade donuts shops, cupcake emporiums and an ice cream tasting room.   Quiet and safe street just blocks from the action.
notes: Full sized bed is great for two adults, and we can provide a Pack N' Play for little ones.  We do have two children and follow a schedule (for them, not for you) of quiet before 9:00am and after 7:30pm.  You may hear us after 9 and before 7:30 as we do live above the space, and they haven't mastered zen silent playing as of yet.
transit: We are two blocks to the closest bus stop and walking distance to food, coffee and more.
host_about: A sense of home, even when we are away is just one of the best things about traveling for us.

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is the place to be for guests who want to experience true "local" Asheville.  Haywood Road, the main strip in West Asheville, is filled with local and farm-fresh eateries, coffee shops, breweries, bars, live music, and thrift and gift shops.  There's easy access to several grocery stores and the fantastic West Asheville Tailgate (Farmers) Market every Tuesday, abundant with fresh produce, food trucks, bakery goods, and locally made products.  There are many parks and green spaces nearby, as well as biking/running trails.  The apartment is just a couple miles from downtown Asheville, boasting great nightlife, live music, restaurants, museums, and shopping.  I am happy to recommend great local eats, bars, hiking and outdoor adventure opportunities, music venues, and the multitude of festivals that Asheville has to offer.
notes: West Asheville is the place to be for guests who want to experience true "local" Asheville.  The apartment is just a couple miles from downtown as well.  I am happy to recommend great local restaurants, bars, hiking and outdoor adventure opportunities, music venues, and the multitude of festivals that Asheville has to offer.
transit: Walking and biking to the heart of West Asheville couldn't be easier, however, the apartment is close to the expressway and public transportation options as well.
host_about:
I'm a young professional who loves to travel, cook, play music, and spend as much time outdoors as possible.  I have lived in Asheville, NC since 2003 and love seeing the area grow and expand in both culture and beauty. 

Respect for others is a top priority, as well as holding to my commitments.  I enjoy meeting and getting to know new people and exploring all aspects of the beautiful city I live in.

summary: Nestled in the heart of West Asheville, this craftsman style bungalow is just a block away from Haywood Road.  Clean and comfortable space with hardwood floors, front porch swing, wifi, and a private room with a plush queen bed and shared bath.

West Asheville is an amazing community
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is an amazing community of historic homes and eclectic businesses.  The icing on the cake is that my home is located a block away from many of the wonderful businesses, bars, and restaurants on Haywood Road.  Walkable is a term that best describes the location of my home.
transit: Parking options:  my home has a driveway that you can park in.  Most of the amenities of West Asheville is walk-able so you wont have to find parking in West Asheville.  If you would like to use public transportation the 'W2' bus line has a stop within 100 feet of my home.  Downtown is about 3 miles away from my home.

name: AWEsome Eco-Home - Walk to Haywood
summary: This modern eco-hOMe is the perfect place to enjoy your time in Asheville!  It is the first certified Hempcrete home in America!  We are walking distance to a Greenway and bustling Haywood Rd in W AVL, and a short drive to all the major attractions!.
space: Modern 2 Bedroom hOMe with private entrance in Eco-Fabulous Home called the Nauhaus ((website hidden)), which was designed as a model for urban sustainability.  It features passive solar energy, a living roof, and hemp-crete walls which make it naturally cool in the summer and warm in the winter, and keeps the space extra quiet.  Come experience the next level of 'Green Living' in one of America's first-ever HEMP Homes!!  Learn more about the design by Googling 'Nauhaus Institute'. The home has 2 bedrooms; one with a queen size bed and the other with a queen size organic futon bed, with decks off both bedrooms overlooking the backyard with fire pit, full of trees and wildlife such as birds, squirrels, rabbits, hawks, and occasional fox and deer.  A year round creek with hobbit style bridge, connects to nature trail, leading to the Hominy Creek Greenway.   The home also has a beautiful tiled bathroom, with bathtub and shower, an open design large living room boasting a cathedral ceiling

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very family friendly.  There are often families walking with children and pets.  The West Asheville Park is a short 3 minute walk at the end of our street.   And, the bustling Haywood Rd is a convenient 15 minute walk through the park and down residential Vermont Ave.
notes: We will match the rate of any comparable property in the Asheville area, based on location and quality.
transit: There is public transit on Haywood Rd, and I believe Brevard Rd if needed.  We offer off street parking close to our home.  The Asheville Airport is only about a 15 minute drive from our place.  There is a taxi service, and car rentals are available at the airport and in town if needed.
host_about:
Meet Lizzy & JahSun
 
Lizzy and JahSun are coaches, guides, facilitators, students, world travelers, adventurers, and lovers of life.  They are proud new parents of beautiful Baby Sophia Sol, who was born on 10 August 2013!  They met while working on a project to build a sustainable community.  They are inspired by the unlimited potential of humanity made possible when we each bring forth our greatest gifts in service to the Whole.  Their lives are in service to helping people get their greatness, and supporting people in collaborative and co-creative endeavors.  Their mission is to remind us all of our Oneness with all things, and to awaken all of humanity to the power of our love and awareness to consciously co-create a world that works for everyone.  They see creating conscious partnerships as a fundamental steppingstone to creating a peaceful existence on the planet for all.  Their big dream is to create a conscious civilization, equipped with permaculture farms, holistic education and healthcare centers, renewable energy systems, conscious birthing and dying temples, and community gathering spaces.  A village to raise the next generation of humans with love and mindfulness, and act as a blueprint model which inspires the world.

Check out our website (URL HIDDEN) to learn more about who we are and what we are up to in the world! We look forward to hosting you and supporting you in having an amazing experience in Asheville!

name: Privacy in the heart of W Asheville
summary: Visit but live like a native. 1/2 a block off Haywood Rd. Private entrance and driveway. Welcoming, clean walk out basement apt with comfort and perks.  Full kitchen, pantry, laundry room, bathroom (shower only).
space: This is a fully furnished walkout basement apartment. The bedrooms are connected; you will have to walk through one bedroom to get to the others. Two bedrooms are large, one with a king bed, one with a queen bed. The third bedroom is really a large walk in closet with a twin bed and some basic furniture in it. Perfect for a single guest or youth. Families love it.  Large, private driveway, parking for up to 8 cars, with outdoor seating. Large garden with colorful honey bee hives (safe distance away). Everything you need for a comfortable stay in W Asheville. Living room and queen bedroom have Roku. West Asheville is known for its tiny bathrooms; expect a small but clean bathroom with a shower, no tub. Nice, clean, fluffy towels provided.  A closet full of games, an umbrella if needed, washer, dryer and detergent, iron, hair dryer, shampoos, soaps, etc.  I have dogs on site, but they are fenced, adorable, and friendly.

name: Private Room West AVL Bungalow
summary: Private Room renter has access to the entire house.
space: You couldn't ask for a better location. Just blocks off the interstate for easy access. We are walking distance from great restaurants and music venues like The Admiral, Isis, Moth Light, Sunny Point Cafe, The Oysterhouse Brewing, Westville Pub, The Universal Joint, Standard Pizza, and Lucky Otter just to name a few.  Guest can also walk to our local Farmer's market and Ingles Supermarket.  Check out our guest guidebook for other restaurants, shops, and venues within walking distance or a short car ride away.   Whether you prefer relaxing on the front porch, staying indoors, or going out on the town, enjoying your trip to Asheville is made easy when you stay in our private room.  A small TV in the living room has netflix , and guest room is provided with an ihome for charging devices as well as listening to music. neighborhood_overview: *Please note that the street view is NOT accurate. Our West AVL neighborhood is an up and coming hip place to stay while visiting North Carolina. West AVL is centrally located with several of Asheville's most popular and well reviewed restaurants, shops, and galleries. Everything you need is right here in West Asheville coffee shops, grocery, pharmacy, bars/ pubs, music venues, hiking trails, and the French Broad River.  But if you do decide to venture out of West AVL, downtown is just minutes away as is the Blue Ridge Parkway, The Biltmore Estate, and RAD (River Arts District)
notes: *The Street view listed is NOT accurate. We now have a small vegetable and herb garden that we are allowing guest to pick from. Right now we have lots of Kale, tomatoes, squash, peppers, tomatillo, eggplant, cabbage, basil,  and other herbs. We usually leave a freshly picked bag out for guest use.
transit: Our location makes walking and biking an easy choice. Public transit is available, but limited. Taxis are always available. A taxi ride home from most anywhere in town is about $10.
host_about:
My partner, Kevin, and I are avid Airbnb host and guest.  We love traveling and sharing our home in Asheville, NC with other travelers.  Through our adventures we have discovered just how beautiful this tiny little planet is.  We do our best to keep it that way.  We use all natural and homemade cleaning supplies, recycle, up-cycle, compost, grow our own, and share :) 
We have two big old dogs who have traveled almost everywhere with us.  They are respectful, calm, and adorable.
We are also interested in home swapping.

neighborhood_overview: Pokeberry Loft is located in a business meets fun commercial neighborhood. A rich blend of both makes this location ideal for quite evenings but late night fun just around the corner. Gas stations, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, gift shops and so much more are all just seconds away, yet you are tucked into a comfortable, off the main strip private location.
notes: Although smoking is not allowed inside Pokeberry Loft  , guest are allowed to smoke on the covered porch directly outside of the living room  and master bedroom .
transit: Getting around Asheville is easy with Uber , the ART transit bus, local cab companies and bicycle rentals. We have provided a list of useful numbers in the guest directory to help you navigate your way around Asheville.
host_about:
Craig and Jeni own and operate at local green cleaning company called Pristine Clean. With ov(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) jobs served in the Asheville area this married couple certainly know a thing or two about Asheville!  
   They raise 6  children here and are all very fond of traveling, art and the outdoors.

name: Private Tiny house w/Loft near dntn
summary: This tiny house with loft is a minimalists private detached unit, set in nature, but very close to downtown Asheville and West Asheville. Enjoy the song birds, read a book on the deck, & a summer rain. Great for two! Hikers' delight!
space: This is a minimalist's dream loft, inspired by a trip to Scandinavia.  Less than a mile to downtown Asheville and West Asheville.  Features a skylight, large picture window, private wooded location with a deck, overlooking the public golf course.  Near to everything!  On the bus line, and in a quiet neighborhood that is home to hundreds of native birds and chipmunks. Nestled on a steep hill on one of the last known dirt dead end road in the city of Asheville.  Off-street parking available. Downtown has everything - restaurants, shops, coined "Paris of the South", and "Beer City", it has something interesting for everyone! Amenities include: a kitchenette and full bathroom, with an upright shower.  Kitchenette has a hot plate, small refrigerator, toaster oven, coffee maker, blender, and microwave.  Living room has a Bose mp3 player and an electric fireplace (that will kick out extra heat if you want it to).  There is also a thermostat to control the temp of the permanent installed heat

Enjoy the song birds, read a book on the deck, & a summer rain. Great for two! Hikers' delight! This is a minimalist's dream loft, inspired by a trip to Scandinavia.  Less than a mile to downtown Asheville and West Asheville.  Features a skylight, large picture window, private wooded location with a deck, overlooking the public golf course.  Near to everything!  On the bus line, and in a quiet neighborhood that is home to hundreds of native birds and chipmunks. Nestled on a steep hill on one of the last known dirt dead end road in the city of Asheville.  Off-street parking available. Downtown has everything - restaurants, shops, coined "Paris of the South", and "Beer City", it has something interesting for everyone! Amenities include: a kitchenette and full bathroom, with an upright shower.  Kitchenette has a hot plate, small refrigerator, toaster ov
neighborhood_overview: Off the beaten path, but almost right downtown.  One of the last dirt roads in Asheville, little known street, yet very close to all Asheville has to offer.  Legal Airbnb.  Not threatened to be shut down like many that are close to town.  You will not have your vacation canceled!   You can DEPEND on this rental!
notes: This has a very steep entry/exit and steep stairs leading to the loft.  This place is not for the meek/handicapped.  If you get winded walking up stairs, probably not the place for you.  ***Stilettos not recommended! Also, there is a train that comes by several times per day (sometimes at night), so if you need a sound night's sleep or if trains bother you, please bring earplugs. There is another Airbnb on the premises.
transit: Having a vehicle is recommended.  You could also use a bike, if you are adventurous.
host_about:
I am a naturalist/artist/minimalist.  I love working out, camping, backpacking, yoga, and creek walking.  I love kids, am a sun worshipper, and tree-hugger. 

I have traveled all over the States as well as Europe, Scandinavia, and some Mediterranean.   I travel light.  I was raised in a loving travel-thirsty family.

Hosting style:  Chances are I will not be here to greet you.  I work a professional full time job, that requires my 100% attention while I am there, and I am a mom when I am not at work, so I may not be able to answer your questions as soon as you'd like.  Please try to get all your questions answered prior to your trip, so that I may take the time they deserve to answer them.  Also, please refer to the "Guidebook" I have set up on Airbnb to let you know my favorite haunts, and must visits of Asheville.  

I am an early to bed early to rise person, so I won't answer texts after 9pm or before 7am.  Sorry, but I have found I need to draw the line ;)  

The neighborhood is a family neighborhood (kids next door) so please no loud interacting, no lude behavior, and no partys.  Reminder that no more than the registered guests are allowed to be on the property, unless with prior permission.  Monday-Friday its work and school week as usual, so no late nights outside that would disrupt the neighborhood.  Weekends are a bit more slack but still please no loud interacting outside that would disrupt anyone's pleasure, or sleep.

The 3 units on the property are either rented via Airbnb or to longer term tenants, so they will probably not be of assistance in answering any questions, and it would be important to not infringe on their privacy or their enjoyment of their vacations or visits.  Please keep to yourself and act with mature behavior.  

Otherwise, I am super excited to host you, and have you here at my house.  The garden I planted my self, and so I hope you have a chance to enjoy it.  I am very proud of my little shady spot.  It's a great safe place to relax and be close to town, too.

Safe travels!  

~Cat
Have a sunny day, regardless of the weather

summary: Antique bed recently replaced with non-squeaking basic bed, as you will see mentioned in reviews. No shared wall with my room. Riverview is an awesome location in West Ash, very convenient to downtown and River District and interstate.
space: My home is uniquely located close to West Asheville (walking distance), River Arts District (walking distance, though uphill on your way home!), and very close to downtown (about an $8 cab ride). There's a beautiful park in my neighborhood for walking, jogging, biking, or tubing/boating on the river! Convenient to the interstate as well.
description: Antique bed recently replaced with non-squeaking basic bed, as you will see mentioned in reviews. No shared wall with my room. Riverview is an awesome location in West Ash, very convenient to downtown and River District and interstate. My home is uniquely located close to West Asheville (walking distance), River Arts District (walking distance, though uphill on your way home!), and very close to downtown (about an $8 cab ride). There's a beautiful park in my neighborhood for walking, jogging, biking, or tubing/boating on the river! Convenient to the interstate as well. Bedroom and a private bath. Certainly can use the fridge, but cooking is off limits. Quite a lot if they want to, but most of my visitors have a busy schedule getting out and about in the heart of Asheville. Buses here are not great. But you can take the bus downtown...I'd just take a cab or uber. Window unit AC only. I don't have a microwave.

name: RainbowUnicorn & Paris of the South
summary: Sure, those fancy perfectly restored classic Bungalows are nice. But, if you're looking for the real-deal eclectic West Asheville vibe, this is the place for you! Walk to the hippest joints in town and return to a creative one-of-a-kind urban oasis.
space: In the nineteenth century, Asheville earned the nickname "Paris of the South" due to a reputation for fine shopping, dining, spas, and entertainment. Today, people travel to Asheville specifically to enjoy our vibrant eclectic "rainbow-unicorn" culture. This spacious room in our 1915 historic West Asheville home combines both! The space you are booking is the largest room in the house. The room includes a single bed, a double bed, and another single bed tucked away into a cozy nook. If traveling with infants or small children, there is plenty of additional room for a pack 'n play (which we can provide to save you the hassle).  The home itself is classic Bungalow meets family Farmhouse.

If traveling with infants or small children, there is plenty of additional room for a pack 'n play (which we can provide to save you the hassle).  The home itself is classic Bungalow meets family Farmhouse. In addition to the primary room and shared full bathroo
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood! The people in this neighborhood are all exceptional LGBTQ-friendly humans. And the location is a rare find (minutes away from the best places without the noise and traffic of living on a busy main road). In addition to plenty of food/drink and shopping options within walking distance, we can also walk to yoga studios, community acupuncture, and massage practitioners.
notes: Our ideal guest is a non-smoker who enjoys animals. We have an "exuberant greeter" mid-size rescue dog named Karma and an indoor/outdoor rescue cat named Bagel. Karma will occasionally bark and the cat enjoys hanging out on the roof outside the bedroom window. We have backyard chickens and bunnies as well as an indoor pet bearded dragon.
transit: A 10 minute walk from our front door takes you to dozens of eateries and pubs, two excellent music venues, coffee shops, a food truck park, bookstores, dozens of shops and small businesses, and a fantastic public park and river walk. There's a city bus stop less than a block away and downtown is  less than 5 minutes away by car. The River Arts District is about 3 minutes away by car and downtown Biltmore (Biltmore Estate) is about a 7 minute drive from our house. Local Uber and taxi services are also available. We are about 15 minutes from the Asheville Airport if renting a car.
host_about:
Former educator, adventurer, wellness advocate, business owner, mother, urban chicken farmer, foodie, wordsmith, artist, free-thinker. 

"Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all."--Helen Keller

name: Perfect West Asheville Location
summary: This funky bungalow is only a quick-minute stroll to the fun restaurants, bars, music venues, tea and coffee shops, and grocery stores of West Asheville. A 5 min. uber to d-town. New queen bed and blackout curtains await you. Bedroom Deadbolts.
space: The space has plenty of spots to chill out or get a little work done. There is the big back yard with seating for six under a beautiful tree, there is a nice screened in back porch ready for breakfast for two and there is a front porch ready to catch the late afternoon sun.  The living room offers cozy leather couches ready for a good reader and the dining room offers space for dinner for six or an extra-large desk and work space with a view of neighbors strolling by. The kitchen has a cozy indoor and private breakfast nook that is super cozy.  All in all, there is ample areas for privacy within.

You will have access to the front door, which enters into the living room. All the space minus my room and basement is shared.  There is plenty of spac
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lovely with lots of people strolling on evening walks. West Asheville is considered the hipper part of Asheville. It is safe with the busy street a half block away. After a day exploring, it is the perfect place to clean up before walking for nice dinner and show.  The River Arts District and downtown are about five minutes away.
notes: There will probably be a bike available for a quick ride to the store. I only ask that if you break it, you get it fixed. The repair shop is just across the street.  I also have some lawn chairs and a cooler to loan out if you ask.  I am generally in bed by 11 during the week and am respectful at all hours. I love all kinds of music tho, so happy to have it on if you feel like it. If I have it on and you would like to change it or turn it off just say so. I have my head phones. Ipod speakers are located behind tv. YOu are welcome to move them around the house. Help yourself to the bathroom products and linens that are out on the shelves. There are extra blankets and pillows in your bedroom closet. There are also hangers and an iron.
transit: The location is perfectly located near biking trails, river put ins, trails, downtown activities, the parkway, eateries and breweries. The ART bus stop is a minute and a half walk away.
host_about: I am massage therapist who after sailing around the world for 8 or so years, now resides half the year in beautiful Asheville, North Carolina and half the year in St. John, US Virgin Islands. I enjoy spending time with friends out and about and playing outside, whether it be mountain biking, hiking, tubing, scuba diving and snorkeling. I enjoy a good read and am pretty good at relaxing.  I have sailed the exotic South Pacific from St. Thomas to New Zealand, sailed the beautiful blue waters of the Caribbean, and down from Antibe, France, to Sicily and sailed a trans-Atlantic twice once to Spain and once to England. I have lived in several European countries, studied abroad several times and so speak several European languages, or at least I did at one time. I have enjoyed diving with sharks in Bora Bora and skydiving in New Zealand, where I lived twice. I have backpacked Central America and lived in Mumbai. I have been away from my home for about 7 years and have been dreaming about it all the while. I hope you will enjoy it as much as I do! Asheville is such a wonderful place to explore!!

name: River Arts District 'Green' Cottage
summary: This eco-friendly, 640 sq. ft. cottage serves as a cozy, clean retreat in the heart of the edgy River Arts District (RAD).  Downtown OR hip West Asheville are a short drive or 30 minute walk away and RAD is reachable within 5 to 10 min of walking .
space: Eco-tourism in the heart of Asheville's River Arts District!  This is a custom, newly built home decorated with a mix of industrial and antique pieces. The compact cottage has 'green' features like on demand water heating, highly efficient air and heating system, rain barrels, composting, gardens, and no VOC interior paints.  The space is small but comfortable, utilizing all square footage in order to reduce the house's carbon footprint.
description: This eco-friendly, 640 sq. ft. cottage serves as a cozy, clean retreat in the heart of the edgy River Arts District (RAD).  Downtown OR hip West Asheville are a short drive or 30 minute walk away and RAD is reachable within 5 to 10 min of walking .      Eco-tourism in the heart of Asheville's River Arts District!  This is a custom, newly built home decorated with a mix of industrial and antique pieces. The compact cottage has 'green' features like on demand water heating, highly efficient air and heating system, rain barrels, composting, gardens, and no VOC interior paints.  The space is small but comfortable, utilizing all square footage in order to reduce the house's carbon footprint.   I'm so happy to share my little home with you!  Please feel free to use any kitchen utensils, dishes and pots and pans.  I will provide good coffee, creamer and sugar for guests along with fresh towels and linens. Also guests will have access to the hammock, gardens and fire pit.  Guests will have
neighborhood_overview: The house resides in the heart of the River Arts District in Asheville.  The RAD lies directly between downtown and West Asheville,  about a mile to mile and a half to either one.  Staying here puts you within walking/biking distance of the diverse range of eating and drinking, sightseeing, and shopping in all of Asheville.  Without walking more than 5 or 10  minutes you can experience all the RAD has to offer: the best brewery in town (The Wedge), over 100 artist studios, restaurants, a juice/smoothie bar, music venue, salon, sake brewery, apple cider brewery, a walking labyrinth, historic houses and industrial buildings,  access to the French Broad River and free riverside concerts in the summer!  The walk into Downtown or West Asheville takes about 30 to 40 minutes depending on where you want to go.  New Belgium Brewery is under construction across the street and will be revamping the area by cleaning up the river and creating green ways, sidewalks, bike lanes, and on the street par
notes: Additional guests will be provided with a queen air mattress, linens and two pillows. All of this can be found in the guest closet upstairs.
transit: There is a bus stop 1/10th of a mile from the house although both downtown and West Asheville are within about one mile of the home.  You can usually squeeze two cars in the driveway, but it fits one car comfortably.  Extra cars can be parked across the street. The airport is 20 minute drive from the house and can be accessed by bus or taxi.  There is also a shuttle the runs in between downtown, River Arts District, and West Asheville called the Asheville Bar Hopper on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday nights for $5 a ride.
host_about: I am in love with Asheville and all it has to offer.  I've lived here almost 10 years now and can't get enough of the food, beer, yoga, outdoor activities (recently fell in love with tubing down the New French Broad River), and amazingly friendly people.  I am a social worker, yoga teacher, sustainability advocate, traveler, compassionate friend, daughter, and sister and seriously in love with my dog, Hank.

name: Asheville Ensuite Quiet and Close
summary: This quiet ensuite is spacious and light with a private entrance and bath. Close to town, but it feels like country here with this large off- street setting. Only 15 min. to Downtown, the Biltmore, restaurants in W Asheville and easy access to I40.
space: This large ensuite room with a private entrance and bath is located at the rear of the house accessible by a lighted walkway from the parking space. This space is very private and quiet with an outside porch and a place to sit in the sun if you wish. The comfortable Sleigh style queen size bed has a new mattress and organic cotton sheets with a down comforter (down alternative also available). There are many windows and lots of light in winter with shade in the summer. The room has a ceiling fan, window AC in summer, and 3 different options for space heaters so everyone can decide how warm they want the room (in addition it is connected to the central heating in the house). The Smart TV comes with Roku features and cable and there is a microwave, an electric kettle, coffee maker, water filter and a small refrigerator in the room as well. Wifi is also available.

The Smart TV comes with Roku features and cable and there is a micro
neighborhood_overview: We are in a quiet corner of West Asheville with easy access to the Biltmore and I40, downtown Asheville, the Asheville school, and the Blue Ridge Parkway. West Asheville has many amenities like good bakeries, coffee shops, and some of the best restaurants in town. Lots here are large. Walking in the neighborhood is pleasant and we are not far from a park along the French Broad River which has wonderful walking. Plus access to the Blue Ridge Parkway and our local outlet mall is close.
notes: There are always interesting things to do in Asheville any time of the year. When the main holidays are over, the town is still a great place to explore and the Biltmore is a local treasure all year long. Getting to events, downtown shops and restaurants here is still easy.  And people like looking through the many antique stores and shops all year long.
transit: You will need a car here, but the house is up off the road with lots of private parking space.
host_about: Hi! I grew up in Oregon and have lived in the SF Bay Area and in NM as well. I am currently semi retired from working in schools here in Asheville as a clinical mental health therapist with children and families. I love traveling and have managed to travel extensively.  My most recent adventures were in Australia and New Zealand.  I also like reading, cooking, entertaining, and experiencing nature in all forms and places. I like to connect with people when and wherever I travel, to experience the cultures up close, and have stayed in Airbnb in my travels. I like the personal touch that comes with Airbnb and decided to try this myself.  I love the diversity we have in the world and still have friends all over the world.

name: Private Hot Tub + Private Balcony!
summary: UpperMaster bedroom in a 4000 sq ft luxury home in West Asheville.  This room features stunning year round views, king bed, TV with netflix, high speed wireless internet, walking distance to groceries, and plenty of space to relax throughout the day. Private hot tub/bath, not shared.
space: While we go through the final touches of remodeling our large home in Asheville, you can stay with us and enjoy the beautiful year long mountain views minutes from everything Asheville has to offer.  Don't worry about noise... all of the loud work has been completed.
description: UpperMaster bedroom in a 4000 sq ft luxury home in West Asheville.  This room features stunning year round views, king bed, TV with netflix, high speed wireless internet, walking distance to groceries, and plenty of space to relax throughout the day. Private hot tub/bath, not shared. While we go through the final touches of remodeling our large home in Asheville, you can stay with us and enjoy the beautiful year long mountain views minutes from everything Asheville has to offer.  Don't worry about noise... all of the loud work has been completed. We have a giant kitchen that you're more than welcome to use to cook any meal.  Help yourself to coffee, and feel free to store your food in our refrigerator.  We're cool with you using our dishes, we just ask that you clean up when you're done. Please don't go downstairs.. the garage is full of tools and building materials. I'm always available over the phone. We live in a great neighborhood on the side of a mountain in Asheville, NC.  The ne
neighborhood_overview: We live in a great neighborhood on the side of a mountain in Asheville, NC.  The neighbors are awesome, and we love where we live.  This place is truly unique.
notes: Both homeowners work full time, and there are two dogs on the property.  Please make your stay as enjoyable as you want, but please be respectful bear in mind that we live here and we are opening up our home to you.   If there's anything you need, we're here to help.
transit: Uber is a very popular option if you plan on going out and not driving.  We are walking distance to a grocery store, but it's probably best if you make sure you have transportation.
host_about: Hello!   My name is Shawn.  I'm an Asheville native.  I enjoy motorcycles, web design, and real estate.  I know all of the best places to eat and all of the best breweries in town.  I'm a people person when I'm not running around town with my two dogs.

description: Very Clean,  Very Private Very Affordable And Very Zen You will be staying in peaceful, quiet, and private 1 Bedroom, 1 Bath Master Suite with a totally private entrance and hallway in the hub of West Asheville. The amenities include: Comfy Double Size Bed, Reading Chair w/Ottoman, Vintage Desk/Chair, various personal size sundries, Hair Dryer, First Aid Kit, Triple Set of Windows (facing west), Refrigerator, Microwave, Walk-In Closet, Shelves of Books and Magazines, Private Street Parking, Wi-Fi, Landscaped Private Back Yard with shaded seating, and Central Air. Our community of neighbors on Nevada Avenue are polite/caring individuals who live harmoniously and are respectful of each other.  Our home is located at the end of a dead end street so there is not a lot of vehicle traffic which makes it that much more peaceful. This is a great, safe neighborhood to walk and enjoy the vibes. Yet just two blocks is Heywood Road, where you will find the hub for all the various specialty stores,
notes: Our home is the second to last house (on the left hand side) at the end of a quiet, dead end street.  Please park in front of our house to both unload your belongings and for your overnight parking. Please let us know your estimated time of arrival if you can.
host_about:
Hello, my name is Pat Johnson and my partner's name is Betty Pomeroy and we moved from Friendsville, PA in November of 2011 to West Asheville, NC.  We came to visit and look around, but by the 6th day we fell in love with the diversity, the artist community, and of course the (URL HIDDEN) we purchased land that 6th day and set in motion to build us a new home in this new town.  And so we did, and we haven't looked back since. 
 
Surrounded by beautiful, charming Arts and Craft Bungalows, West Asheville offers diversity of people, food ,music, arts, schools, and service business, all in a stones throw! We encourage you to come to Asheville and stay a while and find yourself.  You won't regret it! 

We love it here and know that you will too. We look forward to meeting you.

name: Artsy comfy home of W. Asheville
summary: This fun bungalow is only a block away from the busy street of Haywood Rd in West Asheville.  Lovely back deck and garden await summer nights after brewery tours and Appalachian hiking.  Soak in the clawfoot tub by candlelight, you deserve it.
space: This home has two bedrooms with 2 full sized, clean and comfy beds that sleeps two each and a plush couch that could sleep one comfortably.  The kitchen is fully stocked with cooking equipment and fresh eggs,but keep in mind, you are right down the street from Biscuit Head and Sunny Point!  Enjoy an enchanting back deck, perfect to sip your coffee in the morning and  a glass of wine or local brew under the stars.   The home is only a block away from local restaurants, venues and dive bars and only 5 min from downtown Asheville, though everything you need is right around the corner!  On Tuesdays, stroll through the local farmers market, located only a block away!

neighborhood_overview: If you want a true local experience, this is it!  This neighborhood is AWESOME.  Stroll around and check out the gardens and small farms our little street has to offer.  You are only a block away from Haywood Road that hosts an array of local businesses.  Most nights you may find live music at The Mothlight and The Isis and can indulge in handmade icecream at The Hop.  Everything in W. Asheville is within walking distance.  There is a little organic grocery store as well as an Ingles and a quirky movie rental store (don't see those often!)
transit: There is a bus stop right down the street and we have Uber and taxi services.
host_about: I am a sparkler that lives off of excitement, entertainment and the arts.  I love to go on adventures and create from my imagination.  I love to travel and meet people, and can never turn down a new experience.  I am clean and respectful, love to cook and sing (often at the same time).  I offer my apartment as a beautiful place to stay in a historic art filled home in West Asheville, just a block away from Haywood Road!

Easily access all major freeways just under 2 miles away.  Guests will have their own private entrance to their space.   If I'm home, I'm happy to help you any way I can.  I've lived in this home for 16 years now.  This is a very convenient area to stay in.  You can be downtown in 5-7 minutes.  The farmer's market is just over the hill about 3 miles away.  Access to all major Asheville expressways are within 2 miles. Access to all major Asheville expressways are within 2 miles. We provide two bikes with locks for your use at your own risk.

host_about: Sandusky was born into a blue collar working family.  He is the son of two retired mail carriers and grew up in Lucerne Park in West Asheville.  He currently resides only a few miles from his childhood home.  Sandusky has not always been considered an artist.  He has been a tradesman for the majority of his life.  He currently owns and operates a heating and air conditioning company and a road construction business.  Sandusky is a former salsa instructor and performer, dancing at the World Salsa congress in Los Angelos in 2005.

summary: Recently renovated with a brand new kitchen and master suite, ours is a fantastic home away from home for your large group of family and friends.  With a great location in hip West Asheville, you are a short drive to all that Asheville has to offer.
space: Spacious home with 6 bedrooms and room for 12.  Extras include trampoline, outdoor playset, gas grill, large backyard, 2 record players with large record collection. To note: 2 of the bedrooms downstairs do not have a door that separates them, they are separate but just have a wall that divides most of the space.

name: Cozy Cabin near downtown AVL
summary: * New listing * Petite Bungalow in a wooded setting. Less than a mile to downtown Asheville & West Asheville. A well-loved artist's home. Quiet neighborhood. Home to 100's of birds and chipmunks. Situated on the back nine of the public golf course.
space: There are two good-sized bedrooms, one has a full sized high quality futon, and will sleep 2 comfortably, and a standard twin.  The other bedroom had a standard queen bed.  Extra people beyond 5, would need to bring air-mattresses/sleeping bags etc.  Full kitchen, fully stocked with stove, oven, microwave, toaster, blender, hot pot, pots/pans, plates, silverware, etc. House is about 1 mile to downtown Asheville.  About 1/2 mile to downtown West Asheville, and 1 mile to River Arts District.  Very nice location in a quiet neighborhood. Some of the ceilings are under 7 feet, anyone over 6'2" may not feel entirely comfy here.

There is a hammock area on the side of the home with a firepit, and a firepit area, that you will share with other Airbnb
neighborhood_overview: Quiet dead end dirt road, quiet neighborhood, in a residential area.  There is a business next door (off the main road, but it backs up to the side of my property).  There is also an active railway that comes by, sometimes at night.  If you cannot sleep around a train, this isn't the place for you.
notes: There is another AirBnb space in the front and back of the property so you are expected to share the parking area with them, so park efficiently.
transit: A car is recommended, but a few blocks walk can get you to the bus station, or there is Uber cab at about $10 into town.
host_about:
I am a naturalist/artist/minimalist.  I love working out, camping, backpacking, yoga, and creek walking.  I love kids, am a sun worshipper, and tree-hugger. 

I have traveled all over the States as well as Europe, Scandinavia, and some Mediterranean.   I travel light.  I was raised in a loving travel-thirsty family.

Hosting style:  Chances are I will not be here to greet you.  I work a professional full time job, that requires my 100% attention while I am there, and I am a mom when I am not at work, so I may not be able to answer your questions as soon as you'd like.  Please try to get all your questions answered prior to your trip, so that I may take the time they deserve to answer them.  Also, please refer to the "Guidebook" I have set up on Airbnb to let you know my favorite haunts, and must visits of Asheville.  

I am an early to bed early to rise person, so I won't answer texts after 9pm or before 7am.  Sorry, but I have found I need to draw the line ;)  

The neighborhood is a family neighborhood (kids next door) so please no loud interacting, no lude behavior, and no partys.  Reminder that no more than the registered guests are allowed to be on the property, unless with prior permission.  Monday-Friday its work and school week as usual, so no late nights outside that would disrupt the neighborhood.  Weekends are a bit more slack but still please no loud interacting outside that would disrupt anyone's pleasure, or sleep.

The 3 units on the property are either rented via Airbnb or to longer term tenants, so they will probably not be of assistance in answering any questions, and it would be important to not infringe on their privacy or their enjoyment of their vacations or visits.  Please keep to yourself and act with mature behavior.  

Otherwise, I am super excited to host you, and have you here at my house.  The garden I planted my self, and so I hope you have a chance to enjoy it.  I am very proud of my little shady spot.  It's a great safe place to relax and be close to town, too.

Safe travels!  

~Cat
Have a sunny day, regardless of the weather

name: Comfy/quiet West Asheville getaway
summary: Spacious, comfortable one-bedroom apartment on the lower/basement level of a two-story home. Though it's basement level, there's plenty of natural light through windows that face a wooded area. Short walk from "downtown" West Asheville.
space: LGBTQ friendly.  Our downstairs apartment has its own private entrance and a nice view of the woods out back.  The apartment includes - A private bedroom with full-sized bed, closet - Bathroom with tub and shower - Kitchenette (two-burner stove, sink, and mini-fridge)  - Small table and chairs for dining/coffee/work - Couch and comfy chair in the living/yoga room.  We can blow up a full-sized aerobed if you have more than two people in your party, but ask for an additional $15/person for more than two guests.  We have wifi but no cable or television.  If you're staying two or more nights, you'll get a gift card for Sunny Point. All guests will have coffee, tea, creamer, and a mini-fridge full of local beer and wine available on the honor system.
description: Spacious, comfortable one-bedroom apartment on the lower/basement level of a two-story home. Though it's basement level, there's plenty of natural light through windows that face a wooded area. Short walk from "downtown" West Asheville. LGBTQ friendly.  Our downstairs apartment has its own private entrance and a nice view of the woods out back.  The apartment includes - A private bedroom with full-sized bed, closet - Bathroom with tub and shower - Kitchenette (two-burner stove, sink, and mini-fridge)  - Small table and chairs for dining/coffee/work - Couch and comfy chair in the living/yoga room.  We can blow up a full-sized aerobed if you have more than two people in your party, but ask for an additional $15/person for more than two guests.  We have wifi but no cable or television.  If you're staying two or more nights, you'll get a gift card for Sunny Point. All guests will have coffee, tea, creamer, and a mini-fridge full of local beer and wine available on the honor system.  Privat
neighborhood_overview: You'll be in the heart of West Asheville - a neighborhood of artists, musicians, young families, and all the color for which Asheville is beloved.  We're within a short walk of: - West Asheville Yoga Studio - Local pubs (Universal Joint, Westville Pub, Altamont Brewery, WALK, Isis) - Very, very good coffee (Odd's Cafe, Waking Life) - Darn good food (West End Bakery, Nona Mia/Ritrovo, Sunny Point).  In addition to everything within a 1.5-mile walking radius, we're a quick drive from downtown Asheville, the Biltmore Estate, and the French Broad River at Carrier Park (where you can put your kayak or tubes in and float all day).
notes: We live in a co-housing community and are very close with our neighbors. We ask that folks not wander around the community, out of respect for our neighbors. Guided tours are available. Heat is radiant floor heat, so cannot be quickly adjusted. We usually keep it around 72 during the winter. If you'd like it warmer or cooler, please let us know ahead of time so we can set it with enough time for the space to adjust.
transit: You'll find ample available street parking in the neighborhood. Buses are available within a 5-min. walk.
host_about:
I'm a writer and magazine editor, and I live in a co-housing community in West Asheville. I moved here from Seattle, WA, in 2010 to write a book about a woman who used folk music to empower communities toward social justice back in the 1930s-50s. I cover folk/roots/Americana music and am happy to talk about it ad nauseam. My wife is a family doctor and our two-year-old daughter is big into dogs, firetrucks, and books. We're all  into good local food, acoustic music, exercise, and traveling. Most of our travel time these days is domestic, visiting friends and family all over the country. But, we also know the value of a good do-nothing beach vacation.

Five things I can't live without (aside from food, water, etc): family, friends, time to relax, time to be creative, travel/exploration.

name: West Asheville Modern Studio
summary: Come visit beautiful Asheville, North Carolina and stay in a quiet, modern studio setting in vibrant West Asheville.
space: This space is a beautifully appointed modern studio apartment with a queen size murphy bed.  It's the perfect base for exploring Asheville.  Split system heat & AC keeps the space comfortable in all seasons.  There is an efficiency kitchen area with a mini fridge & freezer, coffee maker, microwave, and hot plate.  There is a tiled shower with a pebble floor.  The space faces the forest, and is quiet, peaceful and private.  There is ample street parking a few steps from the front door.

The immediate neighborhood is quiet.  Much walking, dog walking, stroller pushing, jogging, etc occur on the rolling hills.  Quaint and quirky homes. Friendly, but not nosy, neighbors.  Popular Tuesday tailgate market is 5 min walk away.  Grocery store 6 min walk away.  Organic garden on adjacent lot.  Some grazing possible.  See Linda.      Enjoy nearby parks, the NC Arboretum,  the Botanical Garden, venues on Riverside Drive on the French Broad River and downtown Asheville,  the Biltmore House, the Grove Park Inn,  the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Appalachian Trail, Mt Pisgah and Mt Mitchell.
notes: If you don't see one at the house, pick up a  Mountain Express - our local independent news rag.  It comes out every Wednesday.  It is free and can be picked up at several purple boxes in the area.  It provides excellent local news and activities and the Wed NY Times Crossword Puzzle.
transit: 5 min walk to ART stop - Asheville Rapid Transit - the local bus system.  Two parking spaces on site.  The airport is 12 mi away.  Check with me to see if I can pick up/drop off.  Taxi is possible.  A rental car is highly recommended if you plan to visit quaint downtown Asheville (4/5 mi  away),  area parks and the French Broad River for hiking, canoeing, biking, and to take in the nearby Blue Ridge Parkway, Appalachian Trail, and NC Arboretum.
host_about: I'm a retired teacher, mother, and grandmother.  I enjoy Contra Dancing and will recommend it to my guests.  I have traveled internationally to Greece, Spain, and Germany. I enjoy the company of others, especially if there is a lot of humor involved.
street: Vance Cres Exd, Asheville, NC 28806, United States

name: VACATION LIKE A LOCAL! Ideal spot!!
summary: My super cute updated bungalow is close to literally just about everything! Convenience, charm and style- all in the heart of popular West Asheville! Great neighborhood, fully fenced yard, many amenities, dogs considered, must be kitty friendly!
space: My super cute updated bungalow is close to literally just about everything! Convenience, charm and style- all in the heart of popular West Asheville! Great neighborhood, fully fenced yard, many amenities, dogs considered, must be kitty friendly! The first thing you should know about my house is that you will have a tiny four-legged host- my super sweet kitty!  She is indoors only and can be cared for easily. She is super low maintenence and really a sweetie! My house is located in popular East West Asheville, across the French Broad River from downtown Asheville and the River Arts District (RAD).    Haywood Road, the main hot-spot of West Asheville is an intersecting street and a short walk from my house. You can walk to the highly-rated Admiral restaurant and bar (make your reservation well in advance) in five minutes and the well-loved Sunny Point Cafe in just a few minutes more. You can even get your BBQ at the highly notable 12 Bones as featured on The Good Morning America show- it

neighborhood_overview: My home is located in East-West Asheville- intersecting with ever growing and popular Haywood Road. If you want music- it's there. If you want local, organic food- it's there. If you want a co-op and juice bar- it's there. If you want local art or shopping- it's there. You want local beer at a hot-spot near-by brewery- it's there. You want drop in yoga- it's there....ALL within walking distance. You may even treat yourself to a hot-stone massage, (with appointment) from my neighbor right across the street... or  just lounge in the hammock right out the back door! Home is about a 5-10 minute drive to UNCA and the Biltmore Equestrian Center. The River Arts District and the heart of downtown Asheville are super close as well.  Just a few minutes to both  interstates 240 and 26 for easy access to Biltmore House and/ or Blue Ridge Parkway, Grove Park Inn, notable golf courses, Mission Hospitals, etc.  The French Broad river is just around the bend and can provide a good float trip for the d
notes: We've had several guests with seamless interactions and great reviews!
transit: Interstates 240 and 26 are within minutes for easy access. Public transit is available from Haywood Road, walking and biking are good options for just about anywhere you'd want to be in town. To get in the woods- you'll need your car!
host_about:
I love living in Asheville!!! 
I am a generous, health conscious, independent gal who loves the outdoors- rivers, oceans and mountains! Asheville has been my home for 15 years- on and off- and I am 100% in love with my community here. I adore traveling yet equally love home and have worked hard to make mine comfortable for others- including you!!!

name: Great pvt apt in West AVL
summary: Gorgeous pvt apartment in friendly West AVL,  walk/bike to restaurants,  2-miles to downtown. Apt is large with living area, queen bed, kitchenette (no stove) and full bath. Separate entry. Private. Porches available to guests.
space: Beautifully appointed basement apt with windows - queen bedroom/living room with lg screen TV  - cable, wifi, kitchen seating area with sink, fridge, coffeemaker, microwave & toaster oven, no stove, full bathroom.
description: Gorgeous pvt apartment in friendly West AVL,  walk/bike to restaurants,  2-miles to downtown. Apt is large with living area, queen bed, kitchenette (no stove) and full bath. Separate entry. Private. Porches available to guests. Beautifully appointed basement apt with windows - queen bedroom/living room with lg screen TV  - cable, wifi, kitchen seating area with sink, fridge, coffeemaker, microwave & toaster oven, no stove, full bathroom. The apt is all yours for your visit. In addition, feel free to relax on upstairs front porch chairs and glider, or take your morning coffee around back to the deck. Private entrance, parking for your one car and driveway is steep. Garage space available for your bikes, coolers, etc. I love to meet my guests and try to be here for each guest's arrival. I live upstairs and am available if needed - text or call me, or come up and knock! I will help with local calendars, maps, directions, suggestions for great meals, walks, events, places to visit, etc. Gu
neighborhood_overview: This is a great, friendly, residential neighborhood, a hidden gem just above the French Broad River and New Belgium Brewery in "east West Asheville" as we're known - feels like the country but you're in the city! This is a residential neighborhood, so if rowdy partying into the late night is your plan, you might want to find another spot. Near grocery (1 mi.), coffee shops, pharmacy, 2nd Gear, outdoor activity center, pubs, top restaurants - walk to The Admiral, White Duck Taco, King Daddy, and The W.A.L.K. - all about .4mi); Isis Music Hall & Kitchen 763, Sunny Point Cafe, 9 Mile West, the U-Joint, West End Bakery, Buffalo Nickel, Pour, (all 1-1.3 mi),  ). Near music venues - The Grey Eagle, Mothlight, Isis Music Hall. Wlak to the River Arts District and The Wedge Brewery. Enjoy walking around our neighborhood - our neighbors are the best!
notes: P.S. - the street view given by airbnb is NOT my street view - they missed it by a bit.
transit: Walk, ride bikes, drive, or take the public bus downtown, to Biltmore Village, (even to the new AVL Outlets) or .... Taxis and Uber available after a night of pub-hopping, a concert at The Orange Peel, or music at 5 Walnut Wine Bar.
host_about:
Retired RN/educator, writer, love to read and walk, love good local food and beer, wine and love the art, music and mountains of WNC. 
As the second of eleven - yep, 11 - siblings, my mom taught us early how to keep our home neat and clean, a real necessity with so many under one roof. I still prize this quality in my home, and in my rental apt. 
Also, having grown up with so many, I love meeting people, having more in my house, and sharing resources and info with and about the community here in Asheville. So I welcome you in the spirit of sharing and peace. I've been told I'm a great tour guide - ask me about places and things to do in AVL and I'll try to be very helpful.

name: West Asheville - Deck in the trees
summary: Featuring a large second story back deck surrounded by hemlock trees, this home is a perfect place to enjoy a quiet evening after your adventure. We are 5 miles (10-15 min drive) from downtown Asheville; and just blocks away from West Asheville.
space: Watch the birds from the comfy sofa, or relax out on the deck after your day of exploring Asheville. Children can play safely in the fenced-in front yard, and you can swing to your heart's content in the hammock between the hemlocks. This is a very quiet, family friendly home, yet only 5 miles from the center of downtown Asheville, and just blocks away from the heart of West Asheville. Note on availability - I list Fri/Sat as night open on the calendar, but please contact me if you want to come earlier or stay later. I can be flexible during the week. Amenities: Fully equipped kitchen with toaster & Microwave oven Dishwasher Gas grill on the deck Tub with shower Washer/dryer in basement Wireless internet Fireplace  Second story deck/Covered front porch Hammock Covered Carport One Queen Bed/One Full Bed/One Full FUTON sofa bed Please note: THERE IS NOT A TELEVISTION IN THIS HOUSE OUTSIDE quiet hours after 10 pm.  (I have neighbors with small children) No smoking anywhere on the property

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is very friendly. Folks are always out walking or visiting with neighbors. You can walk across the street and check out the school playground, or walk down the block to get to the public library, coffee houses, grocery stores, and many of west Asheville's restaurants and pubs.  We are only 4 miles from the center of downtown Asheville, and it takes about 8 minutes to drive to town. We are a few blocks away from the Malvern Hills park where there are tennis courts and walking paths.
notes: We are also close to the Hominy Creek Park trail where you can walk, run, ride bikes, and eventually connect with Carrier Park along the French Broad River. Here is a guide about some highlights for the weekend Saturdays ONLY Winter hours 10am - noon thirty- visit the north Asheville tailgate market at the Grace Covenant Church on Merrimon Ave for local food and craft vendors. You can get coffee there, pick up some pastries and or bread from the Farm and Sparrow tent, buy some goat cheese from Spinning Spider or Three Graces Dairy, Get Roots and Branches crackers, pick up some rasbperry preserves from Imladris Farms, local chocolate also for sale. This market is a vibrant market - often with live music and craft vendors in addition to all local foods One day Downtown Asheville: walk around Lexington Avenue, Church Street, Pack Square, City County Plaza visit the Basilica of Saint Lawrence  (URL HIDDEN) eat at Salsas (Latin) or Mela (Indian) or Early Girl (American) Champa (Asian) La Zo
transit: A city bus stop is located one block from the house. The neighborhood has many sidewalks that make getting around safe and easy. Parking on site is off street and one space is completely covered, a second space is partially covered.
host_about: I am a musician and a nurse educator, and I have lived in Asheville for almost twenty years. I can usually be found playing music, hiking, cooking, gardening, or working with the Alpine dairy goats that my boyfriend and I keep. We are currently making cheese and buttermilk, and plan to cook up some soap this fall with the goat milk. I love traveling and hosting travelers, and I particularly enjoy connecting with folks wherever I go.

name: Location, Location-West Asheville
summary: Our 1925 bungalow has been updated over the years but still retains an artsy feel. We offer a  private "garden" room and bathroom that opens to a large vegetable, herb and flower garden. A small deck offers a quiet place to enjoy the outdoors.
space: With painted wood floors and folk art on the wall, this unique space is a "walk in basement" with private entrance that brightens with natural light from full size windows. The private entrance allows you to come & go as you please.  Our accommodations easily accommodates up to 2 people, very comfortably.   A queen size pillow top mattress provides for a pleasant night's sleep.  For the winter months the entire basement area is heated with a gas monitor heater.  In the room itself has a portable electric heater to keep in nice & toasty warm. We love music, people, and relaxing on the weekends when we can. Our family is busy with many activities and a large garden out back. If peace and quiet is your priority, please be aware that 3 people live in this house and we are very active!  Our high-school age son lives (his bedroom is in the upstairs main living area) with us part time.  His drum room is in the basement where your room is located.  When he is home, he doesn't drum from 9pm - 1

neighborhood_overview: Two blocks from our house, you can find coffee shops, restaurants, pubs, and bakeries. This is an eclectic neighborhood of many restored bungalows and new construction as well.  We are less than 8 minutes from the Hominy Creek access to the French Broad River. This is the common put-in for tubing through Asheville, many take out at the Bywater. Also, a large park with paved trails and sports amenities is nearby.  We are 3-4 miles from downtown Asheville, where you can find even more amenities. Whether you hope to spend spend time on the river, want a gourmet foodie weekend, or hope to take in some Asheville culture, you will find yourself positioned to easily get around.
notes: We have 2 bicycles there your welcome to borrow for commuting around Asheville.
transit: Shops, Coffee Shops, Restaurants & Nightlife is West Asheville all within walking distance. River Arts District is less that 3 miles away. Downtown Asheville is less than 4 miles away. If necessary, Bus Stop is 2 blocks Away.
host_about:
Both my wife & I enjoy a healthy & active lifestyle.    We enjoy running, a great glass of wine, good coffee, warm weather & more importantly Asheville.     We have lived everywhere from Jackson MS (my wife) to Jackson WY (me), but are now happy to call Asheville our permanent home. Often times, we enjoy being tourists in our own home town.  I'm a student of Asheville's history & enjoy sharing that information for others.

Other hobbies of mine include mountain biking & grilling frequently.

name: Comfy house 10 minutes to downtown.
summary: Only 10 minutes to downtown Asheville and Haywood road in West Asheville. Bring your dogs and relax on 1.3 acres of secluded property.  Make s'mores by the fire pit and snuggle up to watch the stars!
space: The first floor has large windows, stained concrete floor, a full size memory foam mattress pull out couch, 50" 4k HDTV with HULU, Netflix, etc. and a reclaimed wood coffee table. A laundry room complete with stacked steam washer and dryer. The full bathroom boasts a large tiled shower with separate temperature controls for the 16" rain shower head and the wall mounted with detachable wand. In the colder months guests can enjoy the heated tiled floor. The tankless, on demand hot water heater guarantees no one will have to take a cold shower. The kitchen is the focal point and comes complete with brand new stainless steel appliances, a 36" farm sink, and a 5 burner gas stove. Seating is a kitchen island so you can watch the magic happen! The beautiful reclaimed barnwood stairs takes you to the second floor where you will find the 2 bedrooms. Each bedroom is furnished with queen sized bed and has its own high efficiency  heat/ac. neighborhood_overview: We share a driveway with a stone church. There is only one house visible from the front porch and you can barely catch a glimpse of the road (which is not a major road).
notes: Silly little thing, our water has high iron content. We have a filter and a softener, its really not a bother to you as a guest but it does make keeping a white bathroom VERY difficult. With that being said we are extremely diligent in regards to cleaning our white bathroom however there is always a slight staining that cannot be removed. Much to our dismay.
transit: There is public transportation but it is not particularly accessible. Uber is available and super reliable.
host_about: Jennifer and I just finished building our Asheville house with our own 4 hands. Well, it's not really done, it never is. We are constantly adding and improving. Jennifer is a massage therapist and Matthew is a contractor. We love Asheville and everything it has to offer and we are excited to be hosts and share the city we love with others.

name: Inn on Westwood - Atkinson Suite
summary: Gorgeous 1860s historic home in West Asheville. Walking distance to restaurants, shops, and the River Arts District. Two 2BR 1BA private apartments or rent whole home. Large bedrooms, full-size beds, mountain views, and room for entertaining.
space: This gorgeous designated historic home, built in the 1860's, is a slice of Asheville history.  Full of special touches you won't find anywhere else, it features 20ft. ceilings, arched double-doors and beautiful crown molding.  Rooms are spacious and well lit, with windows just as grand as the space itself!  Enjoy the enclosed sun porch with your morning coffee or an evening cocktail. Soak up some sun (or shade) on any of the open air porches.  The home is fully stocked for your vacation needs with complimentary tea and coffee, fruits, chocolate, granola bars and a chef's kitchen ready for you to use! A continental breakfast of fresh, local ingredients is also included.  Gorgeous tile-work lines the washrooms and we offer complimentary Aveda bath products.  You'll be within miles from Downtown Asheville, and an even closer walk to hip West Asheville, with easy access to the interstate and local attractions. name: Firefly Hidden Haven with Archery!
summary: West Asheville at its most adventurous! Private residence Farmhouse with Archery ! Our hidden quiet haven is bountiful with verdant trees, garden and a grassy field two miles from down town.  Relaxed, Easygoing, fascinating Fun.  Private entrance.
space: This is a newly renovated air bnb room!   Firefly Haven is a private old farmhouse residence with Archery lessons by appointment only.  The "Artemis Room" has a new comfortable queen sized wooden bed, full closet, dresser, desk and view of the woods.  It is off the library and its private entrance goes right onto the deck overlooking a wooded hillside.  this is a bird sanctuary and full of lovely bird sounds...  You would never know you are so close to down town. There is lots of music, great restaurants, festivals, yoga, art, breweries and fun just down the road from our land. Get a true taste of West Asheville here.  Pass through a mixed new neighborhood to our very private hidden haven bountiful with quiet, verdant trees and a grassy field only two miles to down town and even closer to the River Arts District. neighborhood_overview: We are very close to downtown in a hidden little forrest on the outskirts of the city.  We live in a very mixed neighborhood,  Artists, Hipsters, Therapists, Hippies, Red Necks, Farmers, old people, young people. A mixed variety of ethnicity.  This is a safe neighborhood and we live at the end of a private lane.
notes: Please enter house by door on driveway.  Your host is a professional Archery instructor and gives lessons both public and private here on the property.  Our house guests can join in the scheduled public shoots for free but they need to pay for a private lesson.  $35 for the first person and $20 per person after that.  Lessons include a warmup,  lesson, all equipment and a 90 minute shoot.  (URL HIDDEN)
transit: There is a bus line a block away.  We are less than ten minutes from the center of downtown by car and four minutes from the River Arts District.  You can drive the back way to the city and avoid the  main road with all of its traffic completely.
host_about: I have lived all over the world and have found myself in Asheville for the past 8 years.  This place is magic! I am a holistic heath practitioner with over 20 years experience in healing arts.  I practice transpersonal hypnosis, energy medicine and cranio sacral therapy as well as somato emotional release.  I have an office 2 miles from my home.  I am also a professional archery instructor and owner of Artemis Archery Asheville.  Essentially I am an easy going host with a wealth of healing and Asheville knowledge.  I dance, enjoy archery, hiking and laughing.

summary: Location Location Location!  This house is in the heart of West Asheville, walkable to some of the hottest spots around.  And Joey the cat is the big bonus!
space: 2 bedroom house in the heart of West Asheville.  Easy walk to the Westville Pub, Sunny Point Cafe, Oyster House, West End Bakery, the new Biscuit Head, the beautiful Isis, The Yoga Studio, and much more, including grocery, music, and clothing stores.  1 mile from The Walk and the award-winning Admiral restaurant.  Less than 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville, and super convenient to the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Biltmore Estate, and all the sights and special stuff the Western North Carolina mountains have for you to enjoy.   The house is 1000 sq feet of coziness, with a large living area which opens to a fully equipped kitchen which opens to a 16x16 foot screened porch which opens to a big, lush, private back yard.  There are two bedrooms, one with a queen and one with a double bed, and a cute bathroom. We have a cat named Joey who is all sweetness and snuggles who stays inside.  He comes with the house and requires very little maintenance. The public bus runs right by our house, so i

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville, so the saying goes, is a little bit in love with itself.  It really has it all, and this house is walkable to all the hot spots.  Sweet, safe residential neighborhoods surround the restaurant/bar district with grocery stores, shops, and everything in between.
notes: There is space for 2 cars to park, off-street parking and easy access.
transit: Public bus runs right by our house, and this is a bike-friendly town too. If you enjoy walking, you may do so to many eateries and bars in the neighborhood, or just stroll around - it's a safe and friendly area!
host_about: My daughter Rosa and I share our West Asheville home with our indoor cat, Joey and our sweet dog, Fina.  We have been here for almost 10 years now.  We love to travel, camp, hike, and otherwise enjoy all that Western North Carolina offers.  I lived in Europe for two years and have subsequently traveled extensively, mostly in Central and South America.  I am a Spanish teacher and musician and love to work with children and adults.  I practice yoga, love to read, dance, eat out, and socialize, and feel fortunate to have wound up in this great city of Asheville with my fascinating and fabulous daughter.

space: While we go through the final touches of remodeling our large home in Asheville, you can stay with us and enjoy the beautiful year long mountain views minutes from everything Asheville has to offer.  Don't worry about noise... all of the loud work has been completed.
