Don't worry about noise... all of the loud work has been completed. We have a giant kitchen that you're more than welcome to use to cook any meal.  Help yourself to coffee, and feel free to store your food in our refrigerator.  We're cool with you using our dishes, we just ask that you clean up when you're done. Please don't go downstairs.. the garage is full of tools and building materials. I'm always available over the phone. We live in a great neighborhood on the side of a mountain in Asheville, NC.  The neighbo
neighborhood_overview: We live in a great neighborhood on the side of a mountain in Asheville, NC.  The neighbors are awesome, and we love where we live.  This place is truly unique.
notes: Both homeowners work full time, and there are two dogs on the property.  Please make your stay as enjoyable as you want, but please be respectful bear in mind that we live here and we are opening up our home to you.   If there's anything you need, we're here to help.
transit: Uber is a very popular option if you plan on going out and not driving.  We are walking distance to a grocery store, but it's probably best if you make sure you have transportation.
host_about: Hello!   My name is Shawn.  I'm an Asheville native.  I enjoy motorcycles, web design, and real estate.  I know all of the best places to eat and all of the best breweries in town.  I'm a people person when I'm not running around town with my two dogs.

Love my location! West Asheville's main drag Haywood is super stroll-able! neighborhood_overview: Love my location! West Asheville's main drag Haywood is super stroll-able!  Restaurants, coffee, tea, ice cream, honey, yoga, massage, barbershops, vintage clothing, music venues, classy bars and dive bars. We've got it all on one road.
notes: -I have a cat. I keep him out of the bedroom, but he is free to explore outside.  -I have a permit from the City of Asheville for Airbnb Homestay.
transit: If you don't have a car- I hear uber is the way to go these days.  As far as getting around West Asheville everything is in walking distance and Haywood is mostly hill free unless you start your way down the hill to the Wedge in the river arts district. If you don't want to go far- there's a taco place right out your back door and a bar across the street.  I have lots of bikes. If you want to borrow a bike let me know early on and I'll make sure I have em working.

summary: We invite you to relax in the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of Asheville, NC in a log cabin minutes from the city and other popular amenities.  Hiking, rafting and disc golf is only a couple of minutes away at Richmond Hill Park.
space: Our log home is only 8 minutes from downtown Asheville and popular West Asheville. We are very close to the city but our property has a very private retreat feel. Our home consists of three bedrooms with 2 full baths. Two bedrooms are downstairs.  Larger Downstairs Room  This is a very spacious room that is divided into two sections by a room divider. One side of the room has a comfortable, full sized futon with a spring mattress and memory foam topper. The other side of the room has a spa area with a massage table. This bedroom has access to the patio and the outdoor hot tub.  Smaller Downstairs Bedroom  This room has a very comfortable, firm, queen, memory foam bed. The room adjoins the main bathroom.  Upstairs Bedroom This is the more private of the three rooms which overlooks the pond and waterfall. It has a queen sized memory foam bed with a pillowtop mattress. transit: There is a bus stop up the road but not in walking distance. You will need a car or bikes for getting around.
host_about: Hello! Thank you for looking at my profile. I have been a massage therapist for over 14 years. I have been living in Asheville, NC for over 10 years. I love to create art, hike in our beautiful mountains, sail, read books, dine on fabulous food.... My husband and I used to live in beautiful Sedona, AZ. We love to travel and visit new places.

name: Convenience In A Country Setting!
summary: Convenience in a peaceful country setting. Very large master bedroom with full bath. Comfortable queen bed. Watch birds in the trees out your windows. Roku tv with Hulu and Netflix. House is professionally cleaned on a regular basis.
space: The clean, private suite has a large mini-fridge, Keurig coffee maker, and microwave. I keep a variety of K-cups, including organic, stocked. There is a Roku tv with Netflix and Hulu, plus many other channels. Your private bath includes shampoo, soap, lotion, and fluffy towels. Original artwork, some by friends and family, is changed periodically and gives the space an elegant yet cozy feel. You are welcome to sit on the back deck and watch the birds. There is a pair of red tail hawks that have made a nest in a nearby tree, and many song birds.
description: Convenience in a peaceful country setting. Very large master bedroom with full bath. Comfortable queen bed. Watch birds in the trees out your windows. Roku tv with Hulu and Netflix. House is professionally cleaned on a regular basis. The clean, private suite has a large mini-fridge, Keurig coffee maker, and microwave. I keep a variety of K-cups, including organic, stocked. There is a Roku tv with Netflix and Hulu, plus many other channels. Your private bath includes shampoo, soap, lotion, and fluffy towels. Original artwork, some by friends and family, is changed periodically and gives the space an elegant yet cozy feel. You are welcome to sit on the back deck and watch the birds. There is a pair of red tail hawks that have made a nest in a nearby tree, and many song birds. You will enter through the front door, with parking in the big circular driveway. Your private room and bath are at the end of the hall. I am generally available to answer questions and take care of any issues that
neighborhood_overview: My house is a mid century modern rancher built in 1968. It is on a four acre lot filled with azaleas, mature trees, and forest. It is in the city limits, about 5 minutes from the more congested area referred to as West Asheville. If you want to be convenient to the action but have a peaceful place to retreat to, my house is perfect!
notes: I do not support HB2, the recent NC bill that limits rights for lgbt people. I welcome all peaceful people in to my home. I am a dog trainer and am always happy to discuss issues you may be having with your 'best friends'! My home is about 5 minutes from the heart of West Asheville, where you will find great little shops, fabulous restaurants and a farmers' market, all within walking distance of each other. Having recently moved here, but long enough ago to have developed a great list, I can recommend realtors, a home inspector, my wonderful yard guy and wood guy, and even the best personal organizer. Asheville is a great place to live and I love to pass on the generosity of spirit I met with when I first got here.
transit: You will be within 5-20 minutes from any part of Asheville.  Rte. 40 is minutes from the door. Even though I'm on the west side, being so close to Rte. 40 means you will only be 30 minutes from Black Mountain, 15 miles to the east of the city.
host_about:
I'm a retired social worker turned dog behavior counselor/trainer. I grew up in the Washington DC area and have lived in London, England and New Mexico, US. Now happily residing in Asheville, NC, I am enjoying the mountains and friendly people. Also the wonderful food!
Back in Maryland, I had a basement apartment I renovated and rented out. And now I am excited to share my beautiful Asheville home with Airbnb guests!
Coming from a very diverse area, I love that Asheville's own diversity is increasing. All are welcome in my home and I do not discriminate on the basis of anything.

name: Sunny Retreat with a View!
summary: Enjoy a wonderful retreat close to the heart of West Asheville and only 10 minutes from downtown. We are located on a sunny  slope overlooking a  beautiful wooded setting. Plenty of natural sunlight in room, with private sitting areas inside and out.
space: We enjoy providing a simple and quiet environment for your personal retreat while enjoying our wonderful city.  Our home is smoke and pet free, nontoxic and uncluttered. Our beds are comfortable, with great support and cotton sheets.  We provide an assortment of tea and have space available in our refrigerator for your use.

neighborhood_overview: Our beautiful, quiet, mountain home is 15 min. from downtown, 15 min from Biltmore estate, and 5 miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway.   The popular West Asheville Haywood street is a short 10 minute drive.  Our home faces east and provides a spectacular view of the majestic mountains in the distance.  The Asheville Arboretum, Farmer's Market, and new Outlet mall are all within 5 miles.  Bent Creek nature area with its miles of mountain bike and hiking trails is 10 min drive from our home.  Access to the French broad river is close, too.  We are easily accessible from I 26 and I 40.  Great location, quiet neighborhood, private, and peaceful.
notes: We have a 60 lb shephard mix dog who loves people but prefers not to have other pets around.  Therefore, we insist on no pets.  Our dog does not go downstairs. She stays upstairs with us or will be in a fenced yard.  We live on a curvy street about one mile up from the base of the mountain so it's best for first time visitors to arrive before nightfall if possible.
transit: A car is best.  We provide off street parking on the driveway.
host_about: Don't worry, be happy.   Enjoy exploring new places, museums, reading, gardening, and riding horses.

name: The AshVilla
summary: The AshVilla is a private 1 bedroom 1 bath cozy apartment in a newly built home! Located in the heart of trendy West Asheville, you will be a hop-skip-and-away from some of the best restaurants, bars and shops Asheville has to offer.
space: Your own private Villa is brand spanking new with a plush queen size bed, full size bathroom, and couch with a queen size pull-out bed. Your home away from home also has A/C and a kitchen stocked with an assortment of tea and coffee to keep you comfortable and cozy. A Flat screen tv, books, and games are available to entertain you on a rainy day! Other perks: Off street parking (for one car) and pet friendly (well-trained and behaved mature dogs).  Have coffee or a glass of wine on your private deck!  The AshVilla is located within walking distance to many great restaurants, bars and shops and so much more!

neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip neighborhood with a downtown of its own.   Best brunch contenders Sunny Point and Biscuit Head,  the Admiral, New Belgium Brewery and many more are within walking or biking distance.  Riverside park (has a dog park!) and Carrier park, hiking/biking and river floating are all just minutes away. There is a plethora to see and do right in the neighborhood and Downtown Asheville is an easy bike or cab ride away!
notes: We will send you an email with check-in information close to your arrival date.
transit: There are enough places within walking and/or biking distance to keep you entertained, but if you want to venture off public transport is available and you can get  a cab ride or Uber anywhere around town for around $10!!
host_about:
We are from the Mountains of Western North Carolina. David is a contractor, specializing in GreenBuilding and Melissa is a Physician Assistant at a Family Practice. 
We to love travel, play outdoors with our dog and enjoy all the great restaurants Asheville has to offer.

name: Thistledo- Cozy 1 Bedr. Private Apt
summary: Located just off Leicester Highway, 15 to 20 minutes from Asheville.  It's a cozy one bedroom apartment, fully furnished with amenities+ .  Limited to TWO ADULTS.  Our neighborhood is established, quiet, and relaxing. No smoking and no pets.
space: We hope Thistledo has everything you need for a home away from home...just bring  your clothes and food and let us take care of everything else.   It is comfortably suitable for, and limited to, ONE or TWO ADULTS.  When you arrive you'll find some bottled water, and one or two bottles of locally brewed beer chilling for you in the frig. There will also be OJ, cream cheese and bagels for breakfast, or chocolate milk and donuts, if you prefer.  Let us know. If you've made it to the frig, you've already passed a small patio at the entrance, with an outdoor table and 2 chairs.  Upon entering the living room, you'll notice a flat screen TV with cable, a DVD player with 250+ apps, lots DVD's, WIFI, a love seat with 2 comfortable recliners, and 2 rocking chairs.  You'll also find lots of info about fun places located in Asheville in the fliers on the shelves.  When you inspect the kitchen, you'll find it fully stocked with pots/pans, baking pans, eating & cooking utensils, glass wear & dinner

neighborhood_overview: The property is located on 1.75 acres in a beautiful established neighborhood, surrounded by trees and mountains.  It's peaceful and quiet, and the private roads are very safe for biking, walking or jogging.
notes: As this is a new listing, we are still in the process of trying to think of anything and everything anyone would need or like to have while being away from home.  At this point--if you need something that isn't there, please feel free to ask and, if it's possible, we'll do our best to accommodate your request.  We invite, and appreciate any suggestions/recommendations you might have that would help make Thistledo more inviting.
transit: We are about a 15 to 20 minute drive to downtown Asheville, 20 minutes to Weaverville, and 30 minutes to Hendersonville.   Since we're in the county, we have no city buses.  There are several fast food franchises close by, and pizza delivery available, plus a few nice, small independent restaurants/diners.  A large grocery store, several pharmacies, and a laundromat are within two to three miles.  We have many brochures in the apt. about activities around the area and we'll be glad to offer additional info if requested.  Asheville and the surrounding mountains are full of fun and adventurous things to do, like hiking, tubing, shopping, golfing, historical locations, enjoying the downtown day and night life, etc.  Plus we have the magnificent Biltmore House.  Come, explore, and enjoy our beautiful city and all it has to offer.  You won't be disappointed!
host_about:
HI!

I'm Vicki, a native of Asheville, and my husband, Tom, relocated from Boston 15 years ago.  Yes, he still says "khakis" for "car keys", but I can translate  if needed!  Just kidding...his accent is just one of the  many things I love about him!

Both of us work full time - I'm a dental hygienist, and Tom, an IT Specialist.  We enjoy every minute we get to spend at home, and also love being with our kids and grand kids, our 2 dogs, going to dinner and movies, being out on the pontoon boat at Lake Fontana in the summer, working around the house, or just relaxing (our favorite)!  We recently bought 2 double floats and did some lazy tubing on the French Broad!  We enjoyed it so much, we'll probably be "floating" every chance we get!  It was beautiful and so relaxing!  If you're in Asheville during the summer months and like being in the water, we highly recommend it! 

We adore Asheville and the surrounding areas, especially the mountains.  I've always felt comforted and protected by them for some reason.  Sometimes you might hear them   whispering to you, but you have to learn to listen closely, and it helps to use your imagination :)   

Getting to meet and enjoy good people from all cultures is one of life's greatest privileges.  Plus it's exciting to know there are so many warm, interesting, and kind people that may cross our paths.  We're looking forward to welcoming you to Asheville and into our home.  Our hope is that our little slice of heaven will serve you well and be a respite for you during your visit.   We will be as interactive as you wish, but our goal is to honor and respect your privacy, thus we will never be intrusive.  We can't wait to meet you!

name: Haywood House Asheville
summary: Haywood House: West Asheville's Newly Restored And Most Walkable Rental!  Fully Restored And Updated Craftsman Home With 3 Bedrooms And 2 Full Baths.
space: The Haywood House is a newly restored,  marvelous craftsman home in walking distance to the heart of vibrant West Asheville. Stay in West Asheville's most walkable rental and enjoy the local restaurants, coffee shops, pubs, ice cream parlors, bakeries and groceries, while leaving the car at home! It retains many features original to the house such as flooring, fireplaces and mantles, windows, and mouldings, but with all the comforts of home. The easy-access, one-level home has ten-foot ceilings and tastefully decorated throughout with period furniture, antiques, lamps and light fixtures. Haywood House is reminiscent of a time gone by, its craftsman charm updated with all the modern appliances and amenities. All three-bedrooms boast king size beds. Eight can sleep comfortably including the convenient sleeper sofa in the living room. While the hall bathroom includes a tub and shower, the master bath has a large walk-in shower and ample counter space. You will be spoiled by the generous l

Only a block or two away are restaurants such as Universal Joint, Westville Pub, Pour Taproom and West End Bakery. Shop for provisions and local treasures at the West Village Market. A short stroll brings you to local eateries such as Biscuit Head, Nine Mile, and  Lucky Otter. The Altamont Brewery or Isis Music Hall offer nightly food and entertainment.

name: Bent Creek: Trails Out Your Door!
summary: Ride, run, or hike out the door!  40 miles of trail and the Blue Ridge Parkway are seconds away from your private entrance.  Fantastic neighborhood park that's great for kids and includes a pump track.  Bike wash and bike storage provided.
space: Lovely, spacious apartment in Bent Creek Neighborhood just walking distance to the entrance of Pisgah National Forest.  Your space has 2 comfy full beds (one is a real bed, the other a pullout sofa with a memory foam mattress), a full bath with body wash as well as local BROO shampoo and conditioner, and an outdoor patio overlooking the wooded backyard.  The kitchen contains a fridge, toaster oven, microwave, coffee and tea pots, and two hotplates for cooking.  Coffee and tea are provided.  There is a bike wash area to clean and dry bicycles if you are here to ride the trails, as well as indoor space to tuck them away and keep them locked up.  There is an outdoor patio with adirondack chairs and the entire backyard is yours to lounge in.  This unique space is the downstairs floor of our home.
description: Ride, run, or hike out the door!  40 miles of trail and the Blue Ridge Parkway are seconds away from your private entrance.  Fantastic neighborhood park that's great for kids and includes a pump track.  Bike wash and bike storage provided.      Lovely, spacious apartment in Bent Creek Neighborhood just walking distance to the entrance of Pisgah National Forest.  Your space has 2 comfy full beds (one is a real bed, the other a pullout sofa with a memory foam mattress), a full bath with body wash as well as local BROO shampoo and conditioner, and an outdoor patio overlooking the wooded backyard.  The kitchen contains a fridge, toaster oven, microwave, coffee and tea pots, and two hotplates for cooking.  Coffee and tea are provided. There is an outdoor patio with adirondack chairs and the entire backyard is yours to lounge in.  This u
neighborhood_overview: We live in a pretty Leave It To Beaver kind of neighborhood.  It is quiet and wooded, and folks are quite friendly.  There is a fantastic community run park, complete with swings, basketball, volleyball, covered picnic area, and pump track.  From your own private entrance you can mountain bike, run, or hike the over 40 miles of Bent Creek forest by accessing the trails through the neighborhood.  If you are up for something longer, you can ride over Bent Creek Gap into Mills River and access the hundreds of miles of trails that Pisgah has to offer.  If you are here to get some road biking in, we are also just minutes by bike from the Blue Ridge Parkway, where you can ride south up to Mount Pisgah, or north towards Mount Mitchell--the highest peak east of the Mississippi.  The apartment is 10 minutes from "Hip" West Asheville where the locals eat, just a few minutes more to the heart of downtown, and also about 10 minutes from the airport.
notes: When you are tired from playing on the trails, Zen Tubing is just minutes down the road and provides some great recovery. Here you can set up a tubing trip on the French Broad River that has you exiting at a huge, beautiful park, or at one of our many fabulous local breweries.  The NC Arboretum is just a minute or two from your door, and Biltmore Estate is just down the road.  In addition to the historical house and grounds, there is also an award winning winery, off-road driving with the Land Rover Experience Driving School, Orvis endorsed fly fishing instruction and skeet, trap and sporting clay shooting available at Biltmore.  The River Arts District in West Asheville features a walkable studio tour, parks and lots of great food.  There is an abundance of music in and around town.  And when you are done with your busy day of playing, we have over 21 breweries and an unending supply of amazing restaurants to complete your day.  We are happy to provide you with routes to ride or run,
host_about:
Hi there!  We are Dawn and Ben, and we are happy that you are interested in our space!
  Dawn has been in Asheville over 20 years, though she spent a hefty portion of that time traveling the world.  She's been working for a local bike shop the last 7 years, where she is still employed, and is also currently in school for Nursing.  She loves being outside, running, and camping, but is most elated when she's on her mountian bike in the woods ripping along beautiful single track. 
Ben moved to Asheville for the mountain biking 13 years ago.  He worked in the bike industry for over 15 years.  He now works as an off-road driving instructor for Land Rover on the Biltmore Estate.  In his free time he enjoys spending time with his daughter Macy, fiancee Dawn, tinkering on his Classic Range Rover and mountain biking.

Kitchen, Living Room, Dining Room, Outdoor table, Firepit We have teenagers that are usually doing homework in their bedroom. My wife and I may be watching a movie or hanging around the fire pit. We are happy to provide tips on great things to do in Asheville. West Asheville is a hip trendy neighborhood with bars and restaurants walking distance from the house. 5-20 min walk depending on where you want to go. Easy drive as well. Bus stop in front of the house. Uber is the easiest way to get around. We have 2 adorable cats that live in the house.
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip trendy neighborhood with bars and restaurants walking distance from the house. 5-20 min walk depending on where you want to go. Easy drive as well.
notes: We have 2 adorable cats that live in the house.
transit: Bus stop in front of the house. Uber is the easiest way to get around.
host_about: Cody & Marla have lived here is Asheville for many years and love it here.  We enjoy many of wonderful natural setting of the area.  We have three teenagers and two cats.  We spend a lot of time camping on a lake with our Pontoon & Sailboat which allows us the opportunity allow you to stay in the house while we are off playing.  We hope you enjoy Asheville as much as we do.

name: Sunny West Avl Bungalow
summary: The bungalow is located in the heart of West Asheville. Walk out your door and in 1/2 a block you will become part of all things fabulous our buzzing community has to offer. Come home and relax in a clean, modern and efficient space.
space: The bungalow offers a clean, modern and zen environment. The newly renovated, modern kitchen is spacious and fully stocked with a small reading nook. Each bedroom has a queen size bed, a closet to hang your clothes, reading lamps and are simply yet intentionally decorated. The living room is cozy with many seating options and a smart tv. You can sign in to you Netflix and Hulu accounts and watch movies or shows.  The dining room has plenty of space to enjoy your snacks or meals. There is also a brand new back deck and a sweet front porch with a swing built for two :-).The bungalow has many green and efficient touches for energy savings as well as comfy living. For starters all the light bulbs are LED. There is recycling in place with a detailed list of acceptable items. The hot water heater is tankless so there is no waste of electricity heating unnecessary amounts of water.  No chemicals are used for cleaning or laundry making the bungalow a great place that is free of toxins.

neighborhood_overview: Located in the heart of West Asheville, you are a half a block walk to our central business district. Walk to Sunny Point, Nine Mile, UJoint, West End Bakery, and the WestVillage Market is located on our corner for essential grocery needs. Within a mile walk are many more wonderful shops and restaurants. 2.5miles  to the River Arts District, and approximately 5 miles to downtown. If you are visiting the Biltmore, the front gate is approximately a 10 minute drive away. West Asheville is a very walkable community. There is a park nearby and access to the river as well as the Hominy Creek river trail.
notes: There free parking available on the street. Parking is only allowed on the opposite side of the street from the bungalow.
transit: The Bungalow is 1/2 a block from the main road that goes through the heart of West Asheville so walking is a great option if you want to explore the neighborhood. There is a bus stop a block away and it's a $10 (approximately) UBER ride to downtown.
host_about:
I am a small business owner and an urban organic farmer who loves animals as well. I am a gypsy at heart and in 1999 decided to make Asheville my home. After traveling the U.S. for almost 2 years it felt great to throw down some roots. Those roots have dug in deep!! Being an entrepreneur in a community that thrives on, supports and is loyal to us small business folks is both a joy and an honor.
Being a host gives me the opportunity to share with so many different folks all the things I truly love about the Asheville community.

Access to the kitchen, Apple TV, Nexflix, washer and dryer, off street parking. I am so happy to share my home with travelers and my busy schedule means weekdays I am not home much. I do quite a bit of running and triathlon racing so that keeps me busy with races, long runs or rides on weekends so I am often not home much. I look forward to meeting you!

notes: Asheville is a music and arts mecca.  We love hosting cool people and facilitating the best stay possible for our guests. :) Early check in's are not possible, late checks in ok. host_about:
We are artist/musicians living in Asheville with our 2 boys and a few pet chickens.
We enjoy gardening & landscaping our peaceful sanctuary.
We are openminded, humorous, non-judgmental, vegetarian,  balanced between urban/rural, into nature, arts, electronic music, philosophy, astronomy, archaeology, and respectful of all life. :)

As hosts, we try to be easy going and accommodating as possible.
As guests, we live by the Leave No Trace principal and/or the "leaving it nicer than you found it" principal. :)

name: Colorful Energy Art-Filled Bedroom
summary: This private bedroom and fully tiled bath are gems of our West Asheville home. The spacious, quiet room is bathed in afternoon sunlight. The bathroom has an extra large standing shower, with two shower heads, skylight and all the comforts of home.
space: This is a spacious and private suite on the second floor of our home. Includes a large walk in closet and comfortable furnishings. This is a pet and smoke free house.
description: This private bedroom and fully tiled bath are gems of our West Asheville home. The spacious, quiet room is bathed in afternoon sunlight. The bathroom has an extra large standing shower, with two shower heads, skylight and all the comforts of home. This is a spacious and private suite on the second floor of our home. Includes a large walk in closet and comfortable furnishings. This is a pet and smoke free house. Guests are welcome to enjoy the shared living spaces (kitchen, dining and living room).  There is a large family room upstairs next to the guestroom that you have shared use of during your stay.   We'll soon have a keyless entry which you'll receive the code to upon making your reservation for ease of entering/exiting. Both my partner and I work from home so are here throughout the day. He is a musician and can give impeccable recommendations on the best spots for live music in town. I work in IT and Human Resources, so am glued to a computer most of the day. We're happy to assi
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a hip, funky, friendly area, full of young families, retirees and stablished locals. It's quiet, yet close to Highways 240 and 26 for easy access to the rest of the city and region beyond. The River Arts District, a strip of local artist studios, restaurants and green space along the French Broad River, is less than 30 minutes walk from the house (or a quick 4 minute drive).  Our home is walkable to bars like New Belgium Brewery and Urban Orchard awesome restaurants like The Admiral, Battle Cat Cafe, The Walk, and King Daddy. And only ten minute walk to one of the best donuts you'll ever have @ The Hole. They offer local roasted coffee, OJ and freshly made donuts that will have you skipping for joy!
notes: We have a happy, friendly and active 6 year old who you may hear at times. He has an active social and sport schedule, especially on weekends, so the fact should be a minimal disturbance on your stay. We offer discounts for long term stays (over a week or a month).
transit: My partner drives for Uber and is happy to offer discounts for new Uber riders. Getting downtown is super easy and a quick 6 minute cab ride away. Our home is walkable to the center of West Asheville (about 1.5 miles), a fun and funky strip of shops, restaurants, cafes and bars. Carrier Park, one of the largest green spaces in the city is less than a quarter mile away. Taxi services are the best way to get around Asheville although if you drive, our street has easy and free street parking available as well.
host_about:
I love color, married a artist and live in one of the most comfortable and colorful homes in West Asheville (and that's saying something in this neighborhood!) My partner Thomas and I decided to move to Asheville after visiting over my birthday weekend two years ago (via Airbnb). We instantly fell in love with the town's charm and haven't looked back

I moved to Asheville from the Washington DC area almost 2 years ago and I love the small town feel, the natural beauty, the southern friendliness and the strong sense of community. I'm blessed to work from home as a consultant for the United Nations, so I get to interact with folks literally all over the world, from the comfort of my home office. I've lived in Sierra Leone and Guatemala and have traveled to a handful of other countries in Europe, the Caribbean and Central America. I've also lived in various cities on both coasts of the US, yet very serendipitously rooted here in Asheville, North Carolina (happy to share that story with you when we meet.) So yes, I love to travel, connect with new people, learn about the many cultures that exist in any particular space and place.

With an active yoga practice, attempts at gardening, a six year old son with an active social calendar, and baby #2 on the way, life is ever expressing joy.

summary: Please come stay in our large home in West Asheville featuring year round mountain views, close proximity to town, large kitchen, large shared living space, and your own private king bed. This booking features two large king beds with a shared bathroom. Perfect for groups of 4.
space: While we go through the final touches of remodeling our large home in Asheville, you can stay with us and enjoy the beautiful year long mountain views minutes from everything Asheville has to offer.  Don't worry about noise... all of the loud work has been completed.
description: Please come stay in our large home in West Asheville featuring year round mountain views, close proximity to town, large kitchen, large shared living space, and your own private king bed. This booking features two large king beds with a shared bathroom. Perfect for groups of 4. While we go through the final touches of remodeling our large home in Asheville, you can stay with us and enjoy the beautiful year long mountain views minutes from everything Asheville has to offer.  Don't worry about noise... all of the loud work has been completed. We have a giant kitchen that you're more than welcome to use to cook any meal.  Help yourself to coffee, and feel free to store your food in our refrigerator.  We're cool with you using our dishes, we just ask that you clean up when you're done. Please don't go downstairs.. the garage is full of tools and building materials. I'm always available over the phone. Both homeowners work full time, and there are two dogs on the property.  Please make your
notes: Both homeowners work full time, and there are two dogs on the property.  Please make your stay as enjoyable as you want, but please be respectful bear in mind that we live here and we are opening up our home to you.   If there's anything you need, we're here to help.
host_about: Hello!   My name is Shawn.  I'm an Asheville native.  I enjoy motorcycles, web design, and real estate.  I know all of the best places to eat and all of the best breweries in town.  I'm a people person when I'm not running around town with my two dogs.

summary: Sweet room in W. Asheville bungalow walkable to all the great shops and restaurants of the West side village!  Quiet, dead end street and off street parking. Just a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville.
space: The fully furnished room offers a super comfortable futon bed that has had 2" memory foam added to the mattress.  This cozy home has a living room, dining room, kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, a large back deck and a full front porch with a swing.  Wood floors throughout.  Working fireplace. Laundry facilities and wifi included. I am a 5 minute drive from the River Arts District and downtown.
description: Sweet room in W. Asheville bungalow walkable to all the great shops and restaurants of the West side village!  Quiet, dead end street and off street parking. Just a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville. The fully furnished room offers a super comfortable futon bed that has had 2" memory foam added to the mattress.  This cozy home has a living room, dining room, kitchen, 2 bedrooms, 1 bath, a large back deck and a full front porch with a swing.  Wood floors throughout.  Working fireplace. Laundry facilities and wifi included. I am a 5 minute drive from the River Arts District and downtown. This is a shared living space, but you are welcomed to use the kitchen while you are here. I am a working artist in a town filled with great art, food, music, and outdoor activities.  I will be pleased to answer any questions you might have and help you discover all Asheville and W. Asheville have to offer. W. Asheville is great. It is a village unto itself with fine restaurants, shops, and the Massag
neighborhood_overview: W. Asheville is great. It is a village unto itself with fine restaurants, shops, and the Massage School and Yoga Center all within walking distance of my house.  And it's just a five minute drive to downtown.
transit: Public transportation is ok, but a car is best.
host_about:
I spent my entire adult life in theatre as an actress, director and producer. Nearly 20 years of that I created original works with objects and puppets. My work has been seen at The Kennedy Center, the Henson International Festival in N.Y., UCLA, and the Walker Arts Center, to name a few.  I tired of the touring life however and am now making beautiful handmade art lamps inspired by a 2 year stay in Korea.  I love my hours in the studio which is located in Asheville's River Arts District!  I must still travel some to get my wares out into the public, but with a studio in the district, many travelers come my way. 

I love to meet new people. I'm friendly and easy to get along with.  With all the traveling done over the years I am quite self sufficient.  Good food is important when you're on the road, and I love to find those special little places tucked away in a neighborhood. As a host, I will be able to point you in the right direction for a wonderful night on the town. 

My motto is - "Be positive and enjoy the ride."

name: bedrm in heart of west asheville
summary: Have your own private sleeping quarters just a stone's throw from everything West Asheville has to offer! You can surprisingly enjoy a quiet walk down my street; however at the end of the street is Haywood-home to numerous cafes, bars, & restaurants!
space: Your 'home away from home' is a medium-sized dwelling which was built around 1930. Although I am an acupuncturist not an artist, I have been told that my home has a  warm, artsy feel to it. It has an excellent location, as well as arts-n-crafts stye charm, without being extravagant!
description: Have your own private sleeping quarters just a stone's throw from everything West Asheville has to offer! You can surprisingly enjoy a quiet walk down my street; however at the end of the street is Haywood-home to numerous cafes, bars, & restaurants! Your 'home away from home' is a medium-sized dwelling which was built around 1930. Although I am an acupuncturist not an artist, I have been told that my home has a  warm, artsy feel to it. It has an excellent location, as well as arts-n-crafts stye charm, without being extravagant! In addition to your own private bedroom with double bed, closet, & dresser, you will have shared access to a full bathroom, full kitchen, spacious living room, & front porch. The kitchen has every spice (& interesting &  ethnic cookbook) & gadget that you would ever want, & probably some you had not previously discovered. There is a small convection oven which reduces cooking time; however, there is not a microwave. There is room in the refrigerator for your pe
neighborhood_overview: Many restaurants & bars are within walking distance. There are 7 local restaurants/bars at the end of this street (and Sunny Point Cafe and The Admiral are just a few blocks away ). Also within walking (actually skipping, its that close) distance are a grocery store, healthfood store, post office, & library (also an eccentric video rental store, Orbitz, that still thrives even with all the online amenities such as Netflix). It is a quiet street for walking, but at the end of it lies a bustling night life with bars & live music- The ISIS Music Hall is one such place. Several bars are conveniently stumbling distance from your sleeping quarters (including the Pour, the world's largest self-pour taproom). In addition, you are less than 15min away from the Blue Ridge Parkway and Biltmore.
notes: My home is not child-proofed. I may consider having a baby or young child as a guest if it is discussed prior to my accepting a reservation. Pets only under VERY special circumstances! When there is room in the house, I may consider additional guests for an extra fee.
transit: You will only be 2miles from Asheville's downtown, and you actually are in the heart of  downtown West Asheville. So you can bike & walk most places. Additionally, cabs & ubers are easy to get, & there is a bus stop at the end of the street.
host_about: I am a 45 yr old female. I lived in WY near the Tetons for 13 yr and now reside in Asheville, NC. My child is my job; I am an acupuncturist (& also a science enthusiast) & work with my patients using vitamins, herbs, & nutrition. I love to travel & meet people & enjoy delicious &/or interesting food, and love music & the outdoors. I especially love anything to do with the water! (I used to coach swimming& swam competitively).  I love world music, funk, and bluegrass. Like I said , I love to travel but these days I am limited due to my work (which I love) and needing to be near to my parents (who I used to never see when I was away all the time).

space: We also rent our downstairs unit, check it out here: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2014453) Please read the house rules before booking. This private apartment is the top floor of our cozy gated home at the end of a one lane gravel road. name: Bungalow in Walkable West Asheville
summary: Beautiful 1928 arts and craft bungalow in hip West Asheville. Rocking chair front porch and relaxing back deck. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, and playgrounds. Short drive to downtown Asheville and Biltmore.
space: Main level bedrooms: one bedroom with queen bed and two bedrooms each with one twin bed. Basement bedroom has a full bed and bath.
description: Beautiful 1928 arts and craft bungalow in hip West Asheville. Rocking chair front porch and relaxing back deck. Walking distance to restaurants, bars, and playgrounds. Short drive to downtown Asheville and Biltmore. Main level bedrooms: one bedroom with queen bed and two bedrooms each with one twin bed. Basement bedroom has a full bed and bath. Guests can access any part of the house and yard except for the upstairs/attic area and garage. West Asheville is a wonderful, eclectic neighborhood and our house is within walking distance to many pubs, restaurants, and playgrounds. Our favorite places to go are Tacos Jalisco, Rocky's Hot Chicken Shack, Nine Mile, and West End Bakery. Walk to most places on Haywood Road in 10 minutes or take a short drive to downtown Asheville or Biltmore Estate. Please, please be kind to our wonderful cat Otto! He is older but loves attention once he gets to know you. During your stay, we have a friend who will come to the house to put out food and water as we
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is a wonderful, eclectic neighborhood and our house is within walking distance to many pubs, restaurants, and playgrounds. Our favorite places to go are Tacos Jalisco, Rocky's Hot Chicken Shack, Nine Mile, and West End Bakery.
notes: Please, please be kind to our wonderful cat Otto! He is older but loves attention once he gets to know you. During your stay, we have a friend who will come to the house to put out food and water as well as clean out litter box which is in laundry room in the basement (not near any sleeping areas).
transit: Walk to most places on Haywood Road in 10 minutes or take a short drive to downtown Asheville or Biltmore Estate.
host_about: I love to read, travel, and spend time with family. I also enjoy sharing how amazing Asheville is with other travelers!

name: Boutique apt in West Asheville
summary: First floor unit in a split house, newly remodeled, includes wifi, kitchen, bathroom and patio entrance. 2 blocks from Haywood meaning bars, coffee shops and restaurants at your fingertips. Ample street parking and easy access to the highway.
space: We renovated a basement apartment to create an independent guest space for travelers and friends.  It includes a functional kitchen and there is an air mattress for a potential third guest.  Some days, we are tempted to move down there ourselves, particularly during the summer.   We love our neighborhood.  It's walkable to Haywood and bikable to downtown.  Plus Asheville is a compact city, so you can get anywhere relatively quickly.

name: Charming Bungalow    Two Room Suite
summary: Welcome to Beer City USA !!  Our !920 's Bungalow is located two blocks from fun bars, cafe's, and great restaurants. Easy 4 mile Uber into Downtown Asheville. Close to Biltmore House and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Enjoy Hiking, Music, and Breweries !!
space: Your Two Bedroom suite offers a comfy Queen bed and the adjoining bedroom has a Full XL Mattress ( 2 inches less than Queen ) .  There is a doorway between the rooms with no door. Your large private Bathroom is located just outside your door. Great setup for close friends and family !!
description: Welcome to Beer City USA !!  Our !920 's Bungalow is located two blocks from fun bars, cafe's, and great restaurants. Easy 4 mile Uber into Downtown Asheville. Close to Biltmore House and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Enjoy Hiking, Music, and Breweries !! Your Two Bedroom suite offers a comfy Queen bed and the adjoining bedroom has a Full XL Mattress ( 2 inches less than Queen ) .  There is a doorway between the rooms with no door. Your large private Bathroom is located just outside your door. Great setup for close friends and family !! You have access to the whole house . You are welcome to store food and drinks in the refrigerator. The front porch includes a swing and chairs to enjoy the mountain air . Would love to greet and provide local information upon arrival.  We are around if you need ideas of where to go and explore. West Asheville is now Best Asheville  !! The neighborhood is friendly and quiet yet two blocks to fun bars and restaurants and some of Asheville's best breakfast spots
neighborhood_overview: West Asheville is now Best Asheville  !! The neighborhood is friendly and quiet yet two blocks to fun bars and restaurants and some of Asheville's best breakfast spots !!
notes: Please park in the Driveway.
transit: We are just off the Interstate and only 4 miles to Downtown Asheville !! Most Guest's Uber to Downtown which is fast and cheap !! Our West Asheville is fun to explore on foot !!
host_about:
An Asheville transplant, I have watched our West Asheville grow into a diverse community with numerous food eateries, music venues, shops and even a gas station with a pub.  I love our community and spend part of my time promoting the Greenway projects across the Asheville area and beyond. 
  
My partner Wynn and I have been living in our home since 2008 and have found that Asheville offers a lifestyle that encourages quality of life.   We look forward to sharing our experience on a visit very soon. Live, Laugh, Love!   

Grandmother of two gorgeous boys, I look forward to sharing my home with people coming to experience the Asheville scene.  My home is open and inviting and within walking distance to all the West Asheville Amenities.

I own a small real estate business, Sweetwater Realty, yes named after the beer from Atlanta.  We love our beers in Asheville.

Live, Laugh and Love!  I look forward to seeing you soon.

name: Inn on Westwood - Bennett Suite Avl
summary: Stunning 1860s historic home in West Asheville. Walking distance to restaurants, shops, and the River Arts District.  Large bedrooms, full-size beds, mountain views, beautiful porches on 3 acres. Two spacious 2BR 1BA private apartments with kitchens.
space: This gorgeous designated historic home, built in the 1860's, is a slice of Asheville history.  Full of special touches you won't find anywhere else, it features 20ft. ceilings, arched double-doors and beautiful crown molding.  Rooms are spacious and well lit, with windows just as grand as the space itself!  Enjoy the enclosed sun porch with your morning coffee or evening cocktail. Soak up some sun (or shade) on any of the open air porches.  The home is fully stocked for your vacation needs with complimentary tea and coffee, fruits, chocolate, granola bars and a chef's kitchen ready for you to use! A continental breakfast of fresh, local ingredients is also included.  Gorgeous tile-work lines the washrooms and we offer complimentary Aveda bath products.  You'll be within miles from Downtown Asheville, and an even closer walk to hip West Asheville, with easy access to the interstate and local attractions. The home is made up of two 2BR 1BA private apartments. Rent one side or the whole h

Walk to a dozen hip bars and coffee shops, farm to table restaurants, and cute and quirky shops. You can check out the local farmers market and bike along the river park. It is a very family friendly neighborhood.
notes: There are two, two-bedroom suites at the Inn.

name: Artsy/Zen Bungalow in W. Asheville!
summary: Beautiful, newly renovated 3 BR/2 BA, w/tons of character and charm.  1.5 blocks from restaurants, bars, park, coffee shops, food market, etc. 5-8 min drive to downtown! Covered front porch, sunny back deck, fenced in yard, gas stove, kid friendly...
space: Our home is at the heart of West Asheville, lovingly known by the locals as "Best Asheville".   It has all the charm and quirkiness of downtown but on a smaller, more walkable scale.  There are coffee shops, local restaurants, bars, bakeries, a farmers market, grocer, holistic health shop and a park all within a 2 minute walk.  So whether you want to stay at home with your loved ones or go out and enjoy the nightlife, there is something for everyone!

summary: Private and peaceful apartment! It feels country but in the city, backing up to lush fields and woods with an amazing view! The best part of this property is that its located 8 minutes from downtown and 2 minutes from the West side hip hot spots!
space: Relaxing and peaceful basement apartment with a separate entrance, great for a couple or single traveler. There is a mini fridge, microwave and a coffee maker for those pesky mornings! Bathroom has a nice deep tub, and furniture is comfy. I provide sheets,  blankets,  towels and bath soap. Parking is in a seperate area, gravelled and secure.  Through the gate, follow the sidewalk and your there!

neighborhood_overview: This residential location is great- its super quiet, peaceful and conveniently located to all the main roads and freeways in Asheville. Close to good food, entertainment and sight seeing destinations.
notes: There are dogs upstairs- they might bark  occasionally, please don't be alarmed, also, we have three cats that roam the property, feel free to pet, but please don't let them in the apartment or they will insist on staying with you! :)
transit: You will have a place for two vehicles to park on site. Uber is a great pickup service here in town, and the fare to downtown from the apartment is about $10.00... an Uber fare from the airport will run about $50.00, but that is still better than a Taxi! We do have access to the local bus lines, about a block away is a pick up location.
host_about: I am a martial arts student,  gardener and artist. I love living here in the mountains,  and really enjoy meeting new people and sharing my life experiences. My passions are in music and living a balanced happy life with my children and my pet family!

name: Vacation in cohousing community!
summary: This unique home is in a co-housing community in the heart of West Asheville, with walking paths, beautiful landscaping, a playground, off-street parking, and woods with a creek runnig through. Walking distance to Haywood Rd, and 5 miles to downtown.
space: The house has lots of light, deck overlooking the woods, AC, dishwasher, and even a Vitamix! 3 bedrooms have a queen bed, 2 single beds, and a king size mattress between them. There's also a sofa bed in the living room.
description: This unique home is in a co-housing community in the heart of West Asheville, with walking paths, beautiful landscaping, a playground, off-street parking, and woods with a creek runnig through. Walking distance to Haywood Rd, and 5 miles to downtown. The house has lots of light, deck overlooking the woods, AC, dishwasher, and even a Vitamix! 3 bedrooms have a queen bed, 2 single beds, and a king size mattress between them. There's also a sofa bed in the living room. The entire house is yours. We will welcome you home, then will be travelling during most of the time you're here. Expect to interact with the neighbors though! This is a cohousing community built with houses on the outside, and courtyard, gardens, playground, and paths on the inside. Everyone has privacy in their house, decks, and front and backyards, while also having an easy way to interact with others in the common areas. This is of course in addition to being in the heart of West Asheville, one of the best neighborhoods
neighborhood_overview: This is a cohousing community built with houses on the outside, and courtyard, gardens, playground, and paths on the inside. Everyone has privacy in their house, decks, and front and backyards, while also having an easy way to interact with others in the common areas. This is of course in addition to being in the heart of West Asheville, one of the best neighborhoods in the area.
notes: We'd like to rent this for the whole period we're traveling, from 6/24 to 7/31. We will also consider just July (7/1 to 7/31). We're not interested in stays shorter than 1 month. Thanks!
transit: West Asheville park is 2 streets down, Haywood Rd is a 10-minute walk, and downtown Asheville and Bitmore Estate are 5 miles away. You'll have a designated parking spot. There are 2 bus lines within a 10-minute walk that go to downtown Asheville.
host_about: We're open hearted and open minded, creative, love to travel, and enjoy the beauty of everyday life with our adorable kids.

name: Yurt! Asheville Glamping! Heat & AC
summary: Our business is called "Asheville Glamping" Follow us on INSTAGRAM -ashevilleglamping to see more!
space: Make your trip to Asheville extra memorable when you stay in our fun yurt :-) 5 miles from downtown and 2 to Haywood Rd on 2.5 acres alone (there are no other homes on this 2 plus acre property- the yurt sits alone here) Follow us on INSTAGRAM @ashevilleglamping and check out pictures of our other sites and glamping adventures! Wait.....What's a Yurt?  A yurt (or ger) is a portable living structure originally developed by the nomadic groups of the Central Asian steppes. Original yurts were fashioned from local wood, felt, and braided horse hair. They were designed to be portable for moving as the horse and goat herds were driven across the plains. Strong and light, they could be set up in a day or so and properly equipped to withstand wind and snow that would crush many other dwellings. Modern yurts like ours are made from more contemporary materials (aluminum rivets, aircraft cable, and polyester materials) with heat-treated and fine finished wood. neighborhood_overview: I moved to Asheville when I was 21--at the time I was living in my old Dodge Caravan with my dog--and watching movies on my laptop....Everyone was so friendly here....and no one batted an eye at the girl who lived in her van---they seemed to think "why wouldn't you live in your van if you had one?" I've always felt at home (URL HIDDEN) matter what kind of roof was over my head. I hope you do too :-)
notes: PLEASE READ: HOLIDAY RATE AND MINIMUM STAY From December 20th to January 2nd we have a four night minimum stay. Airbnb is currently lacking the feature to change the minimum stay during the holiday season so please keep this is mind when you are looking at these dates. If your reservation does not comply with the minimum we will have to cancel it- Thank you!
transit: Everything is a short drive from the yurt- If you want to there are taxi's available and I leave our favorite cabbies number on the fridge. He will take you downtown for just ten bucks.
host_about: We LOVE alternative dwellings and micro housing. We ourselves live in a  270 sq ft vintage camper with our three dogs. We have really been enjoying the opportunity to share our land with guests and have met so many amazing people through hosting on AIRBNB.   Together, Josh and I own two pieces of land in Asheville. One has just the yurt alone on it. Our other property is home to Bettie and also has several private campsites. It's nice to be able to offer people a range of options- from camping on the cheap to enjoying a luxurious stay in our yurt or restored vintage trailer! Joanna owns an environmentally conscious cleaning company in Asheville, Clean Green Asheville. Josh makes tactical gear like tourniquet holders and works out of his airstream shop. We are both very friendly and active people and we do all of the work on both properties ourselves :-)

name: Colorful & Artistic W. Ashev. Home
summary: A leisurely 10 minute walk to W. Asheville's cafés, restaurants & bars, our home offers mountain views, vibrant sunsets, a colorful interior, and a healthy garden.  Only 5 minute drive to downtown and Biltmore.  Enjoy fresh eggs and welcoming hosts.
space: Enjoy a true West Asheville experience in a colorful home with vibrant gardens and backyard chickens.  You can tell all your friends that you stayed in Authentic Asheville.   Whether you are enjoying morning coffee on the spacious front porch or a glass of wine on the back deck, you'll relax right in our inviting space.   Our home is uniquely us - purple on the outside and festive on the inside.  Only four years old, designed by us, and built by the green building company Russ works for, we love making our home a warm, welcoming environment for friends, family and guests complemented by the best mountain views in West Asheville.  The location is pretty amazing (read more below) and positions you to enjoy many different aspects of Asheville on foot or by car. We keep our home clean and take pride in tending it.  Your room comfortably sleeps two adults with room on the floor to create a pallet for a child.    We invite you to stay with us and enjoy our home.
description: A leisurely 10 minute walk to W. Asheville's cafés, restaurants & bars, our home offers mountain views, vibrant sunsets, a colorful interior, and a healthy garden.  Only 5 minute drive to downtown and Biltmore.  Enjoy fresh eggs and welcoming hosts. Enjoy a true West Asheville experience in a colorful home with vibrant gardens and backyard chickens.  You can tell all your friends that you stayed in Authentic Asheville.   Whether you are enjoying morning coffee on the spacious front porch or a glass of wine on the back deck, you'll relax right in our inviting space.   Our home is uniquely us - purple on the outside and festive on the inside.  Only four years old, designed by us, and built by the green building company Russ works for, we love making our home a warm, welcoming environment for friends, family and guests complemented by the best mountain views in West Asheville.  The location is pretty amazing (read more below) and positions you to enjoy many different aspects of Asheville
neighborhood_overview: We landed an ideal location when we built our home.  A great neighborhood to walk through with friendly faces abounding, we are just a seven minute walk to West Asheville's eclectic restaurants, bars, locally-owned shops, and cafes that go on for about 2 miles.  Like walking?  Extend your mileage and walk down to the River Arts District (5 minute walk) or downtown (25 minute walk) to enjoy a multitude of restaurants, free street performance art, art galleries, and theaters.  Hop in the car and drive to the Biltmore (5 minute drive) or out for a hike in the Blue Ridge Mountains (25 minute drive).
transit: All you need is within walking distance.  But, you'll definitely want to explore further and a car would be needed.  We have one driveway parking space waiting for you.  We also have two bikes (including helmets, lights, and locks) available for rent.  Let us know if you might be interested.
host_about: Russ and I have been together for nearly ten years.  We enjoy happy living, eating at local restaurants (of which there are so very many), designing and finishing home projects, tending our garden, keeping our chickens fed, working for two local businesses, and taking walks in our neighborhood.   After I had already decided to move to Asheville (en route from working as a tour guide in Skagway, AK and Boston, MA), Russ and I met on a cruise ship (oddly enough because this ain't our style at all) and the rest is history.  Since then, we have traveled to Spain, Alaska (again), Costa Rica, and the West Coast of the US.  We designed our home making it uniquely ours and Russ built it with the green building company where he has worked for over 8 years.  We are also lucky to have a long-term roommate and old friend -Jenn- who has lived with us since 2009.  She is easy-going, fun-loving, and currently studying to get her Masters in Social Work.  We LOVE living in Asheville, NC and are happy to call this big, small town home until forever.

space: My house is painted beautiful bright colors so hopefully you will find it an artsy cheerful place to be. There's purple, orange,  green, teal and many many green plants. There is a nice patio space in the back that is partly shaded and partly sunny.

There's purple, orange,  green, teal and many many green plants. There is a nice patio space in the back that is partly shaded and partly sunny. You would have access to anything you needed in the house. It's a small house, 2 bed/1bath, but I stay pretty busy, out and about.  I can be available for anything you need and if I am not there, feel free to call or text for recommendations for entertainment, food or drink. I lead a pretty busy and quiet life during the week (and really the weekend too). I will be coming and going from work and other appointments and when I am home, typically quietly working. I love that I can walk to everything, starting wi
neighborhood_overview: I love that I can walk to everything, starting with walking to my favorite coffee shop, Battlecat, just around the corner. Haywood Rd has everything I need within a mile and a half including market, grocery, yummy restaurants, bars with outdoor seating and great beer selection, my favorite yoga studio, juice bars, and my wonderful school where I teach! Everything is so close on a bike too- I can be downtown in 10 minutes, and my house is only a half mile from Carrier Park where I like to jog on the greenway by Hominy Creek/French Broad River. And I really love that folks are friendly and say hello.
notes: This listing is for my spare bedroom that has a nice full futon. The bathroom is shared with me.  My dog is a bit older and super sweet and friendly. If you stay here you would need to be super sweet to her and be attentive about shutting the doors and gate, though she is not one to dart out the door. The dog door needs to be open 24 hours a day.
transit: The ART bus is not super frequent or fast but there are stops that are close by and the schedule is easy to access online. Taxis are cheap if you want to get back from downtown later than the bus, around $10.
host_about: I am a hard working teacher. I like to walk, love to eat well and practice yoga. I love to read and learn and occasionally play some music or dabble in an artsy project. My partner and dog live here with me.

space: Just across the French Broad River from downtown Asheville is the neighborhood of West Asheville. Set back four blocks from West Asheville's main thoroughfare, Haywood Rd, is our 1100 sq. ft. 1920's bungalow on a half acre of flower, fruit, and herb gardens.  We have a nice, well supplied kitchen, one bath, and 2 comfortable bedrooms available for up to 4 quests (plus a kid or 2?). We are excited to announce our new addition to the house - a sunporch/ greenhouse, that is the perfect place for meals in the cool of the day.  LHS has very  convenient access to I-240, I-26 and I-40, getting you wherever you need to go with ease. It's a quiet residential neighborhood about a 12 minute bike ride to West Asheville central, 10 minute walk to Carrier Park on the French Broad River, about a 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville, and 2 blocks from the nearest city bus stop. host_about: My partner and I are parents for our 3 year old son, and horticulturalists who love the beauty and diversity of nature. Bill works extensively to plant edible plants in public spaces and cultivates his own orchards of fruit, nuts, and useful weeds. He dedicates his creative energy to helping our community by implementing his innovative ideas in regards to living more sanely on the planet. Monica is happily a stay at home mom, and homestead gardener - "holding down our fort".  Both of us are are doing our best to leave this place better than when it found us.

name: Eclectic bedroom in West Asheville
summary: Thoughtfully appointed moderate-sized room waiting to soothe your stress. ~Queen sized Sealy Posturpedic bed ~Mini-fridge, microwave, coffee/tea and fixings ~Iron & board ~32" HD television, Roku w/ Amazon Prime, Pandora, and earbud remote
space: I bought my first home a year ago, and learning to  fix it up slowly-but-surely is a delight. I am sure you will love the details in your room. Guests also have access to my favorite spaces: ~sitting room on the main level perfect for getting in a bit of work on your trip  ~the guest bath in the hallway is shared with my guests in another room and folks that come through during the day, but don't fret - I have a shelf set aside just for you to assure you feel welcome, comfortable, and at your ease while you're staying with me, and the bathroom is cleaned daily ~When the weather is nice, the front and side porches are great spots for a cup of coffee or tea PLEASE NOTE: I own a small Boston Terrier and a Boxer/Pug mix, and occasionally have visits from or dogsit my mother's Schnoodle. They are all are very friendly dogs, but this listing is only appropriate for those who can tolerate small loving fur balls in common spaces (they will, of course, not have access to your room).
description: Thoughtfully appointed moderate-sized room waiting to soothe your stress. ~Queen sized Sealy Posturpedic bed ~Mini-fridge, microwave, coffee/tea and fixings ~Iron & board ~32" HD television, Roku w/ Amazon Prime, Pandora, and earbud remote I bought my first home a year ago, and learning to  fix it up slowly-but-surely is a delight. I am sure you will love the details in your room. Guests also have access to my favorite spaces: ~sitting room on the main level perfect for getting in a bit of work on your trip  ~the guest bath in the hallway is shared with my guests in another room and folks that come through during the day, but don't fret - I have a shelf set aside just for you to assure you feel welcome, comfortable, and at your ease while you're staying with me, and the bathroom is cleaned daily ~When the weather is nice, the front and side porches are great spots for a cup of coffee or tea PLEASE NOTE: I own a small Boston Terrier and a Boxer/Pug mix, and occasionally have visits from
neighborhood_overview: I live in a quiet, safe, up-and-coming residential neighborhood. It's not all the prettiest, but I feel very safe here. There are not loud parties or issues in the evenings (and, of course, my guests and I show our neighbors that same courtesy in return). My home is a brick rancher built in the 60s with nearly an acre of property - this neighborhood was built before they started really packing the houses one on top of the other. Extremely easy access to Patton Ave (straight to downtown) or to i-40 (which will get you anywhere else around Asheville). About 15 minutes from downtown whichever way you take. 25 minutes to the airport.
notes: I do run an interactive theatrical business out of my home/property, so that means people coming through with some regularity, and often into the later evenings. This is primarily in the downstairs space, which is soundproofed so I don't foresee any issues, but don't hesitate to speak up if anything isn't feeling good on your end and I'll what kind of accommodation I can make. PLEASE NOTE: I own a small Boston Terrier and a Boxer/Pug mix, and occasionally have visits from or dogsit my mother's Schnoodle. They are all are very friendly dogs, but this listing is only appropriate for those who can tolerate small loving fur balls in common spaces (they will, of course, not have access to your room).
transit: Off-street parking is available for your one car at our home. The closest bus stop involves walking a busy road with no sidewalk, so we don't recommend it. You can drive a very short distance to another stop and then bus into downtown proper if your heart is set on public transit. Uber has many affordable options in town. Other local taxi services are also relatively reasonable. Those with bikes could use them, please again be aware of your own safety needs and comfort levels with roads that lack shoulders or biking lanes.  I'm happy to recommend my best tips for finding easy parking downtown during Drum Circle, festivals, etc.
host_about:
I relocated four years ago to Asheville from New York State, looking for a change of pace. Sure found it! I love this town and its quirky people. Bought my first house almost two years ago, and working hard in my downtime to fix it up - it's a passion-project, I love being crafty and learning how houses work! The guest rooms were first on the list, and you'll occasionally see a work-in-progress as you visit. Don't worry, I keep the dust to a minimum when guests are in the house!

From being a fast-paced-burned-out-exec I have turned into a part-time chinese health clinic manager, part-time horse drawn carriage tour guide, and student. All these activities keep me on-the-go, so we may or may not meet when I'm hosting unless the stars align! When we do, I am super-happy to chat over a cuppa, make recommendations, and learn more about the awesome guests who come through my home. Always feel welcome to text, even if we don't connect face-to-face :)

I love travel, meeting new people, and discovering new experiences!  I lived in Paris for a year in my early adulthood, have lived in many states and moved more than 30 times as an adult - as a former vagabond, I love hearing about your experiences.

When hosting, I want to be sure you're as comfortable (or even more so!) as you would have been at home. I keep the house as clean as possible for everyone's mutual comfort, and the shared bath is cleaned daily to be sure it's fresh when you're getting ready for your plans in town.

Looking forward to meeting you and hosting you in my home!

summary: Be guests in our new home in an upstairs bedroom with a private  bath downstairs. Enjoy living in Asheville for a few days, in a wooded area, but close to everything.  Safety and your enjoyment are our primary concerns.
description: Be guests in our new home in an upstairs bedroom with a private  bath downstairs. Enjoy living in Asheville for a few days, in a wooded area, but close to everything.  Safety and your enjoyment are our primary concerns. The shady back deck is available for reading, talking, working on your laptop, as well as for breakfast on Saturday in summer.  Sorry, though, cool weather makes the porches less functional. Guests may sit in kitchen for morning coffee/tea and homemade baked goods Tuesday-Friday or on porches in summer. We love to provide information and help, but can also respect quiet time. We are on the edge of West Asheville abutting a private school campus. At two miles distance are great cafes,restaurants and entertainment.  And of course, downtown Asheville has all that and more: 5 miles. Best if you have your own car, but Craig is an Uber driver. Our home is not child ready, and the room is available only for two adults, unless special arrangements are made in advance.

notes: Our home is not child ready, and the room is available only for two adults, unless special arrangements are made in advance.
transit: Best if you have your own car, but Craig is an Uber driver.
host_about:
Craig and I moved into our newly constructed West Asheville home in May 2014. Santina is a retired psychotherapist who loves gardening, cooking, and meeting with friends. Craig is an Uber driver as well as a photographer/personal historian.

Our home is a wooded oasis just 2 miles from the center of West Asheville and 4 miles from downtown.  Deer, wild turkeys and rabbits are frequent visitors.

name: Private Asheville Cabin Apartment
space: NO CLEANING FEE!  Our private log cabin home has an apartment available for your stay in beautiful Asheville.  This 2 bedroom apartment has a private entrance, fully equipped kitchen, central a/c, wood burning fireplace, wi-fi, phone, cable tv, deck, a firepit and a horseshoe court.  The bedrooms are furnished with queen size beds.  Come enjoy the peace and quiet in the woods but also the convenience of only being 15 minutes or less away from the Blue Ridge Parkway, the Biltmore Estate, Warren Wilson College,  the historic Grove Park Inn, antique shops and art galleries and everything else that Asheville has to offer.  For the more adventurous, try hiking, kayaking or zip lining.  Small mountain towns overflowing with charm are just a short drive.  Crafts and artist galleries are in abundance.  The eating is great, and it isn't just the southern cuisine.  Vegetarians and carnivores will both be happy in this town.  Literally, you could be in downtown Asheville eating at one of the fabu

host_about: This photo was taken by some friends when we went on one of the many beautiful hikes in the Asheville area.  It was actually a waterfall hike in the Pisgah National Forest near Brevard.  My husband and I are native Ohio Buckeyes. I have worked in accounting but now enjoy yoga, dancing, sewing and reupholstering.  I also recently became a nanny for 3 little girls and am having a lot of fun doing it.  My husband has worked in the telecommunications field for years and continues to do so.  We like to visit our grandson, daughter and son-in-law in Boston and have another daughter here in Asheville, NC.  We love it when the whole family can get together.  Whether we are sitting on the deck or by the cozy fireplace, we love to share our place with family and friends.

summary: Our house is super homey. Its just the two of us and we are trying to help people out who are visiting asheville we can tell you all about it! Super chill quiet place away from all the hustle and bustle. Come stay! :)

You don't hear very many cars, and Warren Wilson College is located down the road and has SPECTACULAR views of the mountains/sunset, as well as many hiking trails and bodies of water and you can see all the animals as you drive by! Plus there's a pretty awesome view from my front porch. :) Right down the road is a bus stop, and there's another one a little bit farther next to the gas station. Uber as well.

name: Rejuvenating Room with River View
summary: Professionally decorated queen bed w/private, adjacent full bath. Wifi, Keurig, small fridge, cozy chair, and breathtaking river views; covered parking, 2nd-story apartment, shared living, kitchen, and balcony. 7 min to  downtown, 1 min to BRPkwy.
space: Relaxing, modern, BoHo, vintage-inspired apartment home, with spacious balcony across the back side of the apartment, overlooking the river.  River has easy access to your canoe or kayak.  2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment with long time couple and their Boxer mix:  Boulevard, or Boule for short.  Airbnb rental is 1 bedroom with 1 bath.

Wifi, Keurig, small fridge, cozy chair, and breathtaking river views; covered parking, 2nd-story apartment, shared living, kitchen, and balcony. 7 min to  downtown, 1 min to BRPkwy. Relaxing, modern, BoHo, vintage-inspired apartment home, with spacious balcony across the back side of the apartment, overlooking the river.  River has easy access to your canoe or kayak.  2 bedroom, 2 bath apartment with long time couple and their Boxer mix:  Boulevard, or Boule for short.  Airbnb rental is 1 bedroom with 1 bath. In addition to their bed and bath, guests have access to the common living area, kitchen, balcony, and laundry.  Grounds are shared by all who live in this small complex.  Covered parking is on the river side of the apartments, with stair access to front porch of apartment. Boule is a friendly dog who loves attention.  He is also self sufficient, so interact with him as you wish.  Robert and Amanda are in and out an
neighborhood_overview: Rivers Edge Apartments is a small complex built on a river.  All units have riverside, covered balconies and front porches.  Neighbors play with their pets and children in the common areas.  The river is a source of peace and fun for all.
notes: In case you missed it:  There are 2 flights of covered stairs from the parking area to the apartment.
transit: Taxis and Uber service our neighborhood and Asheville.  A bus stop is on Tunnel Road.  You can walk to the Root Bar and a few fast food restaurants on Tunnel Road--but why would you?
host_about:
We are a fun loving, artistic, creative couple. After a long time in NYC (and tons of other cities) we have found ourselves making this beautiful town home, at least for the time being. 

Robert is a writer who works from home, and Amanda works nights while balancing several other theatrical and creative projects. We share our home with the best roommate ever, our dog Boule (pronounced Bully). He is the most gentle giant and will most likely the best thing about your trip to Asheville. 

When we aren't working we love to drink the awesome beer this region has to offer, listen to live music, support the local theatres with our time and talent, and make sure to have to use Uber once a week.  Amanda and Boule love to hike and can offer advice on breathtaking views or a good watering hole (beware the cold!!)

We look forward to sharing our home with you ! :)

name: Cozy mountain retreat with views!
summary: Our beautiful studio apartment, tucked away in the woods on top of the mountain has so much to offer. With beautiful views over looking the smokey mountains and centrally located 15 mins from both downtown Asheville and Black Mountain it is the perfect peaceful get away. Charming. Romantic. Relaxing.
space: This charming, cozy studio apt has so much to offer. It comfortably sleeps 2 people, (however a 3rd person can be arranged at an extra charge.) With its large windows looking out over the mountains you can watch the birds, and squirrels, or maybe even see a fox or a bear! You have access to a privet deck with the most magical morning views, a wonderful place to sit and enjoy your coffee. If you feel like staying in and watching a movie there's an XBOX 360, Netflix, HBO go, cable, and a large DVD collection to choose from when we are home.  You will find a selection of coffee and and tea for your enjoyment. It is the perfect romantic get away, or retreat to write. If you are passing through ridding the blue mountain parkway we are just a hop, skip and a jump away. We are close enough to town, yet magically set in the mountains. Relax in nature or visit a local brewery downtown.   Either way enjoy all the wonderful aspects of Asheville.
