neighborhood_overview: Beautiful, romantic, quiet and peaceful. The views, woods, nature and wild life surround you.
notes: This studio apt is perfect for a romantic getaway for a couple. A family with 1 child. Anyone riding the blue ridge parkway. Writers. Yogis. A quiet place to relax. We are very close to the Warren Wilson campus which offers beautiful hikes and walks along the river. As well as fun events in the summer time.
transit: Sometimes you can call an uber, if not you can park at the bottom of the hill at the community center and catch one from there. Otherwise we are about 12 min to downtown.
host_about:
I am a fun loving creative artist. I love meeting new people and finding inspiring adventures. I am a woman of many roles, Casting Director, Interior Designer, real estate adventurer. 
My partner Ayden, is an author and actor. A truth seeker. A meditation teacher and life coach. 
Our home is peaceful and relaxing. A perfect place to enjoy time with your loved one, or quiet time alone.

name: Sweet, private, above-garage studio
summary: Our studio above a detached garage is private, clean and cozy - ideal for a couple's weekend getaway.  We are 5 miles from downtown Asheville and about 1 mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway in a tiny bungalow neighborhood in East Asheville.
space: The studio includes hardwood floors, a little bar area and a clean bathroom with shower.  The studio ceiling is just under 8 feet, so please take note of that if you are tall.  There is wifi & Roku for some streaming television and access to your Netflix or MGo account.  We offer a mini refrigerator and Keurig coffee maker for your convenience.  Starbucks coffee, sugar & cream provided, along with bottled water in the fridge.  No food or toiletries provided, as there are so many dietary sensitivities, allergies, etc.  Also, there are so many great places to eat in Asheville!
description: Our studio above a detached garage is private, clean and cozy - ideal for a couple's weekend getaway.  We are 5 miles from downtown Asheville and about 1 mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway in a tiny bungalow neighborhood in East Asheville. The studio includes hardwood floors, a little bar area and a clean bathroom with shower.  The studio ceiling is just under 8 feet, so please take note of that if you are tall.  There is wifi & Roku for some streaming television and access to your Netflix or MGo account.  We offer a mini refrigerator and Keurig coffee maker for your convenience.  Starbucks coffee, sugar & cream provided, along with bottled water in the fridge.  No food or toiletries provided, as there are so many dietary sensitivities, allergies, etc.  Also, there are so many great places to eat in Asheville! We only have room for 1 car.  Please park on the stone parking area to the right of the garage.  You walk up the steps onto the deck and turn left to a stairway up to the studio do
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located in East Asheville, 5 miles from downtown, 4.5 miles to Biltmore Village and about 1 mile to the Blue Ridge Parkway.  The WNC Nature Center is about a mile away, and we are very close to a Starbucks, grocery store and a few fast food options.  A great new restaurant that we like in East Asheville is Copper Crown.  We are also very close to Highland Brewery.
notes: This is a studio over a garage that we use, so you may hear the door open and close.  We try to keep this to a minimum. We are a busy family of 4 coming and going from our home, and we have a dog living in the main house.
transit: Our neighborhood is located very close to a bus stop.  Please check Asheville Regional Transit online for schedules and fees to ride the buses.  Although we are within walking distance to Ingles Grocery and Starbucks, we recommend driving there instead of walking.  It is not easy to cross Tunnel Road on foot, as it is a very busy 4-lane highway.
host_about: Cara is a knitwear maker/designer working in the Asheville River Arts District, and Eric is a home builder.  We have 2 teenage sons.  Asheville has been our home for 15 years.  We love the mountains.

name: Serene stay-4min away: dwntwn/play
summary: Private queen bedroom just steps to full bath-shower/tub; sitting, coffee maker, sm fridge, ceiling fan, lrg closet. 1-story home shares living, gourmet kitchen, screened porch, gas grill; 4 min to downtown; easy access (phone number hidden)/BlueRidgePkwy-Enjoy!
space: Serene stay-4min away: dwntwn/play Enjoy our home and your private room with dedicated bath.  Wireless internet access.  Ellington, our dog, will join us in welcoming you.  You are minutes from downtown, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and all of the Asheville area.
description: Private queen bedroom just steps to full bath-shower/tub; sitting, coffee maker, sm fridge, ceiling fan, lrg closet. 1-story home shares living, gourmet kitchen, screened porch, gas grill; 4 min to downtown; easy access (phone number hidden)/BlueRidgePkwy-Enjoy! Serene stay-4min away: dwntwn/play Enjoy our home and your private room with dedicated bath.  Wireless internet access.  Ellington, our dog, will join us in welcoming you.  You are minutes from downtown, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and all of the Asheville area. You have access to our home, except our master suite.  You can cook (and clean!) in our gourmet kitchen, enjoy a fire or simply relax in our great room, breathe the fresh air on our screened back porch, and even grill something on our gas grill. Washer/dryer are at your disposal, too.  Let us know if you'll entertain your own guests and we will negotiate the use of space with y'all. We enjoy our work and active social life.  We will be available as much or as little as you
neighborhood_overview: We have a quiet, diverse neighborhood.  Stonebridge has one entrance and exit; its residents walk their pets and exercise within our boundaries and enjoy Asheville's playground and the wilderness beyond.
notes: We have wireless internet; ask us for the password.  Guy speaks a little French, and Anita recognizes a few words in Spanish.  We do speak many forms of USA English, especially: southern (urban and rural), mid-western, NYC, and Texas.  Ellington is a very friendly dog.  He is 1/2 King Charles Cavalier and 1/2 Havanese--both breeds are loyal, loving friends.  Please don't let him out the front door, but feel free to give him his cookie as you leave.  He WILL insist! If you have a car to park, you can park beside the drive, or at the very end of the drive next to the mailbox and I can usually back around one vehicle.
transit: Asheville's bus system has a stop just outside our neighborhood, on Middlebrook; and another stop at the intersection to Tunnel Rd.  Taxi service is also available.  Car rentals are at the entrance from Tunnel Rd., on Tunnel Rd.
host_about: Our kitchen has this motto, borrowed from Van Morrison:  "Ordinary Life Be My Rock."  Married since 1978, we have been grounded by that motto and our faith.  We have lived in Atlanta and other cites/towns in Georgia; Louisville, KY; 15 minutes from Washington, D. C.; SanAntonio, TX; St. Louis, MO; and now Asheville, NC since 2001.  We love Asheville; it is like a smaller version of Atlanta mixed with Guy's roots from the mountains of West Virginia.  We treasure its diversity, cultures, the arts, delicious foods, and the amazing creation that surrounds us 24/7.  Our home has been a center of hospitality all of our lives.  Now that our children are grown and no longer populating our place with their friends, we have room to share our home and city with you!  Come and enjoy Asheville.
street: Stonebridge Drive, Asheville, NC 28805, United States

summary: Cozy cabin in an urban retreat, warm, comfortable yet conveniently intown and minutes to Downtown, Biltimore Estate, plus the Blue Ridge Parkway. This escape within the city, just close the doors behind you to enter serenity!
space: Discover another 5 STAR Airbnb property we would like to showcase  Mid Century Home Close DownTown . We create comfortable distinct opportunities for unforgettable experiences, always inspired by the essence of the locale.  Thank you! Our cabin feels comfortable secluded but you are only about ten minutes to most points of interest. Let us pamper you once you step through the doors of our 1937 log cabin. neighborhood_overview: Homeland Park is a neighborhood built as a resort community of about 70 close by log cabins during the 1930s. It offers handcrafted log cabins and cottages each with unique and special characteristics still present, reminding visitors that this uncommon place is indeed one of Asheville's treasures. These cabins hold fast to their heritage of a time gone by.  This area will charm as you meander through its tree lined streets of oaks and dogwoods,  listening to the song birds. Today it is a terrific rental destination or temporary home while relocating. Everything is easy access.
notes: We provide linens, toilet paper, paper towels, coffee, and tea. In the bathroom we have a 3 in 1 Body Wash, Hand Soap & Shampoo, (Citrus + Aloe Body wash), infused with essential oils, botanical extracts, and a citrus and aloe scent, this invigorating wash nourishes and hydrates skin and hair, so it's gentle enough for everyday use. We didn't want you to pack these bulky items so you would have more room in your suitcase to bring back wonderful treasures you will find here in Asheville! Outdoor grill- (charcoal and starter not provided)
transit: Drive about 10 minutes to down town and park in any one of several parking decks where the first hour is always free. Street performers  make downtown an exciting and fun place to be. Many guests who want to enjoy the benefits of Asheville being called "Beer City USA" opt to use Uber or taxi ride.
host_about:
We are a couple who moved to Asheville, NC from Guatemala Central America  years ago after living overseas for 5 years. We traveled to Asheville after selling everything and brought our 2 dogs, and a couple of suitcases. 

We love to travel back to Guatemala to visit family and prefer to stay in homes rather than hotels. It is nice way to get a sense of where the locals eat and play!

For fun around here we have been in a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a Navitat Canopy Adventure zip line tour, ridden on the pubcycle, savor all the arts, tempt our palates in our food scene and enjoy Lake James.

 We would love to answer any questions you might have about Asheville during your stay at our place and work with you to make it memorable.

name: Private Lakefront Mother-in-Law Apt
summary: Enjoy this private 1000 sq. foot lower level apt suite on Kenilworth Lake in the heart of Asheville.  Large master bedroom and bathroom with claw foot tub, living room, full kitchen, and private patio. Steps from the lake with dock and pedal boat.
space: This house is so beautiful with 100 feet of lakefront, a dock and a fenced in yard if you want to bring your pet!  It is amazingly peaceful and relaxing yet so convenient to downtown Asheville.  Guests have called it their sanctuary. We hope that you will feel the same and allow us to pamper you with breakfast  (my husband is a chef)  and wine and cheese in the evening.   Full private apartment including kitchen, full bath, bedroom with electric fireplace, patio and access to lake with dock.  Washer and dryer also available to you.  Coffee maker and hairdryer.

Separate access from the outside to your apartment with key for privacy.  Full access to yard, hammock, firepit, lake, dock and pedalboat. We want you to be happy and comfortable while
notes: 2.5 miles from downtown and Biltmore Village.  1/2 mile from the Asheville mall and major bus lines but you would never know it from how quiet it is on the lake.   All you hear is nature.
transit: Parking on car pad in front of house.  Bus line 1/2 mile to everywhere.
host_about:
Hi,
Karl and and I recently made the choice to move to Asheville.    Our home is within the Asheville city loop but you would never know it.  All of the convenience of being near downtown with the peacefulness and beauty of being on a lake.  All you see from our lake home are trees and beautiful views that are peaceful and relaxing. People have called it their santuary from busy lives. We hope that you will feel the same and allow us to pamper you with a chef made breakfast each day (Karl is an actual restaurant chef)  and wine and cheese in the evening.

name: Groove Stone Getaway
summary: Located in a serene Blue Ridge Mountains' bedroom community, Groove Stone Getaway is minutes to the Biltmore House, Downtown Avl, Blue Ridge Pkwy -- all that Western NC offers. Space for 5...but tailored to maximize the relaxing comfort of 4 Guests.
space: Located in a serene bedroom community of the Blue Ridge Mountains, scenic and charming Groove Stone Getaway enjoys beautiful mountain views and fantastic sunsets from the comfort of the large 3-Season room located in the private backyard.   With a fireplace in the main living room, you will feel cozy on cool mountain nights.  Your living room offers a 40" HD Smart TV with free Netflix, on demand HBO GO, and YouTube access.  There is also a DVD player and plenty of DVD's for downtime.   Free high-speed Wi-Fi internet access is available throughout the house. Your kitchen and dining areas are open and bright, including a roomy 6-person dining set.  There is plenty of cabinet space, a glass top stove, fridge with ice maker, toaster, coffee maker and dishwasher to help make your stay simple and convenient. A washer and dryer are located in the hallway leading to the central bath. The bathroom has a full tub shower and new vanity, towels are provided along with starter shampoo and toilet pa

neighborhood_overview: Surrounded by the scenic Blue Ridge Mountains, with a short drive to the city, Groove Stone Getaway is located near all that Western North Carolina, and Asheville, have to offer.  As you begin to explore beautiful Western North Carolina, and Asheville, you will find Groove Stone Getaway conveniently located near everything -- whether you're here to hike, bike, shop, eat, drink, take a brewery tour or simply enjoy the mountain views, you will find it all within a 15 min drive: *Biltmore Estate--spend the day at the historic Vanderbilt Estate, the largest privately owned home in the US.  With over 250 rooms, 33 bedrooms, 43 bathrooms, 65 fireplaces, 3 kitchens, 250 acres of landscaped gardens and over 100 miles of hiking trials.  Visit the winery and tasting room, take a horseback ride, rent a bike or bring your own--you can even take a Segway tour and see the Estate in fun and unique way. *Biltmore Village--specialty boutiques, cafes and cobblestone streets make this a charming stop dur
notes: Groove Stone Getaway offers parking for two vehicles in a private drive.   Please note on-street parking is not permitted.
transit: Groove Stone Getaway offers parking for two vehicles in a private drive.   Please note on-street parking is not permitted.

name: Mid Century Modern Basement Apt..
summary: Quiet delight surrounded by gardens. Near shopping, restaurants, downtown Asheville, Blue Ridge Parkway, and public transportation.
space: Quiet delight surrounded by gardens. Near shopping, restaurants, downtown Asheville, Blue Ridge Parkway, and public transportation.Beautiful ground level, fully furnished basement apartment in mid Century Modern East Asheville home.  Owners live in main house. Private entrance.  Large living area with television (streaming only), dinning area, full kitchen that includes microwave, coffee maker, and blender.  Private bathroom with large walk-in  shower, bedroom with a queen size futon bed.  Linens provided.  Access to secluded patio, expansive gardens, and laundry room.  WiFi, Netflix and Hulu Plus.  Quiet neighborhood with many trees, friendly neighbors and places to walk.  Restaurant and shopping only minutes away.  Public transit nearby.   A short distance from the municipal gulf course and Blue Ridge Parkway.  8 minutes from downtown.  A great place to relax as well as enjoy the beauty and excitement of Asheville.  No smoking or pets, please.

host_about: Hi, I'm from Habana, Cuba.  I have been in the United States since 1968.  I just retired after almost 20 years teaching English as a Second Language first in Florida and then in Asheville.  I love hiking in the woods and being in nature.  I take care of my body, love cooking vegetarian dishes and dehydrating vegetables from my garden.  I belong to a conscious dancing community here in Asheville and dance at least twice weekly.

Within 1 mile of:    Blue Ridge Parkway    Highland Brewing    Veterans hospital  Within 7 miles of:    Grove Park Inn    Biltmore House    Orange Peel (all downtown venues) We try to be around when you need us, but not to bother you. host_about:
My lady Terri and I have been wanting to become hosts for some time now. We both have been in Asheville for over 10 years and we have seen our beloved town turn into one of the most desirable destinations in the southeast.  We love our town and enjoy sharing it with as many people as possible. Hotels have become expensive in town and we enjoy keeping our cabin a very reasonable alternative for prospective visitors. 

I live in the cabin as often as I can but I do travel for work often.  Giving the perfect opportunity to share my home whit anyone traveling to town.  Welcome to my tiny cabin and take good care of it while I'm gone.

name: The Kitty Loft
summary: This is a sweet, quirky little apartment 10 minutes from downtown Asheville. It is a small studio with bedroom, bathroom, living area and kitchenette. Please make sure to read the entire detailed description before booking!
space: This is a very cute, private loft close to downtown Asheville. It's seconds from I-40 so it's very convenient if that's your route into town, and it's a comfortable space if you're looking to unwind after a day (or night) on the town. Here's the catch: This space is on the top floor of an animal hospital. It is directly above the dog kennels, which is why this apartment is probably one of the cheaper ones you're looking at today. It's a bit of a gamble... often there are no dogs spending the night, or the ones there are totally quiet- other times you get a barker or two. I do have a white noise machine in the apartment that works like a charm for me. If you're a light sleeper this might not be the place for you. There is no way to know in advance if there will be dogs downstairs. Catch #2: Some of the dogs that stay in the clinic are not very well house trained and sometimes make a mess. Being above them, you might catch some fumes rising up. You're welcome to open all of the windows a

neighborhood_overview: Chunns Cove is a world unto itself. We have one  86 year old neighbor whom you can barely visible through the trees, otherwise all you can see is a spectacular 270 degree view of the valley and woods opposite from the house. The cove is human-quiet but bird-noisy! We regularly see creatures that you wouldn't expect and could easily mistake this place in summer for a Costa Rican rain-forest! Ingles, our local grocery store, is 2 minutes down the road and Walgreens is 5 minutes away.  Our favorite dinner restaurants are the Admiral in West Asheville and the Bull & Beggar in the River Arts District for which we recommend reservations but you might find a couple of seats around the bar to order a selection of fabulous plates. Lunch time we are partial to Chai Pani's Indian Street Food which i take with no spices and Doc Chey's is ideal on a tight budget but arrive early or be prepared to wait for a seat.

name: Lovely mtn home with a view! 1
summary: Lovely south facing room with very comfortable queen size bed. Private bath with jacuzzi. Linens and towels provided. Room darkening shades. You will have access to entire house. Nice, safe residential neighborhood. Secluded yet close to downtown.
space: Linens and towels provided. You will have access to entire house. Nice, safe residential neighborhood. Secluded yet close to downtown. Located halfway between downtown and the parkway in beautiful Haw Creek valley. Retreat like setting on 3 beautiful acres with stream. Relax on the front porch or back patio and watch the animals. Wifi but no TV. Very quiet and relaxing. Fragrance free and smoke free. Comfortable, clean and affordable.  Please note that there are two other rooms for rent as well if you are more than 2 people.  .  Also please note that even though I have no pets, I often pet sit. So be sure to check first if you prefer no pets. You will need a car as the house is 10 minutes from downtown. Please contact me through airbnb if you need more information about the house or the area.

name: Cozy Room in Mountain Home
summary: Cozy study/bedroom with pull out sofa bed. TV available for movies but no cable. In quiet country neighborhood but only 25 minutes from downtown Asheville and 20 from Black Mountain!
space: This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only minutes from town. This bedroom is a fairly small space (cozy = small) so it's ideal for people traveling alone or with very light baggage. Two people are a bit of a squeeze but it can be done! The bathroom is shared between this and one other bedroom. The bed is a pull out sofa so it's not the most comfortable bed you've ever slept on but it does get the job done.
description: Cozy study/bedroom with pull out sofa bed. TV available for movies but no cable. In quiet country neighborhood but only 25 minutes from downtown Asheville and 20 from Black Mountain! This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only minutes from town. This bedroom is a fairly small space (cozy = small) so it's ideal for people traveling alone or with very light baggage. Two people are a bit of a squeeze but it can be done! The bathroom is shared between this and one other bedroom. The bed is a pull out sofa so it's not the most comfortable bed you've ever slept on but it does get the job done. Guests will have access to shared bathroom but will probably have it to themselves unless both of my spare bedrooms are rented for the same night. Communal areas include spacious living room, kitchen, dining room and outdoor areas with hammocks and fire pit. I will be in and out of the house throughout the
neighborhood_overview: The best part of this neighborhood is that there's very little neighborhood at all. You are in a very peaceful private setting with no nearby houses visible. You'll be surrounded by forests, meadows and farms.
notes: Please note that there is no wifi at the house, and cell phone reception is spotty. Most people can get clear reception outdoors and in some rooms of the house, but be prepared to be out of touch! Also, I am on well water. Occasionally the water will run red because of iron in the well, especially if it hasn't rained in a while. This is not dangerous to your health and if you run the water for a couple of seconds it will clear up. It is safe to drink the tap water but if you think this will bother you then you may want to bring some bottled water with you.
transit: The nearest bus stop is about three miles away. You will need a car. Rental services are available at the airport. Parking is on site. Keep in mind that the roads near my house are pretty windy. You may want to add a few minutes to your expected commute if you're not used to mountain roads.

neighborhood_overview: Beverly Hills is located central to some of Asheville's most popular attractions. This is a very quiet neighborhood but in very close proximity to downtown. Great dog friendly and family safe neighborhood. Lots of walkers, joggers and street biking. We are very close to the parkway and it is an awesome place to live. The Nature Center Recreation Park and Soccer Complex are 2 minutes from the house. We are also surrounded in Beverly Hills by the municipal golf course.   We have many superb restaurants in Asheville. My favorite southern breakfast that is close by is Happy Jacks with awesome organic local ingredients that are used. We also have close by Pomedora's Italian and East Village Grille for incredible steaks and sandwiches if you don't fill up on their appetizers. Last but not least is Ultimate Ice Cream which is handmade by the local owners. For those who like shopping we are located 5 minutes from the Asheville Mall. Asheville also offers an eclectic selection for shopping that
notes: The gate entrance has a touch of rustic ruggedness so be sure to watch your steps on this short river rocks walkway!!! (See pictures) !!!
transit: We are a short walk to the public bus line. Taxicabs services are also available. Avis car rental service is located 5 minutes from the house.
host_about: I am an Asheville NC native, born and raised here. I love the mountains. I have 4 grown children and 3 grand children, and I am an avid dog lover.

name: Cozy AVL Suite Near Everything
summary: Sweet private sanctuary only 5 min. to downtown, features private entrance, fully-loaded kitchenette, super comfy queen-sized Sleep Number bed with memory foam topper. Recently renovated with full private bathroom, separate living area with futon, A/C  and dine-in table.  Enjoy the fully fenced back yard and hot tub access under large trees.  Dog and kid-friendly with access to trampoline and swingset.  Private driveway and off-street parking.  5 min to Blue Ridge Parkway, downtown and shopping.
space: Sleeps up to three adults comfortably (perfect for a small family or a couple plus one friend). Clean and recently remodeled with beautiful cork flooring and two lockable private entrances. Recreational amenities include: badminton court, disc golf basket, hammock, fire pit, hot tub, screened porch, giant trampoline, and swingset. Fresh towels and linens are waiting for you. Kitchenette includes mini-fridge, microwave, hotplate, sink, french press with coffee, tea, and the fixins. Wi-fi available.

Kitchenette includes mini-fridge, microwave, hotplate, sink, french press with coffee, tea, and the fixins. Wi-fi availab
neighborhood_overview: I am lucky to live in one of Asheville's older and more established neighborhoods, with tall trees and lush natural beauty. You'll be amazed at how private it is while being so conveniently located to Asheville's main attractions. You might even glimpse some local wildlife when driving through the neighborhood. I live on a relatively busy road (depending on time of day), but the house is tucked up and set back from the road, so it's also very peaceful.
notes: It is a shared driveway so please make sure to park all the way behind my house. If you access the back yard, please keep the privacy gates closed at all times. (My dogs are curious travelers and I'd rather they stay safe at home). I will allow one friendly and well-behaved dog to accompany your trip (so long as shots and flea/ tick treatments are up to date). The hot tub is wonderful, and please make sure to turn the jets off when you are finished with your soak.
transit: I live on a bus line for public transportation and anywhere you want to go is pretty much less than ten minutes away by car. The exit for my home is two exits from downtown with easy access to restaurants and shopping. My home is not super-walkable to places, so you'll likely want motorized transport. (Though there is a family-friendly neighborhood pub less than 1/2 a mile away) Cab fare to central downtown runs an average of $15. (4.5 miles away) and Uber has been quoting $10-$12 to get downtown.
host_about: I'm a fun-loving, compassionate, creative and hospitable human who loves her home, city and dogs very much. I welcome sharing my guest suite with respectful and kind folks looking to explore the local scene and all it has to offer. I'm happy to respect your privacy entirely or make new friends along the way. Happy adventuring, everyone!

The cove is human-quiet but bird-noisy! We regularly see creatures that you wouldn't expect and could easily mistake this place in summer for a Costa Rican rain-forest! Ingles, our local grocery store, is 2 minutes down the road and Walgreens is 5 minutes away. name: Charming Country Farmhouse
summary: This quaint country house is tucked up in a cove in East Asheville just 15 min from downtown. A single dwelling house with the original deed dating back over 100 years. Cozy and comfortable with a great outdoor deck to enjoy the natural landscaping.
space: The main floor of the house has a living room with a wood stove, lounge/den with a music entertainment center, kitchen/dining area, bedroom with queen bed and a bathroom. The second floor has a desk/office/sitting area, a bedroom with a king bed and Apple TV (only TV in the house), a bedroom with a single bed and a bathroom. A private deck area with a table, umbrella, chairs, portable fire pit and gas grill. Parking for 4 cars. A short but vigorous trail behind the house will get your heart rate going. And a charming out building will be mostly off limits with access to only 1/3 of it.

neighborhood_overview: You are staying in a country house on a charming country cove with a creek across the road. Neighbors stay to themselves but are friendly and helpful. The closest grocery store, gas station and restaurants are 3-4 miles from the house and are mostly located on Tunnel Rd.
notes: There are hiking/biking trails at the end of Shope Creek Rd that deadends into the Blue Ridge Parkway land, 1.5 miles from the house. Other close by trails are at Warren Wilson College 5 min away. A nearby wedding/event venue is Bull Creek Ranch.
transit: You will need your own car, bicycle or motorcycle to get around.

name: Comfortable Basement Apartment
summary: One bedroom, one bath private basement apartment in beautiful mountain home. Private entrance, incredible views and tons of outdoor space including fire pit.
space: Finished basement apartment. The bedroom has a queen bed, cedar lined closet and vanity closet with sink. There is no window in the bedroom. Some people really like having a very dark bedroom, for others it can be unsettling. Both the kitchen and the bathroom do have windows. The laundry room has washer and dryer that you are welcome to use, along with a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave and toaster. This kitchen is not set up for heavy duty cooking (no pots and pans, stove top or oven) but it gets the job done for casual meals or reheating leftovers. Dishes are provided. The bathroom is small but has a fairly large shower and excellent water pressure. Please note that there is no internet, tv or cell reception indoors, although you can get a clear signal outside. This is an "unplugged" apartment.  The house has beautiful views and loads of space to roam. There's an outdoor fire pit that you are more than welcome to use, and hammocks for lounging in the summer. Very private loca
description: One bedroom, one bath private basement apartment in beautiful mountain home. Private entrance, incredible views and tons of outdoor space including fire pit. Finished basement apartment. The bedroom has a queen bed, cedar lined closet and vanity closet with sink. There is no window in the bedroom. Some people really like having a very dark bedroom, for others it can be unsettling. Both the kitchen and the bathroom do have windows. The laundry room has washer and dryer that you are welcome to use, along with a kitchenette with refrigerator, microwave and toaster. This kitchen is not set up for heavy duty cooking (no pots and pans, stove top or oven) but it gets the job done for casual meals or reheating leftovers. Dishes are provided. The bathroom is small but has a fairly large shower and excellent water pressure. Please note that there is no internet, tv or cell reception indoors, although you can get a clear signal outside. This is an "unplugged" apartment.  The house has beautiful v
neighborhood_overview: The best thing about this neighborhood is that there isn't really one! The house is fairly secluded but still only a short drive to Asheville or Black Mountain. The roads close to my home are very windy, so you may want to add a few minutes to your expected commute if you're not used to mountain roads.
notes: Again, please note that there is no internet or cell reception! Also, I do have a large(ish) dog, Bear, that has free roam of the property. He's very friendly but likes to play policeman, so be prepared for a loud greeting when you drive up to the house.  In winter, the basement can get a little chilly. This is an old house and not quite as efficient as I would like. There are space heaters in the bedroom and kitchenette, but if they don't do the trick please let me know and I will bring more heaters over. Please don't be shy!  I am on well water. Occasionally the water will run red because of iron in the well, especially if it hasn't rained in a while. This is not dangerous to your health and if you run the water for a couple of seconds it will clear up. It is safe to drink the tap water but if you think this will bother you then you may want to bring some bottled water with you.   Lastly, this house is in the country, and we typically don't lock doors out here. There will be a key fo
transit: I am about 5 miles from the nearest bus stop. Having a car is extremely helpful!

name: Constitution Cottage
summary: A cozy, clean and comfortable 3 bedroom/2.5 bath vacation rental property tucked away in a quiet peaceful setting while centrally located within a 15 minute drive of Downtown Asheville.
space: This brand new fully furnished 3 bedroom/2 ½ bath home can comfortably accommodate up to 6 people. All the furnishings and appliances are new.  The house is well equipped with superior bedding, bath towels, kitchen accessories (ie. pots, pans, silverware, plates etc.), blow dryer, iron, washer and dryer, high definition TVs in all the bedrooms with access to cable, Netflix and DVD player. Some exceptional extras include fire pit with adirondack chairs and a relaxing back porch. If travelling with children, the house contains board games and Nintendo Wii video game console to keep them entertained. The luxurious master bedroom with a King size bed and its own private bathroom is on the main level. Upstairs on the second level are the two additional bedrooms (one with a queen size bed and the other with two twin beds) which share a large bathroom and each have very spacious walk in closets.

Upstairs on the second level are the two additional bedrooms (one with a queen size bed and the other with t
neighborhood_overview: The house has beautiful winter mountain views and sits on an acre of land. It is part of Riceville Forest, a quaint residential community located 7 minutes from Warren Wilson College and 10 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, America's favorite scenic byway.  In the morning, you can take a stroll up Independence Way and become one with nature.  You may even see a cow or two. When you are not discovering one of the many nearby hiking trails or waterfalls, there are plenty of other fun activities around town to keep you busy including white water rafting, biking and zip lining. You can explore the downtown area, the River Arts District, or spend a day at the Biltmore Estate. You can also enjoy a beer or two at one of the many breweries in the area. For your convenience, you will find a few maps and travel guides at the house.
transit: Due to the tranquil retreat like setting of the home, having your own transportation is highly recommended for better access to all the great things Asheville has to offer. However, Uber services are also readily available in the area.
host_about: I'm a commercial real estate broker and mortgage broker originally from Miami, Florida.  A few years ago, I relocated to Asheville, NC, however, I do travel back to Miami on a monthly basis for work and to visit family. I'm a foodie and beer lover.  I also enjoy spending time outdoors!

name: Blue Ridge Cottage  5 Acre Forest
summary: The best of both worlds! Quiet, secluded cottage only ten minutes from downtown Asheville. Sip your morning beverage on a private deck on a 5.5 acre forest. Enjoy easy access to Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway & the Smokey Mountains.
space: Enjoy the best of both worlds! This quiet, secluded cottage sits on a private 5.5 acres of forest only ten minutes from downtown Asheville.  Sip your morning beverage on a private deck surrounded by the sights and sounds of the Blue Ridge Mountains. With easy access to Asheville's restaurant scene, you'll be free to stay fully connected to our city's rich and vibrant culture, or simply kick back, relax and enjoy a 360 degree wildlife immersion experience at the Blue Ridge Cottage. The cottage is surrounded by a forest of lush trees making it a perfect habitat for the diverse wildlife of Western North Carolina. We have raccoons, opossums, woodchucks, chipmunks, squirrels, turtles, rabbits with the occasional red fox and turkey. If you are a bird watcher, the spacious check will be a perfect place for spotting any of the 20 different species of birds our forest is home to.  Being only 2 minutes away from the Blue Ridge Parkway you may even be lucky enough to see the occasional deer or bl

notes: If your looking for a tranquil location that is 10 minutes from downtown Asheville, this is as good as it gets.
transit: We now have Uber in the Asheville area. The city bus is about 1/4 of a mile from The Blue Ridge Cottage. Parking is Free, and we can accommodate any autos, trailers, motorcycles or boats that you have.
host_about: My wife Sandy and I moved to Asheville 11 years ago to enjoy the rich community of Western North Carolina. I'm a professional photographer and travel around this region capturing images of our beautiful wildlife and surroundings landscapes. I offer Guide Services around Western NC both with and without photography lessons. Sandy, my wife, works in healthcare, and enjoys creating crafts and drawling in her spare time. Sandy and I both love to hike, raft, go to the numerous festivals and enjoy the diverse restaurants and music that we have in the Asheville area.

name: Peaceful Mountainside Living
summary: Just 10 minutes from downtown. Reside in  historic hunting grounds of the Vanderbilt's. The solitude will revive you from the bustle of our creative community. Tastefully decorated: private entrance, bath, and your own deck to enjoy the view!
space: Tucked adjacent to the Blue Ridge Parkway, yet located within the City limits, it's the perfect blend of nature, relaxation and access to all Asheville has to offer. This unique home is located in an upscale area and situated on 5 wooded acres. The Private suite features a bright and airy romantically inspired bedroom with outdoor access. Separate roomy living area with high ceilings, original art and fold down full sized futon, which can accommodate another guest.  Large private deck with views. Please note: Although not listed as a private apartment it does have a private entrance, locked doors and constitutes the entirety of a level in a large home.  We felt that since it does not have a kitchen, it would be improper to list it as an apartment.

We own and operate retail businesses downtown and would be pleased to share our experiences and insights of this wonderful area with frequent and first time Asheville guests and travellers.

Daniel and Marylou

name: Crescent Moon Cottage- Asheville NC
summary: Petite (300 sq. ft.) sweet & cozy cottage. 10 minutes from downtown Asheville and 2 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway. Completely updated with queen tempurpedic bed, WIFI, washer dryer, front screened porch and private back patio.
space: Crescent Moon Cottage is a petite, quaint and cozy 300 square foot stand-alone cottage, perfect for an individual or couple that appreciate a very clean, beautifully decorated and fully equipped small and cozy private space. Located in a historic cottage and log cabin community just 10 minutes from Downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway and the the Biltmore House.The cottage is updated, bright with lots of natural light with completely equipped kitchen and linens.New, Queen-size, temperpedic bed for a great nights sleep. Screened- in front porch with swing and rocker, and back flagstone courtyard with privacy-fence adds to the charm and provides additional space to relax and unwind. Small dog allowed with additional $25 housekeeping fee. Check-in is 4:00 pm or after and check-out is 11:00 am.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood was built in the 1930's and was originally called Homeland Park. It was a vacation destination with quaint cottages and log cabins for guests. The neighborhood is wooded with lots of large oak-trees, dogwoods etc. The neighborhood is a community in the sense that neighbors know one another, do things together and look out for each other.  The neighborhood is walkable and very pet friendly.   I will allow a well-behaved, house-broken dog, with the payment of an additional $25 charge for housekeeping. This fee is not included in the AIRBNB payment and will be collect during your stay at the cottage.
notes: A well-behaved, house-broken dog is allowed with an additional payment of $25.00 housekeeping fee. This fee is not included in the AIRBNB payment and is collected during your stay. The neighborhood is eclectic and pet friendly. The Cottage is within a short driving distance to most Asheville attractions and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
transit: The neighborhood is centrally located in Asheville with short drives to downtown Asheville, downtown Black Mountain, the Blue Ridge Parkway and the Biltmore House.  Entrances to interstate 240 are within 2 miles of the cottage.  Parking is located in front of the cottage and is off street parking.  Asheville Airport is located about 25 miles from the cottage.
host_about:
I grew up St. Petersburg, Florida and hold a Masters degree from Florida State University.  I've been in Asheville, NC since 2000 and love everything about it.  I love the mountains and nature and prefer to be outdoors.  I am an animal lover and have two little doxies and a cat.  I like to hang out with friends, spend time with family and garden. I am a nonprofit accounting and finance professional and was most recently employed at MANNA FoodBank as CFO.  

Setting up my little cottage as a seasonal rental was a labor of love and I believe that this is felt in the great energy in the cottage.  I want guests to feel completely at home and have everything they need to be able to enjoy their stay in Asheville.  I am somewhat informal in my approach to renting the cottage and like to accommodate guests as much as possible. The most important thing for me in renting the cottage is that my guests are comfortable and get a good nights rest so that they can get out and enjoy everything that our great little city in the mountains has to offer.

name: Private Retreat Near Downtown
summary: Our spacious bedroom + private bath open onto a lovely patio, perfect for morning coffee. Minutes from downtown or hiking on the Blue Ridge. Chill out in the garden or play golf at the course around the corner. Permitted by City of Asheville.
space: Spacious bedroom with separate entrance and private bath. Off street parking. Fits 2 people comfortably. Has microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker with coffee, tea and snacks.
description: Our spacious bedroom + private bath open onto a lovely patio, perfect for morning coffee. Minutes from downtown or hiking on the Blue Ridge. Chill out in the garden or play golf at the course around the corner. Permitted by City of Asheville. Spacious bedroom with separate entrance and private bath. Off street parking. Fits 2 people comfortably. Has microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker with coffee, tea and snacks. Access to patio with wisteria arbor and garden. I am available to give tips on enjoying Asheville and I will respect my guests privacy. My neighborhood is quiet and has an historic golf course around the corner. They let people walk the course before and after hours which makes for a lovely local outing. The area has been designated as an urban forest because there are so many large mature trees in the neighborhood. There are city buses 2 blocks away. Downtown is 7 minutes by car. Blue Ridge Parkway is 3 minutes by car. The Biltmore House is 12 minutes by car on I-40 or 20 mi
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is quiet and has an historic golf course around the corner. They let people walk the course before and after hours which makes for a lovely local outing. The area has been designated as an urban forest because there are so many large mature trees in the neighborhood.
notes: Due to the many dietary restrictions these days, I do not serve breakfast. You do have a mini fridge, microwave and coffee maker in the room, as well as glasses, coffee mugs, bowls and utensils. I supply coffee and tea along with condiments.
transit: There are city buses 2 blocks away. Downtown is 7 minutes by car. Blue Ridge Parkway is 3 minutes by car. The Biltmore House is 12 minutes by car on I-40 or 20 minutes via the scenic Blue Ridge Parkway. Nature Center and Swannanoa River is 4 blocks away.
host_about: I am an avid designer of spaces both inside and out. It gives me great joy to create environments that invite people to relax. Originally from New Orleans, I also love good jazz and a bowl of gumbo. Asheville has won my heart though and I enjoy exploring the many hiking trails in the area. The people here are some of the happiest you will meet anywhere. I love traveling and meeting others who value the experience of exploring different places on this amazing planet. I think Airbnb is an amazing network of fellow travelers.

name: Bright Bedroom with Amazing View!
summary: A cozy bedroom in a quiet country setting while only minutes from downtown Asheville. Comfortable, quiet and private.
space: This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only minutes from town. This bedroom has a full bed and comfortably sleeps one or two.
description: A cozy bedroom in a quiet country setting while only minutes from downtown Asheville. Comfortable, quiet and private. This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only minutes from town. This bedroom has a full bed and comfortably sleeps one or two. You will have access to a shared bathroom, although usually you will be the only one using it unless both of my extra bedrooms are rented for the same night. Communal areas include kitchen, living room, dining room and outdoor spaces. Be prepared for no wifi! I am usually in and out of the house throughout the day, but am mostly away. I'm easily accessible by phone and am more than happy to give tips for things to do around town and in the surrounding areas! The best part of this neighborhood is that there's very little neighborhood at all. You are in a very peaceful private setting with no nearby houses visible. You'll be surrounded by forests, meado
neighborhood_overview: The best part of this neighborhood is that there's very little neighborhood at all. You are in a very peaceful private setting with no nearby houses visible. You'll be surrounded by forests, meadows and farms.
notes: Please note that there is no wifi at the house, and cell phone reception is spotty. Most people can get clear reception outdoors and in some rooms of the house, but be prepared to be out of touch! Also, I am on well water. Occasionally the water will run red because of iron in the well, especially if it hasn't rained in a while. This is not dangerous to your health and if you run the water for a couple of seconds it will clear up. It is safe to drink the tap water but if you think this will bother you then you may want to bring some bottled water with you.
transit: The nearest bus stop is about three miles away. You will need a car. Rental services are available at the airport and parking is on site. The roads around my home are fairly windy, so add a few minutes to your expected commute if you're not used to driving on mountain roads.

name: Studio Apartment in Serene Setting.
summary: Studio apartment in quiet pastoral, garden setting thirteen minutes from downtown Asheville. Two minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, and five minutes from Warren Wilson College with full kitchen and bath. Retreat like setting. Two night minimum.
space: Wonderful, private, studio apartment with own entrance in downstairs of single family home. Great complement to any vacation to Asheville whether you are looking for some quiet time mixed with seeing the sites, or easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, or a retreat like atmosphere. Quiet, serene, and "the best nights sleep" are often used to describe people's stay here. Wonderful kitchen helps save money for those who wish to cook, or not have to run out for a cup of tea, or coffee first thing in the morning.
description: Studio apartment in quiet pastoral, garden setting thirteen minutes from downtown Asheville. Two minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, and five minutes from Warren Wilson College with full kitchen and bath. Retreat like setting. Two night minimum. Great complement to any vacation to Asheville whether you are looking for some quiet time mixed with seeing the sites, or easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, or a retreat like atmosphere. Quiet, serene, and "the best nights sleep" are often used to describe people's stay here. Wonderful kitchen helps save money for those who wish to cook, or not have to run out for a cup of tea, or coffee first thing in the morning. Guests have full access to gardens and own small covered sitting area outside of apartment. We are happy to provide you with suggestions for places to eat, directions, and things to see around town. Our neighborhood is semi-rural with ver
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is semi-rural with very little car traffic and lots of foot traffic. It is very quiet at night and you will see the beautiful night sky due to lack of street lights! We are close to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Folk Art Center, and Warren Wilson College.
notes: Driveway is shared, but plenty of room for parking.
transit: You will need a car in order to stay here. The closest bus line is a couple of miles away and not always reliable.
host_about:
Hello from CasaQuiet!

We are Sandi, Alan, and Greer.

I am Sandi a self-employed Clinical Herbalist, Holistic Health Educator, and Teacher. I am an organic gardener and lover of flowers! I have been blessed to be the owner and caretaker of this home and land for over a decade in which time I created an edible and medicinal wonderland. 

Alan is an Edible Mushroom and Wild Food expert and Educator. Greer is a nanny, studying to become a CNA, and a homemaker. We live simply, but well. Take good care of ourselves through exercise and eating well, and enjoy being around others who do the same.

At the moment, I am off exploring new horizons, but I will be here to book your reservation, answer any inquiries you may have, and take care of all of your arrival details. Then Alan and Greer will be your wonderful hosts during your actual stay.

We think humor and laughter are a daily necessity. Our home life is intentionally quiet and rejuvenating. Your stay at the studio apartment will certainly be the same.

Welcome, and enjoy your stay!

name: Riverbend "Treehouse" Studio
summary: Located along the Swannonoa River only 12 minutes from downtown Asheville, this quaint space is a perfect getaway for a romantic weekend or a personal retreat. Jacuzzi tub for two, private wooded porches w/hammock, and swing make this a sweet mountain getaway.
space: Relax on the hammock and enjoy the sounds of the river on the porch swing. The comfortable, private porch is the perfect place for reading, relaxing, and enjoying an afternoon beverage.  Enjoy a Jacuzzi tub for two and wind down. The studio is accessed through a private entrance with private parking and features a queen size bed and a queen size sleeper sofa, flat screen tv with Netflix and Hulu streaming services, DVD player, fridge, coffee maker, tea kettle, and microwave. Coffee, tea, and chilled water are provided.  Studio is stocked with care. Books, games, and art supplies for a creative and relaxing vacation.  The property is located in a house perched in the trees--ideal bird watching and spotting wild turkeys, river otters, blue herons, beavers, ducks, and the occasional black bear. The river is only accessible via a short walk across the street and down the riverbank.  Please note that while actual treehouses are amazing, this is a "treehouse," meaning a studio within a house

The property is located in a house perched in the trees--ideal bird watching and spotting wild turkeys, river otte
neighborhood_overview: This east Asheville neighborhood is a gorgeously wooded, private refuge with easy access to Asheville's best spots. 12 minutes to Downtown Asheville 3 minutes to Blue Ridge Parkway 5 minutes to Warren Wilson College 15 minutes to Bilmore Estate Creekside Tavern, Filo Bakery, MoJo Coffee Truck, Pomodoro's, and the world's best taco truck are only minutes away on Asheville's eastside.
notes: The studio adjoins the main house. We aim to provide a restful, respectful sanctuary. Locally produced chocolates, cheese, and crackers are available at arrival for an additional fee.  Home baked muffins and juice can also be delivered to your doorstep for a breakfast service up charge. A 20 pound rescue dachshund mix lives in the main house and is available for petting at guests' request. Coffee, chilled water, and tea are provided. Please help yourself.  You're welcome to use the sleeper sofa for extra sleeping.
transit: A private drive is available for guest parking.  Limit two cars per reservation.  Access to public transportation is available about one mile from the house on Tunnel Road.  For guests looking to arrive via air, Asheville has recently welcomed Uber ride service.

Loves: Asheville, soup, pups, and the sharing economy

name: Beautiful Mountain Home
summary: 4 bedroom home with beautiful views.  25 minutes to downtown Asheville and 20 minutes from Black Mountain. Spacious yard with fire pit and sun deck.
space: This home is beautifully situated overlooking a valley with a farm below. The house is clean and comfortable, and offers a relaxing atmosphere if you're trying to get away from the daily grind. There are 3 bedrooms in the main body of the house. The master bedroom has a private bathroom and deck, while the two additional bedrooms have a single bathroom shared between them. The master bedroom has a queen bed, the second bedroom has a full and the third has a pull out sofa that is about the size of a double. There is a kitchen that is outfitted with all the equipment, spices and cooking basics that you would need, a dining room with plenty of space for large parties, and a beautiful living room with large windows to enjoy the view.  The downstairs section of the house consists of a basement apartment. This apartment has a bedroom with queen sized bed and a small vanity closet with sink. Note that this bedroom has no windows. There is also a small bathroom (but it has a great shower with

name: Master Suite w/ whirlpool tub, king
summary: Spacious master suite featuring natural bedding and a whirlpool tub in feng shui-friendly East Asheville home, ten minutes from downtown with one foot in the country. The Blue Ridge Parkway and many trails are minutes away. A beautiful & tranquil retreat.
space: The master suite is quite luxurious for one or two people. It includes a king-size bed with a natural latex mattress, 100% bamboo fiber sheets, as well as a large bathroom with separate whirlpool tub & shower and his & hers sinks. The master suite is situated on the opposite end of the house from the other bedrooms, ensuring plenty of privacy. The home is a wonderful, contemporary design with great flow throughout.
description: Spacious master suite featuring natural bedding and a whirlpool tub in feng shui-friendly East Asheville home, ten minutes from downtown with one foot in the country. The Blue Ridge Parkway and many trails are minutes away. A beautiful & tranquil retreat. The master suite is quite luxurious for one or two people. It includes a king-size bed with a natural latex mattress, 100% bamboo fiber sheets, as well as a large bathroom with separate whirlpool tub & shower and his & hers sinks. The master suite is situated on the opposite end of the house from the other bedrooms, ensuring plenty of privacy. The home is a wonderful, contemporary design with great flow throughout. Shared kitchen, patio, 1/2 bath, living room, and dining area. Included is a complimentary tea & coffee bar. I stay quite active, yet committed to make your stay pleasurable. If I can't arrange to be there when you arrive, I'll leave a key with instructions. There will be towels and everything you need! Also, I'm very avail
neighborhood_overview: 12 minutes from downtown Asheville but we have friendly cows just across the street. The house is minutes away from lots of trails and the stars are brighter out here!
notes: FOR THE MONTH OF AUGUST, I will actually be in Europe, but my very trustworthy friend will be looking after things (she, however, has her own place). I will leave very clear notes about everything you'll need to know as well as my friend's number (don't be shy to call on her as I want to make sure you've got what you need). There will also be one or two other individuals living in the home, active, friendly, and easy-going people, and you will not feel stranded!
transit: It's advisable to have a vehicle as it's a mile and a half along a curvy mountain road to the nearest bus stop. Downtown Asheville: 10-12 minutes Blue Ridge Parkway: 5 minutes Biltmore Estate: 12 minutes Black Mountain, NC: 15 minutes Asheville Airport: 25 minutes UNC-Asheville: 14 minutes Warren Wilson College: 5 minutes If you need to rent a car, shared-economy style, search relay rides. If you need a taxi, search uber.
host_about:
I'm a holistic health practitioner and a musician, pursuing my interests in the beautiful mountains of western North Carolina, where I've lived since 1994. I speak a couple of languages, love photography, and am often in the garden or out hiking. I have a small acupuncture practice in downtown Asheville and I also perform as a guitarist in solo and group settings. 

Having just been using the Airbnb platform since August '14, I've actually been renting rooms in my home steadily since 2008, both to short-term and long-term guests. I pride myself on being an accommodating host and truly enjoy meeting new people. Otherwise, I'm always looking forward to using the Airbnb platform for travel!

name: LEFT BANK B&B - AN ARTISAN B&B
summary: Southwest wing of our Villa, private access to 2 large bedrooms, private living room and 1.5 baths. Kenilworth neighborhood, fantastic central location minutes from downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate. Continental or gourmet breakfast options.
space: Beautiful 5000 sq ft Villa in Historic Kenilworth neighborhood, gardens, great walking area. 1 m South of downtown and .5 m North of Biltmore Estate. Guest quarters are at the Southwest wing of second floor, accessed by a private staircase. Guest accommodations include 2 very large bedrooms- king bed and queen bed.  A private sitting room is adjacent. A complimentary continental breakfast is offered to guests each morning or a gourmet breakfast can be requested at check-in for $10/ person.  Left Bank B&B is licensed by the city of Asheville as a Home Stay  facility. Our villa is nestled amongst gardens and woods at the end of a tiny street. Mountain views, a Civil War trail and easy access to Asheville's concert, art venues and restaurants makes the Left Bank an excellent choice of B&B. AC, central heat, wood stove, cable TV, WiFi.   Guests can share an upstairs living space for a quiet evening or meditation /yoga. Breakfast is served in the dinning room or if you prefer in the garden.
description: Southwest wing of our Villa, private access to 2 large bedrooms, private living room and 1.5 baths. Kenilworth neighborhood, fantastic central location minutes from downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate. Continental or gourmet breakfast options. neighborhood_overview: Left Bank B&B is located in the beautiful and eclectic 1920's neighborhood, Kenilworth. The streets are lightly travelled and great for a run or walk.
transit: We are located 15 min by car from the Asheville airport, 2 hours from Charlotte, NC airport, and 1 hour from the Greenville, SC airport.
host_about:
Sam & Oksana Stark, renowned "Foodies", love to cook and share stories of our adventures. We are a B&B licensed by the City and inspected by the County Board of Health. Rooms are for rent by the night or the entire property is available for large private parties. An overnight with us includes a gourmet breakfast, farm fresh, as we are a Farm to Table establishment.

Sam Stark is a Professional Glass Artist since 1971 . Oksana Stark, is a  textile artist currently quilting and Indigo  dying .  The Stark Art Glass, Ltd.  studio is located on the property and guests are welcome to visit the studio. Private glass blowing lessons may also be an option for the guests. Oksana's textile studio is always open to visitors.

Our home is filled with art, books, comfort, warmth and pets. We can offer you complete privacy or a friendly chat about Asheville and it's offerings. You decide and we will gladly accommodate you.

summary: Hi there, I am usually here half of each month cause I travel for my business. The cabin is very cozy but also provides privacy and separate baths.  Safe and close to downtown Asheville! Annie
space: This beautiful historic log cabin combines the serenity of the Great Smokey Mountains with the flair and soul of it's native New Orleanian owner. Ideally located to provide both privacy and convenience to all Asheville has to offer. Approximately five minutes to enchanting downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Pkwy., great hiking, waterfalls, the Folk Art Center, golfing, the Nature Center, the Biltmore estate and more. 3 bedroom , ( 2 queen and 1 twin ), 2 bath furnished, private deck with hot tub. Located in a quiet, safe area of  East Asheville, approximately 1500 sq ft, all appliances and fully equipped kitchen, 2 TVs, wood burning fireplace, covered flat parking,  W/D, cable and wifi , linens and towels. Just show up and relax !!

host_about:
My lady Terri and I have been wanting to become hosts for some time now. We both have been in Asheville for over 10 years and we have seen our beloved town turn into one of the most desirable destinations in the southeast.  We love our town and enjoy sharing it with as many people as possible. Hotels have become expensive in town and we enjoy keeping our cabin a very reasonable alternative for prospective visitors. 

I live in the cabin as often as I can but I do travel for work often.  Giving the perfect opportunity to share my home whit anyone traveling to town.  Welcome to my tiny cabin and take good care of it while I'm gone.

summary: Cosy studio apt with kitchenette and private bathroom and entrance. Has a queen size bed and a full size futon.
space: Room has a queen size bed and a futon that will accommodate 3/4 people. Also have small air mattress and flip-bed to accommodate children. This room also has it's own private bath, kitchenette, and patio. TV with dvd's. Linens and towels provided.  You will have access to entire house. Nice, safe residential neighborhood. Secluded yet close to downtown. Located halfway between downtown and the parkway in beautiful Haw Creek valley. Retreat like setting on 3 beautiful acres with stream. Relax on the front porch or back patio and watch the animals. Very quiet and relaxing. Smoke free. Comfortable, clean and affordable. Also please note that even though I have no pets, I often pet sit. So be sure to check first if you prefer no pets. You will need a car as the house is 5-10 minutes from downtown.  Please contact me through airbnb if you need more information about the house or the area.

name: Private Mountain Hideaway in Town
summary: Quiet, spacious suite in wooded setting, light filled, birdsong abounds and minutes to downtown. Private porch, entrance, mini food prep area, lux linens, separate sitting area.  Close to TJs, restaurants. Soothing refuge with the comforts of home.
space: This is a large, spacious, spotless and comfortable suite, light filled with woods views all around, nice amenities, newly renovated.  High quality linens. The porch is large and comfy for sipping your morning coffee, plant filled in warm weather, and surrounded by birdsong and wildlife. Entrance is private, parking is directly in front.  More like a private studio than a "room" due to spacious seating area inside,  nice selection of books and games for your use and large porch outside. Coffee, tea, light breakfast and snacks are included during your stay and there is a small fridge, toaster, microwave and coffeemaker, utensils, plates and cups. Everything you need for a comfy and pleasant retreat in Asheville!
description: Quiet, spacious suite in wooded setting, light filled, birdsong abounds and minutes to downtown. Private porch, entrance, mini food prep area, lux linens, separate sitting area.  Close to TJs, restaurants. Soothing refuge with the comforts of home. This is a large, spacious, spotless and comfortable suite, light filled with woods views all around, nice amenities, newly renovated.  High quality linens. The porch is large and comfy for sipping your morning coffee, plant filled in warm weather, and surrounded by birdsong and wildlife. Entrance is private, parking is directly in front.  More like a private studio than a "room" due to spacious seating area inside,  nice selection of books and games for your use and large porch outside. Coffee, tea, light breakfast and snacks are included during your stay and there is a small fridge, toaster, microwave and coffeemaker, utensils, plates and cups. Everything you need for a comfy and pleasant retreat in Asheville! You have access to the suite f
neighborhood_overview: I am located in Chunn's Cove, surrounded by woods and wildlife, beautiful landscaping.  No neighbors can see in any of the windows! Lots of songbirds, hummingbirds, wild turkeys and in the evening, a chorus of insects soothe you to sleep! Ceiling fan and large bank of windows provides an airy, cooling  with a sense of being centered in nature. There is A/C for any hot Carolina evening.  Community is very safe and secure. The suite is a pleasant respite after an active day in Asheville hustle and bustle, has a seating area inside with table and chairs, sofa and lots of interesting books, games. Porch has large eating table and chairs for relaxing and watching the wildlife,  plant filled in summer. I am close to Trader Joes, Whole Foods, Ingles, lots of trendy restaurants and Asheville Mall, 9 minutes to Biltmore Village. Mini prep area for preparing small meals and snacks, fridge for storing beverages and perishables. I can recommend some favorite spots for dining or shopping as well as
notes: Pets are not allowed and smoking is allowed outdoors only. No food or garbage can be left outdoors as they attract bears.
transit: Very central location with easy access to 240 and Tunnel Road but you feel tucked away on the mountain. Easy access to downtown, Blue Ridge Parkway for hiking, Biltmore Village and Biltmore Estate.
host_about: Have owned and shared properties in Hawaii, Florida, Minnesota. Therapist, yogi, outdoor enthusiast, love animals. travel, gardening, sunshine. Have traveled to some of the finest accommodations in the world and prefer a remote campsite! Yearly travel to India to study meditation and energy healing. neighborhood_overview: Chunns Cove is a world unto itself. We have one  neighbor to the north barely visible through huge evergreens, otherwise all you can see is a spectacular view of the valley and mountains. The cove is human-quiet but bird-noisy! We regularly see creatures that you wouldn't expect and could easily mistake this place in summer for a Costa Rican rain-forest! Ingles, our local grocery store, is 2 minutes SW and Walgreens is 5 minutes SE. Our favorite dinner restaurants are the Admiral in West Asheville and the Bull & Beggar in the River Arts District for which we recommend reservations but you might find a couple of seats around the bar to order a selection of fabulous plates. Lunch time we are partial to Chai Pani's Indian Street Food which i take with no spices and Doc Chey's is ideal on a tight budget but arrive early or be prepared to wait for a seat.
notes: Whether you are attending a Yoga Workshop (there is plenty of space in the main house living-room and the apartment living room for yoga), Hiking & Mountain Biking Trails (request comprehensive local list of hikes, scenic drives and trails), coming to watch a band play at the Orangepeel, Attending a Wedding (if you book early, we can host a maximum of 10 people), or an annual event (Moogfest, Leaf, Bele Chere), Celebrating your Anniversary (how better to do it than with chocolate, croissants and a hot-tub), Exploring the Blue Ridge Parkway (please request info), Pisgah National Forest, Botanical Gardens at Asheville, a Foodie event, (The Admiral & Bull and Beggar are our firm favorites, but we can also recommend Cuchina 24, Wasabi, Table, Zambra, Brasilia Churrasco Steakhouse, The Blackbird, Chestnut, Posana, Market Place for dinner and for lunch; Early Girl Eatery, Chai Pani, Mela & 12 Bones) or just sampling the best coffee in Asheville (our favorites are High Five for cozy, Izzy' fo
transit: The airport shuttle will bring you to the door, there is a bus-stop into Downtown about half a mile away, where you can rent bicycles or you can walk the 2.2 miles into the heart of Downtown. Every direction has beautiful views!
host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc's list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding this spectacular Chunn's Cove residence, over the last year, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc's native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish makes him trilingual. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay's world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20's, evolving to a decade of motherhood  punctuated by a successful decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple, eager to explore exciting new ventures.

name: Rustic Cabin in Asheville Forest
summary: Nestled in the forested and desirable Buffalo Mountain, this charming, romantic hideaway is 15 minutes from exciting downtown Asheville. Partake in all the entertainment Asheville has to offer, or just relax and enjoy the solitude this cabin offers.
space: There are two decks, one of which has a 6-person hot tub and a delightful 180-degree view of the surrounding forest. It has rustic wood chairs and a covered two person swing, perfect for relaxing with a good book or bird watching. The second, accessible from a downstairs bedroom, overlooks the side yard and has its own two person swing. The well-equipped galley kitchen has all the modern large appliances: dishwasher, microwave, electric stove/oven and the basics in dishes, small appliances (including a Keurig), cookware and spices. Two bedrooms downstairs, one has a double size log bed, the other a king size log bed. Upstairs loft bedroom has queen size log bed, small flat screen TV and a beautiful, wooded view. Two full baths, one on each level. Imagine relaxing in your loft bubble bath while gazing out at the surrounding forest! Loft reading nook with comfy papasan chair and your own library with an eclectic reading selection. TV room has leather sofa and loveseat and 42" flat screen

neighborhood_overview: We love that it feels so secluded and away from city life, yet is so close to downtown Asheville and the wonderful restaurants we like to patronize. We've already seen some of the mountain wildlife (have yet to see our first bear!) and we love to sit on the deck amongst the beautiful, stately trees and enjoy the solitude and view. The pine paneling interior brings back memories for me of visiting our family cabin on the lake back in the 70's when I was a child growing up in Minnesota. The upstairs bedroom loft is our daughter's retreat and she spends hours up there reading and looking out at the gorgeous forest.
notes: Please call me for more details
transit: No, not within 3 1/2 miles.
host_about: I work PT from my home in Charlotte and love to travel with my husband who is in the restaurant business.  (when possible, our 20 year old daughter and 2 dogs come as well)  We love Asheville and go there whenever our cabin is not booked!

neighborhood_overview: The Community in East Asheville is a friendly walking, jogging neighborhood developed around the Asheville Municipal Golf Course, which is listed on the National Register of Historic Places.  This course is one of the oldest golf courses in Western North Carolina. The 18-hole golf course designed by Hall of Fame golf architect Donald Ross opened for play in 1927.
notes: We provide clean linens, towels,3 in 1 Body Wash, Hand Soap & Shampoo, (Citrus + Aloe Bodywash), dish soap, toilet paper, paper towels, coffee, and tea.
transit: Drive 10 minutes to downtown and park in any one of several parking decks where the first hour is always free. Street performers  make downtown an exciting and fun place to be. Many guests who want to enjoy the benefits of Asheville being called "Beer City USA" opt to use Uber or taxi ride.
host_about:
We are a couple who moved to Asheville, NC from Guatemala Central America  years ago after living overseas for 5 years. We traveled to Asheville after selling everything and brought our 2 dogs, and a couple of suitcases. 

We love to travel back to Guatemala to visit family and prefer to stay in homes rather than hotels. It is nice way to get a sense of where the locals eat and play!

For fun around here we have been in a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a Navitat Canopy Adventure zip line tour, ridden on the pubcycle, savor all the arts, tempt our palates in our food scene and enjoy Lake James.

 We would love to answer any questions you might have about Asheville during your stay at our place and work with you to make it memorable.

neighborhood_overview: -My neighborhood, typically called the East End, sits directly adjacent to downtown. You can see downtown. You can walk there. Unless you are wearing stilettos. Or unless you just don't want to walk a half mile.  -My neighborhood is eclectic, lively and friendly. I know all of my neighbors. Residents are a mix of newcomers to the area and people whose families have lived in the same house for many generations. - My neighborhood is cool and funky.   -My neighborhood is not fancy and swanky.  PLEASE, don't rent from me if you wish to be surrounded by cookie cutter houses with manicured lawns. I love my neighborhood. I want to rent to people who will enjoy it as I do.
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville NC for 15 years and love to call it home. I am a singer-songwriter and i spend much of my time playing shows and making recordings. If you're interested in the local music scene I can definitely give you some suggestions. 
  I enjoy Asheville for the beauty of the place, the great music and food, and the open minded eclectic vibe here. It's a great town.
  I have toured all over the country and often stayed with hosts, so I know what it's like to be a guest in someone's home. Personally i appreciate a host who is accommodating but also lets me have alot of privacy and the option to keep interactions to a minimum, and as your host that's what I can offer you.
  If you need anything, or would like information about Asheville, I will gladly help you out, but otherwise I will be upstairs in my part of the house and you'll have the apartment downstairs to yourself.
  Come stay at my special, beautiful house!!!

summary: Centrally located- 5 min. from downtown, 7 min. from Biltmore House, near Biltmore Village,the Blue Ridge Parkway, golf ,and shopping! The upstairs tenant in this home stay, Hannah, is the operator and is available for help.
space: Welcome to Kenil "Worth" It! Centrally located in Asheville, NC. This house apartment vacation rental is a homestay with a long term tenant living upstairs. The decor is a mix of artisan and contemporary style with recycled metal backsplashes, live edged wood shelves and table, and leather furniture. description: Centrally located- 5 min. from downtown, 7 min. from Biltmore House, near Biltmore Village,the Blue Ridge Parkway, golf ,and shopping! The upstairs tenant in this home stay, Hannah, is the operator and is available for help. Welcome to Kenil "Worth" It! Centrally located in Asheville, NC. This house apartment vacation rental is a homestay with a long term tenant living upstairs. There is a separate entrance to this private space used exclusively by the vacation rental guests. The 830 sq. feet space has been completely renovated to make your vacation relaxing, comfortable, and convenient. The space is well-lit and has a lot of natural light too. The new kitchen includes stainless steel appliances, concrete countertops, and custom designed shelves created from local live-edged hardwoods. The one bedroom offers a queen size bed complete with down-pillow top mattress and crisp linens.  We also provide soft, clean towels and washclothes. The decor is a mix of artisan and contemporary style
neighborhood_overview: Located in historic Kenilworth. The neighborhood is a mix of newer and well-preserved older homes. It is a quiet neighborhood with regular walkers and exercise enthusiasts.
notes: The long term tenant upstairs has lived there for five years. The tenant is respectful and quiet.
transit: It is just 2 miles from downtown (a quick car ride or 30 minute walk) and just minutes from access to the Blue Ridge Parkway. There is a city bus stop at the bottom of the street and a bowling alley 0.4 miles which is a quick 7 minute walk.
host_about: I am a locally grown custom furniture builder in Asheville, NC. My wife, a school teacher and realtor, and I enjoy living in the beautiful mountains of Western NC and raising our twin girls  outside as much as we can.  We both coach our girls' soccer team and have an appreciation for a weekend away! We have renovated Kenil-"Worth"-It with creativity and care. We hope you enjoy your stay there.
