name: Sommer Beech House
summary: Built in the woods among the trees, it's like living in a tree house.  The main living areas have tons of windows, so all you see are trees.  It's in a quiet rural area of Asheville, just 15 minutes from the heart of downtown.
space: Passive and active solar thermal stays cool in summer and warm in the winter.  Energy efficient home in the Arts & Crafts Style.
description: Built in the woods among the trees, it's like living in a tree house.  The main living areas have tons of windows, so all you see are trees.  It's in a quiet rural area of Asheville, just 15 minutes from the heart of downtown. Passive and active solar thermal stays cool in summer and warm in the winter.  Energy efficient home in the Arts & Crafts Style. All spaces.  But not all drawers and closets will be free for usage. Owner will not be there but caretaker lives next door in the garage apartment if needs arise. One of the few remaining areas of rural, single family homes with large tracts of land that are this close to Asheville.  This house is built on 7 acres of land.  Bears, turkey, dear, foxes are seen in the neighborhood. There is not public transportation nearby, but uber comes to pick you up, along with other cab companies. There are cats who live inside and outside the house on a regular basis.  If guests fear allergic reactions from residual dander, take this into considerat
neighborhood_overview: One of the few remaining areas of rural, single family homes with large tracts of land that are this close to Asheville.  This house is built on 7 acres of land.  Bears, turkey, dear, foxes are seen in the neighborhood.
notes: There are cats who live inside and outside the house on a regular basis.  If guests fear allergic reactions from residual dander, take this into consideration.  Cats will not be there during the guests' stay.
transit: There is not public transportation nearby, but uber comes to pick you up, along with other cab companies.
host_about: I am a small business owner.  The houses I list on airbnb are all on a 20 acre farm that I use for events, and to grow food and flowers.  The houses are not available from Thursday to Saturday, from April through November, because events are held on the farm.  Otherwise, if the dates are open Sunday-Wednesday or mid-November through March, our guests get to experience all our amazing farm and valley have to offer.  I feel honored to get the chance to care for this beautiful valley and to get to know the many great people who come and stay with us.  We take pride in offering high quality and reasonable accommodations with friendly service on our part.

name: Gorgeous Mountain View 3BD
summary: Comfortable 3bd/2bath home 20 minutes from Asheville and 15 minutes from Black Mountain. Quiet, peaceful location with a beautiful view, sun deck, and spacious yard.
space: This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only minutes from town. There are three bedrooms that can sleep 6, although one bed is a fold out double and is best for two kids or one adult. This is an older home, so it's got a lot of character but also a bit of wear and tear.
description: Comfortable 3bd/2bath home 20 minutes from Asheville and 15 minutes from Black Mountain. Quiet, peaceful location with a beautiful view, sun deck, and spacious yard. This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only minutes from town. There are three bedrooms that can sleep 6, although one bed is a fold out double and is best for two kids or one adult. This is an older home, so it's got a lot of character but also a bit of wear and tear. Close to great hiking trails, the Swannanoa River and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Since the basement apartment is often housing other airbnb guests, the basement and garage are off limits, but the body of the house and outdoor space is all yours! I usually am either staying in the basement apartment or off the premises. Besides seeing my car out front you will hardly know I'm there as I'm in and out most of the day. However, I'm very accessible and am more than happy
neighborhood_overview: The best part of this neighborhood is that there's very little neighborhood at all. You are in a very peaceful private setting with no nearby houses visible. You'll be surrounded by forests, meadows and farms.
notes: Please note that there is no wifi at the house, and cell phone reception is spotty. Most people can get clear reception outdoors and in some rooms of the house, but be prepared to be out of touch! The TV only plays dvds. There is no cable but a large selection of dvds to choose from! Also, I am on well water. Occasionally the water will run red because of iron in the well, especially if it hasn't rained in a while. This is not dangerous to your health and if you run the water for a couple of seconds it will clear up. It is safe to drink the tap water but if you think this will bother you then you may want to bring some bottled water with you.
transit: The nearest bus stop is about three miles away. You will need a car. Rental services are available at the airport and parking is on site. The roads near my home are fairly windy, so you may want to add a few minutes to your expected commute time if you are not used to driving on mountain roads.
street: Shope Road, Asheville, NC 28805, United States

name: Beauty & Peace in Asheville
summary: Elegant full apartment with private entrance on a lovely wooded road, 7 min from downtown. Full kitchen, private bath, cozy living room and extensive permaculture gardens with honey bee hives. Great quiet lodging with large library of books and DVDs.
space: The rental space is a daylight downstairs apartment with windows facing east. With our love of beautiful, old things, we have named our decorating style 'Victoriental'. It is comprised of a large living room-bedroom suite with a comfortable sofa and chairs, a working fireplace, a TV with dvd player (we do not have any network television, but do have wifi) and a large library of books and dvd's. The bed is a double, very comfortable. If needed we can set up an additional single bed in the space for a reasonable fee.  This is an ideal place for writers or anyone attending a yoga workshop, Buddhist retreat, Sufi gathering, or any other retreat for quiet contemplation. Off the bedroom is a private bathroom with full tub. There is a full kitchen in a separate room with stove, microwave, toaster oven, drip coffee pot, refrigerator, cookware, cuisinart and a small blender for smoothies. There is also a washer and dryer,  which we need access to.
description: Elegant full apartment with private entrance on a lovely wooded road, 7 min from downtown. Full kitchen, private bath, cozy living room and extensive permaculture gardens with honey bee hives. Great quiet lodging with large library of books and DVDs. The rental space is a daylight downstairs apartment with windows facing east. With our love of beautiful, old things, we have named our decorating style 'Victoriental'. It is comprised of a large living room-bedroom suite with a comfortable sofa and chairs, a working fireplace, a TV with dvd player (we do not have any network television, but do have wifi) and a large library of books and dvd's. The bed is a double, very comfortable. If needed we can set up an additional single bed in the space for a reasonable fee.  This is an ideal place for writers or anyone attending a yoga workshop, Buddhist retreat, Sufi gathering, or any other retreat for quiet contemplation. Off the bedroom is a private bathroom with full tub. There is a full kitche
neighborhood_overview: We are in East Asheville, about a 7 minute drive to downtown, depending on how you catch the lights. Our home is in a heavily wooded area, and since we are very close to the Blue Ridge Parkway, bears are regular visitors, especially in spring and fall. The general ambience of the neighborhood is serene. We are less then a half mile fromTunnel Road, an easy walk, where on our corner the East Village Grill serves good diner-type food, and next to it, Filo's, one of the best coffee houses in Asheville that serves ridiculously good quiche and cheese cake, and incredible breakfast sandwiches. About a mile away is the best homemade ice cream place in town, 'Ultimate Ice Cream'. The Blue Ridge Parkway is about a mile away, with it's Folk Art Center featuring high quality local pottery, weaving, rustic brooms, jewelry, etc. We are also about a 15 minute drive from the lovely artsy shopping town of Black Mountain. Groceries are easily obtained at the local supermarket, Ingles, half mile away. O
notes: The kitchen is stocked with basics…coffee, organic teas, eggs, bread, granola, milk, juice, etc. It's enough to get you going in the morning if you prefer not to go out for breakfast. While we are never functional enough in the morning to serve breakfast, we do highly recommend Filo coffee house one block away. The owner, Maria, worked as a pastry chef at the Biltmore estate and she brings a high standard of excellence to her offerings; you will never find a more delicious quiche anywhere! There are also wonderful croissant breakfast sandwiches and excellent coffee choices. Filo has recently renovated and expanded their offerings to include dinner and bar services. Next door, at the East Village Grill, Maria's brother Nick presents classic Greek diner fare. Between them, they give the neighborhood a kiss of Greek gustatory flare. Air BnB collects local city taxes for home-stay. Please be aware that we have a pet cat and keep honey bees on the premesis. If you are allergic to either, pl
transit: Approximately one half mile away, on Tunnel Road, is a stop for the Asheville Rapid Tranist (ART) bus system.
host_about:
We have traveled to many countries and been treated with great kindness and hospitality and are looking forward to reciprocating that here in our Asheville home.  Our interests are varied and include permaculture garden design, publishing books of practical spirituality, keeping honey bees, reading, traveling (especially to Turkey), and cooking.
We operate a small publishing company, Logosophia Books, from our home, dedicated to creating books of practical spirituality. 
Our motto is "Beauty is not a luxury, it is a necessity!"

space: Comfortable remodeled cabin with two baths, King master bedroom, Queen size in second bedroom. Quiet neighborhood on cul de sac. name: Hiking & Nature Minutes to Downtown
summary: The Kaleidoscope Room is a private space located in a quiet, pastoral neighborhood only 10 miles to downtown Asheville. Walk to nearby hiking trails, say hello to the horses on our property and enjoy beautiful Blue Ridge Mountain views.
space: The Kaleidoscope Room is an artful space located only 6 miles from The Blue Ridge Parkway and 4 miles from Warren Wilson College and The Swannanoa River. It is a studio apartment located on the lower level of our home with separate entry.
description: The Kaleidoscope Room is a private space located in a quiet, pastoral neighborhood only 10 miles to downtown Asheville. Walk to nearby hiking trails, say hello to the horses on our property and enjoy beautiful Blue Ridge Mountain views. The Kaleidoscope Room is an artful space located only 6 miles from The Blue Ridge Parkway and 4 miles from Warren Wilson College and The Swannanoa River. It is a studio apartment located on the lower level of our home with separate entry. Guests who stay in The Kaleidoscope Room can enjoy access to our 6 acres. Sit and relax beside the creek or roast marshmallows on a campfire. Walk through the beautiful neighborhood or hike up to the Mountains to Sea Trail.  The room itself is equipped with a kitchenette, which includes sink, small refrigerator, toaster oven, microwave and coffee maker + coffee. The private bathroom has a shower. We provide linens and towels. Sleep comfortably on the queen size bed. There is also a pull-out sofa and a pack 'n play. Cab
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a quiet area with a rural feel, but is only 10 miles to downtown Asheville and all the incredible dining, art and entertainment our wonderful city has to offer!
notes: Pack 'n play available (bring your own baby sheets and blankets). Please note that we have dogs and children living on the main level, who may not always be completely silent. All are all quite friendly though! Rest assured that we will make every effort to help you enjoy a comfortable and relaxing stay.  We are professional educators and are available to provide child care for an additional fee with advance notice.  Guests are also welcome to pitch a tent on the property for an additional fee.
transit: Asheville Rapid Transit offers bus service to Warren Wilson College, which is only 4 miles from our house. Try Uber in our area!

name: Asheville Mountain Home ON RIVER!
summary: East Asheville, EASY ACESS, 10 minutes to downtown, 2 minutes to Blue Ridge Pkwy, 15 minutes to Biltmore, right on the Swannanoa River, private drive, kayaks, float boats, outdoor shower, covered spacious deck, fire-pit by the river, wildlife, scenic, private, truly a pretty view right in the bend of the river...love!
space: River is stocked with trout and bass. All forest across the river - only a few homes on this street.  Very private but close to great dining and entertainment.  Access to the Blue Ridge Parkway only 1/2 mile from the house.  Easy access amazingly in the country to be so close to everything!  Full bath, linens, 2 queen beds, one in each bedroom. (Please note the cost if using both bedrooms). Enjoy the full covered deck which includes a gas grill and tables/chairs to enjoy the meals.  Great place, you just have to see it to believe it! In the sunroom there is a mini fridge, coffee maker, cable tv and a microwave, for you own privacy, if desired. You will have access to my full kitchen, which I share with you.. I eat out most of the time, so you'll have it to your self most of the time! Kayaks and Float Boats are available for rent.  Remember, you will need your own transportation for drop-off and pick-up.
description: East Asheville, EASY ACESS, 10 minutes to downtown, 2 minutes to Blue Ridge Pkwy, 15 minutes to Biltmore, right on the Swannanoa River, private drive, kayaks, float boats, outdoor shower, covered spacious deck, fire-pit by the river, wildlife, scenic, private, truly a pretty view right in the bend of the river...love! River is stocked with trout and bass. All forest across the river - only a few homes on this street.  Very private but close to great dining and entertainment.  Access to the Blue Ridge Parkway only 1/2 mile from the house.  Easy access amazingly in the country to be so close to everything!  Full bath, linens, 2 queen beds, one in each bedroom. (Please note the cost if using both bedrooms). Enjoy the full covered deck which includes a gas grill and tables/chairs to enjoy the meals.  Great place, you just have to see it to believe it! In the sunroom there is a mini fridge, coffee maker, cable tv and a microwave, for you own privacy, if desired. You will have access to my f
neighborhood_overview: I live at the END of the cul-de-sac, so it's private.  We enjoy outdoor evening dinners and building fires.... enjoy the outside views/fires until midnight...  Full of trees, private home at the end of the road, beautiful views of the river, swim, kayak, fish, relax on the deck, read a book.....   I'm just 2 miles off Tunnel Road which has shopping and restaurants including East Village Grill and Filo - great place for coffee and desserts.  Creekside Tavern is awesome and only 2 minutes away.
notes: One of a kind find - would love to share it and have others enjoy the view, fishing, relaxing on the covered porch, grilling on the deck, relaxing in the hammock by the river... just good fun.  Often see, ducks, many birds feeding, otters, blue herons, geese, and beavers.  Binoculars (2) in sunroom for your convenience.  Quiet, relaxing, scenic, one of a kind.  Amazingly in the country but just minutes from the downtown nightlife and dining.  Trout, catfish, and many other fish available without obtaining a license to fish. If you wish to use the 2nd bedroom, please note the extra fee involved. I have a 4lb chihuahua that lives on the property.  Dogs are allowed if under 50lbs and friendly.
transit: You'll need transportation, however bus runs about a mile away if needed.
host_about: Laid back, moved to Asheville to enjoy the mountains and the rivers, plus to be close to downtown for some fantastic dining and entertainment!  I'm 51 Semi-Retired and would love to share my home with you on the Swannnanoa River.  Incredible COVERED DECK overlooking the river so close you can 'touch it"! There is a 6 person fire pit right beside the river - great for smores and total relaxation. Kayaks, Float Boats, River Stocked with bass/trout, great for the fisherman and fisherwomen!  Me, I just want to share this great location which is only 10 MINUTES from downtown and help you enjoy a true Asheville experience.

name: Farm School Cottage
summary: This lightfilled, eclectically modernized & decorated mountain cottage provides guest comfort & privacy . Set in English gardens across from the Swannanoa river,  5 mi from downtown Asheville, near Blue Ridge Parkway, Warren Wilson College & LEAF.
space: The space is comfortable, cosy, and equipped with all amenities to make your stay easy, graceful and memorable.
description: This lightfilled, eclectically modernized & decorated mountain cottage provides guest comfort & privacy . Set in English gardens across from the Swannanoa river,  5 mi from downtown Asheville, near Blue Ridge Parkway, Warren Wilson College & LEAF. The space is comfortable, cosy, and equipped with all amenities to make your stay easy, graceful and memorable. Whole house access. In the summer there is a great English garden out front of the cottage.  There is a small front porch, and a back patio with a gas grill for summer  BBQ. There is a great fire pit out back with 6 Adirondack style chairs.  Wood provided.  Newspaper and lighter in pantry. I will be on call should you need anything or have any questions about the cottage or your accommodation.  Please call (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). Farm School Cottage is situated in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Western North Carolina.  It will feel like you are living in the green, wooded countryside - close to Warren Wilson College and LEAF compound -
neighborhood_overview: Farm School Cottage is situated in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Western North Carolina.  It will feel like you are living in the green, wooded countryside - close to Warren Wilson College and LEAF compound - yet you are only 5 miles from the center of downtown Asheville with easy access via Hwy 70W to Hwy 240W and the downtown exits.  A close by restaurant is Pomodoros, a great Greek/Italian restaurant.  Behind the restaurant is Ultimate Ice Cream -  great local made-from-scratch flavors. Downtown restaurants are plentiful, as are breweries, pubs, and venues with live music.  Ingles Market  is close by, and Whole Foods market is approx. 2-3 miles away opposite the Asheville Mall on Tunnel Road.
notes: Please conserve water.  As the septic system is delicate, please NO items other than toilet tissue to be flushed into the system.
transit: Uber is available at Farm School Cottage.  We have ample parking. There is a car rental on Hwy 70 a couple of miles from FS Cottage and one at the Asheville Airport.  There are a number of taxi services.
host_about:
I am a positive, upbeat, Healing Arts practitioner (Shiatsu and Thai massage, Reflexology).  I am also a landscape gardener, a beekeeper (no hives at present!), and an artist.

 I love the peace and quietude of nature walks, yoga, and gardening, and yet am very social, enjoy gathering with friends and family to share a meal, and getting to know new people.

I love to travel and experience new cultures, their language, food, habits, clothing.  I have traveled widely: all over southern Africa, the Middle East, and India.  I have lived in Switzerland, England, Greece, New Zealand, and South Africa.  I have also visited all European countries except the Scandinavian countries.  My style of traveling is enjoying the truly authentic vibe of any country by simply becoming immersed in the culture, experiencing the little known, and even the unknown.  I am open to simple accommodations as long as they are clean and hospitable.

My motto is: "We are all One, what we do to others, we do to ourselves...thus, spread Love, Peace, Joy wherever you go...and the world will be a better place!"

name: Lux Apt ~ B&B ~ HOT-TUB ~ Mtn Views

space: If the dates you have selected in our Apartment are unavailable, you might like to try our Luxury Sunrise Guest Room https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2213748,  our Luxury Sunset Guest Room  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/5532718 or our Luxury Airstream https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3888845  Just a 5 minute drive or a 2 mile saunter from Downtown, our luxurious stone & stucco home on a Private Road with an extra-wide driveway to accommodate up to 10 cars, was totally renovated throughout 2013/14. Boasting clean, fresh 7.5PH well-water throughout our spacious home and apartment, your ultimate luxury will be soaking in your private mineral spa, overlooking nothing but woods of trees and a mountainous skyline. Located on the south-side of the house, exceptional apartment views of local wildlife can be seen through picture-frame windows, not limited to frequent sightings of mountain lions, black bears and cubs. A brand new deluxe Serta queen-size bed will ensure your nights are both comfortable an

If the dates you have selected in our Apartment are unavailable, you might like to try our Luxury Sunrise Guest Room https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/2213748,  our Luxury Sunset Guest Room  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/5532718 or our Luxury Airstream https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/3888845  Just a 5 minute drive or a 2 mile saunter from Downtown, our luxurious stone & stucco home on a Private Road with an extra-wide driveway to accommodate up to 10 cars, was totally renovated throughout 2013/14. Boasting clean, fresh 7.5PH well-water throughout our spacious home and apartment, your ultimate luxury will be soaking in your private mineral spa, overlooking nothing but woods of trees and a mountainous skyline. Located on the south-side of the house, e
neighborhood_overview: Chunns Cove is a world unto itself. We have one  neighbor who is barely visible through the trees, otherwise all you can see is a spectacular almost 360 degree view of the valley and woods from the house and private apartment deck. The cove is human-quiet but bird-noisy! We regularly see creatures that you wouldn't expect and could easily mistake this place in summer for a Costa Rican rain-forest! Ingles, our local grocery store, is 2 minutes down the road and Walgreens is 5 minutes away. Our favorite dinner restaurants are the Admiral in West Asheville and the Bull & Beggar in the River Arts District for which we recommend reservations but you might find a couple of seats around the bar to order a selection of fabulous plates. Lunch time we are partial to Chai Pani's Indian Street Food which i take with no spices and Doc Chey's is ideal on a tight budget but arrive early or be prepared to wait for a seat.
notes: Whether you are attending a Yoga Workshop (there is plenty of space in the apartment living room for yoga), Hiking & Mountain Biking Trails (request comprehensive local list of hikes, scenic drives and trails), coming to watch a band play at the Orangepeel, Attending a Wedding (if you book early, we can host a maximum of 10 people), or an annual event (Moogfest, Leaf, Bele Chere), Celebrating your Anniversary (how better to do it than with chocolate, croissants and a hot-tub or by ordering our Guest Basked crammed with goodies to surprise your partner), Exploring the Blue Ridge Parkway (please request info), Pisgah National Forest, Botanical Gardens at Asheville, a Foodie event, (The Admiral & Bull and Beggar are our firm favorites, but we can also recommend Cuchina 24, Wasabi, Table, Zambra, Brasilia Churrasco Steakhouse, The Blackbird, Chestnut, Posana, Market Place for dinner and for lunch; Early Girl Eatery, Chai Pani, Mela & 12 Bones) or just sampling the best coffee in Asheville
transit: The airport shuttle will bring you to the door, there is a bus-stop into Downtown about half a mile away, where you can rent bicycles or you can walk the 2.2 miles into the heart of Downtown. Every direction has beautiful views!
host_about: Well-immersed in the pastry and chocolate world for several decades, there is nothing on Marc's list of culinary delights that features higher than chocolate and coffee. Playing a considerable role in both gutting and rebuilding this spectacular Chunn's Cove residence, over the last year, Marc has conclusively proved that watching informative and directional Home Improvement Shows for the best part of adulthood, is akin to learning a new language. Born in Quebec, Marc's native tongue is French but his English rivals any native tongue and his Spanish makes him trilingual. Not without her artistic inheritance, Fay's world is defined as a pleasurable balance between entrepreneur and artist, commencing with a decade of international business travel in her 20's, evolving to a decade of motherhood  punctuated by a successful decade in the office. Now the time is ripe to spread those four Sagittarian wings for this highly motivated couple, eager to explore exciting new ventures.
street: Chunns Cove Road, Asheville, NC 28805, United States

name: Peaceful, Spacious Mountain Retreat
summary: Spacious and peaceful home nestled in the tree canopy off a gravel road.  Private and quiet, yet less than 5 miles to BRP, 7 miles to downtown and 9 miles to RAD.  Beautiful south facing covered porch, new kitchen, new carpet, 3BRs (king, 2 queens).
space: We love our Mountain Retreat and want to share it with you.  Whether you are looking for a couples retreat, a family getaway, or just getting together with some friends, we think you will find our home peaceful, relaxing, comfortable and immaculately clean.  Our home has 3 private bedrooms and 2 full baths.  Recently renovated.  Fully equipped kitchen.  Washer and dryer.  Master has a king and its own private full bath.  Second bedroom has a queen, and the third bedroom has a queen.  46" LCD (with Blu-ray/DVD player, movies, Netflix streaming, music hookup and Wii).  We now have cable TV too!!  Second and third bedroom share a full guest bathroom.  Wi-fi.  Large, serene covered porch (with very few bugs) just off the kitchen provides a wonderful area to unwind and talk about the day's activities with your travel companions over your favorite beverage while soaking in the long range, south facing views.  Covered porch is also a great place to watch early morning wildlife with a cup of h

Second and third bedroom share a full guest bathroom.  Wi-fi.  Large, serene covered porch (with very few bugs) just off the kitchen provides a won
neighborhood_overview: Close to town, yet provides a feeling of being 'out there'.
notes: Parking for 3 vehicles available.  Full-size Weber propane grill for cookouts.  Fire pit for outside fires.  We provide all the clean sheets, blankets, towels, etc that you will need.
transit: 22 miles to airport.  Less than 5 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway.  7 miles to downtown.  7 miles to the Biltmore Estate.  3 miles to nearest, well stocked grocery.  3 miles to gourmet coffee and pastries.  9 miles to River Arts District.  Great sushi, Thai, Indian, Italian, German and Southern cuisine all under 10 miles away.
host_about: We love the mountain lifestyle and all that Asheville has to offer.  From the gorgeous natural setting, to the outdoor activities, to the eclectic mix of people, to the abundant variety of AMAZING food, to the thriving music scene (local and otherwise) to our beautiful mountain home.  On any given day, you will find Jenna and Chris out hiking with their dog on the Appalachian Trail, seeing a show in town, enjoying a cold beverage at one of the many nearby brewpubs, planning their next adventure or just chilling at home watching the sun set from the covered porch.  We love to travel, experience new things and meet interesting, adventure loving folks!

name: 10 Minutes to Downtown  Epic Views!
summary: Ten minutes to downtown, this clean and contemporary farmhouse still has a rural feel. It is  on the edge of a 40 acre farm. There is ample outdoor space for relaxing, and some walking trails and picnic areas.  The inside is light, airy and open.
space: The house is two stories with hardwood floors and an open floor plan.  There are three bedrooms.  The master has a queen and a full bath.  The upstairs bedrooms are spacious.  One has a queen and  twin size daybed that pulls out to form a king.  The other bedroom has a queen and a futon that folds out to a full.  The house comfortably accommodates 6, but can sleep up to 10.  There is one full bath upstairs that the two upstairs rooms share.
description: Ten minutes to downtown, this clean and contemporary farmhouse still has a rural feel. It is  on the edge of a 40 acre farm. There is ample outdoor space for relaxing, and some walking trails and picnic areas.  The inside is light, airy and open. The house is two stories with hardwood floors and an open floor plan.  There are three bedrooms.  The master has a queen and a full bath.  The upstairs bedrooms are spacious.  One has a queen and  twin size daybed that pulls out to form a king.  The other bedroom has a queen and a futon that folds out to a full.  The house comfortably accommodates 6, but can sleep up to 10.  There is one full bath upstairs that the two upstairs rooms share. You will have the whole house to yourself, as it is a stand alone rental.  You will also have a side yard and a loop road through the woods (about 1/3 mile on which to walk).  There is also a picnic area with amazing views near the bottom of the driveway with a picnic table set up for your enjoyment. If we
neighborhood_overview: This area feels like a hybrid between rural and suburban. The house is down a gravel road.  You can hear the sounds of civilization and there are neighbors nearby, but it is a mostly private space.
notes: We prefer minimum stays of 3 nights but there may be times of exception.  During the summer months we prefer 5 nights but we may make exceptions to this on a case by case basis. We provide all linens including 2 towels sets per person and sheets for the bed.
transit: You will want a car if you stay here.  The nearest bus stop is 2 miles away.
host_about: I live on the other side of the farm and raise goats and chickens with my family.  Having a vacation rental has been a dream for awhile.  I am also a licensed naturopathic physician, but right now I spend most of my time on the farm!

name: Master Bedroom with Private Bath
summary: Large comfortable private bedroom with private bathroom. Wrap around porch off of bedroom. Beautiful views in a quiet valley 25 minutes from downtown Asheville and 20 minutes from Black Mountain!
space: This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only 20 to 25 minutes from town. This bedroom has a queen bed, private bathroom and private wrap around porch. The house has two other bedrooms which may or may not be occupied during your stay. This space is about 20 minutes to downtown Asheville, 30 to west Asheville and the nearest grocery store, coffee shop, etc is about 10 minutes away.

Beautiful views in a quiet valley 25 minutes from downtown Asheville and 20 minutes from Black Mountain! This home is clean, well maintained, and beautiful. You will have the privacy of staying in a rural mountain environment but are really only 20 to 25 minutes from town. This bedroom has a queen bed, private bathroom and private wrap around porch. The house has two other bedrooms which may or may not be occupied during your stay. This space is about 20 minutes to downtown Asheville, 30 to west Asheville and the nearest grocery store, coffee shop, etc is about 10 minutes away. Guests have access to private bathroom, kitchen, living room and dining room, as well as beautiful outdoor areas with hammocks and firepit. I am usually in and out of the house throughout the day but spend most of my time away. I'm easily accessible by phone and am happy to answer questions or give tips on great things to
neighborhood_overview: The best part of this neighborhood is that there's very little neighborhood at all. You are in a very peaceful private setting with no nearby houses visible. You'll be surrounded by forests, meadows and farms. The roads leading to and from the house are windy, so be prepared for slow going if you're not used to mountain roads!
notes: Keep in mind that there is no wifi at the house, and cell phone reception is spotty. Most people can get clear reception in the yard and in some rooms of the house, but be prepared to be out of touch! Also, I am on well water. Occasionally the water will run red because of iron in the well, especially if it hasn't rained in a while. This is not dangerous to your health and if you run the water for a couple of seconds it will clear up. It is safe to drink the tap water but if you think this will bother you then you may want to bring some bottled water with you.
transit: The nearest bus stop is about three miles away. You will need a car. Rental services are available at the airport. Parking is on site.

name: Nanna's Nook
summary: This is a cute little fully furnished apt above my garage. It has a cozy double bed , kitchen with stainless steel appliances , towels/linens etc and high speed wifi . I am one mile from the Asheville mall, 3miles from downtown & the Biltmore estate.
space: There is a small porch space that you can sit on if you like to be outside .
description: This is a cute little fully furnished apt above my garage. It has a cozy double bed , kitchen with stainless steel appliances , towels/linens etc and high speed wifi . I am one mile from the Asheville mall, 3miles from downtown & the Biltmore estate. There is a small porch space that you can sit on if you like to be outside . I also have a large patio with picnic table in my front yard that is next to my pond , and guests are welcome to sit out here and enjoy the sound of the waterfall. I work from home and am available for questions and recommendations on restaurants, live music etc. My home is located across the street from the municipal golf course which is  a nice walking neighborhood. There is a city  bus stop within a short walk from my home.
neighborhood_overview: My home is located across the street from the municipal golf course which is  a nice walking neighborhood.
transit: There is a city  bus stop within a short walk from my home.
host_about:
I currently  have a business  wholesaleing jewelry from Turkey.
 I am also a real estate agent and have been selling real estate for over 26 years  and I do some private duty nursing work . I have a pottery studio in my basement  , and love to garden , and cook. I am a member of the local rowing club, and love to ride my bike on the blue ridge parkway. I have two grown daughters and three grand daughters. The room I rent out is theirs when they visit .I love to travel and spent several 5 month time frames over seas , and have used Airbnb a lot! I love meeting new people.

name: Queen memory foam on top of futon
summary: This single family house is located on the east side of downtown in a very quiet neighbourhood.  The room is in a single family home; three bedroom/two bath with wood floors, back deck and front porch with a swing and rocking chairs.
space: There is space for 2 extra guests in another room; memory foam mattress on the floor.
description: This single family house is located on the east side of downtown in a very quiet neighbourhood.  The room is in a single family home; three bedroom/two bath with wood floors, back deck and front porch with a swing and rocking chairs. There is space for 2 extra guests in another room; memory foam mattress on the floor. Kitchen, internet, Netflix I leave it up to my guests to decide how much interaction they want. I love the quietness on this road. Close to everything but surrounded by trees. There is a bus line about ten minutes walk from the house. There is space for 2 extra guests @ $25 each in another room; memory foam mattress on the floor.
neighborhood_overview: I love the quietness on this road. Close to everything but surrounded by trees.
notes: There is space for 2 extra guests @ $25 each in another room; memory foam mattress on the floor.
transit: There is a bus line about ten minutes walk from the house.
host_about:
I teach Yamuna body rolling and foot fitness classes here in Asheville.  My son and I moved here in 2013 from northern Italy, close to the Swiss border. Originally from the Caribbean I have lived on three continents and speak 3 languages. 
I'm interested in hosting easy going pleasant people I can feel happy about having in my home around me and when they leave I want to feel that I can't wait until they come again for another visit.  You can cook, do laundry if you need to and I have wireless.  I will try to help you as best as I can but I am pretty busy so I need guests who are self-sufficient and because I'm a terrible tourist myself (I've been to Paris three times and the closest I got to the Eiffel Tour was on a city tour bus and I'm perfectly fine with that) I'm not good for statistics on population, income, politics or suggestions on places to go unforturnately.  But on the plus side for the most part I'm happy, easygoing, bright enough to live 51 years well and have a great sense of humour.  I live on trying to be as considerate as possible to others and I truly appreciate when that is also shown to me.  If you are difficult, or a complainer and you know you are because people have told you in as many different ways as they could, my home is not the one for you. You won't have a good time and neither will I. 
I do have a dog and a cat so if you have allergies this is likely not the house for you unfortunately. Gracie, our dog, is very friendly and very loving. If you stroke her she will be your slave.  :) After 8 years I'm still not sure Diego, the cat, even likes me. :)
Any other information you may need, please ask and I will be honest in my reply. :)

name: Modern Master - Minutes to Downtown
summary: Beautiful, modern, spacious home convenient to all of Asheville + Large deck, gorgeous views, and lots of room to relax.  Enjoy the home's master bedroom with modern king bed and super comfy memory foam mattress, private master bathroom with large garden tub, shower, and double vanity. Full kitchen and more
space: This home is recently restored with cherry hardwood floors and a simple, modern design.  Beautiful decks and patios give plenty of space to relax or grill outside. Tunnel Road hosts shopping and restaurants, as well as leading you right into downtown (only 6.5 miles!).  We're just two miles off of Tunnel Road.  If you'd like to visit West Asheville or the River Arts District its all a short drive, we're convenient to I-240, I-40, and all of Asheville. You are just a few short minutes to Filo, a local coffee shop featuring excellent coffee and baked goods.  East Village Grille is one of our favorite places to eat in town. (it's right next door to Filo) We are foodies so we will have plenty of great places to recommend. It's very close to the Blue Ridge Parkway.  You could easily ride your bicycle and get on the parkway to enjoy a beautiful bike ride and/or hike from one of the nearby trails.

neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe, convenient to lots of restaurants, shopping, about a mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway!  You could safely and easily ride your bike to the Parkway entrance from our home.  Please drive slowly through our quiet, dead end neighborhood.
notes: We are constantly improving our home and adding new features for you to enjoy.  Please let us know if you have any special requests that we can have ready for you. You will be sent a restaurant guide the day of check in.
transit: You could easily ride your bicycle from the house to the buss stop that is only 1.9 miles away.  If you are arriving and don't have a car we will gladly pick you up at the nearest buss stop.
host_about:
Traveling all over the world inspired me to get my degree in Culinary Arts and inspired me to move to Asheville.  Great food and unique culture is hard to find in one place.  Somehow Asheville has managed to combine culture, art, great food, locally brewed beer, local farms, and local businesses into a charming town nestled into ancient mountains full of waterfalls, hiking, history, and art.

Asheville is one of the few places that has four beautiful seasons and some of the best coffee and restaurants around.  I am excited to open up my home to travelers and I'm looking forward to share all there is to experience in and around Asheville.

name: Serenity 12 minutes from downtown
summary: Mountain getaway just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville, but miles and miles of trails and the Blue Ridge Parkway are just minutes away. All in an artfully designed and furnished home with comfortable nooks inside and out.
space: Private room with full-size bed in an 1800 square foot ranch-style, uniquely designed contemporary home with cathedral ceilings and open floor plan on a 1/2 acre of land with beautiful gardens. The Green Room is located on a wing of the home, which gives guests plenty of privacy.
description: Mountain getaway just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville, but miles and miles of trails and the Blue Ridge Parkway are just minutes away. All in an artfully designed and furnished home with comfortable nooks inside and out. Private room with full-size bed in an 1800 square foot ranch-style, uniquely designed contemporary home with cathedral ceilings and open floor plan on a 1/2 acre of land with beautiful gardens. The Green Room is located on a wing of the home, which gives guests plenty of privacy. Shared kitchen, bathroom, patio, living room, dining area, and washer/dryer. Included is complimentary tea & coffee bar. I am quite active but committed to make your stay pleasurable. A perfect retreat from the business of town, but not far away either. Across the road is pasture land and a creek. The stars are brighter here than other parts of Asheville :) Warren Wilson College is nearby, with miles of trails to explore. Also the Blue Ridge Parkway and the surrounding Parkway land is all i
neighborhood_overview: A perfect retreat from the business of town, but not far away either. Across the road is pasture land and a creek. The stars are brighter here than other parts of Asheville :) Warren Wilson College is nearby, with miles of trails to explore. Also the Blue Ridge Parkway and the surrounding Parkway land is all in the neighborhood.
transit: It's advisable to have a vehicle as it's a mile and a half along a curvy mountain road to the nearest bus stop. Downtown Asheville: 10-12 minutes Blue Ridge Parkway: 5 minutes Biltmore Estate: 12 minutes Black Mountain, NC: 15 minutes Asheville Airport: 25 minutes UNC-Asheville: 14 minutes Warren Wilson College: 5 minutes If you need to rent a car, shared-economy style, search relay rides. If you need a taxi, search uber.
host_about:
I'm a holistic health practitioner and a musician, pursuing my interests in the beautiful mountains of western North Carolina, where I've lived since 1994. I speak a couple of languages, love photography, and am often in the garden or out hiking. I have a small acupuncture practice in downtown Asheville and I also perform as a guitarist in solo and group settings. 

Having just been using the Airbnb platform since August '14, I've actually been renting rooms in my home steadily since 2008, both to short-term and long-term guests. I pride myself on being an accommodating host and truly enjoy meeting new people. Otherwise, I'm always looking forward to using the Airbnb platform for travel!

name: 25 Acre Retreat 9 Miles to Downtown
summary: Peaceful 25 acre property with grassy fields surrounded by gorgeous mountain views. Hiking trails, fire pits, camp sites, winding creek. Adjacent to federally protected land with more trails. 9 miles to downtown Asheville; near Warren Wilson College.
space: Our 3 bedroom 2 bath home accommodates up to 8 people, with 2 queen size beds and 2 sets of bunk beds.  It's fully equipped with a large kitchen, breakfast bar, dining room that seats 6, yoga / meditation room with long-range views, washer / dryer, back deck with outdoor dining set, and lots of natural light from the large bay windows and skylights.  There's a TV with a complimentary Netflix account as well as DVD's. There's also an AUX jack where you can plug in your phone or iPod to play music thru ceiling speakers located in most rooms. The house sits on large grassy fields with mountain views. One of the fire pits on the property is right beside the house, and a creek runs thru the backyard. There are 2 outdoor hammocks to lounge in.

name: Sunny Modern Country Apartment
summary: Enjoy bird sounds, the breeze, southern mountain views, and clear night skies 9.2 miles from downtown Asheville. My green-built home is well appointed, with great attention to detail. It's perfect for a couple or individual seeking a bucolic getaway.
space: Built in 2011, my top-floor apartment is more like a custom mountain chalet. 16 foot ceilings invite the sun into the kitchen and its hickory-floored main room. It has a custom hickory kitchen with dishwasher and island with 2 breakfast stools. Coffee lovers, just bring your beans. The bedroom and bathroom are right-sized for an individual or couple. •  In mid-2015 it received all new furniture and upgrades.  •  The couch offers a queen sized sleeper for your 2nd, 3rd or 4th guest.  •  There are place settings for 6 if you plan to have company for dinner.  •  The unit is nearly ADA rated, with entrance ramp, a no-step shower and grab-bars. •  Fully stocked with the eco-friendly basics (cleaners and detergents, shampoo, cotton balls and swabs, etc.)  •  No need to filter or to buy bottled water. The whole-house RainSoft water purification system ensures the finest water from our mountain well for your drinking, washing and bathing needs.  Feel free to take some home with you. • There is

neighborhood_overview: We are half-way between Black Mountain and Asheville, 1000' beneath the Blue Ridge Parkway.  Our little unincorporated area is called Riceville. We have 5 churches, no stores or stoplights, and has a reasonably interesting history found by Googling "Riceville, NC history". This is the country, where people generally keep to themselves. It is normally very quiet with fantastic starry nights. There are children in the neighborhood, and you may occasionally hear them playing, 'ahh... the sounds of youth'. To mention a few of the prominent neighbors, we have bear, coyote, bunnies, turkey, fox, skink, lightning bugs and frogs. There are many dogs in this holler. Generally, they keep the bears away. All of them are friendly with people, even if a bit vocal, but are not necessarily gregarious with interloping dogs.
notes: •  Shope Rd. is a private gravel road and does not require 4wd. It does not get plowed in winter, and snow is rare. Full-length RV's will not fit up the driveway. •  Verizon is the only reliable cell network in the Riceville area, and throughout most of WNC. •  From your deck, you have a wonderful view of our neighbor's 1890's era farm with cows and goats, beneath Peach Knob and the Blue Ridge Parkway. •  You can see down into the neighbor's back yard from east side of the home. We provide full blinds in the bedroom to ensure your privacy. •  We don't lock our doors out here. If you do, raise the door handle up to engage the deadbolts from the outside, then lock with key. Key may stick. Hold a finger against the cylinder when removing key and it will slide right out, do not force it. •  Despite my best efforts toilet flush handle sticks, please make sure it returns or it will run, and run.  Before check-out: •  Clean up embarrassing messes •  Strip the beds, and load items into washing
transit: We are 10 miles from both Asheville and Black Mountain. It's takes 15-20 minutes either way. You will need a car, EV, motorcycle or bicycle to get around, unless you love to walk. There is good road cycling and trail running in the valley. The roads do not have shoulders to speak of.
host_about: My arrival in this valley was not coincidental. This quiet and sunny cove continues to inspire my work in the renewable energy field, providing respite from the bustle of life.  I'm an active outdoorsman and lover of healthful and intentional living. In a previous life, I have owned bicycle shops and captained a multi-disciplinary bicycle racing program, then became a green-builder, then I founded a renewable energy company that turns solar power in electric vehicle fuel.  Additionally, I am very proud of my full-honors high-school daughter!
street: Shope Road, Asheville, NC 28805, United States

name: NEW: 12 minutes to downtown
summary: Contemporary East Asheville home with excellent vibes, just 10 minutes from downtown, but with one foot in the country. The Blue Ridge Parkway and many trails are minutes away. A home with great flow, surrounded by the scenic Riceville community.
space: // The Blue Room, Green Room, and Master Suite in this home have been listed on Airbnb for over a year, while this whole house listing is brand new. The reviews on the individual rooms have been excellent, so trust you're in good hands! // You'll get the best of town & country in this semi-rural home in the scenic Riceville community of East Asheville. It's a spacious 1,786 square feet, with 3 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms on a 1/2 acre of land. The home has quite the unique, contemporary design, with cathedral ceilings and a semi-open floorpan. I'd boast that it's tastefully furnished. People say it has a nice flow! It is an excellent design for entertaining.  The master suite is quite luxurious and includes an all natural latex king-size mattress in addition to a whirlpool tub, his & hers sinks, a water closet, and a walk-in shower. The two smaller bedrooms are located on the opposing wing from the master suite which ensures plenty of privacy. There is a king-size bed in one of the room

neighborhood_overview: 12 minutes from downtown Asheville but there are cows just across the road.  The home is not part of a neighborhood or subdivision - thus, it's very private. It's minutes away from lots of trails and the stars are much brighter out here, being a couple of ridges over from downtown!
notes: Utilities are, of course, included: electricity, propane, water, and WIFI.  There is a complimentary tea and coffee bar, which is stocked with teas, coffee, coffee filters, and includes an electric coffee grinder, an electric kettle, and a coffee maker.  Basic necessities are provided: linens, towels, toilet paper, soap and shampoo.  So you know, there is no microwave (there is a gas stove & oven, and toaster in the kitchen; also a juicer). Also, please participate in composting if you like - the garden will display its gratitude :)
transit: It's really necessary to have a vehicle as it's a mile and a half along a curvy mountain road to the nearest bus stop. Downtown Asheville: 10-12 minutes Blue Ridge Parkway: 5 minutes Biltmore Estate: 12 minutes Black Mountain, NC: 15 minutes Asheville Airport: 25 minutes UNC-Asheville: 14 minutes Warren Wilson College: 5 minutes If you need to rent a car, shared-economy style, search Relay Rides. If you need a taxi, search Uber.
host_about:
I'm a holistic health practitioner and a musician, pursuing my interests in the beautiful mountains of western North Carolina, where I've lived since 1994. I speak a couple of languages, love photography, and am often in the garden or out hiking. I have a small acupuncture practice in downtown Asheville and I also perform as a guitarist in solo and group settings. 

Having just been using the Airbnb platform since August '14, I've actually been renting rooms in my home steadily since 2008, both to short-term and long-term guests. I pride myself on being an accommodating host and truly enjoy meeting new people. Otherwise, I'm always looking forward to using the Airbnb platform for travel!

name: Zen Garden Home and Gardens
summary: Our lovely, spacious private room with high ceilings, private bath and entrance offers an adjoining solarium; a place to rest and enhance your visit. Includes a continental breakfast . We are located in a quiet neighborhood minutes from downtown.
space: The sleeping/lounging room you will use has a new comfortable futon mattress, down comforter and plenty of space to lounge, read or watch TV.   The desk area will accommodate your laptop.  Cell phones using Verizon work well.  At&T users will have to go outside to get reception.  There is a table and chairs in the solarium and also on the front porch for your use.   A Continental is provided and special requests will be considered.  Fruit, yogurt, muffins, tea and coffee. Please let us know if you have a special diet. We will do our best to accommodate your desires and needs.

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a quiet family neighborhood with an interesting history. There is a walking trail minutes away that leads to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Mountain to the Sea Trail.  From our backyard you can see Pisgah Mountain and a western sunset. From the front deck enjoy moon viewings and sometimes rainbows.
notes: Our location is convenient to all you will need. Downtown Asheville is minutes away, as is Biltmore House, The Grove park Inn, The Blue Ridge Parkway, The Southern Highlands Craft Guild Shops, Asheville Mall, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, hospitals and the arts district.   I am an Ikebana Master Instructor and if you would like that experience I would be delighted to arrange to give you a class in my studio located behind our home.  There will be an extra charge of $30.00 per person for a two hour class including all materials.
transit: Park at the top of the driveway which is flat and easily accessible to the house.  Our city is easy to get around in.  Starbucks is close by in several locations.......Enjoy it all.   Looking forward to meeting you.
host_about: Our home is our retreat and we enjoy sharing it with others. Visitors tell us they find our home calming, inspiring and a fun place to be. We came to this region for a summer vacation, thirty-five years ago. Sharing our knowledge of Asheville and the region is our pleasure.  We love discovering new places to hike, eat, listen to music and have fun. We like to travel and our last trip was to Ireland, where we stayed at B&B's and enjoyed meeting the people and  absorbing the wondrous landscape. Our style of hosting is to respect your privacy and also to be helpful when asked. We look forward to meeting you.

name: Secluded Modern Cabin with Hot Tub
summary: This rustic, modern cabin sits on 22 acres of private, wooded creekside property in the beautiful Shope Creek area of east Asheville. Newly renovated with 4 bedrooms, 2.5 baths, a new hot tub, large deck and a creekside fire pit.  A perfect getaway!
space: This rustic modern cabin is located on 22 acres of private wooded and creekside property in the beautiful Shope Creek area of east Asheville,  NC.  The  newly renovated large four bedroom log cabin is nestled on a south facing slope minutes from Pisgah National Forest access roads and parking lots, where hiking and biking trails are plentiful. Downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway and Warren Wilson College are also only 15-20 minutes away.  Get the best of both worlds at Shope Creek with a mix of vibrant city attractions and the natural beauty that makes the western NC so famous. The house is equipped with two wood burning fire places and a built in fire pit by the clear rushing creek.  The newly constructed 900 square foot deck has a covered outdoor dining area and a hot tub where you can enjoy the beautiful mountain views and the unobstructed night sky.   The cabin has four bedrooms and two and a half bathrooms.  The large master suite has a king bed, a private full bathroom and

neighborhood_overview: The cabin is located in the gorgeous Shope Creek area of Asheville minutes from hiking and biking trails, but also just ten minutes to Whole Foods and other in town conveniences.  In addition, the property is surrounded by the bold Shope Creek and has a logging road behind the house that is perfect for long hikes up into the forest.  The sound of the rushing creek can be heard from the deck and several of the bedrooms adding to the relaxing feel of this property.
host_about:
We are a family with two small children that love living in the Asheville area.  Both my husband and I were born in North Carolina and have always been especially drawn to the western portion of the state.  We love camping, fishing, biking, hiking and being on the water.  In addition to loving the outdoors, we also frequent the areas unique shops and independent restaurants and would love to share our recommendations with our guests!

We also have a much smaller listing located conveniently close to town!

name: Cozy place 6.5 miles to Downtown
summary: Available Tonight! Modern, warm home in gorgeous neighborhood with mountain views and access to hiking, nature, and downtown.  Enjoy the 50 inch flat screen TV with Netflix and sink into a Rhapsody memory foam bed after a day of hiking in Asheville.
space: I do not take reservations more than 30 days in advance due to Airbnb cancellation and other policies.  This space is modern and artsy with beautiful mountain views off the veranda.  This luxurious home has 3 large bedrooms with KING size beds 2.5 bathrooms with large garden tub, shower, double vanity and more.  Sleeps 6. Cherry hardwood floors, huge kitchen, yoga room and much more in this 2500 square feet, enjoy quick access to the outdoors and grilling.  Kickback and relax with plenty of space for 6-8.  50 inch flat screen TV with wifi and Netflix for all to enjoy. The basement apartment will be opened up for more than 6 guests based on the per person fee. Add the 1200 square foot basement with 2 bedrooms (1 King, 1 queen), 1 bath, another kitchen, living room, dining room, flat screen tv and more for additional guests. The upstairs of the home has 3 bedrooms each with a king bed and 2.5 bathrooms.

neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe, convenient to lots of restaurants, shopping, about a mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway! You could safely and easily ride your bike to the Parkway entrance from our home. Please drive slowly through our quiet, dead end cul-de-sac
notes: We are constantly improving our home and adding new features for you to enjoy. Please let me know if you have any special requests that we can have ready for you
transit: Tunnel Road hosts shopping and restaurants, as well as leading you right into downtown (only 6.5 miles!). We're just two miles off of Tunnel Road. If you'd like to visit West Asheville or the River Arts District its all a short drive, we're convenient to I-240, I-40, and all of Asheville. You are just a few short minutes to Filo, a local coffee shop featuring excellent coffee and baked goods. East Village Grille is one of our favorite places to eat in town. (it's right next door to Filo) We are foodies so we will have plenty of great places to recommend. It's very close to the Blue Ridge Parkway. You could easily ride your bicycle and get on the parkway to enjoy a beautiful bike ride and/or hike from one of the nearby trails.
host_about:
Traveling all over the world inspired me to get my degree in Culinary Arts and inspired me to move to Asheville.  Great food and unique culture is hard to find in one place.  Somehow Asheville has managed to combine culture, art, great food, locally brewed beer, local farms, and local businesses into a charming town nestled into ancient mountains full of waterfalls, hiking, history, and art.

Asheville is one of the few places that has four beautiful seasons and some of the best coffee and restaurants around.  I am excited to open up my home to travelers and I'm looking forward to share all there is to experience in and around Asheville.

summary: This house is brand new!  If you want to read reviews since I don't have too many here yet, click on my profile and look at my other listing.  The two are almost identical, but this one has some improvements such as more privacy, a king in the master and larger master bath.  Both houses are immaculate, have gorgeous views and are extremely convenient to downtown and Biltmore.  The houses have open floor plans and are modern with huge covered porches and three bedrooms.
space: The house is two stories with hardwood floors and an open floor plan.  There are three bedrooms.  The master has a king and a full bath.  The upstairs bedrooms are spacious.  One has a queen and  twin size daybed that pulls out to form a king.  The other bedroom has a queen and a futon that folds out to a full.  The house comfortably accommodates 6, but can sleep up to 10.  There is one full bath upstairs that the two upstairs rooms share.

You will have the whole house to yourself, as it is a stand alone rental.  You wil
neighborhood_overview: This area feels like a hybrid between rural and suburban. The house is down a gravel road.  You can hear the sounds of civilization and there are neighbors nearby, but it is a mostly private space. The best thing is that despite the private feeling, there is a large grocery store that is only about 2 miles away, and downtown in only 6.5 miles away.  We are also very close to the entrance to the Blue Ridge Parkway so you can easily access it for one of the most scenic drives in our country.
notes: We prefer minimum stays of 3 nights but there may be times of exception so you can always ask.  During the summer months we prefer 5 nights but we may make exceptions to this on a case by case basis. We provide all linens including 2 towels sets per person and sheets for the bed.
transit: You will want a car if you stay here.  The nearest bus stop is 2 miles away. The gravel road to the house is only .25 miles off a well maintained state road, and it is not steep or curvy.
host_about: I live on the other side of the farm and raise goats and chickens with my family.  Having a vacation rental has been a dream for awhile.  I am also a licensed naturopathic physician, but right now I spend most of my time on the farm!

name: Creekside Bed & Breakfast(homemade)
summary: Clean & modern digs for 2. Ten minutes to Asheville, next to Blue Ridge Pkwy. Close to everything. Relax to sounds of water. Minutes to  "must sees".  Queen Serta Presidential bed, 2nd floor all to yourself, overlooking creek. Breakfast included!
space: Welcome To Asheville! We offer fresh and clean accommodations, with modern minimalist flare. ALL of our linen to include quilt, blankets and pillow shams are washed after each guest. Mini refrigerator with 2 Dasani water,  2 La Croix and snacks. Special occasion? Let us know if you want us to provide flowers and/or libations (age restrictions). Private bathroom has a blow dryer, toiletries and fresh bathroom linen with each full day of your stay. Iron and iron board NOTE: accommodations are located on the second floor. BREAKFAST: Depending on your preference, enjoy a light (Monday- Thursday) to medium breakfast  (Friday-Sunday) served between 8-9:30 a.m.  Depending on the day of the week, the menu will include a main dish, seasonal fruit, coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice. Your host will leave menu options on the day of arrival. Vegetarian and vegan options available upon request. Please let us know if you have special dietary needs or allergies. Therapeutic Massage is also available

name: Awesome Asheville Space!
summary: Our home is a 10 minute drive to downtown AVL and is nestled behind the Blue Ridge Parkway.  It is lovely and quiet here.  Your space is in our fully finished basement with private entry, full bath, living room, and efficiency kitchen-mtn views/fire pit in back.
space: Huge space!  You get the full finished basement with private entry, kitchen efficiency, full bath, large living area, bedroom, futon couch, tv, with a fire pit and great view of the mountains.  We live upstairs.  Location is 10 minutes from downtown Asheville, 5 from Warren Wilson College, and 5 to Blue Ridge Parkway.  Excellent choice for bike riders, hikers, and/or day time adventurists!  Ideal for one or two couples or couple with kids.  There is one master bedroom and one futon in the living space.
description: Our home is a 10 minute drive to downtown AVL and is nestled behind the Blue Ridge Parkway.  It is lovely and quiet here.  Your space is in our fully finished basement with private entry, full bath, living room, and efficiency kitchen-mtn views/fire pit in back. Huge space! Location is 10 minutes from downtown Asheville, 5 from Warren Wilson College, and 5 to Blue Ridge Parkway.  Excellent choice for bike riders, hikers, and/or day time adventurists!  Ideal for one or two couples or couple with kids.  There is one master bedroom and one futon in the living space. Backyard, fire-pit, and grill.  Access to full basement with bedroom, bath, living room, and kitchenette.  99% private! (storage area is at bottom of stairs, which we may have to access; otherwise, space is totally private-we do
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood in low density residential neighborhood.  It's very rural and the development stops here (for the most part).  There are no sidewalks, it's very mountainy, with lots of trees and wildlife.
notes: You are renting the entire basement apartment, and we do live upstairs.  We are here to help you in anyway we can.  You may find us playing with our dog in the yard or hear our daughter crawling on the floor during the day, but other than that it's pretty quiet and peaceful here.  Like I said it's a great place for day-time adventurers- biking/hiking meca; urban adventurer, quiet/mountain space; and fun people! ;)
transit: WE are about 10 minute car ride to downtown Asheville.  Blue Ridge Parkway is 5 minutes away.  So likely you will want to drive to your destination - Riceville Road (leading to our house) is very windy and narrow - not good for biking or walking.  Biking toward Waren Wilson College is great!
host_about:
Nichole and I are a young couple who have lived in Asheville, NC for 10 years!  We love the mountains, outdoors, and all the urban activities Asheville provides.  Our home is settled in just behind the Blue Ridge Parkway and which offers us a pleasant view of the mountains and a short drive to some of the best road biking (or hiking) in the country! We are also a very short drive to downtown Asheville - we love it here!

Nichole and I love all things to do with personal development and health and wellness.  On the cutting edge of superfoods, bulletproof coffee, and other personal development tools, we are living the lives of modern day professionals wanting the best out of life!  "Health and Personal Development is not for Hippies anymore is my saying!" ;) We listen to people like Tim Ferris and Dave Asprey, Abraham Hicks and Wayne Dyer, Dr. Michael Beckwith and David Wolfe.  We love going to live events and hanging out with our friends.  We read lots of books, and Chris loves his sports. 

We intend to give you a very fun stay.  We are a young family with a dog and small child so our ideal guests have a similar rhythm of waking hours - maximizing the use of the day.  We know the area very well and can assist you find what you want - bike trails/routes, climbing spots, hiking areas, waterfalls, swimming holes, spring water, etc.  We also have a fire pit in the back yard to wind down from your day.  Your space is in our finished basement with its own entry a bedroom, your own bath, living room, and kitchenette.  I must say, the kitchenette is a great place for a morning (or night) writing/reading/coffee ritual!

name: Quiet rustic home in the mountains
summary: A cozy getaway away from it all, no internet or TV here, just the chirping of the birds to let you relax. Lots of great books, a working fireplace, you are three miles from Asheville's greatest attractions in a peaceful, neighborhood.
space: We love our Mountain home and want to share it with you. Whether you are looking for a couples retreat, or just want to get away, we think you will find our home peaceful and comfortable. Recently renovated, fully equipped  kitchen.  Just off  The Blue Ridge Parkway, yet close to town. 18 miles to airport. Less than 2 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway. 4 miles to downtown. 3 miles to the Biltmore Estate. 1 mile to Walmart Supercenter. Less than 5 miles to River Arts District. And so much more… Parking for 3 vehicles available. Our home has two bedrooms and a full bath room.  - Bedroom 1 in the front of the house has two twin beds (or together as 1 Queen) and a large closet.  - Bedroom 2 in the back of the house has two twin beds (or together as 1 Queen) and a large closet. Backyard woods view.  - Living room has 2 recliners and a sofa with a pullout bed. We offer shampoo, conditioner and body wash.

neighborhood_overview: I've been out here since I was 2 years old and made the greatest memories of my life, hiking, fishing and exploring. 18 miles to airport. Less than 2 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway. 4 miles to downtown. 3 miles to the Biltmore Estate. 1 mile to Walmart Supercenter. Less than 5 miles to River Arts District. And so much more…
notes: We are in the mountains, food left out at night may become bear food.
transit: If you wish to get out there... You'll need a car.
host_about:
What are 5 things you can't live without? 
Mountains, hiking in wide open spaces,
Ocean, sailing in a fresh breeze
A good book and something to write in(I guess 4 is well by me)

Born is a small town in Florida, I spent 15 summers in Asheville and in the surrounding mountains and rivers.

I'm a School teacher and run a adventure wilderness camp in the summers.

name: Serenity Yurt
summary: Come try something new and adventurous and stay at our yurt and enjoy the best of both worlds. You can feel a closeness to nature while not skimping on amenities as our yurt is outfitted with everything you need to have wonderful secluded retreat.
space: Living "in the round" will give you tranquility that will stay with you well after you return home.
description: Come try something new and adventurous and stay at our yurt and enjoy the best of both worlds. You can feel a closeness to nature while not skimping on amenities as our yurt is outfitted with everything you need to have wonderful secluded retreat. Living "in the round" will give you tranquility that will stay with you well after you return home. One of our biggest selling points our yurt is that it is in a secluded location but you will only be 5-10 minutes from restaurants and groceries and 15-20 minutes from Biltmore and downtown Asheville or Black Mountain.  If you are looking for a hike the Mountains to the Sea Trail will be about 100 yards from your door. We have received some questions about a sulfur smell in our water that is mentioned in some of our reviews. We are happy to report that as of April 1, after extensive trouble-shooting we have remedied this problem.

summary: Beautiful mountain views above with city lights below. This charming space is a short five minutes and $5 Uber ride from downtown Asheville yet feels worlds away. Exposed rock wall opposite original outside wall gives this apartment a unique and comfortable feel. Everything is newly renovated.
space: Apartment suitable for two people comfortably with room for a third. Very spacious 600 square foot tastefully decorated, reinvented lower level apartment well equipped for both short and long stays. Super convenient to downtown, grocery stores, and tons of restaurants. Plenty of privacy with a separate entrance with a screen door allows guests to enjoy the fresh air and natural light. Outside space with Adirondack seating for guests to lounge the day away. Lots of space on this double lot on our small mountain leaves you feeling away from it all even though you're merely minutes from downtown. Very open layout with beautiful archways and a unique rock wall add both charm and class. Super clean and newly renovated apartment equipped with a private laundry room and great big bathroom. The kitchenette has everything you could need to feel at home when you're away from home. Netflix and Hulu streaming available on flat screen TV. neighborhood_overview: I like to think I live on Asheville's best kept secret! It's quiet, has beautiful views and is close to everything. Depending on which way you go down the mountain you are truly not far from wherever you're headed. You can be downtown in minutes to enjoy all the excitement Asheville has to offer and then retire home in the evening for a quiet peaceful night.  I wouldn't want to call anywhere else home!
notes: Well-mannered, house-broken dogs are welcome but please no rambunctious or aggressive breeds, as I have a small dog and indoor/outdoor cat on the property. My cat doesn't go into the apartment so no need to worry about allergies! The place is newly renovated with brand new linens and rugs so I'd like to keep it clean and fresh for future guests as long as possible. Send me an inquiry and we can discuss a pet fee and anything else further! No cats please.

name: Town and Mountain Peaceful Retreat
space: Welcome to our peaceful retreat tucked under the Blue Ridge Parkway! Our location offers the best of both worlds! With convenient access to the mountains and the town. We are located approximately 7 miles from the center of downtown Asheville, with it's quaint restaurants and coffee shops. And a country mountain road drive up to the Blue Ridge Parkway with inviting trails and spectacular views of the Blue Ridge and Great Smokey Mountains. The Biltmore Estate and Winery is very close by and a great way to spend the day. Also, Beaver Lake is right at your doorstep with a great walking path. Pisgah National Forest and the Great Smokey Mountain National Forest are both nearby with lots of outdoor recreation and adventure activities. Outside makes this home a great mountain vacation setting with the small stream that runs through the property and under the driveway. A forest of trees to your left as you enter, adds to the peacefulness and privacy. The rock patio off the carport is a great p

name: Historic Log Cabin Asheville (18)
space: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our accommodations consist of beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930s. Relax and rock away your stress with a tranquil stay in the Overlook cabin.   This cabin comes with a stone front porch with rocking chairs, small refrigerator, microwave, wood burning fireplace, a queen and a double bed and sleeps 4 people.    Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided.  Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the Internet. All of our vacation cabin rentals have FREE wireless access, today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance. A rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember.  The quaint town of Weaverville is only 5 miles North and downtown Asheville only 6 miles South.  Great restaurants nearby and the French Broad River only a couple of mile

name: LG Private Rm, Entrance and Bathrm!
summary: Just Listed (reduced price)...Our beautiful home is on a quiet hillside, 2 miles N. of downtown. Enjoy the privacy of your own large room, bathroom, shower, entrance & fridge. Walk to trails, gardens, UNCA, eateries & a breathtaking sunset/mtn view.
space: The space is private, clean and simple. It is an extra large room with a comfortable king size bed as well as a fold out futon couch. There is a work desk, some end tables, a large closet and a big Papazan chair to enjoy. Your private entrance takes you through your private bathroom to your private bedroom.  Private parking included!
description: Just Listed (reduced price)...Our beautiful home is on a quiet hillside, 2 miles N. of downtown. Enjoy the privacy of your own large room, bathroom, shower, entrance & fridge. Walk to trails, gardens, UNCA, eateries & a breathtaking sunset/mtn view. The space is private, clean and simple. It is an extra large room with a comfortable king size bed as well as a fold out futon couch. There is a work desk, some end tables, a large closet and a big Papazan chair to enjoy. Your private entrance takes you through your private bathroom to your private bedroom.  Private parking included! You will have access to your own personal fridge, hot water heater, tea and coffee.  You will have your own entrance, so you can be as private as you like with no time restrictions. There is free wireless access, as well as a shared laundry machine and dryer that you are welcome to use.  Feel free to use the property, including the back patio and the front gardens and sitting bench. We only ask you to avoid usi
neighborhood_overview: This home is perched on a hill with some views of downtown and the mountains   Best neighborhood in town...quiet, safe, close to beautiful hiking trails, the botanical gardens, UNCA, a spectacular sunset & mountain view, and plenty of great eateries are all within a 5-10 minute walk.  Try walking over to 'Zen Sushi' and 'The Hop' Ice Cream on Merrimon for a great night. Or our local hangout, 'Asheville Brewing Company' for the best beer, pizza and $3 movies every night. No need to drive.
notes: Please be aware that this room is on our first floor. We do our best to be quiet and observe quiet hours, but you may hear us at times. We have an adorable baby girl (born in October of 2015).  She has a great temper but she also does have her moments. You may hear her momentarily, but we live in a separate part of the house so her noises have never been a problem with previous guests.  I just like for guests to know ahead of time. There is also an air filter in your room that you can run to create white noise. We are a legally permitted 'Homestay'. This means that the city of Asheville has inspected and approved this room. The permit can be viewed in the pictures.
transit: It is so easy to get around, by foot, bicycle or by car. Situated only 2 miles from downtown.  Uber rides are also available for about $6 to downtown. There is also a convenient public bus walking distance as well. Airport transportation can also be arranged. (just ask us)
host_about: I am a massage therapist and yoga teacher who usually lives in Asheville, NC. I am often on tour teaching Thai Yoga Bodywork around the U.S. I live with my girlfriend, Krystal, who is an acupuncturist and a yoga teacher. We are professional and friendly and one of us will be around to greet you. We would be honored to host you in our healing sanctuary...
