name: Country Living in the City Limits
summary: I live in a 1939 Cape Cod home near 67 acre Beaver Lake in the northern part of Asheville.  It is convenient to downtown by car (8 minutes max) or by bus.  My house sits on a one acre lot and is private.  I actually have two bedrooms available.
space: This is for one attic bedroom which is spacious and private.  This listing has a king size bed. There is another smaller yet cozy bedroom  upstairs that has a queen size bed. Go to Private Room with Private Grounds to view that bedroom.
description: I live in a 1939 Cape Cod home near 67 acre Beaver Lake in the northern part of Asheville.  It is convenient to downtown by car (8 minutes max) or by bus.  My house sits on a one acre lot and is private.  I actually have two bedrooms available. This is for one attic bedroom which is spacious and private.  This listing has a king size bed. There is another smaller yet cozy bedroom  upstairs that has a queen size bed. Go to Private Room with Private Grounds to view that bedroom. Travelers are welcome to watch TV in the living room, sit on the covered side porch or the rear deck which is quite large (12X31).  You are welcome to walk the grounds as well.  2.5 blocks away is Beaver Lake, a 67 acre lake which is a wonderful walk as well.  The city bus line goes right past my house and the bus stop is 3 minutes away.  There are numerous grocery stores, restaurants and banks on Merrimon Avenue which is  7 blocks away. I should be here most of the time to help you should you need assistance. Th
neighborhood_overview: This is a 1930's upscale neighborhood with lots of trees and a huge lake.  We are convenient to downtown and there is not much development here.  That all happened 80 years ago thank goodness.  There are multiple banks, drug stores, restaurants five and more blocks from the house on Merrimon Avenue.
notes: I sometimes hold gatherings in my home during the day or in the evening.  This is not often and these are not loud affairs and I will do my best to coordinate with you so that you don't have to be exposed to a group setting.  Should we be in the living room, I will open the rear door so that you can enter from there and have private access to the stairs that go up to the second floor.
transit: You can get downtown in your own vehicle in around 8 minutes or you can take the bus which comes by every 45 minutes.  The bus runs right in front of my house though the bus stop is about 1.5 blocks to the left of my driveway as you exit the property.
host_about: I am a semi retired male, UNC graduate, interested in spirituality, organic gardening, Access Consciousness, and enjoying life.  My home is my temple and I aspire to make it welcoming and peaceful for all who enter into it.  Beauty is important to me so I have a fair number of art objects in the house.  I lead a health conscious lifestyle.  My home is also gay friendly.

notes: No Smoking allowed  No Pets Allowed   Free Parking in front Available  Shared Bathroom-If the room next to this space is rented, then it is shared, otherwise it is not. (That is information I may disclose to guests once the room is booked)
transit: Traveling from this house to downtown is a two mile drive/walk. I walk regularly to downtown and it takes myself about 20 minutes. The drive is about 5-7 minutes.  Parking downtown:Sundays are free STREET parking. Monday-Saturday can be quite busy and is always worth checking out the two free parking lots on Church street. If one can not find parking there, the best bet is to park in the garages. The first hour is free is these garages. If you decide to street park just remember to have a bag of quarters!
host_about:
I am a personal assistant for a community and health based organization known as "The Spot", located in downtown Asheville. This group of people I am working with are tight knit and trustworthy and I am here to help them, as they are helping me with my personal goals. I wish to further my self and community taught education in Women's/Human studies and Holistic Health. I am physically active and enjoy exercise and participating in competitive sports. I enjoy a city life but also a rural one which is why Asheville has been a perfect place for myself. 
 I require respect and care from the people looking to share my space. If you have any other questions for me and this space call my number or email provided.

name: Share My Home Above Asheville
summary: Share my 5000 sq. ft. Fantasy Home 3500 ft high above the city  Mountain Views, Chef's Kitchen, Decks & gardens to meander in & do Yoga 5 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway & 10 to town I'm a senior with 2 loving pups, please come visit..........
space: I have a 5000 sq ft home on top of a mountain yet only 5 minutes away from one of the most famous scenic parkways in America and 10 minutes down to one of the unique towns in the USA: Asheville.  My home built in 2004, sits on almost 1 1/2 acres of almost flat land (rare in the mountains) with places to walk, practice Yoga, or just sit on the deck and read while enjoying the majestic mountains, or if lucky watch mama bear and her cubs walk the property.  Don't worry, no risk, as long as you stay away from the cubs.  The large upstairs bedroom is actually a second master suite with windows in bedroom and bath overlooking the mountains and the gardens plus a small balcony for that first private cup of coffee.  If you have an extra guest or two the 2nd bedroom with full bath will be made available to you. On the main floor there's a Chef's kitchens, sans chef.  So if you can cook, go at it.  Otherwise, Asheville is renowned for it's restaurants, and ALL of their fine cuisine can and will

My home built in 2004, sits on almost 1 1/2 acres of almost flat land (rare in the mountains) with places to walk, practice Yoga, or just sit on the deck and read while enjoying the majestic mountains, or if lucky watch mama bear and her cubs walk the property.  Don't worry, no risk, as long as you stay away from the cubs.  The large upstairs bedroom is actually a second master suite with windows in bedroom and bath overlooking the mountains and the gardens plus a small balcony for that first private cup of coffee.  If you have an extra guest or two th
neighborhood_overview: Crime is rare.  Love is everywhere.  The only thing greater the Love you will feel is the Beauty that you will experience.  I have lived in New York, London, Paris.....and been in much of the rest of the world.....I choose Asheville.
notes: I have two small dogs.  They do not bark (maybe a little).  As already noted, I do.  This is not a hotel, nor a BNB.  You are invited into most of the house except of course my bedroom, and I request that you come into my LIBRARY BY INVITATION ONLY.  I will respect your privacy, and ask the same. THE PHOTOGRAPHS AROUND THE HOUSE:  I have risked my embarrassment by hanging photographs I have taken of sunrises and sunsets  over the past few months.  They conflict with the beautiful art I have collected during my lifetime, but I am proud of them.  If you see one of them that you might like to take home with you to hang in some small space, let me know.  They are not masterpieces and I am not trying to create a business.  If they can be a tangible remembrance for you and I am reimbursed for my efforts.  I would be pleased.  However feel no pressure.
transit: Uber, Taxi's, Rental cars, bicyclists, donkey carts.....Come to Asheville...Stay with me, stay downtown, but come to Asheville and experience.....
host_about:
I like people.  I like making the world a better place one step at a time. Besides that: 
I am a retired businessman and Philanthropist.  Amateur writer, well traveled and  well read.  I live in Asheville because of the people, mountains,the air,  atmosphere and because I am tired of suits and formality.  I am self made as well as self educated.  I've lived in London, Paris, New York and South Florida.  I expect to live out my days here. Maya Angelou & Mother Theresa are my idols.  Cavafy & Frost my favorite poets.  Ella Fitzgerald & Lady Holliday favorite singers.  Jerry Herman's music and lyrics (think Hello Dolly, Mame, La Cage Au Follies).  I have served on the Board of Caring for Children for over two years.  Prior to that I have been active on similar organizations in New York City, Fire Island and Fort Lauderdale, Florida.
I have 2 dogs: a Westie & a 15 pound rescue terrier mix. 
My mantra is a quote from Nelson Henderson, "The true meaning of life is to plant a tree under whose shade you do not expect to sit."

name: Your room is ready in Asheville!
summary: Rest easy in your light-filled bedroom with a private half-bath and a shared full bath.   Spring has sprung here in Asheville! Now is a great time to enjoy our hiking, river rafting, brew pubs and more! We look forward to meeting you.
space: After a busy day exploring Asheville, rest easy in our north Asheville home. We're in a completely renovated 1940s stone-and-rock house within walking distance of UNCA. You will delight in your colorful, light-filled bedroom with a queen-sized sleigh bed, your own private half-bath, and a shared full bath.

As our guest, we invite you to start your morning with fresh coffee and bagels. We offer complimentary toiletries, fresh linens, WiFi, and no stairs to climb. We are easy to find and centrally located in north Asheville, near everything that makes Asheville so fun. We offer safe, private off-street parking, and cover
neighborhood_overview: We are easy to find and centrally located in north Asheville, near everything that makes Asheville so fun. We offer safe, private off-street parking, and covered storage space for bikes and kayaks.
notes: Victoria is a local artist and English-Spanish bilingual; Gordon works in the tourist industry in  Asheville. Our home is filled with art and light. We are LGBTQ-friendly; everyone is welcome. We'd love to meet you.
transit: We are 17 miles from AVL airport, less than a mile from Interstate 26, and two blocks from the French Broad River. We are a 5-minute drive or 10-minute walk to UNCA; the River Arts District (5 minutes away), downtown Asheville (5 mins.), river tubing (5  mins.), brewery crawls (10  mins.), Biltmore Estate (10  mins.), river rafting (15  mins.), the Blue Ridge Parkway (20  mins.), and of course the Hot Springs (25 mins).
host_about: Victoria is an artist and is English-Spanish bilingual; Gordon is a woodworker and in the tourist business in Asheville. We love living in Asheville, surrounded by the great Smokey Mountains; you're going to love staying and playing here.

name: A Lovely Room in a Lovely Home
summary: Enjoy a "Real Breakfast!" with us. We are promising you an affordable, warm and gracious "B&B" experience.  This includes a  delicious complementary breakfast "hand crafted" just for you.   We'll  be glad to assist you with your visit.
space: Our newly renovated single story home is very close to Asheville (9 minutes to Pack Square in Asheville.)  Weaverville is only 4 minutes to Main Street via I-26.   Our location provides a great jumping off spot for all that Asheville and Weaverville have to offer. The guest room has a queen-sized bed, dresser, desk, chair, and a reading lamp.
description: Enjoy a "Real Breakfast!" with us. We are promising you an affordable, warm and gracious "B&B" experience.  This includes a  delicious complementary breakfast "hand crafted" just for you.   We'll  be glad to assist you with your visit. Our newly renovated single story home is very close to Asheville (9 minutes to Pack Square in Asheville.)  Weaverville is only 4 minutes to Main Street via I-26.   Our location provides a great jumping off spot for all that Asheville and Weaverville have to offer. The guest room has a queen-sized bed, dresser, desk, chair, and a reading lamp. We will pamper you with a complimentary breakfast that will be prepared personally for you each day of your stay. You will have safe "on premises" parking.    Susan and Gary are available to give advice about restaurants, bars, hiking zip-lining, biking and other local attractions; including The Grove Park Inn, The Biltmore Estate and the North Carolina Arboretum. We are easily accessible to Asheville.  Our neighbor
neighborhood_overview: We are easily accessible to Asheville.  Our neighborhood is well maintained and feel safe.  There are pets and kids in the neighborhood.  Drive carefully.
notes: dba Shoemaker & Company
transit: Directions to our home:  Coming from Asheville:  via I240 to Weaverville ramp I-26W go 5 miles, exit at New Stock Rd. Turn right at traffic light and turn left at Citgo station.   Take first left after Pizza Hut.   Proceed on Knoll Ridge Rd. Take third left onto Westminster Rd.  Enter first house on the right where Firwood Court begins. Business Travelers We welcome business travellers and are willing to help with special accommodations.  Let us know what we can do to help with planning a successful business trip.
host_about:
We are from Asheville, North Carolina. I am a retired teacher and Gary is retired from business. We love to travel in the states as well as internationally. 

Four years ago, we went to Ecuador to study Spanish for a month.  We visited Quito and Cuenca.

On our trip last September 2014, we visited Venice, Florence, Rome, Pompeii, Pisa, Tuscany, Siena, Ancona.  Before returning home we visited Hvar, Croatia for 10 days.  The entire trip lasted 30 days.  Every stay in Italy and Croatia was an Airbnb.   

We are planning a Airbnb vacation in Spain, and maybe Portugal, for this autumn.   Stay tuned.

Gary and I got married in Barbados in May of 2012.

As Airbnb guests we are considerate and unassuming.   As Airbnb hosts we are engaged with our guests and enjoy offering suggestions for their trips.  We have full breakfasts with our guests.  We answer questions and help them plan their day.

We are doing business as Shoemaker & Company, a registered corporation in the state of North Carolina.

name: Sweet Sunny Suite w/ Fenced in Yard
summary: Charming bedroom suite w/ bathroom, open kitchen, and screened-in porch, 8 minutes from downtown. Right off highway which leads to Downtown, Westside, River Arts, Biltmore, hiking, etc. Two 25# pups live here. Let's talk about your pup joining!
space: My house is just minutes from downtown, the River Arts District, the West Side, and the high way.  It's also set on nearly an acre, so it's quiet and you can see the stars at night.  Your bedroom has an attached bathroom for your own private use.  I can accommodate any friendly dogs at the house.  My front yard is completely fenced in.  I let my dogs hang out there when I'm not home, with a kiddie pool and drinking water.

There is plenty of yard available to you, as well as a wood deck in the back and a screened in porchin front for dining, morning coffee, and reading.  There are two bedrooms that are off limits but the rest of the house is yours to use , including a laundry room.  I have done lots of renovations to the house to make it an invit
neighborhood_overview: Woodfin is situated just barely north of Asheville.  There is a river park and restaurants just 2 minutes from the house.  The house is less than 10 minutes from the majority of every great thing Asheville has to offer.
transit: There is a small gravel lot for parking at the house.  Lots of folks also use Uber around here so if you want to have a saucy night out, you should be able to get home, no problem.  An Uber from my house to downtown is $10-15.
host_about:
I am passionate. I am an optimistic realist. I come from humble beginnings. I believe in working hard and treasuring the simple and beautiful things in life. I have traveled quite a bit but am so happy to be settling in to Asheville. I have a bit of an edgy sense of humor at times but certainly have a sweet and nurturing spirit as well.

I teach people how to brew coffee in incredible ways and what quality coffee looks like, tastes like. I also talk a lot about what it takes to get that coffee in to your cup. I like to make coffee accessible and am very turned off by pretension in the coffee community.

I spend a lot of time thinking about how to improve myself. I genuinely want to be the best person I can be and contribute in the most positive way I can.

name: Downtown, River Arts, W Asheville
summary: Comfy queen sized bed, just minutes from Downtown, River Arts, and West Asheville! Fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, and laundry are available during your stay.  As well as easy access to the highway, nature hikes, and the Biltmore!
space: Less than five minutes to Downtown, River arts, and West Asheville, this lush private room has a comfy queen sized bed, a private workspace, and a shared bathroom.  You are welcome to use anything in the kitchen, laundry, and record player, just keep in mind there is a possibility of these spaces being used by other guests, or myself, on occasion.   I will always do my best to communicate with you if there are guests staying in the other room, or the Airstream in the driveway.  But please be advised, there is only one bathroom in the house.  Look at it as an opportunity to expand your horizons and meet other awesome people! If you'd like the whole place to yourself, please check out my other listing, which allows you to rent the entire home! Thanks for looking :)

neighborhood_overview: Super quiet street, just seconds from the highway, and 5 minutes to Downtown, River Arts District, and West Asheville! My house is also across the street from the French Broad River and has some lovely hiking and nature walks in the area!
notes: Please keep in mind when booking that this is a shared space, you will have your own room, but the bathroom and kitchen will often times be in use by either myself, or other guests.  I will always do my best to remain as transparent and open as possible to your requests, concerns, and needs.  As well as who will be there during your stay, if anyone at all! I ask that you remain respectful of the space and keep it clean, so others can enjoy it as well.   And one last thing, I have a dog.  Like I said, we won't be around much, but from time to time, we will.  If you are uncomfortable with dogs in any way, please let me know and I will do my best to accommodate.   Otherwise, have yourself a marvelous time!
transit: Not real familiar with the bus system, but Asheville has one should you need to get around.  If you have a car, we are right down the street from the highway, and you can always call Uber or Lyft, won't cost much! Also, if I am around and you need a ride, don't hesitate to ask!
host_about: Cosmic mermaid with a bit of an eclectic and eccentric sense of life.  Adventuresome spirit who enjoys connecting with others and would love to host as many travelers as possible! Loves stories from both near and far, as well as expanding her network on the global grid.  Thanks for your interest, she is already looking forward to your stay :)

space: The apartment is about 1,000 sq ft, with sitting area, full balcony to sit and enjoy coffee, tea and croissant.  The Keurig coffee machine, microwave and mini-fridge are there for those midnight snacks or simple breakfasts you want to make for yourselves in order to go out to the balcony and watch the mountains come out of the mist. A television in the living room and the bedroom with a full selection of cable channels as well as local ones.  Of course free wi-fi and excellent internet even here 3,500 ft up.  Just 5 minutes by car to the famous Blue Ridge Parkway with its incredible panoramic drive;  and only a 10 minute,  4 mile drive down the mountain to the center of Asheville.  However you might just consider spending some time amidst the tranquil gardens or fields on the property.

In the winter there is the warmth of a wood burning stove in the living room.  Off street parking is also available. Living room and dining room are available for your use beside the kitchen. There is also a wonderful screened in front porch, sun room and a back deck with gas grill you  also  have access to.  I am happy to provide coffee and teas for your morning start, there is always home made jams, and you never know what else may be there for you, but no promises. No matter the kitchen is yours to use.  Shopping is so close don't feel shy about taking advantage of
neighborhood_overview: This home is in a safe and lovely walk-able neighborhood one block from a small park and tennis courts.   I 240 is one mile away.  The Grove Park Inn is  also very close.  UNCA is 2 miles away.  Downtown is 1 1/2 miles away.
notes: As of December 2015 the city of Asheville has requested home stays have a permit, I have complied, passed the inspection and have been issued a permit.
transit: The bus stop is a block away with service about every half hour.  Uber is now available in town, I can also help with transportation when I'm available to downtown.  I'm a perfect location for vendors for The Highland Craft Fair, and depending on my schedule will also get you there and back.
host_about:
Retired from nutritional supplement business a few years ago.  Have lived in Asheville since 2004 after relocating from San Francisco.  
Enjoy the outdoors, music, traveling and of course meeting new people and sharing experiences.

name: Private, sunny suite near Downtown
summary: Sunny, private suite near Downtown & West Asheville, River Arts District, French Broad River, and more! LGBTQ & straight friendly. all the amenities of home plus home raised eggs. Kids and dogs welcome. Please inquire about avail. before booking.
space: Simple, clean and comfy with a queen size and twin bed and private sitting area with your own coffee maker. Breakfast of our own home-raised eggs is included! Our home is a suburban farmstead in the making, and we will always share whatever fresh seasonal bounty is rolling in from the garden.  Two beds are available in this suite, each in their own room with a real door in between: One queen size with a conventional mattress and one twin with a futon platform bed with a memory foam and wool mattress topper.  We are are a welcoming, fun family and welcome children and pets alike. We do ask that you be prepared to take your dog with you when you go out and keep them in the suite when you leave.  We have lived in Asheville over 10 years and are happy to offer guidance and suggestions for our favorite places to visit! We our outdoorsy folks and have lots of gear you can borrow to enjoy the French Broad River (a canoe and paddles, inner tubes, etc.) and lots more so just ask! The space has

neighborhood_overview: We are in a quiet working class residential neighborhood on a dead end street. We've lived here seven years and always found our neighbors friendly and it's a very safe location, if not much to look at! It's a great place to take a quiet stroll or sit in the garden in the warm months and watch songbirds and honey bees doing their thing!
notes: Our home is near the interstate, so there is some steady droning traffic noise at night that could disturb light sleepers (though we find it to be more of white noise). The space has white noise machine for your convenience. If you have any questions at all, please let me know!
transit: We are very close to I-240 so it's easy to hop on the interstate and go wherever you want, or ride your bike down to the River Arts district.
host_about: Hello & welcome to our home! So a little about us: My wife works for a non-profit, protecting the environment in our beautiful Western NC mountains and I am a stay-at-home papa with our daughter (who absolutely loves everyone). On the side,  we're urban homesteaders, AirBnB hosts, and I'm also a driver with Uber. We both love meeting new people, growing, cooking & eating good food, traveling, camping, hiking, discovering new swimming holes, home-brewing, science, nature, and all kinds of art & music. We want you to have a great, comfortable stay, especially sharing tips on our favorite places to enjoy and explore in and around Asheville. Ask us anything and make yourself at home!

This neighborhood is located next to UNCA, offering wonderful hiking trails throughout the botanical gardens, and from April-December, a weekly farmer's market every Saturday from 8 AM - 12 PM. host_about:
I am a personal assistant for a community and health based organization known as "The Spot", located in downtown Asheville. This group of people I am working with are tight knit and trustworthy and I am here to help them, as they are helping me with my personal goals. I wish to further my self and community taught education in Women's/Human studies and Holistic Health. I am physically active and enjoy exercise and participating in competitive sports. I enjoy a city life but also a rural one which is why Asheville has been a perfect place for myself. 
 I require respect and care from the people looking to share my space. If you have any other questions for me and this space call my number or email provided.

name: Spa Retreat Asheville
summary: South facing, downtown & long views. Enjoy a secluded, peaceful home away from home with private outdoor spaces, sauna, hot tub & outdoor shower. You're only 10-12 minutes  and four miles from bustling Asheville. Fabulous views from almost 3000 feet.
space: This is an extraordinary contemporary style property with great location & with a similar views as the Grove Park Inn. Ceilings are high, & the entire south facing is windows with 30-40 mile views (on a clear day).
description: South facing, downtown & long views. Enjoy a secluded, peaceful home away from home with private outdoor spaces, sauna, hot tub & outdoor shower. You're only 10-12 minutes  and four miles from bustling Asheville. Fabulous views from almost 3000 feet. This is an extraordinary contemporary style property with great location & with a similar views as the Grove Park Inn. Ceilings are high, & the entire south facing is windows with 30-40 mile views (on a clear day). Guests have access to the entire lower level with separate entrance, including a moderate sized bedroom (queen bed), an adjoining living room with sectional couch and pull out queen bed (up-charge for third and fourth person), a small full bathroom, and sauna. Additionally, guests are permitted to use the lower level patio, main level patio with hot tub and outdoor shower, & grounds (6 1/2 acres). There is also a half bath on the main floor that is available when necessary. Our greatest resource is that we are available personal
neighborhood_overview: Our home is on almost 7 acres in a residential community of single family homes with close access of all Asheville features, and within 3 1/2-4 miles of the famed blue ridge parkway.
notes: Our road is 1.9 miles from Beaverdam Rd., and it is a curvy. Our concrete driveway is in a hairpin curve, under a streetlight, and is straight/steeply up. There's a mailbox with our number, and a large stone marker with three 'R's'.
transit: You need your own transportation to get around, as the nearest bus stop is almost two miles away.
host_about: I and my wife are longtime residents of Asheville who moved here to enjoy the mountains and all that Asheville offers.  I've maintained a chiropractic practice here and am now slowly disengaging to have more time to travel and enjoy the area, particularly long distance biking and hiking.  My wife owns a well regarded women's consignment store in North Asheville, minutes from downtown.  We know the area WELL and can enthusiastically share our "secret" special places with you.  Just ask! A big plus we can talk about (if interested) is I can offer guided bike/hike tours for all levels, bikes and helmets provided.

summary: This is a large BR/Bath with soaking tub & walk-in shower in a renovated hillside 1960s home. Also an exercise room and private enclosed patio. Kitchen and common area privileges. 5 mi downtown. 2-week minimum. No night owls or late sleepers, please.
space: Medium-term rental for a single person perhaps moving to the area or temporarily in the area. The large bedroom has a queen bed, chest, night table, chair and walk-in closet. Please note that there is only a curtain, not a door, to the master bedroom. (The second bedroom -- which would be mine -- has a door.)

name: Bungalow and BBQ
summary: Spacious bedroom and private bath in a sweet bungalow with lots of personality. Extremely convenient location in a historic neighborhood that is wonderful for walking/running, close to UNCA and only about a mile from downtown. Next to great BBQ!
space: Lovely, bright, and spacious private bedroom with adjacent private guest bathroom make your stay very comfortable. The bedroom has a writing desk, large closet, and wonderful original art. Perfect for one or a couple. The screened porch is nice for lounging with coffee, or wine in the evenings. Indoor cats are in residence and are friendly and adorable. There is off street parking for a small to medium car. Asheville Homestay Permit Issued and Up to Date

neighborhood_overview: Norwood Park is a wonderful historic neighborhood full of lovely tree lined streets, where lots of walking, running and cycling happens. It's within walking distance to a nice little park, the Grove Park Inn, UNCA, and lots of restaurants and ice cream shops. It's about a mile to downtown, very convenient to neighborhood amenities and easy to find.
notes: I have indoor cats, so if you're allergic or have an aversion to cats, this is not the place for you! I don't allow the furry ones in the guest room, however. Also, I have an off street parking spot for a small to mid sized car. If you have a larger vehicle, just let me know and I can accommodate you. There are about 5 stone steps between the parking area and walkway to house that are slightly irregular and may present an inconvenience to those with mobility issues.
transit: Bus lines run right nearby and cabs are about $5 to downtown. We also have Uber now!
host_about: I am a lover of the outdoors. I'm an artist, and do mostly landscapes because I never get tired of natural scenery. I also get outside a lot, whether it be hiking, paddling, or camping. Travel is one of my favorite things to do also, and I've been lucky enough to see some amazing places around the world.

name: It's All About The View
summary: Bittersweet Cottage is a wonderful retreat from your everyday cares.  The one-bedroom cottage is located between downtown Asheville land the Blue Ridge Parkway.  We think it has everything you need for a relaxing getaway.  We hope you feel the same.
space: Bittersweet Cottage is a self-catered free-standing accommodation. The location is ideal.  We are only 5 miles from downtown yet offer outstanding city and long-range mountain views.  You can listen to the sounds of the beautiful waterfall while soaking in your private hot tub, feed the koi in the pond and, well, just let it all go.
description: Bittersweet Cottage is a wonderful retreat from your everyday cares.  The one-bedroom cottage is located between downtown Asheville land the Blue Ridge Parkway. Feel free to stroll around. There are no shared amenities.   We are always available  but endeavor to stay out of the way.   We have been in the vacation rental business for over 11 years and have found that most folks just want to do their own thing.  That doesn't mean that we wouldn't be happy to have a glass of wine and get to know you better, but we will leave th
neighborhood_overview: North Asheville has just about anything you can think of - DOUGH is a very popular bakery/cafe.  Trader Joe's is a recent arrival.  A stroll through the Beaver Lake Bird Sanctuary is always a fun thing to do.
notes: We stock the Cottage with breakfast items for your first morning.  There are eggs, juice, fruit, muffins, coffee and tea.  The kitchen is fully stocked and all linens and paper products are  provided. Robes and complimentary spa slippers Locally-made herbal soap RATES: January through March  - $235.00/Night April through September - $265.00/Night October - $295.00/Night November through Decemb(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)% off for stays of 7 nights or more 2 Night minimum One night stays will be considered if they fall between 2 reservations NO CLEANING FEE NO SECURITY DEPOSIT Maximum occupancy is two guests. Additional overnight guests are not allowed without prior approval. No pets please. Smoke what you like outside but there is absolutely NO smoking inside the Cottage. If the Cottage is booked please see our other listing "The Suite at Bittersweet".
transit: Private parking is provided for the Cottage.  Taxi service is also available if you don't want to drive into town.   Uber is also available in Asheville.

name: Modern Tiny House on Wheels
summary: My custom-built THOW sits just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville on the Weaverville line. It is bright and airy with a mountain view in the winter and beautiful woods on one side. It was recently featured on an episode of HGTV's Tiny House Hunters!!
space: The house is 130 square feet plus sleeping lofts. It sits on an 18 foot trailer.
description: My custom-built THOW sits just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville on the Weaverville line. It is bright and airy with a mountain view in the winter and beautiful woods on one side. It was recently featured on an episode of HGTV's Tiny House Hunters!! The house is 130 square feet plus sleeping lofts. It sits on an 18 foot trailer. I am usually around but even if I'm out of town I'm always available by text, phone, or e-mail. I call this kind of area "urban country" meaning that it's dark and quiet at night and has some of the quirks of the countryside but you can still see the neighbors' homes and have very quick access to any urban amenities you might want. The property is about 1 mile from Interstate 26...super easy access! The house is off of a private gravel road. You will occasionally have lights from a car or truck shine briefly into the windows of the tiny house as they pass by. Hot water tank is only 12 gallons so plan ahead for multiple users!!
neighborhood_overview: I call this kind of area "urban country" meaning that it's dark and quiet at night and has some of the quirks of the countryside but you can still see the neighbors' homes and have very quick access to any urban amenities you might want.
notes: The house is off of a private gravel road. You will occasionally have lights from a car or truck shine briefly into the windows of the tiny house as they pass by. Hot water tank is only 12 gallons so plan ahead for multiple users!!
transit: The property is about 1 mile from Interstate 26...super easy access!
host_about:
Hello! I'm a former Interior Designer turned Restaurateur turned tiny house owner. I love exploring Western North Carolina and as part of the process of moving here, decided to try tiny house living during this phase of my life. I've realized that many people are curious about downsizing and "testing" out the lifestyle so I decided to share my place as both a vacation novelty and a learning experience for those wondering if it might be the right move for them.

Having run my own restaurant back in San Diego, I'm really into the food scene in Asheville, as well as going out to support live music on a regular basis. Hiking is another one of my passions, and at the moment, I'm getting ready to launch an on-line vacation planning business. As you can see, I'm very enthusiastic about everything this part of the country has to offer! :-)

name: Historic Log Cabin Asheville (9)
space: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our accommodations consist of beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930s. Relax and rock away your stress with a tranquil stay in the Happy Haven cabin.   This cabin comes with a rocking chair front porch, small refrigerator, a queen bed and sleeps 2 people.    Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided.  Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the Internet. All of our vacation cabin rentals have FREE wireless access, today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance. A rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember.  The quaint town of Weaverville is only 5 miles North and downtown Asheville only 6 miles South.  Great restaurants nearby and the French Broad River only a couple of miles away. name: New Home 7 min. from downtown
summary: This new green built house (2016) is located 7 minutes from downtown Asheville but has the feel of the country.  The property overlooks a small homestead with a rushing stream.  This newly built and decorated space is the perfect retreat.
space: Environments are very important to me.  I've worked hard to create a space that feels serene and comforting.  The aesthetic is clean, cozy, and modern with a rustic twist.  The decor captures some of the Appalachian culture so many come to this region to experience.   The apartment is the entire bottom floor of a house (in which I live in the top two floors)  You will have your own entrance with plenty of privacy.  It is best suited for a couple but can accommodate up to 4 people.  The bedroom has a queen size bed.  The living room couch can fold out into a queen bed as well. The living room is equipped with books, games, a TV, and yoga/meditation tools.  My hope is that during your stay it will feel like home for you.

The living room is equipped with books, games, a TV, and yoga/meditation tools.  My hope is that during your stay it will feel like home for you. The bottom floor of the house is
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is beautiful and quiet. It's a country road that leads to a mostly undeveloped subdivision with spectacular views.  It's a a lovely area to walk.    We are in walking distance to the Fireplace Restaurant.   It's minutes away from many other dining options, stores, yoga studios, YMCA, parks and lakes, and only a 15 minute drive to Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: The bedroom has a queen size bed.  The sofa in the living room pulls out to a queen size bed as well.   No pets allowed. The driveway is new and in great condition, however it is VERY STEEP.  I don't recommend driving up it in snow or ice.
transit: The interstate entrance is only a few mile from the home. Within minutes you can be in any part of town, and within 15 minutes onto the Blue Ridge Parkway.  There are many recreation options: lakes, rivers, parks, etc.
host_about: I have always loved hosting people  so it's really fun to make it a part of my daily life.  I have lived in the Asheville area for the last 16 years.  I spent the last 10 years a little outside the city limits in a beautiful but more rustic cabin on 7 acres.  I'm thrilled to be living in a new, green built home only 7 minutes from downtown but with the charm of the country (the house overlooks a small homestead).  I always try to find locals when I travel to get advise on what I should do.  In turn, I love being the local so I can share  some of the special gems we have in Asheville.  The only problem is there's so much to do in WNC it's hard to decide what the best choice is on any given day.

name: Your Home Away From Home
summary: When you step into this immaculately maintained two-bedroom, two-bathroom charmer, you'll know that you've chosen the right home base for your mountain getaway. Located in one of Asheville's best areas, this comfortable oasis is close to everything!
space: You'll feel right at home in this clean, beautifully decorated home. The open flow of the kitchen, dining and living areas gives you plenty of room to relax with your loved ones.  Both bedrooms feature comfortable queen-sized beds. The master boasts an en suite bathroom complete with a walk-in spa shower. There is also a small sitting room for reading. Have little ones? Thanks to its full-sized crib, the sitting room can also double as a nursery.  If you enjoy relaxing outdoors, you'll love the front porch with its white wooden rocking chairs and porch swing. For more privacy, you can unwind under the stars on the back patio.  Fresh linens and towels are included in your stay. The home also includes a fully equipped kitchen, new HDTV televisions in the living room and den, wireless internet, and central air.

neighborhood_overview: This comfortable home puts you in close proximity to the world renowned Grove Park Inn and Spa, the Reems Creek and Asheville Country Club golf courses, the Biltmore Estate, the beauty of the Blue Ridge Parkway, and the best restaurants and entertainment downtown has to offer.  Located in a quintessential North Asheville neighborhood, this home is perfectly situated for enjoying the highlights of both Asheville and Weaverville. Visit the local artisan shops, bakeries and cafés on Weaverville's main street in the morning and dine at one of the many highly reviewed restaurants in downtown Asheville by night. Or you may want to enjoy a stroll around Lake Louise before heading to the parkway to see the foliage. Interested in visiting the Biltmore Estate? It's just a fifteen-minute drive from your home away from home.
transit: Feel free to bring your car – or rent one when you fly in. The spacious driveway and garage are both available for your use.

summary: Enjoy the beauty and serenity of a lakefront home nestled in the woods, only six miles from downtown Asheville.  Comfortably sleeps eight in four spacious bedrooms. Fenced yard and a four person hot tub.  Pet friendly!
space: Newly decorated to meet the demands of function and good taste, you will find all of the conveniences of a luxury vacation rental.  The living room is equipped with a fifty-two inch flat screen TV, a state of the art entertainment system, and a logged gas fireplace.  Flat screen TVs are in all of the bedrooms. Cable and internet are provided. For some extra needed privacy, retreat to a private office with computer and printer.  No amenity has been spared in a roomy kitchen that is equipped with a gas stove and oven, an electric oven and two microwaves, and a large center island table that seats six.  Should you find in-kitchen eating wanting, step through to the separate formal dining room that seats 10-12 and has its own gas log fireplace. neighborhood_overview: This home is unique by simultaneously meeting the needs of those who want quiet and seclusion and those who want proximity to the conveniences of a city and surrounding attractions.  Once through the main driveway and onto the property relish the feeling that you are miles away from the hustle and bustle of daily life. And yet without sacrificing privacy, you are walking distance to a grocery store, gas station, pharmacy, fast-food joints, restaurants, and putt-putt golf.
notes: This home is unique by simultaneously meeting the needs of those who want quiet and seclusion and those who want proximity to the conveniences of a city and surrounding attractions.  Once through the main driveway and onto the property relish the feeling that you are miles away from the hustle and bustle of daily life. And yet without sacrificing privacy, you are walking distance to a grocery store, gas station, pharmacy, fast-food joints, restaurants, and putt-putt golf.  Major regional attractions are short car rides away.  You are, for example, eight miles from the majestic Biltmore Estate, five miles from the Grove Park Inn and Spa, ten miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, and ten miles from hiking trails.  If white water rafting is to your fancy, the French Broad River is three miles away. Preferring to stay on land, enjoy breath-taking views of the Appalachian Mountains on golf courses less than ten miles away.  Horseback riding is a short twenty-five minutes jaunt from your lakefr

transit: We are very close to the bus line should you desire and have off street parking for your convenience.
host_about: I really, really love living in Asheville with my husband John. I am a licensed massage therapist and yoga instructor. I especially love coffee, running, hiking, yoga, and spending time in new places. My husband is an EMT and carpenter and we love all things outdoors. He really likes coffee too, rock climbing and anything that prevents him from sitting still for long. I like hotels and he likes couches, we usually split the difference :)

name: Garden Apartment 2 Miles From DT
summary: Visit this fresh, charming apartment with separate entrance, and pretty fenced yard only 2 miles from Pack Square downtown.  Four rooms (bedroom, living/dining, full kitchen, full bath), and a beautiful private, stone patio to enjoy our mountain air!
space: Four pretty rooms, with a separate entrance in our landscaped, picket-fenced backyard. Park in the adjacent drive, and enter from the private, covered, stone patio.  This is a daylight, walk-out basement apartment under our home. Living room has large TV with cable service.  Full kitchen has stove/oven, fridge, microwave, toaster, and Keurig-type coffee maker. The bedroom has a full bed.  The bath has a vanity with storage, and a walk-in shower, rather than tub.  The apartment has fresh paint, new carpet, and comfy towels and bedding.  Heat, A/C (window unit), and internet with wifi will make your stay comfortable.

Heat, A/C (window unit), and internet with wifi will make your stay comfortable. Please enjoy off-street parking, comfortable outdoor seating on the private, covered stone patio, and the fenced backyard gard
neighborhood_overview: North Asheville and the Grove Park Neighborhood are quiet, leafy, and peaceful.  Shady, tree-lined streets feel a world away, yet we are only two blocks from the main road through town, where you will find restaurants, grocery stores, pharmacies, fast-food, etc. Two miles down that road, you will find a very lively, charming downtown, full of great restaurants, galleries, music, breweries, and wonderful architecture.  And chocolate.  Ask us about the chocolate!  We are close to a great public playground, and about half a mile from a pretty lake (a nice place to walk).  The UNC Asheville campus is about 1.5 miles away, the Biltmore Estate is about a ten-minute drive away, The Grove Park Inn is about a ten-minute walk, and the Blue Ridge Parkway is about 5 minutes drive.  The neighborhood is almost entirely nice, single-family homes.  Lovely!
notes: While this apartment is in our basement, it is a full walk-out basement with windows.  Doesn't feel like a basement apartment at all!
transit: While Asheville is very "green", public transit is limited to buses with somewhat restricted hours.  We do have Uber, Lyft, and taxis.  Great town for bicycles and walking, too!
host_about:
We are a former bank executive and a retired attorney, living in the coolest city in America, and wanting to share the joys of travel with others!  We love golf, motorcycles, British television, and football, but more than anything we love being together.  We are easy-going folks, who stay up late and start mornings slowly.  

We want our guests to enjoy our space and our town, and to feel delighted with both, when they head home.  

When we stay with you we need privacy, relative quiet, a comfy bed, heat and air, and cable TV.

We are positive and easy-to-please.  Mutual respect is our goal!

name: Secluded Setting near downtown
summary: Location, convenience, privacy describe this apartment which is part of the main floor of my home.  You will be staying near downtown in an 1880s "Queen Anne" home with modern conveniences, and you can park just outside your door.
space: Welcome to our beautifully appointed three-room suite on the main floor of this lovingly restored, owner occupied, 1880's “Queen Anne" home.  Although we are located very near to the lively downtown Asheville area, the large lot is surrounded by trees and lush vegetation which affords a great deal of privacy and the feeling that you are “away from it all".  We are located at the base of Town Mountain, just a short walk to downtown as well as neighborhood restaurants, coffee houses, shopping and entertainment.  There are fireplaces in each of the rooms, yes, even the bathroom which also features a large glass shower and fluffy towels.  The bedroom has a queen size bed with fresh linens. Just off the living/dining area there's a “mini" kitchen complete with bar sink, under-counter refrigerator, microwave, toaster oven and a Keurig beverage maker. You can have your morning coffee or unwind at the end of the day while enjoying a view of the western mountains from your private deck adjacent

Just off the living/dining area there's a “mini" kitchen complete with bar
neighborhood_overview: Asheville is a wonderful place to visit with changing seasons and diverse dining and entertainment choices.  You are likely to be doing a good bit of walking, so bring comfortable shoes. I know of only one restaurant in the area that requires a coat and tie.  For all the rest you will be very comfortable in  casual attire.  In many of our fine eating establishments jeans, shorts and sports clothing are the rule of the day.  I would suggest that you bring clothing for the season.  In winter we do get some really cold snaps, but mostly I wear sweaters and leather jackets.  Although, some days I need to pull out the Mountain Hardwear coat to ward off the cold and wind.  Spring, summer and fall usually offer warm days and cool nights, so you might need a lightweight jacket or sweater for evenings even in the summer.  I'd suggest that you check your mobile device for any forecast of unusual weather events in the area.
notes: Towels, bed linens, and basic necessity paper products are provided.  A basket of assorted toiletries is available in the bathroom in the event you have left something behind.  In the kitchen, there is a small fridge, Keurig touchscreen hot beverage maker, microwave, toaster oven, bar sink and dish soap.  Also you will find plates, bowls, glassware and flatware and kitchen linens.  Some coffee K cups and coffee condiments will be in the kitchen area to tide you over until you make a run to the store. Grocery markets less than a mile from here are Ingle's, Trader Joe's and Harris Teeter, and GreenLife (owned by Whole Foods). Free Wi-Fi is provided.  There is a clock/speaker in the living area and one in the bedroom to stream your own music from your mobile device.  There is a USB port to charge your devices and a retractable speaker line to plug into your device.  Be sure to bring your own cord to plug into the USB or electrical outlet for charging your devices. The Sony Bravia smart TV
transit: Although there are many things to do within walking distance, I recommend that you have a vehicle in order to enjoy such things as The Biltmore Estate, The Blue Ridge Parkway, River Arts district, etc.  Taxi service and car rentals are readily available.  Please note that my driveway does not accommodate  campers and RVs.
host_about:
My wife and I moved to Asheville from Houston, TX in 1989.  We restored a wonderful old house in the Chestnut Hills Historic district where we accomplished our dream of having a bed and breakfast.  We lived and worked there until (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Arlington Street is only a few blocks from the bed and breakfast that we started.  Now I live alone in another "one of a kind" house.  Much of my time is spent mentoring young men in my church and facilitating a grief recovery program.

We chose Asheville because the mountains offer a sense of peace and tranquility not found in many other places.  Also, we were attracted here because of the fascinating mix of people who call Asheville home.  Asheville has wonderful restaurants comparable to many of our favorites in Houston.   Also to be found in Asheville are the Symphony, Asheville Community Theater, and outstanding medical facilities.  We were drawn here by the Blue Ridge Parkway, The Biltmore Estate, The Folk Art Center and the like.  I have appreciated such things as a huge farmers market for fresh produce, and alsoexcellent shopping for groceries in our local stores.

 I love the natural beauty of the area and sometimes enjoy taking a picnic lunch to a sunny rock in the middle of a rushing stream on a warm day in February.  

Asheville is very simply a great place to vacation and live.

name: Everything Zen
summary: A charming bungalow with two queen beds with the best of both worlds, close to Asheville while surrounded by rural nature. 1/2 mile from the French Broad River in the Woodfin neighborhood just 4 miles to downtown. A well-stocked amazing Kitchen awai.
space: Both bedrooms have queen sized beds. The couch can even sleep a 5th person. The house is full of cool Asian inspired influences. Clean, simple and modern. A true Ashevillian experience.
description: A charming bungalow with two queen beds with the best of both worlds, close to Asheville while surrounded by rural nature. 1/2 mile from the French Broad River in the Woodfin neighborhood just 4 miles to downtown. A well-stocked amazing Kitchen awai. Both bedrooms have queen sized beds. The couch can even sleep a 5th person. The house is full of cool Asian inspired influences. Clean, simple and modern. A true Ashevillian experience. Full house, with a well stocked kitchen full of tools, seasonings & spices.  Dine in some, eat out some...but please, no fires in the wood stove and no smoking inside.  As much or as little as you want. We love Asheville and want to make you as comfortable as possible! We are just down the road if you need anything. Very close to town but surrounded by nature. Such a sweet spot!  It is rural, peaceful, and private. A dead end road makes this great neighborhood chill! Easy access to West Asheville and Downtown.       Minutes from I-26 access, Downtown, Merri
neighborhood_overview: Very close to town but surrounded by nature. Such a sweet spot!  It is rural, peaceful, and private. A dead end road makes this great neighborhood chill! Easy access to West Asheville and Downtown.
notes: Sorry but, no fires in the wood stove, we have toasty electric heat for you and a heated blanket.  Our idea of "Zen" doesn't include a TV...or smoking inside :)  We just had the ovens and linens professionally cleaned...
transit: Minutes from I-26 access, Downtown, Merrimon Avenue, Patton Avenue, West Asheville, but in nice chill seclusion.
host_about: We love Asheville and want to share this cool town with you! We are chill locals with a guest experience focus. We have set up the house so you can feel at home here. We have both traveled extensively in Asia and the house reflects it. We enjoy hiking, canoeing and motorcycling. We are very environment and local economy minded.

neighborhood_overview: This part of N. Asheville/Woodfin is the best kept secret around. Super close to everything, but with elbow room.

host_about: Jason & I are both 22 year Asheville residents. We are both antique/junk dealers that love to travel, spend time outdoors, music, bike, ski. We are both people persons so would be very happy to answer any questions or give advice that you may have about the area.

name: Private 1 BD/BA Cottage -N. Aville
summary: This beautiful cottage is on a quiet hillside, 2 m. N. of downtown. Enjoy the privacy of your own space: bedroom, living room, mini kitchen, bathroom, entrance & deck. Walk to trails, gardens, UNCA, trails, eateries & a breathtaking sunset/mtn view.
space: Best of Both worlds...Nestled on a private dead end mountain road, yet only 2 miles from downtown...Experience Asheville's natural beauty by day and it's hopping nightlife easily from our beautiful home retreat.   The cottage is attached to our larger home, but has its own private entrance, balcony, bedroom, bathroom, mini kitchen and living room, as well as private off road parking.  There is a comfy queen size bed in the bedroom and a fold-out futon in the living room. 1-4 adults can fit comfortably. Kids are also welcome.   This is a legally permitted 'Homestay' by the city of Asheville. Our permit # can be found in the pictures.

This is a legally permitted 'Homestay' by the city of Asheville. Our permit # can be found in the pictures. You will have access to your own space, including a mini kitchen with a large fridge/freezer, dishwasher, etc
neighborhood_overview: This home is perched on a hill with some views of downtown and the mountains.  Best neighborhood in town...quiet, safe, and walking distance to beautiful hiking trails, the botanical gardens, UNCA, the weekend farmers market, a spectacular sunset & mountain view, and plenty of great eateries are all within a 10-15 minute walk.  Try walking over to 'Zen Sushi' and 'The Hop' Ice Cream on Merrimon for a great night. Or our local hangout, 'Asheville Brewing Company' for the best beer, pizza and $3 movies every night. No need to drive.
notes: We have an adorable baby girl (born in October of 2015).  She has a great temper but she also does have her moments. You may hear her momentarily, but we live in a separate part of the house so her noises have never been a problem with previous guests.  I just like for guests to know ahead of time.
transit: It is so easy to get around, by foot, bicycle or by car. We are only 2 miles from downtown. Uber rides are also available for about $6 to downtown. There is also a convenient public bus walking distance as well. Airport transportation can also be arranged. (just ask us).
host_about: I am a massage therapist and yoga teacher who usually lives in Asheville, NC. I am often on tour teaching Thai Yoga Bodywork around the U.S. I live with my girlfriend, Krystal, who is an acupuncturist and a yoga teacher. We are professional and friendly and one of us will be around to greet you. We would be honored to host you in our healing sanctuary...

neighborhood_overview: Welcome To Asheville Asheville is a very special city; a jewel in the heart of the mountains of western North Carolina and one of the most the most progressive cities in the south. It has been called the Sedona of the east because of it's spiritual energy and the San Francisco of the East because of it's vibrant diversity and cultural life. These links will help you to get to know Asheville better.   Official Asheville Tourism Site (website hidden)   Asheville, NC. Travel Guide (website hidden)   Cosmic Buffet (website hidden).php
notes: Cancellations: $25 administrative fee. Cancellation before 30 days/ full refund less fee; before 21 days/ 50% refund less fee; after 14 days/ no refund. Rates are subject to change.
transit: You can get to any part of Asheville within minutes.
host_about: I moved to Asheville in 1980 and love it here. I started the first costume company here …then spent 14 yrs co-founding a large intentional community called Earthaven Eco-village, outside of A'ville ….followed by living a decade in India. My current passions are singing, writing, dancing, gardening & eco-spirit activism. Recently I've been loving creating nurturing fun spaces to live in.

name: Historic Log Cabin Asheville (19)
summary: Go on a nostalgic journey as you enjoy a wistful look back to simpler days with a stay in the Goldview cabin which was used in the filming of the 1958 movie "Thunder Road" starring Robert Mitchum. Two bedroom, full kitchen, day bed and a fireplace.
space: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our accommodations consist of beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930s. Relax and rock away your stress with a tranquil stay in the Kozy Korner cabin.   This cabin comes with a rocking chair front porch, fenced in front yard, full kitchen with gas stove, microwave, refrigerator, plates, cups, bowls, silverware etc., has a queen bed and sleeps 2 people.    Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided.  Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the Internet. All of our vacation cabin rentals have free wireless access, today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance. A rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember.  The quaint town of Weaverville is only 5 miles North and downtown Asheville only 6 miles South.  Great restaurants nearby and the
description: Go on a nostalgic journey as you enjoy a wistful look back to simpler days with a stay in the Goldview cabin which was used in the filming of the 1958 movie "Thunder Road" starring Robert Mitchum. Two bedroom, full kitchen, day bed and a fireplace. Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our accommodations consist of beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930s. Relax and rock away your stress with a tranquil stay in the Kozy Korner cabin.   This cabin comes with a rocking chair front porch, fenced in front yard, full kitchen with gas stove, microwave, refrigerator, plates, cups, bowls, silverware etc., has a queen bed and sleeps 2 people.    Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided.  Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the Internet. All of our vacation cabin rentals have free wireless access
neighborhood_overview: The Log Cabin Motor Court was originally a place where weary travelers would stop and camp for the night on a blanket of pine needles beneath the tall pine trees.  Next came the log cabins built by locals and travelers as they passed through.  The first cabin built in 1929.  These cabins were used in the filming of Thunder Road with Robert Mitchum and are rich in history.  Come visit and experience the friendliness of the motor court, sit on your porch and chat with your neighbors or relax under the pines with a good book.
notes: The Log Cabin Motor Court is located between I26 and Highway 25, a unique piece of history close to downtown Asheville.
transit: We are only 6 miles from downtown Asheville and 5 miles from Weaverville with I26 above and Hwy 25 at our entrance you will fine us easy to locate and a convenient midway point for all the beauty to see in and around Asheville.  If you would like to take a taxi downtown and leave your car, Uber has been used from our location and is approximately a $20 ride.
host_about: We love Asheville and enjoy exploring other destinations around the world.
street: Weaverville Highway, Woodfin, NC 28804, United States

name: Lucky W Cottage-city and country!
summary: Just minutes to downtown and the Blue Ridge Parkway, but surrounded by farms and wildlife! Lucky W Cottage is located on the grounds of Lucky W Farm in the Beaverdam Valley of North Asheville.
space: Lucky W Cottage is a 1925 guest house and is situated over our detached garage. It has approximately 800 sq.ft. of newly remodeled and upgraded living space. It is private and is located 100 ft or so from the main house where we live with our three boys. The cottage has one bedroom with a queen-size 19th century antique bed with a 3" memory foam topper, a living room area with a queen-size fold-out sofa, a generous, contemporary kitchen, a walk-in closet and a modern bathroom with a large mosaic tile shower. The decor is a fun mix of new and old. It has wi-fi and a TV for DVD's or Netflix. Enjoy your morning coffee or late night apertif alfresco on the private bistro table and chairs.  We will provide all linens, coffee and farm fresh eggs.
description: Just minutes to downtown and the Blue Ridge Parkway, but surrounded by farms and wildlife! We will provide all linens, coffee and farm fresh eggs. There are many places to discover on our small patch of
neighborhood_overview: The Beaverdam Valley is a special place in North Asheville situated just below the Blue Ridge Parkway. It has lots of history and lots of good people. What I love about it is that we live in a rural setting but are very close to downtown Asheville. We have wonderful views and lots of wildlife and are only minutes away from almost everything we might need.
notes: No children under 8 years of age. We have lots and lots of animals here on our farm and they are all free-roaming (except the horses). Please come enjoy ours, but we have a no pet policy for Lucky W Cottage. We are sorry for this, but for the safety of all the animals (yours and ours), we think this the best policy.
transit: There is public transportation, but one must hoof-it to the nearest bus stop which is at least 1/2 mile down the road. We have had guests use taxi and uber service, but most guests use a car. Parking is always available right at the cottage.
host_about:
Hi! My husband William and I are from Asheville NC. We have a small farm just minutes from downtown where we raise chickens, bees, and horses. We sell eggs and honey. 
We love to travel and camp. We are interested in knowing the places we visit by knowing the people who live and work there. We want to eat the regional cuisine and find and do things we can't do at home.

name: Charming Victorian twin BR for 2
space: Charming room with 2 twin size beds, furnished with Victorian antiques on 2nd floor with view of a lush forest and Blue Ridge Mountains in season, and the sunrise if you are an early bird... Your own private bathroom with tub/shower combination. My house contains an eclectic mixture of art, crafts and mementos gathered during the years I traveled all over the world as a translator for the United Nations. I love entertaining, enjoy chatting with guests and sharing experiences, but I am not invasive and respect my guests' privacy. I usually retire to my study in the evening. Huge back deck for relaxing, overlooking woods and gardens offering lots of privacy. Classic rocking chair front porch. Breezy screened sun room for reading or enjoying a cup of tea during the warmer seasons. Over one acre of wooded property: wild turkeys, rabbits, opossums, swallowtail butterflies, dozens of birds including humming birds. This is a peaceful, safe and private community among ranches and farms in the

name: Elder & Kid friendly home
summary: I am living in a large house and love hosting people. I am 2 miles north of downtown and walking distance to multiple restaurants. You will have the master bedroom with private bath. If you are in for a full relaxing stay I am a massage therapist.
space: The master bedroom has a king size temperpedic extra firm mattress. If you have kids or extra adults we can bring an extra mattress in for the floor. Your bathroom is fully private. There is a large private balcony overlooking the back yard. The room is upstairs. (If you have many people, there is another room available in the house, just ask and we can discuss a group discount).
description: I am living in a large house and love hosting people. I am 2 miles north of downtown and walking distance to multiple restaurants. You will have the master bedroom with private bath. If you are in for a full relaxing stay I am a massage therapist. The master bedroom has a king size temperpedic extra firm mattress. If you have kids or extra adults we can bring an extra mattress in for the floor. Your bathroom is fully private. There is a large private balcony overlooking the back yard. The room is upstairs. (If you have many people, there is another room available in the house, just ask and we can discuss a group discount). You will have access to the living rooms, kitchen, bathrooms, back porch and yard. (Note- I don't have internet) I live in the house and will likely be around for your stay. I work from home; my massage studio is downstairs. I enjoy cooking and sharing meals with guests and giving suggestions of places to visit and hike. The neighborhood is quiet and lovely for walki
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and lovely for walking. Very close to the university and botanical gardens. Restaurants in walking distance include Thai, Japaneese, burritos, ice cream, pizza, and a bakery. Depending on traffic, downtown is a 5-10 min drive. Also the bus line stops 1 block away.
notes: If you have a mellow quiet dog, I am open to them visiting too. The back yard is fully fenced in.  I am a licensed massage therapist and give guests $15 off my regular price.
transit: The bus system here is not wonderful but it does drop off 1 block away. My place is an easy drive or bike ride from downtown and UNCA. There is plenty of road parking right infront of the house.
host_about: I have lived in Asheville for 5 years. I spend much of my time hiking in the mountains near here. I have a lot of knowledge of our local edible and medicinal plants. I am a kitchen witch and often have nice smelling things on the stove or in the oven. I am quiet and clean.
street: Mt Vernon Cir, Asheville, NC 28804, United States

name: Spacious Mountain home in Asheville
summary: Peace and Serenity describe this private mountain home located in the Blue Ridge Mountains. The majesty of the 3,000 ft elevation and the 3 mile proximity to downtown Asheville make this vacation rental a perfect "getaway". Accommodates 12 people.
space: "Mountain Vista Alchemy" as we endearingly refer to our home, is a unique experience. It's a peaceful respite in the mountains and within 8 minutes, you can be in eclectic downtown Asheville , 3 miles away.If you are an adventure person, the Blue Ridge Parkway is 2.7 miles away. Ride your road or mountain bike, hike or just drive this scenic route. Downtown Asheville was named, by Bon Appetite, "America's Best Small City" to eat and drink . It was also named "Beer City USA" four years running. It is the home of coffeehouses. restaurants, microbreweries, museums, galleries, bookstores, antique shops, and boutique. Taste, sip, hike or ride your way through Asheville. It  is truly Magical.

neighborhood_overview: Mountain Vista Alchemy sits on 2.31 acres and has a private driveway. The surrounding neighborhood comprises about 10 homes.
transit: No public transportation  is in the mountain but Uber Asheville is a good option for the nights when you will be "hitting the town" Approximate cost to Uber from airport is 21-25 US Dollars.

name: Spacious Home in Historic Area
summary: 5 bedrooms in total, 3 on the upper level and 2 on the lower level, plenty of space to spread out. 2 bathrooms upstairs and 1 downstairs. 3 living spaces plus dining area and kitchen. Large deck off the kitchen to enjoy the wildlife.
space: Most of the house has just been remodeled, nice and new! 2 driveways for multiple vehicles. Space to spread out with 2 whole levels to enjoy. Trampoline in back yard, and soccer goals in front.
description: 5 bedrooms in total, 3 on the upper level and 2 on the lower level, plenty of space to spread out. 2 bathrooms upstairs and 1 downstairs. 3 living spaces plus dining area and kitchen. Large deck off the kitchen to enjoy the wildlife. Most of the house has just been remodeled, nice and new! 2 driveways for multiple vehicles. Space to spread out with 2 whole levels to enjoy. Trampoline in back yard, and soccer goals in front. Whole house. I'll possibly be available during your stay. Beautiful and historic neighborhood just 5 minute drive to downtown Asheville. Walking distance to The Grove Park Inn (about 15 min walk) and Avenue M a local restaurant. Walk to a local park with play area. You may also spot the wild turkeys. 15 minute walk to the bus stop. 5 minute drive to downtown restaurants and bars. 25 minute drive to Asheville Airport. We have a 2 night minimum stay . No Pets Please, this is a Pet Free Home, so great for those with allergies! Linens provided.

host_about:
We moved from England to Asheville, NC in 2012. We are a married couple with 3 boys. 
Dan's a general contractor and Sarah owns a health and wellness business.
We love traveling and good local or ethnic food.

name: Town Mountain Guest Suite on BRPkwy
summary: Private quarters (bedroom+, den, bathroom) with separate entrance and covered parking. Property adjoins Blue Ridge Parkway with connecting trails and yet conveniently located only 5 miles from downtown Asheville. Comfortable place to relax & enjoy.
space: Covered parking and private entrance leads to open, daylit room with live-edge wood slab bar, full sized fridge and microwave. French doors open to small sidewalk patio with table/chairs that looks over the wooded hillside below, deep and long distance seasonal views in winter or a tree-house feeling in summer months. Private den with desk, TV, and massage table (requires set up). Bedroom has small sitting area, full sized bed, and a wardrobe. Small bathroom with shower is off of the main room (around the corner from the den) but still in private basement space.

host_about:

I find it fun to meet people and make connections!

name: Sunny, private retreat near town
summary: Bright, newly renovated 3 bedroom, 1 bath house located above a quiet road on a large lot near Beaver Lake in North Asheville. Close to Merrimon Ave, Reynolds Mtn, RAD and downtown. Fully equipped eat in kitchen and open sunny dining/living area.
space: A combination of refurbished midcentury antiques and new furniture fill this bright open space that has been renovated over the past two years including complete kitchen and bathroom makeovers. The two largest bedrooms have new queen beds with very comfortable new mattresses, cotton sheets, down comforters and cotton duvet covers. All kitchen appliances and equipment, mattresses and linens were new in Spring of 2015. A working wood burning fireplace keeps the space extra cozy on cool evenings. A Weber grill is included as well as an outdoor fire pit. The house is well off of the road via a paved driveway with plenty of off street parking. There is also a detached single car garage available. Dressers and closets are available for storing your belongings. If you have need of a full three bedroom house, we can convert the office back into a bedroom with either a bunk bed or a full bed for long term stays or provide blow up mattress and linens for short term stays. We are avid cooks ourse
description: Bright, newly renovated 3 bedroom, 1 bath house located above a quiet road on a large lot near Beaver Lake in North Asheville. Close to Merrimon Ave, Reynolds Mtn, RAD and downtown. Fully equipped eat in kitchen and open sunny dining/living area. A combination of refurbished midcentury antiques and new furniture fill this bright open space that has been renovated over the past two years including complete kitchen and bathroom makeovers. neighborhood_overview: The house is close to Beaver Lake and the Bird Sanctuary, Reynolds Mountain and Thirsty Monk North. Merrimon Ave provides a direct route to downtown (4 miles) through an array of local businesses or take side roads through charming neighborhoods. It is also near the French Broad River with easy access to the River Arts District and I-26.
notes: The lawn is mowed every other Monday during growing season.
transit: Busses are available on Merrimon Avenue within easy walking distance.
host_about: My husband and I run a Design/Build firm, Mountain Sun Building & Design, here in Asheville. We enjoy creating beautiful light filled, energy efficient homes on both a custom and spec basis. When we are not busy with work or our two kids and their soccer schedules, we love to explore the world, hike, ski, cook and garden. I'm a lifelong North Carolinian and have spent the last 19 years in the Asheville area.
