name: Walk to Lake / Close to Downtown
summary: At Home in Asheville! Nestled in the woods and within walking distance to Beaver Lake, our studio apartment is convenient to downtown, I26, and UNC Asheville. Clean and private with a fully stocked kitchen. Luxury linens. Fresh flowers. Come retreat with us.
space: Come enjoy the quiet seclusion of our studio apartment, conveniently located in an upscale neighborhood in Asheville. Nestled in a heavily wooded area, this apartment is three miles from downtown and less than half a mile to the interstate (easy drive to Biltmore Estate). The apartment boasts a fully stocked kitchen (stove top, microwave, refrigerator), a plush queen size bed, a private bathroom with shower, leather love seat, large closet, outdoor hammock, off-street parking, and a private entrance with covered porch. Idyllic Beaver Lake is an easy, half-mile walk through the neighborhood (no lake view from the apartment), and it is a place where guests can fish (catch and release only), walk/jog (1.5 mile loop), picnic on the large grassy areas, and/or enjoy the sunset.  This studio apartment is a quiet place to retreat from the many entertainment options Asheville has to offer. As your hosts, we can make recommendations for fun events happening during your stay including free music
description: At Home in Asheville! Nestled in the woods and within walking distance to Beaver Lake, our studio apartment is convenient to downtown, I26, and UNC Asheville. Clean and private with a fully stocked kitchen. Luxury linens. Fresh flowers. Come retreat with us. Come enjoy the quiet seclusion of our studio apartment, conveniently located in an upscale neighborhood in Asheville. Nestled in a heavily wooded area, this apartment is three miles from downtown and less than half a mile to the interstate (easy drive to Biltmore Estate). The apartment boasts a fully stocked kitchen (stove top, microwave, refrigerator), a plush queen size bed, a private bathroom with shower, leather love seat, large closet, outdoor hammock, off-street parking, and a private entrance with covered porch. Idyllic Beaver Lake is an easy, half-mile walk through the neighborhood (no lake view from the apartment), and it is a place where guests can fish (catch and release only), walk/jog (1.5 mile loop), picnic on the lar
neighborhood_overview: The Lakeshore community is an upscale university neighborhood surrounding Beaver Lake. We are so close to downtown and yet conveniently accessible to I26, which takes you to West Asheville in a jiffy and to Biltmore in less than fifteen minutes. A Blue Ridge Parkway entrance is tucked away in North Asheville off Beaverdam Road, ten minutes down the road. A city bus stop is a two minute walk, and traveling to downtown requires only one bus.
notes: Please leave the studio in the same condition you found it. If you require supplies that are not available, let us know and we will do our best to accommodate you.  We have a small outdoor cat that lives on the property, but she does not go inside the rental space and linens for the rental do not come in contact with the cat. Most guests never even see our cat. She prefers to bask in the sun on our front porch or to disappear into the woods to do what cats do. Guests must be able to navigate stairs. Three steps down to a mulched path to your porch where two steps up on the porch gets you into the apartment.
transit: A city bus stop is a close walk away. Cars and walking / biking are the best options. Our driveway is typical of the area: It is steep. Guests can park at the top of the driveway and walk down the hill to your porch or you can park right in front of the path to your porch. There is room to turn around in the driveway so that you can avoid backing up the hill.
host_about: Before my husband and I married, we dreamed up Asheville as a perfect home: hiking, laid back people, cooler temperatures with endless sun, thriving art scene, incredible local food movement and, of course, beer culture. In 2011, life dealt us the incredible gift of a professor position at UNC Asheville; we packed our family and drove from Tucson, AZ to these mountains. We are a young family who enjoys playing outdoors, cooking big meals, reading, drawing, writing, and telling stories. We remain in love with all that this region has to offer, and we pride ourselves for knowing about the great entertainment options happening around town (many of which are free). We look forward to hosting you in Asheville soon.

name: Adorable cottage, 7min. to Downtown
summary: A little piece of paradise just 5 miles from downtown Asheville.  Our cute stand alone cottage has private parking, deck, and garden.  It's tucked away from the noises of the city so you can enjoy nature but be minutes away stores, food, & nature.
space: Our cottage is a very cute and private and stands alone in our back yard and besides a creek.  Although we are just minutes from downtown, you will feel like you are in the country and will hear the creek from the bedroom.  We have lots of wildlife, birds, chickens, wild turkeys.... that visit us.  Our two daughters play in the yard as well.  Our personal favorite, the cottage has a private outdoor bath tub and outdoor dining area.  You will love this quiet little retreat home while you explore Asheville and the beautiful surroundings.   This cottage can accommodate up to 3 adults with one queen size bed and a twin fold out couch.
description: A little piece of paradise just 5 miles from downtown Asheville.  Our cute stand alone cottage has private parking, deck, and garden.  It's tucked away from the noises of the city so you can enjoy nature but be minutes away stores, food, & nature. Although we are just minutes from downtown, you will feel like you are in the country and will hear the creek from the bedroom.  We have lots of wildlife, birds, chickens, wild turkeys.... that visit us.  Our two daughters play in the yard as well.  Our personal favorite, the cottage has a private outdoor bath tub and outdoor dining area.  You will love this quiet little retreat home while you explore Asheville and the beautiful surroundings.   This cottage can accommodate up to 3 adults with one queen size bed and a twin fold out couch. You will have your own private deck, outdoor bath tub and parking space.  Also, coffee maker, toaster, blender.
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is beautiful and quiet.  It's a country road that dead ends, so we only have local traffic.  Lots of wildlife, trees, and birds. Walking distance to restaurants. Minutes away from stores, schools, yoga studios, YMCA, parks and lakes. 15 minute drive to Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: This cottage is best for 1-3 adults, or 2 adults and a child, one queen size bed and one twin fold out bed.  Children are  a welcomed addition!   We have two young girls that will be in the yard playing.   Also, we own a spa, Still Point Wellness, and will extend a 10% discount if you would like to have a service at our spa.   When you call please let them know that you are our airbnb guest. Are you traveling with a group?  We can recommend other airbnb's on the block to accommodate your group.
transit: The interstate entrance is less that a mile from our home.  Within minutes you can be in any part of town, and with 15 minutes onto the Blue Ridge Parkway, lakes, rivers, parks, and recreation.
host_about:
We have lived in Asheville with our two daughters Sofia and Rosalina for the past six years.  We moved here from Big Sur, California, where we worked and taught massage and yoga at the Esalen Institute.  
We own Still Point Wellness, unique spa in downtown Asheville where we offer Esalen massage, salt water floatation, and somatic psychotherapy ((URL HIDDEN)  We also teach massage and bodywork locally and internationally.
We value friends, family, community, and healthy living.  
We are grateful to be able to share our little piece of paradise with you.

name: Spacious North Side Private Haven!
summary: Our property is surrounded by large oaks and hickory trees. This lower level apartment has a fresh, comfortable interior. Great kitchen! Tempur-pedic bed. Pvt entrance. Pvt parking. Close to downtown, UNC/Asheville, Grove Park. Biltmore,kayaks & bus!
space: The apartment is new and fresh, tastefully decorated and filled with the best of comfortable furnishings! Great private parking can even allow for some motor homes and vehicles with trailers. Kid friendly as well!
description: Our property is surrounded by large oaks and hickory trees. This lower level apartment has a fresh, comfortable interior. Great kitchen! Tempur-pedic bed. Pvt entrance. Pvt parking. Close to downtown, UNC/Asheville, Grove Park. Biltmore,kayaks & bus! The apartment is new and fresh, tastefully decorated and filled with the best of comfortable furnishings! Great private parking can even allow for some motor homes and vehicles with trailers. Kid friendly as well! Cable TV, wireless internet, loads of interesting books. Private full size washer and dryer. Private kitchen is fully equipped for long stays. Feel free to wash your car, relax in outdoor seating. Gas barbeque available on request. We live in the home above the apartment and are available for questions, suggestions and conversation if you wish. Otherwise we are a quiet neighbor! Our very small  2 street neighborhood is quiet and friendly. We are a few blocks from a great children's park, next to Woodfin City Hall! The YMCA is jus
neighborhood_overview: Our very small  2 street neighborhood is quiet and friendly. We are a few blocks from a great children's park, next to Woodfin City Hall! The YMCA is just across the street, as is Reynolds Mountain shops. On Saturday there is a Farmer's Market there!
notes: We are 7-10 minutes to the center of downtown. The Biltmore House is about 15 minutes.  We are quite close to kayaking places on the French Broad, probably 5 minutes away. The Grove Park Inn is 5 minutes. Trader Joes, Fresh Market, Whole Foods and various great restaurants are between us and downtown.
transit: The bus route is right at the end of the street.  A local delivery service will pick up meals from gourmet restaurants and deliver them to our door!
host_about:
My husband Marshall and I are both semi-retired from medical professions, have been married 45 years and have one son and now one grandchild! We moved to Asheville 3 years ago from Clearwater, Florida, where we lived for 24 years. Prior to that we lived 5 years in the San Francisco Bay area. Both of us are originally from the metro Detroit area. We have always enjoyed traveling as well as historical books and movies. Lately back issues have curtailed our out of country travel, however we know the benefits of a comfortable mattress, back friendly chairs and sofas and good televisions and outfit our home and apartment accordingly!  My hobbies are gardening and jewelry making.  Our home and apartment sit on 2 acres of mainly hillside. When we moved here the land was in need of someone who loved to nurture the vegetation and enrich the soil so I literally "dug in" and began the process. If it's in spring, summer or fall you will see me outside with garden tool in hand. Marshall enjoys biking, driving his car along the Blue Ridge, and keeping up with football, baseball, hockey and auto racing. 
Our son Eric works in the film industry as a grip. He and his family recently relocated to Atlanta, Georgia as the film industry in North Carolina lost it's tax incentive and Georgia added an incentive. We miss them all but especially our beautiful grandchild Kiela, who is 3. We were able to have them close for the past 3 years and enjoyed that tremendously!
While neither of us are great cooks we do love all the simple natural foods that Asheville has so much of. We can't do without Amish butter, organic peanut butter, Ezekiel toast plus good tea and coffee in the morning! Trader Joe or Fresh Market can help us most days with semi prepared foods so we don't feel that a "restaurant run" is mandatory!
Our apartment is located on the lower level of our home. It has it's own entrance, plus 2 parking sites. Exterior is brick. We did a build out of this area, which is roughly 1100 square foot over the past 2 years, adding walls, electric, plumbing, new windows, and of course all the things that make a place fun to stay in, like fresh carpet and paint, new cabinets, appliances, lighting, etc. It has been decorated and furnished with various antiques as well as new pieces. We love mission style so that is seen both in our home as well as in the apartment. If I travel I always want to know about the mattress so we furnished our apartment with a Tempur-pedic  king bed and a good quality queen standard mattress. We put a Ekornes Stressless chair in the living room as well as a sofa with spring down cushions. The electric fireplace adds ambiance as well as offers additional heat if needed, although we have a heat pump. We want you to feel that everything is fresh and "special" for your stay, and you can expect a more than just clean apartment; one that says we feel your stay here is a special time. 
Your privacy is always maintained. When we travel it's important to us and we will do no less for you! This is a memorable, comfortable home and we trust you will feel the same and come back to see us again!

name: Historic Log Cabin Asheville (4)
space: Located just outside Asheville North Carolina we offer the best cabin rentals on our side of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Our accommodations consist of beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930s. Relax and rock away your stress with a tranquil stay in the Snug Harbor cabin.   This cabin comes with a rocking chair front porch, fenced in front yard, full kitchen with gas stove, microwave, refrigerator, plates, cups, bowls, silverware etc., has a king bed and sleeps 2 people.    Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided.  Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the Internet. All of our vacation cabin rentals have FREE wireless access, today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance. A rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember.  The quaint town of Weaverville is only 5 miles North and downtown Asheville only 6 miles South.  Great restaurants nearby and the

name: Treehouse close to downtown
summary: A beautiful in town wooded retreat feels like you are far away.  3 story comfortable private house just a mile up the mountain from downtown with decks on each floor, lots of original art surrounded by lush trees and wildlife. Monthly rentals only.
space: This gorgeous 3BR/2BA home on a very quiet, private and wooded street is located just 1 mile into downtown Asheville in the Grove Park neighborhood. Beautiful bird sanctuary, large landscaped property with small spring creek, rock walls, and a variety of flowering trees and plants and raspberries and blueberries. Sit in comfy furniture on any of the decks which surround the home and take in the natural environment whilst enjoying a cook out with the new gas grill, or your gourmet meal prepared from the fully equipped kitchen which has a new large capacity oven. The dining room seats 6-10. This home boasts original art throughout, flat screen TVs, stereo and Apple TV, and a wood burning fireplace. Large master bedroom has private deck, king bed, large closet, large bathroom with shower and jetted tub. Additional bedrooms have one full and two queen beds. New locally, handcrafted organic cotton mattresses with brand new luxurious linens.

name: Terrace Cottage
summary: Located in one of Asheville's oldest historic districts, walkable to UNC-Asheville, the Omni Grove Park Inn, restaurants, wine shops, markets, greenways, parks and more! Downtown is walkable on well-lit sidewalks (under 2 miles), a 5-min drive away.
space: Experience a classic, private, Arts & Crafts-style guesthouse in our beautiful Historic District close to the center of Asheville. All linens and other amenities including HDTV are provided so just bring your groceries- and your laptop for the fast WI-FI. The cottage is very private and comfortable, situated in a quiet location in our safe and friendly neighborhood. Nice walk to downtown along tree-lined streets with great markets and restaurants along the way. Walk to the university, botanical gardens, parks and greenways.  Enjoy a real cook's kitchen, tiled bathroom, sunny deck, closet storage, and locking storage for bikes and strollers. In addition to the queen bed and full-size sofabed, there is a Simmonsd Beautyrest inflatable bed stored in the closet.  Original owners on the property are knowledgeable about area entertainment and recreation opportunities. A quick twenty minutes drive from our airport with shuttle service available, and the bus line is one block distance running

In addition to the queen bed and full-size sofabed, there is a Simmonsd Beautyrest inflatable bed sto
neighborhood_overview: Our beautiful Historic District close to downtown is a safe, friendly neighborhood with well-lit sidewalks, wonderful gardens, parks, and a fantastic greenway linking to the center of Asheville.
transit: Asheville's ART bus stop is one block from the cottage. Uber service is under ten dollars from our property to te center of downtown!
host_about:
Welcome to Terrace Cottage!

For fifteen years we have enjoyed hosting visitors in our Asheville, North Carolina cottage from across the country and around the world including England and Ireland, Greece, Canada, Mexico and Cuba, Argentina, Japan and The Phillipines. We welcome guests from around the corner, across the US and our international visitors as well! Our college-age daughter grew up listening to many different languages in the driveway.

We enjoy traveling including work-and-play trips to Ireland, England, Sweden and Greece. Twenty years here at our residence built in 1926 and our adjacent Terrace Cottage was built in 2000.

We love working in our perennial beds and veggie gardens.

I'm an online entrepreneur designing and marketing wooden playthings for young people. I also collect and blog about vintage wooden toys.

My wife is a clinician with UNC-Chapel Hill School of Medicine. 

We love living in Asheville and are always happy to return home when away. It is a nationally-celebrated and uniquely beautiful mountain city overflowing with eclectic opportunities for enjoying first-rate dining, entertainment, crafts and artwork. The Blue Ridge Parkway entrance is ten minutes from our home, leading to the North Carolina Arboretum, Mount Pisgah, Craggy Gardens, and Mount Mitchell- the highest elevation east of the Rocky Mountains. 

I fly fish and welcome inquiries regarding our local waters. My favorite streams are under an hour away and have been rated in Trout Unlimited's Top 100. There are excellent fly shops and outfitters nearby if you need them.

Walking, running and cycling are huge in Asheville and there are too many options to mention from neighborhood greenways and hill climbs to maniacal day-longs as well, contact us for info. Our local runner's and cyclist's shops are just blocks away.

Speaking of walkable- ditto our supermarket and specialty/whole foods markets, cafes, coffee shops, local theater, pharmacies, UNC-Asheville, botanical gardens, awesome kid's parks and more.

Thanks for looking at Terrace Cottage and we welcome your inquiries!

name: 1973 Asheville Airstream
summary: Introducing Josie the Spacepod! This 1973 Argosy Airstream is brand new to Asheville, and only 5 minutes from Downtown, River Arts, and West Asheville.  The Spacepod has just received some major renovations, is a fully contained unit, and comfortably sleeps four people.  Perfect for your magical Asheville getaway!
space: This original tiny house has everything you need to live comfortably, and spaciously during your time in Asheville.  Complete with a kitchen, full sized bed, pull out couch, and functioning bathroom!   There is a stove, a fridge, two sinks, and electric space heater, lots of storage, a shower, a working toilet, and a super comfy bed.  The hot water heater is currently broken, so if you'd like a warm shower, I ask that you please use the shower inside the house.  Its much bigger and has better water pressure as well.   Otherwise, this Airstream has it all!  And she would really love it, if you booked her for your stay :)

This original tiny house has everything you need to live comfortably, and spaciously during your time in Asheville.  Complete with a kitchen, full sized bed, pull out couch, and functioning bathroom!   There is a stove, a fridge, two sinks, and electric space heater, lots of storage, a shower, a working toilet, and a super comfy bed.  The hot water heater is currently broken, so if you'd like a warm shower, I ask that you please use the shower inside the house.  Its much bigger and has better water pressure as well.   Otherwise, this Airstream has it all!  And she would really love it, if you booked her for your stay :) Everything inside of the Airstream, the front and back p
neighborhood_overview: Super quiet street, just seconds from the highway, and 5 minutes to Downtown, River Arts District, and West Asheville! My house is also across the street from the French Broad River and has some lovely hiking and nature walks in the area!
transit: Not real familiar with the bus system, but Asheville has one should you need to get around.  If you have a car, we are right down the street from the highway, and you can always call Uber or Lyft, won't cost much! Also, on the off chance I am around, and you need a ride, don't hesitate to ask!
host_about: Cosmic mermaid with a bit of an eclectic and eccentric sense of life.  Adventuresome spirit who enjoys connecting with others and would love to host as many travelers as possible! Loves stories from both near and far, as well as expanding her network on the global grid.  Thanks for your interest, she is already looking forward to your stay :)

name: Walk to Lake, Privacy, Convenience
summary: Nestled in the woods on a one acre lot, our spacious 3 bedroom home is a convenient walk to Beaver Lake, five minute drive to downtown,  and one mile to I26. Luxury linens and modern kitchen with all the personal touches. Incredible family retreat!
space: Come enjoy this quiet sanctuary conveniently located in an upscale neighborhood in North Asheville near Beaver Lake. Nestled on a heavily wooded one acre lot, this three bedroom home boasts vaulted ceilings, high end kitchen finishings, luxury linens, antique and hand-made furniture, two queen size beds, one 3/4 (antique) bed, a baby crib, down-filled leather couch, a reading room, a large dining room table seating for ten, a fire pit, and two open-air porches for relaxing. The home is 2.5 miles from downtown (easy bike ride), less than half a mile to I26 (easy drive to Biltmore, West Asheville, and hiking destinations), and a five minute walk to Beaver Lake (no view of the lake from the house). This is our home, so the kitchen is fully stocked with all our favorite things including quality spices, everyday condiments, black skillets, pots and pans, premium glassware, and Fiesta dinnerware. We have a small fire pit, lights hanging in the trees, and a hammock. Because this is our home,

neighborhood_overview: The Lakeshore community is an upscale university neighborhood surrounding Beaver Lake. We are so close to downtown and yet conveniently accessible to I26, which takes you to West Asheville in a jiffy and to Biltmore in less than fifteen minutes. A Blue Ridge Parkway entrance is tucked away in North Asheville off Beaverdam Road, fifteen minutes down the road. A city bus stop is a two minute walk, and traveling to downtown requires only one bus.
notes: We have toilet paper, paper towels, linens, sheets, shampoo / conditioner, hand soap, and hair dyer. Guests should provide all other toiletries including soap.
transit: A city bus stop is a close walk away. Cars and walking / biking are the best options. Guests have room to park two cars.
host_about: Before my husband and I married, we dreamed up Asheville as a perfect home: hiking, laid back people, cooler temperatures with endless sun, thriving art scene, incredible local food movement and, of course, beer culture. In 2011, life dealt us the incredible gift of a professor position at UNC Asheville; we packed our family and drove from Tucson, AZ to these mountains. We are a young family who enjoys playing outdoors, cooking big meals, reading, drawing, writing, and telling stories. We remain in love with all that this region has to offer, and we pride ourselves for knowing about the great entertainment options happening around town (many of which are free). We look forward to hosting you in Asheville soon.

name: Cozy Cabin Minutes to Downtown
space: This apartment is the first floor of the home we live in. It is a luxury log cabin nestled amongst a beautiful forest of trees, yet only minutes to downtown Asheville.  Enjoy a very comfortable king size bed in the apartment and queen size bed in a room attached. Kitchen and bathroom can be accessed through the room with the king sized bed.  Hang out area is in this room as well, where you might find yourselves relaxing on the sofa or sipping on some tea looking out the large windows at a forest of mature trees. The apartment is located minutes from downtown Asheville.  It is an easy drive to world class hiking as well as the thriving River Arts District. We have lived in Asheville for years and love it.  We would be glad to help guide you to the best of what Asheville has to offer.

name: Minutes to DT Asheville, Pvt. Bath
summary: Comfortable, clean, low priced accommodations to the traveler who loves peace and quiet. Located on an acre just 10 minutes to Downtown Asheville. No tourist noise or traffic. Lovely surroundings. Private bathroom. Offered by experienced host Sandy.
space: Asheville and Beyond! Let's look at what the "Beyond" gets you. In this case you can stay out of and away from road noise, pollution, and tourist traffic. Downtown Asheville to my front door will be about 10-12 minutes. The highway I-26 is nearby so you have easy access.  Once at my house a lock box/key will be available for 24 hour access. Enter through the front door (please take extra care to make sure the house kitty cat does not get out while your entering and exiting)  into a large, roomy living room area, dining area. Your room is off to the right. Your private bathroom is directly outside your bedroom. The bedroom has a comfortable full sized bed, desk and dresser, large closet and mini fridge and microwave for your convenience. There is a nice sized kitchen where light meal making can be done. The room is equipped with a TV and you can access your Netflix, Hulu plus account, etc, via wii-fii internet. Or you can simply watch a movie from the Redbox located not too far away. Th

neighborhood_overview: Weaverville has been called "Asheville's little sister to the North." Small town charms, mountains and valleys, scenic views, fresh cafe breakfasts, local organic dining, live local mountain music, world class zip-lining, regional brews, art safaris, real local craftspeople, outfitting services and (URL HIDDEN) all here in this little town that people flock to in order to be just a hop, skip and jump to the city of Asheville.
transit: Not too near to public transportation so a car is best to have.
host_about:
I live  a low key lifestyle in surroundings that are so peaceful, serene and close to the beach. I like to share that with others who travel and want to find affordable accommodations.
I like to give others their private space so much so that I created a separate living space in my home with a private entrance and bath. I enjoyed decorating the room to give an airy feel, with surfaces that are easy to keep clean.
I hope that that you will find a visit to the Hammock to be just as peaceful, serene, picturesque and charming as I do.

name: Cozy North Asheville Retreat
summary: This newly renovated apartment is all you could want for a visit to Asheville!! Private entrance to a one bedroom apartment with living/dining area, convenient to freeway and LOTS of outdoor activities!! Short 9 mile drive to charming downtown.
space: This large daylight basement offers both privacy and comfort. It has been entirely renovated in the last 3 months!! You will enter into the large living area with a designated dining area complete with Keurig and fridge/freezer and all dishes/utensils. For your entertainment pleasure, lounge comfortably in the recliner or on the queen size couch and enjoy a HUGE dvd collection and new large screen tv with Direct tv and a surround sound system. Proceed down a hallway leading to the bathroom and a comfortable, private bedroom with an I8 sleep number bed. There are also two large closets with plenty of storage!!

If I can't be here to meet you in person, I will text you a code to get into the apartment. Parking will be to the right as you pull in th
neighborhood_overview: We live in a beautiful, quiet and private residential neighborhood nestled at the base of a mountain. There is only one entrance/exit and therefore no thru traffic making this neighborhood peaceful and safe.
notes: There are two small dachshunds living upstairs that may bark, but only when guests are arriving or if things get loud!
transit: We are very convenient to 19/23 or future 26 and we are a short 9 mile drive (10-15 minutes depending on your driving speed!) to the heart of charming downtown Asheville. We are also a 9 mile drive to the iconic Blue Ridge Parkway where you can access scenic views and hiking trails galore!
host_about:
Hi! I'm Stephanie and I live in the beautiful mountains of Western North Carolina. I love everything to do with good food and wine, hanging out with good friends and traveling! 

I love being a host for Airbnb as I get to meet so many great people from all walks of life!!

summary: We have a one bedroom, 1 bath suite in a quiet neighborhood conveniently located  about 4 miles from downtown Asheville and from the Blue Ridge Parkway.   Enjoy a private entrance and off street parking.  The suite includes an efficiency kitchen.
space: The bedroom has a queen size bed with a new memory foam mattress.  The living area has a full size sofa bed which also has a memory foam mattress.  Kitchen includes coffee maker, mini fridge, toaster oven, induction burner, microwave oven and Reverse Osmosis water filter.

name: Private Home with Private Grounds
summary: This is a spacious 1939 home with two extra bedrooms upstairs. There is a private bathroom/shower upstairs as well.  The house sits on a private 1 acre lot.  There is a covered side porch and a rear deck.  Parking is off street & safe.
space: This house is amazingly spacious with 9 foot ceilings and oak floors on first level.  Huge old timey kitchen.  Large flat screen in living room with (URL HIDDEN) internet access.
description: This is a spacious 1939 home with two extra bedrooms upstairs. There is a private bathroom/shower upstairs as well.  The house sits on a private 1 acre lot. Large flat screen in living room with (URL HIDDEN) internet access. This upstairs bedroom is cozy and quiet with a small walk-in closet.  It has a queen size hand made bed and a desk for writing and a bentwood rocking chair.  It shares a small bathroom with shower with another hospitality space on Airbnb that you can find at Country Living in the City Limits.  To book both rooms you will need to reserve or instant book them individually. I live here so I will be available to you as a guest most of the time.  Happy to contribute to your time with us here in Asheville. I live in a 1930's neighborhood for the most part.  It is part of Lake View Par
neighborhood_overview: I live in a 1930's neighborhood for the most part.  It is part of Lake View Park and a great place to live away from the hubbub yet close to downtown.  there are banks, grocery stores, and restaurants within 5 and more blocks of my driveway on Merrimon Avenue.
notes: I live in a beautiful part of town with a huge lake nearby surrounded by mountains for walking, sitting, meditating.  Sometimes when I go to the lake I just cannot believe that I live here (refugee from Boston 20 years ago).  How does it get any better than this?
transit: The Asheville bus line goes right by my house and the bus stop is only 1.5 blocks to the left of my driveway as you walk exiting the property.  You can drive downtown from my home is 8 minutes or less most of the time.
host_about: I am a semi retired male, UNC graduate, interested in spirituality, organic gardening, Access Consciousness, and enjoying life.  My home is my temple and I aspire to make it welcoming and peaceful for all who enter into it.  Beauty is important to me so I have a fair number of art objects in the house.  I lead a health conscious lifestyle.  My home is also gay friendly.

name: Cozy One-bedroom apartment
summary: My small apartment is neat and clean. Right around the corner from UNCA, Botanical Gardens, and a couple minutes from downtown. Sits in a quiet wooded neighborhood where there are trees to hang a hammock and enjoy nature sounds with a beer :)
space: I do have a TV with access to a DVD player as well. I can leave a note on how to use it. My apartment is small so its useful for just relaxing or sleeping after hiking the many nearby trails or experiencing the many downtown breweries. I'd be glad to recommend both for you. You will find various post-it notes to help you with your stay as well!

I will be out of town during your stay but I can have someone stop over if a problem does arise. My neighborhood is great in my opinion! Eclectic group of people l
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is great in my opinion! Eclectic group of people live around me, more so the younger crowd. Usually everyone is quiet and friendly. There is a bus line a very short walk away as well as the Botanical Gardens. There is also a walking/biking path that runs by the main road. You can take that downtown if you don't want to drive or call a taxi.
notes: Fell free to contact me regarding any questions.
transit: Taxi, biking, walking, are all available from my place. About a 4 minute drive downtown. 10 minutes by bike and maybe 25 minutes by foot.

name: Private Bed&Bath w/Private Entrance
summary: We live in a quiet neighborhood in North Asheville (with a 10 minute drive from downtown Asheville).  Your room is separate from our living quarters.  You will have your own entrance, key, bathroom, shower, mini-fridge, microwave, and in-room coffee.
description: We live in a quiet neighborhood in North Asheville (with a 10 minute drive from downtown Asheville).  Your room is separate from our living quarters.  You will have your own entrance, key, bathroom, shower, mini-fridge, microwave, and in-room coffee. -Our cats do not ever go into the space we rent through Airbnb!  The room is separate from our living quarters.  We have to walk outside and go downstairs in order to get to it.  So, if you have an allergy to cats, you don't need to worry! -The floor of the room is made out of stone/marble.  It can be very cold!  You might want to bring some slippers and/or extra socks.
notes: -Our cats do not ever go into the space we rent through Airbnb!  The room is separate from our living quarters.  We have to walk outside and go downstairs in order to get to it.  So, if you have an allergy to cats, you don't need to worry! -The floor of the room is made out of stone/marble.  It can be very cold!  You might want to bring some slippers and/or extra socks.
host_about:
Hello!
My name is Amanda.  I live in Asheville, NC with my wife, Liz, and our cats, Molly and Neko.  I was born and raised in Duluth, GA.  Then, I earned a B.A. degree (in Women's Studies) from the University of Georgia.  After that, I moved to Asheville and earned a K-6 Teaching License from the University of North Carolina Asheville.  Since then, I have been working as a Teacher Assistant at elementary schools in Asheville/Buncombe County.  When I'm not at work, I like to make art, go on walks, and read.

As an Airbnb host, I like to greet my guests (if we happen to run into each other, or if they request to meet me), and then I like to do my own thing!  Of course, I am always available for any questions or concerns!  Thank you for your interest!  We hope to see you soon!  : )

summary: OPEN STUDIO-STYLE cottage overlooking meadow and starry nights. Expansive decking, pavilion for morning coffee or evening wine, hammock creek side, fire pit, badminton, bocci ball, bean bag~ A bird sanctuary less than 5 mi to downtown or the parkway!
space: REFOCUS COTTAGE is sophisticated OPEN STUDIO- STYLE SPACE, uncluttered in its decor and is in such a serene country setting you may not want to leave the FOUR ACRE property with creek, meadow, woods and fire pit, pavilion, horse shoes, badminton, boccie ball, bean bag toss, sky chair and hammocks.  Its SPECTACULAR DECKING overlooking the meadow and woods makes it the loveliest of escapes for recharging, decompressing, writing, painting, photographing... When you do venture out, you will find that you are LESS THAN FIVE MINUTES TO DOWNTOWN Asheville and pretty much everywhere else you might want to go. Return home to star-filled skies that your cathedral windows and skylight won't let you forget in this chic, bright, open studio style cottage. The queen size bed is comfortable with a heated mattress cover.  There is a pull-out chair bed for extra guests and a VERY COMFORTABLE new queen-size futon sofa.  Off the decking ABOVE is a private 2nd BR with a sofa platform bed for one (mattress

neighborhood_overview: Friendly safe walk-friendly neighborhood.  It feels like a sleepy country resort and yet it is only minutes to downtown Asheville.  There is access to the parkway from this end of town which is wonderful and fast.  It is only a 3 miles drive to Beaver Lake which can be walked around in 45 minutes for painless, pleasant exercise in a beautiful setting.  The local restaurant choices are great - Zen Sushi, Ambrozia, Home Grown, Dough, Marcos, Stoney Knob Cafe, Plant... for vegetarian, vegan, meat lover, pizza lover, small plate fusion...
notes: This property is magic, inspiring, calming, restorative.  We have become a destination.
transit: Getting around from here is VERY EASY with a short drive to anywhere you'll want to go.  There is public transit also into town and various other locations and an option for taxis if you decide to visit our many breweries and don't want to drive home.
host_about: I like putting people and environments together and have converted my art studio to a rental cottage to do just that.  Since graduating from Carnegie Mellon as a painter, A LONG TIME AGO, I have had many creative occupations including theater, film, interior design and teaching. A strong desire to share the property that my husband and I have sculpted together for 15 years has led to the conversion of a free standing art studio to RACK FOCUS COTTAGE  (304379). The need for a 3 BR led to the renovation of RACK FOCUS (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)) . Because this property is right across the street from the cottage, its guests can easily share the wooded walk, creek sitting,meadow and fire pit of the park-like setting of the cottage. Similarly furnished and appointed it is ideal for larger groups. We love to travel but this is our favorite destination. Make Asheville yours. Stay with us.  Short, extended stay or long term.

name: Vintage Carriage House Apartment
summary: The Carriage House apartment is located behind our house at the end of a short driveway. Perfect central location for singles or couples in a quiet residential neighborhood.Close to UNCA and downtown.
space: Built in the 1920's, the ground floor of the carriage house was recently renovated as an office and quilting studio.   The  apartment upstairs was "refreshed" at the same time,  blending old-world charm and modern convenience (while retaining original built-ins and wood paneling). The eclectic décor reflects our interests in photography (John) and quilting (Lou) as well as travel momentos. Because the apartment is our “guestroom" for family and friends, we have furnished it accordingly….and as frequent Airbnb guests around the world, we have provided all the amenities we would want for ourselves. The eat-in kitchen has an electric stove, microwave, toaster, coffee makers ( regular and French press) tea kettle , blender and all the cook ware and utensils you would need.   The bedroom has a new and comfy Queen bed, quality linens and closet and dresser for belongings. A small desk and chair if you MUST work and plenty of electrical outlets for computers, phones , etc. Lamps on each side
description: The Carriage House apartment is located behind our house at the end of a short driveway. Perfect central location for singles or couples in a quiet residential neighborhood.Close to UNCA and downtown. The eat-in kitchen has an electric stove, microwave, toaster, coffee makers ( regular and French press) tea kettle , blender and all the cook ware and utensils you would need.   The bedroom has a
neighborhood_overview: The carriage house apartment is located in a Historic residential district in North Asheville within walking distance to favorite neighborhood restaurants: Luella's (barbeque), Vinnie's (Italian) and Asheville Pizza and Brew, one of the oldest craft breweries in Asheville. Drive/Uber or walk 1.5 miles to eclectic downtown Asheville and wonderful restaurants and more breweries than we can count.  Our immediate area has grocery stores, the UNCA campus, Asheville Botanical Garden, and greenways. A quick drive takes you to the River Arts District, West Asheville, Grove Park Inn, the Biltmore Estate and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Head North or South…we're right in the middle of the best Asheville has to offer.  If you've never been to Asheville, I can give you great resources for information about weekly events, seasonal festivals, local restaurants and attractions.
host_about:
We are a retired couple, John ( consultant/writer) and Lou (nurse) We love to travel and prefer to rent apartments rather than hotel rooms so as to fully appreciate the experience . 
Asheville has been home since we moved from DC in 2006 and every day  has been filled with the joy of discovering all that drew us here: music and  mountains, food and festivals , dog parks and bookstores and plenty of charming souls to keep us here. 
We've taken care to provide a space WE would stay in, that our family and friends will come to call home …and where you will discover your very own Asheville.
street: Norwood Avenue, Asheville, NC 28804, United States

name: Heaven Zen (guest house)
summary: Private house/cottage; beautifully decorated in a quiet, peaceful neighborhood. Walk to UNCA, the Botanical Garden, Grove Park Inn. Less than a 5 minute drive to downtown.  (Please note, this is not a party house.)
space: Clean, quiet, cozy, relaxing. A studio space with a queen size bed. Area for making coffee, tea and toast. Nice selection of organic chocolates and teas. Large bathroom with roomy shower for two. Private and up on a hill with a view that overlooks the rest of the area including the mountains. Nice front porch to sit on.
description: Private house/cottage; beautifully decorated in a quiet, peaceful neighborhood. Walk to UNCA, the Botanical Garden, Grove Park Inn. Less than a 5 minute drive to downtown.  (Please note, this is not a party house.) Clean, quiet, cozy, relaxing. A studio space with a queen size bed. Area for making coffee, tea and toast. Nice selection of organic chocolates and teas. Large bathroom with roomy shower for two. Private and up on a hill with a view that overlooks the rest of the area including the mountains. Nice front porch to sit on. 5-10 mins. walk to restaurants such as Rise and Shine (breakfast), Atlanta Bread Co., Bruegger Bagels, Asheville Pizza and Brewing (movie), Zen Sushi, YoLo, Luella's, The Hop. The UNCA Farmer's Market is Saturday mornings and just a couple of blocks away. You can walk downtown in 20 minutes if you like.  Beaver Lake and the Bird Sanctuary are just minutes away and a nice, quiet place to walk. Also the Botanical Garden at UNCA is a 10 minute walk from the hous
neighborhood_overview: Heaven Zen is on  a No Outlet street in North Asheville.  Easily accessible and near everything! The Blue Ridge Parkway is 15 minutes away.
notes: The house is decorated with sacred geometry structures, buddha and gene key artwork.
transit: Uber is a great option since finding parking in downtown Asheville can be a challenge. You can walk downtown from Heaven Zen in about 30 minutes. Instead of walking down Merrimon, you would go through the campus of UNCA and then down the greenway and right into downtown.
host_about: I've lived in Asheville for over 13 years and am known by many as at least one of the following: Entrepreneur, Innovator, Designer, Writer, Astrologer, Healer, Massage Therapist, Human Design student, Projector, Yoga Enthusiast, Artist, Vegetarian, Mother with 23 year old son, Zach, living with me. I am available for astrology readings, healings, advice on Best of Asheville including Best Yoga classes, Best waterfall hikes, Best places to eat etc.

name: Unique 1920's Bungalow
summary: 1920's Bungalow with lots of character! Rear balcony views of sunsets in distant mountain peeks, plus partial winter views of the French Broad River. Conveniently located less than 3 miles from Downtown, and West Asheville, quick access to I-26.
space: The house is currently being rented and will be free starting June 5th for the first time on Airbnb.  I'm looking to rent the home for the whole month of June and July preferred, but I am flexible, as long as its longer than 6 days. I will also be updating profile pictures and description as the current tenants move out. At the moment there is no TV, but I am willing to get one before your arrival if requested, along with any other needs you may have, just ask. name: Cute cottage10 minutes north, quiet
space: Two night minimum required on weekends. Cute, 2 bedroom completely  remodeled cottage  located just 10 minutes to downtown and about 3.5 miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway in beautiful Beaverdam Valley in North Asheville.  It is in a quiet neighborhood on a large level lot. For bicycling enthusiast, Elk Mountain Scenic Hwy is just one mile away. Refinished hardwood floors, new custom-made cherry cabinets, new kitchen counter tops, fresh interior paint, queen bed in one bedroom and full size (double) bed in the other bedroom.  Washer /dryer, wood stove, deck with gas grill.  Kitchen is fully equipped with plates, flatware, glasses, pots and pans.  Has a Samsung 42" plasma HDTV and Samsung Blu Ray player. Cable TV and WiFi high speed internet access. It is well located, about 2 miles to Merrimon Ave, where you will find 3 grocery stores, shops, banks, several  restaurants, a public library and Beaver Lake, and from there the Biltmore Estate is 10 minutes away; the Grove Park Inn is only 5 m

host_about: I grew up in Asheville and have had a variety of different careers from being a probation officer for 4 years, just out of college,  then 16 years in banking and finance  then owning  a restaurant in downtown Asheville in the 1990's and then starting a gift and garden retail store (Thyme In The Garden)  7 years ago, which I sold my interest in this year to my former wife.  In the last three years I have become a fixture at the YMCA, lost a lot of weight, have developed an interest poetry, reading and embarrassing attempts at writing. I also love to cook and play golf, but have little time from either this year.

summary: Casual elegant comfortable apartment to enjoy some time in Asheville. Less than 5 mile to the heart of downtown. The  bedroom has queen size bed with very nice linens. Nice walk-in shower and bathtub. Fully equipped kitchen.
space: This Apartment  is an ideal space for a single or a couple. This is the place to stay if you want to be close to downtown, whether you're here for a romantic getaway or for one of our many festivals or would just like to spend some time in Asheville. If you want to be near any location on a nice quiet place, this is the perfect spot.

host_about:
My name is Julia. I'm a middle aged woman living a good life in Asheville. I have lived here  for 11 years  and love to call it home. I enjoy Asheville for the beauty of the place, the great music and food, the open minded and the warmth of the people. It's a great town. 
Before I was living in Charlotte NC for many years and long time ago I lived in Colombia S A, where I was born. 
I love to travel, experience different cultures and try different kinds of food. My favorite hobby is to make handcrafted jewelry.

name: Asheville Long Range Views-Hot Tub
summary: Enjoy the beauty and serenity of a home with long range mountain and French Broad River views, only six miles from downtown Asheville.  Comfortably sleeps eight, a four person hot tub, spectacular stone fireplace in living room. Pet Friendly!!
space: Peace, relaxation, solitude, luxury, with only the breeze or the cry of a soaring hawk to break the silence.....all surrounded by a 100-acre nature preserve with turkeys, bob cats, deer, and even an occasional bear. Just seven miles from the center of eclectic and historic Asheville, North Carolina, and close to a host of Western North Carolina attractions and activities. A uniquely constructed home that seamlessly blends with its mountain environment, the home features a 22-foot-high cathedral ceiling, two large stone fireplaces (one in the living room and one in the master bedroom), and includes all the usual amenities plus a 6-person hot tub on the terrace, broadband Internet, a CD/Tape/Radio sound system throughout the house and unlimited U.S. long distance calling. Completely furnished, it will comfortably accommodate 8 people. We welcome up to two pets with an additional $75 fee for one pet and $100 for two pets. The oversized master bedroom on the first floor has a king bed, 32"
description: Enjoy the beauty and serenity of a home with long range mountain and French Broad River views, only six miles from downtown Asheville.  Comfortably sleeps eight, a four person hot tub, spectacular stone fireplace in living room. Pet Friendly!! Peace, relaxation, solitude, luxury, with only the breeze or the cry of a soaring hawk to break the silence.....all surrounded by a 100-acre nature preserve with turkeys, bob cats, deer, and even an occasional bear. A uniquely constructed home that seamlessly blends with its mountain environment, the home features a 22-foot-high cathedral ceiling, two large stone fireplaces (one in the living room and one in the master bedroom), and includes all the usual amenities plus a 6-person hot tub on the terrace, broadband Internet, a CD/Tape/Radio sound system throughout the house and unlimited U.S
neighborhood_overview: This home is unique by simultaneously meeting the needs of those who want quiet and seclusion and those who want proximity to the conveniences of a city and surrounding attractions.  Once through the main driveway and onto the property relish the feeling that you are miles away from the hustle and bustle of daily life. And yet without sacrificing privacy, you are a short drive to a grocery store, gas station, pharmacy, fast-food joints, restaurants, and putt-putt golf.
notes: The lower basement level will not be occupied during your visit, however, THERE IS AN OFFICE WITH AN OUTSIDE ENTRANCE THAT MAY BE USED BY OWNER AND ONE OR TWO CONTRACTORS.
transit: Close to I26 and Merrimon Avenue so driving is a breeze.  If you want to explore the breweries or have a drink with dinner Uber taxi is approximately a $20 trip to downtown Asheville.
host_about: We love Asheville and enjoy exploring other destinations around the world.

name: Dog Friendly Cabin in the Woods
summary: Abner's Cabin is located in N. Asheville on two private wooded acres with pastoral mountain views.  We are located just 10 minutes north of the central hub of the downtown Asheville (around 8 miles).  Excellent reviews from travelers since 2008!!!
description: Abner's Cabin is located in N. Asheville on two private wooded acres with pastoral mountain views.  We are located just 10 minutes north of the central hub of the downtown Asheville (around 8 miles).  Excellent reviews from travelers since 2008!!!
host_about:
We are outgoing, fun-loving folks that love to laugh.  Steve is a retired fire Chief from New Orleans and I am a wannabe retiree but love my job so much that I cannot see my self ever stopping (in the near future).  Steve says he works more now than when he had 400 firemen that answered to him.  He is always helping a neighbor or a friend (sometimes people he does not even know) with projects around their homes.  I sell residential real estate and farms and land.  Land is what I really enjoy the most!  What better job could you have than one where you get to go outdoors, hike property and find just the right fit for the right folks.  

Steve and I love to travel - usually to a beach or to visit friends and our children and lovely grandchildren.  When we are not working, we are on the Harley taking small rides in these beautiful Appalachian Mountains.  

Abner's Cabin has been a vacation rental since 2006 and we have many return travelers.  We have met some awesome people of whom many have become friends over the years.  We truly care about your comfort and want to make sure you are lacking in nothing when you arrive.

name: Cozy 1BR w/ Qu Sleeper Sofa
summary: Location location location! Less than 3min from Grove Park, 5min from downtown [plethora of restaurants & breweries] & less than 10min from RAD & West Asheville! Come enjoy all that is Asheville from the comfort of my cozy little home! Hammock incl!!
space: I live in an old classic row house that has been converted into a duplex. Lots of natural light & mountain breezes flowing through the many windows in the house! The entire first floor of the home is yours! :) Two fruit & veggie baskets hanging in the kitchen for storage as well as fully stocked kitchen! Pots, pans, dishware, glassware, silverware, cutting board, knife block, wine opener and dish soap for you to clean up after yourself! ;)

My neighborhood is home to the historic Thomas Wolfe House & Omni Grove
neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is home to the historic Thomas Wolfe House & Omni Grove Park Resort. As well as just around the corner from UNCA campus.
notes: Walking distance to : ABC store  Wal-greens Ave M restaurant & bar Wells Fargo Ingles Fresh Market Stein Mart Presbyterian & Episcopal churches Beaver Lake Grove Park Asheville Country Club
transit: Bus stop is one block away Downtown is a $7 uber ride Free parking on street in front of house & abc store parking lot
host_about:
I am a full time student and full time employee. I a the proud mother of a 7yr old fur baby that lights up my life!! :)

I don't have a lot of free time but when I do have it i enjoy taking a yoga class or volunteering for PSR or Global Zero. 

I love natural lighting and lots of plants...but unfortunately I have been too busy this year to rebuild my indoor garden. :( 

But there is fresh garden thyme, lemon grass & sweet marjoram growing in hanging baskets on the porch! Please feel free to enjoy them in whatever meals you prepare!

PS: I do not provide toilet paper, paper towels or any such items! As I typically only rent my home out when I am out of the country!

name: Asheville Airstream & Cozy Bungalow
summary: 1973 Argosy Airstream & Two Bedroom Bungalow, just five minutes from Downtown, River Arts, and West Asheville! Relax in this quiet neighborhood, right across the street from the French Broad River! This place sleeps as many as you can fit, so come on over, and enjoy Asheville!
description: 1973 Argosy Airstream & Two Bedroom Bungalow, just five minutes from Downtown, River Arts, and West Asheville! Relax in this quiet neighborhood, right across the street from the French Broad River! This place sleeps as many as you can fit, so come on over, and enjoy Asheville! Guests will have full access to the kitchen and appliances, including blender, toaster, steamer, oven and stovetop.  As well as the iron, washer and dryer, record player, and personal hygiene and cleaning products.  There is soap/shampoo in the shower, a first aid kit in the medicine cabinet, as well as laundry soap under the sink! Please make yourself at home and enjoy your stay :) I live about an hour away and will always be available, should you need anything.  If not, my assistant Jake is 5 minutes away, and can address any immediate needs that you may have.  Please always contact me first, and I will get you in touch with him, should the occasion arise. Super quiet street, just seconds from the highway, and
neighborhood_overview: Super quiet street, just seconds from the highway, and 5 minutes to Downtown, River Arts District, and West Asheville! My house is also across the street from the French Broad River and has some lovely hiking and nature walks in the area!
transit: Not real familiar with the bus system, but Asheville has one should you need to get around.  If you have a car, we are right down the street from the highway, and you can always call Uber or Lyft, won't cost much! Also, on the off chance I am around, and you need a ride, don't hesitate to ask!
host_about: Cosmic mermaid with a bit of an eclectic and eccentric sense of life.  Adventuresome spirit who enjoys connecting with others and would love to host as many travelers as possible! Loves stories from both near and far, as well as expanding her network on the global grid.  Thanks for your interest, she is already looking forward to your stay :)

name: Sunny Aerie with Mountain Views
summary: It's a 1500 SF home with large, sunny open common area with 30' deck, a large master bedroom in the trees with a private porch and bath with jacuzzi, an exercise room and deck, and great views down a valley and into the Blue Ridge Mountains
space: The home is at the end of a country mountain road only 5 miles from downtown Asheville, just outside the city limits. Grocery stores and restaurants are 2 miles distant.  The home's common area looks down a valley toward the Blue Ridge Mountains in the distance and the master bedroom is surrounded by a hilly tree cover.  The common area, bedrooms, and hallway have hardwood floors with oriental rugs, the kitchen floors and counters are porcelain tile. It's Mexican tile in the master bath, which also has a jetted tub and open wall shower. The common area has cathedral ceilings, two walls of windows, skylights, a screened porch and 30-foot deck. Please note that the master bedroom at the end of the hallway does not have a door. Visually, it's pretty private unless someone comes to the entryway, and it has a door to the ensuite bath and walk-in closet. But the door-sized, room-corner, entryway opens directly onto the end of the hallway.
description: It's a 1500 SF home with large, sunny open common area with 30' deck, a large master bedroom in the trees with a private porch and bath with jacuzzi, an exercise room and deck, and great views down a valley and into the Blue Ridge Mountains The home is at the end of a country mountain road only 5 miles from downtown Asheville, just outside the city limits. Grocery stores and restaurants are 2 miles distant.  The home's common area looks down a valley toward the Blue Ridge Mountains in the distance and the master bedroom is surrounded by a hilly tree cover.  The common area, bedrooms, and hallway have hardwood floors with oriental rugs, the kitchen floors and counters are porcelain tile. It's Mexican tile in the master bath, which also has a jetted tub and open wall shower. The common area has cathedral ceilings, two walls of windows, skylights, a screened porch and 30-foot deck. Please note that the master bedroom at the end of the hallway does not have a door. Visually, it's pretty pr
neighborhood_overview: It's extremely quiet and peaceful here. The house is on a side of the hill near its top. You can see neighbors across and down the street and two homes immediately downhill, but the neighbors up and across the hill are distant and shielded by thick tree cover.
notes: This was a simple home built in 1960 that was largely gutted and renovated in the late 1990s. Because it's a home that's lived-in year around, you'll find lots of little things not in most vacation rentals, like ice packs, good dinnerware, and wall art. Because I own an inn, I'm aware of small touches to make your stay smooth and pleasurable.
transit: There's no public transit. There is covered parking for one vehicle, off-street parking for a second.
host_about: I've owned and managed Hill House, a 4-star, 10-room inn just north of downtown Asheville since February 2012. It's not on AirBnB. This is my personal home, which I either like to book when I take a vacation or at times book the guest room to a traveler. I treat my guests here, just as I treat those at Hill House.

name: Local living in Asheville!
summary: Welcome to our sunny bungalow in North Asheville! We are located minutes from downtown, the Grove Park, Blue Ridge Parkway, UNCA, Biltmore Estate and endless outdoor activities. Come enjoy all Asheville has to offer! Ideal for couples, girls trips and small families. Lovely corner lot in great neighborhood!
space: This home just "feels" nice and relaxing when you are there. The home is safe and inviting and encouraged 'hanging out'. It is situated on a corner lot with lots of space to play and be outside in nature. Almost every time I have been there I have seen wildlife-mostly wild turkey families, but occasionally bears, fox, & pheasants may cross your path. Don't be afraid, just be smart and enjoy this amazing opportunity!

I like to do key exchange in person but it is not required if you are having a late check-in or for some reason it won't work. In general, when leaving, please leave the keys on the kitch
neighborhood_overview: This area of Asheville is full of great neighborhoods, minutes from everything in and around town. From the back yard, there is a lovely mountain view which will only get more beautiful as autumn arrives. You can take walks from your front door, use the 'secret' Blue Ridge Parkway entrance nearby, see nature right outside the window and within minutes be in downtown enjoying amazing food, bars, art, music and more!
notes: There is an extra person charge after 2 people to help adjust for usage. If you are traveling with children under 5, please let me know about them in the message but don't add them as an extra person.

name: Relaxing Room (Mountains/Lake View)
summary: Beautiful well appointed room in charming Mediterranean style 1920's era home.
space: ABOUT OUR HOUSE: Our home was built in 1928 and has 3 bedrooms, 2.5 baths in a quiet and safe neighborhood located just north of downtown Asheville. ROOM DETAILS: The guest bedroom is set up with a regular/firm queen-size bed. Curtains turns this well lit room into a cozy dark room so you can sleep all day after a long night of driving and traveling. OTHER DETAILS: • Clean sheets/bedding and fresh towels provided • Wifi access • Driveway to park your car LOCATION: Only 30 minutes from the Asheville Regional Airport and 13 minutes from Pack Square Park in the center of downtown Asheville.  We're 15 minutes to Blue Ridge Parkway north access and no more than 30 minutes to the Biltmore Estate. Many river activities are close by with 5-10 minute access to the French Broad River. Please feel free to contact us with any questions.

neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood, safe and quiet. Walking distance to trails surrounding Beaver Lake (approx. 3 mile loop) great for runners and walkers.
notes: We have a very friendly dog named Satchel (see photo). She is a white female boxer and will greet you with some barks when you arrive then will disappear unless you choose to enjoy her company.
host_about:
Hi,

As a guest, I'm typically traveling for short business trips. I help clients with  technology strategy, process and organizational problems. I'm an easy guest as I'm typically at client sites during the day and happy with internet access and a quiet room for the night. Having spent much of my career traveling and staying in hotels, I much prefer meeting new people and having a more relaxed place to stay via Airbnb.

When I'm traveling for fun my wife and I enjoy experiencing different cultures, food, nature, the arts and architecture. My favorite travel destinations tend to be mountain areas in the US and Europe (Italy in particular).

name: Asheville Serene Retreat - Hot Tub
summary: Enjoy the beauty and serenity of a home nestled in the woods only 6 miles from downtown Asheville. A uniquely constructed home of wood and rock that seamlessly blends with its mountain environment,
space: Peace, relaxation, solitude, with only the breeze or the cry of a soaring hawk to break the silence ... all surrounded by a 100-acre nature preserve with turkeys, deer, and even an occasional bear. Just seven miles from the center of eclectic and historic Asheville, North Carolina, and close to a host of Western North Carolina attractions and activities.  This 3,200 square foot home perched high on the side of a mountain at the end of a pristine forested drive offers stunning panoramic winter views and spring and summer views as well through the lush curtain of leaves from hardwoods standing as sentinels of your privacy. A uniquely constructed home of wood and rock that seamlessly blends with its mountain environment, the home features a 22-foot-high cathedral ceiling, two large stone fireplaces, and includes all the usual amenities plus a 6-person hot tub on the deck, broadband Internet, a CD/Tape/Radio sound system throughout the house and unlimited U.S. long distance calling. Comple

neighborhood_overview: This home is unique by simultaneously meeting the needs of those who want quiet and seclusion and those who want proximity to the conveniences of a city and surrounding attractions.  Once through the main driveway and onto the property relish the feeling that you are miles away from the hustle and bustle of daily life. And yet without sacrificing privacy, you are a short drive to a grocery store, gas station, pharmacy, fast-food joints, restaurants, and putt-putt golf.
notes: We welcome up to two pets (three if all under 10lbs) with an additional pet fee of $75 for one pet, $100 for two pets and $125 for three (under 10lbs).
transit: Close to I26 and Merrimon Avenue so driving is a breeze.  If you want to explore the breweries or have a drink with dinner Uber taxi is approximately a $20 trip to downtown Asheville.
host_about: We love Asheville and enjoy exploring other destinations around the world.

name: Spacious Lower-level Flat w/Patio
summary: Delightful, clean 2-3 room suite for up to 5 guests, w/luxurious queen bed, comfy futon (when required) & all the amenities you need. Your stay includes high-speed wireless internet, cable TV, stereo, fridge, microwave, coffee maker (no full kitchen), washer/dryer, & walkout patio.
space: Our spacious suite provides everything you need for a refreshing getaway in the mountains. Start the day in one of our Rocking Chairs with a warm cup of coffee or tea from the Keurig machine, with access to a Mini-Fridge and Microwave as well, but there is no stove/range. We can provide Filtered Water, along with sugar and milk.  Relax in the custom-tiled Shower of the 2-sink Master Bathroom, fully-stocked with Toiletries, and a Half-Bath in the hallway near the Washer/Dryer. Enjoy some time outside on the Patio Picnic Table or take a nap on the Hammock (seasonal). You can stay in touch with High Speed Wi-Fi access, listen to music on the Stereo with MP3/Computer hookup, or watch your favorite shows on the Digital Cable TV.  We provide Heat and Central AC throughout, as well as Ceiling Fans in most rooms. We aim for our guests to have the most comfortable visit, so please let us know if there is anything we can do to help.

neighborhood_overview: Please let us know what your interests are and we can give you some personalized recommendations to make the most of your visit.  Asheville is known for its food, beer, artists, charm and free-spirit. Our area, known as Jackson Park or UNCA area, is a quiet, residential neighborhood close to the bustling Merrimon Ave, and less than 2 miles from downtown. From the house, you are walk-able to restaurants, shops, the charming UNCA campus, Botanical Gardens, and the Asheville Greenways (paved and gravel walking/biking paths). Downtown Asheville is lively and vibrant with many local shops, high-end boutiques, museums, galleries, antiques, buskers (street performers), and plenty of good food. While you are here you can visit the many live music venues, artist studios, craft breweries, and world-class restaurants focusing on locally sourced and organic foods.  We are situated in the Appalachian Mountains with plenty of outdoor activities to keep you busy - from hiking the waterfalls, to tubin
notes: Please feel free to contact us if you would like to discuss your potential visit. We're looking forward to welcoming you to our home. Just let us know if there is anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable!
transit: You can park your car in our driveway or on the street in front of the house. From here, you can walk to the nearby restaurants, shops, and activities, or head just 1.5 miles into downtown Asheville. Parking in downtown can be a challenge sometimes but there are many free or paid options. There is also a city bus stop right at the end of the street that will take you to many places in the area for just $1 cash. We have Uber ride-share/taxi in the area and can give you a code for a free ride (for 1st time customers).  We are 20 minutes from Asheville Airport (AVL), 1.5 hours from Greenville-Spartanburg International Airport (GSP) in Greer, SC, and 2 hours from Charlotte Douglas International Airport (CLT) in Charlotte, NC.
host_about: Fun-loving, laid-back married couple always up for something new or interesting. Hiking, running, dancing, yoga, board/card games, movies, crafting, cooking, breweries, going out to chill in AVL, or getting all dolled up for downtown - we love to have a good time. We spent 3 years in California hosting on AirBnB and absolutely loved the experience. We are looking forward to hosting more guests in our new home in Asheville. We are getting to know the land, the people, the food, the culture, and we love to share our recommendations with guests. We are pretty easy going hosts and love meeting new people. I guess that means we are pretty easy guests too! Looking to rent out our guest suite and stay with other hosts to make new friends around the world.

name: Asheville Studio 1 mile to downtown
summary: This studio comes complete with bathroom, kitchen, living space, and private driveway.  Just over 1 mile to downtown.  We strive to offer you a clean, comfy, and private stay.  With two queen air mattress in living room the space holds 6 if need be.
space: Furnished downstairs of a beautiful home in a nice neighborhood ONLY 1 mi. from downtown!   Kitchen, full bath, 1 bedroom, living room, great afternoon sun!   Washer and Dryer.   1 mi. to the Historic Grove Park Inn and Spa. 4 mi. from the Biltmore Estate. 1/8 mi. from iconic Asheville Pizza and Brewing Company. 1 mi. from UNCA campus. 1 mi. to Blue Ridge Parkway access. As you can see, you will be super close to so many amazing locations in Asheville. You will be beautifully surprised at the peace and quiet of a this neighborhood location that is so close to town.  There are healthy grocery stores just a couple of minutes away.  Local shops and restaurants are a short walk as well. If you need info on where to dance, do yoga, kayak, whitewater raft, hike, and explore the parkway just send me as message and I can help.

neighborhood_overview: We are on the historic and reputable North side of town.  A great relaxing area, safe and close to town.  Just 1 mile to town.  Great food and drink options in our neighborhood.
notes: There is no T.V here.   Hey, it's Asheville.. most people I know don't have a T.V.
transit: The bus access is a 3 minute walk from our door.
host_about:
I followed the whitewater to this beautiful mecca in the mountains.  I love all the amazing opportunities to be in the gorgeous natural beauty of this area.  So many rivers, waterfalls, trails, and views to enjoy.  Asheville also happens to be one of the coolest towns I've ever come across to hang out in.  Southern charm, for sure.  Lots of great live music, delicious restaurants, local festivals, amazing art scene, and a happening dance community.  Oh yeah, a healing arts mecca.  Plenty of yoga and therapeutic options around these parts.
I'll tell you where to find the best huevo rancheros you've ever had in your life!
I've lived in Asheville for 10 years now, and know the area pretty well from all of my exploration.  I have worked at the 5 star resort, The Grove Park Inn, and happen to live just one mile from this world famous Resort and Spa.  Being a massage therapist there, I can tell you which treatments will be perfect for you.  I have spent plenty of time at the Biltmore Estates and can suggest good walks to take there.

host_about: Easy-going and considerate, I have  two children in college and teach Buddhism and Yoga worldviews at the University of North Carolina, Asheville Osher Lifelong Learning Institute. I've lived at Asheville for 14 years, know the city and region well and enjoy assisting guests in planning their dining, sightseeing and recreation. Hosting guests runs deep in my family, as my grandparents opened their large house as a bed and breakfast for many years.

name: Historic Log Cabin Asheville (14)
summary: The Moon Beam cabin is one of 18 beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930's, part of the Log Cabin Motor Court.  Gas log stove, air conditioning, shaded front porch, full kitchen with gas stove, and queen bed. PET FRIENDLY.
space: The Moon Beam cabin is one of 18 beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930's, part of the Log Cabin Motor Court.  Gas log stove, air conditioning, rocking chair front porch, full kitchen with gas stove, and queen bed. PET FRIENDLY. Enjoy a nice afternoon on the shaded front porch of the Moon Beam cabin. The cabin has a full kitchen with gas stove, microwave, refrigerator, plates, cups, bowls, silverware etc., gas log stove, a queen bed and sleeps 2 people. Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner and a coffee maker are provided. Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the internet with free wireless access.  Today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance, a rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember.  The quaint town of Weaverville is only 5 miles North and downtown Asheville only 6 miles South.  Great restaurants nearby and the French Broad River only a couple of miles away. Matt
description: The Moon Beam cabin is one of 18 beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930's, part of the Log Cabin Motor Court.  Gas log stove, air conditioning, shaded front porch, full kitchen with gas stove, and queen bed. PET FRIENDLY. neighborhood_overview: The Log Cabin Motor Court was originally a place where weary travelers would stop and camp for the night on a blanket of pine needles beneath the tall pine trees.  Next came the log cabins built by locals and travelers as they passed through.  The first cabin built in 1929.  These cabins were used in the filming of Thunder Road with Robert Mitchum and are rich in history.  Come visit and experience the friendliness of the motor court, sit on your porch and chat with your neighbors or relax under the pines with a good book.
notes: The Log Cabin Motor Court is nestled in a natural setting a short distance from downtown Asheville, between I26 and Highway 25.
transit: We are only 6 miles from downtown Asheville and 5 miles from Weaverville with I26 above and Hwy 25 at our entrance you will fine us easy to locate and a convenient midway point for all the beauty to see in and around Asheville.  If you would like to take a taxi downtown and leave your car, Uber has been used from our location and is approximately a $20 ride.
host_about: We love Asheville and enjoy exploring other destinations around the world.

name: 2.5 mile 2 dntwn, Comfy Suite, Pets
summary: 600 sq. ft. full-sun downstairs studio is all yours! Cozy fireplace seating area, hardwood floors, bay window, French doors for private entry; bath and kitchen. Quiet street across from the golf course & just 2.5 short miles to downtown. Pets ok.
space: Our mid-century-modern home is located in the quiet neighborhood of North Asheville, just 2.5 miles from downtown Asheville, and one mile from the Asheville Pizza and Brew, one of our oldest craft breweries. Enjoy a movie while having the best pizza in A'ville, and great draft beer! Or for a step up from pizza, there's dining at Ave. M with outdoor seating and a great brunch. Or head another 1.5 miles south to our eclectic downtown with shops, entertainment, and the best restaurant selection rivaling any city in the country. All just 5 minutes from our home! Biltmore Estate, a popular destination is an easy 5 more miles south. And, of course, more breweries than we can count.  Your full-sun basement apartment is a spacious 600 sq. ft. large and made for lounging and comfort. Enjoy the living room area in front of the fireplace or TV, or the dining table in front of the bay windows.  You have a private bath with shower. The breakfast nook has a microwave, toaster oven, efficiency refrig

neighborhood_overview: North Asheville is an easy drive to so many places. 10 minutes north of the Biltmore, it's a straight drive there, no need to get on the interstate. We're 2 miles from the Grove Park Inn, another favorite spot to visit, built around the same time as the Biltmore. An interesting and fun place to visit, built of boulders in the side of a mountain, with views, restaurants and shops, plus it's free to visit.
notes: We have a washer and dryer downstairs in a separate area from your apartment. But there might be a time I'd like to ask you if I can do a load of laundry. If you're not comfortable with that, it's perfectly fine. Communication is key!
transit: We're 2.5 miles off of 240 the main hub around Asheville. It's only a $5 Uber ride from downtown if you want to park here and leave your vehicle behind. We also live on the infamous Elk Mountain Scenic Highway ride that goes straight up to the Blueridge Parkway (5 miles up) and around to Town Mountain Road. Just ask us for directions. This is a beautiful and scenic ride by car or bike. There's a bike shop 1 mile from us, rent bikes and bike downtown on quiet streets. The bus is a little less than a mile from us and goes downtown and other areas.
host_about:
Graphic designer, married to Tom. 
We have 2 cats, one is 21 and one is about a year. 
We enjoy mountain biking, road biking, climbing, hiking, and food and wine. And coffee and chocolate. 
And LOVE our home in Asheville, a great place to live or visit!
