name: Modern room with attached bath
summary: Bright, quiet, private room with full attached bath (en suite), 8 minutes to downtown Asheville and 5 minute to UNCA, but feels like you're in the forest. The room has a queen bed. I have two lovely indoor cats. Perfect for one or a couple.
space: In case you missed it, I have cats! The room for rent is the guest room in my house built last year. It has whitewashed hardwood floors upstairs and concrete downstairs, 10' ceilings throughout. There is a full attached bath. The kitchen/dining/living area is a big open space and I have a cozy breakfast nook, as well as a patio and garden.
description: Bright, quiet, private room with full attached bath (en suite), 8 minutes to downtown Asheville and 5 minute to UNCA, but feels like you're in the forest. The room has a queen bed. My room and my office are the only rooms I'd prefer you don't hang out in, but everywhere else is fine! I've got plenty of tea and coffee you are welcome to. I work from home, as well as adjuncting at UNCA, so I am home quite a bit and can help with directions, recommendations and anything else you may need. Most of the time I'm working but am happy to hang out when I am able! Woodfin is a small community that bor
neighborhood_overview: Woodfin is a small community that borders Asheville, my house is just outside of the city limits. There's not much within walking distance but everything is a quick drive. Everyone is really friendly and warm around here and there are interesting walks.
notes: My cats are very nice, and in the spring and summer, I usually have kittens that I foster for the Humane Society.
transit: There's a bus stop on the other side of highway 26, but I wouldn't recommend my place for people without their own transportation. I have plenty of parking. My house is located just off exit 24 (the exit right after UNCA).
host_about:
I am a project manager at a small interactive tv company and also an artist. I have cats named Remus and Penny.
I love to travel and have been throughout southeast asia, Australia, some of Europe and north africa, all over the US, and lived in Japan for a year. I'm a big baseball fan, we have a great minor league team in Asheville! I'm pretty liberal and a vegetarian, but I don't care if you cook meat in my frying pan.

name: Log Cabin Near Downtown Asheville
summary: Town and country – best of both worlds. Romantic! Semi-secluded, 5 minutes from town, near Blue Ridge Parkway. Close mountain views from deck. Hot tub for 6. Fire pit in quarter-acre yard, fenced & gated with playground. Cable TV, wireless internet.
space: Red Gate Cottage is a 1,100 s.f. log and stone cabin with 3 bedrooms – queen bed in master and double bed in second bedroom. Third bedroom flexible – either two extra-long twin beds or one king bed. 2 bathrooms – en suite master bath has deep soaking tub with candle sconces. Vintage cabin faced with stone and cedar on the outside and exposed original log walls on inside. Cathedral ceilings throughout are faced with pine planks. Three fireplaces: big river stone fireplace has a gas log, there's a chiminea on the deck and a fire pit in the yard.   A great venue for romantic couples, friends, or family groups to celebrate holidays and special occasions.
description: Town and country – best of both worlds. Romantic! Semi-secluded, 5 minutes from town, near Blue Ridge Parkway. Close mountain views from deck. Hot tub for 6. Fire pit in quarter-acre yard, fenced & gated with playground. Cable TV, wireless internet. Red Gate Cottage is a 1,100 s.f. log and stone cabin with 3 bedrooms – queen bed in master and double bed in second bedroom. Third bedroom flexible – either two extra-long twin beds or one king bed. 2 bathrooms – en suite master bath has deep soaking tub with candle sconces. Vintage cabin faced with stone and cedar on the outside and exposed original log walls on inside. Cathedral ceilings throughout are faced with pine planks. Three fireplaces: big river stone fireplace has a gas log, there's a chiminea on the deck and a fire pit in the yard.   A great venue for romantic couples, friends, or family groups to celebrate holidays and special occasions. Guests enjoy the private use of Red Gate Cottage and the quarter-acre fenced and gated yard
neighborhood_overview: This magical retreat in a wooded setting has picturesque old world charm reminiscent of an Italian Alpine cottage. North Asheville location, not far from the Grove Park Inn, 5 minutes from town and NC University (UNCA) campus. Black Mountain is within 30 minutes, and Lake Lure, Chimney Rock Park and Wolf Laurel Ski Resort are all within 45 minutes. Mt. Mitchell, highest mountain in the Eastern U.S., is an hour's drive up the Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: Red Gate Cottage is available and accessible year round. It has central heat & air conditioning and is well insulated. The driveway is kept cleared in the unlikely event of snow. Snow Melt and snow shovels are on hand, as well as kitty litter for tire traction if you need it.  Prices are lower in winter - contact host for special pricing.
transit: Car recommended. Taxi & uber service, metro bus stop 1/2 mile. 27 minutes to Asheville Airport. Great area for hiking and mountain biking right out of the door or on the nearby Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: I traveled all over the world and now have put down roots in North Carolina.  My stone and cedar cabin looks much like an Italian Alpine cottage, so impressions of Northern Italy found their way into the landscaping.  Most of all, the house  is what it always want to be – a faithfully restored cabin with all the modern luxuries.  It's a peaceful mountain retreat minutes from the excitement of downtown Asheville, and also near the Blue Ridge Parkway with spectacular hiking, biking, and scenic driving. I love making Red Gate Cottage a special home away from home for my guests.  I live just a few minutes away and I'm service oriented, so I enjoy making sure my guests lack for nothing.

name: Mountain Beauty/City Convenience
summary: Would you like a mountain setting, but with the convenience of downtown Asheville only a few minutes drive away?  Our beautifully-appointed apartment is situated at 3400' elevation, between downtown Asheville and the Blue Ridge Parkway.
space: The private apartment is self-contained on the ground level; no steps to climb!  With the rearranging of a couple of pieces of furniture, it should be handicap-accessible for most individuals. The bedroom has a standard full bed.  Additional sleeping space in the living area on the foldout loveseat.  Ideally the apartment will accommodate a maximum of three adults.

Full apartment with separate bedroom, living room/dining area, kitchen and full bath. We are happy to answer questions for you and provide guidance on the many things to do in Asheville! The property is located adjacent to the state road, so travel is easy--no steep driveways, or tricky navigation.  The property is surrounded by a horse farm on one side and a small estate on the other--neighb
neighborhood_overview: The property is located adjacent to the state road, so travel is easy--no steep driveways, or tricky navigation.  The property is surrounded by a horse farm on one side and a small estate on the other--neighbors close enough for comfort, but with a spacious feel. Love fine dining, the arts and shopping?  Downtown is less than 10 minutes from the apartment! Love nature?  Hiking trails are accessible less than 10 minutes from the apartment!
transit: Über is available at this location.  Please not that Ubër drivers should pick up guests at the bottom of the driveway for the security of our home.
host_about:
My partner and I enjoy the wonderful life that Asheville has to offer:  its diversity, culture and eclectic spirit.  We love our home and its wonderful location:  cool summer breezes, abundant flowering gardens, ease of access to Downtown Asheville.  We hope you'll love our home and gardens just as much, and we want your stay to be comfortable, safe and relaxing.

We look forward to your stay with us!

name: Downtown, River Arts, & W Asheville
summary: Comfy full sized bed, just minutes from Downtown, River Arts, and West Asheville! Fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, and laundry are available during your stay. As well as easy access to the highway, nature hikes, and the Biltmore!
space: Less than five minutes to Downtown, River arts, and West Asheville, this lush private room has a comfy full sized bed, a shared kitchen, and a shared bathroom.  You are welcome to use anything in the kitchen, laundry, and record player, just keep in mind there is a possibility of these spaces being used by other guests, or myself, on occasion.   I will always do my best to communicate with you if there are guests staying in the other room, or the Airstream in the driveway.  But please be advised, there is only one bathroom in the house.  Look at it as an opportunity to expand your horizons and meet other awesome people! If you'd like the whole place to yourself, please check out my other listing, which allows you to rent the entire home! Thanks for looking :)

Look at it as an opportunity to expand your horizons and meet other awesome people! If you'd like the whole place to yourself, please check out my other listing, which allows you to rent the entire home! Thanks for looking :)
neighborhood_overview: Super quiet street, just seconds from the highway, and 5 minutes to Downtown, River Arts District, and West Asheville! My house is also across the street from the French Broad River and has some lovely hiking and nature walks in the area!
notes: Please keep in mind when booking that this is a shared space, you will have your own room, but the bathroom and kitchen will often times be in use by either myself, or other guests.  I will always do my best to remain as transparent and open as possible to your requests, concerns, and needs.  As well as who will be there during your stay, if anyone at all! I ask that you remain respectful of the space and keep it clean, so others can enjoy it as well.   And one last thing, I have a dog.  Like I said, we won't be around much, but from time to time, we will.  If you are uncomfortable with dogs in any way, please let me know and I will do my best to accommodate.   Otherwise, have yourself a marvelous time!
transit: Not real familiar with the bus system, but Asheville has one should you need to get around.  If you have a car, we are right down the street from the highway, and you can always call Uber or Lyft, won't cost much! Also, if I am around and you need a ride, please don't hesitate to ask!
host_about: Cosmic mermaid with a bit of an eclectic and eccentric sense of life.  Adventuresome spirit who enjoys connecting with others and would love to host as many travelers as possible! Loves stories from both near and far, as well as expanding her network on the global grid.  Thanks for your interest, she is already looking forward to your stay :)

name: HOME, INDOOR POOL, NEAR IT ALL
summary: Spacious, single level artist's home with heated pool, gardens, koi pond. North Asheville minutes from the enchantment of downtown, restaurants, shops, golf, ziplines, rafting, microbreweries, galleries and Blue Ridge Parkway.  Gas fireplace, chef's kitchen, HDTV, Netflix.  Caretaker, two standard poodles on premises.
space: Here you have it all. Comfort, peace, and a private heated indoor pool with all the wonders of Asheville close at hand. Spend a day touring the Biltmore Estate or off site seeing and then stretch out your tired muscles in the swimming pool. Take a stroll to the koi pond as you plan your activities for the day.
description: Spacious, single level artist's home with heated pool, gardens, koi pond. North Asheville minutes from the enchantment of downtown, restaurants, shops, golf, ziplines, rafting, microbreweries, galleries and Blue Ridge Parkway. Comfort, peace, and a private heated indoor pool with all the wonders of Asheville close at hand. Spend a day touring the Biltmore Estate or off site seeing and then stretch out your tired muscles in the swimming pool. Take a stroll to the koi pond as you plan your activities for the day. In the pool room you will find water games for all to enjoy, volleyball, basketball, badminton and more. There is water aerobic equipment and an instructor can be arranged.  Your exclusive use of the pool is available 24 hours a day. There is security gate parking. The owner/caretaker's apartment off the kitchen is private. There is a place to smoke outdoors. Ther
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood Is quiet and wooded with beautiful gardens, rolling terrain and winter mountain views.
notes: This property is not suitable for children under 5. There will be an additional charge for unexpected guests of $30 per night if the number of guests is greater than 4. Large groups (6+) are discouraged from using the pool. This is a private home pool and not equipped for heavy use.
transit: Just down the hill from us is public transportation for travel all over Asheville.
host_about: My husband and I are originally from Michigan. We came to Asheville after living on our sail boat in the Caribbean for a few years. Dick still sails, RC sailboats, on the local lake and I am a painter and jewelry artist. Living in Asheville feeds my creative soul. Although, living in  Asheville is a long way from the sea and family we would never live anywhere else. Even after 24 years living here is still new, fresh and exciting to us. We spend time exploring new restaurants, galleries and shops and making new friends and enjoying the old. Our motto is "Don't postpone joy."

neighborhood_overview: It is like escaping to the country yet minutes to down town, extremely close access to the BLUE RIDGE PARKWAY, close to the GROVE PARK INN with BEAVER LAKE AND BIRD SANCTUARY for painless exercise less than a two mile drive away. Local organic food and great restaurants in the neighborhood...
notes: Asheville is a great little city, lively and fun, clean and colorful.  To be able to get-away and feel at home with a kitchen etc makes the stay so much more enjoyable.
transit: Is easy with a car and possible with cabs, UBER and buses.  Once in town, you can walk the entire downtown area.
host_about: I like putting people and environments together and have converted my art studio to a rental cottage to do just that.  Since graduating from Carnegie Mellon as a painter, A LONG TIME AGO, I have had many creative occupations including theater, film, interior design and teaching. A strong desire to share the property that my husband and I have sculpted together for 15 years has led to the conversion of a free standing art studio to RACK FOCUS COTTAGE  (304379). The need for a 3 BR led to the renovation of RACK FOCUS (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)) . Because this property is right across the street from the cottage, its guests can easily share the wooded walk, creek sitting,meadow and fire pit of the park-like setting of the cottage. Similarly furnished and appointed it is ideal for larger groups. We love to travel but this is our favorite destination. Make Asheville yours. Stay with us.  Short, extended stay or long term.

space: Friendly, quiet neighborhood great for walking and close to downtown Asheville, the Grove Park Inn, UNCA and yoga studios. neighborhood_overview: In a wooded setting convenient to downtown, north Asheville has its own distinctive culture and feel. In addition to being very near the Grove Park Inn, we are also close to UNC-Asheville, the governor's western residence and a little used entrance to the Blue Ridge parkway. Many enjoy walking and biking on our neighborhood roads and our dog is always eager to accompany you if you wish!
notes: Coffee/tea and fruit is included with the room rate. Gluten and dairy free breakfast is available on request for $10 up-charge per person.
host_about: Easy-going and considerate, I have  two children in college and teach Buddhism and Yoga worldviews at the University of North Carolina, Asheville Osher Lifelong Learning Institute. I grew up in the south, lived in Japan as a Zen monk, have traveled extensively in Europe and Asia, attended grad school at Stanford and managed a business at Palo Alto, CA. I've lived at Asheville for 14 years, know the city and region well and enjoy assisting guests in planning their dining, sightseeing and recreation. Hosting guests runs deep in my family, as my grandparents opened their large house as a bed and breakfast for many years.

name: Fabulous Studio 10 min to downtown!
summary: This basement studio apartment is only a ten minute drive to downtown Asheville. Owned and newly renovated by local artistic welder/blacksmith Callie Warner, this place has so much charm you might want to never leave! Comfortable scale. Views
space: The house sits at the end of a cup-de-sac. The upstairs is also on AirBnB so may be occupied the same dates as downstairs, but the privacy of each is great. The house sits on a lot of land and feels very private. Yet, you can walk to Beaver Lake in fifteen minutes and walk around the lake and back for a good 4 mile jaunt.

I'll be there for you as much as you need me to be but I like to stay pretty behind the scenes. Please do feel free to text me with questions. Since I grew up on Cherry Lane, in the house next door, I have many fond and magical memories. Today, it still holds that magic. It's a family centered neighborhood and
neighborhood_overview: Since I grew up on Cherry Lane, in the house next door, I have many fond and magical memories. Today, it still holds that magic. It's a family centered neighborhood and folks appreciate slow driving on Cherry Lane's small street as there are kids who actually play outside!  My grandparents bought the three acres in 1945 because a double rainbow hung over the eastern view. 10 Cherry Lane was where they lived until my family moved in with them. Four kids and two parents living in the upstairs at 10 had my grandparents moving quickly to build their dream house.
notes: There is a full sized mattress that is kept in the owners closet downstairs that can be pulled out for a third person. There is also a queen sized blow up mattress that, if not in use by upstairs tenants, may be brought down for you to use as well. $25 will be added for each additional person over allowed two for downstairs. There is also a full kitchen with a coffee maker, coffee machine, full size refrigerator, and a four burner stove and oven. Outside is a small grill.
transit: There is a bus route right at the entrance to the neighborhood. By car, you can turn left out of Cherry Lane and take an immediate left at the light, drive to the bottom of the hill, take a left and follow the River Road to 12 Bones, Bywater Bar, the River Arts District, and many other spots along the river. You can also take the River Road to Broadway, which will lead you straight to town. Or, you can take 19-23 and get to town in a flash.

summary: Our apartment is in a remodeled old hotel off a main road in North Asheville. Years ago the hotel was converted into business spaces. We have converted 3 rooms into a big and wonderful apartment for friends and vacationers!
space: A unique and charming lofty space located extremely centrally (only a five minute drive to the center of downtown). We run a candle business right next door, so we're usually around to say 'hello' and give recommendations.
description: Our apartment is in a remodeled old hotel off a main road in North Asheville. Years ago the hotel was converted into business spaces. We have converted 3 rooms into a big and wonderful apartment for friends and vacationers! A unique and charming lofty space located extremely centrally (only a five minute drive to the center of downtown). We run a candle business right next door, so we're usually around to say 'hello' and give recommendations. There are three rooms to the apartment - the bedroom and bathroom, tucked back in the quietest part of the building, which connects to adjoined rooms for the living and dining areas. There is one parking space right in front, and extremely easy parking for additional cars on a quiet neighborhood street next door. We run a wholesale candle company on the other half of the floor, and our home is only one mile away so we're so we're usually around to say hello and give recommendations and always available to stop by if you need something. Of course,
neighborhood_overview: Located in the middle of one of Asheville's main commerce roads, the apartment is about 3/4 miles to the heart of downtown, and within 2 blocks of several of Asheville's finest restaurants and conveniences such as CVS, fast food, you name it!
transit: The location is within minutes of the 240 freeway and as it's located just off the main road, it's very easy to get in and out, either down into town or to any of the freeways in the area.
host_about: We are West Coast transplants, living in beautiful Asheville, NC.  We own a wholesale candle company, and absolutely love good food, craft beer, bluegrass music, hiking with our pups, and getting out to discover fun new adventures.

name: Historic Log Cabin Asheville (3)
summary: The Snuggle Inn lives up to its name providing you with cozy accommodations. This cabin has a small refrigerator, a king bed and sleeps 2 people and is the second cabin on the right as you drive into the Log Cabin Motor Court.
space: The Snuggle Inn cabin is one of 18 beautifully aged historic cabins originally built in the 1930's, part of the Log Cabin Motor Court. The Snuggle Inn lives up to its name providing you with cozy accommodations. This cabin has a small refrigerator, a king bed and sleeps 2 people. Cable TV, wireless broadband, air conditioner, microwave and a coffee maker are provided. Consider sitting back in a 100 year old cabin, feel the charm, feel the history then look it up on the internet with free wireless access.  Today's comforts with yesterday's ambiance, a rustic stopover that time forgot will be a treat you'll long remember.  The quaint town of Weaverville is only 5 miles North and downtown Asheville only 6 miles South.  Great restaurants nearby and the French Broad River only a couple of miles away. Mattress, box spring and pillows are encased in hypoallergenic covers provided by National Allergy.

neighborhood_overview: The Log Cabin Motor Court was originally a place where weary travelers would stop and camp for the night on a blanket of pine needles beneath the tall pine trees.  Next came the log cabins built by locals and travelers as they passed through.  The first cabin built in 1929.  These cabins were used in the filming of Thunder Road with Robert Mitchum and are rich in history.  Come visit and experience the friendliness of the motor court, sit on your porch and chat with your neighbors or relax under the pines with a good book.
notes: The Log Cabin Motor Court is located between I26 and Highway 25, a unique piece of history close to downtown Asheville.
transit: We are only 6 miles from downtown Asheville and 5 miles from Weaverville with I26 above and Hwy 25 at our entrance you will fine us easy to locate and a convenient midway point for all the beauty to see in and around Asheville.  If you would like to take a taxi downtown and leave your car, Uber has been used from our location and is approximately a $20 ride.
host_about: We love Asheville and enjoy exploring other destinations around the world.

neighborhood_overview: Super quiet street, just seconds from the highway, and 5 minutes to Downtown, River Arts District, and West Asheville! My house is also across the street from the French Broad River and has some lovely hiking and nature walks in the area!
notes: Please keep in mind when booking that you are renting the entire house! You will have access to any and all amenities, so please be respectful.  From time to time, there will be guests staying in the Airstream in the driveway.  It is a self contained unit, so there should be no reason why they will need to use the house.  If you'd like to include the Airstream in your booking, please let me know, and we can work out a pricing arrangement that reflects the addition.   I will always do my best to remain as transparent and open as possible to your requests, concerns, and needs.  As well as who will be occupying the Airtsream, if any, during your stay. I ask that you remain respectful of the space, so future guests can enjoy it as well.   And one last thing, I have a dog.  We stay at the house on occasion, so if you have allergies and need me to do some extra cleaning before you arrive, please don't hesitate to ask! He sheds very little, but dog hair has a way of getting all over everythin
transit: Not real familiar with the bus system, but Asheville has one should you need to get around.  If you have a car, we are right down the street from the highway, and you can always call Uber or Lyft, won't cost much! Also, on the off chance I am around, and you need a ride, don't hesitate to ask!

name: Cozy North Asheville Rest Haven
summary: This space is serene and maintains a minimalist living style. The home is  spacious with little to no disturbances from neighbors or other occupants, and is within two miles from the spirited downtown Asheville, and four miles from West Asheville.
space: The space is minimal, clean, warm, and friendly. There are three open windows that let in plenty of sunshine and creates a calming presence.
description: This space is serene and maintains a minimalist living style. The home is  spacious with little to no disturbances from neighbors or other occupants, and is within two miles from the spirited downtown Asheville, and four miles from West Asheville. The space is minimal, clean, warm, and friendly. There are three open windows that let in plenty of sunshine and creates a calming presence. Other than the room and the bathroom, guests will be able to access the the Kitchen, Living Room, and Front/Back Porch. If a washer or dryer is needed, the Community House behind us is available for use. Throughout your stay I will be able to tell you some hot spots in Asheville. If there is anything extra needed that will make your stay more comfortable such as more blankets, or adjusting the heat, I will be more than happy to do so. The Neighborhood is quite Tight Knit. The two houses behind us are close acquaintances and friends of ours. The "Green House" is a clean, hippy Haven I would say. The House
neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood is quite Tight Knit. The two houses behind us are close acquaintances and friends of ours. The "Green House" is a clean, hippy Haven I would say. The House to the right hold a husband and wife who creates SilverMoon Chocolates which can be found in any health conscious store like Whole Foods or various Co-ops. They are also musicians and have an adorable two year daughter and three year old super friendly dog.
notes: We compost and recycle. This is a Vegan Household but guests are more than welcome to cook whatever products they like. We just ask that meat/animal products are not kept out and that this is respected.
transit: The house is about a two-five minute walk from the Bus Stop that goes directly into downtown Asheville. The Bus system is one that does require a bit of planning however since they come about every 15-20 minutes. Downtown is literally just under two miles away so the walk or drive is not too strenuous. The house is right off of Merimon which is a fairly busy, and well lit road. Merimon has a fabulous Vegan and 90% organic restaurant called "Plant", and some other restaurants that are some good hang out spots that are super convenient for getting around. West Asheville is a great area too. It is about 8 minutes away and is off of the highway so guests would  most likely prefer to drive, but it is worth checking out.
host_about:
I am a personal assistant for a community and health based organization known as "The Spot", located in downtown Asheville. This group of people I am working with are tight knit and trustworthy and I am here to help them, as they are helping me with my personal goals. I wish to further my self and community taught education in Women's/Human studies and Holistic Health. I am physically active and enjoy exercise and participating in competitive sports. I enjoy a city life but also a rural one which is why Asheville has been a perfect place for myself. 
 I require respect and care from the people looking to share my space. If you have any other questions for me and this space call my number or email provided.

I am newly retired after many years of diverse professions.  I am now enjoying tennis, hiking, classes at UNCA, book club, yoga, entertaining (love to cook and bake), volunteering for the literacy council. Words to live by: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it."

space: The Large Bedroom (with Private Bath) is light and bright, and newly furnished.  Windows overlook abundant nature everywhere.  Very peaceful, yet minutes from downtown, with bus transportation close too.   HOT TUB available too.  Easy walk to  Beaver Lake. Private Drive so no traffic, with only 5 houses on street.  Truly one of a Kind setting.

Given that I work in Real Estate, I do know the area very well and can share a
neighborhood_overview: This is a special area for accessibility to popular Beaver Lake and nearby restaurants and UNCA.   Friendly neighborhood with many people walking and running.  A very popular donation based YOGA studio is a half mile away.
notes: I do have one older indoor/outdoor friendly cat.  Please consider this when making your reservation.  Pets of any kind ARE NOT OK, sorry.

host_about: I like to mix and mingle with all types and ages of people and sharing stories of life in general.  My home is my retreat and now I want to share it with others.  I've lived many places in the US, love to travel and like music of all kinds, especially funk, salsa and jazz.  I love introducing people to Asheville and know it well.  I moved here from San Francisco and know you will enjoy your time here too.  I'm open to sharing a glass of wine or tea on my deck after you've enjoyed your day if you'd like - and will respect your privacy too, as you do mine.  Let the magic happen!

neighborhood_overview: The Log Cabin Motor Court was originally a place where weary travelers would stop and camp for the night on a blanket of pine needles beneath the tall pine trees.  Next came the log cabins built by locals and travelers as they passed through.  The first cabin built in 1929.  These cabins were used in the filming of Thunder Road with Robert Mitchum and are rich in history.  Come visit and experience the friendliness of the motor court, sit on your porch and chat with your neighbors or relax under the pines with a good book.
notes: The Log Cabin Motor Court is located between I26 and Highway 25, a unique piece of history close to downtown Asheville.
transit: We are only 6 miles from downtown Asheville and 5 miles from Weaverville with I26 above and Hwy 25 at our entrance you will fine us easy to locate and a convenient midway point for all the beauty to see in and around Asheville.  If you would like to take a taxi downtown and leave your car, Uber has been used from our location and is approximately a $20 ride.

name: Skylight Suite 7mins. from downtown
summary: A bright and spacious apartment on the top level of our home.  It has it's own parking, entrance, and deck. It shares a wall with our home and family, and you may hear the sounds of our children playing. It's perfect for a single person wanting a quiet getaway, taking a yoga training, or in town for business. Just minutes from downtown Asheville, close to local yoga studios, shops and restaurants. You will feel like you are out of the busyness of the city on our quiet country road in Woodfin.
space: Our apartment consists of a living room with high ceilings and skylights.  The bedroom is cozy and quiet.  It has a private bathroom with a shower.  The kitchen has a sink, small fridge, toaster oven, microwave, dishes.  We keep the space very clean.

You will have the whole apartment to yourself. Includes a private deck and parking space. We are home in the evenings and weekends, and will give you as much privacy as you wish.  We are always available for any questions you may have. Our neighborhoo
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is beautiful and quiet.  It's a country road that dead ends, so we only have local traffic.  Lots of wildlife, trees, and birds. Walking distance to restaurants. Minutes away from stores, schools, yoga studios, YMCA, parks and lakes. 15 minute drive to Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: The apartment is in our home, and you are likely to hear us from the living room (of the apartment) when we are home.  This space is most ideal for 1-2 people.  Children welcome upon request.  Please contact us on the day before or of your arrival to get the door code.
transit: The interstate entrance is less that a mile from our home.  Within minutes you can be in any part of town, and with 15 minutes onto the Blue Ridge Parkway.  We are close to lakes, rivers, parks, and recreation.
host_about:
We have lived in Asheville with our two daughters Sofia and Rosalina for the past six years.  We moved here from Big Sur, California, where we worked and taught massage and yoga at the Esalen Institute.  
We own Still Point Wellness, unique spa in downtown Asheville where we offer Esalen massage, salt water floatation, and somatic psychotherapy ((URL HIDDEN)  We also teach massage and bodywork locally and internationally.
We value friends, family, community, and healthy living.  
We are grateful to be able to share our little piece of paradise with you.

name: Studio at Green Oaks Community
summary: The Studio is a convenient haven to stay at while exploring A'ville area. Downtown is 10 min. away by Riverside or Xway. Yummy dining, dancing, Arts District, clubs, cultural events, hiking, tubing & more are all super close to our secure 5 1/2 ac.
space: Green Oaks Studio is a perfect place to stay while you explore Asheville. Only 5 min. walk to the French Broad River and a 10 min. bike ride to downtown Asheville. Health food stores, dining, dancing, Arts District are all close by. The studio is self contained with a kitchenette, shower, toliet & small deck.  Coffeemaker, fridge, convection oven and essentials are provided. We have a community laundry room open to you too. Hey if you like you can even rent a solar electric ELF we have to get around in. It's a 1 person vehicle. We have over 5 acres with some trails. The gardens and pagoda are shared by the other 4 houses on the land and you! We're glad to guide you in your endeavors around Asheville. Maps and current happenings in the area will be waiting for you. We like our guests to have as much quiet and privacy as they like. You can contact us anytime if you need anything or have questions. Our location is uniquely located and is a wildlife haven. The best kept secret of Asheville

neighborhood_overview: Welcome To Asheville Asheville is a very special city; a jewel in the heart of the mountains of western North Carolina and one of the most the most progressive cities in the south. It has been called the Sedona of the east because of it's spiritual energy and the San Francisco of the East because of it's vibrant diversity and cultural life. These links will help you to get to know Asheville better.   Official Asheville Tourism Site (URL HIDDEN)   Asheville, NC. Travel Guide (URL HIDDEN)   Cosmic Buffet (URL HIDDEN)

host_about: I moved to Asheville in 1980 and love it here. I started the first costume company here …then spent 14 yrs co-founding a large intentional community called Earthaven Eco-village, outside of A'ville ….followed by living a decade in India. My current passions are singing, writing, dancing, gardening & eco-spirit activism. Recently I've been loving creating nurturing fun spaces to live in.

space: This unit is located in the Heart of Historic Biltmore Village within steps of oodles of shopping and dining options.  It is brand new in 2016 and has all the amenities for a truly enjoyable stay.  Parking is free in the Village and should not be a problem before noon or after 5pm.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is the Village developed by  Frederick Law Olmsted in the early 1900s for the workers that built The Biltmore estate.  The Village was designed for everything the Villagers needed and boasts that same feel today with many of the original cottages.
transit: There is a hop on hop off trolley that picks up one block from entrance and takes you to all the pertinent sites in AVL, the unit is also across the street from the public bus stop, but one can walk to the 2.2 miles to downtown if desired.  Free Public Parking is prevalent with the exception of noon to 5p on the weekends.

name: Asheville Apt/Suite w/ Fireplace
summary: A private entry, 4-star quality studio apartment set on a heavily wooded acre lot in a quiet neighborhood located minutes away from all Asheville area attractions like Biltmore Estate and the historic downtown area home to restaurants, and shopping.
space: Over 400 sq. ft. bedroom suite with private bath and fireplace. Large secure off street car port. Two miles to Blue Ridge Parkway or ten minutes to either Biltmore Estate or Downtown Asheville. Property is in a quiet neighborhood. This home is ideally situated for those wishing to explore the Blue Ridge Pkwy or the small urban character of "the Paris of the South" better know as Asheville.  A private secure entrance looks out to a forested garden with views of wild turkeys feeding in the morning and the occasional mama bear and cubs passing through during the night.  Half-mile down the mountain from the property are restaurants, grocery, pharmacy and gas stations. Asheville mall, theaters and more shopping are minutes away and easily accessible. A left turn out of the subdivision and 20 twisty and picturesque miles through the canyon are Lake Lure and Chimney Rock Park. Downtown Asheville provides a wide variety of dining options, along with live music venues, and shopping to suit ever

name: The Cloister
space: Airbnb gives the room to the first person who books it, there may be several people asking for the same dates. Don't miss your chance! I also list "The Keep" and "Studio 54" on airbnb. Comfortable clean shared home in historic Kenilworth neighborhood with off-street parking. Right in the middle of  wonderful Asheville. Bedroom with  shared bath and single bed. Use of kitchen including cabinet space for your groceries. Wi-fi is available of course. Enjoy morning coffee on the deck watching the birds.   We have an assortment of interesting games, big screen for DVD and roku. Fenced yard great for dogs, neighborhood great for walking dogs. We welcome dogs who are friendly, well behaved and pick up their poop in the yard AND in the neighborhood. What's that, your dog can't scoop poop? But you will? OK that will be fine. host_about:
Loving Asheville!
I enjoy community, domestic life, dancing, vintage stuff, textiles, mountains, rivers, gardens, cats, other people's dogs, adventure, the Caribbean, cooking, eating, games, funky art, funky artists, yard sales, growers' markets, fireflies.
I think about how things work, how systems interconnect, cause and effect. I have million dollar ideas and don't develop them.
I like to have a purpose or a project, can't go somewhere new just to be a tourist. During leisure time I like to read a good book, play Bananagrams or watch something off-beat. 
My hosting style is casual and tidy (I know, it's an enigma). Come in, make yourself comfortable, explore the kitchen and commons so you know where to find things. Feel free to turn on the roku box and watch Netflix or Hulu or enjoy Pandora radio. I'm living a busy life but I love to meet new people and connect. I usually get over to the house for a while every day to do chores and check on things.

host_about:
Loving Asheville!
I enjoy community, domestic life, dancing, vintage stuff, textiles, mountains, rivers, gardens, cats, other people's dogs, adventure, the Caribbean, cooking, eating, games, funky art, funky artists, yard sales, growers' markets, fireflies.
I think about how things work, how systems interconnect, cause and effect. I have million dollar ideas and don't develop them.
I like to have a purpose or a project, can't go somewhere new just to be a tourist. During leisure time I like to read a good book, play Bananagrams or watch something off-beat. 
My hosting style is casual and tidy (I know, it's an enigma). Come in, make yourself comfortable, explore the kitchen and commons so you know where to find things. Feel free to turn on the roku box and watch Netflix or Hulu or enjoy Pandora radio. I'm living a busy life but I love to meet new people and connect. I usually get over to the house for a while every day to do chores and check on things.

name: Convenient Biltmore/Downtown home
summary: This home is located 2.5miles from Downtown (6-10$ Uber ride) ,walking distance to shopping in Biltmore Village and Catawba/ French broad Brewing. 0.5 mile from Biltmore House entrance, also great for guests going to shows at Orange Peel
space: Private cozy space with two rooms available if needed. You will have a private bathroom, with access to half bath downstairs. There is a loft with printer and desk available if needed. We are very relaxed and easy going people, feel free to come and go as you please whether it's early or late. We grew up here in Asheville and are very familiar with the nightlife and things to do ie: good dining, breweries,  mountain biking, hiking, floating the river, and many other things we can recommend. We venture downtown frequently on weekend evenings and guests are welcome to join if they want. We love entertaining and good conversation. We have two small dogs that are just as accommodating as we are. They don't bark or shed and they love getting pets and attention!

name: Cozy bed/bath close to Biltmore
summary: Comfortable queen size bedroom and separate private bathroom. We are just a few minutes away from the Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge parkway, breweries and more. Homestay permit holder and off street parking provided.
space: Comfortable queen size bedroom with separated private bathroom. Bedroom is looking out beautiful trees and creek. Located in a safe and quiet family neighborhood within a mile to the Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge parkway, Hi Wire Brewery, Catawba and Asheville mall etc. Everything is within an easy drive. The bedroom has a comfortable queen size bed, a writing desk with a chair, a bedside table, and a large closet. Your bathroom has a bathtub and a shower head.  Yare welcome to hang out anywhere else in the house with us and our two French bulldogs. Chill in the yard, enjoy cup of tea/coffee in the sunroom or make your meals in a fully equipped kitchen. You will also have access to the back deck, backyard, and main floor of the house, which includes a living room, kitchen, dining room, and sun room. Our house has been properly inspected and a homestay permit is issued. My husband works from a home office so someone will likely always be around, or at least nearby, should you need anythin

name: Charming room w/bath, historic area
summary: Beautiful 100-yr-old Dutch Colonial home. Luxurious master suite w/ queen size bed, en suite bath w/ jacuzzi tub. Quiet, close to Biltmore Estate & downtown. Eclectic art collection. Outdoor patios. WiFi. LGBTQ friendly. Sorry, no pets, we have cats.
space: Your 2nd floor suite is quiet, clean and comfortable with nightstands and reading lamps on either side of the queen-size bed and plenty of dresser space. The adjoining private bath features a jacuzzi tub, which is wonderful after a day of hiking the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains that surround Asheville. We are conveniently located in a beautifully treed, historic Asheville neighborhood called "Kenilworth".  Very close to Biltmore Village (10-minute walk) and downtown Asheville (20-minute walk). Our outdoor patios (1 with sun, 1 with shade) are soothing and perfect for sipping wine or iced tea.  Colorful, eclectic house with intriguing art collection, perfect for relaxing!  Note: There are some outdoor and indoor stairs to navigate. (If you have knee/ankle problems, this may not be the right choice for you.)

Note: There are some outdoor and indoor stairs to navigate. (If yo
neighborhood_overview: GREAT LOCATION! The 100-year-old neighborhood is beautifully treed with a park just across the street and plenty of historic homes. 20-minute walk to downtown Asheville. 10-minute walk to Biltmore Village & the entrance to The Biltmore House. 5-minute walk to the Kenilworth Inn. Chiles Mansion is just five blocks away. 15-minute walk to the Asheville History Center in the Smith-McDowell House. If you like baseball, McCormick Field is just a 15-minute walk.  The Tobacco Barn and other fun antique malls are also nearby.
notes: Note: There are some outdoor and indoor stairs to navigate. (If you have knee/ankle problems, this may not be the right choice for you.)    We provide coffee and tea and a light continental breakfast (self-serve fruit and English muffins) in the morning. Please let us know if you require milk or cream for your coffee. We can recommend some wonderful breakfast or brunch spots in Asheville. THANKS!
transit: During the day, you can walk to several areas. There are some hills involved and some areas of traffic, so you can expect a moderate level of exertion. You can also get around by car, public bus (there's a stop in front of the house), as well as plenty of taxis and Asheville now has Uber.
host_about: Hi!  I manage the admin for my dear friends, who own this beautiful house. I will be your primary point of contact, so feel free to contact me with questions. We are happy to accommodate you, whether you desire a very independent stay, or you'd like some helpful advice on where to go/what to do around Asheville. We know ALL the best dining options in town, craft cocktail/brewery spots, and best jazz clubs/musicians. We can recommend hikes in the beautiful mountains surrounding Asheville, and can send you links to great websites with all the trail data.  I'll make sure the space is clean, comfortable for your arrival. (Booking with us, in effect, directly supporting the arts, as the home owners and I include professional musicians, actors, writers and artists!)

space: The space is large, clean and fairly new. neighborhood_overview: I love four things about my neighborhood: Biltmore Village, Corner Kitchen (President Obama favorite) and Catawba brewing within walking distance AND The Biltmore Estate practically across the street-sweet! .Acess to four Yoga studios within 1 -1/3 mi. also Highlands Brewing,  Biscuit Head ,  Wicked Weed and Catawba  Beer Brewing Company-which is on the end of my street and has live bands and is within walking distance.  'Plank' a gym, is right there, too. When I leave my driveway, I am over at the Biltmore Estate in about 4 minutes.  I loop past McDonald's and there it is after the charming Biltmore Village with countless shops. I am closer to the Biltmore Estate than anything and there is so much to do over there from Antler Hill Village with Grape stomping and Friday After Five where the party begins with a great free band.   Wish that I could do instant book, but with family and friends visiting Asheville,  I only book up to a week ahead of time and usually only for up to four nigh
notes: Asheville has tons to do and is a fun destination.  Ask about special weekly rates, especially in low season!  Even in summer, staying 5 days or more I may be able to offer a great deal...Don't mind late night guests who go on 'beer crawls', and need a ride home either.  Play it safe, stay here and request a ride ( basically, though-you must call me before 12 midnight, because I cease rides by 1 am at the latest due to early morning work; so sorry.  Gas grill, outdoor table and chairs are all guest friendly for a relaxing dinner in-
transit: It is easy to get to Catawba Brewery (one block) Biltmore Estate, 1/2 mile, Wendy's, ,McDonald's, Moe's, and lots of great eateries within 1 mile plus 1-3/4 mile to Wicked Weed, Orange Peel ,La Zoom Comedy Bus Tour and more downtown.
host_about:
Hi to all,
I am a former New Yorker and Floridian who ended up in Asheville.  We picked this place for its very close vicinity to downtown.  This place is fairly new (built in 2007) and has location, location, location.   We are a stones throw from the Biltmore Estate, Orange Peel and Catawba Brewery where most of the tours like Ghost Tour Trolley (Grey Line) depart.  We are also next to McDonald's, Wendy's, Long John Silver's, The Bohemian, T.G.I.Friday's, The shops in Biltmore Village, all within walking distance.  I went to school for cooking, so there may be a New York Cheesecake, Key Lime Pie, Hummingbird cake, Berry tart, or scones awaiting you.  I love downtown and am offering free rides into and out of the city which saves you about $9.- 12. per trip.  Most of the cool tours like La Zoom take off across from the Orange Peel which is about a mile and a quarter from my location.
I will pick up from the Asheville Airport, too, which is about 25 minutes from the house.  No transport from Greenville or Charlotte.   
Asheville is the coolest place offering HungerGames Tours, Zip lines, a new Bikebar that was seen on Las Vegas 'Trip Flip' and is nothing short of hilarious, downtown walking ghost tours, a Ghost Tour trolley, The Biltmore Estate, Grove Park, Wicked Weed, and so many places to eat, not to mention go out and explore.
I look forward to meeting you and you can consider me your 'concierge and chauffer' for your holiday to Asheville. This is one trip that will make you consider moving here.   I flew down from New York to see Rent, and moved here shortly after.  I am a true Sagittarian and enjoy meeting fellow wanderers...lol...See you soon..

host_about: I love this town of Asheville, NC!  I teach children during the day and can be found out on the trails, at a local brewery, or relaxing by the river on most evenings and weekends.  I enjoy live music and almost always have my dancing shoes on.  I'm happy to share my love for this town with others!  I am new to Airbnb , which is why I don't have any reviews!  It's a great space, come see for yourself!

name: Biltmore Village Inn
summary: An elegant seven-bedroom Queen Anne Victorian built in 1892, the Biltmore Village Inn is a picturesque getaway tucked away on a quiet historic street. Just a short four-block walk to fine shops and restaurants. The closest inn to the Biltmore Estate.
space: We're among some of the youngest BnB hosts in Asheville, which makes us a great fit for first time BnB travelers!  We're located on top of a hill in Biltmore Village with mountain views, a hammock and outdoor fire pit.  Located just two miles from downtown, you're close to everything going on but feel far away from the City when back at the Inn.  Best of both worlds!
description: An elegant seven-bedroom Queen Anne Victorian built in 1892, the Biltmore Village Inn is a picturesque getaway tucked away on a quiet historic street. Just a short four-block walk to fine shops and restaurants. The closest inn to the Biltmore Estate. We're located on top of a hill in Biltmore Village with mountain views, a hammock and outdoor fire pit.  Located just two miles from downtown, you're close to everything going on but feel far away from the City when back at the Inn.  Best of both worlds! In addition to your own luxurious room and bathroom, you'll also be able to enjoy our dining room, guest pantry, parlor, second floor turret sitting table, wrap-around porch and pergola seating area with fire pit. We're in the office from 10-6 pm everyday helping to make sure you have a fabulous time in Asheville.  We like to consider ourselves experts on local food and attrac
neighborhood_overview: Everything located in Historic Biltmore Village is great and in walking distance!
notes: Included in your stay is a gourmet breakfast each morning and social hour each evening!  These are perfect times to interact with other guests visiting Asheville.
transit: Asheville has terrible public transportation so we advise having your own vehicle to get around with.  For daytime tours of our beautiful City, hop on a trolley with a pick-up location just minutes away from the Inn or catch a quick 5 minute ride to downtown from UBER if you're hitting up one of our fabulous breweries.

name: Feels like ur own apart. / central!
summary: Natural rainbow prisms, breathtaking room, connected semi-private kitchen/livingroom.  Central location, rocking chair porch, mins away from anything you need, traveler's favorite sites. Second queen temp bed optional. Massages/pet-sitting available.
space: Second floor large room in home with a pristine new feel.  You go up the stair and through a new kitchen and living area that is connected to your room.
description: Natural rainbow prisms, breathtaking room, connected semi-private kitchen/livingroom.  Central location, rocking chair porch, mins away from anything you need, traveler's favorite sites. Second queen temp bed optional. Massages/pet-sitting available. Second floor large room in home with a pristine new feel.  You go up the stair and through a new kitchen and living area that is connected to your room. Feel like you are arriving to your own home up a small set of stairs through a rocking chair porch.  The entrance and bath will be shared with another rental room, but living quarters are well separated.  As you enter the house, a privacy curtain separates your entrance from the hosts' receiving room, and is fully separated from the rest of host's daily living area.  You will go up a flight of beautiful stairs with a chandelier to your suite.  A fenced back yard and pet-sitting as an addition is an option for well behaved pets. We will respect your privacy, but if you would like some point
neighborhood_overview: This is an eclectic neighborhood in a central location close to everything that Asheville has to offer!  We are right off of 74, one exit away from Whole Foods, the Blue Ridge parkway, the Shoji hot tubs, the Mall, and 10 minutes from downtown Asheville.  On our exit you can visit the Nature Center, Highland Brewing Company, all sorts of convenient shopping and food stops, yet feel tucked away in a semi-private and wooded home.  We are on the edge of the neighborhood, without any residential neighbors that see into our yard.  We are walking distance to the library, convenience store, public park, and close to local favorites like Brother Wolf, The Regeneration Station, The Toy Boat, and other great neighborhood gems.
notes: I have ten years experience as a licensed massage therapist and we can set up in room massages!  My daughter enjoys pet sitting, her and our gentle border collie Bootsie are lots of fun.  Please only well behaved generally quiet animals, as there are other guest down the hall.  Also, Friday and Saturday nights can be lively sounding, as we are on the edge of a neighborhood near local happenings, but our yard is bordered by a very large partly wooded lot.
host_about: Hi!  I hope you visit!  I am currently studying as a graduate student of Chinese Medicine.  I am a massage therapist and offer massages to guests.  Yoga and meditation is a passion, and I keep an active and wholesome lifestyle.  I am pretty new to Asheville myself, so exploring the city is something I hope to do also!

name: Blue Ridge Parkway Arts'n Crafts!
summary: This Arts 'n Crafts inspired retreat was created to feel peaceful, warm, cozy, and quiet.  Everyone who visits comments on the perfect feel of the space.  It's literally five minutes from everything!  I adore children but this is for adults only.
space: Beautiful Arts 'n Crafts Style Cottage! I have a brand new, furnished, beautiful 1 bedroom private house with 1 full bath for adults only.  There is also a futon in the loft space for 2 adult guests if needed. Why choose my space: --The "feel" of the space is one of peaceful quiet and thoughtful design.  You will feel it as soon as you walk in. --Everything is new, cozy and comfortable. --Along with being a writer, providing an exceptional guest experience is part of my livelihood.  I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people, getting them acquainted with the beauty and fun of Asheville, and providing any level of connection with which you are comfortable.  I live 5 houses up the road so I'm as available as you need me to be.  I can check in daily through text/email/phone or step back completely until you ask for assistance.   --You can walk to the Blue Ridge Parkway and hike the Mountain to Sea trail every morning. --The house is exactly 6.5 miles (7 minutes) from all the downtown restauran
description: This Arts 'n Crafts inspired retreat was created to feel peaceful, warm, cozy, and quiet.  Everyone who visits comments on the perfect feel of the space.  It's literally five minutes from everything!  I adore children but this is for adults only. Beautiful Arts 'n Crafts Style Cottage! I have a brand new, furnished, beautiful 1 bedroom private house with 1 full bath for adults only.  There is also a futon in the loft space for 2 adult guests if needed. Why choose my space: --The "feel" of the space is one of peaceful quiet and thoughtful design.  You will feel it as soon as you walk in. --Everything is new, cozy and comfortable. --Along with being a writer, providing an exceptional guest experience is part of my livelihood.  I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people, getting them acquainted with the beauty and fun of Asheville, and providing any level of connection with which you are comfortable.  I live 5 houses up the road so I'm as available as you need me to be.  I can check in daily t
notes: There is a private in-law unit in the back and under the loft area that is also rented so please respect each other's space.  As with any space located above an upstairs space, the folks below may hear your foot traffic.  I ask guests to keep shoes downstairs so that footsteps are light.  Most people who visit Asheville tend to be out and about all day and go to bed at a reasonable hour so it's usually not an issue.  Everyone has been very gracious and appreciative of each other in this hosting community.  I'm lucky to be a part of it! I (the owner/host) live five houses up the street and I'm always available.
transit: There is no public transportation nearby.  Taking Uber downtown is about a $15-20 ride according to the estimation on their website.
host_about:
Welcome to Asheville!  Relax and enjoy my cozy place!  

I moved to Asheville eight years ago from San Francisco and have never looked back.  I grew up in the South and missed being among the dogwoods, thunderstorms and BBQ!  I have traveled the world and have never known a place more friendly and creative.  I'm a writer, musician, teacher, traveler and hiker...from the John Muir Trail to the Annapurnas and now the Blue Ridge.  

Please come cozy up in my place and stay awhile!

summary: A quiet getaway and still close to downtown and west Asheville. The cottage is truly a 3-dimensional piece of art. It is not a place you will forget. Guests have said it's adorable, romantic, European and unique. Quiet street and family neighborhood.
space: Unique two story cottage built by two designers in West Asheville. Interior walls are american clay plaster. There is a full kitchen, bedroom with queen bed, and bathroom with shower. Washer and dryer are available on property. There is a small reading loft above the breakfast area that could sleep a guest if needed. There is a bathtub outside for hot or cool baths.

I am an artist, teacher, hair stylist and mother of a beautiful 11 year old daughter, Olive. I love to travel, do yoga, swim, make art and eat good food. Asheville will be my home base as long as Olive is in school.  We love to travel and the last two summers we have camped along the Pacific Coast Highway, done airbnb in Santa Fe, and the camped on Oregon coast. 

At home Olive is very  in to dance and friends and I like to spend time with my wonderful artist/writer boyfriend Willy. 

We love our home and the ability to hop  downtown and the river walk.... It's a wonderland.   I consider myself a relaxed and reliable host. I enjoy meeting new guests, but also respect privacy.  Hope you enjoy your stay.

name: Studio next to dwntn and Biltmore
summary: Our home is located on the south side of downtown between Biltmore Village and downtown Asheville.  It is a five minute drive to downtown, and 2 minutes to Biltmore Village and the entrance to Biltmore Estate. City bus stop close by too.
space: A wonderful homestay in a great Spanish Colonial Revival home in the Kenilworth Neighborhood.  The rental space is a studio only and is part of the main house.   Our home is located on the south side of downtown between Biltmore Village and downtown Asheville.  It is a five minute drive to downtown, and 2 minutes to Biltmore Village and the entrance to Biltmore Estate. The studio is very clean and has a full bathroom with shower, and 1 comfy queen size bed.  There is a dining area, and sitting area with flat screen tv, premium channel cable package, and wireless internet. Linens and towels are provided.   There is private off-street parking with easy access to the studio through our garden.  There is a bus stop within walking distance.  There is no A/C but who needs that in the mountains?  The studio stays cool during the day.  There are large windows that allow for a cross breeze through the studio.  There is a ceiling fan if needed, and we do have hot water radiators to keep you warm

name: The Cottage on Parkway Loop
space: Whether you are planning a vacation to our beautiful town, or traveling for business, The Cottage on Parkway Loop offers you a comfortably elegant alternative to sterile hotel rooms. At 600 sq ft the recently renovated Cottage has a lot to offer for its diminutive size.  Downstairs are the living room, kitchen, and dining areas.  A full bath with claw-foot tub and laundry adjoins the living room. Upstairs is the master bedroom with king- sized bed and half bath. This light filled room is tucked into a dormer with large windows looking out into a canopy of trees.  A small nook entices you to stay and read a while.    The fully equipped custom kitchen has a dishwasher, stove, microwave, and refrigerator.  Other amenities include: cable TV, DVD player, high speed and wireless Internet connections, air-conditioning, and washer-dryer.   The Cottage on Parkway Loop is located in a quiet residential neighborhood just one mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway and ten minutes from downtown Asheville

name: Forest Hill Bungalow
summary: Our home is located in the historic Kenilworth neighborhood in Asheville, NC, located minutes from downtown and Biltmore Village.  The spacious two bedroom, one bath apartment for rent is located in the upstairs portion of our 1917 bungalow.
space: Our home is located in the historic Kenilworth neighborhood located minutes from downtown and Biltmore Village.  The upstairs space available for rent is a two bedroom, one bath spacious apartment located in the upstairs portion of our 1917 bungalow.   The space is a perfect size for two adults with or without children. Occupancy is limited to four adults, however children under the age of 12 are allowed free of charge.  We are family friendly and welcome LGBT guests. The apartment has a private separate entrance from the rest of the home.  We strive to keep our apartment clean and clutter free.   There is a full bathroom with shower and bath, two bedrooms with one queen and one full bed and a kitchen with a small dining area.  We do not have cable tv, but do have wireless internet and a flat screen tv with an apple tv equipped with netflix.   A private drive is provided that can easily fit at least two vehicles.    We were both born in North Carolina and have been in the Asheville are

We were both born in North Carolina and have been in the Asheville are
neighborhood_overview: Kenilworth is a thriving urban neighborhood in Asheville, with homes constructed varying from small Arts and Crafts cottages to significant  Spanish revival estates. It is within walking distance to Biltmore Village and the thriving downtown area.
notes: Towels and linens are provided along with basic kitchen supplies for cooking meals. Toilet paper and paper towels are also provided to guests.  Please let us know if there is a special request you have prior to your visit and we will do our best to accommodate you!
transit: Kenilworth is centrally located between downtown, Biltmore Village and Tunnel Road.  The apartment is within 2 miles of downtown and several great restaurants and coffee shops.  The neighborhood is quite hilly and does not have many sidewalks, but is still very assessable to downtown and the biltmore village area by way of car, bike or foot.  The city operated bus stops are less than a quarter of a mile away from the apartment.
host_about: We are a family with small children that love living in the Asheville area.  Both my husband and I were born in North Carolina and have always been especially drawn to the western portion of the state.  We love camping, fishing, biking, hiking and being on the water.  In addition to loving the outdoors, we also frequent the areas unique shops and independent restaurants and would love to share our recommendations with our guests!

notes: I just remodeled , and opened my apt. for Vacation rental. The next phase is working on an outside space. At the moment, all I can offer is some seating on my porch.
transit: You can reach the Asheville Bus Route by walking a mile up the street.
host_about: A newbie to hosting a vacation apt. Looking forward to meeting all kinds of people, from all over. I would describe myself as easygoing . Hoping to make friends, and guiding my visitors to all that Asheville has to offer. I do work during the day, so many times I can't get online till after 3pm. So please be patient with me. I will try to get back to any inquiries a.s.a.p.

name: 20's Bungalow Downtown/Biltmore
summary: Enjoy Asheville as a local! Stay .75 mi to center of downtown (Pack Place), 1 mi to the gates of Biltmore Estate, & 10 min drive to the Blue Ridge Pkwy. Asheville's historic Kenilworth neighborhood puts you in the heart of all that Asheville offers!
space: This is our primary residence, so you will arrive to a fully stocked home on a quiet, friendly street. We invite you to enjoy Asheville as a local! We will leave you a list of all the best local food, activities, and attractions.  Our home is child friendly, as we have a boy and a girl, but not toddler-proofed.  If you are an athlete, let us know and we can help you find running, cycling, swimming groups to suite your needs. We are both adventurers and can also give direction on various rafting, kayacking, zip lining, and wilderness based activities.
description: Enjoy Asheville as a local! Stay .75 mi to center of downtown (Pack Place), 1 mi to the gates of Biltmore Estate, & 10 min drive to the Blue Ridge Pkwy. We invite you to enjoy Asheville as a local! We will leave you a list of all the best local food, activities, and attractions.  Our home is child friendly, as we have a boy and a girl, but not toddler-proofed.  If you are an athlete, let us know and we can help you find running, cycling, swimming groups to suite your needs. We are both adventurers and can also give direction on various rafting, kayacking, zip lining, and wilderness based activities. The only space that is off-limits is the locked storage basement, which has only an outside access. We will be available during your stay. Kenilworth is a historic Asheville neighborhood that w
neighborhood_overview: Kenilworth is a historic Asheville neighborhood that was designed by Olmstead and the first homes built by John Chiles. Our street is primarily arts and crafts bungalows built in the 1920's as homes for the railroad workers. Kenilworth has since seen many building booms and has an eclectic assortment of homes and people. It is truly the neighborhood that most closely resembles Asheville's local culture, with historic Kenilworth Church in the heart of the neighborhood (and at the top of our street). Neighbors are family here and it is not uncommon for neighbors to speak to our guests (and assume you are our family!).
notes: Master Suite - King bed, Master bath with stand-alone clawfoot tub, and laundry room attached Bedroom #1 - smaller with full bed. More of a "boy" room Bedroom #2 - larger with a twin bed and nice hide-away trundle. More of a "girl" room. (trundle has the same Serta mattress as the twin) We are happy to leave some toys out for your stay, if you let us know. We have board games and books in the home at all times.
transit: There is an ART (bus) line pick up at the top of our street (~.2 mi). However, Asheville is not very mass transit friendly (unfortunately). In nice weather, we walk to Biltmore Village (~1 mi to the center) or downtown (~.75 mi to the center), but be prepared to walk hills. Additionally, we have a very efficient Uber network here.
host_about: We are a family of 4 that loves adventure! We live in a fantastic place to explore and be outdoors on a daily basis on bike, trail, and water... but we have wonderlust that won't stop calling. We love to travel to places near and far.  We host guests in our personal home when we travel. As hosts, we hope to provide our guests with advice and recommendations that will have them exploring Asheville like a local, all while relaxing in our sweet little home in the best neighborhood in town.  We welcome children and pups because traveling as a family has made our relationships better, and given us priceless memories together.

host_about:
I have traveled extensively, worked in various areas and industries.  My main interest being wellness and hospitality, with a focus on food and fitness,  encompassing the space in which I live, both community and dwelling.  
 My intention is creating value... Honing my human spirit.  I began my love affair with Western North Carolina in 2000.  Its magical, with never ending adventures in nature as well as community cohesion, mixed with diversity. It shines.  I made the decision to make this my home in 2006. I have done much of the renovation work myself, keeping it simple, pleasing to the eye, considering space and comfort.
  I relish all the offerings this area has; hiking, cycling and dipping in those luscious waterfalls. The abundance of food choices available is astounding. I have reverence for the farmers and artisans, passionately working their craft, producing a variety of choices for every palate.
 The Art is everywhere! Their is never ending choices of live music, theatre, and entertainment unique to this area,  a constant reminder of how fortunate I am. Best of all, its the people I love most, always a smile shared amongst strangers in passing.  Come and experience the energy yourself.
Peace Love Freedom

name: Biltmore Little Red House
summary: 1/4 of a mile from the entrance of the Biltmore Estate, our fully renovated 1920's era home (3 bed, 1 bath) is set on a quiet street with easy access to I-40. Less than 2 miles from downtown Asheville. Gourmet kitchen & all the comforts of home.
space: Our bungalow is within walking distance to Historic Biltmore Village with three of the top 20 restaurants in Asheville, several of the finest craft galleries in the region (New Morning Gallery & Southern Highland Craft Gallery) and the tasting rooms for Catawba and French Broad Brewing.  When you stay with us, you will find yourself within a mile of the antique shopping district, a local organic grocery store, and several banks. You're within a 1/4 mile of the Red Trolley stop. Our home is also a couple of miles from the River Arts District and Downtown Asheville.  If you're interested in outdoor activities, we are 3 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway.  Our comfortable home has three bedrooms and one bath.   - Bedroom 1 in the front of the house has a queen-size sleigh bed with armoire and large closet.  - Bedroom 2 (the study) has a full-size leather pull out sofa, desk and leather chair for reading your favourite novel, and a closet  - Bedroom 3 has a queen size sleigh bed with large

host_about:
I was born and raised on a small island in the Mediterranean called Malta. My parents are German and Dutch so therefore I don't look as exotic as I sound. I've been living in Asheville for 11 years. I am a fundraiser by profession. I love to crossfit, hike, eat great food and drink fabulous wine. I'm an avid adventurer; I've been fortunate enough to see a good portion of this world; I've taken several Outward Bound courses. 
I love hosting guests and look forward to hosting you and your family/friends!

summary: Mimi's Cottage, which has 1 bedroom, 2 bathrooms, and sleeping space for 2, is ideal for a couple searching for a romantic escape. Just minutes from Biltmore Village and Blue Ridge Parkway, you'll love this quiet urban setting!
space: Have the ultimate North Carolina getaway by escaping to ‘Mimi's Cottage,' a quaint Asheville vacation rental home. Situated minutes from all the area's most renowned attractions in a quiet, friendly neighborhood, this wonderful cottage is the perfect place for those looking to experience the best of this beautiful region. Nestled amidst well-kept gardens scattered throughout verdant lawns and shaded by lofty 100 year old oak trees, you'll immediately find yourself at ease in this serene setting. Look forward to taking in the dazzling scenery while you unwind on the private wraparound porch's shaded sitting area with a refreshing beverage in-hand. After an eventful day in town, come home and prepare a delicious meal in the fully equipped kitchen, which is complete with all the cooking appliances you'll need to whip up your favorite recipes. neighborhood_overview: When you stay at this exceptional dwelling, located in the middle of the city in a wonderfully walkable neighborhood, you'll be ideally situated to explore everything the area has to offer. ‘Mimi's Cottage' is just 10 minutes from downtown Asheville, where you can enjoy mouthwatering cuisine at local restaurants, visit the local galleries and wander through the charming shops. While you're in the area, you may also choose to explore the nearby breweries or tour the famed Biltmore House in Biltmore Village, just 5 minutes away. Additionally, you'll love spending beautiful North Carolina days admiring beautiful mountain views while cruising down the Blue Ridge Parkway or camping in Great Smoky National Park, where you'll find a bounty of pristine trails - perfect for exploring the region's natural splendor. Regardless of how you choose to spend your time here, you're sure to have a memorable getaway when you stay at this wonderful Asheville vacation rental home!
notes: Key Residence Features: - Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, wireless internet access, outdoor firepit, air conditioning with dual controls, private wraparound porch, soundproofed bedroom, 2 flat screen TVs with cable and DVD players, in-unit washer/dryer, and much more - Delightfully quiet neighborhood setting in an urban location - Minutes from restaurants, renowned attractions, beautiful parks, and more! Bedroom Configuration: - Bedroom: Queen-sized Bed

Outside- screened-in sleeping/yoga room in woods, deck w/ pond, spring-fed plunge pool. There are three rooms upstairs; two with queen beds and one with a king. Downstairs there is an expansive suite with private bath and another queen bed.
space: A designer by trade, I have spent over 10 years (living in &) customizing this home with contemporary finishes and unique details. In this home you will find original art, stylish decor and quality appliances. KITCHEN The updated kitchen boasts concrete counter tops, and acid-washed copper back splashes with a granite island and a propane cook top. LIVING ROOM There are wood floors and high ceilings with a contemporary Scandinavian wood stove it's center piece. The hearth is steel with a cultured stone of coral behind. BEDS There are 3 (new in July 2015) queen-sized beds in the guest bedrooms and one king-sized bed in the master. Pillows and linens (new in July 2015) are provided, and all bedrooms have curtains or blinds, bed-side tables, hangers, trash cans etc. LOUNGE The downstairs offers a 4th bedroom and party space. neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is very QUIET and there is lots of space between the houses. The Blue Ridge Parkway, 40, 240 and 74A are all within 2 miles. The Biltmore Estate, the Asheville Mall, and downtown are all 7-10 mins. away.
notes: The house may not be suitable for some families with young children. The art collection contains a number of nude drawings, paintings and photos, (everything is very tasteful) and there are a number very fragile things in the house, from a gorgeous dark-cherry pool table, and a functioning 1929 slot machine to walnut furniture and white bed spreads. Please mention that you've read this if traveling with kids. The "bog" below the house is a bucolic refuge, filled with the sound of splashing water coming from a drinkable fresh water mountain spring which travels down a 25' piece of split bamboo. There are fish, crayfish, (and giant rocks) in a small pond at the edge of the leaf-shaped deck, and tiki torches for night visits. The driveway is STEEP - as in, streets-of-SF steep. This driveway makes it possible for the house to be only 7 min,. from downtown while still being  so wonderfully private, and completely out of view from the road. When heavy snows are forecast, many people in this
transit: Car required to get around - no businesses are walk-able.

name: The Sweet Pine House sleeps 4
summary: Located in one of Asheville's favorite historic neighborhoods, you are just minutes to either the Biltmore Estate or the heart of downtown, yet when you arrive home you feel far from it all.  Kitchen is fully equipped and ready to go. Linens also included. 1 queen bed, and sleeper couch
space: This one queen bedroom apartment is in a duplex with both units rented as AirBnB units. The cozy first floor unit (the Sweet Pine House) has a queen sleeper couch for extra guests, lots of closet space, a gas fireplace, flat screen TV with an immense collection of movies and board games for your enjoyment. The spacious full bathroom includes a washer and dryer for your convenience right off the living room. The large private bedroom has great lighting, a comfortable queen bed and lots of closet space. There is of course air conditioning but the windows also open for fresh air. The eat-in kitchen was completely gutted and rebuilt in 2009. It includes a microwave, coffee pot, refrigerator, stove top and oven, and of course a dishwasher. All dishes, pots and pans and linens included. There is a lovely patio for your outdoor entertainment with an outside grill and seating for dinner.
