neighborhood_overview: The listing is located in a very desirable downtown neighborhood perfectly situated between the Biltmore Estate (with a Starbucks at the Entrance) just one mile away and downtown restaurants and shopping just one additional mile (a straight shot down Biltmore Avenue). Mission Hospital is walking distance from this rental. The neighborhood has several parks, perfect for families with small children and also boasts the most trees of any downtown Asheville neighborhood.
notes: This unit has off street parking in front of the house on our side of the street. It can comfortably accommodate two cars. The driveway is reserved for the up stairs unit. As you enter the patio and outdoor seating is for your use. There is a patio within the fenced in back yard for the upstairs tenant's use.
transit: From your Asheville house you will need to bike or drive to your desired destinations. We have left a binder in the unit to provide you with the basic orientation and lay of the land! Feel free to take an Asheville Map and keep it with your for your adventures. Uber taxi is available and can get you downtown in five minutes or so.
host_about:
Trish and Steph are busy moms raising their five year old son. They lived in this sweet home for 12 years before recently moving north of town and using this now as a rental home. It has been thoughtfully furnished and equipped to make your Asheville visit perfect. Please let us know if we forgot anything!

We run a local theater company and often have shows in production. Season and show information is available in the unit along with coupons for discounted tickets. 

Steph is often acting and directing both which keep her busy. Trish is a nurse midwife who has been delivering babies for twenty years.

name: Close to it all! Pet friendly!
summary: 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom fully equipped home minutes to Biltmore and Downtown
space: Blackberry Cottage is a fully equipped, pet friendly, 3 bedroom and 2 bath home with an eat in kitchen, comfortable living room, deck, washer and dryer and a large yard.  Each bedroom is complete with a comfortable queen bed with new, soft linens. Each bedroom has fresh new paint and new ceiling fans to lull you to sleep. There's plenty of room with full size dressers and closets for each bedroom. You'll find original photography and artwork that the owners have taken or collected through their trips around Asheville in each bedroom and the house.  Spread out in the comfortably furnished living room complete with two leather sofas (the love seat reclines!). name: Cozy ranch house in Asheville, NC
summary: Come stay at Grandma's house! This cozy ranch house has the warm feeling of staying with family, with three full bedrooms and two baths, but is set in a known artistic neighborhood, and is only minutes from downtown Asheville! Enjoy the homey feel while you're livin it up in Asheville!
space: Set in the renowned artistic neighborhood of Kenilworth, there are regular studio strolls around the neighborhood, as well as several parks and plenty of lovely locals. Downtown Asheville, grocery stores, the Biltmore house and the Blue Ridge Parkway are all minutes drive away. Plus, friendly hosts happy to help with recommendations for food and trips!

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very family friendly, in the heart of Asheville, and full of artists! There is a variety of studios in the neighborhood and there are often studio strolls that are free and open to the public.
notes: Pets are allowed with an additional fee of $100 and owners are responsible for any damage. Starting in September we will be charging 200$/night for our fall season fee. Please take note when booking in advance.
transit: Buses stop every half hour at the bus stop at the top of the street and can be used to access all of Asheville for between $1-$5

name: CONVENIENT Pine TreeHouse sleeps 6
summary: This beautiful upper unit of a town home feels like a tree house!  Lots of windows mean sunlight just pours in. Two queen bedrooms with bathrooms. The living room features a queen sleeper sofa and gas fireplace. Convenient to downtown and The Biltmore House. Accommodates two cars in ample driveway.
space: This lovely two bedroom condo has a bathroom in each bedroom. The living room offers an additional sleeper couch and a gas fireplace. Hard wood floors throughout. The kitchen has a vaulted ceiling and is full of light with beautiful terra cotta cement counter tops and stainless steel appliances. Dining room right off the kitchen again with many windows. There is a large walk in closet off the master bedroom with a washer and dryer for your use. All linens provided and the kitchen has many amenities including dishwasher, new refrigerator, microwave, pots and pans etc.  The backyard patio is for your use and has plenty of seating for eating, a grill and a fire pit.

The house is yours, please e
neighborhood_overview: The listing is in a highly desirable downtown Asheville neighborhood perfectly situated just between the Biltmore Estate and the downtown restaurant and shopping district. We are one mile to the entrance of the Biltmore where you can also find the closest Starbucks. One additional mile down Biltmore Avenue will get you to downtown shops, music, and incredible restaurants.
notes: Quiet time is after 11pm. Outside noise after that time might disturb our very friendly neighbors and inside noise might disturb the tenants downstairs. Smoking on the outside patio is fine but we ask you not to smoke in the house. The house easily accommodates 5 adults plus one child or less adults and more children. The space is a little tight with 6 adults.
transit: We are located in a residential neighborhood. There is lots of walking happening in our neighborhood and you might enjoy walking around the block or to a nearby park. To get to the Asheville attractions you will need to ride your bike or take your car. Uber taxi can take you downtown in about five minutes.
host_about:
Trish and Steph are busy moms raising their five year old son. They lived in this sweet home for 12 years before recently moving north of town and using this now as a rental home. It has been thoughtfully furnished and equipped to make your Asheville visit perfect. Please let us know if we forgot anything!

We run a local theater company and often have shows in production. Season and show information is available in the unit along with coupons for discounted tickets. 

Steph is often acting and directing both which keep her busy. Trish is a nurse midwife who has been delivering babies for twenty years.

summary: This apartment has parking for two cars,  2 private ground level entrances- one through the complete kitchen with dishwasher and laundry, the other from the yard filled with giant oak, other trees, and flowers.  Can accomodate up to 6 people.
space: The apartment is in the lower level of our home, with windows only on the West side. There is a portal into the sleeping area with a curtain, but no door. neighborhood_overview: 60 year old low density suburban neighborhood. We have a 4 acre private neighborhood park that fronts US 25, and our house is 3 blocks away. Great neighborhood for walking/jogging.  Restaurants/coffee shop within walking distance.
notes: This is a large house in a quiet, low-density neighborhood.  There are two guest rooms on the main level and a seperate groundlevel apartment below.  For large family gatherings, we can accomodate up to 10 people with advanced planning.
transit: Like most of America, public transportation is minimal. A public bus runs about once an hour between downtown, about 5 miles north,  and the Airport, which is three miles south.
host_about:
2nd room available, can accomodate 4 or more, but can let rooms separately.

75 year old sane and healthy mature man.
Semi Retired Psychologist.
Have pleasant home. Pets welcome on inquiry.
Border Collie mutt, BLUE, 70 pounds, in residence.
I am a registered Democrat because there is no viable party to the left.  I welcome Republicans.
Drink wine moderately.  No Drugs. Do not smoke.
Read: The Nation, NYRB, G & L Review, Asheville Citizen-Times, NYT on Sundays.
Like Movies on DVD. Do not like TV
I speak Despairanto, not listed below.

name: Peace and Quiet Minutes From Town
space: This is a 3 story Green Built home only minutes from the City of Asheville, and Tunnel Rd. Shopping and Whole Foods.  Tucked away in East Ashville, this space offers the quite you seek after a long day of playing in the city, your favorite restaurant or brewery, or being out for the day on your favorite trail or river.  There is plenty of space for the whole family to relax and enjoy time together.

There is plenty of space for the whole family to relax and enjoy time together. You will have mostly full access to the house with the exception on one locked closet and room on the lower level. Just about 9 minutes from Whole Foods and Asheville Mall and 10 minutes to downtown where all the great dining and shopping is. Do to regulations, use of the fireplace is not permitted.

name: The Fern Street Apt near Biltmore
space: Welcome to "Fern Street on the Green," a brand new apartment in a quiet neighborhood in Asheville, NC near the Biltmore Estate. The charming apartment has its own entrance and is on the back lower ground level of a larger home – facing onto a large private greenway-wonderful for bird watching. There is a quiet tenant on the upper level. (Please note that there is an exterior stairway from the parking area to the apartment - well lit with handrail.) Fernie is a monthly rental, beginning the 1st of the month. But from March 13, 2016 it is available for 1 week minimums until April 1 when we'll begin a full month requirement again.  The 500sq foot Fern Street Apartment is located: 1 mile from Biltmore entrance on a quiet street 2 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway 3 miles to downtown Asheville 15 minutes from the Asheville airport And within an easy drive of Warren Wilson College and Black Mountain  There is easy access to Interstate 40 and I-26.  Local bus service is only 2 blocks away. We

transit: There is bus service nearby. Off-street parking for two cars is provided.
host_about:
I'm a people person who loves music. I direct Womansong, a community chorus for women. 

My husband, Peter, builds beautiful houses and just completed this one. Since we live so close to the Biltmore estate, we thought it would be fun to furnish one of our apartments as a short term rental. We love Asheville, and love to see others enjoy all its charms as 'the Paris of the South'.

name: That 70s House
summary: A cool relaxing, renovated space ideal for 2 couples on vacation or a professional on work stay. Convenient location 5 minutes from downtown Asheville and Mission.Well appointed kitchen, large fenced back yard, outdoor living space.Mid-century style.
space: This newly renovated 1937 house is a one level private home.  It has hardwood floors in all rooms but the kitchen and bathrooms. Mid-century furniture and fixtures as well beautiful artwork throughout the house. There is a cozy and convenient gas fireplace that is easy to operate with the flick of a switch.  One bathroom has been recently renovated and has a deep tub and sunflower shower head.  The other is brand new and has a tiled shower with room for 2. The kitchen is well appointed and newly renovated with stainless steel appliances, granite counters and everything a home chef needs. Bedrooms have new mattresses and linens. Master bedroom has a king size four poster teak bed.  Second bedroom has a queen. Both bedrooms get beautiful afternoon sun. The carport has been converted into an outdoor living space with a couch, chairs, bistro table and dart board. The backyard is big and private with large trees and a fully fenced  grassy lawn. There is also a small fire pit. This home is r

neighborhood_overview: The house is centrally located in beautiful established Kenilworth.   The Biltmore Estate, Mission Hospital, The Orange Peel, downtown Asheville, Whole Foods are all within a 5 minute drive. The Kenilworth Park is a 2 min walk. The tennis courts and basketball courts have been newly surfaced and are open to the public.
notes: There is a very friendly orange tabby named Morris who lives at the house.  Guests are asked to feed Morris as part of their stay.
transit: The public bus is located on the adjacent street, about a 3 minute walk. All major hi-ways are with a 5 mins drive. Asheville Airport is 20-25 mins away.
host_about:
I am a mother, a student of life and a life long entrepreneur.  I am passionate about family, live music, good food, modern art, beautiful places, inspiring conversation and connecting with interesting, open minded people.  

I lived in the Caribbean for 21 years and am now lucky enough to divide my time between Asheville NC, Bonn Germany and St.John USVI which are some of the greatest places on this planet offering a little bit, of all of that!  

My home in Asheville is available as a short term rental through this site. And if you are considering a trip to the Virgin Islands, I have lots of connections so please check out my informative website WhatToDo-VI.

Thank you

name: Downtown Convenience: Orange Peel
space: Walk to the heart of downtown Asheville in less than 10-minutes!  We are located steps from the minor league baseball field.  Hardwood floors throughout, washer and dryer, shared bathroom (there's only one in the home), likely the best kitchen in Asheville, front porch with a view of the blue ridge mountains, and a fenced in backyard.  In the summer enjoy fresh blueberries, tomatoes and various fresh vegetables from the garden; or, walk to the Saturday farmer's market.   Two rooms are rented via Airbnb or longer-term (traveling nurses and P.T. interns at the hospital are common), the third room in the home is mine (I live here).  We will consider a well-behaved dog with deposit.  I have one LARGE pooch (85 pounds) currently.   Note: The steps to get up to my house are "steep", with no handrails. You can walk up the driveway and enter in the back of the home (no steps).  I'm a female, outdoor person who loves biking, hiking, climbing, adventures, rafting, snowboarding, etc.

name: Mountain Retreat with Hot Tub
summary: Ideal location, walking distance to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Mountain to Sea trail. Ten minutes from Biltmore House and downtown Asheville. Private spacious bedroom, queen bed, couch, ensuite bath, coffee station, hot tub, deck, and patio.
space: The rental bedroom is the only room downstairs in the house. It has a private bathroom.
description: Ideal location, walking distance to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Mountain to Sea trail. Ten minutes from Biltmore House and downtown Asheville. Private spacious bedroom, queen bed, couch, ensuite bath, coffee station, hot tub, deck, and patio. The rental bedroom is the only room downstairs in the house. It has a private bathroom. Guests can access the bedroom through the garage or through the front door of the house. It is a split level house, so you do not have to enter the main living floor. Guests may use the patio in the back yard and the hot tub on the upper deck. One of the homeowners, Carrie runs has a home office so she is often available. Carrie is happy to make recommendations for Asheville. We live in a quiet neighborhood. Our street dead ends at the forest, so it is not a thru-way street. There is not much traffic. The roads are a little curvy, but not steep. Neighbors are very friendly. Several people walk their dogs. We often walk to the Blue Ridge Parkway, and quickly acce
neighborhood_overview: We live in a quiet neighborhood. Our street dead ends at the forest, so it is not a thru-way street. There is not much traffic. The roads are a little curvy, but not steep. Neighbors are very friendly. Several people walk their dogs. We often walk to the Blue Ridge Parkway, and quickly access the Mountain to Sea Trail, which is only about a 10 minute walk. We also run on the Mountain to Sea trail.
host_about: We love to travel. We have lived in Uganda, South Africa, Peru and Ecuador, and we have traveled in many other countries. We enjoy the great outdoors which is why we LOVE living in Asheville, NC. There is great hiking, biking, food and site-seeing in our mountain town.

name: Bodacious Downtown Brick House!
summary: Newly restored 1928 Brick Beauty, 3 bedrooms, 2 full baths, large back deck. Oversized kitchen, large living room, free wifi. W/D, snacks/linens incl.  3 mins drive to Biltmore! 12-min walk to all South Slope breweries, $6 Uber to downtown and RAD.
space: Newly available, GREAT location, GREAT layout of this 1928 2-story historic brick house. Large kitchen and open plan dining room, large back deck and spacious living room.  3 bedrooms each with queen bed and full size futon in living room with privacy doors.  Plenty of free street parking.  We have excellent reviews from our other properties so we're sure you're going to love this one!  Hurry and book soon before we move into this awesome house.

Plenty of free street parking.  We have excellent reviews from our other properties so we're sure you're going to love this one!  Hurry and book soon before we move into this awesome house. Easy, keyless entry makes check in and check out a breeze! We live 3 minutes away so we're available if you need us and all the delicious charms of Asheville await! We're on the edge of leafy and lovely Kenilworth. We're a three minute walk to Mission Hospital (which hopefully you won't need!) and a
neighborhood_overview: We're on the edge of leafy and lovely Kenilworth. We're a three minute walk to Mission Hospital (which hopefully you won't need!) and a 12 minute walk to all of South Slope.  It's a 2 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate and Hi-Wire Brewing and Standard Pizza!
notes: Three night minimum stay required on  select holiday weekends.  Occasional one night stays permitted.
transit: It's so easy to walk downtown because we're two minutes walk to Biltmore Ave.  You can be in South Slope in 10 minutes, or take an Uber and be there in 5 minutes!
host_about:
Together with my husband Michael, we're two American writers who moved to Asheville from Prague in July of 2013. We're originally from NY and NJ and we chose Asheville for the obvious, awesome reasons.  We're having the time of our lives here! Diane is the founder and designer of Musewear Flip Flops ((SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) them!) and Michael writes a tech news column for CNET.  We both have excellent suggestions on things to see and do here --especially restaurants!  Asheville is a foodie and beer lovers paradise.  

We do serious beach time in Brigantine NJ, a place we have loved for more than 15 years.  By now it's probably clear we're big fans of "the good life" and we'll do our best to share it all with you!

Less than 2 miles from Blue Ridge Parkway; 4 miles to Biltmore Village. 11 min drive from downtown Asheville. 3 miles from I40.
notes: Rent nightly, or weekly or monthly for discounted rate.  Have pack-n-play if needed for small child.
host_about: We have lived in Asheville since 2001. I'm originally from ATL and my husband from Boston. We love the outdoors, have two daughters, are pet friendly (but don't have one currently). Mountain biking, rock climbing, trail running or yoga are all things we love to do in Asheville.

name: Beautifully appointed apt in mtns
summary: Restful, peaceful. beautiful apt. looking out on rhododendrom forest; soothing colors, living room, dining room, kitchenette, full bathroom, large bedroom with king size bed and add'l single bed; sofa bed in living room.  Private deck and courtyard.
space: Have coffee out on the private deck and courtyard in the morning and wine on the deck in the evening looking out on a beautiful rhododendron and hardwood forest.  Beautifully appointed furnishings with artwork by local artist for sale.  Located in a very quiet neighborhood of 8 houses on a hillside with mountain views.  12 miles from downtown Asheville, 6 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, 11 miles to the NC Arboretum with extensive biking and hiking trails, 10 miles from Sierra Nevada Brewery, and 10 miles to the Asheville Regional Airport.  You will be welcomed with an extensive book of attractions and great things to do in our Blue Ridge Mountains.  Endless questions answered by your host with a smile and willingness to make your visit to Asheville extraordinary.  WiFi, Satellite TV, Coffee Maker, Microwave, Toaster Oven, a bottle of wine, and a beautiful setting and space await you.
description: Restful, peaceful. beautiful apt. looking out on rhododendrom forest; soothing colors, living room, dining room, kitchenette, full bathroom, large bedroom with king size bed and add'l single bed; sofa bed in living room.  Private deck and courtyard. Have coffee out on the private deck and courtyard in the morning and wine on the deck in the evening looking out on a beautiful rhododendron and hardwood forest.  Beautifully appointed furnishings with artwork by local artist for sale.  Located in a very quiet neighborhood of 8 houses on a hillside with mountain views.  12 miles from downtown Asheville, 6 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, 11 miles to the NC Arboretum with extensive biking and hiking trails, 10 miles from Sierra Nevada Brewery, and 10 miles to the Asheville Regional Airport.  You will be welcomed with an extensive book of attractions and great things to do in our Blue Ridge Mountains.  Endless questions answered by your host with a smile and willingness to make your visit t
neighborhood_overview: As can be seen by our pictures, this is a very quiet, peaceful, restful neighborhood.  We are surrounded by nature, mountains, forest, and wildlife.  It is a quiet spiritual retreat for us.
notes: You will be very close to the Blue Ridge Parkway and multiple attractions in the Blue Ridge Mountains such as Mt. Pisgah, the Folk Art Center, Sierra Nevada Brewery, Mountain biking and hiking trails at the NC Arboretum, and downtown Asheville.  You will be within 3 to 4 miles of several grocery stores including an organic grocery story, Walgreens, an urgent care center, and multiple restaurants to suit every taste.
transit: We are approximately 4 miles to a bus line for public transportation.  The roads surrounding our neighborhood are all two lanes.  A four lane road is  3 miles to the south of us and 6 miles to the east of our location.  We have very few bike paths in the city at this point.  Bike paths are increasing in number but we have a ways to go in terms of making our region bike friendly on the roads.  Public transportation is spotty at our end of the county. We have one to two taxi services.  Car Rentals are available from the airport.  We also have an Enterprise Rental Care company downtown.

I'm an Asheville/WNC native.  I love hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic  and ancient mountains.   My vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, Pandora, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, DOG FRIENDLY and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back.

My best friend Troy Pope and I are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

I look forward to sharing this area with you!

name: The Red Door
summary: The Red Door is a fully furnished apartment for two. It is very convenient to most of the popular areas of Asheville, including the Blue Ridge Parkway,  Biltmore Village and Biltmore Estate. It is a cozy space with an outdoor patio for relaxing.
space: The Red Door is an apartment all your own in East Asheville, fully equipped with a complete kitchen and a cozy living room with tv and cable.  Even though it's not within walking distance of downtown or West Asheville, it is a closer drive to more attractions than apartments in those areas would be. It also has a comfortable queen bed and soft sheets that welcome you when you come in after a wonderful day of seeing some of what the Asheville area offers. notes: I will leave current information about the area  on the bookcase by the front window including books on hiking and things to do around Asheville.
transit: A bus stop is located three blocks from the apartment, and Asheville has several taxi services.
host_about: I've recently retired and am in the process of discovering things in life that I love and didn't have time for or never took the time to experience, from simple things like how to build a fire in our wood stove to more challenging things like taking duplicate bridge lessons. Our Airbnb comes with a low price so that you will to be able to visit the incredibly beautiful and eclectic area in and around Asheville. Our apartment in the Oakley area is less than 10 minutes from most of the popular attractions in the area including Biltmore Village and downtown Asheville. I look forward to sharing the experience of this truly beautiful place that I call home. My hope is that you will feel like this is your home away from home and that I can do whatever is necessary to help you have that experience.

name: Eclectic Arts&Craft on Edge of Town
summary: My charming bungalow has the ease of a 10 min-drive to downtown, less-than-5min-drive/15min-walk to Biltmore Village, yet still feels like escaping town. Clean&bright with a sweet porch & yard, this well-loved home is ready for you! Come relax&enjoy!
space: Colors abound in this sweet space from the warm orange of the living room, to the gold and oat walls of the main bedroom. The bathroom with its deep soaker tub (my favorite!) is swimming in sea greens. The decor is simple and a little eclectic. The front bedroom has a comfy but firm queen bed, while the back bedroom--the kid-friendly room--has a comfy twin bed.  There is an extra room at the top of the spiral staircase--a wide open space with an extra sleeping area (full-sized futon) and room for lounging, yoga, and kids' play. The kitchen is recently renovated and well-stocked with equipment for cooking, and also includes filtered water at the sink. For summer's heat, there is a window A/C unit in the living room and also one in the upstairs room. The two bedrooms have window fans or a ceiling fan. The front porch provides shade and plant life, and a small table for eating, and a sitting area for relaxing.
description: My charming bungalow has the ease of a 10 min-drive to downtown, less-than-5min-drive/15min-walk to Biltmore Village, yet still feels like escaping town. For summer's heat, there is a window A/C unit in the living room and also one in the upsta
neighborhood_overview: I love the quiet of my neighborhood and its close proximity to the Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village, Warren Wilson College, the Blue Ridge Parkway and still the direct and quick drives into town. There is a park right up the street, a public library, and my yard has plenty of space to play or lie in the sun. There is a Whole Foods within 5 minutes of the house (by car), and an easy, back-road route to get there! At the top of the street, you can turn left to head toward the French Broad Brewery and Catawba Brewery tasting rooms...or maybe turn right and head towards Highland Brewing Company's grand new space that hosts music and is family-friendly. Either way, you can't lose!!
notes: Filtered Water in the kitchen!
transit: City bus stop at the end of the block. Plenty of off-street parking is available just for you.
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville for almost 20 years, and love to call it my home. I am an avid dancer, specifically studying West African dance. I love spending time outside in these wonderful mountains, and I usually seek out paths along streams and rivers, loving the icy mountain waters like I do! I have a 3-year-old boy, and manage one of the shops of an amazingly delicious local ice cream. 
I have traveled a lot, mostly in the "developing" world: India, Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe, Lesotho, South Africa, Guinea, Ivory Coast, and Mali; but I also have traveled in Italy working on farms, as well as visiting friends in France and the Netherlands. I love to travel through relationship connections, seeing the inside views of life in the lands I visit. I am excited to host you in this land I live & love immensely!

name: Beautiful Kenilworth Jewel
summary: Spacious, private, and lovely, this one-bedroom apartment is on the lower level of a three-story  home. Enter through your own private entrance and enjoy your own deck within the woods. You're in the woods but 5-7 minutes away from all the major attractions, downtown, Biltmore Estate, Biltmore Village, the Blue Ridge Parkway and River Arts District. Majestic trees, eclectic mix of housing styles and the 19-acre Kenilworth Lake – a 10 minute walk from the house - makes walking here wonderful.
space: We were chosen by a senior AirBnB staff to be the place they stayed at. "The two of you are the definition of what it means to be a remarkable AirBnB host. The care you put into the host-guest relationship is noticed and truly appreciated." Spacious, very private, peaceful and lovely, this newly renovated one-bedroom apartment is on the lower level of a three-story, local notable artist's home. It has filtered water, a mini-fridge and microwave, and filtered water. Situated in a quiet, historic Asheville neighborhood – Kenilworth - there is plenty of natural light through windows that face the woods. Enter through your own private entrance and enjoy your own deck overlooking the lush woods for three seasons, or a partial mountain view when the leaves are down. It is very private giving you all the space you need. Tall, mature trees face your entrance and apartment, giving the visual perspective of being in a tree house. This special hide-away is centrally located & 5-7 minutes to just

neighborhood_overview: Kenilworth is one of Asheville's wonderful neighborhoods, a historic gem with its own distinct feel.  You're in the woods but 5-7 minutes away from most of Asheville's major attractions.  Majestic trees, safe streets, eclectic mix of housing styles and the 19-acre Kenilworth Lake – a 10 minute walk from the house - makes walking (and driving) here great fun.
notes: Deepen your artistic expression with a one or two day private retreat with Lynn. It has been tremendously impactful for participants. Special Retreat discount for people who are our Air BnB guests.
transit: There is a downtown bus, but having your car really makes the most sense, altho given our close proximity to downtown and the micro-breweries, many guests Uber.
host_about:
Lynn is a nationally shown artist and gravitates toward all that is art. 
She is also a long-standing licensed psychotherapist.
Jake is a mgmt consultant in the ethics and compliance field.
 We enjoy unique (ethnic) food, cooking, bicycling, walking interesting neighborhoods and areas, being in the mountains, and taking in the areas culture.

host_about:
For much of my life I have enjoyed hosting my guests wherever I've lived across the USA.  So I decided to expand.  Plus I enjoy sharing my home and Asheville.
I am an active retiree, walk/hike every day with my dogs, am very glad I live in Asheville, truly a social/artistic/progressive/somewhat urban island in the South.  I am also an avid reader and a "foodie".
I am located near the Biltmore Estate, 2 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway, 3 miles from the heart of Downtown, and have easy access to I-40.
Come on down!  Or up or over!

name: Cozy Charm by Biltmore & Parkway
summary: I have a sweet & calm home available just 4 minutes from Biltmore Estate or the Blue Ridge Parkway & 9 minutes to downtown Asheville. The house sleeps up to 5 with 2 bedrooms, 1 full bath & a futon for one in the large living room. Welcome Ya'll!
space: This listing is for the entire house all to yourself! I want a beautiful and restful space when I come home, so I have designed it that way for you, too. My home is unique because while it is simply furnished, it is comfortable, clean, chic, and a happy place to be. The house sleeps up to 5 with two bedrooms & 1 full bath and a floor futon for a person in the large living room. Wifi, comfy beds, full kitchen, record player, and eco-friendly. Enjoy the peaceful setting and open space in the living room for yoga or exercise (mats provided).   There is plenty of yardspace to have a picnic or take a nap in the sunshine. There are mature trees on the property, as well as a willow, maple, and several native herbs and spring-flowering bulbs. The house has rain barrels, an organic raised garden bed (covered in fall), and wild weeds. Come spend some time at my Biltmore bungalow and experience awesome Asheville! neighborhood_overview: My home is only a 4 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate or the Blue Ridge Parkway, or 9 minutes to downtown Asheville. It is convenient and quiet.  Often times, you will hear the birds in the morning and can watch them from the living room windows. In the evening you can occasionally see deer and rabbits in my yard.
notes: For those looking to possibly move to Asheville, I know a wonderful real estate agent (no kickbacks - just a good experience!) and can give you tips on neighborhoods.
transit: Public transportation and taxi service is available, but I would recommend having a car to have the best experience overall.
host_about: I am a singer/songwriter from the mountains of Asheville, NC that grew up in downtown Atlanta, GA. When I am not traveling with my sweet band (an all-female trio) I love the library, listening to music, hanging out with my eclectic family, tending my garden, and going to art shows of all kinds.

description: Come stay at our comfortable single family home while you visit quirky, eclectic Asheville famous for her mountains, artists, beer and great food. We have a single family home that offers a possibility of several resident arrangements including 2 single bedrooms with new queen sized memory foam topped mattresses, one additional room with futon, or the possibility of renting the whole house while hosts are regularly away.  The front porch and furnished back deck are available at this level.  Each room has a keyed lock for privacy. Washing machine and dryer are in the unit. The rooms for rent are located on the upper level of the house with full bathroom.  There is a half bathroom along with fully equipped kitchen/dining room and living room equipped with a flat screen TV hooked to cable with extensive movie channels and Netflix. We are a friendly couple that are happy to be here for you...and equally satisfied to honor your request for total privacy.  The rooms in the main house if rent
neighborhood_overview: Kenilworth is a lovely pedestrian and family friendly neighborhood known for its 1920 homes and bungalows.  We are located just south of Downtown Asheville central and within walking distance  to both funky downtown and chic south Asheville/Biltmore area.  Asheville Mall and the antique shops are less than a 5 minute drive away.  Mission Hospital and AB Tech are around the corner.
notes: Free street parking available.  Your hosts have skills that you might find desirable- He is a professional chef trained in a nationally recognized culinary school.  She is a nurse and happy to assist you if the need arises.
transit: At the end of the street is a conveniently located bus stop with bench.  Buses run every 30 minutes and range from $1-$5 to anywhere in town.  Taxis and Ubers are available.  Of course you can walk or rent a bike downtown to enjoy the slower, laid back pace of our town.  Cars can be rented easily from lovely Angela at Avis/Budget nearby.   If you would want to arrange a trip to nearby attractions, we can provide a local to drive you there and even act as a friendly guide at a price lower than traditional taxi fares.

description: Comfortable guest bedroom in our mountain home sleeps two in a queen bed. Private bathroom, porch view, and only minutes from Biltmore Estate & downtown Asheville. Our home is in an awesome, scenic, and convenient location: we are a short 15-minute drive from downtown Asheville, 10 minutes from the airport, 10 minutes from the Biltmore House, 5 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, and 5 minutes from Interstate 26. This rental includes use of the guest bedroom and bathroom only. Use of the front porch is also permitted when we are not using it. Because this is our private residence, access to all other parts of our house including the kitchen and living room is not permitted. Please be respectful of our private space. Because we have key-code locks, we offer self check-in to all of our guests,
neighborhood_overview: South slope of Brown Mountain overlooking south Asheville toward Mt. Pisgah, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and the Pisgah National Forest. Less than five minutes to local restaurants, bars, and shopping. Quiet neighborhood, secluded in forest, tucked away up on the mountain.
notes: Also included in the room: Mini-Fridge, Coffee Maker & Coffee, TV & DVD Player (no cable). We cannot provide a refund for inclement weather or adverse travel conditions affecting driving access in our neighborhood or the region. Our refund policy is standard terms set by AirBnB.
transit: Easy access to Asheville, Blue Ridge Parkway, Biltmore, and more! 5 minutes to Interstate 40, Walmart, restaurants. Under 15 minutes to downtown Asheville.
host_about:
Hello! My husband and I are looking forward to hosting guests in our home as well as being a guest of others during our travels. We became AirBnB hosts in 2014 and have since hosted nearly 400 bookings/guests.

We live in Asheville in the beautiful mountains of western North Carolina.

Allison works as a fourth grade teacher at Mills River Elementary School. Peter works as the Trails & Outreach Coordinator at a regional land trust, Carolina Mountain Land Conservancy. Both of us work to keep this region we love as wonderful as it is today, and make it even better for future generations.

We love to take road trips throughout the year. We have appreciated the kindness of many over the years who have let us stay in their home or camp in their yard, or have rented a room to us for a reasonable rate. We are guests who are focused on our travels and we most often are seeking simply a room to hang our hat for the night before our travels resume the following morning. For that reason, most hosts barely know that we are there. In appreciation for the kindness shown to us over the years, we pay it forward by being clean and courteous when we are guests in the homes of others, and we are seeking to host guests who are similarly self-sufficient and simply seeking a basic place for the night.

We look forward to you staying in our home!

name: Griffin's Lair Biltmore Village AVL
summary: An upstairs luxury apartment created in the upstairs of an original George Vanderbilt cottage. Located in Historic Biltmore Village with an upper terrace backing up to the 8,000 acre Biltmore Estate. Views of The Village &All Souls Cathedral
space: Griffin's Lair has two parking places and a loading area in a commercial mixed use historic business. Privacy is assured by gates and fences to the upper terrace. Interior magnetic storm panels keep it quiet and cozy. Designer interiors, two large flat screen TV's with sound bar, full kitchen and laundry, microweave sheets
description: An upstairs luxury apartment created in the upstairs of an original George Vanderbilt cottage. Located in Historic Biltmore Village with an upper terrace backing up to the 8,000 acre Biltmore Estate. Views of The Village &All Souls Cathedral     Griffin's Lair has two parking places and a loading area in a commercial mixed use historic business. Privacy is assured by gates and fences to the upper terrace. Interior magnetic storm panels keep it quiet and cozy. Designer interiors, two large flat screen TV's with sound bar, full kitchen and laundry, microweave sheets Biltmore village has 8 restaurants. Ruth's Chris is next door & Starbucks is just 2 houses away. The Richard Morris Hunt Cathedral of All Souls is across the street. Just 4 doors to Biltmore Estate entry. Minutes from downtown Asheville. Bus stops close by. I do not live close by. My Architects office is just 3 blocks away in The Village. I typically allow my guests lots of privacy and am close by in the day if needed (UR
neighborhood_overview: I personally petitioned the City of Asheville to create The Biltmore Village Historic District, created a private museum to restore it and authored The Development Plan for the COA and NC dept of Archives and History. I fell in love with Biltmore Village when I moved to Asheville. It was a small community about the same size as my home town in Mississippi (3K) It was also a charming collection of English Tudor historic structures designed by Richard Morris Hunt and R S Smith
notes: The cottage apartment is upstairs and not aces accessible to those who are not able to climb a flight of stairs. The 8,000 acre estate above the low retaining wall is not available to guests, tickets must be purchased at the gatehouse. It does however add privacy and occasional wildlife. The rooftop is not to be climbed on. Children should be well supervised due to the art, antiques and potential dangers to children who climb.
transit: Very Convenient to bus stops 2 blocks away.

It is a healthy space with a heavy duty mattress cover, box spring cover, and pillow covers!

The entrance and bath will be shared with another rental room, but living quarters are well separat
neighborhood_overview: This is an eclectic neighborhood in a central location close to everything that Asheville has to offer!  We are right off of 74, one exit away from Whole Foods, the Blue Ridge parkway, the Shoji hot tubs, the Mall, and 10 minutes from downtown Asheville.  On our exit you can visit the Nature Center, Highland Brewing Company, all sorts of convenient shopping and food stops, yet feel tucked away in a semi-private and wooded home.  We are on the edge of the neighborhood, without any residential neighbors that see into our yard.  We are walking distance to the library, convenience store, public park, and close to local favorites like Brother Wolf, The Regeneration Station, The Toy Boat, and other great neighborhood gems.
notes: I have ten years experience as a licensed massage therapist and we can set up in room massages!  My daughter enjoys pet sitting, and she and our gentle Border collie, Bootsie, will keep your pet great company.  Please only well behaved generally quiet animals, as there are other guest down the hall.  Also, Friday and Saturday nights can be lively sounding, as we are on the edge of a neighborhood near local happenings, although separated by a large partly wooded lot.  Additionally, there is a laundry mat with in one minute of driving.
transit: Please feel free to park in our driveway, which is flat and easily accessible.   Again we are walking distance to many local favorites and convenient businesses.  Uber is a handy affordable ride that is available if needed.
host_about: Hi!  I hope you visit!  I am currently studying as a graduate student of Chinese Medicine.  I am a massage therapist and offer massages to guests.  Yoga and meditation is a passion, and I keep an active and wholesome lifestyle.  I am pretty new to Asheville myself, so exploring the city is something I hope to do also!

This three bedroom one bath home on an mountaintop is located just 10 minutes from all the amenities downtown Asheville offers

name: Cozy Cottage in the City
summary: Location, location, location! Settle into this sunny cottage overlooking 1 acre of gorgeous property. 5 min walk to breweries & dining in Biltmore Village.  5 min drive to Blue Ridge Pkwy and downtown.  Complete privacy yet close to everything.
space: This is a cozy turn of the century cottage that will feel like home.  Updated kitchen and bath mean historical charm with modern amenities.  Gorgeous  property features end-of-the-road privacy, gardens, fruit trees and a full wooded acre for a true feeling of serenity in the heart of town.  Biltmore Village is an easy walk and features great shopping, several restaurants and 3 breweries (soon to be 4!)  Downtown is only a 5 minute drive and pedestrian friendly West Asheville is less than 10.  We are on the Blue Ridge Parkway side of town so plenty of hiking trails to explore with four legged friends. House is located in Oakley, an up-and-coming and diverse neighborhood that can be explored on foot.  Thursday farmers market is a 3 minute walk from the house.

name: Biltmore/Downtown Perfect Location!
summary: Located halfway between downtown Asheville and the Biltmore, this beautiful, brand new 3 bedroom/2.5 bath home is close to everything Asheville has to offer! Perfect for a weekend getaway or longer-term rental.
space: Located on a quiet residential street halfway between downtown Asheville and the Biltmore Estate, this is the perfect getaway for those who want everything the beautiful and charming city of Asheville has to offer. This home features two master suites, one on the main floor and one upstairs.  Walk to the upscale shops and restaurants of Biltmore Village, or hop in your car or bicycle and get to downtown's world class restaurants and shopping in just a few minutes. You're a short drive from the scenic Blue Ridge Parkway, recreation on the French Broad River, countless hiking and mountain biking trails of Pisgah National Forest, charming towns of Western North Carolina, and the unique and vibrant culture of the Appalachians.  This Energy Star and HealthyBuilt certified home was built in 2012 and is outfitted with new EVERYTHING. It offers two master suites with queen beds, plus a third bedroom with two twin beds, so it could be the perfect rental for two small families. The open floor pl

neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential street a few minutes walk from Biltmore Village.
notes: Please let us know if you have any special requests, and we will try our best to accommodate you. A pack & play and baby gate are available by request.
transit: You can easily walk to Biltmore Village, but we would strongly recommend having a car to get downtown and around the Asheville area. There is so much to see just outside the city limits! There is a bus line just outside the door on Biltmore Ave that will take you downtown, and taxis and Uber are available.
host_about: Hello!  We recently moved to Asheville from Oakland, CA. We've travelled with AirBnb for years and are excited to offer a cozy place to stay for people visiting this beautiful area. Amy writes novels for young adults, and Brian teaches Qi Gong and works as a cinematographer. Some of our interests include hiking, camping, Buddhism, music, traveling, and eating brunch at the many fine  restaurants in town. We look forward to meeting you!

name: The Keep
space: Airbnb gives the room to the first person who books it, there may be several people asking for the same dates. Don't miss your chance! Comfortable clean shared home in historic Kenilworth neighborhood with off-street parking. Right in the middle of  wonderful Asheville. Bedroom with shared bath and firm double bed. Use of kitchen including cabinet space for your groceries. Wi-fi is available of course. Enjoy morning coffee on the deck. We have an assortment of interesting games, big screen for DVD and roku. I HAVE A CAT. Fenced yard great for dogs, neighborhood great for walking dogs. We welcome dogs who are friendly, well behaved and pick up their poop in the yard AND in the neighborhood. What's that, your dog can't scoop poop? But you will? OK that will be fine. If you are looking for other spaces I also list "The Cloister"  and "Studio 54". I offer some flexibility about cancellations on a case-by-case basis. I just don't want to pay airbnb for the privilege of having your booking c

host_about:
Loving Asheville!
I enjoy community, domestic life, dancing, vintage stuff, textiles, mountains, rivers, gardens, cats, other people's dogs, adventure, the Caribbean, cooking, eating, games, funky art, funky artists, yard sales, growers' markets, fireflies.
I think about how things work, how systems interconnect, cause and effect. I have million dollar ideas and don't develop them.
I like to have a purpose or a project, can't go somewhere new just to be a tourist. During leisure time I like to read a good book, play Bananagrams or watch something off-beat. 
My hosting style is casual and tidy (I know, it's an enigma). Come in, make yourself comfortable, explore the kitchen and commons so you know where to find things. Feel free to turn on the roku box and watch Netflix or Hulu or enjoy Pandora radio. I'm living a busy life but I love to meet new people and connect. I usually get over to the house for a while every day to do chores and check on things.
street: Castle St, Asheville, NC 28803, United States

name: Spring Fling near Biltmore Estate
summary: Calendar is up to date, and warm weather is here!  Our place is great for small and medium groups... indoors, rooms are spacious, and lots of outdoor play space in the yard as well. Contact me, and we'll get ya fixed-up! Drew
space: Beautiful private Biltmore Forest home on several acres - five minutes to Biltmore Estate entrance and the galleries & restaurants of Biltmore Village, easy 2 miles off I-40, 15 minutes to the airport... plenty of parking. Our property is a 1920's brick bungalow purchased by my grandparents when they were newlyweds... Located in Biltmore Forest, it's close to the famous Biltmore House (1 mile in a straight line, 3 by car). Less than a mile to the Blue Ridge Parkway, and 10 minutes to downtown restaurants and the River Arts District. The house is 5-bedrooms, 2500 sq ft, privately situated on part of a 5-acre compound that's been in the family for almost 100 years... wood floors, lots of plants and BIG windows throughout... Relax on the 500 sq ft brick terrace and enjoy the season. Full kitchen with fine views to the wooded east yard. Fireplace and two comfortable dens... dining room seats 12 or more, also with plenty of windows. Two queen bedrooms downstairs share a bright clean bathroo

I am a geographer - I work with GIS/mapping systems, mainly helping people and groups get started with this exciting technology. I travel often for work, thus the opportunity to have this place to yourself!
I sail, dive, run, LOVE live music (great scene here in Asheville).

I live in a big old family home - known it all my life - great energy here - come enjoy!

name: Cozy Bedroom/Bath Near Downtown!
space: Bedroom is on the downstairs level (not an underground basement) of the house, and includes a private bathroom and a very comfortable queen bed. You will have access to a spacious back yard and a porch as well. Feel free to play our baby grand piano!
description: Bedroom is on the downstairs level (not an underground basement) of the house, and includes a private bathroom and a very comfortable queen bed. You will have access to a spacious back yard and a porch as well. Feel free to play our baby grand piano!  Guest will have access to their own private bathroom (including a tub and shower) as well as a coffee machine and a private deck.  Upon request, guest may use the washer, dryer, and the upstairs kitchen. Extra sleeping arrangements available upon request if needed. *We will need to know ahead of time if you would like to use these amenities.  Interaction with guest is based on your desire. We will be on the upper level of the house, but would love to interact with you as much as you'd like! House is located in a quiet neighborhood half a mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway and just a couple minutes from shopping and restaurants. We are located about seven minutes from downtown, nine minutes from Biltmore Estate, and  a minute away from the B
neighborhood_overview: House is located in a quiet neighborhood half a mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway and just a couple minutes from shopping and restaurants. We are located about seven minutes from downtown, nine minutes from Biltmore Estate, and  a minute away from the Blue Ridge Parkway and some of their trails.
notes: House is less than a half mile  to the Blue Ridge Parkway entrance and an easy five minutes from downtown Asheville!  We are also twenty minutes from Chimney Rock.
transit: Parking is included on the proper.  No car provided at this location.
host_about:
I am an adventurer. I love to travel, try new things, meet new people, and get out there to see things for myself. I also love to cook, dabble in photography, journal, and listen to music. 

Parker is my best friend and my husband. He is a talented musician that runs his own studio and piano lab. Enjoys playing and creating music, woodworking, and reading. We are pretty opposite... but hey, it works! 
 
We love our city and all that it has to offer.

name: Restful Room #1 in Asheville, NC
summary: Comfortble bedrooms in spacious house, Living Room, Dining Room and Den accessible to guests, and Kitchen for do it yourself breakfast with most anything you need or want. A quiet, low density neighborhood, in the city but 6 miles South downtown.
space: Handsome brick ranch in beautiful neighborhood 5 miles S of Asheville Center, 2 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway and I-26. Only local traffic, good for walking. Front door in city, back door in country. Futons for extra people available, upon request. A gay friendly home. Breakfast food provided -- fresh fruit and Cereal or you may cook bacon and eggs; good bread and jam. Local printed guides and maps available.  Local shopping center has many interesting stores, including an "Earth Fare," which I think is better than "Whole Food" and not as expensive. Many good restaurants in neighborhood: Italian, Indian, Chinese, Mexican, and Contemporary Southern. Front yard in town; back yard in country. Often a bitt cluttered because I do not put any yard waste on street. Leaves and and garden waste is composted; stems and prunings are saved for kindling in our fireplace. Work in the yard for me is meditation and I go into Alpha state.

neighborhood_overview: This a quiet neighborhood. There are no sidewalks, but the streets are safe for walking and auto traffic is respectful of walkers. There is a city park nearby which also offers walking areas, and the State Arboretum is nearby.

name: Great Location by Biltmore Village!
summary: You'll sleep in comfort and peace in your Master Suite within this tranquil apt in a lovely section of S Asheville. Enjoy an amazing night's rest on the king-sized memory foam mattress. Short drives to downtown, tons of restaurants, & the BR Parkway.
space: Although just off a main road, this apartment borders woods, which are just feet from the door. A garden bench invites you to sit and relax while enjoying the many songbirds that come to the feeders. Wireless internet, tea & coffee are among the amenities. Your Master Suite is at the opposite end from the living room and kitchen. Want to go for a drive with amazing views? The Blue Ridge Parkway is .5 miles down the road. Wake up hungry and don't want to cook? A left or right turn out of the apartment complex brings you to numerous restaurants, cafes, and even a couple of pubs. Downtown Asheville, with it's amazing variety of entertainment, is a short 10-15 minute drive. Interested in history or architecture? Two miles brings you to the Biltmore Mansion, built by George Vanderbilt II in the 1800s. This chateau style mansion is the largest privately owned house in the US and is ranked eighth in America's Favorite Architecture. Be sure to visit at Christmas (Nov - Jan) when the mansion is

neighborhood_overview: It's a wonderful location—convenient to so many things, and at the same time very peaceful within the complex itself. I love the deep red of the brick buildings, set against the greenery surrounding.
notes: Minimum stay of 2 nights.
transit: The Asheville transit system has a stop right where Ascot Pt. Circle intersects the main road, so a five minute walk.
host_about: I'm a pretty relaxed individual.  I'm into hiking in this beautiful part of the country, kayaking on lakes, line dancing.  I also enjoy photography and some crafts.  My children are all grown and gone and I enjoy company, so here I am!  I'm somewhat new to this area, but as I accumulate brochures and such I'll enjoy sharing these with you, and I can recommend some local hikes.

name: Blue Ridge Parkway, Brand New Apt.!
summary: Stay in this cute, completely private in-law suite walking distance from the Blue Ridge Parkway! It's minutes from a vibrant downtown, and the beautiful Biltmore Estate.  Being a teacher, I love children, but this space is for adults only. Thank you!
space: Tucked in on one side of the Blue Ridge Parkway, I have a brand new, beautiful 1 bedroom private (separate but attached to the main house) apartment available with 1 full bath and a half bath for adults only.  There is a newly added desk not shown in the photos. Why choose my space: --The "feel" of the space is one of peaceful quiet and thoughtful design.  You will feel it as soon as you walk in. --Everything is new, cozy and comfortable...great bed! --Along with being a writer, providing an exceptional guest experience is part of my livelihood.  I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people, getting them acquainted with the beauty and fun of Asheville, and providing any level of connection with which you are comfortable.  I live 5 houses up the road so I'm as available as you need me to be.  I can check in daily through text/email/phone or step back completely until you ask for assistance.   --You can walk to the Blue Ridge Parkway and hike the Mountain to Sea trail every morning. --The apart
description: Stay in this cute, completely private in-law suite walking distance from the Blue Ridge Parkway! It's minutes from a vibrant downtown, and the beautiful Biltmore Estate.  Being a teacher, I love children, but this space is for adults only. Thank you! Tucked in on one side of the Blue Ridge Parkway, I have a brand new, beautiful 1 bedroom private (separate but attached to the main house) apartment available with 1 full bath and a half bath for adults only.  There is a newly added desk not shown in the photos. Why choose my space: --The "feel" of the space is one of peaceful quiet and thoughtful design.  You will feel it as soon as you walk in. --Everything is new, cozy and comfortable...great bed! --Along with being a writer, providing an exceptional guest experience is part of my livelihood.  I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people, getting them acquainted with the beauty and fun of Asheville, and providing any level of connection with which you are comfortable.  I live 5 houses up the r
notes: Please note the unit is attached to a larger home that is also an Airbnb guest space.  Please respect each others privacy.  As with any space located under an upstairs space, you may hear foot traffic.  I ask guests to remove shoes in the other space so that footsteps are light.  Most people who visit Asheville tend to be out and about all day and go to bed at a reasonable hour so it's usually not an issue.  Everyone has been very gracious and appreciative of each other in this hosting community.  I'm lucky to be a part of it!
transit: There is no public transportation to this area.  According to an estimation on the Uber website, a ride to downtown is about $15-20.  Some guests have informed me that the Uber is $10-15.
host_about:
Welcome to Asheville!  Relax and enjoy my cozy place!  

I moved to Asheville eight years ago from San Francisco and have never looked back.  I grew up in the South and missed being among the dogwoods, thunderstorms and BBQ!  I have traveled the world and have never known a place more friendly and creative.  I'm a writer, musician, teacher, traveler and hiker...from the John Muir Trail to the Annapurnas and now the Blue Ridge.  

Please come cozy up in my place and stay awhile!
street: Parkway Loop, Asheville, NC 28803, United States

name: Modern Condo Minutes From Biltmore
summary: This comfortable and stylish one bedroom condo is minutes from all of Asheville's best sites including Biltmore Estate, Downtown, and the Blue Ridge Parkway.  The condo fits four comfortably and is located in a small, friendly development.
description: This comfortable and stylish one bedroom condo is minutes from all of Asheville's best sites including Biltmore Estate, Downtown, and the Blue Ridge Parkway.  The condo fits four comfortably and is located in a small, friendly development. The spare bedroom, and master closet are locked.  The rest of the space is accessible. I will be in and out of internet service during my time away.  My property manager can be reached if needed.
host_about:
Traveler that loves to explore new places.  Teacher and social justice advocate living in Asheville, NC.

name: Nice room close 2 Biltmore / Dwntwn
summary: Great room- 2 twin XL beds with good new mattresses, feather pillows new shared bath in cool, new, art-filled home with cats to pet. 7 minutes to downtown, 5 minutes to Biltmore Village, 7 minutes to Blueridge PKWY. Friendly, relaxed, happy home.
space: This is a great new contemporary home with high ceilings, art great views all around and a great loft feel. In the winter we see rolling ridges and other times of year are enveloped in green trees. The kitchen is clean, bright and new. Your bedroom is very comfortable for two friends. It has 2 twin XL new comfortable mattresses, new extra-large feather pillows and nice new bedding.  It has a  clean new bathroom that is shared with another guest room.  We have friendly indoor cats to pet also.

neighborhood_overview: We are central to all things Asheville. Downtown, The Biltmore House and Village, Blueridge Parkway, trails, West Asheville, the Arts District all within 10 minutes. We are also close to the major freeways. We have friendly cats to pet too!
notes: We have friendly cats!  Please be nice to them. Close your bedroom door if you don't want visitors!
transit: There is a bus line on Fairview Road a very short walk to an adjacent street. We are not familiar with the lines; but I'm sure they can be researched online.

name: Blue Ridge Parkway House and Apt.!
summary: This Arts 'n Crafts inspired retreat was created to feel peaceful, warm, cozy, and quiet. The second bedroom is actually its own attached private in-law suite. Everyone comments on the perfect feel of the space. Five minutes from everything!
space: Beautiful Arts 'n Crafts Style Cottage with in-law suite! I have a brand new, beautiful 1 bedroom house with 1 full bath in the main house and a 1 bedroom 1.5 bath in the in-law suite attached in the back.  The in-law suite has its own master bed and bath.  There is a futon in the loft space in the main house for two guests and a pull out mattress for the floor for two other guests. Why choose my space: --The "feel" of the space is one of peaceful quiet and thoughtful design. You will feel it as soon as you walk in. --Everything is new, cozy and comfortable. --Along with being a writer, providing an exceptional guest experience is part of my livelihood. I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people, getting them acquainted with the beauty and fun of Asheville, and providing any level of connection with which you are comfortable. I live 5 houses up the road so I'm as available as you need me to be. I can check in daily through text/email/phone or step back completely until you ask for assistanc

I thoroughly enjoy meeting new people, getting them acquainted with the beauty and fun of Ashevi
neighborhood_overview: Very quiet wooded neighborhood on a cul-de-sac type street (it's actually a loop) bordering the Blue Ridge Parkway.  Amazingly quiet!
notes: I (the owner/host) live five houses up the street and I'm always available through text, phone or email.
transit: There is no public transportation nearby. Taking Uber downtown is about a $15-20 ride according to the estimation on their website.  But I've had some guests say it is $10-15.
host_about:
Welcome to Asheville!  Relax and enjoy my cozy place!  

I moved to Asheville eight years ago from San Francisco and have never looked back.  I grew up in the South and missed being among the dogwoods, thunderstorms and BBQ!  I have traveled the world and have never known a place more friendly and creative.  I'm a writer, musician, teacher, traveler and hiker...from the John Muir Trail to the Annapurnas and now the Blue Ridge.  

Please come cozy up in my place and stay awhile!

name: Private Room and bath
summary: This is a private room in our house. The room is simple and has one comfy  queen size bed. You will have your own bath down the hall.
space: You will have your own private room with a queen size bed. Some have said the bed is a bit on the soft side and some have said it is comfortable, so please take that into consideration when booking.  You will also have your own private bathroom that is located down the hall with shampoo, conditioner, and soap to use. The tub can drain slow at times; we do live in an older house, but the water pressure is amazing.
description: This is a private room in our house. The room is simple and has one comfy  queen size bed. You will have your own bath down the hall. You will have your own private room with a queen size bed. Some have said the bed is a bit on the soft side and some have said it is comfortable, so please take that into consideration when booking.  You will also have your own private bathroom that is located down the hall with shampoo, conditioner, and soap to use. The tub can drain slow at times; we do live in an older house, but the water pressure is amazing. You are welcome to use our kitchen but please clean up after yourself. Do not eat our food or leave open containers of food in our fridge.  We have plenty of Tupperware that you can use located in the cabinet next to the fridge. But please feel free to make yourself some coffee or tea in the mornings and  use our yard or deck for lounging. Scott and I both work but we are more than happy to help you with whatever you need. We'd love to provide r
neighborhood_overview: The Biltmore House and Village are a mile away. There are many quaint stores in the village and the Biltmore property has so much to do you could spend an entire day on it. If you like beer, Asheville is the city to visit. Catawba Brewing has a tasting room that is very close to our house, as does French Broad Brewery. A new brewery recently opened, Sweeten Creek Brewery, that is a little more than a mile away as well. The River Arts District and downtown Asheville are just a few miles away. The Blue Ridge Parkway is located about a mile away and makes for a beautiful drive in the spring, summer, and fall months.
notes: We have two indoor/outdoor cats. One of the cats is very shy and will probably hide. The other cat is more social and loves to smell new people but she will not bother you in your room if you close the door.
transit: You are welcome to park here for free. Biltmore Village is a mile walk. Uber/taxis into downtown are $10-15. Once you get into downtown, however, it is a very walkable city.
host_about: I am an attorney who works in IT compliance and Scott works for a resort management company. We love Asheville and all of the things there are to do here. We love to go see live music, drink beer, and of course, eat. I love cooking and baking and Scott is an avid disc golf and tennis player. We love to travel and meet new people, but we can also get down with a netflix marathon.

name: Newly Finished with Great View
summary: Downstairs unit in the trees with great views of the Smokies.  Newly finished August 2015, with queen bed, queen sleeper sofa, kitchenette, wifi.  Private patio downstairs but full access to large deck upstairs with fantastic views.   Pet friendly with dog door, all designed to let your pets play with ours, or keep them separate. Cool and comfortable; you have your own AC, but you probably won't need it.  Secluded location with no visible neighbors, but 5 minutes from restaurants.
space: Incredible mountain side setting with 1 acre fenced area.  Beautiful custom apartment decorated by resident artist.  Fullish kitchen has refrigerator, microwave, large toaster oven, coffee maker, and induction burner--enough for the basics but not the place to cook your meals for a week.  Everything's ready to go, with all linens, utensils, etc. provided.
description: Downstairs unit in the trees with great views of the Smokies.  Newly finished August 2015, with queen bed, queen sleeper sofa, kitchenette, wifi.  Private patio downstairs but full access to large deck upstairs with fantastic views.   Pet friendly with dog door, all designed to let your pets play with ours, or keep them separate. Cool and comfortable; you have your own AC, but you probably won't need it.  Secluded location with no visible neighbors, but 5 minutes from restaurants. Incredible mountain side setting with 1 acre fenced area.  Beautiful custom apartment decorated by resident artist.  Fullish kitchen has refrigerator, microwave, large toaster oven, coffee maker, and induction burner--enough for the basics but not the place to cook your meals for a week.  Everything's ready to go, with all linens, utensils, etc. provided. You'll have exclusive private access to the downstairs unit pictured, with separate entry via a keypad code. You have your own private, fenced deck downstai
neighborhood_overview: We're in South Asheville in the hills above a quiet residential area, with no visible neighbors. You can listen to Roxy (our Malamute) howl when she hears a siren down below (but never at night--we promise).  We probably have 25 restaurants within 10 minutes of our house, from P.F. Chang's to Buffalo Wild Wings on Lake Julian to Tupelo Honey. There is also a locally owned, first rate movie theatre close by. In addition there are high-end shops and upscale dining at nearby Biltmore Park Town Square
notes: We're often at home during the day, so you can leave your dogs with ours to play (after a supervised meet & greet) or give them inside/outside access from your own unit and private fenced patio. You have your own dog door! Asheville is also very dog friendly so you may be surprised where they are welcome!
transit: We're 6 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and about 12 from The Biltmore and less than 20 from downtown, with easy routes to all of those.
host_about: Semi-retired couple; moved to Asheville in early 2014.  Richard operates a bookstore and Patricia is an artist.  Easy going, happy to help you navigate the area, but also happy to let you have your freedom.  When we're not buying more books or painting, we like to spend time with our dogs, listen to music, cook, etc.  We also coordinate a local hiking group.
street: High Top Lane, Asheville, NC 28803, United States

name: Welcome Home! 3Bdr 2.5 bath for 10.
summary: This sunny, light filled home is just minutes from everything! This duplex rents together to sleep 10 or separately to sleep 4 and 6 with a one bedroom plus sleeper couch down (see The Sweet Pine House) and two bedroom plus sleeper up (see The Pine TreeHouse). Great for large familiesLots of outdoor space! Towels and Linens included.
space: Upstairs unit is the Pine tree house. Nestled high in the trees with great views. Kitchen with vaulted ceiling, outstanding light, two queen bedrooms, and sleeper couch,   1.5 baths, washer/dryer, Stainless steel appliances, outdoor patio with grill and fire pit, and fenced in back yard. Downstairs cozy apt with queen bedroom and sleeper couch, sleeps four with second complete kitchen and separate washer/dryer, and additional outdoor patio and seating. Both have flat screen TVs and lovely furnishings. Parking is somewhat limited. There is room in the driveway for two cars and only one car in front of house. Additional cars will need to be left in a downtown parking lot (only five minutes away) or we can arrange free parking across town where we live. Just let us know if you need that.

Additional cars will need to be left in a downtow
neighborhood_overview: Your home away from home is located in the most desired downtown neighborhood perfectly situated between the Biltmore Estate and Downtown shops and restaurants. Mission Hospital is walking distance from this home. The neighborhood has more trees than any other Asheville neighborhood. There are two parks close by, perfect for young children.
notes: Asheville has a vibrant art and local theatre scene, incredible restaurants, locally brewed beer, and some of the best hiking and white water around! Have fun!!!
transit: You will need to drive your car or ride your bike except around the immediate neighborhood where there is lots of walkers. Distance to the Biltmore is about 1 mile (Starbucks just at the entrance) and about 1 additional mile to downtown using Biltmore Avenue (it is a direct shot). Uber taxi can get you downtown in about five minutes
host_about:
Trish and Steph are busy moms raising their five year old son. They lived in this sweet home for 12 years before recently moving north of town and using this now as a rental home. It has been thoughtfully furnished and equipped to make your Asheville visit perfect. Please let us know if we forgot anything!

We run a local theater company and often have shows in production. Season and show information is available in the unit along with coupons for discounted tickets. 

Steph is often acting and directing both which keep her busy. Trish is a nurse midwife who has been delivering babies for twenty years.

name: Cozy Bungalow In Asheville
summary: Small quiet cozy Private room in 1931 bungalow. My home is no more than 10 minutes from downtown, Biltmore House and Village, and The Blue Ridge Parkway. Easy access to I-240 & I-40. Shared bathroom. Shaded yard and firepit availability-just ask.
space: 1931 Bungalow. Original windows and  doors with hardware. Original wood floors and dining room corner cabinets! Quiet and settled home is in a semi quiet neighborhood. There is a police and fire station and the Oakley Public Park no more than a block from the house.  There is one healthy cat living in the home which means a litter box that gets cleaned daily sometimes twice daily. I do work and I love my home and my town! Queen bed sleeps two with a shared bathroom.
description: Small quiet cozy Private room in 1931 bungalow. My home is no more than 10 minutes from downtown, Biltmore House and Village, and The Blue Ridge Parkway. Easy access to I-240 & I-40. Shared bathroom. Shaded yard and firepit availability-just ask. 1931 Bungalow. Original windows and  doors with hardware. Original wood floors and dining room corner cabinets! Quiet and settled home is in a semi quiet neighborhood. There is a police and fire station and the Oakley Public Park no more than a block from the house.  There is one healthy cat living in the home which means a litter box that gets cleaned daily sometimes twice daily. I do work and I love my home and my town! Queen bed sleeps two with a shared bathroom. The house is open except for my bedroom and basement, of course. Feel free to use the Kitchen, Tea station, entertainment area and fire pit.I have room for a tent outside, of which I have two with air mattresses. Just ask. If you have any questions or need assistance with what to d
neighborhood_overview: Mostly Quiet neighborhood, Police and Fire stations and park are no more than a block away. There is an active elementary school a house row away from my home so in school session you do hear children playing at the school. A laundromat and 2 convenience stores are no more than a 5 minute walk from the house. There is a Walmart within a half mile driving distance from the house. Highland  brewing is one mile away!
notes: I have a fire pit to use if you would like. I also have tubes for floating down the French Broad River with a cooler and its own float. Pick and Drop off included! Just ask me about it!
transit: Buses and Taxis are available. Asheville is very bike friendly as well. Ubers do run in this town.
host_about: I am fun loving and crafty. I am wild and somewhat eccentric at times but basically normal!  I enjoy movies and movie trivia, and karaoke. I love Asheville and all it has to share with me. I have 2 cats, Molly and Smuckers who live in the home with me and can't wait to meet and greet you!  My boyfriend also lives here with me and would be happy to show you around the house. If you  need any tips about this small big city of mine, I'll be glad to help out. My motto is 'YES"!

name: The Grapevine Guest Suite
summary: The Grapevine Guest Suite is a fully furnished studio suite, with modern accommodations and historic charm. It is centrally located just minutes to The Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, Downtown, and the River Arts District.
space: Our guest house is bright, clean and comfy! It has hardwood and tile floors, queen size memory foam bed, cable, wireless internet, linens, dishes, bake and cookware, coffee maker, microwave, small deck. It is centrally located just minutes from the Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, downtown, and Mission Hospital. Most pets are accepted as there is plenty of yard space, but it is only partially fenced.
description: The Grapevine Guest Suite is a fully furnished studio suite, with modern accommodations and historic charm. It is centrally located just minutes to The Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, Downtown, and the River Arts District. Our guest house is bright, clean and comfy! It has hardwood and tile floors, queen size memory foam bed, cable, wireless internet, linens, dishes, bake and cookware, coffee maker, microwave, small deck. It is centrally located just minutes from the Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, downtown, and Mission Hospital. Most pets are accepted as there is plenty of yard space, but it is only partially fenced. The living space is on the second level with exterior stairs. The stairs are a little steep. There is laundry in the unfinished lower level and plenty of off street parking. We have lived in Asheville for 18 years and will always be around to give directions, suggest restaurants, recommend fun things to do, and help with any special needs you may have. We are lo
neighborhood_overview: We are located in an historic neighborhood of small houses that were built to house the employees of the Biltmore Estate. Today it is still a place for quiet hardworking Ashevillians. Don't judge this book by its cover, the outside area is a work in progress.
transit: We are just 2 doors down from Hendersonville Rd or 25 which is the main north/south road through Asheville. We are right on the bus line and there is a grocery store just around the corner.
