host_about:
Hello! I'm an outgoing, conscientious male physician, athlete, and cultural enthusiast. I have a military background. I was a good boy scout...and learned to "always leave the area better than I found it"!  I love to travel to clear my head of the rigors of medical practice, to meet interesting people and to explore various geographies. I own several properties myself and respect the nuances and sensitivities of having a new person in one's dwelling. I enjoy a wide range of activities, but 'active activities' are at the top of the list.  I currently practice a self created philosophy I call 'militant voluntary simplicity' which allows me to live and travel lightly and easily. Cheers!
PS: For extra validation and security, I hold unrestricted medical licenses in NC, SC and Texas...you are welcome to look me up (once we meet I can show ID and last name) at the medical board for any or all. Just websearch the (SC or NC or TX) Medical Board and there will be a link to look up licensees. This profile wont let me put the direct link for you. You will see that I am in good standing (which means my medical and legal records are pristine).Thx in advance!

name: The Lodge
summary: The Lodge, only yards away from a private hot tub and fireside massage, features hardwood floors, a massive stone fireplace open to the master bedroom and living room, and a walk-in shower. With a fully equipped gourmet kitchen.
space: Book your overnight accommodations at The Lodge and enjoy privacy while being only yards away from a private hot tub and fireside massage at Shoji Spa.  The Lodge features hardwood floors, a massive stone fireplace open to the master bedroom and living room, and walk-in slate shower. With a fully equipped gourmet kitchen, prepare your own meals or have meals delivered in by one of our many local restaurants.  Lounge on your large private deck that overlooks the Pisgah National Forest and offers amazing views of Asheville's nighttime skyline.  With two bedrooms and two futons in the living room area, the Lodge sleeps up to six (6) and is perfect for family or friends traveling together or a couple who wants a bit more space to relax.

notes: Staying more than 1 night at Shoji? Our guests now receive a complimentary 1 hour Hot Tub for up to 2 people when 2 consecutive nights are booked. * This soak is a complimentary soak only; it cannot be used to reduce the price of that package.  Book a spa package (hot tub plus massage) at the same time you book your accommodations and receive a 15% discount on 1 night's stay. We charge for the full amount of your stay at the time of booking.  There is a $100 fee for any changes or cancellations after the time of booking.  *If canceling within 30 days prior to your stay, Shoji will provide 100% refund minus $100 fee. If canceling two weeks prior to your stay, Shoji will provide 50% refund. If canceling or changing any portion of your reservation within two weeks, or at anytime during your stay Shoji will not be able to provide any reimbursement.
host_about: Roberta Jordan is the owner of Shoji Spa & Lodge, a  Japanese-inspired outdoor hot tub and day spa in Asheville, NC. The Spa only 10 minutes from downtown, offers contrast therapies including sauna, cold plunge, private outdoor hot tubs, aromatherapy showers, facials and massage therapy.

description: *NEW LISTING* - Cozy 7X11' Gypsy Wagon. Full size bed, space heater, camp sink,kettle,french press,single burner, refrigerator. Shower House and Outhouse nearby. Think fancy camping! The wagon has electricity, a mini fridge, electric kettle and single burner. There is wireless internet in the parking area and throughout some areas of the property, but not reaching the wagon. We invite you to explore our 6 acre homestead, pet the dairy goats or fish in the pond. You will have access to a shared shower house and rustic outhouse, both within a one minute walk from the wagon. We are located less than 1 mile from the Blue Ridge Parkway, and less than 5 miles to Biltmore Estate. We live in a gypsy wagon elsewhere on the property and do hope to meet you during your stay. Feel free to reach out to us duri
neighborhood_overview: Our property is at the end of a dead-end road, with us and our nearby neighbors surrounded by 125 privately owned forest acres east of Asheville.
notes: -Check in will be easily self guided if neither of us are home.  -We do want to stress that what we offer is an old-fashioned outhouse. It is beautiful, spacious, and clean, but it is an outhouse!
transit: The drive to downtown Asheville is less than ten minutes. Bus lines do not run nearby. We recommend having your own transportation. Our property is not conducive to bike travel as the only route to downtown is on a main highway.
host_about:
Hey Ya'll, we are Steve and Kylie.  We were married in 2013 and have been living in our homemade gypsy wagon ever since.  We have shared many magical times with friends and family on our homestead, and decided to build another gypsy wagon in order to share the joy of a simple life with others.
Our day to day consists of caring for our goats, chickens, garden, and each other.

name: Comfortable room in great location!
summary: Our loving and pet-friendly home is located within walking distance of Biltmore Village, restaurants, shops, and breweries. Our lives are full of foods, music, and outdoors. We hope your stay in a private room will make your trip memorable!
space: Our home is decorated nicely and always clean. We do have two energetic and friendly dogs that may ask for a rubbin'. If you take a seat on the couch, you'll probably end up with one on either side and some good cuddles and kisses.  **If you are allergic to or despise creatures of the canine variety... unfortunately, this accommodation may not suit you, but we hope that is not the case!
description: Our loving and pet-friendly home is located within walking distance of Biltmore Village, restaurants, shops, and breweries. Our lives are full of foods, music, and outdoors. We hope your stay in a private room will make your trip memorable! Our home is decorated nicely and always clean. We do have two energetic and friendly dogs that may ask for a rubbin'. If you take a seat on the couch, you'll probably end up with one on either side and some good cuddles and kisses.  **If you are allergic to or despise creatures of the canine variety... unfortunately, this accommodation may not suit you, but we hope that is not the case! Your room is on the second floor with a window facing the backyard. It is furnished with a queen-size bed and a desk. The closet is off limits because we use it for storage, sorry! There are 3 hooks on the wall for hanging things though. The bathroom in the hallway upstairs is for you to use as well. You will be sharing it with Emily but she will stay out of your way
neighborhood_overview: We live in a family neighborhood dating back to the 1800s. Our home was built in 2009. We are only 2.7 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway. We are a half mile away from the main road into Biltmore. Moe's Original BBQ is located on that corner and another restaurant located in the old Biltmore train depot called Village Wayside is right up the road from there. It is one of our favorites. Catawba, French Broad, and Hi-Wire breweries are also about a half mile away. A spa, many shops like J. Crew, Lulu Lemon, and a few local ones are located within Biltmore Village, too. A gas station and multiple banks are within a mile.
transit: It would be convenient to have your own car, of course, but you can manage without one. We have an off-street parking spot for one car, in addition to our own. The public bus, called ART, stops literally feet from our driveway and is pretty navigable. Uber is always an option, too. If needed and if we are available, we will give you rides for a small fee. We are 2.5 miles walking from the middle of downtown and there are safe sidewalks the whole way there... (It's too far for me to walk it though) We are only a mile from the entrance to the Biltmore Estate but once on the grounds, it's 3 miles to the house. We are about a 20 minute drive from the Asheville Regional Airport and about 1 minute off of Interstate-40.
host_about:
Hello BNB-ers! I grew up in mid-Michigan and decided to flee the nest when I was 18 and have been living in Asheville ever since (about 5 years). I love my town almost as much as I love to travel. I spent time backpacking SE Asia in the spring of 2013 and realized the contribution that fellow travelers and those you meet along the way really make to your journey.  I'm in nursing school through Western Carolina University and hope to move West upon graduation. Sometimes my mutt, Lotus, travels with me but sometimes he stays with my friends. Following nursing, my dog, my people, and traveling... is music. Of course it's music. It may not be in that order either but I live for music as long as there isn't too much of a twang involved. And food. Wonderful, weird food. 

I always leave a room cleaner than when I arrived. I even make my bed every morning. My remotes even have a certain arrangement that they must sit in. 

"This is not about being superhuman-- this is about realizing that being human is super." -Sadhguru

name: Peacock Room Near Downtown
summary: Come stay at our comfortable single family home while you visit quirky, eclectic Asheville famous for her mountains, artists, beer and great food.
space: We have a single family home that offers a possibility of several resident arrangements.  The Peacock Room is on the ground floor near the entrance and on the same level as the living room, kitchen and half bathroom.  The front porch and furnished back deck are available at this level.  The room also has a keyed lock for privacy.
description: Come stay at our comfortable single family home while you visit quirky, eclectic Asheville famous for her mountains, artists, beer and great food. We have a single family home that offers a possibility of several resident arrangements.  The Peacock Room is on the ground floor near the entrance and on the same level as the living room, kitchen and half bathroom.  The front porch and furnished back deck are available at this level.  The room also has a keyed lock for privacy. Washing machine and dryer are in the unit. There is a shared full bathroom on the upper level of the house.  Also there is a fully equipped shared kitchen/dining room and living room equipped with a flat screen TV hooked to cable with extensive movie channels/ Netflix. We are a friendly couple that are happy to be here for you...and equally satisfied to honor your request for total privacy.  The rooms in the main house if rented individually are more for those travelers seeking interaction with other like minded sou
neighborhood_overview: Kenilworth is a lovely pedestrian and family friendly neighborhood known for its 1920 homes and bungalows.  We are located just south of Downtown Asheville central and within walking distance  to both funky downtown and chic south Asheville/Biltmore area.  Asheville Mall and the antique shops are less than a 5 minute drive away.  Mission Hospital and AB Tech are around the corner.
transit: At the end of the street is a conveniently located bus stop with bench.  Buses run every 30 minutes and range from $1-$5 to anywhere in town.  Taxis and Ubers are available.  Of course you can walk or rent a bike downtown to enjoy the slower, laid back pace of our town.  Cars can be rented easily from lovely Angela at Avis/Budget nearby.   If you would want to arrange a trip to nearby attractions, we can provide a local to drive you there and even act as a friendly guide at a price lower than traditional taxi fares.

Please come and join us.  We will make every effort to make you feel at home and  your complete privacy will be guaranteed.

name: Cozy Apt- Near Biltmore!
summary: My 1 bedroom, 1 bath apartment is perfect for a short stay in Asheville. The bedroom has a comfy queen size bed. The location is 5 minutes from the mall and Biltmore, and only 10 minutes from downtown. Convenient location!!
space: The apartment is a small/medium two bedroom, one bath apartment. There is a full kitchen, dining room with 6 chairs & a table, and a living room. This is a great place for a quick stay in Asheville. This is my home, so you can expect clothes in the closets and food in the kitchen. It's bright, comfy, and is spacious. You will have the entire apartment to yourself.
description: My 1 bedroom, 1 bath apartment is perfect for a short stay in Asheville. The bedroom has a comfy queen size bed. There is a full kitchen, dining room with 6 chairs & a table, and a living room. This is a great place for a quick stay in Asheville. This is my home, so you can expect clothes in the closets and food in the kitchen. It's bright, comfy, and is spacious. You will have the entire apartment to yourself. You'll have full access to my apartment other than the master bedroom closet. There is a second bedroom that is not open to guests. You will be renting the full apartment, and you'll have very little or no interaction with me. However, you're welcome to call me anytime if you need assistance. This apartment is within 5-8 minutes of the Biltmore, Asheville Mall, Biltmore Village, and many areas to shop and
neighborhood_overview: This apartment is within 5-8 minutes of the Biltmore, Asheville Mall, Biltmore Village, and many areas to shop and eat. If you're interested in heading downtown or to the Blue Ridge Parkway, you're a short 8-10 minute drive away.
notes: As this is intended for one-nighters or weekend stays, there is limited closet/dresser space for storing your clothing. You are welcome to use the kitchen if you'd like.  If you have any questions at all, call me! :)
transit: You'll have 2-3 parking spaces directly in front of the unit. The closest bus stop is about 1/3 of a mile up the hill. You will most likely need your own car in this part of town. You can use Uber if you'd like.

name: Studio Apt, Kingbed, Quiet/Private
summary: Private entrance, full bath, king bed, studio kitchen (stove, refrig, microwave, coffeemaker, toaster) private patio overlooking woods.   2 miles to Biltmore Estate and 3.5 to downtown Asheville. I live upstairs, the apt is separate.
space: You can be in  the mountains or  downtown in minutes and yet  we enjoy a quiet, private neighborhood.  I have lived in Asheville for 21 years and I will do my best to help you make this a wonderful visit.
description: Private entrance, full bath, king bed, studio kitchen (stove, refrig, microwave, coffeemaker, toaster) private patio overlooking woods.   2 miles to Biltmore Estate and 3.5 to downtown Asheville. I live upstairs, the apt is separate. You can be in  the mountains or  downtown in minutes and yet  we enjoy a quiet, private neighborhood.  I have lived in Asheville for 21 years and I will do my best to help you make this a wonderful visit. Off street parking.  Patio that is private for the Apartment.  We (2 of us - myself and my husband, Steve) live upstairs.  We have no pets and we do not smoke inside or out.  We ask the same from our guests. We will share our washer and dryer with guests who stay one week or longer. We have provided brochures on all things Asheville for your visit, and as well, we are only a call or text away and happy to help with information. Our neighborhood is mostly 1960s ranch homes, nice trees and nice people.  If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing place to stay
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is mostly 1960s ranch homes, nice trees and nice people.  If you are looking for a quiet, relaxing place to stay with easy access to downtown Asheville - this is it!  If you want to stay in the heart of Asheville where you can walk to restaurants and bars - this is not it.
notes: We provide off street parking for one car.   Our comfortable living area has a recliner loveseat, tv with access to Netflix and Amazon movies. Wifi
transit: We are approx 2 miles to the Biltmore Estate and 3.5 to the heart of downtown Asheville.
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville for 21 years.  Wow - so many changes here.  I recently retired from 20 years in Marketing with a local corporation and making time now for my passion of painting.
We, my husband Steve and I, are now embarking on an adventure as Airbnb hosts.  We welcome guests into our wonderful, comfy studio apartment and are happy share all we know about Asheville.  We want our guests to enjoy their privacy and relax, but we are always happy to share info.

summary: Your own comfortable house in historic Grove Park neighborhood. Modern comfortable furnishings, and decorations - no B&B "antiques." Enjoy garden views or explore the food, art and scenery of Asheville.

Modern open kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom with king size bed, updated bathroom with claw-foot tub.  Queen size air bed and additional linens available upon request. You don't want to stay in a B&B? We don't blame you. No creaking poster bed, knick-knacks or morning conversation. summary: Enjoy the city in an historic inn, right in downtown. A private, ground floor room with a full-size bed, desk, comfy chair, high ceilings and large window with natural light. With fridge, microwave, ceiling fan. Shared bathroom, cleaned daily.
space: A private, ground floor room with a full-size bed, lounge chair, microwave, ceiling fan, sink, high ceilings, large window with natural light.  Downtown Asheville Outside Your Door At the Gray Rock Inn, downtown Asheville is right outside your door, and our reasonable rates means your money can be spent on enjoying the city. Conveniently located on Biltmore Ave. and an easy walk to breweries, music venues, art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.  The Gray Rock Inn is a great value, a "no frills" but clean and comfy place to explore the city from. Perfect for those that want to spend their time exploring downtown Asheville and not driving.  Walk around downtown and enjoy its bustling and vibrant scene. Or, if you'd just like to relax, sit on our front porch or balcony and relax. After taking it all in you can return to a quiet, private and secure setting. An Historic Inn With a Background as Interesting as Asheville The Gray Rock Inn is a classic 106 year old building, housing both sh

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop that is open to the public. Across the street are the Orange Peel music hall and Wicked Weed Brewery. Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
notes: Please communicate your arrival time so we can be there for you. Check-in is by appointment only. Confirm with us ahead of time if you will be arriving late. Rooms are stocked with hand soap and towels. The room has a window air conditioner for the summer months.
transit: Public transit bus stops are in front of the building, going north and south. Asheville's main bus depot is 4 city blocks to the west. There is some parking in the back, and pay parking next door.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

name: Solo Traveler's Room Near Downtown
summary: Welcome to your urban sanctuary! With happening downtown out the front door and acres of gardens out the back, this location is perfect for experiencing all Asheville has to offer. A private room designed with the solo traveller in mind!
space: Looking for even more space? Take a look at our room with 2 full beds: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/8209645 I have travelled around the world using AirBnB and have loved every single experience. Now my boyfriend, Nick, and I have settled in our favorite city - Asheville! We are excited to be offering travelers a peaceful retreat, just steps from the heart of downtown, with vast gardens and woods to explore in the backyard. This is the best spot to be in Asheville. We hope you love it as much as we do! Our home is warm, peaceful, and environmentally conscious. The walls are painted with clay-based paint, we compost food scraps, and cook using local ingredients. Our property is adjacent to the Ashevillage Sanctuary, a beautiful educational center with two acres of permaculture gardens, food forests, and natural buildings throughout. You are welcome to respectfully walk through the land, especially as to reach Beaucatcher Overlook Park. This is 30 acres of woodland and trails perfect for
description: Welcome to your urban sanctuary! With happening downtown out the front door and acres of gardens out the back, this location is perfect for experiencing all Asheville has to offer. A private room designed with the solo traveller in mind! Looking for even more space? Take a look at our room with 2 full beds: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/8209645 I have travelled around the world using AirBnB and have loved every single experience. Now my boyfriend, Nick, and I have settled in our favorite city - Asheville! We are excited to be offering travelers a peaceful retreat, just steps from the heart of downtown, with vast gardens and woods to explore in the backyard. This is the best spot to be in Asheville. We hope you love it as much as we do! Our home is warm, peaceful, and environmentally conscious. The walls are painted with clay-based paint, we compost food scraps, and cook using local ingredients. Our property is adjacent to the Ashevillage Sanctuary, a beautiful educational center with tw
neighborhood_overview: Our house is perfectly located between city and nature. It is just a short walk out the front door to happening downtown Asheville, yet our house is tranquil enough to feel as if we were miles away. Out our backdoor is acres of the beautiful gardens and natural buildings of Ashevillage Institute. Beyond this is another 30 acres of woodlands, part of Beaucatcher Overlook Park. We love our urban sanctuary! An extra plus is the Minor League Asheville Tourists' Baseball Field down the street. Season runs April through mid-September.
notes: Although we don't have any animals of our own, we are a pet friendly home  : ) We have an additional $25 cleaning fee for pets who stay in our rooms.
transit: We are happy to offer shuttles to and from airport and around town if needed for a small fee. However, we always walk to and from downtown so you are likely not to need much transportation once you make it here. There is also a bus stop at the bottom of our street to take you greater distances. 10min walk to Downtown Asheville  (French Broad Food Co-op and the Orange Peel are closer) 5min drive to the Biltmore Estate 10min drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway 10 min drive to Haywood Rd in West Asheville
host_about:
I am a sustainability educator, group facilitator, event planner, cook, and gardener. My partner and I have spent time living and teaching in communities throughout Europe, West Africa, and Central America. When not on the road we are constantly hosting amazing guests from around the world. 

We hand picked Asheville as the place to call home because of the creative culture, friendly people, happening urban life, endless things to do, and gorgeous mountains that surround the city on all sides. After months of searching, our dream house found us. Close to downtown, nature all around, many rooms for entertaining, and the best neighbors ever - the Ashevillage Institute! Check them out online.

The decision to open our rooms for AirBnB was a no brainer. We have used this incredible service dozens of times abroad and never have a bad experience. This is our way of returning the favor : )
street: Buchanan Place, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

name: AA Asheville Walk to Downtown!!
space: Walk to the heart of downtown Asheville in less than 10-minutes!  We are located steps from the minor league baseball field.  Hardwood floors throughout, washer and dryer, shared bathroom (there's only one in the home), likely the best kitchen in Asheville, front porch with a view of the blue ridge mountains, and a fenced in backyard.  In the summer enjoy fresh blueberries, tomatoes and various fresh vegetables from the garden; or, walk to the Saturday farmer's market.   Two rooms are rented via Airbnb or long-term (3-months for traveling nurses and P.T. interns at the hospital), the third room in the home is mine (I live here).  We will consider a well-behaved dog with deposit.  I have one LARGE pooch (85 pounds) currently.   Note: The steps to get up to my house are "steep", with no handrails. You can walk up the driveway and enter in the back of the home (no steps). Please don't park in or block the driveway, unless you need to unload.  I'm a female, outdoor person who loves biking,

notes: Reminder: 3-bedrooms (one is mine, two are rented). One bathroom. No breakfast or food served/provided (you're on your own), as is typical with Airbnb rentals. Coffee and tea are available. Mugs are hanging next to the sink. Additionally, once confirmed, please print out the confirmation and house manual (address, my phone number, etc!!)
transit: Walking distance to downtown; very close to the orange peel and wicked weed brewery. I recommend downloading the UBER app. It's usually only $5.00 to get where you need to go.
host_about: Outdoor, adventure enthusiast.  Professional therapist, educator, writer, advocate.

name: Mountain Sunset, Walk to Downtown
summary: The heart of downtown is just a short 15 minute walk away and the Orange Peel venue is only a 13 minute walk away.
space: We love our condo in Downtown Asheville. From our condo, it's an easy stroll to downtown to get a cup of coffee, enjoy dinner or drinks, stroll through an art gallery, or catch a baseball game. We are far enough out, though, that we still get a restful night's sleep.  Please pardon the photo quality. This summer we repainted and refreshed our whole condo. We have homespun pictures at the moment, but are getting higher quality pics soon.  We would love to have you come share our home! You would have your own bedroom with a sunset view looking towards downtown. You would also have access to the kitchen, living room, bathroom, wifi, and parking. Our home is pet-free. The Biltmore Estate is about a 10 minute drive. The Grove Park Inn is about a 10 minute drive. A plethora of restaurants are in 12 minute walking distance or a 5 minute drive. The River Arts district is about an 8 minute drive away as well (you could walk if you love big hills). One of the access roads to the Blue Ridge Parkw

From our condo, it's an easy stroll to downtown to get a cup of coffee, enjoy dinner or drinks, stroll through an art gallery, or catch a baseball game. We are far enough out, though, that we still get a restful night's sleep.  Please pardon the photo quality. This summer we repainted and refreshed our whole condo. The Biltmore Estate is about a 10 minute drive. The Grove Park Inn is about a 10 minute drive. A plethora of restaurants are in 12 minute walking distance or a 5 minute drive. The River Arts district is about an
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is convenient to downtown though not amidst the traffic and noise.
notes: Important: Once you book, please skim the house manual which serves as an FAQ. It will answer most pertinent post-booking questions. We do not own pets.  Parking at our condo is free. If you're driving downtown, rather than walking, event parking can range from $5 to $10. Mon - Saturday street parking meters don't charge after 6pm. You'll likely spend about a dollar an hour at most parking decks and metered parking. Take plenty of quarters for metered or you can use the passport parking app. Uber ride is about $5 We are a legally recognized Homestay permitted by the city of Asheville. The definition of a Homestay means this is our primary residence. Short term vacation rentals (29 days or less) are restricted in Asheville city, but we do have permission to operate for short term rentals as a licensed homestay.  Check photos for permit.
transit: To get downtown, we usually walk. We recommend driving or using public transit if you are traveling beyond the downtown area.
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville, NC for 12 years and my husband has lived here for most of his life. We love living so close to downtown and enjoying all the great dining and breweries in this town. We also love running, hiking, and other outdoor activities. On quiet days at home, I like reading and crochet. 

One of our favorite trips was going to Banff in the Canadian Rockies. We had an amazing snowboarding vacation there! We also really enjoyed our trip to Jamaica to go scuba diving. 

I teach middle school and Michael owns a property management company. We love hosting friends and family, and are looking forward to meeting you!

name: Downtown 1 Queen Bedroom (5)
summary: Downtown Asheville's Private Room Youth Hostel since 2004. Keyed private bedroom and shared lockable bathroom. Although reservations can span or depart Saturday, we are closed for check-ins on Saturdays.
space: Rooms change often, but this listing is for a room with at least one Queen bed, sleeping two in the same bed. Our guests walk around downtown to the dozens of restaurants, breweries & music venues. They tell us that our location is the most important aspect of their stay. We are honored to have had so many wonderful guests stay with us over the years.

They tell us that our location is the most important aspect of their stay. We are honored to have had so many wonderful guests stay with us over the years. Free Wifi, free physical computer access, free do-it-yourself pancakes and or waffles, free coffee & tea, as well as ability to store and prepare food. Staff personally check in all guests, showing what is available to the guest as well as where to store food & house rules. We also go over the map of downtown if interested, or help find places of interest. As a small International Youth Hostel since 2004, it is not uncommon to meet & rela
neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet street in the central business district, but all of downtown is within a few blocks from us. For example, we have 10 breweries from 1-3 blocks from us.
notes: We send a text at 3:30pm on the arrival date to the phone listed in the reservation in order to schedule arrival times starting at 4pm.
transit: The central transit station where all city buses come to and depart from is one block away from us. The Greyhound station is 1.4 miles from us.
host_about:
Downtown Asheville's Private Room International Youth Hostel since 2004.
The consistently highest rated & oldest standing Asheville Hostel. 
Keyed private rooms, shared lockable bathrooms. 
No bunks or dorm rooms. 
The Tiny House is the only room with a bathroom in the room.

Walk to anything downtown in less than 11 minutes!
Our properties are in the Central Business District.
3 blocks from the center of town; Vance monument, or Pritchard Park. 

Our mission has always been to be a simple, clean, safe, & affordable place for young travelers.

Children are permitted if supervised by parent.
We do not accept walk-up reservations
Please reserve online in advance.
We don't accept animals or pets.

We begin checking in scheduled reserved guests after 4 pm.

Rooms change often.
Even though the room you are checked into may not look exactly like the one in the picture:
1. A listing for a Queen bed will be a room with at least a Queen bed, sleeping together.
2. A listing for 2 Twin beds will be a room with at least two Twin beds, sleeping separately. 
3. A listing for the Tiny House is always the Tiny House, there is only one.

Although our Airbnb profile was created in 2012, we didn't go live until April 24th 2015. 

All Airbnb reservations require at least a two night minimum, two guest maximum, which helps us keep the price down & value up.

We will respond to reservation requests after 4 pm est if not earlier.

Reservations can span or depart Saturdays, but we are closed for check-ins on Saturdays.

Any changes to Airbnb reservations including; cancellations, date changes, refunds, extenuating circumstances, etc, must be initiated by you through Airbnb. Please do not ask us to make these types of changes for you, as we have very limited control over Airbnb's reservation system. We can only fully control our own reservation system.

name: Downtown Bob Marley House
summary: A funky little home for those travelers desiring a clean, fun and relaxing environment from which to explore the city. This house is just a ten minute scenic walk to downtown, and is only a couple of miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway's hiking trails.
space: Mellow & Funky Enjoy yourself
description: A funky little home for those travelers desiring a clean, fun and relaxing environment from which to explore the city. This house is just a ten minute scenic walk to downtown, and is only a couple of miles to the Blue Ridge Parkway's hiking trails. Mellow & Funky Enjoy yourself Kitchen, Living Room with Projector, Bedroom, and Bathroom, and Front porch for smoking cigarettes. The short walk to downtown is both highly scenic and full of free, fresh fruit! notes: We send a text at 3:30pm on the arrival date to the phone listed in the reservation in order to schedule arrival times starting at 4pm.

host_about:
Downtown Asheville's Private Room International Youth Hostel since 2004.
The consistently highest rated & oldest standing Asheville Hostel. 
Keyed private rooms, shared lockable bathrooms. 
No bunks or dorm rooms. 
The Tiny House is the only room with a bathroom in the room.

Walk to anything downtown in less than 11 minutes!
Our properties are in the Central Business District.
3 blocks from the center of town; Vance monument, or Pritchard Park. 

Our mission has always been to be a simple, clean, safe, & affordable place for young travelers.

Children are permitted if supervised by parent.
We do not accept walk-up reservations
Please reserve online in advance.
We don't accept animals or pets.

We begin checking in scheduled reserved guests after 4 pm.

Rooms change often.
Even though the room you are checked into may not look exactly like the one in the picture:
1. A listing for a Queen bed will be a room with at least a Queen bed, sleeping together.
2. A listing for 2 Twin beds will be a room with at least two Twin beds, sleeping separately. 
3. A listing for the Tiny House is always the Tiny House, there is only one.

Although our Airbnb profile was created in 2012, we didn't go live until April 24th 2015. 

All Airbnb reservations require at least a two night minimum, two guest maximum, which helps us keep the price down & value up.

We will respond to reservation requests after 4 pm est if not earlier.

Reservations can span or depart Saturdays, but we are closed for check-ins on Saturdays.

Any changes to Airbnb reservations including; cancellations, date changes, refunds, extenuating circumstances, etc, must be initiated by you through Airbnb. Please do not ask us to make these types of changes for you, as we have very limited control over Airbnb's reservation system. We can only fully control our own reservation system.

name: 2 Beds, Private Room near Downtown
summary: Welcome to your urban sanctuary! With happening downtown out the front door and acres of gardens out the back, this location is perfect for experiencing all Asheville has to offer. Bedroom features two full size beds, ideal for families and friends.
space: Traveling alone? Maybe you'd prefer our other room: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/8654108 I have travelled around the world using AirBnB and have loved every single experience. Now my boyfriend, Nick, and I have settled in our favorite city - Asheville! We are excited to be offering travelers a peaceful retreat, just steps from the heart of downtown, with vast gardens and woods to explore in the backyard. This is the best spot to be in Asheville. We hope you love it as much as we do! Our home is warm, peaceful, and environmentally conscious. The walls are painted with clay-based paint, we compost food scraps, and cook using local ingredients.  Our property is adjacent to the Ashevillage Sanctuary, a beautiful educational center with two acres of permaculture gardens, food forests, and natural buildings throughout. You are welcome to respectfully walk through the land, especially as to reach Beaucatcher Overlook Park. This is 60 acres of woodland and trails perfect for dog-walking or tak

The walls are painted with clay-based paint, we compost food scraps, and cook using local ingredients.  Our property is adjacent to the Ashevillage Sanctuary, a beautiful educational center with two acre
neighborhood_overview: Our house is perfectly located between city and nature. It is just a short walk out the front door to happening downtown Asheville, yet our house is tranquil enough to feel as if we were miles away. Out our backdoor is acres of the beautiful gardens and natural buildings of Ashevillage Institute. Beyond this is another 50 acres of woodlands, part of Beaucatcher Overlook Park. We love our urban sanctuary! An extra plus is the Minor League Asheville Tourists' Baseball Field down the street. Season runs April through mid-September.
notes: We can provide a small cot with bedding in the room if you need to sleep an extra guest. This is an additional $30 for the cot.  Although we don't have any animals of our own, we are a pet friendly home  : ) We have an additional $25 cleaning fee for pets who stay in our rooms.
transit: We are happy to offer shuttles to and from airport and around town if needed for a small fee. However, we always walk to and from downtown so you are likely not to need much transportation once you make it here. There is also a bus stop at the bottom of our street to take you greater distances. 10min walk to Downtown Asheville  (French Broad Food Co-op and the Orange Peel are closer) 5min drive to the Biltmore Estate 10min drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway 10 min drive to Haywood Rd in West Asheville
host_about:
I am a sustainability educator, group facilitator, event planner, cook, and gardener. My partner and I have spent time living and teaching in communities throughout Europe, West Africa, and Central America. When not on the road we are constantly hosting amazing guests from around the world. 

We hand picked Asheville as the place to call home because of the creative culture, friendly people, happening urban life, endless things to do, and gorgeous mountains that surround the city on all sides. After months of searching, our dream house found us. Close to downtown, nature all around, many rooms for entertaining, and the best neighbors ever - the Ashevillage Institute! Check them out online.

The decision to open our rooms for AirBnB was a no brainer. We have used this incredible service dozens of times abroad and never have a bad experience. This is our way of returning the favor : )

name: Guest Room at Oakland Cottage B&B
space: Reserve the Garden Room, Magnolia Suite or Dogwood Suite, each one a guest room at Oakland Cottage Bed and Breakfast in Asheville, NC.  Choose any one of these guest rooms (based on availability) for your Vacation In Asheville. The Garden Room #5, on the second floor, has a king bed, full private bath with jetted tub/shower combination, in-room mini-fridge, microwave and coffee maker, cable-TV, WIFI and private balcony.  Additional daybed w trundle is in the room for an additional guest or two.  Dogwood Suite is on the main floor with a private outside entry & porch in addition to the inside hallway entry.  Entry foyer has a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker as well as a daybed with trundle for an extra guest or two.  Full private bath is tiled and has a spacious shower (no tub).   In-room cable TV, WIFI. The Magnolia Suite is on the second floor and is a two room one bath Suite.  King bed and Cable TV in the main room of this Suite.  Double doors open to "sun-room" with bay window

name: Downtown Tiny House
summary: Renting rooms in downtown since 2004.  3 blocks from the center of downtown.   Although reservations can span Saturday, we are closed for check-ins on Saturdays.
space: VERY small separate apartment for 1-2 guests.  Full size bed. (A few inches smaller than a Queen) Interior square footage is only around 12 x 12 feet. Kitchenette; refrigerator, sink & coffee maker.  AC & heat temperature is controlled by the guest. A few guests have taken issue with the fact that the bathroom only has a curtain, and no door.  Our guests walk around downtown to the dozens of restaurants, breweries & music venues. They tell us that our location is the most important aspect of their stay. We are honored to have had so many wonderful guests stay with us over the years.

Our guests walk around downtown to the dozens of restaurants, breweries & music venues. They tell us that our location is the most important aspect of their stay. We are honored to have had so many wonderful guests stay with us over the years. Tiny House guests also have access to the main building where there is a computer, and other kitchen options, and more space to stretch out. neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet street in the central business district. Everything downtown is less than an 11 minute walk. We have 9 breweries from 1-3 blocks from us, and much more! Check out our Airbnb 'Guidebook'. We have gone over the map of downtown with whomever wants to for 10+ years, but now everyone has phones, so please ask us to point out places that you might be interested in, or our favorite places to go for what you are looking for.
notes: We would like to stress how tiny this accommodation is. The photos make it look larger than it actually is.
transit: One block from the central bus station where all local city buses start and end.  Catch a city bus to the Asheville Regional Airport which is 15 miles away for $1 during certain hours/ days. Taxis have been around $45 one way, so try Uber or rent a car for the airport otherwise. We are 1.4 miles from the Greyhound bus station.

summary: Come be the FIRST guests in our newly constructed apartment.  The apartment is one bedroom with an open concept bright living space.  It is located on the bottom level of our beautiful 1920's craftsman bungalow in the heart of downtown Asheville.
space: We have spent this winter designing and constructing a beautiful and bright downstairs apartment in our 1920's Craftsman style bungalow in downtown Asheville.  We are full-time farmers and full-time parents and are looking forward to hosting families, couples and friends in our new space.  Our family lives upstairs and the downstairs apartment is one bedroom, one bathroom with large and bright windows throughout.  The bathroom has the old cast iron tub original to the house, new fixtures, pedestal sink and travertine tile floors (throughout the apartment).  The living area and kitchen are one room with brand new Ikea cabinets, bright yellow paint and radiant floor heat (throughout the apartment).  The living room has a double sized fold out futon for extra sleeping space.  The bedroom  has a ceiling fan, open bookshelves, queen sized bed and a small closet for hanging your clothes.  There is a lovely porch off the private entrance to the apartment for sitting in the evenings or wheneve

name: MODERN RIVER ARTS ECO-COTTAGE
summary: Modern 2-level cottage with comfy rustic furnishings. Super clean, comfy queen beds, bedrooms with vaulted ceilings, and independent heating/cooling for each room! Blocks from White Duck Taco, Wedge Brewing, Grey Eagle, restaurants, galleries, etc.
space: Welcome to my modern eco-cottage in the heart of the River Arts Districtl! My home is newly built, bright and clean, and a 20-min walk from downtown Asheville. It has 2 bedrooms with queen beds, and a sofa in the living room that folds into a full-size bed for a 5th person. There is a TV with Roku in the living room and a wireless TV in one of the bedrooms, and Netflix is available on both of them. I provide coffee, tea, cereal, and milk to get you started in the mornings!
description: Modern 2-level cottage with comfy rustic furnishings. Super clean, comfy queen beds, bedrooms with vaulted ceilings, and independent heating/cooling for each room! Blocks from White Duck Taco, Wedge Brewing, Grey Eagle, restaurants, galleries, etc. Welcome to my modern eco-cottage in the heart of the River Arts Districtl! My home is newly built, bright and clean, and a 20-min walk from downtown Asheville. It has 2 bedrooms with queen beds, and a sofa in the living room that folds into a full-size bed for a 5th person. There is a TV with Roku in the living room and a wireless TV in one of the bedrooms, and Netflix is available on both of them. I provide coffee, tea, cereal, and milk to get you started in the mornings! Guests also have access to the full house and there is free off-street parking for 2 cars in the driveway. I live in town and am available if guests need me. A 20-min walk will take you into downtown Asheville with its many restaurants, bars, breweries, shops, galleries, t
neighborhood_overview: A 20-min walk will take you into downtown Asheville with its many restaurants, bars, breweries, shops, galleries, theaters, and other activities. A 10-15 min walk will bring you to the South Slope neighborhood, a hotbed of local microbreweries (the Wedge Brewery, High Wire, Green Man, Burial, Twin Leaf, Wicked Weed, Asheville Brewing Company). Walk 5 minutes downhill and explore the galleries, coffee shops, restaurants, and pubs along the French Broad River in the River Arts District, or check out a show at the Grey Eagle, a fantastic music venue just a few blocks from the house!
notes: I am happy to offer rides to/from the Asheville airport for $35. Just let me know if you would like a ride!
transit: The Gray Line Trolley sight-seeing tours and the La Zoom comedy bus tours are really fun ways to see the town!
host_about: I'm originally from Chicago, went to school in Iowa, and worked on agricultural and food policy at the Environmental Protection Agency in DC for 7 years before I moved to Asheville in 2013. I love interesting food, craft beer, and music, and I love sharing all of these with good friends, both old and new. I also love to travel and meet interesting people, and I'm excited to provide a cozy resting spot for fellow travelers looking to explore the area. Hope to see you soon!

name: CasaLina
summary: Welcome to CasaLina! Built a hundred years ago, is now open for you to experience the confort and coziness of this little house full of character and ornamented with the colorful culture of the people of the Americas.
space: Welcome to CasaLina! This is a newly renovated arts and crafts bungalow from the 1920's, centrally located. The location of the house is minutes from south slope brewing district, Biltmore Village, downtown Asheville or the River Arts District. CasaLina is a very comfortable and cozy environment with art work featuring Latin America culture.  Guests will enjoy full access of the house. Two Bedrooms, dining room, living room, bathroom, kitchen and lovely front porch. CasaLina is located in one of the more diverse areas of town. Hamilton is a mixed use street with several medical related businesses and residential housing. It is a relatively quiet street with not much through traffic.

space: Walking distance to central downtown Asheville, with mountain and city views from huge deck. Located in established family neighborhood with newer residents moving into the area and restoring the homes. Our home is one of the most recently renovated houses and one of the nicest houses on this narrow city street. Neighborhood has survived the many transitions of downtown Asheville, while holding on to the charm of this historic downtown community. Come prepared to live like the locals of downtown Asheville!

name: Champagne Tastes on a Beer Budget
summary: Downtown 2 Bedroom, 1 Bathroom Apartment With Free Off Street Parking For 2 Cars
space: Finally, there's an answer to champagne tastes on a beer budget: the hip, affordable and new-to-market Ann Street Suite. One of Asheville's freshest rentals, this sweet suite doesn't sacrifice luxury for affordability: bold artwork and stylish furnishings, sprinkled with a helping of modern chic, decorate the apartment – the epitome of Asheville's artsy-cool vibe. Summit the stairs to this top-floor apartment, situated right in the center of Asheville's vibrant arts scene, and open the door to a space bathed in creativity. Pops of color pepper the apartment and metal-mounted graffiti art and local WNC landscape photography decorate the walls. Twin bedrooms offer cushy Tempur-Pedic mattresses – take your pick of king or double -– and the kitchen is outfitted in high-end Ikea. Walk back downstairs, and at your feet are all of Asheville's downtown eateries, art galleries, breweries and cultural destinations. The Ann Street Suite is Asheville's up-and-coming vacation rental: new to the mar
description: Downtown 2 Bedroom, 1 Bathroom Apartment With Free Off Street Parking For 2 Cars Finally, there's an answer to champagne tastes on a beer budget: the hip, affordable and new-to-market Ann Street Suite. One of Asheville's freshest rentals, this sweet suite doesn't sacrifice luxury for affordability: bold artwork and stylish furnishings, sprinkled with a helping of modern chic, decorate the apartment – the epitome of Asheville's artsy-cool vibe. Summit the stairs to this top-floor apartment, situated right in the center of Asheville's vibrant arts scene, and open the door to a space bathed in creativity. Pops of color pepper the apartment and metal-mounted graffiti art and local WNC landscape photography decorate the walls. Twin bedrooms offer cushy Tempur-Pedic mattresses – take your pick of king or double -– and the kitchen is outfitted in high-end Ikea. Walk back downstairs, and at your feet are all of Asheville's downtown eateries, art galleries, breweries and cultural destinations.
neighborhood_overview: In addition to the superb location, the Apartment has been completely renovated with brand new appliances and furnishings. The beautiful artwork is of the surrounding mountains and local graffiti art.   North Ann Street runs perpendicular with Haywood Street and Patton Avenue. The interstate is easily accessed from the property, with the added bonus of two free off-street parking spaces, in the heart of downtown Asheville
notes: Rates include taxes.
transit: Public bus stops are all over downtown and the corner of blocks.
host_about:
The owner, Jeremy Goldstein has made 32 North Ann Street a project since he purchased the property in 2002, slowly make improvements and while running his business in the building directly next door. 

Over the past 20 years, Jeremy has built a successful multi-disciplinary real estate practice. Jeremy graduated cum laude from Duke University in 1994 with a Bachelor of Arts degree in Public Policy Studies. He held salesperson licenses in Virginia, Maryland, and the District of Columbia and currently maintains broker licenses in North Carolina and South Carolina.

Mr. Goldstein advises private and institutional investors nationwide in the acquisition, disposition, and financing of commercial property. 
He married an Asheville native, and together they moved to Asheville to raise their four sons.  He spends his  “free" time traveling with his family to their sons' sporting events. Eventually, he hopes to get back to hiking and biking in the beautiful mountains of Western North Carolina. But for now he manages to get to Crossfit — unfortunately well before the sun comes up, in addition to serving as Chairman of  Asheville Planning & Zoning Commission and board member to Irene Wortham Center.

neighborhood_overview: "The River Arts District consists of a vast array of artists and working studios set in an urban scene of old factories and historical buildings. Everywhere you turn, art abounds - with creativity happening around every corner. The former warehouse district has grown to house nearly 200 studios and galleries in more than 20 historic buildings."
notes: Yall can help yourself to condiments, tea/coffee, food, etc. Clean sheets, clean towels, basic toiletries , Ac and Heat.

host_about: B and I are open minded, University of Georgia grads that have traveled the world and decided to call this wonderful/eclectic mountain town home! B is a local business owner and I'm a sales representative. We enjoy all things nature, craft brews, and our dog!  We look forward to having you in our home :)

name: Beautiful historic home downtown
summary: The house is beautifully furnished with amazing original details. The location is unbeatable; a five minute walk to downtown, a five minute walk to the breweries of south slope, and a ten minute walk to the river arts district galleries.
space: This house is a historic gem located at the center of Asheville's most happening neighborhoods, just a five minute walk from downtown. There are five retired fire places, a great kitchen for entertaining and cooking, a wrap-around front porch, and plenty of space to relax and retreat. The house has two upstairs bedrooms each with a queen bed, and an extra mattress can be set up to accommodate two more upstairs. There is an additional artist studio/guest room in the backyard with a queen sized bed. It is a very charming but rustic studio; please note there is no toilet in the back studio, so guests will need to venture inside to use the loo. The back space has no central heat but passive solar keeps it fairly toasty. The main house has gas heat that keeps it nice and warm in the winter. The backyard is expansive and peaceful.

neighborhood_overview: The home is located on historic South French Broad Avenue, just a block from Aston park where you can catch amazing sunset views. A four block jaunt north will deliver you to downtown, where there are endless restaurants and shopping. Four blocks east is the burgeoning South Slope area, where there are over a dozen breweries and more restaurants (and the famous Orange Peel music venue). Four blocks west is the River Arts District, where there are countless art galleries and more good restaurants. You really couldn't hope for a better or more central location in Asheville.
transit: Plentiful street parking, almost anything is walkable.
host_about: I'm from North Carolina, love music and mountains and good people:)

neighborhood_overview: Located ideally near the edge of downtown, Skyloft offers the benefits of proximity to downtown with ease of parking, long range views and a more natural setting.  We like to get around and explore, and one of our favorite things is the incredible ease of getting to downtown, Tunnel Rd. area (grocery stores and mall), Biltmore Estate (5 min), the Blue Ridge Parkway, Asheville City Market, River Arts District, and the rest of Asheville's neighborhoods.  Located very close to McCormick field, the rooftop deck offers an incredible viewing spot for summer fireworks shows during the Asheville Tourists baseball season.
notes: The City of Asheville only allows for one short-term rental per month.
host_about:
Our favorite things about Asheville - the outdoors (hiking, biking, tubing), eating (amazing food opportunities), the beer scene, the arts, farm to table movement, focus on sustainability, the local soccer scene, and quality of life.

J.D. is a native of Wisconsin, and Alicia was raised in northern Virginia.   We have two daughters and a cocker spaniel.

name: Private Room with Full Bathroom
summary: Eco-friendly, great location - 5-15 minute walk to downtown, parks and restaurants. Wi-fi, TV with premium cable channels and Netflix. A/C, refrigerator, coffee maker, filtered water. Safe and relaxed atmosphere.  Easy parking. Great neighborhood.
space: This is a private room on the second floor of the main house. Our family (including two kids 6&7, a dog and cats) lives here, and we are respectful of your privacy. The room is well equipped with a nice queen size bed,  flat screen 40 inch TV with cable and Netflix, and a mini fridge. You have your own bathroom with shower. You have access to the downstairs kitchen. If you are looking for an unique space that is charming and full of history but part of a friendly, vibrant, progressive, creative community you will enjoy staying with us and we will enjoy hosting you!

neighborhood_overview: Montford is a cozy, tree-lined neighborhood with sidewalks that is historic, yet progressive and friendly.  Our house was designed and built by Richard Sharp Smith, the supervising architect of the Biltmore Estate, who designed many houses in Montford in the early 20th century and helped to define the character of the city in his time. Thomas Wolfe and O. Henry are buried in the 10-acre cemetery located five minutes from the house. There are free, outdoor Shakespeare performances during the summer and early fall at the nearby park.
notes: Keep in mind we have 2 kids (6 & 7) living here on weekends. They are well behaved and are very social but they are kids. We also have 2 cats (very friendly) and a 10 month old puppy (overly friendly). The room is very quiet but there can be the occasional outburst.
transit: It's a 10 minute walk or two minute drive to downtown Asheville. We are on the transit route. Uber and taxis are available as well. One of the best restaurants in Asheville is just down the street. The grocery stores: Trader Joe's, Earth Fare, Whole Foods, the local food coop, Ingles, and Harris Teeter are all within a five minute drive.

name: The Tarot House
summary: Roomy two-story 1917 Craftsman bungalow. Step back in time to 1920's Asheville. From one to four people welcome. Ideal for family or friends getaway. Centrally located on quiet residential street, only a few blocks from restaurants & shops.
space: You and the members of your group will be the only guests at any given time. You will have private use of two adjoining bedrooms and one bath, and access to all the other rooms seen in the photos. This space is ideal for a family group or a group of friends-who-feel-like family and want to save money at the cost of some privacy. You can also save money by preparing meals in the well-equipped kitchen. This is my home, so I'll be sharing the public spaces.

Guests sleeping in the double bedroom p
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a wonderful mix of residential and commercial. Shops, restaurants and grocery stores are all within walking distance. There is a community garden around the corner and backyard chickens next door. No rooster!
notes: The Tarot House has been issued 2015 Asheville City Home Stay Permit #15753.
transit: The bus stop is less than a block away. Downtown Asheville is a twenty to thirty minute walk. I'll give you a map that shows two walking routes that keep you off the busy main thoroughfare.
host_about: I've lived in this wonderful urban oasis forty years. I enjoy walking to downtown Asheville or to UNCA. I'm retired after working in public and university libraries, including a dozen years in our local history archive. I enjoy singing in a chorus, gardening in my back yard, and making three-dimensional art. The Tarot House is decorated with my art, much of it inspired by my interest in Tarot Cards. Readings are available.

name: Hidden treasure near Downtown, UNCA
space: Our private guest bedroom is ready for you!  You will have a queen size bed and private bath with large walk-in shower, plus a private deck.  This guest bedroom has a private entrance and off-street parking.  A small refrigerator and coffee maker (coffee, cream, and sugar!) are provided. We have two acres that includes several garden areas and wooded land. It is an unusual setting so close to town!  The guestroom is located on the first floor of a large addition completed just a few years ago and is attached to the original 1890's home.   You will be very close, walking distance to Downtown Asheville and the UNCA campus. There is great strolling in the neighborhood along some of Asheville's growing greenway system.  You may also walk to several near-by spots, 5 Points Diner, Greenlife, Trader Joe's, High Five Coffee are all very close.  For nightlife, you will be near to all the hub-bub and fun of Downtown Asheville, totally walkable from our home. We have a small sweet dog and one mel

transit: Taxi or Uber drivers are readily available with a phone call.
host_about:
My husband and I renovated our historic home in 2003 then built an addition in 2010.  We have lived in Asheville since 1993 when we each moved here for jobs.  Tim is an architect and, I work part time for an association and a local caterer.  Tim grew up in Buffalo NY and I am from Georgia.  We garden, keep bees and enjoy entertaining at our home.  

Asheville is a most wonderful place.  I can't think of anywhere else I would want to live!  It is great fun to share our fun city and community with visitors.

name: Location! Location! Location!
summary: Montford is the Historic District that borders Downtown on the north side. Ask any Ashevillian and they'll tell you that Montford is where you want to be for access to all of the wonderful things Asheville has to offer.
space: Welcome Home, We offer one private bedroom with attached private bathroom in a 1915 arts and crafts Historic Montford home. Walk three blocks through the historic streets and you're downtown. Enjoy some of the world's best breweries, dining, music, and visual art in a most casual community. We are "Friendly!"  There are two bedrooms in the home. They both include their own private bathroom. The kitchen is available for your use. All of the normal kitchen tools are available but we don't believe in microwaves so you won't find one of those. We are usually available to point you in the right direction or even join you downtown. We are both big fans of our city and we know all the culinary hotspots as well as music venues and art walks. Email in advance for assistance with booking tours such BrewsCruise or LaZoom. We are glad to help.

neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood is the one and only Historic Montford. Any Ashevillian will tell you that this is the premier neighborhood for easy access to downtown and a safe and quiet environment at night.
notes: Check our guidebook for our favorite spots and if you have any questions about Asheville or things to do ask ask ask. We are Ashevilloisseurs, Beer Geeks, Art nerds, Foodies, and Music Junkies.
transit: Public transit is available within a few blocks.
host_about:
Meg and I are from small farming towns in the mountains of Western North Carolina outside of Asheville. We've traveled all around this big world and proudly believe that Asheville is the best city on earth. 
Our home is in Historic Montford which was established in 1893 and occupied by only about 50 people most of which who were business men in the city. Many of these residents would find immortality in Thomas Wolfe's autobiography "Look Homeward Angel." 
Though predominantly single family homes, land use in Montford has been mixed since the earliest days of development. The old Highland Hospital, located off the northern end of Montford Avenue, was the scene of a deadly fire in 1948, among the victims was Zelda Fitzgerald, wife of F. Scott Fitzgerald.
Just off Pearson Drive is Riverside Cemetery which is the final resting spot for some of Asheville's most prominent citizens, including Thomas Wolfe, O Henry (William Sydney Porter), governors of North Carolina, Zebulon Vance (Civil War) and Locke Craig.

name: Cottage in the Heart of Asheville
summary: Private room and bath, walking distance to neighborhood pubs, restaurants and UNC Farmer's Market.  Walking distance to Grove Park Inn Resort, 1.5 miles to downtown Asheville.  Mountain and city skyline views.  Dogs in residence (petting privileges)
space: You can exhaust yourself having fun touring the Biltmore Estates and everything that Asheville has to offer, yet at the end of the day, you will have a peaceful and quiet place to rest your head, in a warm and friendly environment.   Your bedroom has a new DOUBLE-sized mattress with a handmade quilt.  The bathroom is the room next to your bedroom, with a tub and shower.   The home has a living room where you can relax and plan your day. Please note that we do have 3 friendly dogs (2 small and 1 medium).

neighborhood_overview: The cottage is located in a serene, tree-lined neighborhood with scenic sitting areas on the front and back porch.  It is slightly under 2 miles walking distance to downtown.  The cottage is 100 years old, with charm to each room (original poured glass windows and glass door knobs) but with the modern comfort of air conditioning.
transit: There is plenty of street parking available as well as off street parking. It is a comfortable easy walk to downtown,  to the Grove Park Inn and to many neighborhood locations (post office, drug store, restaurants, pubs).  Cab fare from the house to downtown Asheville is approximately $10.00.
host_about: I am a semi-retired occupational therapist.  I recently relocated to Asheville from California to explore this beautiful part of the country.  I have a passion for hiking, traveling, quilting, gourmet cooking, and of course, dogs.  I volunteer with Manna Food Bank and Brother Wolfe no-kill animal shelter here in Asheville.

name: 1843 Rankin House Inn
summary: Award winning restoration a few blocks from downtown. A perfect place for families & friends to gather. Have the entire inn to yourselves and walk to restaurants, shops and breweries.  Contact us before booking to ensure availability.
space: Come stay in the oldest house in Asheville. The original owner built it as a farm house in the 1840's.  Five bedrooms and the common spaces in this 4200 sf house are perfect for groups or families to have fun. Restoration began in the 90's and is now complete.
description: Award winning restoration a few blocks from downtown. A perfect place for families & friends to gather. Have the entire inn to yourselves and walk to restaurants, shops and breweries. Five bedrooms and the common spaces in this 4200 sf house are perfect for groups or families to have fun. Restoration began in the 90's and is now complete. There are several porches and a courtyard along with a large dining room off the kitchen. A huge parlor where the first indoor catholic services were held. A good innkeeper allows guests their space to make themselves at home while being available for whatever comes up. We do love to talk about the history of the house and what's happening downtown. The Montford district has some of the most beautiful architecture in the state but still retains the family neighborhood feel. It's a quiet, serene sett

name: Lovely Home Downtown-Easy Walk
summary: Our beautiful  2BR, 1.5BA House is in a quaint old neighborhood and only blocks north of Downtown Asheville.  Its a two story house with a great kitchen, huge back deck/Grill, sweet front porch with swing, washer/dryer, Dining Room, and Living Room.
space: Our house is a completely renovated historic home located in the Chestnut Hill Neighborhood, right next to Downtown.  It was built in 1916 and was thoroughly renovated in 2011.  We have 2 beds, and we also offer an Air Mattress if you need it.  Huge back deck with winter views of the Grove Park Inn, with gas-grill, quaint front porch on great street with rocking chairs and porch-swing.  Beautiful home, Great neighborhood! Walk to Downtown (.8 of a mile to center) or Charlotte Street (.2 of a mile) very easily, also close to Grove Park Inn.  Typically it takes around 15 minutes to walk to the center of Downtown, easy stroll.

This neighborhood is directly North of Downtown Asheville. Our House is exactly .8 of a mile to the  very center of Downtown Asheville, and .2 miles to great shops and Restaurants on Charlotte Street and Merrimon Ave.
notes: There are a couple of areas that will be off limits and will have locks on them.  They are one of the upstairs rooms, and two small closets in Bedrooms.  There is also an apartment in the lowest level of the house with a completely separate entrance around back under the deck which has permanent tenants.  Please be mindful of your noise levels late at night.  The House is older and doesn't have Central AC, however, we do have 3 very capable window AC units that do the trick.  One is located downstairs, and 2 more are located upstairs, in each bedroom.
transit: We mostly travel on foot or bike.  Its an easy walk to great Restaurants, bars, music, shops etc.  The House is exactly .8 of a mile to the  very center of Downtown Asheville.  The easiest walking route to Downtown from our house is via Central Ave.
host_about: We are an active, fun-loving couple that do a lot of Hiking and Biking around the Mountains. We love Downtown Asheville and walk there quite often.  We got married in the summer of 2013.

neighborhood_overview: Our Historic neighborhood has beautiful Victorian homes, Old big trees & fabulous gardens. Its a great place to take a walk. You can walk downtown and stroll thru Montford areas . Close by you will find the Civic Center and the Basilica of St. Lawrence.   Asheville has a wide variety of trendy restaurants, lots of locally owned stores, live music venues, theaters, and bars/clubs. There are many local breweries, festivals, farmers' markets and special events are frequent.Whole Foods & Trader Joe's are also nearby. Park your car and avoid the hassle and expense of parking downtown . You can go for a stroll thru the areas historic neighborhoods, pubs and fabulous Restaurants . All Within walking distance to Downtown Asheville  ( Depending which way you go its about a 20 min walk or 3 minute drive ) Asheville is located within easy driving distance to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Pisgah National Forest, DuPont State Forest and other areas for hiking, biking, waterfalls, tubing ,rafting, kayakin
notes: The Cottage is somewhat small for 6 adults , It is better suited for 4  but will accommodate 6 (Sleeper Sofa ) The Cottage does have Air Conditioning in the Living Room . It will Cool the house and front bedroom but not so much in the rear bedroom . There is a ceiling fan . Park your car and avoid the hassle and expense of parking downtown . You can go for a stroll thru the areas historic neighborhoods, pubs and fabulous Restaurants . All Within walking distance to Downtown Asheville  ( Depending which way you go its about a 20 min walk or 3 minute drive )
transit: All you need is a good pair of  shoes ! You can walk or bike and avoid parking in town . You will need a car to venture further out and explore the mountains and all of our beautiful  waterfalls and hiking trails .
host_about:
Parents to 2 great kids . We love traveling,  music, good healthy food, and  exploring new places . 

Basically believing we can all make the world a better place one person at a time.

name: Charming Downtown
summary: A beautiful one-hundred year old historic home in the Montford neighborhood built by Richard Sharp Smith. 3- 5 minute walk to  downtown.   Hot tub, room mini-fridge, outdoor spaces for relaxation, high-speed wi-fi, gourmet kitchen.
space: This home is a quick 5 minute walk from the center of downtown.  This historic neighborhood is peaceful, yet only a short walk to all the fun activities downtown.  Fantastic restaurants nearby, the Pritchard Park drum circle,  the  US Cellular Center, and St. Lawrence Basilica  are only three blocks away. We are a 5 minute drive from UNCA.. You won't need to move your car once you are settled in, unless you decide to go to the Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village, 10 minutes away.  Easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, NC Arboretum, Folk Art Center and much more!

Easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, NC Arboretum, Folk Art Center and much more! The Gold room is upstairs and has a queen-sized bed and shared bathroom.  All rooms have high speed wi-fi, mini fridge, window air conditioners,  access to outdoor hot tub (bring bathing suits!), f
neighborhood_overview: I love the beautiful old historic homes in this Montford neighborhood.  My house dates from circa 1910, and built by Richard Sharp Smith.  Many of the homes in the neighborhood date from the 1880's.  This Victorian neighborhood was the first suburb of Asheville.  It is  very quiet and friendly.  Lots of beautiful walking opportunities around the neighborhood.
notes: The day of your arrival, a general ETA is very much appreciated.    I have two small short-haired kitties, Sebastian and Sasha, real sweet and mellow.   They stay outside most of the time and are never allowed in guest rooms for those who might be slightly allergic. I have had several guests stay who are allergic to cats and have had no adverse reactions.      LGBTQ and straight-friendly.    Hair dryer, Mini fridge in the room, iron and ironing board available upon request, outdoor hot tub, outdoor screen room, patio with pergola, outdoor fire pit, gas and charcoal grills, flower, herb  and vegetable gardens.
transit: We are happy to do shuttles to and from airport and around town if needed for a small fee. The city bus stops near  the house, but the house is so conveniently located that you will hardly need the public transportation.
host_about:
I am a professional musician. I teach private music lessons in my home and also do a lot of performing and am an adjunct professor of music.   I love to travel, meet people and do fun things. I am proud of my town and am happy to help visitors find the best experience.  I am really easy-going and have been renting rooms in my house for many years to people who need a place to stay for weeks, months or sometimes years.  Guests will have a comfortable home away from home with easy flexibility within the house to come and go as you please. (must love music!)

my life motto:  life is for fun!!!!

summary: The Squire Billy Room, situated at the top of the staircase, is our largest bedroom. It offers a large private bath right outside the room with a claw foot tub, a king bed, fireplace, original pine mantle, and a heart pine floor.
space: Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies.
description: The Squire Billy Room, situated at the top of the staircase, is our largest bedroom. It offers a large private bath right outside the room with a claw foot tub, a king bed, fireplace, original pine mantle, and a heart pine floor.  Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies. The historic architecture and it's convenience to all the attractions of downtown makes your stay a memorable experience. The casual atmosphere along with eclectic furnishings create a relaxed setting for a rejuvenating Asheville stay. The inn is walking distance to many shops, grocery stores, restaurants, and bars if you decide to leave your car in our off street parking.

name: Artsy apartment close to downtown
space: Hi,  This cosy and charming apartment will be a perfect base to discover Asheville and its surroundings.  Five minutes (walking from downtown), situated in the historical neighborhood of Montford. Its central location will enable you to walk around easily. This one bedroom apartment is full of light and sun. Composed with a living room, a small kitchen and a cute bathroom and bedroom.  It will offer a really cosy and peaceful atmosphere to hang out and rest. The kitchen is full equiped and will allow you to cook at home, (it's a small kitchen no big counter) but it's how I usually do (the supermarkets are also walking distance), if you decide not to eat out in the many great restaurants Asheville has to offer. The building apartment is really quiet.

host_about:
Hello, I am french, and my husband is american, we are both architects, still young (36-36)!,
Live between Paris and the US.
I have been living in Paris for 12 years, and enjoyed it really much!
I can give good tips for shopping adresses, cool design stores, museums, galleries, and everything you need to have fun in Paris!
I cannot wait to have people staying in my place, i love it so much, i ll hope to have people who will enjoy it, as much as i do.
I co-owned this appartment with a good friend of mine, he will welcome you, if i am not in Paris, his name is Adolfo, and he is from Chile (he speaks english and spanish) and live just down the street.
Hope to hear from you soon,
Anne Sophie

space: Offering a clean and private one-bedroom basement apartment in the Historic Montfort District, where the location can't be beat!
