name: Historical 2 BDR, walk downtown
summary: A ten-minute stroll from downtown Asheville, this charming 1915 Craftsman bungalow is directly across the street from a school playground and three blocks from two major organic supermarkets. A peaceful hideaway in the heart of the city.
space: The house was built in 1915 and features a floor plan in which the kitchen, bathroom, bedrooms, etc. are arranged around the living room, with a hallway for added privacy. So the living room is like the hub of a wheel, and is very much a communal space. Outside, in classic bungalow style, a porch spans the entire front of the house from side to side, providing ample room for a get-together in warm weather.
description: A ten-minute stroll from downtown Asheville, this charming 1915 Craftsman bungalow is directly across the street from a school playground and three blocks from two major organic supermarkets. A peaceful hideaway in the heart of the city. The house was built in 1915 and features a floor plan in which the kitchen, bathroom, bedrooms, etc. are arranged around the living room, with a hallway for added privacy. So the living room is like the hub of a wheel, and is very much a communal space. Outside, in classic bungalow style, a porch spans the entire front of the house from side to side, providing ample room for a get-together in warm weather. The whole house. I check my guests in and I'm available by text, phone call or email if there are any questions. The neighborhood is known as Murdock Linden, part of the broader North Asheville area, developed in the 1920s; our street was known as Josephine in those days. A very friendly neighborhood, where a smile and nod from every passerby is guar
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is known as Murdock Linden, part of the broader North Asheville area, developed in the 1920s; our street was known as Josephine in those days. A very friendly neighborhood, where a smile and nod from every passerby is guaranteed, and unusually peaceful and quiet considering its proximity to Merrimon Avenue. The house is walking distance to Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter, City Bakery, a 50-acre wood, a yoga studio, and downtown Asheville (all within twelve minutes or less by foot). One of Asheville's five magnet schools is directly across the street.
transit: You are no more than a ten-minute stroll from a yoga studio and three major supermarkets, two of them featuring organic food; another two minutes on foot brings you to downtown Asheville. Buses run regularly on Merrimon Avenue, just two blocks away. You can reach both downtown and Highway 240 (Asheville's beltway) by car in under two minutes. The house is a ten-minute drive from Biltmore Estate and a fifteen-minute drive from the beautiful Blue Ridge Parkway.
host_about: I'm a stone mason, copy editor, and writer. The house is full of books, everything from fiction to wildlife guides, myths and folktales, history and anthropology, so if you're a reader you'll find a lot here. Most of the art on the walls was done by my mom, a terrific painter, and the playroom is my grandson's, so four generations have enjoyed this house.

name: Luxury Loft in Heart of Downtown
summary: Contemporary condo overlooking the coolest street in Downtown Asheville. A spacious industrial style loft with two bedrooms and two bathrooms, and large porch overlooking Lexington Ave. FREE parking, secure, close to everything. Walkscore 92
space: Loft style condo is a blend of historic (renovated printing press building) and modern features with hardwood flooring and original brick. High end appliances in kitchen and full access to washer and dryer. Private terrace overlooks Lexington Avenue for great people watching. This is a downtown loft and while the doors and windows are double paned you may experience some ambient noise on rare  occasions, ear plugs are provided for light sleepers. Master bedroom has a queen size sleep number bed.  Second bedroom is a queen size Murphy Bed. This room also has a laptop friendly workplace.  If you plan on accommodating a 5th guest, please let us know and we will prepare the sofa bed as well. (single size)

neighborhood_overview: This space is right in the heart of downtown Asheville and walkable to countless restaurants, breweries, shops and bars.  Asheville is know as Beer City, USA and offers brewery tours as well as countless top rated restaurants.  Take advantage of the fabulous arts and culture scene downtown and in the River Arts District, as well as at numerous music venues. Also plan to visit the Biltmore Estate or Blue Ridge Parkway four miles away. If your into the outdoors, hiking, biking, paddling and zip lining options abound. We live next door to a great coffee shop, and recommend grabbing a brew and a pretzel at Lexington Avenue Brewing around the corner.  Lexington Ave is the hub for Asheville local shops and restaurants! We are located within walking distance to the Orange Peel, Asheville Civic Center and many other downtown venues.
notes: While Asheville offers year round activities the high seasons runs from May-August, October-November for leaf season, and bookings for those months should be made far in advance.
transit: This location is central to everything you could possibly want.  Taxis and Uber are available as well.  Several grocery stores are less than a mile away should you decide to stay in and cook.
host_about:
My wife and I are happy Ashevillians but have lived in Florida, DC, and Charlotte.  We live in town a half mile away, and are happy to provide local tips on the best restaurants and tours.

We love to travel and hosting has been a cool way to give others a unique experience on their trips.

name: Forsythia Hall Church Mouse Pad
summary: Seize the unique opportunity to stay at Forsythia Hall: a lovingly restored church built in 1910, a stunning masterpiece of design and craftsmanship. Enjoy an in-house class in the Sanctuary, or take the short walk to explore all of downtown.
space: Just beyond the events sanctuary of this large owner-occupied converted church is Forsythia Hall's Church Mouse Apartment; a private one bedroom apartment with full eat-in kitchen, living area, high quality queen mattress, and yummy shower.

name: Bodacious Downtown Bungalow
summary: This newly rehabbed 1920's bungalow is a mile from downtown (20 min walk), just up the hill from the River Arts District (10min walk) & 2 miles from Biltmore. With charm & plenty of space, it's the perfect home from which to explore our vibrant town!
space: As a craftsman-style bungalow, this house oozes architectural charm, yet it's fully outfitted with all modern conveniences. The kitchen has a new stainless steel dishwasher and refrigerator, microwave and a gas stove. There is a convenient laundry room on the second floor which means you don't have to pack a lot for longer stays. The office, with its exposed brick and glass-block wall, features a desk and high-speed WiFi throughout the house. Each of the bedrooms has a queen bed and the office has a full-sized super-comfy futon.   The large living room has lots of seating and a piano that's for guest use.   It's ready and waiting for your talented hands! There's a spacious two-tiered back deck for catching some sun, and a covered porch in the front of the house that's great for watching the world go by.  Asheville is bursting with options in every direction from the house.  If you've come for beer tasting and explorations, you're in the right spot.
description: This newly rehabbed 1920's bungalow is a mile from downtown (20 min walk), just up the hill from the River Arts District (10min walk) & 2 miles from Biltmore. With charm & plenty of space, it's the perfect home from which to explore our vibrant town! As a craftsman-style bungalow, this house oozes architectural charm, yet it's fully outfitted with all modern conveniences. The kitchen has a new stainless steel dishwasher and refrigerator, microwave and a gas stove. There is a convenient laundry room on the second floor which means you don't have to pack a lot for longer stays. It's ready and waiting for your talented hands! There's a spacious two-tiered back deck for catching some sun, and a covered porch in
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is known as "South French Broad" (named after the river that flows through town) and is ideally situated in Asheville. You can be at the Biltmore, many of the South Slope breweries or downtown restaurants or right in the middle of all the galleries of the River Arts District all in less than five minutes drive. We walk a lot and take $6 Uber rides pretty much everywhere! If you're a walker, you can even leave your car behind, as both the RAD and downtown are accessible by foot via spacious sidewalks.  It takes about 20 minutes to walk downtown, and about 10 minutes to get to South slope or RAD.  These are mountains so the walk is hilly and may take longer for less fit people.  Uber is a great option, we usually only pay about $6 to go anywhere downtown or to take an Uber home.  South Slope = Beer! The Bodacious Downtown Bungalow is located within walking distance to 7 amazing breweries, all just steps from one another. You just gotta love this town! None of these shoul
notes: We've just added a stand-up piano that's freshly tuned and ready for a good, old-fashioned tickling of the ivories!  It's for guest use and we hope some visitors will fill the house with fine music!  The house has a 32-inch flat-screen Smart TV in the living room. We don't have cable service, but we do provide free Amazon Video On Demand which features hundreds of movies and TV shows. If you have a Netflix, Hulu, Pandora or Spotify account, you can also sign in to those services on the TV.
transit: Street parking is plentiful in front of the house and if you're patient you can almost always get free parking downtown - we're experts at it!  Uber is a great option that many of our guests use regularly.
host_about:
Together with my husband Michael, we're two American writers who moved to Asheville from Prague in July of 2013. We're originally from NY and NJ and we chose Asheville for the obvious, awesome reasons.  We're having the time of our lives here! Diane is the founder and designer of Musewear Flip Flops ((SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) them!) and Michael writes a tech news column for CNET.  We both have excellent suggestions on things to see and do here --especially restaurants!  Asheville is a foodie and beer lovers paradise.  

We do serious beach time in Brigantine NJ, a place we have loved for more than 15 years.  By now it's probably clear we're big fans of "the good life" and we'll do our best to share it all with you!

space: Although rooms change often, this listing is for a Bedroom with at least one Queen bed, sleeping two in the same bed. We also go over the map of downtown if interested, or help find places of interest. As a small International Youth Hostel since 2004, it is not uncommon to meet & rela
neighborhood_overview: We are on a quiet street in the central business district, but all of downtown is within a few blocks from us. For example, we have 10 breweries from 1-3 blocks from us.
notes: We send a text at 3:30pm on the arrival date to the phone listed in the reservation in order to schedule arrival times with our guests for the day.
transit: The central transit station where all city buses come to and depart from is one block away from us. The Greyhound station is 1.4 miles from us.
host_about:
Downtown Asheville's Private Room International Youth Hostel since 2004.
The consistently highest rated & oldest standing Asheville Hostel. 
Keyed private rooms, shared lockable bathrooms. 
No bunks or dorm rooms. 
The Tiny House is the only room with a bathroom in the room.

Walk to anything downtown in less than 11 minutes!
Our properties are in the Central Business District.
3 blocks from the center of town; Vance monument, or Pritchard Park. 

Our mission has always been to be a simple, clean, safe, & affordable place for young travelers.

Children are permitted if supervised by parent.
We do not accept walk-up reservations
Please reserve online in advance.
We don't accept animals or pets.

We begin checking in scheduled reserved guests after 4 pm.

Rooms change often.
Even though the room you are checked into may not look exactly like the one in the picture:
1. A listing for a Queen bed will be a room with at least a Queen bed, sleeping together.
2. A listing for 2 Twin beds will be a room with at least two Twin beds, sleeping separately. 
3. A listing for the Tiny House is always the Tiny House, there is only one.

Although our Airbnb profile was created in 2012, we didn't go live until April 24th 2015. 

All Airbnb reservations require at least a two night minimum, two guest maximum, which helps us keep the price down & value up.

We will respond to reservation requests after 4 pm est if not earlier.

Reservations can span or depart Saturdays, but we are closed for check-ins on Saturdays.

Any changes to Airbnb reservations including; cancellations, date changes, refunds, extenuating circumstances, etc, must be initiated by you through Airbnb. Please do not ask us to make these types of changes for you, as we have very limited control over Airbnb's reservation system. We can only fully control our own reservation system.

space: Location, Location, Location!!!  My Adorable House is located right Downtown (a 10-15 minute walk to the heart of downtown!) The house is cozy, bright, cheerful, clean & inviting! I love meeting, talking to & getting to know my g
neighborhood_overview: It's SO close to downtown!!! It's literally a 3-4 block/10-15 minute walk...
notes: My 12yr old Chocolate Lab (LilyBelle) lives here, she's very sweet and friendly, so you must love dogs to stay here!
transit: There are City Buses and Cabs and Ubers but you don't really need them as you can walk downtown quicker than you could wait on any of those other methods!
host_about: I'm a 30 year old single gal living in Asheville, NC! I own a Wedding & Portrait Photography company in downtown Asheville. I've got A LOT more checks to make on my 'travel bucket list', so I try to take trips as much as possible! I think Air BnB is an affordable way to see the places I wanna see & it's pretty neat to live as the locals live in the cities I travel to! :) I am a beer snob, music fan, bike enthusiast, movie buff, animal lover & adventurer!

name: Walk downtown, trees, birds,pets ok
summary: This large craftsman home includes a beautiful upstairs apt: 2.5 bedroom/ 2 bath, private sunny kitchen, private living room and surrounded on 3 sides by trees/green space.  12 minute walk to Downtown, Greenlife/Whole foods, Trader Joes. Cab $6.00
space: It is very spacious 2.5 BR/ 2 BA upstairs apt; 1500 sq. ft. This historic home is nestled in an authentic historic Asheville neighborhood just a few feet from Albemarle Park and very near Grove Park. Great neighbors and super walkable. Literally walk out the back yard to the best frozen custard and video store in town. One block away are great restaurants (Gan Shan), pubs (King James), bakeries, coffee shop (City Bakery). The best yoga anywhere is 4 to 5  blocks away.   The space has lots of light, and is spacious. Offers both great sunset and sunrise, mountain views and  greenery all around. Crows, hawks, song birds. It has a small kitchen with windows filling two walls. Be aware: We are 1 of only 8 LEGAL short term rentals in Asheville. All the others are illegal and their reservations are subject to cancellation upon notice from zoning inspectors so rent with us. Upstairs is the unit for the guests: One of the bedrooms has a full bath in it. The other has a sitting room with lots of

It has a small kitchen with windows filling two walls. Be aware: We are 1 of only 8 LEGAL short term rentals in Asheville. All
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is so close to downtown. 10-12 minute walk. 5 minute bike. In one direction (towards Downtown) is great food and drinks. In another direction is one of the best craftsman neighborhoods in America, Albemarle Park (Grace Kelly's apartment; shooting locations for Last of the Mohicans). A few blocks further is the Grove Park neighborhood with architecturally unique homes galore. In another direction you can walk up town mtn all the way to the Blue Ridge parkway on gorgeous, very low trafficked winding mountain roads that are used by bikers, walkers and runners a lot.
notes: Most of furnishings, linens, beds, etc are new. The high end beds and linens are super comfortable.We have a variety of pillows, from down, down alternative, and regular poly so you have some choices. Beds usually have at least  5 pillows each. We wash all the sheets, pillows cases (obviously) and the mattress pads and comforters  between every guest.
transit: Getting around is sooo easy from this space. An Uber ride is only $5.00/$6.00 to downtown. Walking: 12 minutes to downtown; 3 minute walk to the Gan Shan Station Restaurant, 4 to King James, 45 seconds to Ultimate Ice Cream/Rosebud Video. 2 min to Charlotte St Pub, 5 min to King James Public House/City Bakery.  8 walk min to Starbucks. 5 minutes to City Bakery (way better than Starbucks) Driving: Just 5 blocks to downtown. 12 minutes to Blue Ridge Parkway, 16 minutes to Bent Creek, 20 minutes or more to other parts of Pisgah National Forest. If you have bikes there is either a big front porch, an interior front hallway or a basement to store them. Asheville car and taxi  (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)
host_about:
I live downstairs.  I am an avid outdoors person (hiking, biking,camping). I travel a lot and love to meet fellow travelers; I want to help them have a great Asheville experience.  Im pretty dialed into the yoga, meditation, music, dance, performing arts, food, art, festival, beer, wine and consciousness scene.  In the past I was a green builder and green developer so I'd like to think I can help provide expert information on the market. Also a big history buff, I can point you in that direction if you like. 

Mostly I'm a person who is in good spirits and a high vibration who wants  to make your stay whatever you want it to be: from a dynamic adventure to restful and relaxing, I will oblige. 

My mottos?:
#1: Be good/do good; practice daily

#2: Know thy (true)self
(URL HIDDEN)Love thy (true) self
   To thine own (true) self be true.

#3: The only thing better than living the dream is sharing it with others

name: Luxury Central Downtown Loft
summary: Modern, luxurious loft in recently remodeled historic building, in the most central block of downtown. Steps away from all the downtown fun, with secure city parking right across the street. Comfortable, clean, quiet, stylish: everything you need!
space: A brand new, chic, modern loft in a beautiful historic building in the middle of downtown. The best of the original features, like beautiful antique wooden floors and old brick work, combined with the comfort of contemporary luxury. High end appliances, European design, comfort and style. Elevator, secure electronic street entrance.
description: Modern, luxurious loft in recently remodeled historic building, in the most central block of downtown. Steps away from all the downtown fun, with secure city parking right across the street. Comfortable, clean, quiet, stylish: everything you need! A brand new, chic, modern loft in a beautiful historic building in the middle of downtown. The best of the original features, like beautiful antique wooden floors and old brick work, combined with the comfort of contemporary luxury. High end appliances, European design, comfort and style. Elevator, secure electronic street entrance. The loft is perfectly comfortable for 2 guests, whether they are a couple, friends or relatives. We can make up the king bed as two twins when needed. For parents traveling with their children we can set up a pull out bed (or two). Depending on your preference, you can check in by yourself or I can be there to welcome you. I live a few minutes away and am available in person, by phone, or by text. I love living in
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the middle of downtown, within walking distance of all the great culinary treats, restaurants, cafes, bars, breweries, boutiques, salons, galleries and downtown liveliness that make Asheville so unique. Our guests usually park once (across from our building) and don't take their car out till they leave. Everything is in easy walking distance, including an independent movie theatre, a fine arts museum and a science museum, the Pack Square park, and a great grocery store.
notes: Our building is residential and we greatly value our good relationship with our neighbors. There is a strict non-smoking policy throughout the building, and we ask our guests to keep noise and nuisance to a minimum at all times. Our loft is not a space for loud entertaining or parties.
transit: There is plenty, secure and covered parking across from our front door, in the city operated parking deck. Maximum fee per day is $10. There is a second, even larger parking garage on the next block. You can easily and safely walk all of downtown and leave your car in its spot during your stay.

name: Modern Condo in Downtown Asheville
summary: Park your car and leave it for your whole stay! This luxury condo is located in the middle of Downtown Asheville. You will be steps away from Asheville's famous restaurants, breweries, and independent stores. This is the perfect Asheville location!
space: Park your car and leave it for your whole stay! This luxury condo is located smack dab in the middle of Downtown Asheville. You will be steps away from Asheville's famous restaurants, breweries, and independent stores. This is the perfect location for adventurous travelers looking to be in the center of the action.  The condo is a modern/industrial masterpiece, with exposed brick throughout, original wood floors, concrete counter-tops, and modern furnishing. The bedroom has a queen sized bed with a Tempurpedic mattress and pillows, and there is room for two additional guests on the modern sectional couch (does not pull out into a sleeper). There is also an outdoor balcony with a cozy bistro table perfect for your morning coffee. Everything you need is included for your stay, including linens, cookware, coffee, an iron and ironing board, toaster, bath products, and cooking utensils. Just show up and relax! neighborhood_overview: This condo is in the middle of Asheville's famous and eclectic downtown, located just steps from shopping, bars, and restaurants.
notes: It is important to note that this condo is made for more adventurous travelers who enjoy city living. You are in the middle of bars, restaurants, and heavy traffic, and there can be some city noise in the unit. If you are looking for a quiet mountain retreat, this unit may not be for you. But, if you want to be in the heart of what makes Asheville a top destination, you're coming to the right place.
transit: You can park your car and leave it if you wish.  Downtown Asheville is extremely walkable, and taxi cabs and Ubers are plentiful.  If you want to get out of town for the day, though, your car is easy accessible in the parking lot across the street from the condo.

name: Downtown Asheville Deal! 2bed/apt
summary: Looking for a fun, downtown deal? Come stay in this cheery, historic home! Walk everywhere downtown. This private apartment can sleep up to 4 guests. 2 night minimum for the weekends Fri-Sun. RENTAL PERMIT current for this year. Number fifty six.
space: This house is over a hundred years old and in the heart of Chestnut Hills, Asheville. You can't get your hands on a house here! This is your ticket in. It's a buzzing, inspiring, alternative, working class hub for artists and open minded visitors. Walk to  •Downtown restaurants, galleries, shops and bookstores and breweries •A convenient hub of grocery stores (Trader Joe's .4 mile, Whole Foods .5 mile, Harris Teeter .3 mile) with hot bars, salad bars, and ready made foods.  • The Civic Center (.9 mile) and dozens of other music venues including the Orange Peel (1.1 mile). •Chocolate shops. We have chocolate! Good chocolate! •Taco Temple (.2 miles) •Gan Shan Station  (.2 miles) •City Bakery (. miles) •The Asheville Yoga Center (.4 mile) •YMCA (.5 mile) Close drive to  • UNC Asheville and Botanical Gardens  • The River Arts District (2 miles) •The Biltmore (just 3 miles to our country's largest, most beautiful mansion!) •The Grove Park Inn (1.4 miles away with top 10 ranked spa in the co

We have chocolate! Good chocolate! •Taco Temple (.2 miles) •Gan Shan Station  (.2 miles) •City Bakery (. miles) •The Asheville Yoga Center (.4 mile) •YMCA (
neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is the home to artists, eco, alternative folks, many of whom own businesses downtown and are restaurant owners, entertainers, healers, dreamers and music makers. The feel is friendly, relaxed, safe and inspiring.
notes: Please consider another property if you are seeking luxury anything. You WON'T find it here. The beds do not have fancy mattresses. The towels are sometimes line dried and may be course. The furniture is half vintage, half new. I do not use chemical cleaners, bleach, dryer sheets or Febreeze. It will not smell like a hospital or a big corporate hotel. The house is more than 100 yrs. old and is quirky with cracks and marks and tons of imperfections. The sheets do not get ironed and may have wrinkles. The location is downtown in a dense area so you may hear neighbors, garbage trucks, kids, weed whackers, chickens. This is not a place for silent retreats, but generally it is peaceful at night. The bathroom is small. If you are a large person you'll be hitting yourself on things. Asheville is VERY wet and smells that way. If you anticipate mustiness being an issue, this may be a problem for you. I'm so sorry but no toddlers, babies or pets. It's just not a good fit. The house is inspected
transit: There is a bus line nearby. $1 will get you from the airport to downtown. No trains or subways. Taxis are available. You can walk and bike to downtown restaurants, venues, grocery stores, breweries, art galleries, book shops and museums and theaters. There are parking garages in the heart of downtown if the weather is bad and you want to roll down the street. Uber is $5 from the heart of downtown.
host_about: I am a full time composer and performer. I have lived in Asheville for five, colorful years and am proud of my neighborhood and vibrant community. I am an active cyclist, runner, yogi, swimmer and hiker. I love to dine out, shop local and gallery hop. I've traveled and toured all over the world and know the value of comfortable, affordable, peaceful, no frills accommodations.

space: Have you ever gazed at dreamy photos in a magazine or on Pinterest and wanted to slip right into them? Let yourself melt into the delectable décor of the French Industrial Chic Loft. notes: there is Apple TV not cable TV (there is no option for choosing Apple TV as an amenity)
transit: Park your car and walk anywhere and everywhere downtown; pedi cabs, taxis and bus available for any jaunts.
host_about:
Having lived in Asheville for 19 years, sharing tips about places to dine and things to do is a natural joy. I've been designing and developing properties for more than a decade. Creating spaces for guests to enjoy is a true labor of love! I also enjoy travel, and have integrated some architectural pieces I've gathered along the journey into some of my rentals. 
I'm so delighted to accommodate you, your family, and friends!

name: Rankin House Inn -Walter Bearden Rm
summary: This room is tucked away in the middle of the house for a quiet, cozy stay. Can be booked as a private bath or joined with the Ms Elizabeth room as a suite.
space: Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies.
description: This room is tucked away in the middle of the house for a quiet, cozy stay. Can be booked as a private bath or joined with the Ms Elizabeth room as a suite.  Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies. Continental breakfast includes warm muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit salad. Coffee and beverages are available 24/7.  The historic architecture and it's convenience to all the attractions of downtown makes your stay a memorable experience. The casual atmosphere along with eclectic furnishings create a relaxed setting for a rejuvenating Asheville stay. The inn is walking distance to many shops, grocery stores, restaurants, and bars if you decide to leave your car in our off street parking.

host_about: I helped  Fred open Rankin House after he completed the renovations on this incredible place. I love this job along with music, photography, and another  home I'm renovating for vacation rentals. I like hanging in the background, ready to help you with what you need for a comfortable stay.

name: COZY DOWNTOWN STUDIO
summary: GREAT LOCATION! 3 blocks from downtown Asheville, nestled in beautiful historic Montford neighborhood. 2 blocks from Trader Joes, GreenLife/Whole Foods, High Five Coffee, Nine Mile, etc. Queen bed, super clean, private patio... great place to unwind!
space: This is the downstairs apartment below a single-family home. There is a small path on the left side of the house that will take you to a wooden fence with a gate. Once you pass through the gate, you will find your private door and patio area.  There is plenty of street parking in front of the house. Please park across the street.
description: GREAT LOCATION! 3 blocks from downtown Asheville, nestled in beautiful historic Montford neighborhood. 2 blocks from Trader Joes, GreenLife/Whole Foods, High Five Coffee, Nine Mile, etc. Queen bed, super clean, private patio... great place to unwind! This is the downstairs apartment below a single-family home. There is a small path on the left side of the house that will take you to a wooden fence with a gate. Once you pass through the gate, you will find your private door and patio area.  There is plenty of street parking in front of the house. Please park across the street. Guests have access to the entire apartment and their own private patio. I live in town and am available if guests need me. The studio is located in historic Montford, an extraordinarily scenic neighborhood with many turn-of-the century homes, old-growth trees, and lots of character. A 10-min walk will take you into downtown Asheville with its many restaurants, bars, breweries, shops, galleries, theaters, and other
neighborhood_overview: The studio is located in historic Montford, an extraordinarily scenic neighborhood with many turn-of-the century homes, old-growth trees, and lots of character. A 10-min walk will take you into downtown Asheville with its many restaurants, bars, breweries, shops, galleries, theaters, and other activities. We are just a couple blocks from High Five Coffee, Tod's Tasties, Nine Mile, Chiesa, Trader Joes and GreenLife/Whole Foods.
transit: The Gray Line Trolley sight-seeing tours and the La Zoom comedy bus tours are really fun ways to see the town!
host_about: I'm originally from Chicago, went to school in Iowa, and worked on agricultural and food policy at the Environmental Protection Agency in DC for 7 years before I moved to Asheville in 2013. I love interesting food, craft beer, and music, and I love sharing all of these with good friends, both old and new. I also love to travel and meet interesting people, and I'm excited to provide a cozy resting spot for fellow travelers looking to explore the area. Hope to see you soon!

name: Downtown Asheville with a View
summary: Be in downtown Asheville and walk everywhere! A private, second-floor, comfy and bright room with queen bed, table and chair, fridge, wifi, high ceilings, wood floors, large windows, shared balcony. Common bathroom, cleaned daily.
space: This is one private room only. Bathrooms and kitchen are shared 'old world' style in this 104 year old Inn and Rooming House. We are located on Asheville's main street, Biltmore Ave; there is always easy access to downtown shops, restaurants, theaters, etc. The Gray Rock Inn is older, but recently remodeled and up to date with new fixtures and fire sprinklers. Of the 20 rooms, just three rooms are rented by the day thru Airbnb. All rooms are private. Room occupancy is limited to two people. Access is easy to bathrooms, kitchen, laundry, patio, porch, and balcony. Free wi-fi is available. Computer and telephone are free in the lobby. John is available through the day for check-ins and questions. Let us know if you will arrive late (after 6pm). A resident manager (Will) is onsite, but late check-ins are by appointment. The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop (open to the public). Across the st

A private, second-floor, comfy and bright room with queen bed, table and chair, fridge, wifi, high ceilings, wood floors, large windows, shared balcony. Common bathroom, cleaned daily. This is one private room only. Bathrooms and kitchen are shared 'old world' style in this 104 year old Inn and Rooming House. We are located on Asheville's main street, Biltmore Ave; there is always easy access to downtown shops, restaurants, theaters, etc. The Gray Rock Inn is older, but recently remodeled and up to date with new fixtures and fire sprinklers. Of the 20 rooms, just three rooms are rented by the day thru Airbnb. All rooms are private. Room occupancy is limited to two people. Access is easy to bathrooms, kitchen, laundry, patio, porch, and balcony. Free wi-fi is available. Computer and telephone are free in the lobby. John is available through the day for check-ins and questions. Let us know if you will arrive late (after 6pm). A resident manag
neighborhood_overview: Asheville is a fun place. There is something here for everyone. We are on the southern edge of the downtown district. Walk up the street for great restaurants, music, comedy, or history. Get out into the countryside for hiking, rafting, or just touring the Blue Ridge Parkway. Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
notes: Please communicate your arrival time so we can be there for you. Check-in is by appointment only. Confirm with us ahead of time if you will be arriving late. Towels and hand soap are supplied in the rooms. Bring a bathrobe and body soap for  showering. The room has a window air conditioner for the summer months.
transit: Walk to downtown shops and entertainment spots. Public transit bus stops are in front of the building, going north and south. Asheville's main bus depot is 4 city blocks to the west. There is some free parking in the back, and pay parking next door.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

name: Walk to downtwn/UNCA! Be Inspired!
summary: Support the arts directly by staying in musicians' home! Relaxing & comfortable, quiet neighborhood, 15-min walk to downtown or UNCA. Stone patio w/ fire pit, piano, guitar, full kitchen, WiFi/Roku, eclectic decor.
space: Our house has a creative energy because we are musicians/composers/creatives!  Enjoy your time here and be close to everything.  1 private bedroom can sleep up to 2 adults. Private bath just down the hall. If needed, we can make the living room sofa/futon available, but it's not a private room (it is more appropriate for 1 adult or 2 smaller children as additional guests).  Wi-Fi and TV with a Roku box (including Netflix and Hulu and 12 HD channels including PBS, FOX, CBS, NBC, and ABC).
description: Support the arts directly by staying in musicians' home! Relaxing & comfortable, quiet neighborhood, 15-min walk to downtown or UNCA. Stone patio w/ fire pit, piano, guitar, full kitchen, WiFi/Roku, eclectic decor. Our house has a creative energy because we are musicians/composers/creatives!  Enjoy your time here and be close to everything.  1 private bedroom can sleep up to 2 adults. Private bath just down the hall. If needed, we can make the living room sofa/futon available, but it's not a private room (it is more appropriate for 1 adult or 2 smaller children as additional guests).  Wi-Fi and TV with a Roku box (including Netflix and Hulu and 12 HD channels including PBS, FOX, CBS, NBC, and ABC). Make yourself comfortable in the main floor of the house, including the upright piano and guitar, back patio, and the lower level where laundry is also located.  We do ask that you not enter the two rooms marked "Private" on the basement level. My name's Chuck, and I'll be your host.  If I'm
neighborhood_overview: We're located in the friendly Five Points Neighborhood, which is well situated between downtown and UNCA campus.  Within 2-10 minutes walk, you can be exploring the free UNCA Botanical Gardens, a network of urban hiking trails, and a public greenway along Broadway. We are also just east of the lovely Montford neighborhood, which is nice to stroll around during the day to see some of the older architecture in Asheville.  There are several good restaurants within walking distance of us (Homegrown, Plant, Moe's, Luella's, Noi's Thai Kitchen, etc.) and a few grocery stores (Greenlife/Whole Foods, Harris Teeter, Trader Joe's).
notes: We do not provide any breakfasts during your stay, however there will be coffee and tea.  Note, there is a wonderful breakfast spot that offers high quality local products at a fair price just 1 mile north of us called "Rise and Shine Cafe" on Merrimon Avenue.  The ambiance is a bit plain, but the food is great, and there's almost never a line (unlike the downtown eateries). Of course, there are a multitude of other places in town to dine as well.
transit: You can walk to downtown in only 15 minutes!  If you'd rather not walk back home after dark or have to worry about finding parking, you can simply take Uber or a taxi.  It's approximately a $5-7 Uber ride.  Be aware that Asheville is very strict about DWI enforcement, and often has random checkpoints set up.  So, it behooves you to plan ahead for safety, if you enjoy imbibing in our wonderful restaurant/bar/brewery scene.
host_about: Hi!  I manage the admin for my dear friends, who own this beautiful house. I will be your primary point of contact, so feel free to contact me with questions. We are happy to accommodate you, whether you desire a very independent stay, or you'd like some helpful advice on where to go/what to do around Asheville. We know ALL the best dining options in town, craft cocktail/brewery spots, and best jazz clubs/musicians. We can recommend hikes in the beautiful mountains surrounding Asheville, and can send you links to great websites with all the trail data.  I'll make sure the space is clean, comfortable for your arrival. (Booking with us, in effect, directly supporting the arts, as the home owners and I include professional musicians, actors, writers and artists!)

summary: Walk to the Chocolate Lounge in 15 minutes! Private back yard with deck, blocks from the best coffee shop in town,  Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, and the bars, shops and restaurants downtown.  Must love cats! We have one sweet senior who will be home.
space: Small 1901 farmhouse, just north of downtown Asheville in the Five Points Neighborhood. Easy walking (1 mile) to the French Broad Chocolate Lounge, Mast General Store, Curate, and just .4 miles to High Five Coffee Bar, Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter and Greenlife Grocery/Whole Foods

We have one sweet senior who will be home. Small 1901 farmhouse, just north of downtown Asheville in the Five Points Neighborhood. Easy walking (1 mile) to the French Broad Chocolate Lounge, Mast General Store, Curate, and just .4 miles to High Five Coffee Bar, Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter and Greenlife Grocery/Whole Foods Entire house with front porch for watching the sunset, big back deck with privacy fence. Table for four on deck. We love to eat outside! We'll be available through the airbnb private messages. We may be traveling as well, but should always have access to the internet. Old and new houses, a few apartment buildings, families, couples. Just a couple blocks to a Greenway on a stream, UNCA, historic neighborhood Montford. You can walk downtown in about 10 minutes. Uber i
neighborhood_overview: Old and new houses, a few apartment buildings, families, couples. Just a couple blocks to a Greenway on a stream, UNCA, historic neighborhood Montford.
notes: Our cat Fatty (short haired male) will be home. He's 16 and not afraid of strangers. He doesn't  scratch - and we clip his nails regularly. He mostly likes to sleep and sit on laps. He has a cat door. He needs to be fed twice a day. Our dog will be staying with friends.
transit: You can walk downtown in about 10 minutes. Uber is $5. There are several parking garages downtown. The first hour is free. The garage on Biltmore Ave across from Mast General Store is $6 for the whole day. There are also several restaurants in the neighborhood next to ours called Montford. It's historic and has great old houses. It's closer than downtown and even easier to walk to. In between our neighborhood and Montford there's a Greenway that goes north and right past UNCA. It's nice for walking or biking. Just north of our neighborhood are more restuarants on Merrimon Ave. One of our favorites is Asheville Pizza and Brewing Company, which shows movies. It's 1.5 miles north of our house.
host_about: Early 40's married couple who LOVE to travel. We've been to 25 countries and are just getting started. Ron works for an airline, and Helen works for a local  non-profit  conserving Southern forests. We love Asheville's mountains, beer, riding our motorcycles on the nearby Blue Ridge Parkway and walking downtown to bars and restaurants. We bought our 1900 farmhouse 15 years ago and have been renovating it with love ever since.

host_about: We met as friends in 2005 at Appalachian State University. Kris moved to Tokyo for many years while Dani moved to NYC after graduation. We reunited in Brooklyn several years later and soon fell in love, had a baby, and moved to a majestic city by the name of Asheville, North Carolina.  We live life with a sense of adventure. We love travel, good food, movies, art, and our baby boy Max!

space: Very clean, open space with lots of light and funky folk Art by Artist Charlotte Scarce.  aka The Sharecroppers daughter!  Outside sitting area extends the space (in warm months) provides a nice outdoor relaxing area

Entrance is on the wrap around side of my porch so is also very private. I believe in giving folks their space so they can maximize their time in Asheville. I am in and out a lot.  Have the room set up for self check in and am always available by text.  With that said, I also love to meet folks and hear about where they are from and share fun things to do in Asheville! Walking distance to River Arts District, Grey Eagle (some of the best music in town), 5 minut
neighborhood_overview: Walking distance to River Arts District, Grey Eagle (some of the best music in town), 5 minute walk to Southslope with all the newest and most unique Breweries Asheville has to offer, New Belgium Brewery opening Spring 2016 less than 1 mile, Biltmore Estate entrance 2 miles, Grove Park in 10 minute drive and all of downtown Asheville with it's Art, Street Buskers, yoga & pilates studios, music, local restaurants and breweries at your fingertips.  $5-6 Uber ride to town or 15 minutes walk.
notes: I live in my home full time so am living life in my side of the house.  I am not a huge TV person but you will hear TV from time to time.  I love music, but will be mindful when you are in your space to keep it low and always shut down after 10pm.  I am not an early riser so no possibility of me waking you up early with my footsteps!  I am very friendly with my neighbors and we tend to visit one another frequently.
transit: Bus runs 7 days a week on S. French Broad bus stop 2 minute walk, Uber $5-6 to center of town or taxi, walk to town 15 minutes (uphill on way in downhill on way home!) or ride your bike!
host_about:
I am a vibrant self motivated person who likes to live each day to it's fullest.  Some of my favorite things in life are traveling, mountain biking, yoga, dance, live music, cooking, reading, watching movies and making connections with people.

My hosting style to to give people as much or as little attention as they desire.  I feel it is of utmost importance to provide a clean, comfortable & safe space with some necessities and peace & quiet.  I like to share fun and interesting things to do in our great town of Asheville and point folks to current entertainment events.

My motto in life is to be as kind and compassionate to yourself and others  each day~ And just ENJOY!

name: Luxurious walk to town with views
summary: Views of town AND walk to town, designer furnishings, luxury everywhere with no expense spared!  Cozy and elegant, fully equipped, gourmet kitchen, quiet wooded cul-de-sac street, and lots of outdoor space to enjoy the mountain scenery. Dog friendly!
space: LUXURIOUS HGTV DECORATOR'S HOME -  NEW TO AIRBNB; MOST REVIEWS ARE ON vacation home rentals. Walk to town and enjoy views of town from our covered porch or open-air BBQ patio. Located in a private, quiet cul-de-sac, this 3-Bedroom, 2-bath home is nestled among gorgeous Oak trees providing privacy amid the sounds of the local birds and crickets. Walk or ride our bikes to town in minutes, or simply relax in the wooded setting. Remodeled by an HGTV segment decorator, this charming bungalow features gorgeous interior decor with designer fixtures and furniture. The fully-equipped gourmet kitchen is complete with Stainless Steel Kitchen Aid appliances and everything needed to make your stay comfortable and easy. Enjoy the open floor-plan which allows conversations to flow from those seated around the gas fireplace to those seated at the bar in the kitchen! The Guest Bedroom features a cozy, elegant, asian-themed room with 800-thread count sheets atop a premium pillow-top Sealy Posturepedic Q

neighborhood_overview: We are located about 15 minutes walking to town but have a view of town from our porch and open-air BBQ area...this is a rare and unique feature in Asheville.  Also, because of the layout of the house, when sitting on the porch you have  a lot of privacy on all sides due to the Bamboo on the right, the wooded area in the front of the house and the slope down to the left of the (URL HIDDEN) makes one feel like they are living in nature when really they are minutes from a marvelous city!  The street is also on two cup-de-sacs so there is very limited traffic.
notes: This home is available as a full home (private) rental for month long stays.
transit: A short three-minute walk will take you to Charlotte Street where the bus and trolly pass almost every 10 minutes going North to The Grove Park Inn and South to downtown or The Biltmore Estate.  You can easily enjoy all of Asheville without a car from our home because of our convenient location to town and Charlotte Street, which offers great public transportation options.
host_about: A California native and resident of the U.S. Virgin Islands for over 20 years, I am a seasoned traveler and always searching for the next great "small town".  After buying our home in 2008 in the still sleepy Asheville, I lovingly remodeled it and had hopes to make it my full-time residence within a few years.  Unfortunately, life got in the way and I've still not been able to make it my full-time residence but enjoy frequent trips there annually.  I am currently located in California and in between there, Colorado and Asheville with frequent trips to the Dominican Republic.  I am an Interior Decorator, Kitchen and Bath remodeler and Home Stager.  I also work as an Independent Consultant on Marketing and Branding for businesses large and small, and coordinate and sell golf trips to Casa de Campo in the Dominican Republic.  I am an avid golfer, sailor, tennis-player and love horses and dancing on the side.  I love cooking and entertaining for friends (my house is PERFECT for dinner parties) and love trying out new foods from different cultures all the time.  I love to speak other languages such as Japanese, French and Spanish.

summary: A private space with private entrance that's part of a historic Victorian home.  5-15 minute walk to downtown, parks, UNCA and restaurants. High speed wi-fi, 50 inch TV with all cable channels and Netflix included. Easy, off-street parking.
space: This is a private apartment below the main house which has its own entrance and outdoor flower and herb garden. Our family (including two little kids, a dog and cats) lives above and we are respectful of your privacy. The studio is well equipped with a full kitchen, a dining table and 2 chairs, two bar stool chairs, a nice queen size bed,  living room with queen sized futon, own entrance, outdoor herb and flower garden, flat screen 50 inch TV with cable and Netflix, and a dining area. You have your own bathroom with shower.  If you are looking for an unique space that is charming and full of history but part of a vibrant creative community you will enjoy staying with us and we will enjoy hosting you!

There is a private driveway that leads to the pri
neighborhood_overview: Montford is a cozy, tree-lined neighborhood with sidewalks that is historic, yet progressive and friendly.  Our house was designed and built by Richard Sharp Smith, the supervising architect of the Biltmore Estate, who designed many houses in Montford in the early 20th century and helped to define the character of the city in his time. Thomas Wolfe and O. Henry are buried in the 10-acre cemetery located five minutes from the house. There are free, outdoor Shakespeare performances during the summer and early fall at the nearby park.
transit: It's a 10 minute walk or two minute drive to downtown Asheville. We are on the transit route. Uber and taxis are available as well. One of the best restaurants in Asheville is just down the street. The grocery stores: Trader Joe's, Earth Fare, Whole Foods, the local food coop, Ingles, and Harris Teeter are all within a five minute drive.

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is known as Grove Park, home to the historic Omni Grove Park Inn. You'll be within walking distance to their golf course, tennis courts, spa, beautiful grounds, and award-winning restaurants. This is a historical neighborhood located at the foothills of Town Mountain, with beautiful architecture and lovely sidewalks to stroll for hours. We are on the trolly tour and people come here to walk and jog. There are many favorite neighborhood restaurants just a short walk away, including King James Public House, great for beer and burgers, City Bakery Cafe, for morning coffee, Homegrown, for farm-to-table dinners, Ultimate Ice Cream, Luella's BBQ, Gan Shan Station, and more.  Grocery stores like Whole Foods, Harris Teeter, and Trader Joe's are just a mile away.
notes: We have private off street parking. You get one off street parking spot.
transit: - There is a bus stop just a block away.  - Easy walk or bike ride to downtown and local attractions and eateries - Asheville Uber is available for taxi services
host_about:
I am a Photographer, Visual Artist, Special FX make-up artist. 
My husband creates metal sculpture. 
We now have three grown boys and we are looking forward to traveling more.  
We enjoy spending time in NYC when not in Asheville. 
I am currently working on a book of photography called Disappearing American Dream. The project creates a platform for everyday Americans to tell their story and share their dream.
My Motto - "Have Paint- Will Paint" I have painted everything from cars, motor cycles, people, The Characters in Disney's Lion King, even the Dixie Chicks on the cover of Entertainment Weekly. 

My Husbands Motto- "Perfection is the enemy of good"

summary: This historic downtown apartment is perfect for your Asheville adventure.  You can not beat this location,  walk to everything! Three night minimum but you'll want to stay longer to fully soak up the unique Asheville vibe.
space: This spacious 700 square foot apartment comfortably sleeps four. There is a private bedroom with a king sized bed and a new queen sized futon in the living room.  Guests should be aware that you have to walk through the bedroom to get access to the bathroom.  Perfect for a family or anyone who wants a little extra space. Hard wood floors and a newly redone kitchen and bath gives this apartment an elegant and comfortable feel. Central heat and air. There is a TV with a network DVD player, but there is NO CABLE. Use the standard HDMI cord to hook up your computer or other devices and enjoy your own music, photos, or videos.   Guest will have access to a big covered front porch and off street parking.  I love living in Asheville and would like to help you make the most of your visit.  Just let me know if you need any suggestions for things to do or places to eat.  I live down the street and am available if you need me, or out of your way if you don't.   The house is located in the 5 Point
description: This historic downtown apartment is perfect for your Asheville adventure.  You can not beat this location,  walk to everything! Three night minimum but you'll want to stay longer to fully soak up the unique Asheville vibe.  This spacious 700 square foot apartment comfortably sleeps four. There is a private bedroom with a king sized bed and a new queen sized futon in the living room.  Guests should be aware that you have to walk through the bedroom to get access to the bathroom.  Perfect for a family or anyone who wants a little extra space. Hard wood floors and a newly redone kitchen and bath gives this apartment an elegant and comfortable feel. Central heat and air. There is a TV with a network DVD player, but there is NO CABLE. Use the standard HDMI cord to hook up your computer or other devices and enjoy your own music, photos, or videos.   Guest will have access to a big covered front porch and off street parking.  I love living in Asheville and would like to help you make the most
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the 5 Points neighborhood. This area has historic houses and is on the north edge of downtown.  This is a very desirable neighborhood.  You'll feel like a local as you take a short stroll out your front door to all downtown locations.
notes: The kitchen has modern appliances and is fully loaded with all the kitchen essentials.  I'd be happy to stock the fridge with any food or drinks you'd like for an additional fee. There's a whole foods store across the street which is super convenient. The market is open from 7:30am-9:00pm every day and has a hot bar & salad bar, coffee & smoothie bar, & deli. Perfect for a quick bite.   Pets are allowed for a fee of $75 for well behaved animals up to 50lbs.  This apartment has all new furniture and I prefer the pets to stay off the furniture.  If this is an issue, I can provide a furniture cover to accommodate you and your fury friend.
transit: Getting around is super easy!  Just a 5-15 minute walk to anywhere downtown.  There's downtown parking garages and street parking if you want to drive.  It can be quicker to walk than it is to drive and find parking. Or take your bike, its a quick and convenient way to get around.
host_about: Hi!  I'm Reid, thanks for checking me out, here'a a little more about me.  I am a father,a realtor, a traveller, and ambassador for world peace.  I have really enjoyed being an AirBnB host, its great to meet new people and help them fall in love with Asheville.  I've lived here for over 20 years now and absolutely love this city.  I am happy share some of my Asheville favorites spots, insider tips, and things to do, so don't hesitate to ask me!
street: Maxwell Street, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

name: Urban Cabin Retreat Master Bedroom
summary: An artist's unique 2 floor cabin from the 1830's reconstructed in the Chestnut Hill neighborhood, 5 blocks north of downtown. Open layout with first floor lounge/kitchen and master bedroom for guests on the entire second floor!
space: The cabin interior is all wood and is bedecked with unique textiles and objects I have collected on my travels as well as finely handcrafted items. Certainly touch and appreciate, but please use care as if items were precious to you too! There is no television, however, a cd/ipod dock/radio as well as speakers for your computer or phone are available for your listening enjoyment. The kitchen is a meat free zone equipped with an electric water kettle, french press, espresso machine, coffee bean grinder, blender and juicer, filtered water, a gas range/oven and cast iron pans. Please don't use soap on the cast iron when washing and yes, you will have to wash your dishes by hand…no dishwasher and no mircowave. For those staying long enough to need to wash/dry laundry you are welcome to my machines. There is a twin futon window nook in the master bedroom as well as a queen latex foam bed.

neighborhood_overview: My house is located within a few blocks of the intersection of Liberty and Chestnut Streets where you will find Asheville Yoga, an Acupuncturist and a Health Food Deli as well as Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter's and Green Life (A Whole Foods Market) on Merrimon Avenue. Just a few blocks east is Charlotte Street where there is Rosebud Video, Ultimate Ice Cream, a wine shop, a few restaurants and City Bakery and climbing the streets east of Charlotte you will get views of the city especially beautiful from the Grove Park Inn at the top of Macon St off N. Charlotte. Head north on Merrimon Avenue to WT Weaver Rd for a bike/walking path that passes UNC Asheville and ending at the botanical gardens.
transit: Park on the street in front of the stone wall and enter the property by descending the stone staircase and walk around to the back porch or park at the bottom of the shared driveway to the right against my curved fence. The back porch door of the log cabin will be your access to the house.  I have a shared driveway with my neighbors. They are a friendly family with two kids and you will surely see them at some point during your stay. Please do not block the use of the shared drive with your vehicle at any time to respect our arrangement. The neighbor on the north side of my property in the duplex is another story and you most likely won't see her, but I recommend you avoid interacting with her if the opportunity presents itself.
host_about: I am an adventurer, keen observer and maker…an artist and educator who travels somewhat frequently for art shows, teaching engagements and to rehydrate the creative sponge! I take great pride in creating an aesthetically pleasing and nurturing living space for myself and like the idea of opening my home as I so appreciate the opportunity to stay in others unique spaces while traveling.
street: Claxton Place, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

name: Handsome Chic Loft in City Centre
summary: Handsome with a bit of elegance around his rough edges, this loft will feel like your first crush and you'll want to explore every bit. A massive undiscovered playground with so much space that wandering and venturing may occur within its walls.
space: Central downtown gem: 2-story with 2 living rooms, 2 kitchen areas, 2 bathrooms; perfect for 4 couples, group travel, or large family. Plenty of space and comfort. Check my other listings. I have other properties on the same street, and can accommodate large parties. Cleaning fee included in the rate. Cleaned with all natural, environmentally friendly products. One parking space per unit provided; lots nearby for additional vehicles $3-5/day. LGBT and straight friendly. complimentary coffee, tea, toiletries, and more There is an additional $150 charge for a one-night stay.

host_about:
Having lived in Asheville for 19 years, sharing tips about places to dine and things to do is a natural joy. I've been designing and developing properties for more than a decade. I'm so delighted to accommodate you, your family, and friends!

name: Cosy Guest Room in 5Points Bungalow
summary: Be my guest in my cosy spare room! Stay in the quiet Five Points neighborhood just north of downtown Asheville and adjacent to the historic Montford neighborhood. Located halfway between UNCA and downtown, the house is an easy mile walk from each.
space: Your room is a spacious sunny bedroom with a (real!) queen sized bed. There is a brand new foam mattress (firm, but cushy on top) and pillows with fresh linens. There are two windows, both with sheers and light-blocking shades.  Clean linens and towels provided.
description: Be my guest in my cosy spare room! Stay in the quiet Five Points neighborhood just north of downtown Asheville and adjacent to the historic Montford neighborhood. Located halfway between UNCA and downtown, the house is an easy mile walk from each.  Your room is a spacious sunny bedroom with a (real!) queen sized bed. There is a brand new foam mattress (firm, but cushy on top) and pillows with fresh linens. There are two windows, both with sheers and light-blocking shades.  Clean linens and towels provided. You're also welcome to share my cosy living room and small kitchen and bath. The kitchen contains an oven, stovetop, fridge, and sink, with plenty of dishes and cutlery (note: no microwave). The bathroom features a fabulous claw foot tub!  Note that there are several concrete steps (with a metal handrail) and two additional stone steps up to the porch (without a handrail) if accessibility is an issue. The house is all one level once you are inside. I'm a busy professional, having jus
neighborhood_overview: The historic Five Points neighborhood is chummy and picturesque and serves as a quiet haven just north of downtown Asheville. There is convenient walking access to the greenway, which leads you to the Botanical Gardens and the university. The historic Montford neighborhood is similarly just across the road for exploring.
notes: I have great wifi but no television. The tub has a removable handheld shower head, and a curtain, but it is a clawfoot tub and won't be the most awesome showering experience you have ever had. It might be the awesomest most relaxing bathing experience you've had, though. :) I use nontoxic, environmentally-friendly cleaning products and have repainted the guestroom with no-VOC paints.
transit: There is a bus route down Broadway and Merriman as well as taxis and uber. Parking is free on the street in my neighborhood (opposite side of the street from the house). Parking fees downtown are inexpensive relative to other cities and meters are free after 6pm and on Sundays (and city holidays), though it can get challenging on a busy night downtown, in which case I would recommend one of the fee-charging garages for convenience. Fortunately, it's an easy walk if you choose!
host_about:
I like hosting because meeting new people is a great way to travel vicariously. I also like hosting because I'm from the southern part of the US and that's how we roll. I've got my own life to get on with, though, so my aim is to provide a comfortable, safe, and affordable place for you to perch on your visit.

I'm currently located in Asheville, NC, USA; the Edinburgh flat is no longer available.

summary: Centrally located! Spacious green built home tucked away on a street both lovely & quiet — 14 min. walk to downtown & 5 min. drive to the River Arts District. Clean and very comfortable. Two porches to choose from and yummy morning coffee!
space: New home, clean AND very comfortable. Brand new queen sized mattress and bed - Really comfy!! Bedroom view of a green ravine. Ceiling fan.  PRIVATE shower & bath RIGHT across the hallway. Spacious closet.

PRIVATE shower & bath RIGHT across the hallway. Spacious closet. Private bathroom across the hall from your room on the second floor of the house. Access to the luscious living room, kitchen, dining room and half bath on the main floor. Two porches to enjoy Asheville's sunshine! I will provide useful information on “happenings" around Asheville including arts and crafts you shouldn't miss, artist's studios you should visit, live music, yummy food, farmer's markets, local brews, African dance classes, "the" yoga studio, hiking & biking, etc. After your reservation is confirmed you will have access to a "community
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood I live in is wonderful to explore on foot - gorgeous tree-lined streets and beautious bungalows, parks, trails, the River Arts District, yummy neighborhood restaurants. My house is centrally located. Downtown is a lovely walk AND The River Arts District is very close by.
notes: The Asheville Regional Airport (AVL) is 15 minutes by car to my house. Asheville transit operates buses that run from the airport to downtown Asheville transit station. Cost is $1, buses do not run on Sundays.
transit: Parking is in front of the house on the street.  Walk anywhere, anytime, to enjoy downtown Asheville restaurants, bars, art, theater and music.
host_about:
Ten years ago I rusticated to the mountains of Western North Carolina to immerse myself in the study of ceramics at the Penland School of Crafts where I have worked since 2006.

My ceramic studio here in Asheville is located at Grovewood Studios near The Grove Park Inn. I spend the majority of my time making one-of-a-kind hand-built ceramic functional ware and sculpture — Come visit my studio if you like.

summary: Montford is one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Asheville.
space: "Cathy is amazing! Really! What a host and is super supportive and making sure your stay is a true Asheville experience. I loved the room, the kitchen, the eggs and all of Cathy's help. Next time I come through town again I am sure to look Cathy's place up and see if its available. Oh, and its quiet! Love that when your on the road sometimes constantly. Thanks Cathy!" Stephen, California "There are THREE completely PRIVATE guest apartments in the a turn-of-the-century historic home. The back yard easily accommodates large gatherings for family dinners and lawn games or private late afternoon lounging. I have been an enthusiastic AirBnb renter for three years and Cathy is by far the most generous and accommodating host I've met. The neighborhood is hilly and beautiful with lovely mature trees. Downtown is a quick drive or a good walk and the bike path is right down at the bottom of the hill. The apartment is charming and quintessentially Asheville with lots of quirky, adorable character

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood was named an Historical District in 2000 and in the early 1900's, Montford was home to the upper class of high society dignitaries, doctors, and prominent businessmen. Notice the wide main thoroughfare that is now Montford Avenue. Arriving late and want an easy dinner? Perhaps you'll walk to one of our neighborhood cafe/pubs all on Montford Avenue toward town. Tod's Tasties has a great omlette, and about four blocks away. Cheisa, three blocks away is a classic Italian and Nine Mile Cafe, which is just two blocks from your apartment is a real local favorite with great micro brews and reasonably priced menu. Within walking distance from your apartment: The Botanical Gardens of Asheville, the University of North Carolina campus, downtown is a mile-20 minute walk or 5 minute car ride. Montford Park is half a block away and has a basketball court, tennis courts and park benches. Riverside Cemetery is one of the coolest places to view Civil War and Spanish American War grave
notes: When one imagines a partying scene, this house would not be in that picture. Because I place a high value on tranquility myself and choose not to dampen the enthusiasm of little ones, these apartments aren't well suited for children.
transit: Enjoy a lovely walk to town through wide boulevards of the historic district with turn of the century mansions on both sides of the street. Drive five minutes to town and park in any one of several parking decks-1st hour is always free! Many of my guests who want to enjoy the benefits of Asheville being called "Beer City USA" for four years, opt to walk to downtown and or take an UBER taxi for around $6. Ask me for a first time discount code.
host_about:
I have travel in my blood. I was born in Chateauroux, France. My sister was born in Germany and I learned to speak German when my family lived there for four years. Some of my favorites places include, Lagos de Atitlan, Uxmal, Merida, San Cristobal, Antigua, Ambergris Caye, Chichicastengo, Amsterdam, Vancouver, Cologne, Berlin and Prague. I prefer to travel off the "gringo trail" and have many more places to visit. Open to house trade.

I am a passionate student of compassionate communication (NVC). Two important things I've learned is that other people's behavior rarely has anything to do with me and that with patience and compassion, most all our needs can be met. 

For fun around here I have ridden a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a mountain top zip line tour nearby, seen our ancient mountains during a flying lesson, rented a scooter and rode the blue ridge parkway, took a few archery lessons so I could pretend to be like Katniss from The Hunger Games, which was filmed nearby. I also enjoy sitting in the backyard watching my chickens do goofy things. What do you like to do for fun? Let me share more fun things to do in our beautiful mountains.

name: Private Room w/Bath -3 blks to town
summary: Nice size private room w/its own bath in back of house w/separate entrance.  Queen bed, toaster oven, tea kettle, refri, lite breakfast, quality linens, great decor. Very private, super quiet, off street parking, short walk to town, some pets ok.  Eco friendly  conscious house.  Great backyard to relax in and smokers welcome - outside.
space: Nice size bedroom with private bath (with shower) over looking a large backyard.  4 windows, nice atmosphere.  I have made the room one I would want to stay in.  So the most important things for me are: nice ambiance (decor), good bed, with quality linens and an area I can make a snack and tea. The little food prep area has small refri, toaster oven, one burner unit and tea kettle, some basics (condiments, tea, coffee) and utensils.  High quality linens, blankets and pillows.  A table with 2 chairs, for hanging out.  There are lots of great little extras.  I am happy to stock granola, yogurt, fruit and if you have something you love, just ask! There is a small TV/DVD in the room and I have an awesome collection of movies that I am happy to share. I have tried to think of all the necessities, lots of conveniences, and many luxurious extras.  I want you to feel at home and pampered.  If there is something I missed, I am open to suggestions and requests.  Asheville City Permit #ASH15307

neighborhood_overview: I live in lovely Historic Montford which has beautiful Victorian homes, tree lined streets, fabulous gardens.  Its a great place to take a walk.  My house is very close to downtown: literally 3 blocks to the Civic Center and the Basilica of St. Lawrence.  Many restaurants, Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, and shops are a 5-10 minute walk.  You can park your car for your stay and get your 10,000 steps in :). Asheville has a wide variety of trendy restaurants, lots of locally owned stores, live music venues, theaters, and bars/clubs. There are many local breweries,  festivals, farmers' markets and special events are frequent. Asheville is located within easy driving distance to the Blue Ridge Parkway, Pisgah National Forest, DuPont State Forest and other areas for hiking, biking, rafting, kayaking and picnicking. The River Arts District along the French Broad River has open local artists studios, restaurants and The Wedge brewery. Asheville is a great location for a short or long visit and a p
notes: I think the best things about my offering is: great location, next to a park and 3 blocks from downtown, quiet, and super wonderful house and the room is very spacious, comfortable and private.  Has everything you need!
transit: My house is perfect if you are flying in and do not want to rent a car.   I am 3 blocks from downtown, 3 blocks from Whole Foods, Trader Joes, and Harris Teeter, 2 blocks  from 2 coffee shops and if you like to walk the River Arts District is about a 20 minute walk, UNC and Botanical Gardens are about 15 minute etc..  So you can definitely manage here on foot.  I can help with airport transport (make a recommendation).  For those who have a car, I can offer, off street parking.  My house is easy for freeway access, which can take you to the many wonderful sites, parks etc.. that this area has to offer and 5-10 minutes from just about anything local.  The Biltmore Estate is about 10 minutes, West Asheville is 5 minutes and the list goes on. I am a block away from the N line of the bus (ART).  The fare is $1.   Its a great town to bike in.
host_about: At Peace

We are across the street from Table and Imperial Life, which features a Friday late night Hip Hop Dance party.  We are two doors down from the One Stop/Ashev
neighborhood_overview: Downtown Asheville is energetic and we are right in the center of the action!  Lots of cool spaces to explore, amazing restaurants and nightlife.  We are across the street from Table and Imperial Life, which features a Friday late night Hip Hop Dance party.  We are two doors down from the One Stop/Asheville Music Hall which stays open late and features funk, reggae, and rock.  Old time, bluegrass, celtic, rock, symphony, African drumming, trad jazz, modern jazz, gypsy, singer-songwriters and eclectic street performers are a stone's throw from here as well.  Award winning restaurants including sushi, Indian (north or south), Korean, Italian, BBQ, Southern, vegan, charcuterie, farm-to-table, pizza, Spanish, gluten free, French, Chinese, bakeries, coffee houses, tea, four chocolateries, twelve breweries (and counting…) and food trucks galore.  Art galleries feature openings every weekend in downtown and nearby and keep daytime business hours to explore artists from the area and from afar.
notes: The building has an elevator.  The entrance to the building has secure keypad code access.  The bedroom is in the interior of the condo with pocket doors to separate the room from the living area and windows.  Downtown Asheville can be noisy and music can be heard Friday nights until 2 a.m. from the club across the street.  We have a white noise machine and earplugs to minimize any disruption.  It can however be loud for guests sleeping on the pullout couch in the living area. We cannot issue refunds for noise emanating from the neighborhood around the condo. The bedroom tends to get hot if the heat is set to 70 so you might want to turn it down for comfort while sleeping.
transit: The loft is close to several parking decks.  You will not need to drive unless you are going to the River Arts District, Biltmore House or hiking in the mountains.  Located between Lexington Ave & Haywood St, the loft is a 1 minute walk to Pack Square and Biltmore Ave and a 3 minute walk to the Grove Arcade & Wall St.  Taxis run all the time.
host_about: I am from Asheville NC.  I love to spend time outdoors, cooking and reading or listening to music.

I'm so delighted to accommodate you, your family, and friends!

notes: This is our primary residence.  The house is, therefore, fully ready for use including a well stocked kitchen (stand mixer, airpopper, rice cooker, blender, food processor, and all cookware), hair dryer, flat iron, towels, linens, etc.

summary: Montford is one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Asheville.
space: "Cathy is a WONDERFUL hostess and a DELICIOUS person! She was overwhelmingly welcome, left us our special eggs from "the girls," helped us make arrangements for a zip line tour and a Biltmore visit, provided us with lots of Asheville reading materials and gave us a wonderful tour of our precious little home for the week. The bed is comfortable, sheets clean and cozy, space heaters available should you get cold, and hot water for your shower or bath in the sweet claw foot tub. I highly recommend staying with her in any of her 3 charming apartments!" ~ Emilie, Manhattan Experience Asheville's premiere Montford Historic District in a completely private, quiet, spacious guest apartment. I have THREE AIRBNB APARTMENTS located in a beautiful two story, owner-occup
neighborhood_overview: Arriving late and want an easy dinner? Perhaps you'll walk a few blocks over to one of our three neighborhood pubs, Tod's Tasties or Chiesa, or Nine Mile Cafe.   Within walking distance from your apartment: The Botanical Gardens of Asheville, the University of North Carolina campus, downtown is a mile-20 minute walk or 5 minute car ride. Montford Park is half a block away and has a basketball court, tennis courts and park benches. Riverside Cemetery is one of the coolest places to view Civil War and Spanish American War grave sites. The Biltmore Estate and Village is approximately 3 miles away. Everything is easy access.
notes: This is a place for vacation tranquility and the apartments have not been decorated with "child-proofing" in mind . As such, these properties are not well suited for children.
transit: Enjoy a lovely walk to town through wide boulevards of the historic district with turn of the century mansions on both sides of the street. Drive five minutes to town and park in any one of several parking decks-1st hour is always free! Many of my guests who want to enjoy the benefits of Asheville being called "Beer City USA" three times opt to walk to downtown and take a $10 taxi ride home.
host_about:
I have travel in my blood. I was born in Chateauroux, France. My sister was born in Germany and I learned to speak German when my family lived there for four years. Some of my favorites places include, Lagos de Atitlan, Uxmal, Merida, San Cristobal, Antigua, Ambergris Caye, Chichicastengo, Amsterdam, Vancouver, Cologne, Berlin and Prague. I prefer to travel off the "gringo trail" and have many more places to visit. Open to house trade.

I am a passionate student of compassionate communication (NVC). Two important things I've learned is that other people's behavior rarely has anything to do with me and that with patience and compassion, most all our needs can be met. 

For fun around here I have ridden a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a mountain top zip line tour nearby, seen our ancient mountains during a flying lesson, rented a scooter and rode the blue ridge parkway, took a few archery lessons so I could pretend to be like Katniss from The Hunger Games, which was filmed nearby. I also enjoy sitting in the backyard watching my chickens do goofy things. What do you like to do for fun? Let me share more fun things to do in our beautiful mountains.
