name: Victorian Cottage Downtown Green Rm
summary: A beautiful one-hundred year old  historic home in the Montford neighborhood. 3 blocks from the center of town, 5-15 minute walk to everything.   Hot tub, high speed wi-fi, cable tv, mini-fridge, outdoor spaces for relaxation, gourmet kitchen.
space: This home is a quick 5 minute walk from the center of downtown.  This historic neighborhood is peaceful, yet only a short walk to all the fun activities downtown.  This is the calendar for the Green Room. Fantastic restaurants nearby, the Pritchard Park drum circle,  the  US Cellular Center, and St. Lawrence Basilica  are only three blocks away. We are a 5 minute drive from UNCA.. You won't need to move your car once you are settled in, unless you decide to go to the Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village, 10 minutes away.  Easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, NC Arboretum, Folk Art Center and much more!
description: A beautiful one-hundred year old  historic home in the Montford neighborhood. 3 blocks from the center of town, 5-15 minute walk to everything. Fantastic restaurants nearby, the Pritchard Park drum circle,  the  US Cellular Center, and St. Lawrence Basilica  are only three blocks away. We are a 5 minute drive from UNCA.. You won't need to move your car once you are settled in, unless you decide to go to the Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village, 10 minutes away.  Easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, NC Arboretum, Folk Art Center and much more! This calendar reflects the reservations for the "Green Room". The Green room downstairs has a comfy queen size bed and shares the mauve bathroom
neighborhood_overview: I love the beautiful old historic homes in this Montford neighborhood.  My house dates from circa 1910, termed a "Victorian cottage", and built by Richard Sharp Smith.  Many of the homes in the neighborhood date from the 1880's.  This Victorian neighborhood was the first suburb of Asheville.  It is  very quiet and friendly.  Lots of beautiful walking opportunities around the neighborhood.
notes: Please park on the Elizabeth side. Also, the day of your arrival, a general ETA is appreciated!      I have two small short-haired kitties, Sebastian and Sasha, real sweet and mellow.   They stay outside most of the time and are never allowed in guest rooms for those who might be slightly allergic. I have had several guests stay who are allergic to cats and have had no adverse reactions.       LGBTQ and straight-friendly.     Hair dryer, iron and ironing board available upon request.  outdoor hot tub, outdoor screen room, patio with pergola, outdoor fire pit, gas and charcoal grills, flower, herb  and outdoor spaces for your pleasure.
transit: Jeff and I are happy to do shuttles to and from airport and around town if needed for a $15  fee. The city bus stops near  the house, but the house is so conveniently located that you will hardly need the public transportation. Uber is also available.
host_about:
I am a professional musician. I teach private music lessons in my home and also do a lot of performing and am an adjunct professor of music.   I love to travel, meet people and do fun things. I am proud of my town and am happy to help visitors find the best experience.  I am really easy-going and have been renting rooms in my house for many years to people who need a place to stay for weeks, months or sometimes years.  Guests will have a comfortable home away from home with easy flexibility within the house to come and go as you please. (must love music!)

my life motto:  life is for fun!!!!

space: This is a soulful, clean antique apartment with a lots of character; original hardwood and ceramic tile floors, hall between breakfast nook (w/ fridge, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, etc.) and living room with built-in ironing board, bedroom with 2 closets and captain's bed with drawers for clothes, small deck overlooking garden and shared firepit, second floor up external stairs (steep), walk to downtown, UNCA, (if you don't mind a nice, but hilly mile walk), around the corner from Asheville Biscuitry, Homegrown Restaurant, Moe's Burrito, Homegrown, Musician's Workshop, Luella's Bar-b-que, trails to UNCA and Botanical Gardens, wooded feel with firepit and grill that you are welcome to use responsibly. 1 mile, nice walk to downtown. The apartment is located in our house, with a separate entrance at the deck behind the house. There is another guest space on the first floor. You may hear others from time to time, but we do our best to be quiet and sensitive to our guests. We are a busy

The a
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is friendly, mellow, safe, typical Asheville neighborhood with some families, some students and professionals. Some historic homes, (like this one,) some newer, close to townhouses, this property is next to undeveloped wooded city property, which makes it feel remote even though you're walking distance from everything, lots of trees. Very cool vibe. Neighbors up the hill have chickens (but they are fenced... ; )
notes: We have a small pug who barks occasionally, but is very friendly. We also have a friendly, timid cat Roe and a tame jack rabbit who loves to be scratched behind the ears.  Apartment is up an external flight of fairly steep external  wooden stairs. An automatic light comes on to illuminate it at night, and there are rails and traction installed on the stairs for safety. Yet, if you have any trouble getting up and down stairs, this would not be a good fit for you. We are happy to help get luggage up for you if we are here when you arrive or leave. We only consider non-destructive, flea-free, reasonably quiet and house-broken pets please. We live in the main part of the house and have 2 young boys 10 and 6, who are wonderful guys, yet can be quite boisterous at times, yet they are often at school or on outings. Nights and school hours are generally very quiet here.
transit: Around the corner from bus stops. Yet, downtown is a mile away, so easier to walk or take Uber. Perhaps a 20-30 minute walk, or 3-5 minute drive. Biltmore Village 10 or 15 minute drive. Blue Ridge Parkway 10 minute drive, Grove Park Inn 10 minute drive.
host_about: I am a writer and musician. My husband is a visual artist and creative director for an advertising agency. Our wonderful kids are 5 and 9, play soccer, and love to camp and do outdoorsy things. We have been in Asheville for about 10 years and love it. We met in San Francisco, but moved here to start a family.

name: Garden Apt near downtown w/hot tub!
summary: Your magical mountain vacation awaits! Located one mile from bustling downtown Asheville, this spacious garden apartment has everything you need for the perfect getaway. Relax in your own personal movie theater, cookout on the gas grill, and soak in the private hot tub. You'll never want to go home!
space: This is a large lower-level apartment in a 1920s four-square bungalow. The space has been fully renovated by the home-owner into a stylish, modern living space. It featured an open floor plan with a sunken kitchen and raised bedroom and bathroom. Some of the more charming features include a wrap-around bar, original farm-style metal kitchen sink, rain-shower shower-head, and a large open living-room area. The cozy bedroom has a full sized bed and a internet-friendly mounted TV. The movie-theater is located in the back of the apartment behind a secret bookshelf door. It contains a projector and screen, a fold-out futon-bed, DVDs, and movie memoribilia. Through the movie-theater bedroom you will find a door that leads to the backyard patio where you will find the hot tub and gas grill.

host_about: Hello! My name is Ander and I have lived in Asheville for about 15 years. I love to travel, eat good food, see live music, and spend time with my 10 year old daughter. I have combined my talents for building and entertaining to create a really unique and fun vacation space. When I travel, I like to live-it-up, so I wanted to created that same kind of experience for my guests.

name: Two Block Walk from Apt to Downtown
summary: Located less than 1 mile from downtown's center, Pack Square, our Montford home was completed in June of 2015.  Wind Powered & Green Certified we offer a one bedroom 650 sq ft apartment with private entrance, large windows, & safe off street parking.
space: Nestled on a beautifully landscaped corner, our wind powered, Green Certified, stylish 2700+ square foot Montford home was completed in June of 2015. We are pleased to offer you a one bedroom 650 square foot apartment area located in our ground level.  The apartment has a private entrance and off street parking.  It offers relaxed comfort with independent climate control and plenty of natural light from large double insulated windows and the secure opaque glass front door.  The bedroom is completely private with two windows, ceiling fan, and big double closet.  A large open plan living room & food area has a separate dining table along with counter/bar seating, plus a comfortable entertainment area.  The large fully appointed bathroom sports a jazzy black & white hexagonal tile floor, granite vanity top, and a shower/tub combo. summary: Historic & charming urban escape in Downtown AVL . Walk to the best Downtown has to offer in 5 minutes. 2 blocks in the other direction takes you to the River Arts District-R.A.D+Great Location & Luxury accommodations! Enjoy!
space: Settle in to our alluring 2BR historic bungalow in the evolving South Slope neighborhood of Downtown Asheville. Enjoy old growth trees and the sound of the city at once adorned with just the right blend of Vintage & Modern accouterments to make your stay comfortable & memorable.  With its location it is simple to get the most out of your trip by staying in the heart of it all. Three blocks from the interstate and walking distance to hundreds of top of the line Restaurants, boutiques, art galleries , music venues. With architecture and culture that permeate throughout the city, all while enjoying the views in the 'Land of the Sky' This vacation home is only minutes away from some of Asheville's most popular dining locations including: Rhubarb, Tupelo Honey, Early Girl Eatery, Zambra, Chestnut, Buchon, Salsa's, Curate, White Duck Taco, and local craft breweries such as Asheville Brewing, The Wedge, Hi-wire, Bens tuneup, Wicked Weed, Green Man & more... name: Serenity & Beauty in Asheville
summary: One or two bedrooms available in a quiet home overlooking Japanese gardens with the songs of finches and playing squirrels. Close to everything yet complete off the path. Let this be your home away from home.
space: It's close to a great coffee shop, cafes, markets and botanical gardens. I have a big wooden deck out back and plenty of room within, great for a quick overnight stay to see Asheville or to create your own space to read, write, meditate, have a massage, or paint. There is NO wifi or TV This is everything I had been looking for. It can fill your greatest desires too.

We're located in a quiet and pretty family neighborhood, yet a couple blocks away from everything Asheville has to offer. There's also yoga studios and a nice jogging path close by. If
neighborhood_overview: We're located in a quiet and pretty family neighborhood, yet a couple blocks away from everything Asheville has to offer. There's also yoga studios and a nice jogging path close by. If you do that kind of thing.
notes: Massage and body-work is also available. I am an energy healer and certified Thai masseuse.
transit: Well, it's Asheville. You hardly need transport. But yes, the buses are great and Uber is seconds away.
host_about:
We're Aria and Michael, from Asheville NC.
We love to travel and host, meeting and sharing with conscious community around the world.
Aria is a Special Needs teacher 
Michael is an Energy Healer
Together we enjoy (obviously) travel, yoga, art, music, hiking, and cooking and sleeping.
Thanks for being part of our life. 
Love and blessings

name: Location! Location! Location!
summary: Located in the River Arts District. Walking distance to coffee shops, art galleries, restaurants, and the beloved Wedge Brewery,  etc. Less than 1 mile to downtown Asheville!  If you are only interested in staying for 1 night please message us,
space: Our house has 2 bedrooms (each with a queen size bed), 1 bathroom, a nice futon and a futon chair that sleeps one small person.
description: Located in the River Arts District. Walking distance to coffee shops, art galleries, restaurants, and the beloved Wedge Brewery,  etc. Less than 1 mile to downtown Asheville!  If you are only interested in staying for 1 night please message us, Our house has 2 bedrooms (each with a queen size bed), 1 bathroom, a nice futon and a futon chair that sleeps one small person. Our house is your house while you're here - you have access to the whole house. We can be available as much or as little as you would like.  Ask us about a tour to the Biltmore Estate - we're pass holders :) "The River Arts District consists of a vast array of artists and working studios set in an urban scene of old factories and historical buildings. Everywhere you turn, art abounds - with creativity happening around every corner. The former warehouse district has grown to house nearly 200 studios and galleries in more than 20 historic buildings."  There are several restaurants/bars - The Grey Eagle Taqueria, Clingman
neighborhood_overview: "The River Arts District consists of a vast array of artists and working studios set in an urban scene of old factories and historical buildings. Everywhere you turn, art abounds - with creativity happening around every corner. The former warehouse district has grown to house nearly 200 studios and galleries in more than 20 historic buildings."  There are several restaurants/bars - The Grey Eagle Taqueria, Clingman Cafe, The Wedge Brewery, 12 Bones, etc.
notes: Yall can help yourself to condiments, tea/coffee, food, etc and the 6 pack of local beer we've left for you. Clean sheets, clean towels, basic toiletries. AC and Heat.
transit: Getting around is easy - it's Asheville!  1 mile to downtown (3 minutes  by car and about a 12 minute walk). Close to trendy West Asheville, the Biltmore Estate and all that Asheville has to offer.
host_about: B and I are open minded, University of Georgia grads that have traveled the world and decided to call this wonderful/eclectic mountain town home! B is a local business owner and I'm a sales representative. We enjoy all things nature, craft brews, and our dog!  We look forward to having you in our home :)

name: Dwntwn Bungalow walk to everything!
summary: Newly remodeled 2 bedroom 1 bath bungalow in the heart of the thriving Five Points Neighborhood. A few mins walk to most anything you may want downtown & a cozy front porch to take it all in. Be a part of the neighborhood with amenities of the city!
space: The Bungalow was built in 1919 with recent updates to  kitchen, bath & dining room. It has unique character, an amazing location and all in all a wonderful feel!  It is perfect for five to six guests and families are encouraged.  If you are just looking for something cheaper than a standardized, corporate, hotel, this is not for you...this is a house that has been lived in & is full of character & life & appreciates its guest to be similar!
description: Newly remodeled 2 bedroom 1 bath bungalow in the heart of the thriving Five Points Neighborhood. If you are just looking for something cheaper than a standardized, corporate, hotel, this is not for you...this is a house that has been lived in & is full of character & life & appreciates its guest to be similar! This is a two bedroom, one bath; with a dining room, den and kitchen. There is a futon in the den that is appropriate for two adult. There is a pack n play & child gates if that is desired. There is a small front yard with flowers, a berry patch and veggies growing in season. There is a quaint front porc
neighborhood_overview: Our thriving 5 Points Neighborhood has been called a great mix of fine and funky, consisting mostly of 1920s and 30s vintage bungalow style homes. We are nestled between downtown and UNC Asheville, a short walk to either. The Reeds Creek Greenway, The UNC Asheville Experimental Forest & the Botanical Gardens are all within a short walk. As well, we have a coffee shop, diner,  MOOG Studios, a health food and grocery stores within a 2-5 minute walk. 5 points is a fun, eclectic, safe, working/creative class neighborhood. So come join in & share the respect of the neighborhood.
notes: This is a great location with walkable access to many fun and exciting things, but all in all a neighborhood, so everyone is welcome and families are encouraged.
transit: This location is convenient to most anything on foot or bike...there are also several bus stops within a few minute walk. Taxis are available & Uber is also in Asheville. There are several UShare (care share cars) within a 10 minute walk. The house house easy access to I-240, I-26 & I-40 & all of downtown.
host_about:
I like to have fun & meet new people and hear about new experiences so as to expand my own understanding of this life.
I like to do fun building projects and see how I might take old materials and recreate them in a new fashion.
I am fairly laid back and I prefer to host people who are also laid back and appreciate bohemian lifestyles. 
I appreciate the urban and rural ways of life and try to live them both to the fullest.
I like new experiences so I've had a variety of jobs/careers: I've been a dishwasher; a farmer; a whitewater rafting guide, a wildland fire manager (in over half the country and other countries too); I served as Director of the Environmental Center @ the local University; got with some awesome colleagues and co-founded the Asheville Buncombe Food Policy Council, I proudly serve as a Guardian ad Litem (child advocacy in the court system) and I do a little community organizing around economic, environmental & overall social justice.

As far as how my style relates to you, my neighbor, I am real hands off! I have a full life and don't hang around too much....but when I do, I like to relax, converse and giggle.

name: Victorian Cottage Downtown Blue Rm
summary: A beautiful one-hundred year old Richard Sharp Smith historic home in Montford neighborhood. 3 blocks from the center of town, 5-15 minute walk to everything.   Hot tub, high speed wi-fi and cable tv,  outdoor spaces for relaxation, gourmet kitchen.
space: You will be staying in the "Blue Room". This is downstairs next to the "Green Room".  Those two rooms share the Mauve bathroom.  This home is a quick 5 minute walk from the center of downtown.  This historic neighborhood is peaceful, yet only a short walk to all the fun activities downtown.  Fantastic restaurants nearby, the Pritchard Park drum circle,  the  US Cellular Center, and St. Lawrence Basilica  are only three blocks away. We are a 5 minute drive from UNCA.. You won't need to move your car once you are settled in, unless you decide to go to the Biltmore Estate and Biltmore Village, 10 minutes away.  Easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, NC Arboretum, Folk Art Center and much more!

Easy access to the Blue Ridge parkway, NC Arboretum, Folk Art Center and much more! This calendar reflects the reservations for the "B
neighborhood_overview: I love the beautiful old historic homes in this Montford neighborhood.  My house dates from circa 1912, termed a "Victorian cottage", and built by Richard Sharp Smith.  Many of the homes in the neighborhood date from the 1880's.  This Victorian neighborhood was the first suburb of Asheville.  It is  very quiet and friendly.  Lots of beautiful walking opportunities around the neighborhood.
notes: Please park on the Elizabeth st side. Also, the day of your arrival, a general ETA is very much appreciated!     I have two small short-haired kitties, Sebastian and Sasha, real sweet and mellow.   They stay outside most of the time and are never allowed in guest rooms for those who might be slightly allergic. I have had several guests stay who are allergic to cats and have had no adverse reactions.    LGBTQ and straight-friendly.      Hair dryer, iron and ironing board available upon request, outdoor hot tub, outdoor screen room, patio with pergola, outdoor fire pit, gas and charcoal grills, flower, herb  and vegetable gardens.
transit: We are happy to do shuttles to and from airport and around town if needed for a small fee. The city bus stops near  the house, but the house is so conveniently located that you will hardly need the public transportation.
host_about:
I am a professional musician. I teach private music lessons in my home and also do a lot of performing and am an adjunct professor of music.   I love to travel, meet people and do fun things. I am proud of my town and am happy to help visitors find the best experience.  I am really easy-going and have been renting rooms in my house for many years to people who need a place to stay for weeks, months or sometimes years.  Guests will have a comfortable home away from home with easy flexibility within the house to come and go as you please. (must love music!)

my life motto:  life is for fun!!!!

name: 380 Reviews  Apt #3 WALK DTWN QUIET
summary: Montford is one of the most desirable neighborhoods in Asheville.
space: "I have been an enthusiastic AirBnb renter for three years and Cathy is by far the most generous and accommodating host I've met. The neighborhood is hilly and beautiful with lovely mature trees. Downtown is a quick drive or a good walk and the bike path is right down at the bottom of the hill. The apartment is charming and quintessentially Asheville with lots of quirky, adorable character. Kitchen is small but provides everything a traveler would need with the added bonus of fresh eggs from the ladies who live out back. Bedroom is airy and comfortable and the bathroom has an inviting claw foot tub that makes me wish I would have had time for a soak. Everything is clean and well appointed, and the selection of books and magazines is terrific. Cathy is so warm and friendly. I had such a nice chat while she watered the garden and I communed with the chickens. I really cannot say enough good things about my visit and I'm already looking forward to coming back!(URL HIDDEN) Mary, May 2015 E

neighborhood_overview: This is a walking neighborhood chock full of historic sites. Take a walking tour. Coming in late and want an easy dinner? Perhaps you'll stop in one of our three neighborhood cafes: Nine Mile and Cheisa and Tod's. Stop in for a quick al fresco breakfast or lunch at Tod's, owners of the acclaimed Table restaurant. Nine Mile always is packed. Chiesa is rustic Italian. Within walking distance from your apartment: The Botanical Gardens of Asheville, the University of North Carolina campus, downtown is a one mile-20 minute walk or 5 minute car ride. Montford Park is only a half a block away and has a basketball court, tennis courts and park benches. Riverside Cemetery is one of the coolest places to view Civil War and Spanish American War grave sites. The Biltmore Estate and Village is approximately 3 miles away. We have four weekly farmers market close by. Everything is easy access.
notes: Because Cathy places a value on vacation tranquility and the apartments were not decorated with child-proofing in mind, they are not well suited for children under the age of fourteen.
transit: Enjoy a lovely walk through the wide boulevards of the historic district. Mansions on both sides of the street. Drive 5 minutes to town and park in any one of several parking decks-1st hour is always free! Many of my guests who want to enjoy the benefits of Asheville being called "Beer City USA" three times opt to walk to downtown and take a $10 taxi or UBER ride home.
host_about:
I have travel in my blood. I was born in Chateauroux, France. My sister was born in Germany and I learned to speak German when my family lived there for four years. Some of my favorites places include, Lagos de Atitlan, Uxmal, Merida, San Cristobal, Antigua, Ambergris Caye, Chichicastengo, Amsterdam, Vancouver, Cologne, Berlin and Prague. I prefer to travel off the "gringo trail" and have many more places to visit. Open to house trade.

I am a passionate student of compassionate communication (NVC). Two important things I've learned is that other people's behavior rarely has anything to do with me and that with patience and compassion, most all our needs can be met. 

For fun around here I have ridden a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a mountain top zip line tour nearby, seen our ancient mountains during a flying lesson, rented a scooter and rode the blue ridge parkway, took a few archery lessons so I could pretend to be like Katniss from The Hunger Games, which was filmed nearby. I also enjoy sitting in the backyard watching my chickens do goofy things. What do you like to do for fun? Let me share more fun things to do in our beautiful mountains.

name: STYLE COMFY Walk2town King&Queenbed
summary: Sometimes you have to sacrifice a quality space to get a primo location. This 2 bed/ 1 bath apt in 1928 historic home has it all. Immaculate, comfy & stylish. Walking distance to downtown Asheville. Large patio overlooking backyard.Live like a local.
space: This truly unique 2 bedroom/ 1 bath apt situated in the lower level of my 1928 home allows guests to see what it is like to live in an authentic, historic, City of Asheville neighborhood.  The guests in this apartment park off the street in the driveway. The huge cement patio leads to the private entrance and overlooks a lush green and wooded backyard. Hard to believe you are 1 mile from bustling downtown Asheville. There is a nice patio set with umbrella and a gas BBQ grill for your exclusive use. Once inside the apt, you will notice the split bedroom plan which allows for plenty of privacy. The bathroom is centrally located off of the hallway so both bedrooms can access it easily. The first bedroom is small but features a comfy queen size bed with beautiful bedding and lots of pillows, bedside lamps, dresser, 2 windows for plenty of natural light, a ceiling fan and closet. Down the hallway, the locked door to the left leads to the laundry room. Straight ahead you enter into the livin

neighborhood_overview: Quiet, historic neighborhood within walking distance to restaurants, massage, movies, grocery store, tennis courts. One mile from Downtown Asheville. Close to UNCA campus, Biltmore Estate, Grove Park Inn, access to the Blue Ridge Parkway, hiking, skiing, kayaking, tubing and Mountain Biking.
notes: This apt is not suitable for children. Guests are supplied with enough paper products, dish soap, shampoo, hand soap, coffee, tea, sugar, etc. for a 3 day stay, which is a standard stay, if guests stay is for a longer duration, it will be necessary to purchase additional supplies. If guests stay is longer than 14 days, a $40 cleaning surcharge will be added to reservation.
transit: Uber is available for about $6 to downtown. Bicycle or walk to town via sidewalks. Drive & park in downtown parking lot.  City bus is avail but not easy to use.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Julie

I was born in N.J, although you would never guess (No Jersey accent here!).   I moved with my family to Clearwater, Florida when I was in high school and graduated from the University of South Florida in Tampa with a degree in Psychology. I eventually heard about Asheville, NC, visited, moved there and lived there full time for 15 years. For the last 6 years I have been splitting my time between Dunedin,(just north of Clearwater) Florida and Asheville, NC, two delightfully beautiful, creative and diverse cities, I absolutely adore. 

 I love the beaches of Florida, but my heart is always drawn back to the mountains.

 When I first moved to North Carolina, I was a social worker. Through some friends, I was drawn into a seasonal inn- keeping position at a ski lodge in Beech Mtn, North Carolina. That lead me to work for a couple of years at the Richmond Hill Inn in Asheville as a concierge.

Ultimately, I decided I wanted to have my own vacation rentals.

That dream has finally materialized and I have furnished vacation rentals in Asheville and Dunedin, where I divide my time. I enjoy traveling, meeting people and providing the most comfortable and  friendly lodging that I can.

My attraction to Asheville & Dunedin besides the natural surroundings are the great outdoor recreation opportunities- biking, hiking, whitewater rafting, motorcycle rides on the Blue Ridge Parkway, kayaking, tennis and lounging at the beach.  I also love the warm, intelligent, creative people of both Asheville & Dunedin, the abundant live music, the vibrant arts scene, many incredible restaurants, and its celebration of diversity.

SO WELCOME TO ASHEVILLE & DUNEDIN!

When I travel, I prefer to stay in individually owned places like cottages, B&B's, hostels, condos and apartments instead of generic hotels. And I want my guests to experience the incredible vibes of Asheville & Dunedin, to enjoy a quiet, comforting, unique get a way, and then come back often to visit.

 The welcome mat is always out ! Either myself or a friend is always available, should the need arise during your stay.

 There is a lock box  for your convenience, so no worries about conflicting schedules, late arrivals, etc. 

 I can be contacted via phone, text or email, before, during and after your stay.

My life motto;

“Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing." Helen Keller

Here's to your life adventures!

Cheers,
Julie
street: Austin Avenue, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

name: The Hidden Attic - Great location!
summary: Walking distance to downtown Asheville(.8 mile), the charming, cozy and quiet Hidden Attic provides an one-of-a-kind lodging. A place where design dances with comfort and convenience. Please contact host for availability after 6/15.
space: The designers, Deb and Angus MacLeod, created a fantastic and romantic hide-away where design dances with comfort and convenience. They have created a magical space where starched doilies hang like snowflakes, crystals reflect colorful light, vaulted ceiling angles and curves add interest and spaces are well utilized. There is an eclectic library and music collection, DVDs and a streaming Blue-ray/DVD player. The Hidden Attic's kitchen is fully equipped, as is the laundry and bath area, including cushy robes and slippers. The queen sleeping areas are located in built-in alcoves and there is a full mattress located in its own space tucked under the eaves. The Hidden Attic is unique, charming and warm. Enjoy snuggling in its warm embrace.

neighborhood_overview: The Hidden Attic is located in a quiet residential neighborhood within walking distance of downtown Asheville. Trader Joe's, Green Life/Whole Foods and Harris Teeters grocers are located within 2 blocks, as are yoga studios, Staples, salons, dry cleaners, restaurants and more.
notes: The Hidden Attic is on the third floor so there are two flights of stairs. The attic storage to the left as you walk in the door contains the patio umbrella, a cooler,  extra paper supplies, rain umbrellas, yoga mats, extra counter stools and cleaning supplies. This space is suitable for luggage storage.
transit: All you need is a good pair of shoes! The Hidden Attic is conveniently located a few blocks off interstate 240 and 2 blocks off Merrimon Avenue (the 240 exit street). It is the main thoroughfare going directly through downtown and is one of the routes to Biltmore Village, an upscale boutique shopping area and the location of the Biltmore Estate. You can walk, bike or take an inexpensive UBER ride to downtown to avoid paying to park. It is approximately a 15-20 minute walk or .8 miles. You will need a car to venture further out to explore the mountains, beautiful waterfalls, hiking trails, and quaint surrounding towns.  Special Recommendations: We recommend using the WAZE app as your GPS. It's more accurate in this area. Also GPS will not work at all in some areas so take a picture of your directions or write them down. Asheville's parking lots and meters use the Passport app to pay for parking. We recommend you have it available on your phone. Some “permit only" parking is available af
host_about:
Greg and I welcome you to the Asheville area! We recently moved to Asheville from Vail, CO and Kansas City, MO and boy do we love living here. Our favorite thing to do is make new friends. We enjoy traveling, food, wine, music, fun and a wide spectrum of cultural activities. We also snow ski and snowshoe, scuba dive and volunteer with several organizations including food pantry's, un-homed outreach, farmers markets, and healthy aging programs. We both have experience in the hospitality industry with Greg working in the hotel industry in Vail and Susan working in many aspects of the industry before teaching Hospitality Management for many years.
If your visit includes a special occasion please let us know so we can surprise you with something special.

name: Cosmopolitan Loft in City Centre
summary: Like the saucy, urbane bestie who is a steady confidant, the Cosmopolitan Loft has got your back. Relax and enjoy this swanky respite after a day on the town. ~Legal City-Inspected Listing~
space: This beautifully decorated loft is situated on one of the most eclectic streets in the epicenter of downtown.  This spacious loft boasts 12 ft original tin ceilings and gorgeous 100+ year old hard wood floors.  Experience the comfort of home loft life with the city at your threshold.  LGBTQ and straight friendly. Cleaning fee included in rate, plus one parking space provided. Four public parking lots less than a block away at $3-$5 per day for additional cars. additional $100 fee for a one night stay

Easy walk to Moog, all downtown breweries, restaurants, and cafés. Less than a block to bars and restaurants, yet quietly tucked away from the hustle and bustle.

host_about:
Having lived in Asheville for 19 years, sharing tips about places to dine and things to do is a natural joy. I've been designing and developing properties for more than a decade. Creating spaces for guests to enjoy is a true labor of love! I also enjoy travel, and have integrated some architectural pieces I've gathered along the journey into some of my rentals. 
I'm so delighted to accommodate you, your family, and friends!

name: Downtown Asheville, Antique Style
summary: Stay in downtown Asheville and walk everywhere! A private, second-floor corner room with antique furnishings, queen-size bed, fridge, wifi, high ceiling, ceiling fan, wood floors, large windows, shared balcony. Shared bathroom, lockable, very clean!
space: This is one private room only. Bathrooms and kitchen are shared 'old world' style in this 104 year old Inn and Rooming House. We are located on Asheville's main street, Biltmore Ave; there is always easy access to downtown shops, restaurants, theaters, etc. Please note: this room faces the street and The Orange Peel which occasionally hosts noisy events.
description: Stay in downtown Asheville and walk everywhere! A private, second-floor corner room with antique furnishings, queen-size bed, fridge, wifi, high ceiling, ceiling fan, wood floors, large windows, shared balcony. Shared bathroom, lockable, very clean! This is one private room only. Bathrooms and kitchen are shared 'old world' style in this 104 year old Inn and Rooming House. We are located on Asheville's main street, Biltmore Ave; there is always easy access to downtown shops, restaurants, theaters, etc. Please note: this room faces the street and The Orange Peel which occasionally hosts noisy events. Access is easy to bathrooms, kitchen, laundry, patio, porch, and balcony. Wi-fi is available. Computer and telephone are free in the lobby. John is available days, and JT is the resident manager. We'll check you in after 5pm (by appointment only) and leave you alone the rest of the time. If you will be arriving late, let us know so we can make sure to be there.  We are not on-site full time
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop that is open to the public. Across the street are the Orange Peel music hall and Wicked Weed Brewery. Read about the Bunkum Stone (a landmark) by the front entry.
notes: Please communicate your arrival time so we can be there for you. Check-in is by appointment only. Confirm with us ahead of time if you will be arriving late. Rooms are stocked with hand soap and towels. Bring a bathrobe and body soap for showering. The room has a window air conditioner for the summer months.
transit: Walk to downtown shops and entertainment spots. Public transit bus stops are in front of the building, going north and south. Asheville's main bus depot is 4 city blocks to the west. There is some free parking in the back, and pay parking next door.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

name: HIP DOWNTOWN HIDEAWAY
summary: Come relax in our cozy downtown hideaway! A few blocks from downtown Asheville with lots of parking, new beds, modern appliances, and stylish furnishings. Great for families, friends, or a romantic getaway. Enjoy downtown Asheville without the noise!
space: Our house has two large bedrooms with brand new queen beds and TVs in each bedroom. We have WIFI, cable TV, central heating and A/C, and washer and dryer. We also provide complimentary coffee, tea, milk, and cereal to get you going in the mornings! The house has a spacious front porch with chairs and a large fenced-in yard. We are just a few blocks from downtown so you can walk there in minutes and can retreat to a quiet house in a residential neighborhood at the end of the day! Unfortunately, we do not allow pets at this property. Sorry, no exceptions.
description: Come relax in our cozy downtown hideaway! A few blocks from downtown Asheville with lots of parking, new beds, modern appliances, and stylish furnishings. Great for families, friends, or a romantic getaway. Enjoy downtown Asheville without the noise! Our house has two large bedrooms with brand new queen beds and TVs in each bedroom. We have WIFI, cable TV, central heating and A/C, and washer and dryer. We also provide complimentary coffee, tea, milk, and cereal to get you going in the mornings! The house has a spacious front porch with chairs and a large fenced-in yard. We are just a few blocks from downtown so you can walk there in minutes and can retreat to a quiet house in a residential neighborhood at the end of the day! Unfortunately, we do not allow pets at this property. Sorry, no exceptions. Guests have access to the full first floor apartment and porch. Guests also have access to lots of free street parking right in front of the house. I live in town and am available if guests
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in a residential neighborhood just blocks away from all the amenities of downtown Asheville so you are a quick walk from countless shops, restaurants, coffee shops, breweries, theaters, concert venues, and pubs! Walk three blocks to the Orange Peel to see a great concert, or check out the hip new breweries of the South Slope area - Burial, Twin Leaf, Catawba, the Funkatorium, and Green Man are all amazing small-batch breweries within blocks of the house. Or tuck into Vortex doughnuts for delicious doughnuts with a local flair! We are a quick drive from the Biltmore Estate and the Blue Ridge Parkway, and zip-lining and rafting outfitters are located nearby.
notes: We are happy to offer rides to/from the Asheville airport for $30. Just let us know if you would like to request a ride!
transit: The Gray Line Trolley sight-seeing tours and the La Zoom comedy bus tours are really fun ways to get around and see the town!
host_about: I'm originally from Chicago, went to school in Iowa, and worked on agricultural and food policy at the Environmental Protection Agency in DC for 7 years before I moved to Asheville in 2013. I absolutely ADORE this area, and I think it's one of the coolest spots in the country, if not the world!!! :)

name: Downtown Hipster Apartment # 2
summary: This redone historic downtown apt is perfect for your AVL adventure. It is only a 5 minute walk to downtown & convenient to 3 major grocery stores- This affordable unit is equipped w/ a queen bed, kitchen, Wifi & a cozy front porch. Check out reviews
space: This hipster apartment will be perfect for your Asheville adventures. This cozy 400 square foot one bedroom apartment has everything you need. This upstairs apartment has a queen size bed,  living room,  kitchen with dining area, and a bathroom.  The bathroom has been redone but guests should know that it is small with a stall shower.  There is a window air conditioning unit that keeps the whole apartment cool. There is a TV and a network DVD player but NO CABLE.  You could stream content from your devices using a standard HDMI cord if you so choose.   Guests will have access to a big covered front porch which is shared with 2 other apartments.  Guests will also be able to use a parking permit to park on the street in front of the house which is permit parking only.  I love living in Asheville and would like to help you make the most of your visit. Just let me know if you need any suggestions for things to do or places to eat. I live down the street and am available if you need me, or

neighborhood_overview: The house is located in the 5 Points neighborhood. This area has historic houses and is on the north edge of downtown. This is a very desirable neighborhood. You'll feel like a local as you take a short stroll out your front door to all downtown locations.
notes: There's a whole foods store across the street which is super convenient. The market is open from 7:30am-9:00pm every day and (email hidden) & salad bar, coffee & smoothie bar, & deli. Perfect for a quick bite. Pets are allowed for a fee of $75 for one small well behaved animal.  This apartment has antique furniture and I prefer the pets to stay off the furniture.  If this is an issue, I can provide a furniture cover to accommodate you and your fury friend.
transit: Getting around is super easy! Just a 5-10 minute walk to anywhere downtown. There's downtown parking garages and street parking if you want to drive. But honestly, it's faster to walk than to drive and find parking.  This is the perfect location to get the most out of downtown Asheville.
host_about: Hi!  I'm Reid, thanks for checking me out, here'a a little more about me.  I am a father,a realtor, a traveller, and ambassador for world peace.  I have really enjoyed being an AirBnB host, its great to meet new people and help them fall in love with Asheville.  I've lived here for over 20 years now and absolutely love this city.  I am happy share some of my Asheville favorites spots, insider tips, and things to do, so don't hesitate to ask me!

name: Sparrow Cottage
summary: This bright, cheerful, and impeccably clean cottage is a little home away from home!  Walking distance to Downtown Asheville, local shopping, restaurants and night life and easy access to the Blue Ridge Parkway and surrounding attractions.
space: Live like a local! Sparrow Cottage is a clean and cozy one bedroom, one bath house only a half mile from UNC-A, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter supermarket and an easy one-mile walk to the heart of Downtown with its great restaurants, galleries, shopping and night life.   The space is inviting, clean and bright! The front door opens out to a great front porch with a sitting area, perfect for a morning cup of coffee or evening glass of wine! The yard is grassed and fenced. The open floor plan includes a living room, dining area and fully equipped kitchen. The full bathroom has a tub and shower combo. The bedroom offers a comfy queen-size bed, closet, chifferobe and nightstands. The futon in the living room converts to a second queen bed.  Please email if you have any questions or special circumstances; we do our best to accommodate guests at Sparrow Cottage and provide an excellent stay in our beautiful city!
description: This bright, cheerful, and impeccably clean cottage is a little home away from home!  Walking distance to Downtown Asheville, local shopping, restaurants and night life and easy access to the Blue Ridge Parkway and surrounding attractions. Live like a local! Sparrow Cottage is a clean and cozy one bedroom, one bath house only a half mile from UNC-A, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter supermarket and an easy one-mile walk to the heart of Downtown with its great restaurants, galleries, shopping and night life. The bedroom offers a comfy queen-size bed, closet, chifferobe and nightstands. The futon in the living room converts to a second queen bed.  Please email
neighborhood_overview: Sparrow Cottage is ideally located for visitors who want easy access to Asheville's quaint and lively downtown as well as all the natural beauty of the surrounding mountains. The center of downtown is filled with restored Art Deco buildings housing a wide variety of restaurants, galleries, night spots, music venues, local breweries and great shopping.  Access to I-240 is a few blocks away. Take a walk through Historic Montford or along Reed Creek Greenway, both right across the street from the cottage. Asheville's vibrant River Arts District and historic Biltmore Estate and Village are both a short 5-7 minute drive from the cottage.
notes: Inquire about longer stays.
transit: 2 off-street parking spaces at entrance to Cottage Walking distance to downtown, UNC-A, Trader Joe's, High Five Coffee Bar and Harris Teeter Supermarket Easy Access to I-240, I-40 and I-26
host_about: I came to Asheville on vacation in 2003 and never left! This place is just that beautiful and welcoming. I love the rich history and all this small city has to offer - the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains, outdoor adventure, great restaurants, art, music and a population of free-spirited creative people. I've recently published my first novel, a Tate Marlowe mystery titled Final Rights.

name: Urban Micro Studio Downtown
summary: Enjoy our minimalist, 1-room efficiency apartment with a private entrance and private bathroom for the solo traveler. Convenient and safe 20-minute walk to downtown Asheville, Whole Foods, Asheville Yoga Center, Still Point Wellness and more.
space: Welcome to our itty-bitty studio for the solo traveler! Enjoy all that Downtown Asheville has to offer while staying in an affordable, convenient location 1-mile from the heart of downtown.  Enjoy basic cooking and food storage with a small fridge, safe induction cooktop, coffee and tea service. There is a single bed that folds into a chair (Ikea) to maximize living space, and a drop-leaf table and stool for laptop use during your stay. Our house manual has tons of information for your stay, including current issues of local independent publications and restaurant guides.
description: Enjoy our minimalist, 1-room efficiency apartment with a private entrance and private bathroom for the solo traveler. Convenient and safe 20-minute walk to downtown Asheville, Whole Foods, Asheville Yoga Center, Still Point Wellness and more. Welcome to our itty-bitty studio for the solo traveler! Enjoy all that Downtown Asheville has to offer while staying in an affordable, convenient location 1-mile from the heart of downtown.  Enjoy basic cooking and food storage with a small fridge, safe induction cooktop, coffee and tea service. There is a single bed that folds into a chair (Ikea) to maximize living space, and a drop-leaf table and stool for laptop use during your stay. Our house manual has tons of information for your stay, including current issues of local independent publications and restaurant guides. Our studio features a separate entrance and fully private space which is attached to the home and shares one wall. Our shaded backyard is also available for you to enjoy. We offe
neighborhood_overview: We are located just minutes from the creek-side greenway, forest trails, and Botanical Gardens on UNCA campus. Whether you like to eat well in or out, our neighborhood is home to Whole Foods, Trader Joe's and Harris Teeter, in addition to the many delicious, local restaurants.   Discover all downtown has to offer. On your leisurely walk, you will see the charming Craftsman style homes of our neighborhood give way to a quirky mix of original Art Deco, Beaux Arts and Neoclassical styles downtown. Stop and listen to any number of talented street musicians and entertainers along your path. Asheville is home to a strong local business culture, featuring locally-owned restaurants and coffee shops, shopping boutiques, and more than 30 art galleries.
notes: We share our home with two cats who roam the property freely.
transit: The studio is centrally located within one mile of major highways, and 1/2 mile from main bus line. One of our favorite things about Asheville is the strong support of bike culture. There are bike lanes through much of downtown, and mindful cyclists are welcome on the greenways and forest trails.
host_about:
Asheville's unofficial motto: "Don't postpone joy"

Five (okay, six) things I can't live without: stars, books, good people, good food, my compass, and my kitties.

My favorite restaurants in Asheville: Plant, Laughing Seed, Mayfel's.

Best places to sit, sip, nibble and dream: The Battery Park Book Exchange, High Five Coffee, Dobra Tea House, The Coffee Bus, Vortex Donuts, Malaprops bookstore.

I'll see anything that's playing at: the Fine Arts Movie Theater, the Mothlight music venue.

If it's your first visit to Asheville, don't miss: a hike on the Blue Ridge Parkway, a sunset drink at the Skybar, the LaZoom Comedy Bus Tour, a roots drink at Noble Kava, the vegan donuts at Vortex, and amazing snackage at the Gourmet Chip Company.

My motto: Life is like a paper airplane. Find some cool paper, be creative, and give it to the wind to see what it does. Rinse, repeat, and enjoy.

host_about: I am a young, part time student currently in the process of starting my own business. I provide start-up book-keeping and online data transfer services for different types of clients including small businesses and non-profits. I use a cloud based software called Xero, a company based out of New Zealand that operates on an international level. My goal is to transfer to the UNCA accounting program in the spring of 2014 and continue my studies there until I earn my 4 year degree then go on to try to earn my CPA. I have several hobbies including backpacking, mountain biking, juggling, computer games, and reading.

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is fun and close to everything most Asheville visitors seek, has a woodsy feel, yet walking distance to downtown and UNCA, Botanical Gardens, with nice, friendly, relaxed neighbors. Dough, Homegrown, Moe's Burritos, Musicians Workshop, Luella's BBQ, all less than 5 minute walk from apartment. Couple of blocks to beautiful UNCA-owned public wooded trails that lead to Botanical Gardens, UNCA, ropes courses, etc. 10 minute walk to Trader Joe's, Whole Foods and Harris Teeters, 15-20 minute walk to heart of downtown (GPS says walking is about 18 minutes) or 3+ minutes by car, according to (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) maps. Neighborhood has some historic homes, some newer homes, some townhouses, w/ some families, professionals, artists, and students.
notes: Our alarm system is actually our little pug on other side of house who loves people but may bark a bit, just  because she wants to protect the premises, but loves everyone once she catches your scent. Kurig coffee machine with K cup coffee included. There is also a mesh insert for ground coffee if you choose to bring your own.  Please leave your key under the door mat when you check out. Check out is at noon. Please leave towels hanging behind door before you leave.
transit: Many guests love the mile walk to downtown and UNCA, however, some guests find it too far to walk. Uber is an affordable and popular option. Bus stops 2 blocks away. Everything accessible. Perfect location to get to downtown and UNCA,  shops, restaurants, cafes, breweries, boutiques, clubs, galleries, theater, fine arts theater, museums, Thomas Wolf House, 10 minute drive to Biltmore Village, Biltmore House and Gardens, and the Grove Park Inn, Blue Ridge Parkway, NC Arboretum.
host_about: I am a writer and musician. My husband is a visual artist and creative director for an advertising agency. Our wonderful kids are 5 and 9, play soccer, and love to camp and do outdoorsy things. We have been in Asheville for about 10 years and love it. We met in San Francisco, but moved here to start a family.

summary: I love this space and I know you will too. A short walk to The Orange Peel and a one mile walk from the heart of Downtown Asheville, with a beautiful view of Mount Pisgah. I live here with my dog, and we would love for you to be our guest :)
description: I love this space and I know you will too. A short walk to The Orange Peel and a one mile walk from the heart of Downtown Asheville, with a beautiful view of Mount Pisgah. I live here with my dog, and we would love for you to be our guest :) As you can tell from the pictures, everything is pretty wide open. 2 bedrooms and one bathroom. The bedroom you'll use is actually mine, but it's so comfortable, I thought I'd let you have it. :) Private entrance for you to the bathroom. Other door is in the hall... which I use. My room / massage room is at the end of the hall. I will give you my phone number, so I am always a text or call away. I'm happy to answer any questions about the area. I'm new here myself, but living and working downtown, I've caught on to some cool spots.  I work weekends so we really won't see each other much. And Daisy usually hides when I'm not here, so you probably won't really see her either. If I haven't met you when you check in, I'll introduce myself when you get
notes: I'm very flexible with checking in and out, but I'm kind of a stickler for an eta on your initial arrival. Any other checking in that you do is great, but certainly not expected. Sometimes it's just nice to have an idea though. :)
transit: walking 1 mile to downtown uber is about $5-$6 to downtown parking garages downtown are $6 day max
host_about:
Thanks for checking out my place. I live here with my dog Daisy. I'm new to Asheville, and wanted to live close enough to walk downtown, with a beautiful mountain view. That's why I think this apartment will be perfect for you too!!! It is a 1 mile pedestrian friendly walk to downtown and a $7 uber ride home. I hope that you have a small dog, but will look forward to talking to you about that :)Asheville is super dog friendly so you're little love bug will have a great time checking out the city with you. 
 I work as a massage therapist in a few locations and practice out of my home. It's a peaceful place, and I hope you'll be our guest.

name: Romantic & Bohemian Private Studio
summary: This one bedroom, one bath studio is located in the back of my beautifully restored 1920s bungalow in downtown Asheville.
space: The studio apartment, located in the back part of my house, is decorated with a mix of modern and vintage furniture. Some have been in my life for a long time, some brand new to the space, and art made by me hangs on the walls. There's a small kitchenette with table and chairs, a bedroom with exposed brick from an old cooks stove and a living area with a very cozy pullout couch. The full bath has a claw foot tub/shower that has a custom copper curtain rod and antique heirloom vanity. This is a perfect retreat for two people, but can accommodate four if necessary.
description: This one bedroom, one bath studio is located in the back of my beautifully restored 1920s bungalow in downtown Asheville. The studio apartment, located in the back part of my house, is decorated with a mix of modern and vintage furniture. Some have been in my life for a long time, some brand new to the space, and art made by me hangs on the walls. There's a small kitchenette with table and chairs, a bedroom with exposed brick from an old cooks stove and a living area with a very cozy pullout couch. The full bath has a claw foot tub/shower that has a custom copper curtain rod and antique heirloom vanity. This is a perfect retreat for two people, but can accommodate four if necessary. The private entrance is in the back of the house, with a cozy porch all to yourself. There is plenty of parking on the street. I will provide you with a parking pass to hang on your rearview mirror. To enter the apartment, simply walk along the driveway to the right of the house and the door is in the back
neighborhood_overview: The beauty of the house not only lies in all of its charm, but also in it's location! There's a unique Whole Foods, called Greenlife, right across the street and Trader Joes is a couple blocks up from that. If you fancy yoga, Asheville Yoga Center is about three blocks away, on Liberty Street. In the other direction, a lovely greenway runs along Reeds Creek, or you can simply stroll around the eclectic neighborhood. Historic Montford, one the oldest neighborhoods (and in my humble opinion, the most beautiful), is a block away and the architecture is truly inspiring. My favorite coffee shop sits at the bottom of the street, called High Five Cafe. Don't let the hip tattooed baristas intimidate you- the coffee is delicious! Most importantly, all of downtown is just a 5-10 minute walk, complete with shopping, museums, restaurants, breweries, bars and music venues.
notes: Linens and towels will be provided. And there will also be tea, coffee and snacks.
transit: It is quite possible to park your car and leave it for your entire visit, but if an outdoor adventure is what you crave, there is plenty of hiking, rafting, mountain biking, climbing and more. The blue ridge parkway can easily be accessed off the highway and interstate 240 is right down the street, which connects you to I40 and I26. There is also public transportation, with a bus stop just a couple blocks away.
host_about: I grew up on the southern outer banks of North Carolina, and I've lived in Asheville for the last five years. I've fallen in love with this eccentric vibrant city and have slowly begun to spread my roots here over the years. Like most Ashevillians, I love the crisp mountain air, the enchanting scenery, the music, the people, and the art. Home is very important to me, as it's the place you can retreat to refuel and ground yourself. I take very good care of my space and with that have a great respect for other people's space as well.

summary: Newly furnished large 1BD garden apartment with all the comforts. Lots of windows give this large space a bright and airy feel, and the light hardwoods help keep it clean. Located in beautiful historic Montford, it's just a 10 minute walk to downtown!
space: Beautiful and spacious, lots of light, and located in the best neighborhood in Asheville: Historic Montford, this 1 bedroom apartment is a quick walk to downtown Asheville and has everything you need for a long or short stay.
description: Newly furnished large 1BD garden apartment with all the comforts. Lots of windows give this large space a bright and airy feel, and the light hardwoods help keep it clean. Located in beautiful historic Montford, it's just a 10 minute walk to downtown! Beautiful and spacious, lots of light, and located in the best neighborhood in Asheville: Historic Montford, this 1 bedroom apartment is a quick walk to downtown Asheville and has everything you need for a long or short stay. Refrigerator, Range, Oven, Dishwasher, Microwave, Washer/Dryer, Coffee Maker, Coffee Grinder, Toaster, Ceramic Tea Pot, Cast Iron Pans, New Wave Enviro Water Filter, Stainless Cookware, DVDs, Books, Wireless Internet, (No Cable),  Wii with drawing, sports games, etc, books, MP3 player, Queen Bed, Dresser, Backyard, Outdoor Table I may or may not be here to check you in, but I will leave detailed check-in instructions upon booking.  If you need anything, please let me know, and I'll take care of it promptly. I love to
neighborhood_overview: I think this is the best neighborhood in Asheville, and when I was looking to move out of my old apartment on Cumberland Ave in Montford, I searched nearly a year for a house in the same neighborhood. I was so happy to find this one. I can't say enough good about this neighborhood. It is the best for walking around and walking to downtown and back. My favorite place to walk here is Riverside Cemetery, and it is really a must see, not just for its famous graves (like Thomas Wolfe & family), but also for its magnificent trees and rolling hills. Montford is truly beautiful, with so many Victorian homes. If you get a chance, do walk or drive down Montford Avenue and Cumberland Avenue and look at all the gorgeous homes. I think walking is better, especially on a spring or summer day, because it really gives you a chance to take in the splendor that is historic Asheville. Montford has several amazing restaurants: Nine Mile for Caribbean, Chiesa for Italia (homeade pasta), and Tod's Tasties,
notes: It's a super comfy, queen size bed. This apartment can sleep up to four people, because in addition to the queen bed, there is a rollaway twin cot, and a very comfortable, long, flat couch. There are extra sheets and towels for the twin bed and couch. This is a downstairs apartment and I do live above you, so I just want you to be aware of that in case you're easily turned off from hearing any foot steps.
transit: Asheville Area Transit stops at the intersection of Soco and Montford Avenue. It is a quick walk from here. The downtown bus station is also an easy walk from here.  Also, if you want to walk to downtown or the River Arts District but don't feel like walking back, you can get an Uber for around $5.
host_about:
I am very excited to be opening my home to guests. The downstairs apartment is quite lovely, and I sometimes wish I lived there myself. I live above it, in the main house, so if there is anything you need during your stay, please do not hesitate to ask. 

Airbnb wants me to tell you 5 things I can't live without. Here are more than 5 for now:  Love and  human interaction, good conversation, and travel. I love hearing other people's stories. I love learning and doing new things. I love having good projects and challenges. I like to share my gifts in a way that makes the world a better place. Most of all, I am very committed to my soul path, and I strive to listen to the voice of Spirit in everything I do. 

I like to broaden my perspective, quiet my mind, move my body, cherish moments, pet animals, eat good food, feel swept away by how wonderful life can feel, and allow myself to grieve when the time comes for that. 

As far as my style of traveling goes, I like so many kinds. I love camping, traveling solo, traveling on the fly and for little money, and I like my comforts. I've come to find that I love luxury too. 

As far as hosting goes, I truly feel that if I've done my job right, you will have all of your needs met, and you will not need too much from me.

I really want you to come to Asheville. I think it is a wonderful place. But don't take my word for it. Come see for yourself.

name: Rankin House Inn- James Eugene Room
summary: The James Eugene Room features a queen bed, private in room bath, private entrance and sitting porch overlooking the courtyard. Wide plank walls, glowing heart pine floors and exposed original brick all add to this rooms rustic and cozy charm.
space: Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies.
description: The James Eugene Room features a queen bed, private in room bath, private entrance and sitting porch overlooking the courtyard. Wide plank walls, glowing heart pine floors and exposed original brick all add to this rooms rustic and cozy charm.  Rankin House Inn is located in Asheville, North Carolina in the historic Montford district. Three  blocks from vibrant downtown Asheville, Rankin House Inn is the oldest frame-built home in Asheville. This five bedroom, five bathroom B&B offers luxurious common spaces and over 1200 square feet of covered porches and balconies. Guest can enjoy off street parking, outdoor porches, courtyard and garden areas. Common areas include the parlor/ game room, dining room and kitchen; where a continental breakfast is available each morning and coffee, beverages and light adult quaffs are offered throughout the day. The James Eugene room also features a semi private outdoor sitting porch. Make yourself at home! The historic architecture and it's convenience
neighborhood_overview: The historic architecture and it's convenience to all the  attractions of downtown makes your stay a memorable experience. The casual atmosphere along with eclectic furnishings create a relaxed setting for a rejuvenating Asheville stay.
notes: The James Eugene room is pet friendly for a small fee
transit: The inn is walking distance to many shops, grocery stores, restaurants, and bars if you decide to leave your car in our off street parking.

I love this job along with music, photography, and another  home I'm renovating for vacation rentals. I like hanging in the background, ready to help you with what you need for a comfortable stay.

name: Romantic, Fireplace KBED Walk2town
summary: HUGE, beautiful, romantic apt, historic neighborhood 1 mile walk 2 downtown action. 2 gaslog Fireplaces. 1 in Bedroom. 50'Smart TV,French doors, glass sun room, wood floors, lots of light, private 2nd floor balcony,views of Grove Park Inn & Mtns.
space: This spacious, furnished apartment, located on the 2rd floor of this beautiful 1928 home, exemplifies Asheville living, very unique. Hardwood floors throughout. French doors between Bedroom and sunroom. Large walk in closet.  Lots of natural light throughout. Both the living room and bedroom have glass doors that open onto a private balcony with awesome views of the Grove Park Inn and Sunset Mtn. The living room is huge with a comfy sectional couch and stone fireplace with gas logs.  The large eat in kitchen has a wall of windows overlooking trees and the back yard.  Both the living room and the bedroom have original stone fireplaces with gas logs. What better way to end or start the day in the mountains then a warm, crackling fire?  The bedroom is spacious with a solid hickory King sized bed,  huge walk in closet, fireplace, french doors....... There is a leather chair & ottoman by the fireplace for a cozy place to read. How much more romantic does it get than lying in bed with your s

neighborhood_overview: This neighborhood is perfect for walking. There are sidewalks that take you past varied and beautiful architecture. Everyone you meet is friendly.  You can also walk to Trader Joe's Grocery store to pick up some great wine & cheese!
notes: This apartment is very spacious but it was designed for two adults maximum. It has one King size bed, so this apartment would not work for 2 friends traveling together. It is perfect for a single or couple. This is a 3rd floor apt and not suitable for children. I do not allow more than 2 guests in this apt. A lot of people inquire as to what constitutes a guest. Simply put, 1 guest=1 human being.  Guests are supplied with enough paper products, dish soap, shampoo, hand soap, coffee, tea, sugar, etc. for a 3 day stay, which is a standard stay, if guests stay is for a longer duration, it will be may be necessary to purchase additional supplies.
transit: The apartment is only 1 block from the bus line.  Sidewalks. Walk or ride bike to town. Cab or Uber ride is only $5-7 dollars into town. Walk-sidewalks lead you right into downtown Asheville from this apartment.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Julie

I was born in N.J, although you would never guess (No Jersey accent here!).   I moved with my family to Clearwater, Florida when I was in high school and graduated from the University of South Florida in Tampa with a degree in Psychology. I eventually heard about Asheville, NC, visited, moved there and lived there full time for 15 years. For the last 6 years I have been splitting my time between Dunedin,(just north of Clearwater) Florida and Asheville, NC, two delightfully beautiful, creative and diverse cities, I absolutely adore. 

 I love the beaches of Florida, but my heart is always drawn back to the mountains.

 When I first moved to North Carolina, I was a social worker. Through some friends, I was drawn into a seasonal inn- keeping position at a ski lodge in Beech Mtn, North Carolina. That lead me to work for a couple of years at the Richmond Hill Inn in Asheville as a concierge.

Ultimately, I decided I wanted to have my own vacation rentals.

That dream has finally materialized and I have furnished vacation rentals in Asheville and Dunedin, where I divide my time. I enjoy traveling, meeting people and providing the most comfortable and  friendly lodging that I can.

My attraction to Asheville & Dunedin besides the natural surroundings are the great outdoor recreation opportunities- biking, hiking, whitewater rafting, motorcycle rides on the Blue Ridge Parkway, kayaking, tennis and lounging at the beach.  I also love the warm, intelligent, creative people of both Asheville & Dunedin, the abundant live music, the vibrant arts scene, many incredible restaurants, and its celebration of diversity.

SO WELCOME TO ASHEVILLE & DUNEDIN!

When I travel, I prefer to stay in individually owned places like cottages, B&B's, hostels, condos and apartments instead of generic hotels. And I want my guests to experience the incredible vibes of Asheville & Dunedin, to enjoy a quiet, comforting, unique get a way, and then come back often to visit.

 The welcome mat is always out ! Either myself or a friend is always available, should the need arise during your stay.

 There is a lock box  for your convenience, so no worries about conflicting schedules, late arrivals, etc. 

 I can be contacted via phone, text or email, before, during and after your stay.

My life motto;

“Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing." Helen Keller

Here's to your life adventures!

Cheers,
Julie

name: Bird House 1 block from Downtown!
summary: This tall, thin beauty of a house provides the convenience of downtown Asheville's many offerings, the privacy of a stand alone structure, and the novelty of trying out the tiny house trend without the commitment!
space: This is a three story house.  If you have any trouble with mobility, this is probably not the vacation rental for you.  The kitchen is located on the bottom floor and has two large doors that open to a small patio.  A retractable screen door keeps the bugs out and let's the outside in.  The main floor where you will enter, has a compact bathroom and seating area along with games, DVDs, and postcards to make your friends jealous of your trip! ;)  The top floor is the bedroom that features a washer/dryer unit, flat screen TV, DVD player, and plenty of storage.   The house is filled with natural light and other features include- WiFi, central air & heat, designated, off-street parking, a private yard with outdoor seating, linens, shampoo, soap, etc.

name: Chestnut Hills Vacalodge!
summary: Family-friendly private 2 Bedroom apartment: 2 Blocks to Vegetarian restaurant, Plant, 2 Blocks to Trader Joe's, 4 blocks to Asheville Yoga, 5 blocks to High Five Coffee, 6 blocks to Downtown!
space: The house is a large duplex. The Rainey family lives upstairs (toddler Hugo, Preschooler Penelope, Papa Eric and Mama Angie). Then we rent the 1st floor out to AirBnB guests! We love where we live. It's right in the middle of everything we want to access in Asheville, but tucked above and away from Merrimon Avenue. There's a huge green space in the back to retreat to for morning coffee or a picnic. The building is a 1920's Dutch Colonial Revival style. We've made some updates to the space to make it more comfortable for modern living, while leaving some eclectic charm. We hope you enjoy and invite feedback!
description: Family-friendly private 2 Bedroom apartment: 2 Blocks to Vegetarian restaurant, Plant, 2 Blocks to Trader Joe's, 4 blocks to Asheville Yoga, 5 blocks to High Five Coffee, 6 blocks to Downtown! We've made some updates to the space to make it more comfortable for modern living, while leaving some eclectic charm. We hope you enjoy and invite feedback! There's free parking in the back for about 2-3 guest cars. You may enter from the back private entrance of the building with the key code. I am always available through phone or text and many
neighborhood_overview: Sometimes people see "Merrimon Ave" and are put-off, because, yes Merrimon is a major thoroughfare through Asheville. The great part is it turns into Broadway and then Biltmore Ave. once you're Downtown. We love living here and the traffic noises have not been an issue. Our house is set up on a hill and off the street enough that it feels like our Urban Sanctuary. We prefer walkability over complete silence and nature noises.
notes: There are not pets living on the property, but we do have young children. We have found the sound proofing between the two apartments to be good, but please don't be alarmed if you hear toddler noises from time to time. If this doesn't float your boat, this place might not be right for you. The Chestnut Hills Vacalodge is in the family zone :)
transit: YES! We're on a bus line that runs often. Download the NextBus app on your phone to find the next bus that will take you downtown, to UNCA, or to North Asheville with ease. Also, our walkability score is an 80, which translates to "Very Walkable" for most or all of your needs.
host_about:
Originally from a small town in Southern Illinois just outside of St. Louis, I now love living in the mountains of Western North Carolina. My husband, Eric, is a native of Asheville. We met at the University of Illinois in Champaign-Urbana, where Eric was in law school and I was having a blast studying sculpture in the Fine Arts department and working as a barista! We love living in the middle of Asheville where we can walk or ride our bikes to everything. I run my own business, Coffee Crate ((URL HIDDEN) from my home office and Eric has a law practice where he enjoys working with individuals and small businesses. We are also landlords of 14 apartments in Asheville and 1 AirBNB. But what we love most is spending time as family with our 4 year old daughter, Penelope, and little Hugo, 16 months. Family hikes, enjoying Asheville's culinary scene, and people watching at some of Asheville's many festivals are some of our favorite things to do as a family. Yes, we love Asheville, but one of our favorite places on Earth is NYC! Eric also loves Japan and I love anywhere Europe. Eric is into cycling and nerd stuff and I am into art, herbs, and social justice. 
Thanks for reading! 

Peace out,

Angie

name: Boho Style apt~Walk to Dtwn or AYC!
summary: Come and stay in an Artist and Yoga abode. Humble, Creative, Loving Environment. 2 min. drive to Dtwn and UNCA Botanical Gardens. Walking distance to Greenlife, Dwtn & AYC. Perfect for those taking yoga workshops. Sleeps up to 4.
space: The full-sized futon can be folded as a bed or a couch for your comfort. It sleeps two. There is a corner of the room we call the 'Moroccan Wing'. Inspired by the culture, there is a jewel toned tapestry and lush pillows. This area serves well for eating, journaling, using your laptop or drinking  tea. There is a twin-sized mattress on the floor. It's tucked in a corner under 2 windows. I donned it with a feather topper, a velvet Euro pillow, soft sheets, and luxurious blankets. The colors on this side of the room are ocean inspired. In the Moroccan Wing there are foam and blankets under the mandala tapestry someone could sleep on if there is a 4th traveller.  A low table, trunk, and tray are creative substitutes for a kitchen table.  The kitchen is cozy and clean. There are four windows in the living room allowing for lots of light. If you desire to paint, it also helps with ventilation.  I have a cat named, Moonshine. She is a newly acquired rescue (Feb '16), therefore, a bit skittis

neighborhood_overview: The location is perfect if you want to be close to downtown. but sleep in a restidental neighborhood.  We are next to 5 grocery stores, including Trader Joe's and Greenlife- a local fav.
notes: Parking is only permitted on side of road. The parking lot is for renters; towing is enforced in all lined spaces. This space is harmonious with the beliefs of equality and open-mindedness. We respect all in this home. No matter color, orientation, religion, and so on.
transit: There is a bus stop a block away. Walking to AYC or the grocery store would take less than 10 minutes. You could walk to downtown in 15-20 minutes, although I usually opt for the 2 minute drive.
host_about: I am an artist, dancer, yoga teacher, and traveller. I welcome fellow peaceful, soul-seeking, kind individuals to my home!
