name: New 1BD Short Walk to Downtown!
summary: 500 sqft, 1BD/1BA with fully equipped kitchen, living room. Easy distance to restaurants, shops, music & breweries. Centrally located only 1/2 mile north of downtown, 1 mile to breweries. Walk or take Uber.
space: The apartment consists of a large kitchen (equipped with fridge/freezer/full size oven and range, toaster oven and kitchen essentials), dining space, living room with full-size couch/TV/armchair. The bedroom features a queen size bed, nightstands, side chair, luggage stand and closet. The bathroom has a large shower, toilet, vanity. Linens, towels, and shampoo, hair dryer are provided.
description: 500 sqft, 1BD/1BA with fully equipped kitchen, living room. Easy distance to restaurants, shops, music & breweries. Centrally located only 1/2 mile north of downtown, 1 mile to breweries. Walk or take Uber. The apartment consists of a large kitchen (equipped with fridge/freezer/full size oven and range, toaster oven and kitchen essentials), dining space, living room with full-size couch/TV/armchair. The bedroom features a queen size bed, nightstands, side chair, luggage stand and closet. The bathroom has a large shower, toilet, vanity. Linens, towels, and shampoo, hair dryer are provided. Guests will have full access to the 1bd apartment and a parking space at the end of the driveway. There is a small outdoor sitting area near the apartment door also available for guests. The garage/workshop space and the main house are off-limits. We will be present on the property during your stay. We will be available for questions/concerns about the property or for suggestions/recommendations about
neighborhood_overview: We love our location! Our immediate area has grocery stores, the UNCA campus, trails, and botanical garden (free), greenways, restaurants. A short walk takes you into downtown and all that has to offer. If you bring or rent a bike, you can easily access the River Arts District, Grove Park. A quick drive takes you to Biltmore Estate, Village and south Asheville. That's all within 10-15 minutes. If you want to drive a bit further -- we have loads of suggestions for hiking or sightseeing!
notes: We provide off street parking in our driveway at the orange cone. However, if you are uncomfortable backing into or out of driveways with sometimes low visibility, we encourage you to park in the street. There are usually at least 3 open spots directly in front of our home.
transit: Downtown is easily accessible by walking or driving (there are loads of public parking garages downtown). Off-street parking is included with our listing. If you are flying in and not renting a car, we recommend you use an Uber or take an airport shuttle into town.
host_about: We are Jon & Jen. Married for 12 years and living in Asheville, NC. We have a toddler and love to spend time outdoors - hiking, camping, biking, and running. We are passionate about live music, good food, local beers, small-batch espresso, and exploring new cities.

name: Hand-built sweet cabin in the city
summary: A quiet cabin in "the woods" of downtown Asheville. Easy 10 minute walk to coffee, town, yoga or grocery stores. Peaceful stylish retreat when you want to rest. Great for creative and adventurous folk!
space: A little hidden cottage in the trees, just 3 blocks from city life. Even closer to grocery stores and fresh coffee, but far from "the norm". Quiet and peace-filled. Our little house is built from lost treasures, and forgotten snippets leftover from the last century. Built in the back of our urban homestead against the tree line, the house is about 700 sq ft, comfortably furnished with everything you'll need and nothing more. Queen bed upstairs, walk-in shower, open, clean and airy. We hope you will be delighted and maybe even inspired by the ease and gentleness of our home. There's a wood stove for heat, a compost toilet and us close by to help you get used to these eco-kind alternatives if you are not already familiar with their use. It's easy, really!

neighborhood_overview: The Five Points neighborhood is one of the closest to downtown and is super laid back, friendly and wooded. It's an easy walk to trails, downtown, yoga studios or coffee - it's all within ten minutes on foot. You'll meet nice folks on your walk.
notes: Cabin is located behind our restored 1920's home. Just through the gate and a short walk through the grassy yard and you're there!
transit: On street parking across the street from the main house.
host_about: I am a long time (20 years) resident of downtown Asheville and am happy to help you find a great restaurant, hike or whatever you're into!

name: Historic River Arts District Home
summary: Beautifully renovated 1897 Queen Anne Victorian home at the top of a hill, centrally located with an easy 1/2 mile walk to downtown Asheville, the River Arts District, New Belgium Brewery, and the South Slope. We are one of the few LEGAL Airbnb's!
space: This is a great space for two couples traveling together, or a group of friends!  The nice part is that there are two bedrooms and each have their own bathroom!  If arranged in advance we can put a twin size mattress on the floor in the 2nd bedroom for an extra person. There is an amazing front porch that is all yours to enjoy and also a living room where there will be a coffee maker and few basic necessities!  We do not have a television, but there is wireless internet throughout the house.  This house is close to everything!  We love living here!
description: Beautifully renovated 1897 Queen Anne Victorian home at the top of a hill, centrally located with an easy 1/2 mile walk to downtown Asheville, the River Arts District, New Belgium Brewery, and the South Slope. We are one of the few LEGAL Airbnb's! This is a great space for two couples traveling together, or a group of friends!  The nice part is that there are two bedrooms and each have their own bathroom!  If arranged in advance we can put a twin size mattress on the floor in the 2nd bedroom for an extra person. There is an amazing front porch that is all yours to enjoy and also a living room where there will be a coffee maker and few basic necessities!  We do not have a television, but there is wireless internet throughout the house.  This house is close to everything!  We love living here! This is a separate 2BR/2BA upstairs apartment within our home. You will have a living room space that is all yours to use as well. You will not have access to our kitchen...but with all the amazing
neighborhood_overview: We are about as close to downtown as you can get and still be in the River Arts District.  Our neighborhood has been growing and changing over the past few years.  There are monthly art walks and a ton of amazing art studios to stroll around.  We also have a handful of notable restaurants close by, the Wedge Brewery, and of course the New Belgium Brewery that's being built.
notes: We have 2 German Shorthair Pointers.  If we are in town while you are staying with us, they will be living in our quarters with us.  The 1 year old goes to daycare during the weekdays and the 13 year old mostly lounges around the house and sleeps. We also have an outdoor-only gray cat who is super friendly and will try to make you think she belongs in the house.
transit: The beauty of this house is the fact that you can walk EVERYWHERE!  If you don't feel like walking, there is a bus stop right next to our house.  There are lots of bike paths all over downtown so bring your bike with you on your trip and hop in the bike lane right in front of our house! You can also UBER and taxi it.  It can be a challenge to find a parking spot for your car in downtown so I would personally walk there.

summary: Winter Deal~ Book 3 nights in January or February and the 4th night is free!!  Yarrow's Cottage is a private, 2 bedroom bungalow located a few blocks from the heart of downtown Asheville, in the historic Montford neighborhood.
space: Yarrow's Cottage is a private, 2 bedroom bungalow.  It is located a few blocks from the heart of downtown Asheville, in the historic Montford neighborhood.  The house was recently renovated and has 1200 sqft, with two large bedrooms, one bath, kitchen, dining room, living room, laundry room, pantry and sweet front porch, all on one level. There is also a small nursery, off of the back bedroom, which is available for an additional fee. There are heart of pine floors and ceramic tile in the laundry, pantry and bathroom. It is eclectic, yet tastefully decorated with warm colors, antiques and comfy furniture.  The kitchen is fully equipped with gas stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, garbage disposal, toaster oven and filtered water. Next to the kitchen, the laundry room has a washer, dryer, iron and ironing board. The dining room comfortably seats 4-5 people, has lots of natural light and even has a fireplace. The living room  is a comfy, relaxing spot to curl up with a good book and enjoy t

neighborhood_overview: The Montford neighborhood is a wonderful destination in itself. It is one of the largest historic districts in the state. Most of the homes were built during the period of 1890 to the 1920's. Take an evening stroll down tree-lined streets and discover the amazing architectural styles of yesteryear. Beautiful gardens and stonework are abundant, as well. Stop by the Visitors Center and discover all the places and activities Western North Carolina has to offer.There's also a weekly farmer's market right behind the Visitors Center. Montford is home to an outdoor theater where the Montford Park Players perform Shakespearean plays. There are community parks and gardens, unique restaurants and even a fly fishing store. Montford is extremely pedestrian and bicycle friendly.
notes: The Nursery: The nursery is located off of the back bedroom and is fully stocked, so you don't have to haul all of your baby gear with you on vacation! It is available for a flat fee of $50 and includes:      Co-sleeper and bedding      Changing table        Strollers - jogging & car seat carrier type       High Chair      Pack-n-play playard      Swing      Few blankets, toys, etc     *I have an infant car seat, bouncer and othe(URL HIDDEN)items, if needed, as well. *Everything is completely cleaned/sterilized after  each baby's stay. If you have any special needs, please let me know. *I use/provide only all natural/organic cleaning products, laundry detergent, soap etc. Come stay at Yarrow's Cottage and experience all of Asheville and WNC's unique, enchanting places.....all within a short distance to your door step. From hiking, biking, kayaking, rafting, fishing, skiing, snow boarding, rock climbing and scenic drives to world renown restaurants, bars, breweries, music venues, art ga
transit: The heart of downtown Asheville is a short 5-10 minute walk. There you'll find diverse restaurants and bars, coffee shops, art galleries, museums, eclectic shopping, amazing street performers, music halls  and numerous breweries.  Hop on the greenway, and follow Reeds Creek to the Botanical Gardens of Asheville or the University of North Carolina campus. It's about a 10 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate, the Grove Park Inn and the North Carolina Arboretum. You also might want to drive over to Hot Springs, NC (30 minutes) and soak in their private tubs by the French Broad River or explore the artistic town of Black Mountain, NC. Downtown Asheville is also quite bicycle friendly and there is a bus stop about 2 blocks away which can take you just about anywhere around Asheville. There are numerous taxi companies in town, as well.

name: A Retreat in Downtown Asheville...
summary: Beautifully renovated 1905 historic home with incredible location. An easy walk to downtown, South Slope, The River Arts District, and West Asheville. Private back yard with a view of protected old growth woods.
space: 1905 historic 1400 square foot home with preserved features such as original hardwood floors throughout, plaster walls, original trim and doors, etc.  On one side of the house is a bustling downtown street, and the other side makes you feel like you're in the forest.  Everything is walking distance, including approx. 20 breweries, countless restaurants, art studios, etc.  Other features include a clawfoot tub, back yard with fire pit, outdoor movie theater with 120" HD screen (see photos), BBQ grill, 60" UltraHD TV in living room, leather chesterfield sofa, wood stove, king size bed with high end mattress.
description: Beautifully renovated 1905 historic home with incredible location. An easy walk to downtown, South Slope, The River Arts District, and West Asheville. Private back yard with a view of protected old growth woods. 1905 historic 1400 square foot home with preserved features such as original hardwood floors throughout, plaster walls, original trim and doors, etc.  On one side of the house is a bustling downtown street, and the other side makes you feel like you're in the forest.  Everything is walking distance, including approx. 20 breweries, countless restaurants, art studios, etc.  Other features include a clawfoot tub, back yard with fire pit, outdoor movie theater with 120" HD screen (see photos), BBQ grill, 60" UltraHD TV in living room, leather chesterfield sofa, wood stove, king size bed with high end mattress. You will have complete privacy and access to the entire house, including both bathrooms, kitchen along with all cookware and utensils, etc. I check my guests in, show them th
neighborhood_overview: This is a booming neighborhood that is changing rapidly into a high dollar sought after place to live.  There are music venues, restaurants, breweries, and countless art studios all within a stones throw.
notes: If you want to experience an outdoor movie next to the fire, just let me know and I will have everything ready including almost any movie of your choice and unlimited firewood. There are 6 off street parking spots in my driveway.
transit: The beauty of this house is the fact that you can walk EVERYWHERE!  It can be a challenge to find a parking spot for your car in downtown so I would personally walk there. Below are some mileages to give you an idea of just how close you are: 0.1 miles to Grey Eagle Music Hall 0.2 miles to Wedge Brewing Co.   0.1 miles to All Souls Pizza 0.5 miles to New Belgium Brewing Co. 0.4 miles to 12 Bones BBQ 0.5 miles to Hi-Wire Brewing 0.5 miles Ben's Tune Up Restaurant and Sake Bar 0.6 miles to Asheville Brewing Co. 0.6 miles the Magnetic Theater 0.6 miles to The Funkatorium 0.6 miles to Twin Leaf Brewing 0.7 miles to Catawba Brewing 0.7 miles to Burial Beer Co. 0.8 miles to Wicked Weed Brewing 0.7 miles to Green Man Brewing 0.5 miles to White Duck Taco 0.7 miles to Bhramari Brewhouse 0.8 miles to Lexington Avenue Brewing ...the list goes on and on and on of places under 1 mile. I can also be hired as a personal tour guide and driver for an agreed upon dollar amount...based on your needs.
host_about: I am 39 years old and have been restoring my 1905 home since 2006.  I love Asheville and everything it has to offer.  Looking forward to a new experience with Airbnb!

name: Private, Downtown & River Arts
summary: This cozy room has a comfortable bed, a private bathroom and your own entrance.  Walkable to Downtown and the River Arts District.  Very close to the Biltmore Estate and West Asheville.  Easy parking.  LGBTQ & straight friendly.  Dogs too, w/ crate. (Read our pet policy below!)
space: Simple, clean and comfy w/ queen-sized bed, private bath, good shower, fridge, coffee-maker,  & wireless internet.  Breakfast is on your own, but why eat in your room when Foodtopia awaits you? We are LGBTQ and straight friendly.  Our home is an urban micro-farm in the making and a land partner in Patchwork Urban Farms.  We are an easy walk or bike to the River Arts District (less than 1/2 mile) and Downtown (less than a mile).  You can bike to West Asheville (less than 2 miles) or UNCA (about 3 miles). We're also really close to Biltmore Village and the entrance to the Biltmore Estate (less than 2 miles).  Pet friendly for dogs with well-behaved humans (**see notes below re: dogs).  We do ask that you be prepared to to take your dog with you when you go out.  We also ask for a 10.00 per day pet/cleaning fee.   We love Asheville & love to help others love it too.  We're happy to offer guidance and suggestions or to leave you to have your own experience.  Check out our guidebook for thi

We do ask that you be prepar
neighborhood_overview: The South-side neighborhood is on the south-west fringes of downtown so it's easy to get most anywhere in Asheville.  I love the urban stream right across the street, the proximity to the river and how it's perfectly situated to be a leading area for urban sustainability and urban agriculture.
notes: I have a lovely housemate named Grace.  Her room is also downstairs but in a different part of the house than this space.  You might hear her go up and down the stairs or meet her in passing.
transit: Walking around is safe and easy.  Minnie and I walk all the time.  I have maps on the wall that show the easiest routes.   I have to admit that public transportation is not amazing in Asheville.  It exists and you can get around on it but it's nothing to brag about yet.   However, we are becoming a very bicycle-friendly town. Green ways are being developed in the the whole city and county for walking and biking.  I think the best deal for parking downtown is in the parking decks.  City decks are usually free for the first hour then $1/hour after that.  Sometimes special event parking raises the price.   Parking is free in RAD and West Asheville.
host_about:
I enjoy a a large and wonderful community here in Western NC.  I live with my super-cute dog, Minnie and a flock of ducks.

I have two social enterprise businesses.  I'm a Celebrant and a Consultant for social profit businesses.  A Celebrant is a ceremony specialist.  I'm also an ordained Inter-faith Minister.  ( So if you want to get married while you're here, I can help you out with that too!  Find out more about that and the other types of ceremonies I help people create by googling Asheville Celebrant.   My other business is Social Profit Strategies, which supports social enterprise businesses and non-profit organizations with development, fund-raising, capacity building and marketing and promotions.

I am passionate about urban sustainability and I'm a land-owner partner in Patchwork Urban Farms.

I love to hike and swim.  I  enjoy, sewing, yoga and spending time with my friends and neighbors.  

I love my town so I'm happy to give you tips and directions or just leave you to your own devices.  Look forward to meeting you in person!

Happy Day!
Michelle

summary: Beautiful,charming house (sleeps up to 6) located in 5-Points neighborhood within walking distance (3/4 mile to center of town) or short Uber ride to downtown AVL.  Wi-fi and smart TV provided.   Whole Foods & Trader Joe's just blocks away.
space: Beautifully restored home with 10-foot high ceilings, clawfoot tub, study, and full kitchen.  Two large maple trees grow in fenced-in front yard and provide shade and privacy Spring through Fall.  Each bedroom has a comfortable queen-size bed.  Fine art photographic prints from Michael Oppenheim Photography are displayed thoughout the home.  There is also a back patio with table and chairs.

Muriel and Michael can provide help and advice throughout your stay. Our house is located in 5-Points neighborhood (originally developed in the late 1800s with many of the homes built before 1920) which is within 3 blocks of three neighboring grocery stores (Greelife/Wholefoods, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter).  Hig
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located in 5-Points neighborhood (originally developed in the late 1800s with many of the homes built before 1920) which is within 3 blocks of three neighboring grocery stores (Greelife/Wholefoods, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter).  High Five Coffee Bar is within several blocks as well.   Highlights for exploring the neighborhood by foot and/or bike include downtown Asheville, UNCA Botanical Gardens and extension forest, Reed Creek Greenway, and historic Montford (including Riverside Cemetery).
notes: Michael is a professional photographer and has published two books on Asheville architecture, Look Up Asheville I & II.  Having shot weddings, special events, and commercial assignments in Asheville for the past 18 years he can point you in the direction to a variety of cool places to visit in the area.  Muriel is a wine-rep and sells  to many of the local restaurants, wine shops, and groceries and is a great resource for advice on all things food and wine-related.
transit: Parking is available on the street in front of the house.

name: CityChicKingBed Fireplace Walk2Town
summary: Gorgeous apt in historic home. Oak floors,stone fireplace, gas logs, 10' ceilings, exposed brick wall, french doors & lots of natural light. Glass door leads to covered porch with views of Sunset Mtn & the historic Grove Park Inn. Walk to everything.
space: I welcome you to come and stay in my spacious, smartly furnished, 1 bedroom first floor apartment located in a beautiful 1928 home and sidewalk lined, city neighborhood.  Just 1 mile north of downtown Asheville and only ½ mile (easily within walking distance) to Trader Joe's and Harris Teeter grocery stores as well as a nice variety of restaurants, stores, tennis courts, bus line, etc.  Truly in the heart of things, yet at night, the neighborhood provides a quiet and comforting place to come home too. It's so tranquil, it is hard to believe you are steps away from all of the hustle and bustle Asheville has to offer. If you are planning on moving here or just want to catch the Asheville vibe, staying here is a great way to see what it is like to live as an Ashevillian.  This apartment has been totally updated and beautifully furnished with your comfort and enjoyment in mind yet the old world charm is evident throughout. There are original oak floors, original stone fireplace with gas lo

neighborhood_overview: The location of the apartment is phenomenal. It is within walking distance to tennis courts, many restaurants, a coffee shop, Trader Joe's Grocery store, the bus line and just 1 mile north of Downtown Asheville. It's an inexpensive cab ride home if you are out enjoying a night of microbrews and live music.  This apartment is close to UNCA, many microbreweries, the River Arts District, Downtown Galleries, live music, fabulous restaurants, The Botanical Gardens, Bent Creek Biking Trails, Blue Ridge Parkway, Grove Park Inn & Spa, French Broad River, Wolf Laurel Ski resort and Biltmore Estate. There is so much to see and do you will want to come back again and again.
notes: This apartment has one king size bed which is perfect for one or two adults. I do not allow more than 2 guests in this apt. A lot of people inquire as to what constitutes a guest. Simply put, 1 guest=1 human being.  Guests are supplied with enough paper products, dish soap, shampoo, hand soap, coffee, tea, sugar, etc. for a 3 day stay, which is a standard stay, if guests stay is for a longer duration, it will be necessary to purchase additional supplies.
transit: This Apartment is within walking distance to several restaurants, a convenient store, coffee shop and  grocery stores. It is also 1 block from the bus stop. A cab ride or Uber from downtown is between $5-$7.00. It is a mile walk from the apt to downtown Asheville via sidewalk.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Julie

I was born in N.J, although you would never guess (No Jersey accent here!).   I moved with my family to Clearwater, Florida when I was in high school and graduated from the University of South Florida in Tampa with a degree in Psychology. I eventually heard about Asheville, NC, visited, moved there and lived there full time for 15 years. For the last 6 years I have been splitting my time between Dunedin,(just north of Clearwater) Florida and Asheville, NC, two delightfully beautiful, creative and diverse cities, I absolutely adore. 

 I love the beaches of Florida, but my heart is always drawn back to the mountains.

 When I first moved to North Carolina, I was a social worker. Through some friends, I was drawn into a seasonal inn- keeping position at a ski lodge in Beech Mtn, North Carolina. That lead me to work for a couple of years at the Richmond Hill Inn in Asheville as a concierge.

Ultimately, I decided I wanted to have my own vacation rentals.

That dream has finally materialized and I have furnished vacation rentals in Asheville and Dunedin, where I divide my time. I enjoy traveling, meeting people and providing the most comfortable and  friendly lodging that I can.

My attraction to Asheville & Dunedin besides the natural surroundings are the great outdoor recreation opportunities- biking, hiking, whitewater rafting, motorcycle rides on the Blue Ridge Parkway, kayaking, tennis and lounging at the beach.  I also love the warm, intelligent, creative people of both Asheville & Dunedin, the abundant live music, the vibrant arts scene, many incredible restaurants, and its celebration of diversity.

SO WELCOME TO ASHEVILLE & DUNEDIN!

When I travel, I prefer to stay in individually owned places like cottages, B&B's, hostels, condos and apartments instead of generic hotels. And I want my guests to experience the incredible vibes of Asheville & Dunedin, to enjoy a quiet, comforting, unique get a way, and then come back often to visit.

 The welcome mat is always out ! Either myself or a friend is always available, should the need arise during your stay.

 There is a lock box  for your convenience, so no worries about conflicting schedules, late arrivals, etc. 

 I can be contacted via phone, text or email, before, during and after your stay.

My life motto;

“Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of humans as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing." Helen Keller

Here's to your life adventures!

Cheers,
Julie

name: Asheville Repose - downtown AVL
summary: Come enjoy our comfy home while you explore Asheville.  Located less than a mile from downtown, within walking distance to local coffee house and Whole Foods.  UNCA Woods with trails only 3 blocks away!
space: In your room you'll have a queen size bed, dresser, table, and chair.  There is an air conditioning unit and a white noise machine for your comfort.  We invite you to enjoy the living room with wood stove, kitchen, dining room, deck, and grill as much as you'd like.  Our dogs Lucy (blue heeler mix) and Salchi (dachshund mix) are friendly and sweet.
description: Come enjoy our comfy home while you explore Asheville.  Located less than a mile from downtown, within walking distance to local coffee house and Whole Foods.  UNCA Woods with trails only 3 blocks away! In your room you'll have a queen size bed, dresser, table, and chair.  There is an air conditioning unit and a white noise machine for your comfort.  We invite you to enjoy the living room with wood stove, kitchen, dining room, deck, and grill as much as you'd like.  Our dogs Lucy (blue heeler mix) and Salchi (dachshund mix) are friendly and sweet. Guests may enter through the main door or the deck door.  Feel free to use the kitchen (we do not have a microwave), shared yet private bathroom, dining area, living room, and deck.  Free street parking is available right outside our home. We are available to provide great ideas on local things to check out!  We'd love to get to know you while you're here, but will honor your privacy.  And you can feel free to get to know us as much as you'd
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighborhood, and our neighbors!  We live in a well-established area developed in the early 1900s (before many people had cars), so please note that our streets are narrow.  Many of our neighbors have lived in our neighborhood long before Asheville became a vacation destination!
notes: We do not have cable TV, but we do have a television set with a connecting cord to your computer.  We also have DVDs and yes, VHS tapes (!) for your viewing pleasure. We do not operate central air in the house, but you will have an air conditioner unit in your private room during summer months.  We do not have a microwave. Our permit number with the City of Asheville is (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) and is due for renewal on 12/18/16.
transit: We live less than a mile from downtown, and are also within walking distance to UNCA, Whole Foods (Greenlife), Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter, and Hi-Five (our local coffee house).   If you enjoy running or a walk in the woods, there are wooded trails 3 blocks away.  Our home is situated on a hill with a retaining wall, so we have no driveway.  Guests are welcome to park on the street directly in front of our house.
host_about:
Hi!  My partner and I love living in Asheville.  We enjoy hiking with our dogs, riding our scooter around town, and attending pot lucks with friends.  

I work at the local Children's Hospital as a Child Life Specialist and also at the Wake Foot Sanctuary and Spa as a Massage Therapist.  I like playing music and dancing in any type of aerobic fashion.  

As a host, we are as involved with your stay as you would like us to be.  We'd love to offer your suggestions to make your trip as fun/relaxing/interesting as possible.  We have lots of ideas!  

As a guest, we are mindful and respectful of your space, fully understanding the importance of a "good guest" since we host our home as well.

name: Private Bedroom on South Slope
summary: Private bedroom on upper floor of large 1928 home on edge of South Slope. Shares a bathroom and small eat-in kitchen on upper floor with a full time housemate and another guest room.  Walk to downtown and South Slope. Off-street parking available.
space: The house is across the street from our city baseball park and less than half a mile from downtown and the breweries on South Slope.  In the winter there is a beautiful glimpse of downtown from the north window in this room. In the summer you can see out over the baseball field and take in the games when the team is in town.  Also the ballpark does a handful of fireworks displays which are viewable from this bedroom.
description: Private bedroom on upper floor of large 1928 home on edge of South Slope. Shares a bathroom and small eat-in kitchen on upper floor with a full time housemate and another guest room.  Walk to downtown and South Slope. Off-street parking available. The house is across the street from our city baseball park and less than half a mile from downtown and the breweries on South Slope.  In the winter there is a beautiful glimpse of downtown from the north window in this room. In the summer you can see out over the baseball field and take in the games when the team is in town.  Also the ballpark does a handful of fireworks displays which are viewable from this bedroom. Guests have access to the kitchen and bathroom up stairs and the living room, dining room and front porch downstairs. We like to give our guests as much privacy as they like however we're often around and available and invite our guests to visit with us. I love my neighborhood for the proximity to town and the South Slope.  And M
neighborhood_overview: I love my neighborhood for the proximity to town and the South Slope.  And McCormick Field and Memorial Field (ultimate on Tuesdays, soccer, football, and lacrosse) are just across the street so it seems like there's often plenty to check out.  Last year there was a concert at the baseball field and Brewgrass was held at Memorial Field, I hope they make that a habit!
notes: I think baseball season is very exciting even though I'm not really a baseball fan.  It brings people watching and excitement.  The games never go terribly late except for Boy Scouts night when they do an outdoor movie.  If you enjoy the activity or decidedly don't, you may want to consult the Asheville Tourists schedule before booking.
transit: Downtown is less than half a mile away and about a fifteen minute walk.  I enjoy the walk but it is uphill so you may want to consider that.  The breweries on South Slope are about 0.4 miles away too.  A bus stop is just at the end of my street for going to places out of walking distance.
host_about: I have been in the area for over 25 years now living just west of Asheville for most of that time.  In early 2011 I made Asheville my permanent home with my two kiddos and my sweet dog.  I LOVE this town passionately with all that it has to offer with its rich history, vibrant art, culinary and beer scenes, outdoor activities, incredible views around every corner and above all, the amazing, WONDERFUL people.  I'm more than happy to help you decide on some must-see's around town and will do what I can to make your time in Asheville comfortable and friendly.
street: Buchanan Avenue, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

name: New Home in Quiet Historic Montford
summary: This is your home away from home. Only 1 mile from downtown Asheville and even a shorter distance to parks, tennis and basketball courts, a small convenience store, and two favorite local restaurants, Nine Mile and Todd's Tasties Café.
space: Newly built, this home was featured in Home of the Week and an annual garden tour.  Beautifully landscaped with herb, native and tropical plants.  The imaginative stonescaping flows through the property allowing for long pauses as you spot glistening rock sculptures and sedums popping out at every crevice.  The home sits on a quiet low-traffic corner lot. The neighbors are professional and nice.  The 1,000 square foot house has an inviting covered front porch, with ceiling fans, where the sunset can be admired, as well as a back porch, where guests can enjoy use of the grill.   The home's interior has an open floor plan, where the kitchen and the living area are all open to each other, and hardwood floors are throughout.  The granite, island bar has three bar stools, while the dining table seats six. The sitting area has a 32" flat screen tv, with free Netflix movie rentals and Apple TV (cable TV not provided) with a large comfortable couch and love seat. The two bedrooms with queen si

Only 1 mile from downtown Asheville and even a shorter distance to parks, tennis and basketball courts, a small convenience store, and two favorite local restaurants, Nine Mile and Todd's Tasties Café. neighborhood_overview: Enjoy a leisurely bike ride or walk around the beautiful, old Montford neighborhood and discover the UNCA greenway or the Riverside Cemetery, where famous American author and Asheville native Thomas Wolfe is buried.
notes: Check out my airbnb Guidebook for attractions and activities.  We rent once a month and reserve for personal use otherwise.  Nth Carolina Sales and Occupancy Tax paid as required.  Equal housing, fair housing, LGBT friendly.
transit: Walking and biking to downtown is one mile.  Asheville Bike Taxi is a unique pedicab service.   Uber, taxi and City bus are available, as well.
host_about:
Hello!

I have been in Asheville for over a decade and am chock-full of info for great local-owned eateries like Early Girl, adventures indoor like the Orange Peel and outdoors like tubing down the French Broad.  I am highly engaged in the community through committees and boards, and almost always can refer you to the event of the week.  I love Asheville and do not intend to leave any time soon, yet traveling to nature's best backpacking is a passion of mine.

I am excited for the opportunity to share my brand new home with others.  Not only is this the first house I've owned, but I built it, as well.  I get so much joy out of creating this peaceful, warm environment.  My favorite morning ritual is to walk around the yard, take in the plants and sip coffee on the spacious porch.  Come try it for yourself!

name: Downtown, Fully Furnished Studio
summary: Perfect little studio, 2 blocks from downtown shops and restaurants! Second floor apt has everything you need; pots/pans, dishware, linens. Four burner stove top-no oven, however there is a toaster oven, microwave, under-the-counter fridge and DW.
space: Lovely furnished studio in historic Victorian with kitchenette, bath, cable TV, queen bed and sitting area, available weekly or monthly. Located in a quiet Montford neighborhood conveniently close to the shops/restaurants of downtown Asheville, and Greenlife grocery store. Separate entrance, laundry on premises and off street parking. This apartment has an outside seating area on back deck. Near public transit and expressway, making it easy to explore the area.

name: Star House
summary: Beautiful historic home in friendly neighborhood within walking distance of downtown.
space: We would love for you to stay with us at Star House!   Our colonial revival home was built in 1925, and is situated in the historic Montford neighborhood which adjoins the northern edge of downtown Asheville.  The home has historic charm along with modern up-fitting for you to enjoy.  The Star House is centrally located, just a 20 minute walk to downtown, a 25 minute walk to the river arts district, a 10 minute walk to UNCA, and a 10 minute walk to your choice of 3 grocery stores.  The Blue Ridge Parkway can be reached by car within 20 minutes.  Our home is next to Montford park, which has plenty of green space, two tennis courts and a basketball court.  The Reed's Creek Green Way is a block away.  Please ask for tennis rackets and basketballs which we will happily provide to enhance your stay!  Week and month long discounts are available.  GLBTQQ2IA especially welcome, information on local community and resources are available.    The Etoille suite features a private entrance, full be

neighborhood_overview: The Montford Historic Neighborhood is in walking distance of downtown, UNCA, yoga studios, multiple grocery stores, plenty of restaurants and breweries.
notes: There is a six pound dog on the premises.  She is quiet and hypo alergenic (poodle mix). If you would like to interact with her she is very loving. Please don't feed her, as she has a sensitive stomach.
transit: Bus stop a block away.  Asheville Regional Airport within a taxi ride's distance.
host_about: I am a 38 year old bookseller (go indies!) from Asheville, NC.  I love historic architecture, gardens, and regional cuisine.

name: Downtown Asheville in Classic Style
summary: Stay in downtown Asheville and walk everywhere! A cozy, quiet and private, second-floor room with antique furnishings, queen-size bed, fridge, free wifi, high ceiling, ceiling fan, wood floors, large windows. Shared bathroom, lockable, very clean!
space: This is one private room only. Bathrooms and kitchen are shared 'old world' style in this 104 year old Inn and Rooming House. We are located on Asheville's main street, Biltmore Ave; there is always easy access to downtown shops, restaurants, theaters, etc. The Gray Rock Inn is older, but recently remodeled and up to date with new fixtures and fire sprinklers. Of the 20 rooms, just three rooms are rented by the day thru Airbnb. All rooms are private. Room occupancy is limited to two people. Access is easy to bathrooms, kitchen, laundry, patio, porch, and balcony. Free wi-fi is available. Computer and telephone are free in the lobby. John is available through the day for check-ins and questions. Let us know if you will arrive late (after 6pm). A resident manager (Will) is onsite, but late check-ins are by appointment. The neighborhood is lively and diverse. Walk to world class restaurants, music, and craft breweries. Next door is a community food coop (open to the public). Across the st

A cozy, quiet and private, second-floor room with antique furnishings, queen-size bed, fridge, free wifi, high ceiling, ceiling fan, wood floors, large windows. Shared bathroom, lockable, very clean! This is one private room only. Bathrooms and kitchen are shared 'old world' style in this 104 year old Inn and Rooming House. We are located on Asheville's main street, Biltmore Ave; there is always easy access to downtown shops, restaurants, theaters, etc. The Gray Rock Inn is older, but recently remodeled and up to date with new fixtures and fire sprinklers. Of the 20 rooms, just three rooms are rented by the day thru Airbnb. All rooms are private. Room occupancy is limited to two people. Access is easy to bathrooms, kitchen, laundry, patio, porch, and balcony. Free wi-fi is available. Computer and telephone are free in the lobby. John is available through the day for check-ins and questions. Let us know if you will arrive late (after 6pm).
neighborhood_overview: Asheville is a fun place. There is something here for everyone. We are on the southern edge of the downtown district. Walk up the street for great restaurants, music, comedy, or history. Get out into the countryside for hiking, rafting, or just touring the Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: Please communicate your arrival time so we can be there for you. Check-in is by appointment only. Confirm with us ahead of time if you will be arriving late. Towels and soap are supplied in the rooms. Bring a bathrobe for quick trips to the bathroom.  The room has a window air conditioner for the summer months.
transit: Walk to downtown shops and entertainment spots. Public transit bus stops are in front of the building, going north and south. Asheville's main bus depot is 4 city blocks to the west. There is some free parking in the back, and pay parking next door.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

I stay upstairs in a separate roof top suite, but the whole downstairs is yours. I am a traveler, gardener & am self employed, so I stay busy....but love to take a minute & chat if our paths cross (& I hope they do). Our neighborhood is a great North As
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a great North Asheville neighborhood right on the edge of the hustle & bustle of downtown. We have natural groceries, yoga studios, families, a small pub, vegetarian restaurant, schools, a bakery/coffee shop, lots of trees, folks walking and many bird nests.
notes: There is a cat on the premises & off street parking for several cars.
transit: The house is a quick 10 minute walk to downtown & special neighborhood hangouts with many great things in between. Cabs to downtown are $3.50. Bus stops are within 1/4 mile. Asheville now has Uber!
host_about:
I have run my own massage therapy practice for 16 years in the Asheville area. I also have a small natural products company where I make body care products & scrubs from herbs I grow and harvest. 
I like to read, catch live music, practice yoga,eat vegetables, and spend times with close ones. I love to travel and have spent time exploring most continents.
The slogan "work hard play hard" pretty much sums me up!

name: Corner Cottage
summary: In a quiet old neighborhood a short walk from downtown, this beautifully renovated bungalow is a perfect base for exploring Asheville. There's a porch with a rocker, a private deck with table and grill, and a nearby cafe. Ask about pets. Come stay!
space: In your welcome packet, you will find suggestions on nearby restaurants, walks, cultural activities, and more! You are just steps from downtown. The Asheville area offers plenty of outdoor activities, from hiking to zip lines and canoeing. And for more information, the Asheville Visitor Information Center is just one block away!

space: Enjoy being a ten minute walk to dozens of restaurants and music venues in the heart of Asheville while staying on a quiet residential street. Downstairs, a queen size futon is also available for use.  Sheets, blankets, towels and washcloths are provided. The main level half bath also contains a washer and dryer.  The kitchen is fully equipped for cooking.

name: Delightful Bungalow By Downtown
summary: Enjoy Asheville like a local in our inspiring  art-filled home in the historic Montford neighborhood, just a few minutes walk (about .5 miles) from downtown.
space: Our 1923 bungalow is bright and cheerful, decorated with fabulous art made by our friends and ourselves.  A charming spot super close the heart of Asheville.  * sweet front porch and garden * backyard with a "hillbilly hot tub" * full kitchen with all you need to cook * recently renovated bathroom  * comfortable queen-size bed * just minutes away by foot: grocery stores, a greenway, parks + downtown shops,  restaurants, music venues and much more.  * natural cleaning products are used * street parking * LGBTQIA welcome *  Wi Fi * A calico cat you get to enjoy and feed.
description: Enjoy Asheville like a local in our inspiring  art-filled home in the historic Montford neighborhood, just a few minutes walk (about .5 miles) from downtown.        Our 1923 bungalow is bright and cheerful, decorated with fabulous art made by our friends and ourselves.  A charming spot super close the heart of Asheville.  * sweet front porch and garden * backyard with a "hillbilly hot tub" * full kitchen with all you need to cook * recently renovated bathroom  * comfortable queen-size bed * just minutes away by foot: grocery stores, a greenway, parks + downtown shops,  restaurants, music venues and much more.  * natural cleaning products are used * street parking * LGBTQIA welcome *  Wi Fi * A calico cat you get to enjoy and feed. You will have access to the whole house (850 sq ft) with the exception of one room. Great front porch, garden and backyard. More than enough space for two people to stretch out and relax.  Minimal interaction. Montford is an historic neighborhood with giant t
neighborhood_overview: Montford is an historic neighborhood with giant trees and beautiful old houses. It's a great place for long walks. Our house is the best of both worlds - super close to the excitement of downtown, while still being in an lovely old neighborhood.  Our neighbors are nice and mixed in terms of socio-economic status, race, age and gender. It can be a lively street at times, though overall it is as quiet as can be expected in a city setting.
notes: Our cat lives here and we ask that you please feed her in the morning. She is indoor/outdoor, mostly indoor in the winter. We also have a dog, who won't be here, and we keep the house very clean, but please note that if you are allergic.  Our house is on a hill - you have to climb up a set of stairs to get to it, so our house is not ideal for someone with mobility issues.  This is a neighborhood, and the houses are close. You will hear sounds - our next door neighbor's band practices sometimes, etc.  We do have a TV, but only for playing DVDs, we do not pick up any stations. We will leave a selection of DVDs you may enjoy watching.
transit: You can walk to almost anything, but driving is easy as well, we are right off of I-26 and I-240. There is a bus stop at the end of our block. The airport is about a 15 minute drive; and there are taxis and shuttles. And while you're here there's free street parking in front of our house.
host_about: Asheville locals. We play music, make art, write, and stay involved in social justice work in our community.

name: Amazing views in unique house
summary: Enjoy this cozy, quaint, and very unique 2 bedroom apartment. Located on the edge of Montford and only a block from downtown. Hardwood floors, crazy ceilings, and a sunlit nook makes this room charming. Enjoy the shared living room space that I hardly use and you canwalk anywhere from here.
space: This space is located in the heart of Asheville. A block away from downtown on the edge of the coveted Montford. The views from the room are amazing, as well throughout the rest of the apartment. See the city lights at  night and look at the beautiful blue ridge mountains during the day while lying in bed. There is a sunlit nook that is suitable for reading, doing yoga, or painting (I have plenty of easels). The shape and structure of the room and house are so unique it adds to the charm.

You will have access to a shared living room with myself, although I hardly use it. You will have access to the kitchen, help yourself to anything you need to cook (just bring the supplies). The bathroom and shower
neighborhood_overview: Montford is one of the best neighborhoods in Asheville. What makes my apartment even better is that I am on the edge of Montford closest to downtown. Even more technical, I'm only a block away from downtown. I love that I never have to drive anywhere and can still experience everything I want. There is all that nightlife a city has to offer plus all the wildlife that a hiker or photographer could possibly dream of. I can walk to any of the worlds best restaurants in minutes. I love that I can drive on the Blue Ridge Parkway and it only takes me five minutes to do that. I guess the real question is what isn't there to love?
transit: Although there is convenient public transit (we have a bus line and there are plenty of cabs), my house is located downtown and once you park I don't see you ever using your car again unless you want to drive to the Biltmore; in that case it would take you eight minutes in the car.

space: Circa 1843 house on the historic register in a quiet neighborhood where you can see downtown Asheville from some of the 1200 square feet of porches.

The neighborhood is the historic Montford district of Asheville. We are an easy 5 minute walk to beautiful, vibrant downtown Asheville and a 5-10 minute drive to Asheville's many other attractions such as the Blue Ridge Parkway, Biltmore House, Grove Park Inn, River Arts District and more. We are also happy to assist you in calling a taxi or Asheville has Uber!

name: Hazel's Hideaway - Walk Downtown
summary: Sunny, one bedroom apartment in beautiful Historic Montford.  A short walk to downtown and a few minute drive to the River Arts District.  "Hazel's Hideaway" has all the coziness of home, the amenities of a hotel, and the personality of Asheville.
space: The location and comfort of “Hazel's Hideaway" makes it the perfect home base for your Asheville adventure.  This centrally located, newly appointed, one bedroom apartment is nestled in the charming Historic Montford neighborhood.  You will be a quick 12 minute walk (or a $5-$7 Uber ride) to downtown with its great restaurants, shopping, and fun "South Slope" Breweries.  You will also be a few minutes drive the the River Arts District with its many artist studios, and the newly built New Belgium Brewery (slated to open May 2nd) perched on the banks of the French Broad River.  Wholefoods, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter are a quick 5 minute drive from the apartment. Just out the backdoor of “Hazel's Hideaway" is the Hazel Robinson Amphitheater, home of the “Montford Park Players", and the longest running outdoor Shakespeare Festival in North Carolina.  From May-November you can catch a beautiful, donation based Shakespeare production in the open air amphitheater.  Pack a picnic and a bo
description: Sunny, one bedroom apartment in beautiful Historic Montford.  A short walk to downtown and a few minute drive to the River Arts District.  "Hazel's Hideaway" has all the coziness of home, the amenities of a hotel, and the personality of Asheville. The location and comfort of “Hazel's Hideaway" makes it the perfect home base for your Asheville adventure.  This centrally located, newly appointed, one bedroom apartment is nestled in the charming Historic Montford neighborhood.  You will be a quick 12 minute walk (or a $5-$7 Uber ride) to downtown with its great restaurants, shopping, and fun "South Slope" Breweries.  You will also be a few minutes drive the the River Arts District with its many artist studios, and the newly built New Belgium Brewery (slated to open May 2nd) perched on the banks of the French Broad River.  Wholefoods, Trader Joe's, and Harris Teeter are a quick 5 minute drive from the apartment. Just out the backdoor of “Hazel's Hideaway" is the Hazel Robinson Amphitheater
neighborhood_overview: Montford is a beautiful historic neighborhood with tree lined streets that are great for walking.  Montford is just north of downtown and a quick walk to great restaurants, breweries and shopping.  Though most of Montford is residential we do have a few culinary gems.  Tod's Tasties is like a second home for us and is just up the street from the apartment.  Wonderful food, great vibe, and oh so Asheville :)  Another fantastic spot in the neighborhood is "9 mile", a Jamaican fusion joint that is great for lunch or dinner :)
notes: The apartment is a stones throw from the Hazel Robinson Amphitheater where Shakespeare performances take place every weekend from May-Nov.  While the shows are not amplified, the actors can be heard so don't be alarmed if you hear yelling etc.  The showtimes are typically 7:30pm -10pm Friday and Saturday, and Sunday 2:30pm-5pm
transit: If you don't want to drive we recommend using Uber.  The service is widely used in Asheville and is usually a very affordable and convenient option.
host_about: We are both native New Englanders who moved to Asheville to escape the hustle of city life, and to start our family in this cool mountain town.  Chris is an analyst in the energy efficiency world, and Heidi is an artist and designer for her small screen printing brand.  We love working on our 1920 craftsman home, playing with our sweet baby girl, walking the beautiful streets of Montford and drinking the delicious local beers of Asheville :)  We enjoy our privacy and extend the same courtesy to our guests so you may not see us during your stay.  If you have any questions while staying with us, don't hesitate to call or text, we are of course happy to help.

name: Downtown Asheville Cozy Single Room
summary: A simple room in an historic inn. Be in downtown Asheville and walk everywhere! A private, second-floor, cozy room with twin bed, desk and chair, fridge, wifi, high ceilings, wood floors, window, shared balcony. Common bathroom, cleaned daily.
space: This cozy room is perfect for the solo traveller, with a twin bed, sitting chair, writing desk, fridge and shelves. A large window lets in natural light (we have solar panels that do obscure the view, but heat our water). Downtown Asheville Outside Your Door At the Gray Rock Inn, downtown Asheville is right outside your door, and our reasonable rates means your money can be spent on enjoying the city. Conveniently located on Biltmore Ave. and an easy walk to breweries, music venues, art galleries, boutiques and restaurants.  The Gray Rock Inn is a great value, a "no frills" but clean and comfy place to explore the city from. Perfect for those that want to spend their time exploring downtown Asheville and not driving.  Walk around downtown and enjoy its bustling and vibrant scene. Or, if you'd just like to relax, sit on our front porch or balcony and relax. After taking it all in you can return to a quiet, private and secure setting. An Historic Inn With a Background as Interesting as A

neighborhood_overview: Asheville is a fun place. There is something here for everyone. We are on the southern edge of the downtown district. Walk up the street for great restaurants, music, comedy, or history. Get out into the countryside for hiking, rafting, or just touring the Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: Please communicate your arrival time so we can be there for you. Check-in is by appointment only. Confirm with us ahead of time if you will be arriving late.
transit: Walk to downtown shops and entertainment spots. Public transit bus stops are in front of the building, going north and south. Asheville's main bus depot is 4 city blocks to the west. There is some free parking in the back, and pay parking next door.
host_about: I love to dance, hike, and meet people. I'm a green builder and real estate person, so I like helping with housing and visions for how we can get along better.

name: 1 BdRm Apartment, walk to Asheville
summary: 1 bedroom  basement apartment with natural light, small private yard and off street parking located in our historic Montford home, one block to the visitors center, quick walk to 3 neighborhood restaurants and 10-15 minute walk to downtown Asheville.
space: Is a one bedroom basement efficiency with natural light, open living area, kitchen, bathroom, pantry and closet; 1950's steel kitchen cabinets, wood / tile flooring and area rugs. Smart TV and wireless internet provided.  You have access to basic cable TV including a free movie channel; however, please do not download pay-per-view movies.  There is a thermostat / controlled dehumidifier and an thermostat or manual controlled window air conditioner. Heating is through the central system with a Franklin style ventless gas fireplace to assist. Entrance is in the rear of our 1925 historic home with a private yard, and motion lighting and low voltage security lighting the pathway to the enterance  There are several importantnt factors to consider:  The apartment has 7 foot ceilings and the bathroom has a small circular shower ( please see picture).

neighborhood_overview: Montford is a historic neighborhood adjacent to downtown Asheville with many homes constructed in the late 1800's and early 1900s. The neighborhood is included in the Asheville visitors trolley tours that begins at the Visitor's center just a block away. There is an eclectic eat-in / sidewalk restaurant, an Italian restaurant (located in a renovated historic church), and an award wining Jamaican style restaurant 1 to 3 blocks away respectively, all serving excellent food and featuring unique menus.
notes: There is convenient access to Asheville's Visitor center (one block away), downtown Asheville and surrounding shopping areas, UNC-A/botanical gardens, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and quick assess to interstate highways.  Nearby groceries include Green life (Whole Foods), Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter, and Earthfare, all within a mile. The River Arts District and the New Belgium Brewery are about .75 miles drive or a convenient bike ride. Downtown Asheville is a 5 minute drive or a 10-15 minute walk, mostly on paved sidewalk.
transit: Public Transportation is one block away which offers guided trolley tours (recommended) to Asheville's downtown, the Grove Park Inn, Baltimore Village and surrounding area with on / off access for the entire day. Fast access by car to interstate I-240 is less than 1/2 mile leading to I-40 five minutes drive away.
host_about: I am a retired professor (U North Carolina, Chapel Hill) and chose Asheville as the place to retire. My wife is employed as a project manager and works out of our home office.

name: Cheerful Home In Historic Downtown
summary: This City of Asheville HomeStay approved apartment is situated on a pleasant wooded lot in a beautiful historic Asheville neighborhood conveniently located near downtown shops and eateries. The space features a large open kitchen and tiled bathroom.
space: Guests will never lack something nearby to do, see, taste, experience! This apartment is conveniently located a mere mile or two of many music venues (such as The Grey Eagle, The Orange Peel, US Cellular Center, Thomas Wolfe Auditorium, ...) restaurants (such as 12 Bones Smokehouse, Tupelo Honey, Mela, Bouchon, Nine Mile...) as well as great places to discover art (such as the Diana Wortham Theatre, Asheville Art Museum, The Blue Spiral Gallery, Thomas Wolfe Memorial, Malaprops Bookstore, Fine Arts Theatre...)

neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a quiet, lovely historic neighborhood located slightly north of downtown Asheville.  Apartment Proximity: Downtown Asheville is within 1 mile. 3 minute walk to: Just up the street check out our fun neighborhood "library"  (a unique take-one-leave-one book drop) at the point where Cumberland Circle connects to Cumberland Ave. 5 minute walk to:  Large park with tennis and basketball courts, great for picnics or lounging with a blanket & book. Access to greenway/ bike path. Nine Mile -a fine neighborhood restaurant. 10-20 minute walk to:  Trader Joes, Greenlife, and Harris Teeter Grocery Stores, High Five Coffee Shop, Tod's Tastees Coffee Shop & Cafe, small park with play equipment, the Botanical Gardens, a 60 acre urban forest, UNCA, and downtown cafés, coffee shops, bookstores, galleries, museums, & boutiques.
notes: The house is an early 1900's arts & craft bungalow that was originally a single family home but has been converted to three completely separate apartments- each with its own private entry.
transit: You can walk to downtown, but driving is easy as well. There is nearby access to I-26 & I-240. The Asheville airport is a 15-20 minute drive and there are taxis & shuttles. There is parking directly in front of the apartment while you visit. NB: Asheville has Uber services available as well.
host_about:
Hello Fellow Traveler(s),

During the academic year I am a high school teacher. In the summer I'm an explorer of places far and near: Alaska, Quebec, France, Costa Rica... and certainly Asheville itself... as there is much to see and do right here in beautiful Western North Carolina.

In addition to teaching and traveling, I am a parent, writer, runner, appreciator of good food, film & music, and a fan of nice people everywhere.  In fact, I'm so much a fan of nice people, as best I can I like to share with them the great place I call home.

I look forward to helping you have a great experience discovering Asheville.

space: A taste of Real Asheville! This Arts and Crafts cottage is located in possibly the most popular area of Asheville, Montford.  One of the most beautiful and largest historic districts in the state of North Carolina,  filled with beautiful landscaping and structures, many of which were built between 1890 and 1925, reflecting Victorian, Tudor, Colonial Revival, Arts and Craft and Georgian architectural styles.   My home is 2000sq ft and provides lots of privacy. Decorated with many beautiful antiques and works of local artist, has hardwood floors and rugs and is filled with lots of beautiful natural light. The large den is very comfortable; with a comfy leather sofa, recliners and rocking chairs all surrounding the wood burning fireplace and 46' smart T.V. including Netflix. The bookcase is loaded with interesting reads of all types, including local history and a few board games. There is Wi-Fi , extended cable TV and a speaker system to connect your music to. neighborhood_overview: Montford is one of the largest historic districts in the state of North Carolina. It is only minutes from The Biltmore Estate , The Grove Park Inn, great hiking from the Blue Ridge Parkway, rafting on the French Broad , walk to Bele Chere , The Moog Fest , The US Cellular Center,  and other great Downtown dining and live music opportunities ,  The neighborhood draws visitors and permanent residents with beautiful landscaping and structures, many of which where built between 1890 and 1925, reflecting Victorian, Tudor, Colonial Revival, and Georgian architectural styles. Montford  houses  the Western Region Visitors center , packed with information about Asheville and Western N.C. attractions and activities , along with a wonderful local farmers market , supplying local foods , beer , live music and more. The neighborhood is very pedestrian friendly with great sidewalks, the Montford Park and two wonderful restaurants, Nine Mile and Todd's Tasty, both with plenty of fresh , local organic
transit: Yes
host_about:
I am a native of Charlotte N.C., have lived in Asheville for 20 years and love it.
Sixteen years ago I joined with a partner and  opened a wonderful live music club and special events venue, Tressa's Jazz and Blues, a must while visiting downtown o.r planning an event in Asheville
  I enjoy  traveling , all outdoor activities, photography and spending time with family , friends and my sweet pup , Casper.
I can give you geat ideas for how to spend your time while in Asheville , from dining to great hikes that only the locals know.
I look forward to hosting you and helping to make your visit to Asheville a wonderful experience.

name: Montford Bungalow
summary: You will love our recently renovated 2 bedroom, 2 bathrooms Montford Bungalow. This cozy  house has lots of character and it's the perfect spot for a small group or a couple looking to relax. Location is a 5 min drive to Downtown or 20 min walk.
description: You will love our recently renovated 2 bedroom, 2 bathrooms Montford Bungalow. This cozy  house has lots of character and it's the perfect spot for a small group or a couple looking to relax. Location is a 5 min drive to Downtown or 20 min walk.
host_about:
We are a multicultural recently married couple.
I am from Santa Cruz, California, and my wife is from Bahia, Brazil.
We both love to travel and we enjoy the outdoors as much as we can.
We also appreciate the arts in all of its wonderful formats.
We believe that travel is a tool for change and growth, that is one of the reasons why we have decided to join Airbnb.
Our house is full of love and positive energy.
We hope you enjoy your stay!

name: Open, sunny downtown condo
summary: Prepare to get comfortable in this condo in the heart of downtown Asheville. This desirable location puts you walking distance to anything; breweries, amazing restaurants and shopping are footsteps away.
space: In the heart of the city this place is for anyone who wants to explore Asheville.
description: Prepare to get comfortable in this condo in the heart of downtown Asheville. This desirable location puts you walking distance to anything; breweries, amazing restaurants and shopping are footsteps away.   In the heart of the city this place is for anyone who wants to explore Asheville.  full kitchen  linens and towels gas fireplace (available October through March) washer and dryer big screen TV with cable  wifi internet stereo with ipod dock digital alarm clock air mattress if need second bed I can interact with you as little or as much as you would like.  I love making recommendations, I have been living here for over 22 years. LGBTQ friendly and straight friendly Location Location Location you are footsteps from Lexington Ave one of the funkiest streets in Asheville.  Everything is at your finger tips.  Lexington Ave Brewery 300 ft away One World Brewery .2 miles Asheville Brewing Co .4 miles Wicked Weed .4 miles Hi Wire .5 miles Table, my favorite restaurant is right around the co
neighborhood_overview: Location Location Location you are footsteps from Lexington Ave one of the funkiest streets in Asheville.  Everything is at your finger tips.  Lexington Ave Brewery 300 ft away One World Brewery .2 miles Asheville Brewing Co .4 miles Wicked Weed .4 miles Hi Wire .5 miles Table, my favorite restaurant is right around the corner. Curate, Limones, Rhubarb and Cucina 24 are all with in minutes of an easy walk. High Five Coffee bar just opened a second location two doors down from the condo. It is the best coffee in Asheville. 5 Walnut Wine bar is also very close, along with Early Girl Cafe for the best breakfast in town. Civic Center .2 miles Orange Peel .5 miles
notes: This is a downtown condo - expect to street some street noise as you are close to restaurants and bars.  Dogs are allowed under these conditions: under 50 lbs is crated while you are not in the condo gets along with other dogs and does not bark a lot If you need a early check in or a late check out please let me know a head of time, I will try to accommodate.
transit: A parking deck is located right across from this property so parking is never a problem. It is $10 a day.  You can walk any where. Taxis and Uber are convenient. City bus stop is close by too.
host_about:
A resident of Asheville for over 22 years. 

I love the local food scene here. I am happy to recommend anything from a simple hike with amazing views, to the spots to hang like a local. 

Let me know if you have any questions I am happy to help!

name: Quiet, Beautiful, Walk to Town
summary: *Discounts for longer stays - 1 to 6 months*. This lovely home has rave reviews and provides the best of both Asheville worlds.  Close to downtown, yet quiet with a private, natural setting. It's a safe, family-friendly, walkable neighborhood.
space: This unique home is located on an half acre wooded lot, in a walkable, historic downtown neighborhood, the best of both Asheville worlds. The fully restored 100 year old home has all the modern conveniences including a Chef's kitchen (with granite counters, Dacor stove, Bosch dishwasher), AC, and  wireless internet.  It is exactly one mile to the Visitor Center at the edge of downtown.  Aside from the beautiful historical homes and gardens, favorite eateries like Nine Mile, Todd's Tasties, Montford Park, Riverside Cemetery, Montford Park Players Outdoor Amphitheater, the Botanical Gardens,Trolley Tours, make this a wonderful and vibrant, downtown neighborhood.  If you love architecture, Victorian, Tudor, Colonial Revival, Georgian, it's all here.   After a busy Asheville day, come home to relax on the back deck, screened porch, or front patio and watch the birds, build a fire in the fire pit, pick some herbs for dinner, play the piano, meet the friendly neighbors, you get the idea...
description: *Discounts for longer stays - 1 to 6 months*. This lovely home has rave reviews and provides the best of both Asheville worlds.  Close to downtown, yet quiet with a private, natural setting. It's a safe, family-friendly, walkable neighborhood.   This unique home is located on an half acre wooded lot, in a walkable, historic downtown neighborhood, the best of both Asheville worlds. The fully restored 100 year old home has all the modern conveniences including a Chef's kitchen (with granite counters, Dacor stove, Bosch dishwasher), AC, and  wireless internet.  It is exactly one mile to the Visitor Center at the edge of downtown.  Aside from the beautiful historical homes and gardens, favorite eateries like Nine Mile, Todd's Tasties, Montford Park, Riverside Cemetery, Montford Park Players Outdoor Amphitheater, the Botanical Gardens,Trolley Tours, make this a wonderful and vibrant, downtown neighborhood.  If you love architecture, Victorian, Tudor, Colonial Revival, Georgian, it's all her
neighborhood_overview: I lived in this home for five years and I often miss living on this street.  That's part of reason I'm renting it furnished for short-term, so I can take great care of it.  I know all the neighbors, it's a popular street for running, dog walking, or just taking a stroll.  Close to lots of Montford gems, like Nine Mile, Botanical Gardens, Montford Park, not to mention all the beautiful homes in this historic neighborhood.
notes: Read the rave reviews.
transit: Yes, there is a bus stop close by.  House is one mile from downtown, so walkable.  Tour trolleys stop a block away.  Handy parking at Visitor Center.
host_about:
I moved to Asheville in 2005 from Palo Alto.  Grew up in San Francisco.  My parents immigrated from Ireland,  so I have lots of Irish family and travel there frequently.  One of my favorite things about Asheville is how similar it is to Ireland. Just as green, but with better weather.  

I am an Electrical Engineer, worked at NASA;  jumped ship to teach high school science at Gunn High School in Palo Alto. 

I enjoy entertaining and traveling and love the idea of creating a space where visitors to Asheville can relax and enjoy this amazing town.  I lived in the Montford home for five years, and it is a wonderful space, with great energy.   I spent many hours working in the garden and this spring it's paying off........Then I moved to another lovely neighborhood, Grove Park, and renovated another 100 year old home.  I also rent the apartment downstairs in that home.   

I am working on adding some of my favorite places to my Guidebook section, so check that out.  Feel free to ask any questions about the house, apartment,  or Asheville area...... - Anne Marie

name: Charming Apt-Walk downtwn
summary: Historic neighborhood--walking distance to downtown, trader joes and much more!
space: Come enjoy our beautiful apartment ( 1 bed/1.5 bath) and see what great things Asheville has to offer.  Restaurants, bars, theaters, galleries, outdoor concerts and so much more are all within walking distance.  You can't beat this spot!  We are located on a quiet street in historic neighborhood, just 10 minutes walking distance to downtown. We are also only 2 blocks from the popular grocery store Green Life (owned by Whole Foods), Trader Joe's and Harris Teeter.  This is a fantastic, historic neighborhood adjacent to downtown- Stroll past historic B&B's down tree-lined streets as you make your way home after a delicious meal at one of Asheville's many great restaurants.  It would be hard to find a more convenient location than this! Our apartment is recently renovated and tastefully furnished.  Old world charm meets modern lofty feel is one of the descriptions I have heard before. Stunning, original heart pine floors, stainless appliances, an open floor plan and beautiful garden are j

host_about: I love to travel, I am a big foodie...That pretty much sums it up!  My partner and I travel extensively and rent our home out while we are away.  If we are not in Asheville you might find us in central America or South East Asia soaking up some sun and surf.  Life is constantly flying by so why not get out there and enjoy it!  Right? Thats my motto.

neighborhood_overview: The Sabe'l  is a short term weekly rental.  We offer one Bedroom apartments, effeciences and rooms.  We have a fair amount of long term residents as well!   This area is a mix of residential and  commercial businesses.   It is a very nice neighborhood to take a walk or bike ride. We also have picnic tables out back, and in the summer an organic community garden.
notes: Check In is at 3:00pm.  Check out is 11:00am. If you stay over a week, up to three weeks the cleaning charge goes up to:  $50.00. If you stay over three weeks the cleaning charge would go up to:  $75.00.
transit: We do have off street parking for one vehicle. Uber is available in Asheville.
host_about:
Hi I am Roxanne the Property Manager for Asheville Investments/Sabe'l at 42 Furman.
I love to:  Dance, hike with friends and family, yoga, gardening, traveling, camping, photography, meet new people, networking and sharing about healthy ways of being and so much more!

name: COZY RIVER ARTS COTTAGE
summary: Come stay in my cozy River Arts cottage! 20 min walk to downtown, just up the street from White Duck Taco, Wedge Brewing, Grey Eagle, restaurants, galleries, etc. Cozy house, comfy queen bed, and great location with all the creature comforts of home!
space: Welcome to my cottage on Chicken Hill! My home is a bright, clean, and cozy with lots of artistic Asheville flair.  The house is less than 1 mile from the heart of downtown Asheville.
description: Come stay in my cozy River Arts cottage! 20 min walk to downtown, just up the street from White Duck Taco, Wedge Brewing, Grey Eagle, restaurants, galleries, etc. Cozy house, comfy queen bed, and great location with all the creature comforts of home! Welcome to my cottage on Chicken Hill! My home is a bright, clean, and cozy with lots of artistic Asheville flair.  The house is less than 1 mile from the heart of downtown Asheville.  Guests have access to the full house and the kitchen. Coffee & tea, cereal, and milk provided. Guests also have access to FREE, OFF-STREET PARKING in the driveway next to the house. And you can enjoy the spacious deck with table and chairs any time of day!  Guests will have the house to themselves. I live next door and am easily accessible in case you need anything! A 20-min walk will take you directly into downtown Asheville with its many bars, breweries, restaurants, shops, galleries, and activities. Or you can walk to South Slope in 10 mins, a hotbed of l
neighborhood_overview: A 20-min walk will take you directly into downtown Asheville with its many bars, breweries, restaurants, shops, galleries, and activities. Or you can walk to South Slope in 10 mins, a hotbed of local microbreweries (the Wedge Brewery, High Wire, Green Man, Burial, Twin Leaf, Wicked Weed, Asheville Brewing Company). Walk 5 minutes downhill and explore the galleries, coffee shops, restaurants, and pubs along the French Broad River in the River Arts District, or check out a show at the Grey Eagle, a fantastic music venue 5 mins from the cottage!
notes: Club Street is a ONE-WAY coming uphill to my house, so... 1) If you're coming from Roberts St, just turn up Trade St, which turns into Club St. I'm the turquoise house on the left!     OR 2) If you're coming from W. Haywood, turn left onto Haywood, turn right at Roberts, and right again onto Trade Street. Trade turns into Club and I'm the turquoise house on the left!
transit: Asheville has a public bus system called the ART, but most places in town are within walking distance.
street: Club Street, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

Tiled Baths & Kitchen • Living room has a gas log fireplace & Plenty of Seating. * Multiple Outdoor Seating Areas • Upstairs bedroom has a seating area & spiral staircase entrance with balcony. **Please NOTE interior stairs are "attic t

transit: Public bus stop at corner of Pearson Dr. & Watauga St. adjacent to Tacoma St. 20 minute (or so) walk to downtown or park at visitor center (at corner of Montford Ave. & Haywood St.)
host_about:
I have lived in Asheville for 33 years. Moved here for nursing school & never left!
I am a runner, organic gardener (you will see my garden if you stay with me) & occasional road biker. I also have a regular yoga practice.
In May 2013 I traveled to San Diego to attend the National Iyengar yoga conference. I will be attending the national conference in May 2016.
I have 4 rescue dogs that are my babies.
I have traveled extensively out west, usually backpacking &/or car camping. I have also visited Greece where I island jumped solo for several days & on another occasion traveled to Barcelona into the Pyrenees & into the very southern tip of France & back down the Mediterranean coast into Spain finding lodging along the way.
Visiting Kauai for my first visit in March 2015- booked lodging via airbnb!
