name: Urban Chic Loft Downtown Asheville
summary: Our true city loft is nestled in the heart of Downtown Asheville - walking distance to everything downtown. Located on eclectic Carolina Lane, enjoy a private, open and clean urban loft. Centrally located, make this your home base to the city fun and the beautiful Blue Ridge mountains.
space: New Contemporary furniture accented by mid-century Eames style swivel chair in the reading nook. New Plush area rugs and New 55" High Definition Television.
description: Our true city loft is nestled in the heart of Downtown Asheville - walking distance to everything downtown. Located on eclectic Carolina Lane, enjoy a private, open and clean urban loft. Centrally located, make this your home base to the city fun and the beautiful Blue Ridge mountains. New Contemporary furniture accented by mid-century Eames style swivel chair in the reading nook. New Plush area rugs and New 55" High Definition Television. Amenities and Features: Complimentary Coffee, Teas, Bottled Water, Toiletries  Central AC/Heat Fully Equipped Kitchen HDTV Cable TV Wireless Internet Ceiling Fan Pillow Top Queen Mattress I look forward to meeting you upon arrival to give you the loft key and show you the features of 31 Carolina Lane. I will be pleased to answer any questions, recommend restaurants, site seeing recommendations, mountain trails/ activities - to make your visit to Asheville a fun and relaxing vacation! I live only 3 blocks away so any needs and requests will have a qui
neighborhood_overview: Eclectic. Asheville's city alley, Carolina Lane, is a mix of creativity and city life in the heart of the city. Walk anywhere - anytime, to enjoy downtown Asheville restaurants, bars, art, theater, music shows - all from our comfortable urban home base.
notes: Parking: There is public street parking on Carolina Lane, however it is not reserved. Most guests are able to secure a spot. If not, there are 4 public pay lots within 1/2 block walking distance.
transit: Walk everywhere downtown. Access to City buses, pedi cabs, on street parking, and 4 parking lots within the block radius.
host_about: I am an Asheville native and I have traveled many cities and backpacked Europe and Asia. I always found that my best travel experiences occurred when I stayed in non-traditional accommodations and apartments ('living close to the ground') as opposed to hotels. I still love to travel and have high standards for tasteful, comfortable, clean lodging that I have translated into the 31 Carolina Lane Loft. I lived and worked in NYC for several years in the fashion industry. I love the energy of city living, and feel Carolina Lane has urban grit. I currently own a thriving local business here in Asheville, and my husband, daughter and I live only 3 blocks from the loft so I am able to provide quick response to any needs or questions you may have during your stay. With great knowledge of the area, I would be pleased to offer any suggestions of where to go and what to see during your stay in our fair city of Asheville.
street: Carolina Lane, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

description: This apartment is perfect for you. With 2 balconies, an open living space floor plan, 2 private bedrooms and a spacious bathroom. The 1 mile walk to the heart of downtown, includes breweries, fantastic restaurants, coffee shops & specialty boutiques
host_about:
Thanks for checking out my place. I live here with my dog Daisy. I'm new to Asheville, and wanted to live close enough to walk downtown, with a beautiful mountain view. That's why I think this apartment will be perfect for you too!!! It is a 1 mile pedestrian friendly walk to downtown and a $7 uber ride home. I hope that you have a small dog, but will look forward to talking to you about that :)Asheville is super dog friendly so you're little love bug will have a great time checking out the city with you. 
 I work as a massage therapist in a few locations and practice out of my home. It's a peaceful place, and I hope you'll be our guest.

name: Blue Bedroom on South Slope
summary: Private bedroom on upper floor of large 1928 home on edge of South Slope. Room shares a bathroom and small eat-in kitchen on upper floor with a full time housemate and another guest room.  Walk to downtown and South Slope. Off-street parking available.  2 night minimum please.
space: My house is across the street from the baseball field which is so much fun during baseball season, especially on fireworks night.  Please check with the Asheville Tourists' schedule for specific details.  Also we're super close to the Orange Peel and South Slope.
description: Private bedroom on upper floor of large 1928 home on edge of South Slope. Room shares a bathroom and small eat-in kitchen on upper floor with a full time housemate and another guest room.  Walk to downtown and South Slope. Off-street parking available.  2 night minimum please. My house is across the street from the baseball field which is so much fun during baseball season, especially on fireworks night.  Please check with the Asheville Tourists' schedule for specific details.  Also we're super close to the Orange Peel and South Slope. Guests have access to both bathrooms and all the common areas of the house. I enjoy visiting with the people who stay with us and at the same time I'm very respectful of my guests privacy.  Also I have a very full and busy personal life so I'm not always able to be available to visit with guests.  It's nice when our paths do cross though. I love the proximity of the South Slope and the Orange Peel and downtown in general.  Another plus is that Biltmore V
neighborhood_overview: I love the proximity of the South Slope and the Orange Peel and downtown in general.  Another plus is that Biltmore Village is only a mile away.
notes: I have three children who only hang out on the main level (this BR is upstairs) but I'm sure some kid noises are audible from upstairs.  Another thing to consider is that baseball season brings people watching and excitement (and fireworks!). The games never go terribly late except for Boy Scouts night when they do an outdoor movie. If you enjoy the activity or decidedly don't, you may want to consult the Asheville Tourists schedule before booking.
transit: Downtown is less than a half mile walk and we have a bus stop close by for going greater distances (like to West Asheville).
host_about: I have been in the area for over 25 years now living just west of Asheville for most of that time.  In early 2011 I made Asheville my permanent home with my two kiddos and my sweet dog.  I LOVE this town passionately with all that it has to offer with its rich history, vibrant art, culinary and beer scenes, outdoor activities, incredible views around every corner and above all, the amazing, WONDERFUL people.  I'm more than happy to help you decide on some must-see's around town and will do what I can to make your time in Asheville comfortable and friendly.
street: Buchanan Avenue, Asheville, NC 28801, United States

name: Walk Downtown private bath peaceful
summary: Private room, King size bed, desk for you to work at, if you need it.  Large closet. Private full bathroom. Living room, fully stocked kitchen, W/D and Wifi.
space: This is a super convenient location, right on the edge of downtown's vibrant scene.  This historic home is large and comfortable with everything you need to cook or relax in a quiet environment just two blocks from downtown, Asheville Yoga center, or UNCA.  Because of location of this listing, it is not a good fit if traveling with children. This bedroom is on the first floor and has a beautiful private full bath. There is a king size bed with a fantastic medium firm mattress, walk in closet with cabinets for your things and a desk for you to work at, if you need it. There is a shared (with other guests) living room, fully stocked kitchen and a large front porch on the same floor. The house is set back from the street, surrounded by trees and it is very peaceful here...amazing that we are so close to downtown! It's a great biking and walking neighborhood too, with excellent road bike trails right out the front door! There's good breakfast, fresh juices and coffee a block away at Greenl

name: Birch House Asheville
summary: Less than a mile away from Asheville's vibrant downtown, our Guest Suite offers the perfect accommodation in the prestigious Montford District. Private entrance, wonderful neighborhood, spacious living space; perfect for your Asheville get-away!
space: Our finished basement offers a very large and comfortable Guest Suite, with bedroom, small sitting/living room, and a bathroom. The private entrance allows access at YOUR convenience.  Aside from the comfortable queen-sized bed in the bedroom, a VERY comfortable sofa-bed in the living room can accommodate 2 more persons. This is one of the few Asheville homestay accommodations that welcomes pets!  Additionally, Birch House is just 0.7 miles from the excitement of downtown - an easy and delightful stroll. Most guests have such a great time exploring Asheville's attractions and amenities that they don't spend much time indoors, but in case you want to spend the day or evening inside, the Suite has a TV with local broadcast channels and Netflix/Pandora access. We can arrange for you to borrow our DVD/blue-ray player if you want to bring your own disks to watch.
description: Less than a mile away from Asheville's vibrant downtown, our Guest Suite offers the perfect accommodation in the prestigious Montford District. neighborhood_overview: Asheville has guest accommodations of every type and price-point. For those interested in an economical "homestay" experience, you cannot do better than Birch House Asheville! Birch House is in the the Montford Historic District, Asheville's premier neighborhood, with stately homes, plenty of luxury B&Bs and nearby (and wonderful) neighborhood restaurants. A great walking neighborhood, very convenient  (20 minute stroll) to downtown. Asheville is known for its fine food, lovely downtown, the many microbreweries in the area, the fabulous Biltmore Estate, and the wonderful array of outdoors/adventure opportunities in the Blue Ridge mountain.  Birch House is central to all Asheville has to offer!
notes: Birch House has completed Asheville's Homestay inspection and permitting process and is proud that we have been found to have met or exceeded all applicable safety and regulatory standards. 2016 City Homestay Permit#00781 on file.
host_about:
Retired RN, now happily living in Asheville.  I've always been told that I am a great tourguide, and I now live in a home that is perfect to house guests and visitors.  

Asheville is full of accommodation options for every budget and lifestyle.  If you are looking for an informal, easy-on-your-budget, friendly and personal stay here, please consider staying in our Guest Suite. 

You will find that I am always available to assist you in having the best time possible in Asheville area, but absolutely able to respect your privacy. Like to cook, hiking, meeting new people.

I'm new at this (hosting), so will bend over backward to make this work for you!

name: Artsy Urban Nest-Walk 2Downtown/RAD
summary: Historic & charming urban escape in Downtown AVL . Walk to the best Downtown has to offer in 5 minutes.  2 blocks in the other direction takes you to the River Arts District-R.A.D+Great Location & Luxury accommodations! Enjoy!
space: Settle in to our alluring 2BR historic bungalow in the evolving South Slope neighborhood of Downtown Asheville.  Enjoy old growth trees and the sound of the city at once adorned with just the right blend of Vintage & Modern accouterments to make your stay comfortable & memorable.   With its location it is simple to get the most out of your trip by staying in the heart of it all. Three blocks from the interstate and walking distance to hundreds of top of the line Restaurants, boutiques, art galleries , music venus.  With architecture and culture that permeate throughout the city, all while enjoying the views in the 'Land of the Sky' This vacation home is only minutes away from some of Asheville's most popular dining locations including: Rhubarb, Tupelo Honey, Early Girl Eatery, Zambra, Chestnut, Buchon, Salsa's, Curate, White Duck Taco, and local craft breweries such as Asheville Brewing, The Wedge, Hi-wire, Bens tuneup, Wicked Weed, Green Man & more... My airbnb rental was my primary home for 7 years I have put 100% love into it. And I am excited to accommodate travelers as a host!

name: Historic Home in Downtown Asheville
summary: This beautiful 1925's Art and Crafts home is located in downtown Asheville,in the up and coming River Art District and 2 miles to Pack Square and Biltmore Estates.  We have two bedrooms with a comfortable full size futon. Beauty and simplicity.
space: The mountain areas of Asheville NC are known for the many beautiful arts and crafts style homes that are so popular in this area. Our home is cozy and reflects the added care and detail that home builders of the past took great pains to incorporate in their one of kind homes. Our home was built in 1925 and has just gone thru a complete renovation. New electric, plumbing, kitchen, bathrooms, and all new appliances. While the renovations were extensive the goal was to keep the old fashion charm of this beautiful home. The bedrooms have new mattresses with new bedding/towels. The bathrooms have the comfort of an antique claw foot tub waiting for you to soak in this spacious tub.  We have wi-fi service throughout the house with a very fast connection.We just added a flat screen television with VGA hook up to your computer for internet programs.This house is on a very quiet street with its own private driveway. Location is what matters in Asheville, my home is in downtown Asheville, minutes

neighborhood_overview: We are centrally located in Downtown Asheville, in the up and coming River Arts District. This neighborhood is going thru an urban renewal since we are 5 blocks away from the River Arts District. We are a minutes away from Biltmore and downtown. About 2 miles! Easy walking distance if you don't mind the hills but I usually drive. Our house manual has a list of favorite restaurants, point of interests and grocery stores/ food markets/ food trucks.
notes: We have a house manual with information and recommendations of our favorite things in town.
transit: You can easily walk to the River Arts District 5 blocks away where you will find studios and restaurants, breweries. We are 2 miles away from Pack Square and Biltmore Estates.Bus line are just down the street. Cars are advised, bicycles, Uber or walking if you don't mind the hills.
host_about:
Hi, I am almost a native of beautiful south Florida. I love the outdoors and the weather here. Florida is really a special place if you venture out into all it has to offer. A great art scene, an amazing one of a kind ecosystem in the Everglades and the best weather in the continental USA in the winter. If you love sunshine, beaches and a diverse population of interesting people, head down our way. We have a small oasis in the middle of Fort Lauderdale awaiting you with some easy fun loving vibes. Now for the Asheville home, if you been to Asheville there isn't really anything I can add to this amazing town. Art, music, food like you have never had before and the beautiful Smokey Mountains!!! 
Thanks,
Ana
Ana

name: Galoob d'Ja Moon Ultimate Hoon Room
summary: Spacious, cozy, private room in a beautiful historical home ideally located near downtown.  This is the center of operations for a non-profit that cultivates and fosters equitable, shareable, self-governed land use arrangements.  The organization shares information with the public by hosting guests.  Self-responsibility is a key element of our exchanges that allows us to reduce costs through shared efforts.  This unique arrangement makes for an all-round perfect, and affordable, experience.
space: Affectionately referred to as the Hoon Room, this room is home to Galoob d' Jah Moon The Ultimate Hoon.  You will meet him during your stay, while experiencing a decor that vibrates his vibrant, playful spirit. This room is situated on the first floor of a large historic home that is within easy walking distance to downtown.  It is cozy, comfortable and fun.  It offers privacy within a vibrant community setting.  In the room one finds a comfy queen-sized bed, flat screen tv, large desk, bookshelf, mini fridge, private bathroom, and a lounge chair.  A private door opens into a nice sized bathroom that includes a shower/tub. Basics such as towels, shampoo and a hair dryer are provided.   The Hoon Room offers traditional travel amenities such as privacy and autonomy, yet feels comfortably familiar.  Local artists contribute to the folk artsy decor in the room, giving it a flair that is unique to Asheville.  We make every attempt to accommodate last minute booking requests.   SELF-RESPONSI
description: Spacious, cozy, private room in a beautiful historical home ideally located near downtown. It offers privacy within a vibrant community setting.  In the room one finds a comfy queen-sized bed, flat screen tv, large desk, bookshelf, m
neighborhood_overview: We love everything about our neighborhood!!!  The street is lined with mature trees and large, older homes full of character, reminiscent of days gone by.  One of the best characteristics of the street is that it is full of large, mature trees that make the area truly feel like a neighborhood. And how could we not love the flavor brought to the area by the Yoga Center and other local businesses.  And what would a neighborhood be without convenient shopping, of which there is plenty within very easy walking distance.  If feels like we have it all, and we do.  We are extremely fortunate to be here, now. Yes Trader Joe's is a block away, as is Greenlife, a Whole Foods grocery.  And did we mention Harris Teeter?
notes: Visitors find themselves in an arrangement that manages the operational activities of Model Community Properties (MCP), a non-profit that  cultivates, fosters and facilitates equitable, Shareable, self-governed arrangements, studying their economic and social impact.  Notice the word “Shareable", as this is critical to understanding our organization and the arrangement into which you are invited. The Shareable arrangements that MCP cultivates, fosters and facilitates are those revolving around the shared use of residential property. While we do support shared business arrangements they are not our focus.   Since our “business" is that of fostering community lifestyles, our main office seconds as a home for those who are involved in its operations.  Activities are managed through self-governance via a structure referred to as “Circle Forward".  Decisions are made by those living and working in our Sharing lifestyle cooperative. We assume our guests to be those who are interested in supp
transit: Just a block away, along Merrimon Avenue, there is a bus stop.  It's also an easy walk or bike ride to downtown, a cab ride is ~$5.  Uber also offers quick and easy service.
host_about:
Model Community Properties (MCP) is a non-profit that  cultivates, fosters and facilitates equitable, Shareable, self-governed arrangements, studying their economic and social impact.  Notice the word “Shareable", as this is critical to understanding our organization and the invitation we extend to our guests to come and check us out, while spending a vacation in the heart of beautiful Asheville.
The Shareable arrangements that MCP cultivates, fosters and facilitates are those revolving around the shared use of residential property.  We offer two rooms to overnight, short-term guests who are interested in supporting the MCP undertaking or are curious about the endeavors of the organization.

host_about:
We are privately located near West Asheville, just off the I40 with easy access to downtown Asheville via Patton Ave. Taking Rt151 you travel through the beautiful rolling hills of the Hominy Valley, its surrounding organic farms, flower gardens and streams, with the Pisgah and Blue Ridge Mountains as a back drop. Just 5 miles from our door is mountain access to the Pisgah Forest and the Blue Ridge Parkways scenic valley over looks, hiking trails and waterfalls. This quiet forest location with its charming guest cabin homes, is also a service provider for the Art Studio World charity and provides a home base for the 'C.H.A.I.' LIFE ARTS CENTER (CHAILA) which offers CREATIVE-HOLISTIC ART INTEGRATION based Workshops, Programs, Retreats, Trainings, Rentals, Guest Visits and more. 

This incredible "Land Project" is dedicated to empowering and inspiring wellness and creativity for all. 

Our CHAILA local team includes Rachel from Art Studio World and David Rosenthal of Planet Kitchen and the famous "PFM Fire Tonic" products known as the Fixer Elixer! 

We are a team aligned in creating our best lives in body - mind - soul, with aligned purpose for serving the next generations of youth with creative thinking tools that empower and inspire. 

When you are a guest in our cabin homes you are provided with clean, comfortable accommodations in a caring heart centered energetically beneficial environment. You are surrounded by nature, the high mountains and a fantastic view of Mount Pisgah. Your payment is considered a donation to the charity and supports  the continuation of youth empowerment programs. Love + Gratitude = Peace

Locations: 
- Asheville Airport 22 miles
- Asheville Downtown 15 miles
- West Asheville 10 miles
- Sliding Rock Water Falls 32 miles South
- P.A.R.I - Pisgah Astronomical Research Institute
37 miles South > 1 Pari Dr, Rosman, NC 28772

name: Cozy Mountain Cabin Near Asheville
summary: Rustic and inviting cabin along a lovely mountain creek, borders Pisgah National Forest. Relax on the deck listening to the peaceful creek. Just 4 miles to Blue Ridge Parkway and only 20-minute drive to Asheville and the best the area has to offer!
space: You will love relaxing on the deck under the trees listening to the peaceful sounds of our creek. Inside your private retreat you will find a full kitchen, comfortable dining and living areas including TV, Blu-Ray/DVD player, surround sound with blue tooth connectivity, all modern appliances and free high-speed wireless Internet access. Upstairs loft-style bedroom feels like your staying in a tree house and both bedrooms face the creek side of the house. Spend the chilly evenings in front of a cozy fire or the lazy summer nights on the deck watching the fireflies sparkle and dance against the treeline.

neighborhood_overview: While the area is very rural, we do have neighbors on either side of the cabin, yet it still maintains a very peaceful and secluded feel. Our neighbors are great people; kind, friendly, and will respect your privacy.
notes: A cleaning fee of $50 and 7.75% tax rate, based on the nightly costs, will be included in your booking and due upon arrival.

name: Creekside apartment by mount Pisgah
summary: The one bedroom apartment sits at the base of mt Pisgah. Enjoy the quiet of the woods and sounds of the creek while still staying close enough to downtown Asheville to enjoy the art galleries and night life. Lots of fruit and flowers growing here.
space: The best thing about this place is the outdoors. A creek runs through the front yard. There is a fire pit, gas grill and a wood/charcoal grill available for your use. When the weather is warm enjoy the badminton court or some bocce ball. You are just minutes away from the blue ridge parkway and mount Pisgah. There are lots of great hikes and waterfalls within just a few miles of the property.  The bedroom has a queen size bed and there is a fold out couch in the living room which is great for the kids. Be aware there is no cell service here but there is wifi and a landline in the apartment.

Be aware there is no cell service here but there is wifi and a landline in the apartment. You have a private entrance and access to the shared laundry room. You are welcome to enjoy all the great features around the property. Play in the creek
notes: I am a big time dancer and Asheville has a fantastic dance scene. If you are looking to dance while you are here I am happy to point you in the right direction. You can also check out (URL HIDDEN) to see a listing of most of our local dance events.
transit: There is no public transit from here to town so it is best that you have a car. There is plenty of parking on the property.
host_about: I am an avid dancer and Asheville has one of the best dance scenes in the country. So if you want to dance while you are here I got the skinny on when and where. I make custom woodwork almost entirely out of salvaged and upcycled materials. I am also a Taekwondo student; currently a second degree black belt.

name: Whistlepig Farm
summary: Built in 1903 and renovated in 2008, our farmhouse has the coziness of an old country home and the vitality of a modern art gallery. A full cascade of windows show off beautiful Hominy Valley and is only 20 minutes from downtown Asheville.
space: Multiple indoor and outdoor sitting areas create opportunities for big parties and intimate conversations. Anne's remarkable collection of modern art and Tom's handmade quilts inhabit the rest of this wonderful gathering space. A horseshoe pit, badminton, bocce balls, and two wonderful swimming holes open up a lifetime of memories. If fishing is your thing, Davis Creek has been restored by the NC Department of Environment and Natural Resources as a protected trout habitat. Mount Pisgah, an easy 1.3 hike and is only 10 minutes away. Feel free to explore the garden and gather what the season has to offer. Our fully appointed modern kitchen has everything the avid cook might need. Whistlepig Farm is available for weddings and events yet different rates apply in addition to house rental.
description: Built in 1903 and renovated in 2008, our farmhouse has the coziness of an old country home and the vitality of a modern art gallery. neighborhood_overview: The house is set in middle of seven open acres. We have 2 neighbors on our road which is a dead end, so there is virtually no traffic making it safe for kids and dogs. The neighbors' homes are visible, yet they are far enough away where it feels private.
notes: Our passive solar addition has solar heated radiant floors and domestic hot water.   But, in really cold weather the wood stove is the way to go. It puts out the heat.  We have all the wood you need and we will be happy to let you know how to make the most of it.  Our house is intentionally simple. It's easy to find almost anything. except the kitchen trash basket.  It does not have a handle and is on the right side of the island.  The recycling bin is in the pantry. Cleaning supplies are under the sink. The cabinet door has a safety latch on it. House cleaning supplies, if you need them, are in the utility room along with the washer and dryer. Bathroom supplies are under the sink in the master bathroom. Linens are in the closet at the top of the stairs, along with a laundry basket. We deliberately have limited our closet space.  There is a small walk in closet in the master bedroom and one rear the front door. We'd appreciate if you refrained from touching or moving any of the paintin
transit: We are 20 to 25 minutes to downtown Asheville depending on traffic, so cars are pretty necessary.
host_about: We are easy going people who just love living a farm life.  We have a 15 year old and a 3 year old keeping us on our toes. We are both therapists which helps pay for the folly of growing specialty garlic for sale to local markets and restaurants.
street: Wishing Well Drive, Candler, NC 28715, United States

name: Private campground on organic farm
summary: Relax by Melodic Creek. Private and Peaceful. Three acres of woods on one of WNC's oldest organic vegetable farms. Just 20 minutes to AVL. Fire Rings. Full kitchen. Bathroom w/shower. W/D available. Three sites for Tent Camping w/2 adults per tent.
space: Campsites on three wooded acres bordered by babbling brook with fire rings in a wooded area of our organic farm. Bathroom with shower. Kitchen with stove, fridge, nuker, toaster, espresso-like coffee maker. (We supply coffee from local micro-roaster.) By staying here, rest assured you are in fact helping a small farm survive year to year and we are grateful to all of you.
description: Relax by Melodic Creek. Private and Peaceful. Three acres of woods on one of WNC's oldest organic vegetable farms. Just 20 minutes to AVL. Fire Rings. Full kitchen. Bathroom w/shower. W/D available. Three sites for Tent Camping w/2 adults per tent. Campsites on three wooded acres bordered by babbling brook with fire rings in a wooded area of our organic farm. Bathroom with shower. Kitchen with stove, fridge, nuker, toaster, espresso-like coffee maker. (We supply coffee from local micro-roaster.) By staying here, rest assured you are in fact helping a small farm survive year to year and we are grateful to all of you. Guests are welcome and encouraged to walk all 11 acres of our organic farm, including the woodlot, the creek, and the vegetable fields. Access to the greenhouses is restricted due to the possibility of damaging the crops and the restrictions of certification. We are happy to include you in our farm life if we can, or leave you alone to enjoy the privacy. The farm is shared
neighborhood_overview: Private secluded 11 acre farm in Hominy Valley, a small valley named after the corn crops that were grown by the indigenous population until the late 1600's. The farm is bordered by Beaverdam creek w/native trout.  Splendid views. Serenity is our biggest asset.  As one of the oldest organic farms in the area with nearly 18 years experience in local food and farmer's markets, we are proud that many our best local restaurants purchase their produce from us.  While we are secluded and in a country setting, we are close to Asheville... Approximately 15 minutes to downtown Asheville;  5 minutes to grocery stores and other necessities;  10-15 minutes to Interstates 40 and 26;  and 20 minutes to the airport.
notes: Campers need to bring all necessary gear: Tent. Sleeping Bags. Supplies. We do not provide any equipment. We will not house campers in inclement weather. Please treat your space and any areas you use with the respect you would as a guest at your distant aunt who might leave you money if she likes you.  We call dirt, soil here. Unfortunately, it comes in buildings despite best efforts.
transit: You will need a car.
host_about: disabled, somewhat retired, over the hill babyboomer hippy type. Love caribbean life. Lived on Maui 10 years. Fourth generation Texan. Horse packer in the Rockies, Grower in the Smokies. Five years in Alaska.

name: Cozy efficiency Apartment
summary: This apartment has living area, a full kitchen, a full bathroom, and a bedroom. Cable tv and wireless internet. It is very comfortable and private. Top that off with views across the valley to Mt. Pisgah,  and it's a great deal.
space: This space is about the size of a large hotel room. It has a living area, full bath, and a full kitchen with a standard stove and refrigerator with ice maker. It also has a deck outside with a gas grill for some outdoor dining.

name: Comfy Barn Room on Organic Veg Farm
summary: Cozy room just 20 min to AVL - stunning views. Furnished: Full bed & linens. A/C, Heater, TV w/DVD's. 30 second walk to shared kitchen & bath. Woods! Creek! on Our 11 acre organic farm. We farm vegetables for fine restaurants, co-op, & farm markets.
space: Our farm, our home, is serene and private. We are 20 minutes from downtown Asheville.  The barn room is up 8 steps over the packing house where we prepare and pack vegetables for market.  Most of the upstairs of the packing house is the farm's 'attic' with the Barn Room as a separate 11x17 space that is furnished with full bed/linens, slider chair/footstool, TV w/DVDs, etc.  It was built for root vegetable storage before being converted to a cozy bedroom. Since we have cut back on planting root vegetables, we are able to share this cheery, private room with airBnB guests. It is about 25 yards to the Bathrooms/Showers or to the Kitchen. The Kitchen has stove, fridge, nuker, toaster, espresso-like coffee maker; pots, pans, dishes, and flatware, etc.  By staying here, rest assured you are in fact helping a small farm survive year to year and we are grateful to all of you.

name: Stone Cottage Garden Homestay TWO
summary: Come stay with us in our beautiful stone home, just 15 min from downtown Asheville. It is in a country neighborhood and you can see the stars at night! Enjoy the gardens, chickens, dog, and cats. We'd love to have you! Kathleen & John
space: Gardens surround this charming homestead with rare trees & shrubs, flowers, and fresh vegetables. The living room wood-burning stove creates a cozy place (in season) to read, talk, or watch a movie. There is off-street parking and a friendly, helpful hostess. We have made quite a few improvements  here lately and the homestead is now even prettier and more comfortable! It may just remind you of your grandmother's house. Many people think that the best things here are the two outdoor covered porches where you can sit and eat, chat, or enjoy a drink.  Outside in the gardens you'll find a hammock, a covered swing, benches, and tables & chairs with umbrellas for your enjoyment.  Your delightful, private, sunny, 2nd floor space has a half-bath right in the room. There is a comfortable full bed, a table and chairs, a lovely view of the garden, and a real secret compartment (ask me). The "eco-carpeting" is soft to walk on and pretty. The room comes with fresh-air dried sheets, nice towels, ki
description: Come stay with us in our beautiful stone home, just 15 min from downtown Asheville. It is in a country neighborhood and you can see the stars at night! Enjoy the gardens, chickens, dog, and cats. We'd love to have you! Kathleen & John Gardens surround this charming homestead with rare trees & shrubs, flowers, and fresh vegetables. The living room wood-burning stove creates a cozy place (in season) to read, talk, or watch a movie. There is off-street parking and a friendly, helpful hostess. Outside in the gardens you'll find a hammock, a covered swing, benches, and tables & chairs with umbrellas for your enjoyment.  Your delightful, private, sunny, 2nd floor space has a half-bath right in the roo
neighborhood_overview: This is a country neighborhood. Each house has about half an acre or more. We are on a very quiet street on one side and a country cut-through road on the other. Very easy to find!
notes: Please contact us if you have any questions or special concerns. We will try to accommodate as much as possible!
transit: There is no public transportation out here. You'll really need a car to come and go. But there's always taxi service.
host_about:
I am a professional landscape designer. I have an office in my home so I'm here a LOT. I am also crazy about gardening. 

I am gradually converting pretty much all of my lawn to gardens. I grow rare and wonderful trees and shrubs, many kinds of annual and perennial flowering plants, and all kinds of veggies. I am currently planting fruit trees, brambles, strawberries, etc. Not much lawn left!

I love to rent rooms to interesting people! I have had so much fun meeting the folks who come here through Airbnb! They have come from many countries, states, and walks of life. I love it! I am hoping to get some Turkish visitors so that I can practice my Turkish on them. I have traveled in many countries, myself and love to swap stories!

I love good food. I grow much of my own. I am interested in all things homesteading. I have been been at this since the 1970's when I built and lived in my own underground house in Michigan. I love to share ideas on this subject.

I love to DANCE! Especially to the blues. You can find me out making something up on the dance floor at the great clubs in "Ashevegas". Looking silly, maybe, but having fun!

And lastly, I am thoroughly in love with this wonderful old stone house. I spend lots of time working to restore my home and make it more and more livable. Several ago I got a new roof and now I'm working on the windows and getting ready to paint the exterior trim. I feel (EMAIL HIDDEN)e see! I'd love to have you!

name: Private, Cozy and Pet Friendly!
summary: Our guest room has a queen bed, private bath, living area with fold out futon, small fridge, microwave and coffee cart.  There's a large fenced-in back yard and sweet older dog!   We love to host you and make our favorite local recommendations!
space: Our guest bedroom with queen-size bed and living area with a full-size fold-out futon are in the finished basement of our 1940's home.  There is a walk-in private entrance at the back of the house, inside of the fenced yard.  A private bathroom with rustic claw foot tub/shower is stocked with towels and washcloths.  There are extra blankets, pillows and towels in the guestroom closet, an extra queen size air mattress if you'd like to really pack in the guests, as well as a "Pack-n-Play" crib for your use if you're bringing a little one with you.   We have free wi-fi for you to use while you're here, and a desk space if you'd like to get some work done.  There are several bookshelves that you can peruse and borrow from while you're here, as well as a fun collection of board games. We have a beautiful large vegetable garden, tree house, hand built picnic table, fire ring, swing and hammock under the trees.

neighborhood_overview: Sand Hill School Road is easy access to the Buncombe County Sports Park, with a great playground, track and walking trails.  It is a 7 minute drive into downtown Asheville via I-40, or a 7 minute drive into West Asheville via fun little back roads.  We can tell you many different ways to access Pisgah National Forest and the Blue Ridge Parkway, and the closest access is only 10 minutes from our house.  Let us know if you need to borrow some good trail maps or want directions to beautiful hiking, waterfalls or vistas! We do live on a very busy road and our driveway is in a little bit of a blind curve.  We highly recommend turning your car to face out and not backing out onto this busy road. (There is a large turnaround grassy spot next to our driveway.)
notes: Please keep the backyard gate closed over the driveway and let us know if your dog(s) are "other dog" friendly so that our 10 year old White Shepard can come play!  If not, thats not a worry, we also have a fenced front yard for Shadow. Our house is surrounded by neighbors on all sides, and some have excitable dogs.  If you are bringing your own dog to visit, just expect the neighbor dogs to greet them often from the other side of the fence!
transit: Driving is most common.  Scott can offer helpful bike route info if desired.
street: Sand Hill School Road, Asheville, NC 28806, United States

name: EcoBunkie in the Mountains - Green
summary: Our Bunkies are tiny, tidy non-electrified camping cabins. Located on 90+acres of pristine forest adjoining with the Pisgah Ntnl Forest and Blue Ridge Pkwy. Beauty Abounds! Reconnect with the natural world and create a sacred space of contemplation.
space: EcoBunkies are off-the-grid offering you a chance to truly disconnect, be prepared to exist without electricity and lights once the sun goes down. The space provides a cozy shelter in a beautiful natural setting. The opportunity to immerse yourself in nature is just outside the door and you will be lulled to sleep by the quiet sounds of the forest. The entry level includes multi-function sitting/sleeping/table furniture. A ladder leads upstairs to the sleeping loft with two comfy twin mattresses that can be pushed together to make a king size mattress. Bedding, linens, and towels are provided at no extra charge!

Guests have access to the lower level of our Amenities cabin, which is a short stroll from the EcoBunkies. It has electricity, ful
neighborhood_overview: Our EcoCabins and EcoBunkies are on a magnificent mountainside that can be the setting for your entire stay. Staying on the land and immersing yourself in nature is a powerful and memorable experience that will leave you feeling refreshed and rejuvenated. Our property adjoins the Pisgah National Forest and is close to Rte 151 which leads you up to the Blue Ridge Parkway. It is helpful to have a good map and trail guide for the area which are readily available online or at many local bookstores.
notes: Sacred Mountain Sanctuary is a 501-(c)3 non-profit organization. All proceeds from your stay at SMS help fund the operation and creation of an educational environment that serves and supports children, adults and the well-being of our planet.  SMS does not permit the use of alcohol or recreational drugs. This is very important! Guests found disrespecting these guidelines will be asked to leave immediately, forfeit their deposit and not be permitted to return to SMS for future visits.
transit: 15 minutes to 1-40 and 25 minutes travel by car to Downtown Asheville. 5 minutes to Rte 151, taking a left out onto this road will and following all the way to end will let you out on the Blue Ridge Parkway just a few miles from Mt. Pisgah and The Pisgah Inn. This road is steep and curvy with switchbacks. You will rise approx. 2,000 feet in elevation within the span of 7-10 miles. Once you reach the top you will have epic views of the surrounding areas and access to the well marked trails of the Pisgah National Forest.
host_about:
Sacred Mountain Sanctuary is comprised of a small community, educational environment, retreat/hermitage center, and biodynamic farm. Our mission is to provide an environment and immersive experiences that will awaken one's being to the sacred nature of existence. 

Anne is our rentals coordinator handling all of our bookings. She will be promptly answering all of your inquiries and questions! We look forward to meeting you and hosting your stay!

host_about:
We are privately located near West Asheville, just off the I40 with easy access to downtown Asheville via Patton Ave. Taking Rt151 you travel through the beautiful rolling hills of the Hominy Valley, its surrounding organic farms, flower gardens and streams, with the Pisgah and Blue Ridge Mountains as a back drop. Just 5 miles from our door is mountain access to the Pisgah Forest and the Blue Ridge Parkways scenic valley over looks, hiking trails and waterfalls. This quiet forest location with its charming guest cabin homes, is also a service provider for the Art Studio World charity and provides a home base for the 'C.H.A.I.' LIFE ARTS CENTER (CHAILA) which offers CREATIVE-HOLISTIC ART INTEGRATION based Workshops, Programs, Retreats, Trainings, Rentals, Guest Visits and more. 

This incredible "Land Project" is dedicated to empowering and inspiring wellness and creativity for all. 

Our CHAILA local team includes Rachel from Art Studio World and David Rosenthal of Planet Kitchen and the famous "PFM Fire Tonic" products known as the Fixer Elixer! 

We are a team aligned in creating our best lives in body - mind - soul, with aligned purpose for serving the next generations of youth with creative thinking tools that empower and inspire. 

When you are a guest in our cabin homes you are provided with clean, comfortable accommodations in a caring heart centered energetically beneficial environment. You are surrounded by nature, the high mountains and a fantastic view of Mount Pisgah. Your payment is considered a donation to the charity and supports  the continuation of youth empowerment programs. Love + Gratitude = Peace

Locations: 
- Asheville Airport 22 miles
- Asheville Downtown 15 miles
- West Asheville 10 miles
- Sliding Rock Water Falls 32 miles South
- P.A.R.I - Pisgah Astronomical Research Institute
37 miles South > 1 Pari Dr, Rosman, NC 28772

name: Stone Cottage Garden Homestay ONE
summary: Come stay with us in our beautiful stone home, just 15 min from downtown Asheville. It is in a country neighborhood and you can see the stars at night! Enjoy the gardens, chickens, dog, and cats. We'd love to have you! Kathleen & John
space: Gardens surround our charming homestead with rare trees & shrubs, flowers, and fresh vegetables. The living room wood-burning stove creates a cozy place (in season) to read, talk, or watch a movie. There is off-street parking and a friendly, helpful host and hostess. We have made quite a few improvements  here lately and the homestead is now even prettier and more comfortable! It may just remind you of your grandmother's house. Many people think that the best things here are the two outdoor covered porches where you can sit and eat, chat, or enjoy a drink.  Outside in the gardens you'll find a hammock, a covered swing, benches, and tables & chairs with umbrellas for your enjoyment.  Your comfortable, sunny room is on the first floor and is easily accessible with only one small step onto the front porch. It has a queen bed and lovely antiques. The room comes with fresh-air dried sheets, kitchen/house/garden privileges, fast wifi, a friendly dog, and sweet cats to visit with (if you like

Your comfortable, sunny room is on the first floor and is easily accessib
neighborhood_overview: This is a country neighborhood. Each house has about half an acre or more. We are on a very quiet street on one side and a country cut-through road on the other. Very easy to find!
notes: Please contact us if you have any questions or special concerns. We will try to accommodate as much as possible!
transit: There is no public transportation out here. You'll really need a car to come and go. But there's always taxi service.
host_about:
I am a professional landscape designer. I have an office in my home so I'm here a LOT. I am also crazy about gardening. 

I am gradually converting pretty much all of my lawn to gardens. I grow rare and wonderful trees and shrubs, many kinds of annual and perennial flowering plants, and all kinds of veggies. I am currently planting fruit trees, brambles, strawberries, etc. Not much lawn left!

I love to rent rooms to interesting people! I have had so much fun meeting the folks who come here through Airbnb! They have come from many countries, states, and walks of life. I love it! I am hoping to get some Turkish visitors so that I can practice my Turkish on them. I have traveled in many countries, myself and love to swap stories!

I love good food. I grow much of my own. I am interested in all things homesteading. I have been been at this since the 1970's when I built and lived in my own underground house in Michigan. I love to share ideas on this subject.

I love to DANCE! Especially to the blues. You can find me out making something up on the dance floor at the great clubs in "Ashevegas". Looking silly, maybe, but having fun!

And lastly, I am thoroughly in love with this wonderful old stone house. I spend lots of time working to restore my home and make it more and more livable. Several ago I got a new roof and now I'm working on the windows and getting ready to paint the exterior trim. I feel (EMAIL HIDDEN)e see! I'd love to have you!

name: Sweet Mountain Home near Asheville
summary: A peaceful bedroom and private bathroom in a spacious home with wonderful mountain views. The room is on the first floor with a private entrance. Also accessible is a washer/dryer, fire pit, organic coffee and tea, and lovely field to walk in.
space: This quiet space has two french doors that lead out to a patio overlooking the mountains. The private bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom and there is a den space downstairs to sit and work, play or relax in.
description: A peaceful bedroom and private bathroom in a spacious home with wonderful mountain views. The room is on the first floor with a private entrance. Also accessible is a washer/dryer, fire pit, organic coffee and tea, and lovely field to walk in. This quiet space has two french doors that lead out to a patio overlooking the mountains. The private bathroom is adjacent to the bedroom and there is a den space downstairs to sit and work, play or relax in. You will have access to the complete 1200 sf downstairs and the gardens just outside the door. We are delighted to share insights on great places to eat, hike, swim, and hear great live music in the Asheville area. We are developing a permaculture homestead here with organic gardens and bees. If you are interested we enjoy sharing our knowledge of gardening, the Appalachian bioregion, herbs for your health, and nature based education. The house is in the Beaverdam valley in Candler near Asheville.  We are in a rural area where some families
neighborhood_overview: The house is in the Beaverdam valley in Candler near Asheville.  We are in a rural area where some families have lived for multiple generations.
notes: We are 22 minutes outside of Asheville on 1.5 acres.  Because our home is surrounded by other large parcels and national forest it instantly calms the nerves and relaxes you with the sounds of nature.
transit: We are 22 minutes from downtown Asheville and 20 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway. You will need a car to get here as public transportation doesn't come here.
host_about: We bought this house near Asheville in December 2014. Since arriving we have upgraded the house, planted several fruit trees, and created a organic veggie garden. Lena teaches at the nearby Waldorf school and Sam is the Director for the WNC Green Building Council. Lena grew up in KY, attended UNCA, and has traveled extensively in HI, Mexico and the US.  Sam grew up in NC and SC, went to the College of Charleston and lived in the Bay area of CA for many years. We got married in the field below our house in May 2015 and are excited to welcome travelers to this spacious and beautiful mountain home.

name: Incredible Mt Pisgah View Retreat
summary: Majestic view of Mt Pisgah in the Blue Ridge Mts. 20 mins to Asheville and Bent Creek Forest. Close mountain biking, hiking and rafting. Private room w full bath and sleeping porch. Queen and futon. Meditation pyramid to enhance a sacred experience.
space: Spiritual place in spiritual setting.  Owner is 4 Agreements Facilitator and renowned spiritual teacher and coach.  Very high vibration in this space. The floor to ceiling windows overlook Hominy Valley and the Mount Pisgah Ridge of The Blue Ridge Mountains.
description: Majestic view of Mt Pisgah in the Blue Ridge Mts. 20 mins to Asheville and Bent Creek Forest. Close mountain biking, hiking and rafting. Private room w full bath and sleeping porch. Queen and futon. Meditation pyramid to enhance a sacred experience. Spiritual place in spiritual setting.  Owner is 4 Agreements Facilitator and renowned spiritual teacher and coach.  Very high vibration in this space. The floor to ceiling windows overlook Hominy Valley and the Mount Pisgah Ridge of The Blue Ridge Mountains. After booking let's  speak on the phone for private road information. GPS does not usually take you on Great Horned Owl Road all the way to my house. The road to the airbnb is only 1/4 mile long after your turn of Warren Creek Road to Great Horned Owl Rd. Will be available to give information and supply breakfast.  Gluten Free available.  Owner lives on other side of the home in separate wing. Blue Ridge Mountains and historic Asheville close by with diverse indoor and outdoor activitie
neighborhood_overview: Blue Ridge Mountains and historic Asheville close by with diverse indoor and outdoor activities available. This house is on a gravel road, which is steep in one area. It is in Pisgah National Forest only 23 minutes from the city of Asheville, and fifteen minutes from trendy West Asheville,  fifteen minutes from the new Outlet Mall,  The Arboretum and The Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: Owner has 2 cats.  Fall begins in the  high mountains from mid Sept. and ends in the lower areas like the city of Asheville mid November. Potential Guests have been inquiring about peak Fall dates. See   (URL HIDDEN)  for the most updated information.
transit: This is countryside and guest will need their own car. There is parking at the entrance to the road which is 1/4 mile to my home.  If your car is low to the ground,  and does not have 4 wheel or all wheel drive, I can ferry you to and from my home if I know your time of arrival.
host_about: I am presently a retired teacher of English and School Guidance Counselor, and presently a Spiritual Life Coach. I have lived in NYC and at the beach, and presently happier than I have ever been in my Blue Ridge Mountain home among the trees with a glorious view of Mount Pisgah and Hominy Valley, only 20 minutes from the center of Asheville, NC. I enjoy sharing the unique amenities of my home-- the screened in sleeping porch adjacent to the guest bedroom, the meditation pyramid that seats four people, the organic and gluten free food I serve for breakfast, and the natural world that surrounds my mountain home. People who live in this area say I have a million dollar view, and I agree both during the day, no matter what the weather,  and the night sky is amazing as well. My motto is..."it's not good news till you share it." Being here is the best news ever!

name: Organic Farm's Creekside Treehouse
summary: Cozy, rustic Treehouse for two about 20 ft from babbling brook. Furnished with full bed. Farm's kitchen, laundry, and bathrooms are about 250 paces up hill. Our organic farm focuses on outstanding produce for fine dining restaurants and retail sales.
space: Rustic treehouse is wrapped in Tyvek to minimize drafts. The 'tree' has a full bed with linens furnished and a small side table. Very minimal lighting furnished by car battery. Candlelight adds to the memorable experience.  Bathrooms are up hill and shared with other guests and residents. There is a fire ring by the tree and a charcoal grill available. Bathrooms/Showers and kitchen approximately 135 yards from the treehouse. Kitchen has stove, fridge, nuker, toaster, espresso-like coffee maker; pots, pans, dishes, and flatware. The bed has lots of covers: 2 comforters and a sleeping bag, plus another comforter and a blanket on the side. By staying here, rest assured you are in fact helping a small farm survive year to year and we are grateful to all of you.
description: Cozy, rustic Treehouse for two about 20 ft from babbling brook. Furnished with full bed. Farm's kitchen, laundry, and bathrooms are about 250 paces up hill. Our organic farm focuses on outstanding produce for fine dining restaurants and retail sales. Rustic treehouse is wrapped in Tyvek to minimize drafts. The 'tree' has a full bed with linens furnished and a small side table. Very minimal lighting furnished by car battery. Candlelight adds to the memorable experience.  Bathrooms are up hill and shared with other guests and residents. There is a fire ring by the tree and a charcoal grill available. Bathrooms/Showers and kitchen approximately 135 yards from the treehouse. Kitchen has stove, fridge, nuker, toaster, espresso-like coffee maker; pots, pans, dishes, and flatware. The bed has lots of covers: 2 comforters and a sleeping bag, plus another comforter and a blanket on the side. By staying here, rest assured you are in fact helping a small farm survive year to year and we are grate
neighborhood_overview: Private secluded 11 acre farm in Hominy Valley, a small valley named after the corn crops that were grown by the indigenous population until the late 1600's. The farm is bordered by Beaverdam creek w/native trout.  Splendid views. Serenity is our biggest asset.  We have nearly 18 years experience in local food and farmer's markets and we are proud that many our best local restaurants purchase their produce from us.  While we are secluded and in a country setting, we are close to Asheville... Approximately 15 minutes to downtown Asheville;  5 minutes to grocery stores and other necessities;  10-15 minutes to Interstates 40 and 26;  and 20 minutes to the airport.
notes: Please treat your space and any areas you use with the respect you would as a guest at your distant aunt who might leave you money if she likes you. And, please wipe your feet before entering the treehouse. Dirt is soil, the blessed medium that allows food to grow. Unfortunately, it comes in buildings despite best efforts, please realize there will be soil everywhere inside and out.
transit: You will need a car.
host_about: disabled, somewhat retired, over the hill babyboomer hippy type. Love caribbean life. Lived on Maui 10 years. Fourth generation Texan. Horse packer in the Rockies, Grower in the Smokies. Five years in Alaska.
street: Peony Lane, Candler, NC 28715, United States

name: private Tiny House in the mountains
summary: Handcrafted green built tiny house on wheels nested in the woods of 50 beautiful acres, with access to pond and hiking trails.  Private & secluded, yet only 20min to hip West Asheville, or 25min to downtown. Propane fireplace, organics sheets, wi-fi.
space: Yes, it's a whole house under 100q ft! An amazing little house with unique touches throughout that make it a true one of a kind you'll just have to see for yourself ... with propane fireplace, full bath, sleeping loft, couch/bed, full kitchen, gas stove, closet, and foldable desk.  Lots of attention to detail in his green built house, with handmade cutting board countertops, custom stainless shower walls, a whole house water filter system, organic beds, linens, and beautiful reclaimed wood throughout.  Sleeping accommodations (please read): You'll need to climb ladder to access the sleeping loft.  It's cozy with a tiny window looking out into the woods, but it is very tiny, beware... just enough space relax and sleep. It fits 2 people nicely if you're comfortable sharing such a small space.  There's also a single bed in the living room, which is set up to be used as a couch during the day.  No ladder climbing needed! You do need to be under 5'6" tall to fit in that bed though... so whe

neighborhood_overview: A wonderful peaceful place to stay away from all the busyness of town, mixed residential and farm land.... easily accessible from I-40 or Patton Ave/Smokey Park Hwy.
notes: I've found people amazed at how much more spacious the house is than they think 98q feet will be.  Curious to hear about your experience and get your feedback.  I always love to hear what I can do to improve the space for guests, so don't be shy, let me know what would have improved your stay so I can make it better for the next person. Thanks! And please post pictures of your stay and the things you love on my tiny house (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) page: (URL HIDDEN)
transit: Public transit not available out by the house. I would recommend  Uber or Taxi if you don't have a car during your stay. Once in downtown or West Asheville it's easy to get around on foot, by bike, or take a bus for longer trips.
host_about: I grew up In Atlanta GA and have traveled and lived all over since I was a child.   I strive to live the change I want to see in the world, and am so grateful and thankful everyday for all the opportunities around me to laugh, learn, live, and explore! I'm a fun, warm, wonderful person, and am excited to be able to open up my home to others. Please make yourself at home, and let me know if I can help make your stay more enjoyable :)!

name: King Size Bed in a private bedroom
summary: 20 Minutes from Downtown Asheville, yet with the serenity of the country and only a short distance from the Blue Ridge Parkway. A Tranquil retreat setting. Other rental Property on site https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/5316343
space: This space is a small retreat center dedicated to wellness. There may be classes or workshops happening on the land. Some will be open to guests including yoga classes , private yoga and massage! If interested we will need notice to book private sessions and bodywork!
description: 20 Minutes from Downtown Asheville, yet with the serenity of the country and only a short distance from the Blue Ridge Parkway. A Tranquil retreat setting. Other rental Property on site https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/5316343 This space is a small retreat center dedicated to wellness. There may be classes or workshops happening on the land. Some will be open to guests including yoga classes , private yoga and massage! If interested we will need notice to book private sessions and bodywork! This room is in a shared house with one permanent resident . Kitchen, bathrooms and living area you will have access to. The futon and the loft bed in the living area may be also rented with quiet hour so all guest can enjoy their stay and use of the living area and kitchen. There is internet and free parking. There will be people on the land most of the time, and some times it will be quite quiet. There is activity often yet we do not provide social events for guests unless there is an event on the lan
neighborhood_overview: Amazing views, happy cow neighbors, retreat setting surrounded by the Blue Ridge Mountains.  20 Minutes from Asheville and 7 miles from the Blue Ridge Parkway.
notes: We are in the country! there will be moths, lizards, frogs, rabbits and black snakes, they are all welcome here and keep the eco system healthy. The black snakes keep the dangerous copper heads away!  If you are easily freaked out by a spider or a lady bug, this is not the place for you! If you love nature, cricket sounds, trees and all the intrigue of the country, please come and explore the beauty here.
transit: car needed
host_about:
We are privately located near West Asheville, just off the I40 with easy access to downtown Asheville via Patton Ave. Taking Rt151 you travel through the beautiful rolling hills of the Hominy Valley, its surrounding organic farms, flower gardens and streams, with the Pisgah and Blue Ridge Mountains as a back drop. Just 5 miles from our door is mountain access to the Pisgah Forest and the Blue Ridge Parkways scenic valley over looks, hiking trails and waterfalls. This quiet forest location with its charming guest cabin homes, is also a service provider for the Art Studio World charity and provides a home base for the 'C.H.A.I.' LIFE ARTS CENTER (CHAILA) which offers CREATIVE-HOLISTIC ART INTEGRATION based Workshops, Programs, Retreats, Trainings, Rentals, Guest Visits and more. 

This incredible "Land Project" is dedicated to empowering and inspiring wellness and creativity for all. 

Our CHAILA local team includes Rachel from Art Studio World and David Rosenthal of Planet Kitchen and the famous "PFM Fire Tonic" products known as the Fixer Elixer! 

We are a team aligned in creating our best lives in body - mind - soul, with aligned purpose for serving the next generations of youth with creative thinking tools that empower and inspire. 

When you are a guest in our cabin homes you are provided with clean, comfortable accommodations in a caring heart centered energetically beneficial environment. You are surrounded by nature, the high mountains and a fantastic view of Mount Pisgah. Your payment is considered a donation to the charity and supports  the continuation of youth empowerment programs. Love + Gratitude = Peace

Locations: 
- Asheville Airport 22 miles
- Asheville Downtown 15 miles
- West Asheville 10 miles
- Sliding Rock Water Falls 32 miles South
- P.A.R.I - Pisgah Astronomical Research Institute
37 miles South > 1 Pari Dr, Rosman, NC 28772

name: Clean, Comfortable, & Convenient
summary: New Listing w/in a 15 min drive of all major Asheville area attractions while enjoying your own easily accessible first floor apartment in a 21st century home with a private setting in this charming wooded neighborhood and designated bird sanctuary.
space: Welcome Home!  Come and stay in our gorgeous, single-level, private  apartment in our home.   You'll enjoy the comfort of two living rooms, fully equipped kitchen, and two bedrooms.  This is a new listing.  We strive to keep the apartment as clean and comfortable as possible.  The flooring throughout is hardwood/tile for a dust-free environment.  Bedding is covered with 100% cotton duvet covers that are washed after each guests' stay.  I am a freak about changing HVAC air filters far more often than necessary.
description: New Listing w/in a 15 min drive of all major Asheville area attractions while enjoying your own easily accessible first floor apartment in a 21st century home with a private setting in this charming wooded neighborhood and designated bird sanctuary. Welcome Home!  Come and stay in our gorgeous, single-level, private  apartment in our home.   You'll enjoy the comfort of two living rooms, fully equipped kitchen, and two bedrooms.  This is a new listing.  We strive to keep the apartment as clean and comfortable as possible.  The flooring throughout is hardwood/tile for a dust-free environment.  Bedding is covered with 100% cotton duvet covers that are washed after each guests' stay.  I am a freak about changing HVAC air filters far more often than necessary. You will have your own private apartment, private entrance, private deck with a grill, and fully equipped kitchen.  Access is by keypad with 24 hour check-in. Owners live on premises and are available as much, or as little, as guests
neighborhood_overview: The home is nestled on 3 private acres within a residential neighborhood.  It is surrounded by trees and you can enjoy watching the constant activity at the bird feeder outside the living room window, or from the deck.  West Asheville restaurants are a short drive away, and there are three grocery stores nearby including a brand-new Super Ingles with Starbucks Coffee, Deli, & Cafe.  The Asheville Outlets are 4.5 miles away.  The Biltmore Estate, Blue Ridge Parkway, Bent Creek Recreation Area, and Downtown Asheville, are all less than 15 minutes away.
transit: There is no public transportation.  Uber is available in the area.
host_about: We have lived in Western NC for over 22 years.  We love it here!  Outdoor activities  such as hiking and trail running rank among our favorites.  We have always enjoyed hosting family and friends in our large home.  When our 3 kids entered their twenties, we remodeled to make better use of the space.  We love to travel and have enjoyed staying at several Airbnb properties.  Peter is a self-employed caterer and property manager.  Jackie is an RN.

name: Pisgah Creek side apartment
summary: Apartment above a detached garage with private stairs and deck. 2 bedrooms, 1 1/2 bath.  Living room with 50" flat screen, Cable WiFi and a stereo. Full kitchen and w gas BBQ on deck. Large fenced inarea for your dog. Hot tub, firebowl and a "cabana' for your enjoyment.
space: You will love relaxing on the deck, listening to the peaceful sounds of the creek. Inside the cool quiet retreat you will find a fully equipped kitchen, comfortable sleeping and living areas including TV/Cable and free high-speed wireless Internet access. There is a sound system were you can connect your smart phone and play your music. Should you need to do a load of wash let us know and we will show you the machines in the garage. The full bath  ( inside the apartment) has a whirlpool tub for a soak after a long hike or bike ride! Lots of fluffy towels in the closet and a spa robe to relax in. The queen size bedroom and living room face the creek side of the house- you will hear the creek run by if the window is open. On the deck bellow your private deck is the hot tub were you are welcome to take a soak after a hectic day of fun! Hot tub towels are in the closet. Spend the lazy summer nights on the deck on the double chase watching the fireflies sparkle and dance against the tree li

neighborhood_overview: While the area is very rural, we do have neighbors on either side of the apartment, yet it still maintains a very peaceful and secluded feel. Our neighbors are great people; kind, friendly, and will respect your privacy just as we hope you will respect theirs. PLEASE DRIVE SLOWELY, ONCE ON THE PROPERTY!
notes: A cleaning fee of $30 and 7.75% tax rate, based on the nightly costs, will be included in your booking and due upon arrival. Please deposit your garbage and re cykle by the garage door.
transit: Pisgah Creek side Apartment is just a few miles from the main highway and Interstates I-40 and I-26. It takes a ~25 minutes to reach West Asheville,Downtown and the Biltmore Eastate. 15 Minutes to world class hiking at the top of Mt Pisgah and no time to hop on your mountain bike and head out on amazing rides or a run!
host_about:
A world traveler who has seen a lot but want to see more. 
While at home, lives in one of the most amazing places on earth!

name: 13 MIN to Downtown - Out on a Limb
summary: Out on a Limb makes relaxing easy with its eclectic vibe, comfortable spaces, spacious outdoor living & exceptional mountain views! Just a short drive from local amenities, area attractions, interstate connections & downtown Asheville!
space: Out on a Limbs "Master Suite" is an over-sized private space with comfortable areas for reading, relaxing or simply soaking up the long range views! This space has its own private adjoining bath equipped with a large garden tub, separate shower and plenty of storage options for your stay. Linens, towels and hand soap are all provided. The bed is queen-sized and sleeps (2) with no additional charge for the second guest. The "Master Suite'' offers good overhead lighting, reading lamps, (2) comfortable seating options and a large walk in closet with additional storage.   Please look for additional rooms offered at Out on a Limb which include a shared bath.
description: Out on a Limb makes relaxing easy with its eclectic vibe, comfortable spaces, spacious outdoor living & exceptional mountain views! Just a short drive from local amenities, area attractions, interstate connections & downtown Asheville!  Out on a Limbs "Master Suite" is an over-sized private space with comfortable areas for reading, relaxing or simply soaking up the long range views! This space has its own private adjoining bath equipped with a large garden tub, separate shower and plenty of storage options for your stay. Linens, towels and hand soap are all provided. The bed is queen-sized and sleeps (2) with no additional charge for the second guest. The "Master Suite'' offers good overhead lighting, reading lamps, (2) comfortable seating options and a large walk in closet with additional storage.   Please look for additional rooms offered at Out on a Limb which include a shared bath.  Guests have full access to the "Master Suite" and all main level common areas of the home to include
neighborhood_overview: Out on a Limb is just off the beaten path yet surrounded in nature, close to area attractions and just minutes from downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway, NC Arboretum and Biltmore Estate. Guests can expect a low-key relaxing visit in a beautifully wooded, private location with exceptional mountain views of the Pisgah National Forest.
notes: A 7.75% tax rate, based on the nightly costs, will be included in your booking and due upon arrival.  Wireless Internet service is available.   The home is on a well with super clean & tasty water!
transit: Out on a Limb offers easy access to local amenities and is less than 2.5 miles from the main highway, grocery shopping, banking, restaurants and cafes'. Interstate connections are within 4.5 miles from Out on a Limb with access to I-40, 240 and I-26. Driving distance into West Asheville, downtown Asheville, the Blue Ridge Parkway, Biltmore Estate and The NC Arboretum are all within 15 minutes or less from the property. The property offers plenty of parking options for guests with easy turn around.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Karen, (the gal on the left) an on-the-go Asheville native with a high energy level, love for decorating, quest for innovation and inherent need for thinking outside of the box. For the past 7 years, I have owned and managed two very successful short term vacation rentals where guests occupied the entire space, yet the home remained void of me as a host. Most recently, I have changed directions, opening rooms in my home to travelers like yourself to offer comfortable, well-thought out spaces with a fun, eclectic vibe and all the comforts of home.

I am a high "D" personality type, a doer, a get-it-done type of girl. My "I" falls close second, and in good company, I have a lot to say and will use large gestures to make my point. I can't live without change, chocolate, earl grey tea, music and inspiring words. I prefer to surround myself with positive, driven people or those constantly moving forward to create their best life possible! 

I am a low-key host with a limited presence and one that allows you the freedom of use for the common areas and of course, your own personal space. It is my goal to ensure that you are comfortable, making my home your own. I am confident that you will find Out on a Limb to exceed your expectations, where unlike most rentals, my experience in the business translates for you as an above average accommodation. 

Thank you for taking the time to read on and learn more about Out on a Limb. I appreciate the opportunity to be your host during your time in Asheville and look forward to our connection!

name: Cabin Min's to Downtn Ashv, Pets OK
summary: Our log cabin is the perfect getaway. Tucked into the mountains on the west side of Asheville, only 11 miles from downtown. On two private wooded acres, a beautiful natural setting at the end of a quiet rural street of homes. 3 queen beds, game room.
space: Enter at the first floor deck to a great room with vaulted ceiling, wood burning stove, dining area and kitchen. A bedroom is on this main floor, and 1 bath. Queen size bed. Loft Floor is above the great room. Large roomy open loft, with another queen size bed.  Downstairs find another bedroom with a cozy queen size bed looking out on the woods. Also a game room with a foosball table, a washer and dryer, and a full bath room.  There is a front deck and a back deck, both covered. The back deck has a grill. • Located on 2 wooded acres. • Vaulted ceiling. • 2 decks • The cabin has TV but no cable. There's wi-fi and an Amazon Fire box for streaming and games. There's a lot of media on the TV, and you can log in with your laptop too.  • The cabin doesn't have a telephone but cell carriers such as Verizon work fine. • Close to Bent Creek, Pisgah National Forest, downtown Asheville, the Biltmore House and so much more. A short drive from downtown Asheville and West Asheville, our log cabin is

neighborhood_overview: The cabin is private but at the end of a rural small neighborhood cup-de-sac with homes, so you aren't isolated from civilization and it's less than 10 minutes to the grocery store.
notes: There is wi-fi, a nice TV but no cable.  There's an Amazon Fire box for streaming and games. So there's a lot of media on the TV, and you can log in with your laptop too.  There isn't a land line phone, you should be able to get cell service (we have verizon and get service there)
transit: You'll need a car to get around, we're 15 minutes to downtown or the Biltmore.
host_about:
Graphic designer, married to Tom. 
We have 2 cats, one is 21 and one is about a year. 
We enjoy mountain biking, road biking, climbing, hiking, and food and wine. And coffee and chocolate. 
And LOVE our home in Asheville, a great place to live or visit!

name: A house away from home!
summary: We are inviting budget-minded vacationers to stay at our 2 BD/1.5 BA townhouse-style apt. in Arden, NC, just 11 miles from downtown Asheville.  Located four miles from the airport, we're convenient to a variety of popular shopping and dining choices!
space: Our space is a very basic yet comfortable choice for visitors to this area, able to accommodate up to four people.  Need an affordable alternative for a small family on vacation, or want a cozier option for a business trip?  Our two-story townhouse-style apt. has parking spaces for up to two vehicles.  In addition to the towels and linens, the kitchen is equipped to handle your cooking and cleaning needs.  While we don't have a washer/dryer yet, a laundromat is located ¼ mile away.  Please, no smoking anywhere on the property, and we unfortunately cannot accommodate pets.  We hope you enjoy your stay here in Asheville, and if you have any questions, please feel free to just ask us!

name: Beautiful  Apt near Asheville
summary: Quiet apt! 10 min from Biltmore House. Restaurants, bars and shops all around. I'm an artist so the apt is full of paintings, drawings and sculptures. It's a beautiful place that we care for with love. We're friendly and welcoming. Rita & Daniel

neighborhood_overview: BILTMORE VILLAGE AND BILTMORE HOUSE ESTATE: If you turn left at the stop light you go to the end of Overlook road and turn left at the Hendersonville road. You'll get to Biltmore Village at you right, with several restaurants (CORNER KITCHEN is a famous and very old one, Obama and his wife dined there when they were here, but you can have lunch also). The Bohemian hotel has a first class meat restaurant, with a dazzling bar, but you also have the Ruth Chris and other choices to eat a good steak. It's next door to the Biltmore Estate. It's worth it, it's breathtaking. RESTAURANTS DOWNTOWN: MELA is an Indian restaurant with a delicious buffet at lunch and dinner a la carte, the CHAMPAGNE BAR is a sophisticated choice to have a glass of champagne, or coffee with desert, at BOUCHON you have delicious French cuisine, and CÙRATE is a marvelous Tapas bar. POSANA has the best brunch on Sundays and CHORIZO is fun and has some wild choices and CÚRATE is a fantastic Tapas Bar, the chef having som

host_about:
We're a friendly, easy going couple. We love art, reading, traveling, cooking, storytelling, playing games, cards and meeting people. 
I paint with bright colors since we lived in Mexico for 4 years, many years ago. 
My husband got Arthur Herman's book "The Cave and the Light" and he laughs out loud reading in bed.
We love British BBC programs and movies, documentaries like "Happy", to read History and books about innovations for the mind and alternative medicine. Daniel worked in Brazil, Mexico, France, Puerto Rico and the US. 
Our home is clean, confortable and we like to think it's beautiful. Friends are always welcome. 
We respect your privacy and leave you alone when you need some quiet time. We also love to chat when you feel like it.
