transit: Airport, bus, uber. taxis all available.
host_about:
I am a single 50 y/o female homeowner.  I work for the American Red Cross.  I have an 8 lb Shih-poo, another 8 lb terrier mix and an indoor/outdoor cat.   All are very friendly, including with children.

 My home is 10 yrs old, on a cul-de-sac with ample parking.  Sweet, quiet, safe neighborhood.  It has a split bedroom/open floor plan so you will have your own space on the opposite side of the house from my bedroom suite.  Tons of windows, so very light filled.

I enjoy hiking, camping, motorcycling, reading, playing games, dining and local music, especially bluegrass.  I also enjoy a huge range of professional bands and musicians from all eras. I really love books based in the south and have a large eclectic book collection.

As far as shows, I prefer to like TV to be entertaining, as well as informative.  Love property/real estate shows, insight into different people and their crazy lives, and true crime shows.  I was in genetics for 20 yrs, so I cannot deny the scientist in me.

I love to travel, mainly to tropical destinations, but am anxious to travel out west where my daughter is living.  I prefer to travel to areas farther from my home.  I would love to travel more!

I prefer non-chain locally owned restaurants, with everything from French cuisine to sushi.  Our loval restaurants here are amazing.  Lots of good dining for certain.

I am pretty easy going and open in my house.  I enjoy guests, but will respect your privacy.  Please let me know your favorite coffee, juice and drinks.  Cream and sugar choices, etc.  I want your immediate needs to be met.  I will have maps of surrounding areas as well as points of interests.  I will also have information on local goings on and events.  My house is located extremely convenient to all of the major thoroughfares, so it's quick and easy to get to your desired locations.

I want your visit to be as comfortable and pleasurable as possible, after all, it is your vacation time.  I am southern and we southerners love to be as friendly, accommodating and hospitable as possible.

Finally, my motto is to believe in now.  Live life with as little worries or regrets as possible. Right "Now" is all we are promised here on this beautiful planet, so I try to stay in it as much as possible.  Enjoy it.  Live to laugh as much as possible.

I look forward to meeting you!!!

summary: Downstairs king with private bath, or upstairs king and double with downstairs bath. Parking in driveway or by mailbox gazebo. Quiet neighborhood, dead end street. Great location near Asheville Airport. Between downtown Asheville and Hendersonville.
space: Home on a dead end street, between downtown Asheville and Hendersonville. 5 minutes to the Asheville airport. Near freeways, shopping, dining (12 Bones BBQ a few blocks away). 15 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate, 10 minutes to the Blue Ridge Parkway. Peaceful and quiet. Master bedroom with a California King Bed, springfree Latex mattress, blackout curtains. Master bath has garden tub, double sinks, toilet. Second bedroom for rent is upstairs, great for families. King bed and bunkbed, have to use the bathroom downstairs. Full use of kitchen, living room, dining room, breakfast table and outdoor table with chairs. We have a 17 pound Westie (West Highland Terrier), and will consider small friendly dogs. Hosts are world travellers with lots of suggestions of what to do in the Asheville area. Come stay with us!

name: South Asheville Peaceful Get-A-Way
summary: Sweet townhome in quiet South Asheville community. Less than 10 minutes to Asheville airport. Near freeways, Biltmore Town Square, Asheville Outlets, lots of shopping and fine dining . 15 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate.
space: Great space for 2 or 3 adults. There is a very comfortable queen bed in the guest bedroom, and a comfortable full-sized sofa bed in the seating area just outside of the bedroom.
description: Sweet townhome in quiet South Asheville community. Less than 10 minutes to Asheville airport. Near freeways, Biltmore Town Square, Asheville Outlets, lots of shopping and fine dining . 15 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate. Great space for 2 or 3 adults. There is a very comfortable queen bed in the guest bedroom, and a comfortable full-sized sofa bed in the seating area just outside of the bedroom. This is a two-story townhome with bedrooms downstairs. You will have access to a private bedroom and shared bathroom downstairs, as well as  a cozy sitting/eating area. Our bedroom is also downstairs, but we only sleep down there, so basically, you'll have the downstairs area to yourself. The kitchen on main level is off limits to guests, however, there is a small refrigerator and microwave downstairs for your bring home leftovers. Someone will be around at all times if you need anything, just let us know. There is parking for 2 cars.
notes: There is parking for 2 cars.

name: Privacy and Comfort near airport
summary: Large master size bedroom with kingsize bed and private bathroom.  We are located off  Sweeten Creek Road (Alt 25), with quick access to downtown Asheville, stores, freeways and airport.  A lovely, quiet neighborhood with beautiful landscaping.
space: Asheville is very difficult to find places to stay, especially ones in desirable areas.  Also, most affordable places are NOT in good areas that are close and safe.
description: Large master size bedroom with kingsize bed and private bathroom.  We are located off  Sweeten Creek Road (Alt 25), with quick access to downtown Asheville, stores, freeways and airport.  A lovely, quiet neighborhood with beautiful landscaping. Asheville is very difficult to find places to stay, especially ones in desirable areas.  Also, most affordable places are NOT in good areas that are close and safe. Guests will be able to use our garage while they are visiting and we will park our car in the basement garage. We live on the premises and enjoy visiting with guests, but we are content to let our guests come and go without fuss or bother.  We give our guest a way to access our house, in case we are out or are in bed.  We like to have our guests feel independent, while they are visiting us. Our neighborhood is a very nice looking area.  The houses are condos and everyone is friendly, without being nosy. Getting around is very easy, as we are in an extremely good location.  We are onl
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a very nice looking area.  The houses are condos and everyone is friendly, without being nosy.
notes: We do not allow pets.  We have two cats that are indoor cats only.  Guests should reconsider coming if either are allergic!  Also, please do not let cats outdoors while they are visiting us!
transit: Getting around is very easy, as we are in an extremely good location.  We are only 1/2 hour from downtown Asheville and minutes from the Biltmore Estate and the Blue Ridge Parkway. Public buses run on Hendersonville Road, which is very close to us.  They run fairly frequently and go to downtown Asheville.
host_about: I am an older woman who is a retired accountant.  I had my own accounting business for 19 years.  I moved to North Carolina from Oregon in March of 2015 with my husband, Jerry, of 52 years, and our two cats.  My hobby/new business is making jewelry.  I also love exploring new skills with Photoshop Elements, but, sadly, don't have much time for it.   My husband and I love to read, love the outdoors, conservation and ecology.

name: Tiny Homestead
summary: Cozy 8X18' little home. Queen loft with ladder, kitchen sink, gas stove, small refrigerator, folding table, composting toilet, hot shower, near airport. We live next door in our 1840's Log Cabin with 2 goats and 2 alpacas. No cleaning fee charged.
space: We occasionally rent long term rates--but only if we're away traveling for a week or more.
description: Cozy 8X18' little home. Queen loft with ladder, kitchen sink, gas stove, small refrigerator, folding table, composting toilet, hot shower, near airport. We live next door in our 1840's Log Cabin with 2 goats and 2 alpacas. No cleaning fee charged. We occasionally rent long term rates--but only if we're away traveling for a week or more. Simply decorated, self-contained, and private. Check in on your own anytime after 3pm. Very safe neighborhood with great neighbors. Some folks prefer to bring their own pillows and/or towels. Six gallon water heater so short but sweet showers. We charge no cleaning fee. We love to interact and get to know guests...perhaps share a meal, wine, music--etc. in our genuine 1840's Log Cabin next door. Urban location, small homestead with great neighbors and easy access to main roads. Off road parking. Great local restaurants nearby. 3 miles from airport and the new east coast Sierra Nevada Brewery. 9 miles south of downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, and the
neighborhood_overview: Urban location, small homestead with great neighbors and easy access to main roads. Off road parking. Great local restaurants nearby. 3 miles from airport and the new east coast Sierra Nevada Brewery.
notes: Crafts and Fine Art for Sale  (on display inside tiny house--made from our homestead materials) --Handmade alpaca felted soap (coconut and olive oil, lye, w/ essential oils, coffee, and/or tea) $3-$5 sliding scale  --Hand knitted scarf w/ handspun alpaca fiber $20-$40 sliding scale  --Unframed matted photos $25-$40 sliding scale  --Framed and matted photos $60-$80 sliding scale For additional info. or questions, contact (EMAIL HIDDEN) or call/text (PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN).
transit: 9 miles south of downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, and the famous Blue Ridge Parkway! City Bus line within one mile.
host_about: Paul 'Rock' Eblen, an Asheville native, earned an MA in Theatre to assist him in creating music for stage and film. Having lived in Los Angeles for several years pursuing a music and film career, he returned to Asheville to produce his own shows. He has been professionally acting, writing, and directing in local and regional theater for more than 30 years. Produces and directs rock musicals such as JC SUPERSTAR, TOMMY, RENT, FOOTLOOSE, SPRING AWAKENING and NEXT TO NORMAL. Annual benefits for his family's local charity include Pizza PanDemonium and Asheville Faerie Arts Festival.

name: Bright, urban chic apt min from Avl
summary: Sophisticated, serene, clean space. Legally zoned & permitted. Newly furnished apt in historic home. Industrial/modern/shabby-chic. Private patio. Fully equipped kitchen. Off street prkg/private entry. Convenient location. 2 night min stay-wknd rates
space: See many more 5 star reviews on our listing at Vee aR Bee Oh . We opened the doors of "Das Peach Pit" to vacation guests for the first time in 2015 but we've been landlords for this former long term rental (and others in Avl) for the past 23 years! We are a legally zoned and permitted short term rental south of downtown Asheville. Named with a nod toward our house's moniker "Das Peach Haus" after my husband's lifelong nickname "Peach", this space is a newly renovated and furnished ground level apartment with plenty of natural light and it feels like a wonderful retreat. Open the doors of this former carriage space on the first level of our home onto a modern living area with brick walls and freshly painted concrete floors softened with natural jute rugs. The exposed copper pipes complete the urban loft feel. The living room provides you with comfortable seating and a 42" HDTV with Local HD network TV, Netflix, HuluPlus and s Bluray DVD for your viewing pleasure. The premium BeautyRest
description: Sophisticated, serene, clean space. Legally zoned & permitted. Newly furnished apt in historic home. Industrial/modern/shabby-chic. Private patio. Fully equipped kitchen. Off street prkg/private entry. Convenient location. 2 night min stay-wknd rates See many more 5 star reviews on our listing at Vee aR Bee Oh . We opened the doors of "Das Peach Pit" to vacation guests for the first time in 2015 but we've been landlords for this former long term rental (and others in Avl) for the past 23 years! We are a legally zoned and permitted short term rental south of downtown Asheville. Open the doors of this former carriage space on the first level of our home onto a modern living area with brick walls and freshly painted concrete floors softened with nat
neighborhood_overview: We live in Oak Park in a cluster of historic houses south of downtown Asheville. Our property is one of six houses that surrounds a one acre park where you will regularly find families practicing baseball and soccer and neighbors running with their dogs amidst the towering oak trees that give the neighborhood its name. Our home was previously owned by a large loving family who ran a greenhouse on the adjacent property which now houses a family owned Hispanic Market. A distinctive feature of our home is the Christmas tree planted by the former family in the front yard over 40 years ago that now towers over the house. We fully remodeled and lovingly restored the interior of our home in 2003, including building the apartment in the former carriage "house" space. We are now working on finishing the exterior (just paint, no noisy tools!). Tim is a general contractor and I am an artist. This space is a beautiful collaboration of both of our strengths.  Great convenience to the Asheville Regi
notes: We are centrally located between Asheville and Hendersonville right off of Hendersonville Rd/US25 and Airport Rd. Easy access to Hwy26, the airport, Sierra Nevada brewery, Blue Ridge Parkway and Outlet Mall, French Broad River, NC Arboretum, hiking and biking trails in Bent Creek and DuPont, Biltmore Estate/Village in 10 min and the south slope of downtown Asheville in 20 min where you will find the heart of the brewery district. We can provide daytime pet sitting and arrange shuttle services to and from the airport/downtown for additional fees.  We can also arrange for a trail guide (both hiking and biking). If you desire to try out the biking trails we can help you arrange bike rental.  Please communicate your desires to us and we will help make sure your stay in the Asheville area is the best it can be. We can put together wine/beer/chocolate/snack packages that can be ordered and ready for your arrival.
transit: We are located in Oak Park, right off Hendersonville Rd/US25 which is the main surface street that runs all the way from Hendersonville through downtown to North Asheville and will take you just about anywhere you would want to go.  For a reasonable fee, we can make arrangements for shuttle services to and from the airport as well as downtown if you don't have a vehicle or just want a DD.  Uber is available in our area. Hendersonville Rd is a major route for Asheville Rapid Transit bus line.
host_about: Transplants from Southern California in 1992 we have loved raising our family in the Asheville area. Our eldest, a daughter (23) is recently married and lives in Minneapolis with her husband. Our two sons (20yo and 13yo) still live at home with us. Tim is a licensed general contractor and insurance adjuster. Elisa is an artist/art teacher and stay at home mom. We have restored multiple historic properties in the Asheville area over the last 23 years including a condemned house in the Montford Historic District for which Tim won the prestigious Griffin Award for historic preservation in 2004. Our commitment to faithful restoration is apparent in this property which we fully remodeled and restored in 2003. While we are new to Airbnb, we are not new to rental property. We have been landlords for several long term rentals in the area for 23 years, including this apartment, so we know how this rental thing works. We love both stimulating and laid back conversation with our friends and appropriate mood music (we can't live without our Bose Sounddock), good food (esp Mexican) and craft beer and wine. Our love of the outdoors takes us to California's Yosemite National Park for camping every summer and to our family condo on the gulf coast as often as we can get there. We enjoy hiking and biking and late night fire pits. We can point you to the usual and the unusual spots in Asheville so just ask. We can make a church recommendation if that's important to you. We attend a cool downtown church with great music and you are always welcome to join us. We think we have the best friends in the world and we especially love making new ones. We look forward to your visit!

name: Tranquil Home by Downtown Asheville
summary: Cozy South Asheville home. Spacious backyard & nestled in a quiet, safe neighborhood. 15 minute drive to downtown Asheville. 5 minute drive to Biltmore park with restaurants & cinema. 8 minute drive to the Biltmore Estate. 7 minute drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway.
space: My house is very cozy and inviting. The room has a queen size high-end memory foam mattress. There's a neat desk for doing work or reading. There's always a container of ice-cold water ready in the room for you.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a range and an oven.  The living room is cozy and quiet with a nice fireplace for the winter. I also have a washer and dryer that you are free to use if needed. On the deck, there's a commercial grade grill where you can cook up some steaks or grill some chicken or vegetables if you'd like.

name: Log Cabin in the mountains/city
summary: Adorable, comfortable, inviting, renovated 1918 log cabin convenient to everything in the Asheville area.  Although close in, you will feel like you are in the country.  Large fireplace, wood floors, and landscaped for privacy.  All amenities.
space: This is a charming log cabin built originally in 1918. It has been renovated, however, do not expect this to be on Hilton Hotel standards.  It is clean but not spotless. Although it is close-in, you feel you are miles away from everything.  There is a water feature in the front and a creek along the back property line with lovely mature evergreens and Japanese maples in the yard. All amenities are included.  Please note the nightly price reflected in the listing changes depending on the day of the week and time of the year. ..sometimes lower and sometimes higher.  There is a lovely working fireplace in the living room.  The woodstove in the kitchen is decorative only.

neighborhood_overview: The house is within three miles of the airport and half a mile from an urgent care center.  Restaurants, access to the national forests and parkway are convenient. 15 minutes from downtown Asheville and Hendersonville.
notes: There is some firewood for the fireplace.  The fireplace works just fine. The woodstove in the kitchen is not set up yet for fires.  (I think the squirrels or birds have nested in the chimney).
transit: Unfortunately, there is no public transit directly in front of the cabin, however, you are near Hwy 25 (Hendersonville Rd.) and Airport Road both of which do provide bus transit.
host_about: From Asheville, NC.  Love to meet people and see new places.  I am self employed; have two children; and three grandchildren.  I love to spend time outdoors camping and hiking and experiencing cultural events.  I will try to accommodate all visitors so their visit to the Asheville area is just what they are hoping it will be.

name: Beautiful Room/Bath Near Asheville
summary: Put your head and feet up on this fabulous bed, your own private bathroom. Near downtown Asheville & Biltmore House. Trail walk to Biltmore Park Townsquare's restaurants, shops, cinema, B&Noble.
space: I'm an artist so the apartment is full of paintings, drawings and sculptures. We lived in Mexico, Brazil and France, so you'll find objects from all over. It's a beautiful place that we care for with love. We're friendly and welcoming. Rita The view from the balcony and bedrooms are beautiful. Our home has a warm, cozy and happy feeling. The bed is fantastic, with the remote control you can raise head and foot and be very comfortable. Rita's an artist, so besides her beautiful paintings we have ornaments from several countries where we lived and traveled. It's a beautiful and unique place. Daniel

neighborhood_overview: BILTMORE VILLAGE AND BILTMORE HOUSE ESTATE: If you turn left at the stop light you go to the end of Overlook road and turn left at the Hendersonville road. You'll get to Biltmore Village at you right, with several restaurants (CORNER KITCHEN is a famous and very old one, Obama and his wife dined there when they were here, but you can have lunch also). The Bohemian hotel has a first class meat restaurant, with a dazzling bar, but you also have the Ruth Chris and other choices to eat a good steak. It's next door to the Biltmore Estate. It's worth it, it's breathtaking. RESTAURANTS DOWNTOWN: MELA is an Indian restaurant with a delicious buffet at lunch and dinner a la carte, the CHAMPAGNE BAR is a sophisticated choice to have a glass of champagne, or coffee with desert, at BOUCHON you have delicious French cuisine, and CÙRATE is a marvelous Tapas bar. POSANA has the best brunch on Sundays and CHORIZO is fun and has some wild choices and CÚRATE is a fantastic Tapas Bar, the chef having som
notes: Washer & Dryer on the premises, coin operated. Continental breakfast, electric kettle, tea and coffee, bread and butter, almond milk, brita water filter.  Full kitchen available to cook, please put the dishes in the washer and take the trash out (left side of apt complex just before you exit).  BILTMORE VILLAGE AND BILTMORE HOUSE ESTATE: 10 minutes away in Biltmore Village you'll get to several restaurants (CORNER KITCHEN is a famous and very old one, Obama and his wife dined there when they were here, but you can have lunch also). The Bohemian hotel has a first class restaurant, with a dazzling bar, but you also have the Ruth Chris and other choices to eat a good steak. It's next door to the Biltmore Estate. It's worth it, it's breathtaking. transit: My husband is a Uber driver and he'll be happy to drive you. There are also taxi services, if you need a list I'll be happy to send it to you.
host_about:
We're a friendly, easy going couple. We love art, reading, traveling, cooking, storytelling, playing games, cards and meeting people. 
I paint with bright colors since we lived in Mexico for 4 years, many years ago. 
My husband got Arthur Herman's book "The Cave and the Light" and he laughs out loud reading in bed.
We love British BBC programs and movies, documentaries like "Happy", to read History and books about innovations for the mind and alternative medicine. Daniel worked in Brazil, Mexico, France, Puerto Rico and the US. 
Our home is clean, confortable and we like to think it's beautiful. Friends are always welcome. 
We respect your privacy and leave you alone when you need some quiet time. We also love to chat when you feel like it.

notes: The cottage is excellently located for those vacationers who wish to be near Asheville's main tourist attractions & amenities. We are located 10miles South of the city center of Asheville. Little charming Biltmore Village & historic Biltmore Estate are also located 8miles South of us. host_about: My husband and our four children moved from St Maarten, Caribbean to the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains of Western North Carolina. Asheville has been our home for four years.  We love the lake, teaming with wide life and in the migrator paths sees a host of visiting wildlife. Our children love to swimming and boat and walking around the lake is so peaceful and serene.

name: One bedroom, private apartment
space: This cozy one bedroom apartment is in a perfect location for enjoying everything that Asheville has to offer. We are minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and Bent Creek (Pisgah National Forest). So if you are coming to the mountains because of the mountains, this is the perfect place for you. Downtown Asheville is a destination of its own as well, and it is just a short drive (10-15 minutes) to the heart of this vibrant city. Whether you are here to see the Biltmore House, shop downtown,or find some great food and music, our location is ideal.       While close to all of the great things that make Asheville so interesting our place is located in a quiet and beautiful setting, open to the sky, yet surrounded by trees.  Our one bedroom apartment is approximately 800 square feet--small enough to be cozy but large enough to have everything you'll need.  It has: -one full bath (large shower) -spacious bedroom with a comfortable queen bed -efficiency kitchen (stove top, small refrigerato
description: This cozy one bedroom apartment is in a perfect location for enjoying everything that Asheville has to offer. We are minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway and Bent Creek (Pisgah National Forest). So if you are coming to the mountains because of the mountains, this is the perfect place for you. Downtown Asheville is a destination of its own as well, and it is just a short drive (10-15 minutes) to the heart of this vibrant city. Whether you are here to see the Biltmore House, shop downtown,or find some great food and music, our location is ideal.       While close to all of the great things that make Asheville so interesting our place is located in a quiet and beautiful setting, open to the sky, yet surrounded by trees.  Our one bedroom apartment is approximately 800 square feet--small enough to be cozy but large enough to have everything you'll need.  It has: -one full bath (large shower) -spacious bedroom with a comfortable queen bed -efficiency kitchen (stove top, small refrigerato
transit: We do not have access to public transportation from our place. Inside the Asheville city limits there is bus service, but the closest stop is about two miles from here. You will want a car to explore Asheville from our beautiful spot!
host_about:
Hi,
This is me playing with two of our grandkids who live just 1/4 mile walk away (trail).
I love to share and would like to invite you to our place at the very "doorstep" to the mountains.  I love putting on my running or hiking shoes or getting on my mountain bike right from the house and hitting some of  best trails in the country. This place, where the French Broad River and the Blue Ridge Mountains meet, can be the beginning of great memories for you as well--including fishing, hiking, road or mountain biking, and driving on the parkway east or west to the highest elevations east of Colorado.  There is so much to say about our beloved Asheville as well (great food, music, shopping, the Biltmore House, etc.), which is only about a 10 minute drive from our place. These mountains are full of treasures 365 days of the year and it would be my pleasure to share some of my favorite places to help your trip be a special one!

summary: Rustic and luxurious 8X18' mini-home. Porch, queen loft, single bed below, kitchen sink, gas stove/oven, refrigerator, RV toilet, hot shower, near airport. We live next door in 1840's Log Cabin with two goats and two alpacas. No cleaning fee charge.
space: This is a new listing as of April 2016 which compliments our other well-reviewed tiny house on same property. For log cabin tiny we do not charge extra for kids age 12 and under, so just enter "2 people" in that case. Occasionally rent long term rates--but only if we're away traveling for a week or more.

Six gallon water heater so short but sweet showers. We charge no cleaning fee. neighborhood_overview: Urban location, small homestead with great neighbors and easy access to main roads. Off road parking. Great local restaurants nearby. 3 miles from airport and the new east coast Sierra Nevada Brewery.
transit: 9 miles south of downtown Asheville, Biltmore Estate, and the famous Blue Ridge Parkway! City Bus line within one mile.
host_about: Paul 'Rock' Eblen, an Asheville native, earned an MA in Theatre to assist him in creating music for stage and film. Having lived in Los Angeles for several years pursuing a music and film career, he returned to Asheville to produce his own shows. He has been professionally acting, writing, and directing in local and regional theater for more than 30 years. Produces and directs rock musicals such as JC SUPERSTAR, TOMMY, RENT, FOOTLOOSE, SPRING AWAKENING and NEXT TO NORMAL. Annual benefits for his family's local charity include Pizza PanDemonium and Asheville Faerie Arts Festival.

name: Artistic Suite near Asheville!
summary: Beautiful set of private bathroom and bedroom. Post card view, art and sunblock curtains.  Sunny suite, artistic, happy feel. Near downtown & Biltmore House. Trail walk to Biltmore Park TownSquare's Restaurants, Shops, Cinema. Enjoy!
space: I'm an artist so the apartment is full of paintings, drawings and sculptures. We lived in Mexico, Brazil and France, so you'll find objects from all over. It's a beautiful place that we care for with love. We're friendly and welcoming. Rita The view from the balcony and bedrooms are beautiful. Our home has a warm, cozy and happy feeling. The bed is fantastic, with the remote control you can raise head and foot and be very comfortable. Rita's an artist, so besides her beautiful paintings we have ornaments from several countries where we lived and traveled. It's a beautiful and unique place. Daniel

neighborhood_overview: BILTMORE VILLAGE AND BILTMORE HOUSE ESTATE: If you turn left at the stop light you go to the end of Overlook road and turn left at the Hendersonville road. You'll get to Biltmore Village at you right, with several restaurants (CORNER KITCHEN is a famous and very old one, Obama and his wife dined there when they were here, but you can have lunch also). The Bohemian hotel has a first class meat restaurant, with a dazzling bar, but you also have the Ruth Chris and other choices to eat a good steak. It's next door to the Biltmore Estate. It's worth it, it's breathtaking. RESTAURANTS DOWNTOWN: MELA is an Indian restaurant with a delicious buffet at lunch and dinner a la carte, the CHAMPAGNE BAR is a sophisticated choice to have a glass of champagne, or coffee with desert, at BOUCHON you have delicious French cuisine, and CÙRATE is a marvelous Tapas bar. POSANA has the best brunch on Sundays and CHORIZO is fun and has some wild choices and CÚRATE is a fantastic Tapas Bar, the chef having som
notes: Washer & Dryer on the premises, coin operated. Continental breakfast, electric kettle, tea and coffee, bread and butter, almond milk, brita water filter.  Full kitchen available to cook, please put the dishes in the washer and take the trash out (left side of apt complex just before you exit).  BILTMORE VILLAGE AND BILTMORE HOUSE ESTATE: 10 minutes away in Biltmore Village you'll get to several restaurants (CORNER KITCHEN is a famous and very old one, Obama and his wife dined there when they were here, but you can have lunch also). transit: My husband is a Uber driver and he'll be happy to drive you. There are also taxi services, if you need a list I'll be happy to send it to you.
host_about:
We're a friendly, easy going couple. We love art, reading, traveling, cooking, storytelling, playing games, cards and meeting people. 
I paint with bright colors since we lived in Mexico for 4 years, many years ago. 
My husband got Arthur Herman's book "The Cave and the Light" and he laughs out loud reading in bed.
We love British BBC programs and movies, documentaries like "Happy", to read History and books about innovations for the mind and alternative medicine. Daniel worked in Brazil, Mexico, France, Puerto Rico and the US. 
Our home is clean, confortable and we like to think it's beautiful. Friends are always welcome. 
We respect your privacy and leave you alone when you need some quiet time. We also love to chat when you feel like it.

name: Modern, Green Country Farmhouse
space: A little bit industrial loft, a little bit rustic retreat, this modern country farmhouse guesthouse is perfect for a couple, with or without a child in tow.  Open-concept living/dining/kitchen with polished concrete floors and tall, wood-beamed ceilings. Immaculate. Beautifully finished and furnished, down to luxurious 400TC 100% cotton linens and towels. This guesthouse is straight out of 'Country Living.' On ten acres in a truly pastoral neighborhood just south of Asheville. Secluded and nestled in the woods, yet flooded with natural light. Completely private, fenced rose and boxwood garden provides outdoor lounging, dining and fire-siding. Hot water tap in the garden for hillbilly hot-tubbing (kids only!). Green & Allergen-free features: Low or No-VOC paints used throughout. Organic, unscented cleaning and laundry products used exclusively. Natural fiber rugs, upholstery and window treatments. Slip-covered upholstery, frequently laundered. No pets of any kind ever inside the home. A

host_about: We are a retired military couple with a lot of travel behind us and in front of us.  Our daughters are each newly married and in graduate school.  The house is a 6 bedroom colonial with a great room, gourmet kitchen and hundreds of feet of decking overlooking the woods.  Rich was an Air Force Weather officer who has also managed local country clubs and hotels.  Valerie is a dental office manager and an avid photographer.

We live in a nice, quiet, and clean neigborhood. It's a great neigborhood for walking and jogging. We do not have the greatest public transport nearby. name: #2- A Single Bdrm in a cozy Ranch
summary: Our ranch style home is very welcoming.  From our yard, view breathtaking mountains!  We live in a quiet neighborhood, between Asheville and Hendersonville, 13 miles from each downtown, a 25 minute drive in either direction.  Come visit!
space: Our ranch style home is very welcoming!  We live in a quiet rural neighborhood surrounded by farms and views of the beautiful mountains!   All year-around the mountains are spectacular!  Fall-time is breathtaking, you don't want to miss seeing the fall leaves!  We are centrally located between Asheville and Hendersonville, 13 miles from each downtown, a 25 minute drive in either direction.  We are about 5 miles from the WNC Agriculture Center which hosts the Mountain State Fair.  The North Carolina Arboretum is 13 miles away.  Anytime is a great time to visit the Biltmore house, the Grove Park Inn, see the waterfalls in Brevard, and explore the Blue Ridge Parkway.  These are just a few of the highlights you can enjoy while you stay with us!  Be sure to see our pictures to give you some ideas of the fun you can have!    It is best to have a car to drive to the nearby cities.  There is public transit and Uber taxi is available in our area.  We are about 10-15 minutes from the Asheville a

neighborhood_overview: This is a great time to visit the Biltmore house!  See the waterfalls in Brevard, travel on the Blue Ridge Parkway and visit the Grovepark Inn, these are just a few of the highlights you can enjoy while you stay with us!   We live in a quiet rural neighborhood surrounded by farms and beautiful mountains!   Our neighborhood has a walking trail, open fields for recreation, and a pagoda. We are centrally located between Asheville and Hendersonville!  We welcome you to our cozy home!
notes: *If you need more flexibility with checking in or out, please let us know.   *Children under 12-no guest fee
transit: It is best to have a car to drive to the nearby towns and cities.  Within 20-30 minutes, we can be downtown Hendersonville or Asheville!  Waterfalls and the Blue Ridge Parkway are conveniently close also.  We are 10- 15 minutes from the Asheville airport. There is public transit from the airport but it is not extensive like in bigger cities.
host_about: My husband and I are passionate about traveling!  I've lived in many places as I grew up since my Dad served in the Air Force.  As an adult, I worked for Delta Airlines.  My husband traveled frequently as a Soccer Player.  We enjoy experiencing other cultures, tasting ethnic foods and getting off the tourist paths to experience the native lifestyles all over the world!  We love meeting people and hearing their stories.  It brings us great pleasure to open our home to  world travelers like ourselves, the occasional vacationers and even locals that just want a change of scenery.

We enjoy experiencing other cultures, tasting ethnic foods and getting off the tourist paths to experience the native lifestyles all over the world!  We love meeting people and hearing their stories.  It brings us great pleasure to open our home to  world travelers like ourselves, the occasional vacationers and even locals that just want a change of scenery.

name: Quaint room with great energy
summary: Spacious room in a quiet neighborhood about twenty minutes from both Asheville and Hendersonville.
description: Spacious room in a quiet neighborhood about twenty minutes from both Asheville and Hendersonville.
host_about:
Hi!  

My name is Austin!  I'm an RN in Asheville, North Carolina.  Total work-a-holic, but I'm trying to start traveling more.  In my free time, I'm all about anything outside, always followed up with a few margaritas.  I love to read, Garth Stein being my favorite author, and I'm shamelessly obsessed with self help novels.  Music is pretty nonstop in my house, I listen to mostly indie/alternative stuff, but I also love reggae and jazz.  I'm all about making the most out of my life and having a great time with everything I do.  

I won't lie, I'm kind of a neat-freak, but aside from that I'm super easygoing and laid-back.  I can't wait to meet you! 

At home, I'm pretty big on recycling and repurposing, and I'm currently beginning to compost as well.  My home (me) is about 90% vegan and I have a gluten allergy.  I keep a pretty put-together, neat house with great energy.

description: Basement apartment with 1 bedroom, large living room/kitchen combo, and 1 full bath. Private entrance and patio with view of lake. Cable TV, wireless internet,  private parking, coin-op laundry room, free fishing and canoe rental. Taxes included. Basement apartment with 1 bedroom, 1 bath large living room/kitchen combo. Private entrance and patio with view of lake. Smart TVs (65" & 40"), cable, wireless internet, free parking, coin-op laundry room available in RV park laundry room next to the pool. There is free fishing (catch and release), paddle boat and canoe rental at the RV park store. There is a separate parking area and entrance to the basement. The entrance door is the first sliding glass door. Take the driveway next to the lake, drive to the back of the house and park next to the garage door. Please don't block the garage door. There is no access between the basement and second story. The address for the basement apartment is 170 Rutledge Rd, the entrance is on Still Lake Trai
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is in a quiet area and is 1.8 miles from Exit 40 on I-26 between Asheville and Hendersonville. Target, Walmart and many other retailers are less than a mile away and at least 20 restaurants are within a mile. Biltmore Park Town Square, (URL HIDDEN) is the next exit (Exit 37) and has unique shops, big retailers, movie theatres, entertainment, brewery, and fine dining.
notes: Cleaning - At the end of your stay, we will change the sheets and make the bed (so you don't have to), we take out the trash, and clean the bathroom.  If you have questions about the apartment or the surrounding area, the store is available to answer your questions and provide help. If you have a problem or need something please call the store ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN)) or text Gathai. There are also discounted Biltmore House tickets at the store as well as other items.

name: Rustic Elegance at Mountain Majesty
summary: If you are looking for a great place to escape; this is it, Mountain Majesty!  Mountain views, gorgeous sunsets, large decks, luxury furniture and plenty of room to spread out.  3 living areas, a cooks kitchen and tree house dining.
space: This is a slice of heaven!  Beautiful views every season!  Come relax and enjoy this secluded property among the trees.  3500 elevation and plenty of acres to hike, explore and enjoy. Why stay in the mountains and not enjoy exquisite long range views from every window.  Beautiful sunsets every night give visitors a breathtaking experience from a 3100 ft. elevation.  Nestled on a mountain between Hendersonville, Asheville and Lake Lure; this luxurious mountain retreat is conveniently located only 20 minutes from their downtown areas. From the moment you walk into this incredible escape; you will appreciate the elegantly appointed features including vaulted ceilings, hardwood/slate flooring, rare riverbed granite countertops and locally crafted mountain laurel railings throughout the main level. name: Enchanted Country Cottage
summary: Welcome to my sweet, cozy, artsy cottage! There is a beautiful pasture on three sides with  horses who add to the peaceful and lovely setting. Although in the country, you will be very close to all Asheville has to offer...15 minutes to downtown.
space: My taste is casual and homey with lots of color and items I have gathered on my travels to various parts of the world. Covered front porch and large screened porch with a lovely view for you to enjoy. My friends say my home is magical...and very sweet.
description: Welcome to my sweet, cozy, artsy cottage! There is a beautiful pasture on three sides with  horses who add to the peaceful and lovely setting. Although in the country, you will be very close to all Asheville has to offer...15 minutes to downtown. My taste is casual and homey with lots of color and items I have gathered on my travels to various parts of the world. Covered front porch and large screened porch with a lovely view for you to enjoy. My friends say my home is magical...and very sweet. The space available is a  bedroom with a queen size bed. Space is available in  drawers and the closet for your personal items.  The living area and nice open  kitchen are yours to use. I would like for you to enjoy them as if they are yours. You will be sharing a bathroom with host.   . I enjoy where I live and I love people so it is a pleasure to share this wonderful area with you. As I have lived here almost 20 years I will be able to give you information on restaurants, galleries, and all th
neighborhood_overview: Being out in the country brings with it an assortment of varying homes and lifestyles. My  curvy little lane is not in a development and has a lovely mountain view. There is a nice neighborhood on the road next to my house which is wonderful to walk in....gentle hills  perfect for a bit of exercise.
notes: This is a no smoking home, but you are welcome to step out and smoke on the covered front porch. I have a cat who will hide from you until she sees you are friendly.
transit: My home is 10 minutes from the Blue Ridge Parkway, 15 minutes from downtown or The Biltmore (URL HIDDEN) the country but convenient. Easy access from I-40, 240 and I-26. The area I live in is actually called Fairview but my mailing address is Fletcher for your GPS. My home is  southeast of the city in a beautiful desirable area.
host_about: I love the wonderful mountain life style here in Asheville. Being a nature lover, there are so many outdoor activities. I love to hike and mountain  bike. Also, I enjoy the art scene since I dabble in creative activities. I am easy going and have many friends. We love to gather on my screened porch which looks out on a pastural setting. I have done a fair amount of traveling including Peru (Machu Pichu), Tibet, Nepal, Thailand, Costa Rica and Europe. I consider myself very down to earth, fun, considerate and I love meeting new people. My cottage is very attractive and cozy.   I like to cook healthy food often with an ethnic flair. Gardening is also a hobby. I will do all I can to be an excellent host of guests.

name: Bedroom with queensize bed and bath
summary: Quiet neighborhood near the airport, Sierra Nevada, Pisgah NF. 20 min to Avl. No pets. Non-smokers only. You will have our spare bedroom & bathroom.  Self-catered breakfast.  Kitchen/laundry privileges.  No airport services provided.  Garage storage.
space: You will be in our guest bedroom/bath.  The office and laundry are also in this area.  The kitchen is adjoining, so you will hear us in the mornings, about 6:30 on weekdays.  Coffee and breakfast foods (cereal, eggs, etc) are available and I can cook you something if I am there or you are welcome to use the kitchen.
description: Quiet neighborhood near the airport, Sierra Nevada, Pisgah NF. 20 min to Avl. No pets. Non-smokers only. You will have our spare bedroom & bathroom.  Self-catered breakfast.  Kitchen/laundry privileges.  No airport services provided.  Garage storage. You will be in our guest bedroom/bath.  The office and laundry are also in this area.  The kitchen is adjoining, so you will hear us in the mornings, about 6:30 on weekdays.  Coffee and breakfast foods (cereal, eggs, etc) are available and I can cook you something if I am there or you are welcome to use the kitchen. You have access to the whole house except the master area.  One side of the garage has space for you to leave things if needed (bikes, etc.). I am presently unemployed but will be out looking for work or hiking, etc., during the day.  David works days.  We like to visit but will respect your privacy.  We have tons of maps for hiking/biking.  We can suggest some restaurants or breweries, but we are not gourmands or beer drinkers
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is mostly ranch style houses on large lots.  We have white squirrels, so take a walk around the block and see how many you can count.  We are very close to the airport, WNC Agricultural Center, and Sierra Nevada Brewing.  We are central to mountain biking/hiking at Pisgah NF, Bent Creek, and Dupont SF.
notes: This is our first time being a host so let us know what things we can improve upon.  At present, we only have an antenna in the attic and no TV in the guest room, but it seems like most people bring their own entertainment via electronic devices.  The wi-fi is just on the other side of the wall from the guest room so reception should be pretty good.
transit: The house is less than a mile from the airport.  Buncombe and Henderson County public transportation are both near, but I wouldn't depend on them.  A car is pretty much required.  There is an Enterprise car rental on Airport Rd. which might be cheaper than renting at the airport.
host_about: My husband and I are in our early 50s.  We mostly do outdoor things-rock climb, mountain bike, whitewater kayak.  David does a lot of trail building/repair as a trail crew leader for our local mt. bike club.  We are pretty boring otherwise.  We will most likely go to bed early, etc.  Lately, our travel destinations usually involve rock climbing.  We have been lots of places here in the SE and City of Rocks, Smith Rock, Yosemite, and Joshua Tree out west.  We are pretty quiet.  You could describe us as conservative liberals.  We are not up on the local beer/restaurant scene but can make some suggestions.  We are close to Buncombe/Henderson bus lines, but public transportation is not great here.  A car would be best.  We could probably pick you up/drop you at the airport, which is 1 mile away.  You can hear the planes take off, but it is not that loud.  No pets and no smoking, please.

host_about:
Hi!  My name is Gail.  I'm a pediatric nurse living on 2.5 acres outside Asheville, NC.  This is a great area for any outdoor enthusiast.  I love running and hiking in the forest, kayaking on the river,   Downtown Asheville is a great little town, wonderful food, drink and music.  

As a guest in my home, you will sleep under homemade quilts and have your morning coffee (organic, locally roasted) on a back porch looking out at the beauty of the mountains.  I am a pescatarian and eat as local and organic as I can. I am happy to advise you on any of the great activities in town.  I'm located near the North Carolina Arboretum, Pisgah National Forest, DuPont State Park, Hendersonville and both The French Broad and Green Rivers.  

My home is on a working farm, goats and horses.  And one resident spoiled dog named Sadie.  

Looking forward to being your host and sharing the beauty of the mountains of North Carolina with you.

notes: Please message me with questions or requests
transit: no
host_about:
My husband and I live in Asheville, NC, originally from Western NY. We have a new puppy and love to travel. We both work from home and travel for work, so most of our free time is spent enjoying our home. When we get the chance to take a trip we like to see and do all that we can in a short amount of time. We are hoping Airbnb allows us to travel more and slow down a bit.

We love kayaking, walking, getting the behind the scene's look on a new place, food, food, food... window shopping, exploring, nature and a good craft beer or a big glass of red at the end of the day. We love Italy and being out West the most but the last few years we have really enjoyed hiking and exploring the mountains, lakes and rivers of WNC.

We aren't much in to hanging around, we really like to be out an about. We like learning and sharing stories but won't be looking for you to plan our trip. We are also looking to become hosts as we have a great space in our home, an incredible destination in Asheville and enjoy meeting people and learning of their experiences.

Life motto: for my husband and I - perfect is boring!

name: Chalet at Winghaven, Sunny Log Home
summary: The Chalet at Winghaven is a brand new, spacious, sunny log home. Close to Asheville and all its attractions, the chalet is surrounded by 38 acres of picturesque hardwood forest. Amazingly this private oasis is very close to shopping & restaurants!
space: Open the sliding glass door of the spacious MASTER SUITE  to enjoy the mountain air or relax with a glass of wine on the covered porch.  Sleeping in the LOFT BEDROOM with its own private full bathroom feels like being away from it all, up in the trees.  Guests of all ages enjoy the BUNK ROOM which is adjacent to another full bathroom which features a washer and dryer. The open kitchen /dining / living space with vaulted ceilings and exposed beams is bright and airy during the day and cozy at night with a fire in the danish wood stove.
description: The Chalet at Winghaven is a brand new, spacious, sunny log home. Close to Asheville and all its attractions, the chalet is surrounded by 38 acres of picturesque hardwood forest. Amazingly this private oasis is very close to shopping & restaurants!  Open the sliding glass door of the spacious MASTER SUITE  to enjoy the mountain air or relax with a glass of wine on the covered porch.  Sleeping in the LOFT BEDROOM with its own private full bathroom feels like being away from it all, up in the trees.  Guests of all ages enjoy the BUNK ROOM which is adjacent to another full bathroom which features a washer and dryer. The open kitchen /dining / living space with vaulted ceilings and exposed beams is bright and airy during the day and cozy at night with a fire in the danish wood stove. We live only ten minutes from the chalet and we are available to answer any questions,  help you plan your stay and to fix any issues that might occur. We are available if you need us, but we will very much re
neighborhood_overview: The chalet is a convenient home base for the multitude of activities our area has to offer: Visit the Biltmore Estate ( 11miles), Downtown Asheville (12 miles), Historic Hendersonville (14 miles), go tubing or kayaking on the French Broad River, zip lining, drive the Blue Ridge Parkway, hike a different trail every day or see five magnificent waterfalls in just one day. There are wine tastings, beer tours, music and dance performances to attend and fabulous restaurants to try. Biking is a favorite sport here be it on the road or on mountain trails. We are more than happy to help you  with planning your vacation so please talk to us and let us know what you are interested in.  Of course the chalet is also an awesome place to just relax, enjoy the sun shining through the leaves, the peace of the forest and the starlit nights.
notes: We looked for a long time to find the ideal vacation rental property here in our beautiful area. We were not satisfied with what we could find, so we decided to build it ourselves! The chalet is very close to our own home, but we still feel like we are on vacation every time we go up there, even though we go there mostly to work! We love the seclusion and privacy of a large property, but we don't like to drive forever to pick up some groceries, go to a restaurant or enjoy the culture of our region. One of the most important aspects in our search for the perfect vacation spot was that the home needed to be sunny and bright. When we found this amazing piece of land it was just a perfect fit. We love the special feeling and connection to nature that only a log home can offer, so this is what we built and we feel that it fits its location amazingly well.
host_about: We live with our three young children on a small farm close to Asheville ,NC. We love to spend time outside with our animals, biking or hiking in the beautiful mountains surrounding our home.

Parking, landscaped trails, a beautiful 1/2 mile walk to the end of the cove down the road. Doggy play time or watching the running of the Poms from the Bay window in the cottage.  Shared driveway, 1/2 acre fenced in with cottage which includes an enriched environment area. I live in the house on the property and can interact as much or as little as one may choose.  Folks can feel free to call me on my line with any questions or needs while in town. Folks can also interact with the four legged ones and learn holistic pet care if that interests them. This cottage
neighborhood_overview: This cottage is located on a street with very few other dwellings, and the road ends at a mountain cove.  There are fields, pastures with horses, and a running stream along the walk down the road.
notes: There is a $25 pet fee for up to 2 dogs per booking as the hair clean up does add to the cleaning time.
transit: No bus system nearby, but the airport is only 7 minutes away....but you would never know it as no planes fly overhead in this area.
host_about: I have rented this cottage off and on to more permanent residents and have loved the community feeling being around interesting and cool folk.  I love animals and theatre, writing, and musicals.  I work as a Physical Therapist in Home Health Care and enjoy meeting all types of people that way too.  Variety is the spice of Life here, and I feel that connecting with others makes Life more fulfilling, plus there is always something to learn from each person we come in contact with.

name: Lovely Asheville Horse Property
summary: Charming 2 BR apt. Quiet dead-end, creekside location with miles of mountain hiking trails. Minutes from AVL Airport, WNC Ag Center, Sierra Nevada Brewery, short drive to downtown Asheville and Hendersonville. Horse accommodations available too!
space: 20 minutes from downtowns Asheville and Hendersonville, this charming apartment offers a quiet country setting away from it all, but still close to all the great amenities and recreation spots in the Western North Carolina mountains. Bring your horses too! WNC Ag Center, Dupont, Pisgah and Biltmore Forest are all a short drive away. We have pastures and shelters to comfortably accommodate 4 horses.  (Currently we do not have our own horses on the premises.)

neighborhood_overview: We are on 5 acres of open pasture at the end of a small private road.  To the south we are bordered by a wide, trout stocked creek and hundreds of acres of mountain beyond.  It is a lovely setting to get away from it all, but still be close to everything the WNC area has to offer.
notes: Accommodations available for up to 4 horses.  Horse rate is $25 per night, per horse.  Includes 3 acres of well maintained pastures, 2 run-in barns and water. Wireless hi-speed internet is provided.  Cable TV is not available.  The televsion is equipped with a Roku box for streaming movies, music, TV and other programs from the internet.
transit: We are just 2 traffic lights (5.5 miles) from the Asheville airport and WNC Agricultural Center. 13 miles from the downtown centers of both Asheville and Hendersonville.

name: Cloud 9 Relaxation-Mountain Views
summary: Imagine a 3 bdr mountain-top destination called Cloud 9- a private estate/farm, 15 min from the Biltmore Estate with a hot tub, full-length deck, wooded hiking trails, fishing, fresh eggs, and blueberries for you to enjoy.  Your peace of heaven.
space: Cloud 9 Farm is in land conservancy application so you know that stewardship is important here. Go back in time to a simpler life of feeling like the valley farm is yours and the mountain-top dwelling in the clouds...your dream.
description: Imagine a 3 bdr mountain-top destination called Cloud 9- a private estate/farm, 15 min from the Biltmore Estate with a hot tub, full-length deck, wooded hiking trails, fishing, fresh eggs, and blueberries for you to enjoy. We are a gated mini-estate of 200 acres that you will be invited to. Pets love to run ahead of you on the hiking trails which you'll have full access to. The mountain top is yours...quiet! We work, you relax. Come join us in farm chores if you want the full farm experience, especially for the kiddos. Summer is fun to fish, pick blueberries and enjoy the open deck in the moonlight. The owners live in a separate house on the farm. What neighborhood? If you mean the cows and chickens, wild turkeys and deer...we've got 'em
